title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: At the first God made the heaven and the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: And the earth was waste and without form; and it was dark on the face of the deep: and the Spirit of God was moving on the face of the waters.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And God, looking on the light, saw that it was good: and God made a division between the light and the dark,

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: Naming the light, Day, and the dark, Night. And there was evening and there was morning, the first day.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And God said, Let there be a solid arch stretching over the waters, parting the waters from the waters.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And God made the arch for a division between the waters which were under the arch and those which were over it: and it was so.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And God gave the arch the name of Heaven. And there was evening and there was morning, the second day.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And God said, Let the waters under the heaven come together in one place, and let the dry land be seen: and it was so.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And God gave the dry land the name of Earth; and the waters together in their place were named Seas: and God saw that it was good.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And God said, Let grass come up on the earth, and plants producing seed, and fruit-trees giving fruit, in which is their seed, after their sort: and it was so.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And grass came up on the earth, and every plant producing seed of its sort, and every tree producing fruit, in which is its seed, of its sort: and God saw that it was good.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And there was evening and there was morning, the third day.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And God said, Let there be lights in the arch of heaven, for a division between the day and the night, and let them be for signs, and for marking the changes of the year, and for days and for years:

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And let them be for lights in the arch of heaven to give light on the earth: and it was so.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And God made the two great lights: the greater light to be the ruler of the day, and the smaller light to be the ruler of the night: and he made the stars.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And God put them in the arch of heaven, to give light on the earth;

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: To have rule over the day and the night, and for a division between the light and the dark: and God saw that it was good.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And there was evening and there was morning, the fourth day.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: And God said, Let the waters be full of living things, and let birds be in flight over the earth under the arch of heaven.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: And God made great sea-beasts, and every sort of living and moving thing with which the waters were full, and every sort of winged bird: and God saw that it was good.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And God gave them his blessing, saying, Be fertile and have increase, making all the waters of the seas full, and let the birds be increased in the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: And there was evening and there was morning, the fifth day.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: And God said, Let the earth give birth to all sorts of living things, cattle and all things moving on the earth, and beasts of the earth after their sort: and it was so.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: And God made the beast of the earth after its sort, and the cattle after their sort, and everything moving on the face of the earth after its sort: and God saw that it was good.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: And God said, Let us make man in our image, like us: and let him have rule over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the air and over the cattle and over all the earth and over every living thing which goes flat on the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: And God made man in his image, in the image of God he made him: male and female he made them.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 28
text: And God gave them his blessing and said to them, Be fertile and have increase, and make the earth full and be masters of it; be rulers over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the air and over every living thing moving on the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 29
text: And God said, See, I have given you every plant producing seed, on the face of all the earth, and every tree which has fruit producing seed: they will be for your food:

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 30
text: And to every beast of the earth and to every bird of the air and every living thing moving on the face of the earth I have given every green plant for food: and it was so.

title: Genesis Chapter 1 Verse 31
text: And God saw everything which he had made and it was very good. And there was evening and there was morning, the sixth day.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And the heaven and the earth and all things in them were complete.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And on the seventh day God came to the end of all his work; and on the seventh day he took his rest from all the work which he had done.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And God gave his blessing to the seventh day and made it holy: because on that day he took his rest from all the work which he had made and done.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: These are the generations of the heaven and the earth when they were made.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: In the day when the Lord God made earth and heaven there were no plants of the field on the earth, and no grass had come up: for the Lord God had not sent rain on the earth and there was no man to do work on the land.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: But a mist went up from the earth, watering all the face of the land.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And the Lord God made man from the dust of the earth, breathing into him the breath of life: and man became a living soul.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And the Lord God made a garden in the east, in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had made.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And out of the earth the Lord made every tree to come, delighting the eye and good for food; and in the middle of the garden, the tree of life and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And a river went out of Eden giving water to the garden; and from there it was parted and became four streams.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: The name of the first is Pishon, which goes round about all the land of Havilah where there is gold.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And the gold of that land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx stone.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And the name of the second river is Gihon: this river goes round all the land of Cush.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And the name of the third river is Tigris, which goes to the east of Assyria. And the fourth river is Euphrates.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And the Lord God took the man and put him in the garden of Eden to do work in it and take care of it.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And the Lord God gave the man orders, saying, You may freely take of the fruit of every tree of the garden:

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: But of the fruit of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil you may not take; for on the day when you take of it, death will certainly come to you.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And the Lord God said, It is not good for the man to be by himself: I will make one like himself as a help to him

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And from the earth the Lord God made every beast of the field and every bird of the air, and took them to the man to see what names he would give them: and whatever name he gave to any living thing, that was its name.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: And the man gave names to all cattle and to the birds of the air and to every beast of the field; but Adam had no one like himself as a help.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: And the Lord God sent a deep sleep on the man, and took one of the bones from his side while he was sleeping, joining up the flesh again in its place:

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: And the bone which the Lord God had taken from the man he made into a woman, and took her to the man.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: And the man said, This is now bone of my bone and flesh of my flesh: let her name be Woman because she was taken out of Man.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: For this cause will a man go away from his father and his mother and be joined to his wife; and they will be one flesh.

title: Genesis Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: And the man and his wife were without clothing, and they had no sense of shame.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Now the snake was wiser than any beast of the field which the Lord God had made. And he said to the woman, Has God truly said that you may not take of the fruit of any tree in the garden?

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And the woman said, We may take of the fruit of the trees in the garden:

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: But of the fruit of the tree in the middle of the garden, God has said, If you take of it or put your hands on it, death will come to you.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And the snake said, Death will not certainly come to you:

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: For God sees that on the day when you take of its fruit, your eyes will be open, and you will be as gods, having knowledge of good and evil.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and a delight to the eyes, and to be desired to make one wise, she took of its fruit, and gave it to her husband.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And their eyes were open and they were conscious that they had no clothing and they made themselves coats of leaves stitched together.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And there came to them the sound of the Lord God walking in the garden in the evening wind: and the man and his wife went to a secret place among the trees of the garden, away from the eyes of the Lord God.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: And the voice of the Lord God came to the man, saying, Where are you?

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And he said, Hearing your voice in the garden I was full of fear, because I was without clothing: and I kept myself from your eyes.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And he said, Who gave you the knowledge that you were without clothing? Have you taken of the fruit of the tree which I said you were not to take?

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: And the man said, The woman whom you gave to be with me, she gave me the fruit of the tree and I took it.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And the Lord God said to the woman, What have you done? And the woman said, I was tricked by the deceit of the snake and I took it.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And the Lord God said to the snake, Because you have done this you are cursed more than all cattle and every beast of the field; you will go flat on the earth, and dust will be your food all the days of your life:

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And there will be war between you and the woman and between your seed and her seed: by him will your head be crushed and by you his foot will be wounded.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: To the woman he said, Great will be your pain in childbirth; in sorrow will your children come to birth; still your desire will be for your husband, but he will be your master.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And to Adam he said, Because you gave ear to the voice of your wife and took of the fruit of the tree which I said you were not to take, the earth is cursed on your account; in pain you will get your food from it all your life.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: Thorns and waste plants will come up, and the plants of the field will be your food;

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: With the hard work of your hands you will get your bread till you go back to the earth from which you were taken: for dust you are and to the dust you will go back.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: And the man gave his wife the name of Eve because she was the mother of all who have life.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife coats of skins for their clothing.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: And the Lord God said, Now the man has become like one of us, having knowledge of good and evil; and now if he puts out his hand and takes of the fruit of the tree of life, he will go on living for ever.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: So the Lord God sent him out of the garden of Eden to be a worker on the earth from which he was taken.

title: Genesis Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: So he sent the man out; and at the east of the garden of Eden he put winged ones and a flaming sword turning every way to keep the way to the tree of life.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And the man had connection with Eve his wife, and she became with child and gave birth to Cain, and said, I have got a man from the Lord.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: Then again she became with child and gave birth to Abel, his brother. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a farmer.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And after a time, Cain gave to the Lord an offering of the fruits of the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And Abel gave an offering of the young lambs of his flock and of their fat. And the Lord was pleased with Abel's offering;

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: But in Cain and his offering he had no pleasure. And Cain was angry and his face became sad.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And the Lord said to Cain, Why are you angry? and why is your face sad?

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: If you do well, will you not have honour? and if you do wrong, sin is waiting at the door, desiring to have you, but do not let it be your master.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And Cain said to his brother, Let us go into the field: and when they were in the field, Cain made an attack on his brother Abel and put him to death.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And the Lord said to Cain, Where is your brother Abel? And he said, I have no idea: am I my brother's keeper?

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: And he said, What have you done? the voice of your brother's blood is crying to me from the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And now you are cursed from the earth, whose mouth is open to take your brother's blood from your hand;

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: No longer will the earth give you her fruit as the reward of your work; you will be a wanderer in flight over the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And Cain said, My punishment is greater than my strength.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: You have sent me out this day from the face of the earth and from before your face; I will be a wanderer in flight over the earth, and whoever sees me will put me to death.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: And the Lord said, Truly, if Cain is put to death, seven lives will be taken for his. And the Lord put a mark on Cain so that no one might put him to death.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: And Cain went away from before the face of the Lord, and made his living-place in the land of Nod on the east of Eden.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: And Cain had connection with his wife and she became with child and gave birth to Enoch: and he made a town, and gave the town the name of Enoch after his son.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: And Enoch had a son Irad: and Irad became the father of Mehujael: and Mehujael became the father of Methushael: and Methushael became the father of Lamech.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: And Lamech had two wives; the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: And Adah gave birth to Jabal: he was the father of such as are living in tents and keep cattle.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: And his brother's name was Jubal: he was the father of all players on instruments of music.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: And Zillah gave birth to Tubal-cain, who is the father of every maker of cutting instruments of brass and iron: and the sister of Tubal-cain was Naamah.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: And Lamech said to his wives, Adah and Zillah, give ear to my voice; you wives of Lamech, give attention to my words, for I would put a man to death for a wound, and a young man for a blow;

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: If seven lives are to be taken as punishment for Cain's death, seventy-seven will be taken for Lamech's.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: And Adam had connection with his wife again, and she gave birth to a son to whom she gave the name of Seth: for she said, God has given me another seed in place of Abel, whom Cain put to death.

title: Genesis Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: And Seth had a son, and he gave him the name of Enosh: at this time men first made use of the name of the Lord in worship.

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day when God made man, he made him in the image of God;

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: Male and female he made them, naming them Man, and giving them his blessing on the day when they were made.

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: Adam had been living for a hundred and thirty years when he had a son like himself, after his image, and gave him the name of Seth:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: And after the birth of Seth, Adam went on living for eight hundred years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: And all the years of Adam's life were nine hundred and thirty: and he came to his end.

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And Seth was a hundred and five years old when he became the father of Enosh:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: And he went on living after the birth of Enosh for eight hundred and seven years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: And all the years of Seth's life were nine hundred and twelve: and he came to his end.

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: And Enosh was ninety years old when he became the father of Kenan:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And after the birth of Kenan, Enosh went on living for eight hundred and fifteen years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: And all the years of Enosh were nine hundred and five: and he came to his end.

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: And Kenan was seventy years old when he became the father of Mahalalel:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: And after the birth of Mahalalel, Kenan went on living for eight hundred and forty years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: And all the years of Kenan's life were nine hundred and ten; and he came to his end.

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: And Mahalalel was sixty-five years old when he became the father of Jared:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: And after the birth of Jared, Mahalalel went on living for eight hundred and thirty years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: And all the years of Mahalalel's life were eight hundred and ninety-five: and he came to his end.

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: And Jared was a hundred and sixty-two years old when he became the father of Enoch:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: And Jared went on living after the birth of Enoch for eight hundred years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: And all the years of Jared's life were nine hundred and sixty-two: and he came to his end.

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: And Enoch was sixty-five years old when he became the father of Methuselah:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: And after the birth of Methuselah, Enoch went on in God's ways for three hundred years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: And all the years of Enoch's life were three hundred and sixty-five:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: And Enoch went on in God's ways: and he was not seen again, for God took him.

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: And Methuselah was a hundred and eighty-seven years old when he became the father of Lamech:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: And after the birth of Lamech, Methuselah went on living for seven hundred and eighty-two years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: And all the years of Methuselah's life were nine hundred and sixty-nine: and he came to his end.

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 28
text: And Lamech was a hundred and eighty-two years old when he had a son:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 29
text: And he gave him the name of Noah, saying, Truly, he will give us rest from our trouble and the hard work of our hands, because of the earth which was cursed by God.

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 30
text: And after the birth of Noah, Lamech went on living for five hundred and ninety-five years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 31
text: And all the years of Lamech's life were seven hundred and seventy-seven: and he came to his end.

title: Genesis Chapter 5 Verse 32
text: And when Noah was five hundred years old, he became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: And after a time, when men were increasing on the earth, and had daughters,

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: The sons of God saw that the daughters of men were fair; and they took wives for themselves from those who were pleasing to them.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: And the Lord said, My spirit will not be in man for ever, for he is only flesh; so the days of his life will be a hundred and twenty years.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: There were men of great strength and size on the earth in those days; and after that, when the sons of God had connection with the daughters of men, they gave birth to children: these were the great men of old days, the men of great name.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And the Lord saw that the sin of man was great on the earth, and that all the thoughts of his heart were evil.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: And the Lord had sorrow because he had made man on the earth, and grief was in his heart.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And the Lord said, I will take away man, whom I have made, from the face of the earth, even man and beast and that which goes on the earth and every bird of the air; for I have sorrow for having made them.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: But Noah had grace in the eyes of God.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: These are the generations of Noah. Noah was an upright man and without sin in his generation: he went in the ways of God.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And Noah had three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And the earth was evil in God's eyes and full of violent ways.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And God, looking on the earth, saw that it was evil: for the way of all flesh had become evil on the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And God said to Noah, The end of all flesh has come; the earth is full of their violent doings, and now I will put an end to them with the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: Make for yourself an ark of gopher wood with rooms in it, and make it safe from the water inside and out.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: And this is the way you are to make it: it is to be three hundred cubits long, fifty cubits wide, and thirty cubits high.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: You are to put a window in the ark, a cubit from the roof, and a door in the side of it, and you are to make it with a lower and second and third floors.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: For truly, I will send a great flow of waters over the earth, for the destruction from under the heaven of all flesh in which is the breath of life; everything on the earth will come to an end.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: But with you I will make an agreement; and you will come into the ark, you and your sons and your wife and your sons' wives with you.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: And you will take with you into the ark two of every sort of living thing, and keep them safe with you; they will be male and female.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: Two of every sort of bird and cattle and of every sort of living thing which goes on the earth will you take with you to keep them from destruction.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: And make a store of every sort of food for yourself and them.

title: Genesis Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: And all these things Noah did; as God said, so he did.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Noah, Take all your family and go into the ark, for you only in this generation have I seen to be upright.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: Of every clean beast you will take seven males and seven females, and of the beasts which are not clean, two, the male and his female;

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: And of the birds of the air, seven males and seven females, so that their seed may still be living on the face of the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: For after seven days I will send rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights, for the destruction of every living thing which I have made on the face of the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: And Noah did everything which the Lord said he was to do.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: And Noah was six hundred years old when the waters came flowing over all the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: And Noah, with his sons and his wife and his sons' wives, went into the ark because of the flowing of the waters.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: Of clean beasts, and of beasts which are not clean, and of birds, and of everything which goes on the earth,

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: In twos, male and female, they went into the ark with Noah, as God had said.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And after the seven days, the waters came over all the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, all the fountains of the great deep came bursting through, and the windows of heaven were open;

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: And rain came down on the earth for forty days and forty nights.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: On the same day Noah, with Shem, Ham, and Japheth, his sons, and his wife and his sons' wives, went into the ark;

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: And with them, every sort of beast and cattle, and every sort of thing which goes on the earth, and every sort of bird.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: They went with Noah into the ark, two and two of all flesh in which is the breath of life.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: Male and female of all flesh went in, as God had said, and the ark was shut by the Lord.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: And for forty days the waters were over all the earth; and the waters were increased so that the ark was lifted up high over the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: And the waters overcame everything and were increased greatly on the earth, and the ark was resting on the face of the waters.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: And the waters overcame everything on the earth; and all the mountains under heaven were covered.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: The waters went fifteen cubits higher, till all the mountains were covered.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: And destruction came on every living thing moving on the earth, birds and cattle and beasts and everything which went on the earth, and every man.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: Everything on the dry land, in which was the breath of life, came to its end.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: Every living thing on the face of all the earth, man and cattle and things moving on the face of the earth, and birds of the air, came to destruction: only Noah and those who were with him in the ark, were kept from death.

title: Genesis Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: And the waters were over the earth a hundred and fifty days.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And God kept Noah in mind, and all the living things and the cattle which were with him in the ark: and God sent a wind over the earth, and the waters went down.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And the fountains of the deep and the windows of heaven were shut, and the rain from heaven was stopped.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And the waters went slowly back from the earth, and at the end of a hundred and fifty days the waters were lower.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: And on the seventeenth day of the seventh month the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And still the waters went on falling, till on the first day of the tenth month the tops of the mountains were seen.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: Then, after forty days, through the open window of the ark which he had made,

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: Noah sent out a raven, which went this way and that till the waters were gone from the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And he sent out a dove, to see if the waters had gone from the face of the earth;

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: But the dove saw no resting-place for her foot, and came back to the ark, for the waters were still over all the earth; and he put out his hand, and took her into the ark.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And after waiting another seven days, he sent the dove out again;

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And the dove came back at evening, and in her mouth was an olive-leaf broken off: so Noah was certain that the waters had gone down on the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And after seven days more, he sent the dove out again, but she did not come back to him.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: And in the six hundred and first year, on the first day of the first month, the waters were dry on the earth: and Noah took the cover off the ark and saw that the face of the earth was dry.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: And on the twenty-seventh day of the second month the earth was dry.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: And God said to Noah,

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: Go out of the ark, you and your wife and your sons and your sons' wives.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: Take out with you every living thing which is with you, birds and cattle and everything which goes on the earth, so that they may have offspring and be fertile and be increased on the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: And Noah went out with his sons and his wife and his sons' wives;

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: And every beast and bird and every living thing of every sort which goes on the earth, went out of the ark.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: And Noah made an altar to the Lord, and from every clean beast and bird he made burned offerings on the altar.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: And when the sweet smell came up to the Lord, he said in his heart, I will not again put a curse on the earth because of man, for the thoughts of man's heart are evil from his earliest days; never again will I send destruction on all living things as I have done.

title: Genesis Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: While the earth goes on, seed time and the getting in of the grain, cold and heat, summer and winter, day and night, will not come to an end.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: And God gave his blessing to Noah and his sons, and said, Be fertile, and have increase, and make the earth full.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: And the fear of you will be strong in every beast of the earth and every bird of the air; everything which goes on the land, and all the fishes of the sea, are given into your hands.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: Every living and moving thing will be food for you; I give them all to you as before I gave you all green things.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: But flesh with the life-blood in it you may not take for food.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: And for your blood, which is your life, will I take payment; from every beast I will take it, and from every man will I take payment for the blood of his brother-man.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: Whoever takes a man's life, by man will his life be taken; because God made man in his image.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: And now, be fertile and have increase; have offspring on the earth and become great in number.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And God said to Noah and to his sons,

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: Truly, I will make my agreement with you and with your seed after you,

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And with every living thing with you, all birds and cattle and every beast of the earth which comes out of the ark with you.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: And I will make my agreement with you; never again will all flesh be cut off by the waters; never again will the waters come over all the earth for its destruction.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And God said, This is the sign of the agreement which I make between me and you and every living thing with you, for all future generations:

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: I will put my bow in the cloud and it will be for a sign of the agreement between me and the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: And whenever I make a cloud come over the earth, the bow will be seen in the cloud,

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: And I will keep in mind the agreement between me and you and every living thing; and never again will there be a great flow of waters causing destruction to all flesh.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: And the bow will be in the cloud, and looking on it, I will keep in mind the eternal agreement between God and every living thing on the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: And God said to Noah, This is the sign of the agreement which I have made between me and all flesh on the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: And the sons of Noah who went out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth; and Ham is the father of Canaan.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: These three were the sons of Noah and from them all the earth was peopled.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: In those days Noah became a farmer, and he made a vine-garden.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: And he took of the wine of it and was overcome by drink; and he was uncovered in his tent.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw his father unclothed, and gave news of it to his two brothers outside.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: And Shem and Japheth took a robe, and putting it on their backs went in with their faces turned away, and put it over their father so that they might not see him unclothed.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: And, awaking from his wine, Noah saw what his youngest son had done to him, and he said,

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: Cursed be Canaan; let him be a servant of servants to his brothers.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: And he said, Praise to the Lord, the God of Shem; let Canaan be his servant.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: May God make Japheth great, and let his living-place be in the tents of Shem, and let Canaan be his servant.

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: And Noah went on living three hundred and fifty years after the great flow of waters;

title: Genesis Chapter 9 Verse 29
text: all the years of his life were nine hundred and fifty: and he came to his end.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth: these are the sons which they had after the great flow of waters

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer and Magog and Madai and Javan and Tubal and Meshech and Tiras.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz and Riphath and Togarmah.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: And the sons of Javan: Elishah and Tarshish, the Kittim and the Dodanim.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: From these came the nations of the sea-lands, with their different families and languages.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: And the sons of Ham: Cush and Mizraim and Put and Canaan.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And the sons of Cush: Seba and Havilah and Sabtah and Raamah and Sabteca; and the sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: And Cush was the father of Nimrod, who was the first of the great men of the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: He was a very great bowman, so that there is a saying, Like Nimrod, a very great bowman.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And at the first, his kingdom was Babel and Erech and Accad and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: From that land he went out into Assyria, building Nineveh with its wide streets and Calah,

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: And Resen between Nineveh and Calah, which is a very great town.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: And Mizraim was the father of the Ludim and Anamim and Lehabim and Naphtuhim;

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: And Pathrusim and Casluhim and Caphtorim, from whom came the Philistines.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: And Canaan was the father of Zidon, who was his oldest son, and Heth,

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: And the Jebusite and the Amorite and the Girgashite,

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: And the Hivite and the Arkite and the Sinite,

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: And the Arvadite and the Zemarite and the Hamathite; after that the families of the Canaanites went far and wide in all directions;

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: Their country stretching from Zidon to Gaza, in the direction of Gerar; and to Lasha, in the direction of Sodom and Gomorrah and Admah and Zeboiim.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: All these, with their different families, languages, lands, and nations, are the offspring of Ham.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: And Shem, the older brother of Japheth, the father of the children of Eber, had other sons in addition.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: These are the sons of Shem: Elam and Asshur and Arpachshad and Lud and Aram.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: And the sons of Aram: Uz and Hul and Gether and Mash.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: And Arpachshad became the father of Shelah; and Shelah became the father of Eber.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: And Eber had two sons: the name of the one was Peleg, because in his time the peoples of the earth became separate; and his brother's name was Joktan.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: And Joktan was the father of Almodad and Sheleph and Hazarmaveth and Jerah

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: And Hadoram and Uzal and Diklah

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: And Obal and Abimael and Sheba

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: And Ophir and Havilah and Jobab; all these were the sons of Joktan.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: And their country was from Mesha, in the direction of Sephar, the mountain of the east.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: These, with their families and their languages and their lands and their nations, are the offspring of Shem.

title: Genesis Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: These are the families of the sons of Noah, in the order of their generations and their nations: from these came all the nations of the earth after the great flow of waters.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: And all the earth had one language and one tongue.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: And it came about that in their wandering from the east, they came to a stretch of flat country in the land of Shinar, and there they made their living-place.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: And they said one to another, Come, let us make bricks, burning them well. And they had bricks for stone, putting them together with sticky earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: And they said, Come, let us make a town, and a tower whose top will go up as high as heaven; and let us make a great name for ourselves, so that we may not be wanderers over the face of the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And the Lord came down to see the town and the tower which the children of men were building.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And the Lord said, See, they are all one people and have all one language; and this is only the start of what they may do: and now it will not be possible to keep them from any purpose of theirs.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: Come, let us go down and take away the sense of their language, so that they will not be able to make themselves clear to one another.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: So the Lord God sent them away into every part of the earth: and they gave up building their town.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: So it was named Babel, because there the Lord took away the sense of all languages and from there the Lord sent them away over all the face of the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: These are the generations of Shem. Shem was a hundred years old when he became the father of Arpachshad, two years after the great flow of waters;

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: And after the birth of Arpachshad, Shem went on living for five hundred years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And Arpachshad was thirty-five years old when he became the father of Shelah:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: And after the birth of Shelah, Arpachshad went on living for four hundred and three years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And Shelah was thirty years old when he became the father of Eber:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: And after the birth of Eber, Shelah went on living for four hundred and three years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: And Eber was thirty-four years old when he became the father of Peleg:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: And after the birth of Peleg, Eber went on living for four hundred and thirty years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: And Peleg was thirty years old when he became the father of Reu:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: And after the birth of Reu, Peleg went on living for two hundred and nine years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: And Reu was thirty-two years old when he became the father of Serug:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: And after the birth of Serug, Reu went on living for two hundred and seven years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: And Serug was thirty years old when he became the father of Nahor:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: And after the birth of Nahor, Serug went on living for two hundred years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: And Nahor was twenty-nine years old when he became the father of Terah:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: And after the birth of Terah, Nahor went on living for a hundred and nineteen years, and had sons and daughters:

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: And Terah was seventy years old when he became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: These are the generations of Terah: Terah was the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran was the father of Lot.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: And death came to Haran when he was with his father Terah in the land of his birth, Ur of the Chaldees.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: And Abram and Nahor took wives for themselves: the name of Abram's wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor's wife was Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah and Iscah.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: And Sarai had no child.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: And Terah took Abram, his son, and Lot, the son of Haran, and Sarai, his daughter-in-law, the wife of his son Abram and they went out from Ur of the Chaldees, to go to the land of Canaan; and they came to Haran, and were there for some time.

title: Genesis Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: And all the years of Terah's life were two hundred and five: and Terah came to his end in Haran.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: Now the Lord said to Abram, Go out from your country and from your family and from your father's house, into the land to which I will be your guide:

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: And I will make of you a great nation, blessing you and making your name great; and you will be a blessing:

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: To them who are good to you will I give blessing, and on him who does you wrong will I put my curse: and you will become a name of blessing to all the families of the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: So Abram went as the Lord had said to him, and Lot went with him: Abram was seventy-five years old when he went away from Haran.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: And Abram took Sarai, his wife, and Lot, his brother's son, and all their goods and the servants which they had got in Haran, and they went out to go to the land of Canaan.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: And Abram went through the land till he came to Shechem, to the holy tree of Moreh. At that time, the Canaanites were still living in the land.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: And the Lord came to Abram, and said, I will give all this land to your seed; then Abram made an altar there to the Lord who had let himself be seen by him.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: And moving on from there to the mountain on the east of Beth-el, he put up his tent, having Beth-el on the west and Ai on the east: and there he made an altar and gave worship to the name of the Lord.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: And he went on, journeying still to the South.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: And because there was little food to be had in that land, he went down into Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: Now when he came near to Egypt, he said to Sarai, his wife, Truly, you are a fair woman and beautiful to the eye;

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: And I am certain that when the men of Egypt see you, they will say, This is his wife: and they will put me to death and keep you.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: Say, then, that you are my sister, and so it will be well with me because of you, and my life will be kept safe on your account.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: And so it was that when Abram came into Egypt, the men of Egypt, looking on the woman, saw that she was fair.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: And Pharaoh's great men, having seen her, said words in praise of her to Pharaoh, and she was taken into Pharaoh's house.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: And because of her, he was good to Abram, and he had sheep and oxen and asses, and men-servants and women-servants, and camels.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: And the Lord sent great troubles on Pharaoh's house because of Sarai, Abram's wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: Then Pharaoh sent for Abram, and said, What have you done to me? why did you not say that she was your wife?

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: Why did you say that she was your sister? so that I took her for my wife: now, take your wife and go on your way.

title: Genesis Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: And Pharaoh gave orders to his men, and they sent him on his way, with his wife and all he had.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: And Abram went up out of Egypt with his wife and all he had, and Lot with him, and they came in to the South.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: Now Abram had great wealth of cattle and silver and gold.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: And travelling on from the South, he came to Beth-el, to the place where his tent had been before, between Beth-el and Ai;

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: To the place where he had made his first altar, and there Abram gave worship to the name of the Lord.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: And Lot, who went with him, had flocks and herds and tents;

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: So that the land was not wide enough for the two of them: their property was so great that there was not room for them together.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: And there was an argument between the keepers of Abram's cattle and the keepers of Lot's cattle: at that time the Canaanites and Perizzites were still living in the land.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: Then Abram said to Lot, Let there be no argument between me and you, and between my herdmen and your herdmen, for we are brothers.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: Is not all the land before you? then let us go our separate ways: if you go to the left, I will go to the right; or if you take the right, I will go to the left.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: And Lot, lifting up his eyes and looking an the valley of Jordan, saw that it was well watered everywhere, before the Lord had sent destruction on Sodom and Gomorrah; it was like the garden of the Lord, like the land of Egypt, on the way to Zoar.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: So Lot took for himself all the valley of Jordan, and went to the east, and they were parted from one another.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: Abram went on living in the land of Canaan, and Lot went to the lowland towns, moving his tent as far as Sodom.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: Now the men of Sodom were evil, and great sinners before the Lord.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: And the Lord had said to Abram, after Lot was parted from him, From this place where you are take a look to the north and to the south, to the east and to the west:

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: For all the land which you see I will give to you and to your seed for ever.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: And I will make your children like the dust of the earth, so that if the dust of the earth may be numbered, then will your children be numbered.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: Come, go through all the land from one end to the other for I will give it to you.

title: Genesis Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: And Abram, moving his tent, came and made his living-place by the holy tree of Mamre, which is in Hebron, and made an altar there to the Lord.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: Now in the days of Amraphel, king of Shinar, Arioch, king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer, king of Elam, and Tidal, king of Goiim,

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: They made war with Bera, king of Sodom, and with Birsha, king of Gomorrah, Shinab, king of Admah, and Shemeber, king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (which is Zoar).

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: All these came together in the valley of Siddim (which is the Salt Sea).

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: For twelve years they were under the rule of Chedorlaomer, but in the thirteenth year they put off his control.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: And in the fourteenth year, Chedorlaomer and the kings who were on his side, overcame the Rephaim in Ashteroth-karnaim, and the Zuzim in Ham, and the Emim in Shaveh-kiriathaim,

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: And the Horites in their mountain Seir, driving them as far as El-paran, which is near the waste land.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: Then they came back to En-mishpat (which is Kadesh), making waste all the country of the Amalekites and of the Amorites living in Hazazon-tamar.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: And the king of Sodom with the king of Gomorrah and the king of Admah and the king of Zeboiim and the king of Bela (that is Zoar), went out, and put their forces in position in the valley of Siddim,

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: Against Chedorlaomer, king of Elam, and Tidal, king of Goiim, and Amraphel, king of Shinar, and Arioch, king of Ellasar: four kings against the five.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: Now the valley of Siddim was full of holes of sticky earth; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah were put to flight and came to their end there, but the rest got away to the mountain.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: And the four kings took all the goods and food from Sodom and Gomorrah and went on their way.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: And in addition they took Lot, Abram's brother's son, who was living in Sodom, and all his goods.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: And one who had got away from the fight came and gave word of it to Abram the Hebrew, who was living by the holy tree of Mamre, the Amorite, the brother of Eshcol and Aner, who were friends of Abram.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: And Abram, hearing that his brother's son had been made a prisoner, took a band of his trained men, three hundred and eighteen of them, sons of his house, and went after them as far as Dan.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: And separating his forces by night, he overcame them, putting them to flight and going after them as far as Hobah, which is on the north side of Damascus.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: And he got back all the goods, and Lot, his brother's son, with his goods and the women and the people.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: And when he was coming back after putting to flight Chedorlaomer and the other kings, he had a meeting with the king of Sodom in the valley of Shaveh, that is, the King's Valley.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: And Melchizedek, king of Salem, the priest of the Most High God, took bread and wine,

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: And blessing him, said, May the blessing of the Most High God, maker of heaven and earth, be on Abram:

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: And let the Most High God be praised, who has given into your hands those who were against you. Then Abram gave him a tenth of all the goods he had taken.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: And the king of Sodom said to Abram, Give me the prisoners and take the goods for yourself.

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: But Abram said to the king of Sodom, I have taken an oath to the Lord, the Most High God, maker of heaven and earth,

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: That I will not take so much as a thread or the cord of a shoe of yours; so that you may not say, I have given wealth to Abram:

title: Genesis Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: Give me nothing but the food which the fighting-men who went with me have had; but let Aner and Eshcol and Mamre have their part of the goods.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: After these things, the word of the Lord came to Abram in a vision, saying, Have no fear, Abram: I will keep you safe, and great will be your reward.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: And Abram said, What will you give me? for I have no child and this Eliezer of Damascus will have all my wealth after me.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: And Abram said, You have given me no child, and a servant in my house will get the heritage.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: Then said the Lord, This man will not get the heritage, but a son of your body will have your property after you.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: And he took him out into the open air, and said to him, Let your eyes be lifted to heaven, and see if the stars may be numbered; even so will your seed be.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: And he had faith in the Lord, and it was put to his account as righteousness.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: And he said to him, I am the Lord, who took you from Ur of the Chaldees, to give you this land for your heritage.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: And he said, O Lord God, how may I be certain that it will be mine?

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: And he said, Take a young cow of three years old, and a she-goat of three years old, and a sheep of three years old, and a dove and a young pigeon.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: All these he took, cutting them in two and putting one half opposite the other, but not cutting the birds in two.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: And evil birds came down on the bodies, but Abram sent them away.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: Now when the sun was going down, a deep sleep came on Abram, and a dark cloud of fear.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: And he said to Abram, Truly, your seed will be living in a land which is not theirs, as servants to a people who will be cruel to them for four hundred years;

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: But I will be the judge of that nation whose servants they are, and they will come out from among them with great wealth.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: As for you, you will go to your fathers in peace; at the end of a long life you will be put in your last resting-place.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: And in the fourth generation they will come back here; for at present the sin of the Amorite is not full.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: Then when the sun went down and it was dark, he saw a smoking fire and a flaming light which went between the parts of the bodies.

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: In that day the Lord made an agreement with Abram, and said, To your seed have I given this land from the river of Egypt to the great river, the river Euphrates:

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: The Kenite, the Kenizzite, and the Kadmonite,

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: And the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Rephaim,

title: Genesis Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: And the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Girgashite, and the Jebusite.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: Now Sarai, Abram's wife, had given him no children; and she had a servant, a woman of Egypt whose name was Hagar.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: And Sarai said to Abram, See, the Lord has not let me have children; go in to my servant, for I may get a family through her. And Abram did as Sarai said.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: So after Abram had been living for ten years in the land of Canaan, Sarai took Hagar, her Egyptian servant, and gave her to Abram for his wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: And he went in to Hagar and she became with child, and when she saw that she was with child, she no longer had any respect for her master's wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: And Sarai said to Abram, May my wrong be on you: I gave you my servant for your wife and when she saw that she was with child, she no longer had any respect for me: may the Lord be judge between you and me.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: And Abram said, The woman is in your power; do with her whatever seems good to you. And Sarai was cruel to her, so that she went running away from her.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: And an angel of the Lord came to her by a fountain of water in the waste land, by the fountain on the way to Shur.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: And he said, Hagar, Sarai's servant, where have you come from and where are you going? And she said, I am running away from Sarai, my master's wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: And the angel said to her, Go back, and put yourself under her authority.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: And the angel of the Lord said, Your seed will be greatly increased so that it may not be numbered.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: And the angel of the Lord said, See, you are with child and will give birth to a son, to whom you will give the name Ishmael, because the ears of the Lord were open to your sorrow.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: And he will be like a mountain ass among men; his hand will be against every man and every man's hand against him, and he will keep his place against all his brothers.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: And to the Lord who was talking with her she gave this name, You are a God who is seen; for she said, Have I not even here in the waste land had a vision of God and am still living?

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: So that fountain was named, Fountain of Life and Vision: it is between Kadesh and Bered.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: And Hagar gave birth to a child, the son of Abram, to whom Abram gave the name of Ishmael.

title: Genesis Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar gave birth to Ishmael.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the Lord came to him, and said, I am God, Ruler of all; go in my ways and be upright in all things,

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: And I will make an agreement between you and me, and your offspring will be greatly increased.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: And Abram went down on his face on the earth, and the Lord God went on talking with him, and said,

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: As for me, my agreement is made with you, and you will be the father of nations without end.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: No longer will your name be Abram, but Abraham, for I have made you the father of a number of nations.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: I will make you very fertile, so that nations will come from you and kings will be your offspring.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: And I will make between me and you and your seed after you through all generations, an eternal agreement to be a God to you and to your seed after you.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: And to you and to your seed after you, I will give the land in which you are living, all the land of Canaan for an eternal heritage; and I will be their God.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: And God said to Abraham, On your side, you are to keep the agreement, you and your seed after you through all generations.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: And this is the agreement which you are to keep with me, you and your seed after you: every male among you is to undergo circumcision.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: In the flesh of your private parts you are to undergo it, as a mark of the agreement between me and you.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: Every male among you, from one generation to another, is to undergo circumcision when he is eight days old, with every servant whose birth takes place in your house, or for whom you gave money to someone of another country, and not of your seed.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: He who comes to birth in your house and he who is made yours for a price, all are to undergo circumcision; so that my agreement may be marked in your flesh, an agreement for all time.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: And any male who does not undergo circumcision will be cut off from his people: my agreement has been broken by him.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: And God said, As for Sarai, your wife, from now her name will be not Sarai, but Sarah.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: And I will give her a blessing so that you will have a son by her: truly my blessing will be on her, and she will be the mother of nations: kings of peoples will be her offspring.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: Then Abraham went down on his face, and laughing, said in his heart, May a man a hundred years old have a child? will Sarah, at ninety years old, give birth?

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: And Abraham said to God, If only Ishmael's life might be your care!

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 19
text: And God said, Not so; but Sarah, your wife, will have a son, and you will give him the name Isaac, and I will make my agreement with him for ever and with his seed after him.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 20
text: As for Ishmael, I have given ear to your prayer: truly I have given him my blessing and I will make him fertile and give him great increase; he will be the father of twelve chiefs, and I will make him a great nation.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 21
text: But my agreement will be with Isaac, to whom Sarah will give birth a year from this time.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 22
text: And having said these words, God went up from Abraham.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 23
text: And Abraham took Ishmael, his son, and all whose birth had taken place in his house, and all his servants whom he had made his for a price, every male of his house, and on that very day he gave them circumcision in the flesh of their private parts as God had said to him.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 24
text: Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he underwent circumcision.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 25
text: And Ishmael, his son, was thirteen years old when he underwent circumcision.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 26
text: Abraham and Ishmael, his son, underwent circumcision on that very day.

title: Genesis Chapter 17 Verse 27
text: And all the men of his house, those whose birth had taken place in the house and those whom he had got for money from men of other lands, underwent circumcision with him.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: Now the Lord came to him by the holy tree of Mamre, when he was seated in the doorway of his tent in the middle of the day;

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: And lifting up his eyes, he saw three men before him; and seeing them, he went quickly to them from the door of the tent, and went down on his face to the earth;

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: And said, My Lord, if now I have grace in your eyes, do not go away from your servant:

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: Let me get water for washing your feet, and take your rest under the tree:

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: And let me get a bit of bread to keep up your strength, and after that you may go on your way: for this is why you have come to your servant. And they said, Let it be so.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: Then Abraham went quickly into the tent, and said to Sarah, Get three measures of meal straight away and make cakes.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: And running to the herd, he took a young ox, soft and fat, and gave it to the servant and he quickly made it ready;

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: And he took butter and milk and the young ox which he had made ready and put it before them, waiting by them under the tree while they took food.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: And they said to him, Where is Sarah your wife? And he said, She is in the tent.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: And he said, I will certainly come back to you in the spring, and Sarah your wife will have a son. And his words came to the ears of Sarah who was at the back of the tent-door.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: Now Abraham and Sarah were very old, and Sarah was past the time for giving birth.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: And Sarah, laughing to herself, said, Now that I am used up am I still to have pleasure, my husband himself being old?

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: And the Lord said, Why was Sarah laughing and saying, Is it possible for me, being old, to give birth to a child?

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: Is there any wonder which the Lord is not able to do? At the time I said, in the spring, I will come back to you, and Sarah will have a child.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: Then Sarah said, I was not laughing; for she was full of fear. And he said, No, but you were laughing.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: And the men went on from there in the direction of Sodom; and Abraham went with them on their way.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: And the Lord said, Am I to keep back from Abraham the knowledge of what I do;

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: Seeing that Abraham will certainly become a great and strong nation, and his name will be used by all the nations of the earth as a blessing?

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: For I have made him mine so that he may give orders to his children and those of his line after him, to keep the ways of the Lord, to do what is good and right: so that the Lord may do to Abraham as he has said.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: And the Lord said, Because the outcry against Sodom and Gomorrah is very great, and their sin is very evil,

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: I will go down now, and see if their acts are as bad as they seem from the outcry which has come to me; and if they are not, I will see.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: And the men, turning from that place, went on to Sodom: but Abraham was still waiting before the Lord.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: And Abraham came near, and said, Will you let destruction come on the upright with the sinners?

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: If by chance there are fifty upright men in the town, will you give the place to destruction and not have mercy on it because of the fifty upright men?

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: Let such a thing be far from you, to put the upright to death with the sinner: will not the judge of all the earth do right?

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: And the Lord said, If there are fifty upright men in the town, I will have mercy on it because of them.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: And Abraham answering said, Truly, I who am only dust, have undertaken to put my thoughts before the Lord:

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: If by chance there are five less than fifty upright men, will you give up all the town to destruction because of these five? And he said, I will not give it to destruction if there are forty-five.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 29
text: And again he said to him, By chance there may be forty there. And he said, I will not do it if there are forty.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 30
text: And he said, Let not the Lord be angry with me if I say, What if there are thirty there? And he said, I will not do it if there are thirty.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 31
text: And he said, See now, I have undertaken to put my thoughts before the Lord: what if there are twenty there? And he said, I will have mercy because of the twenty.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 32
text: And he said, O let not the Lord be angry and I will say only one word more: by chance there may be ten there. And he said, I will have mercy because of the ten.

title: Genesis Chapter 18 Verse 33
text: And the Lord went on his way when his talk with Abraham was ended, and Abraham went back to his place.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: And at nightfall the two angels came to Sodom; and Lot was seated at the way into the town: and when he saw them he got up and came before them, falling down on his face to the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: And he said, My masters, come now into your servant's house and take your rest there for the night, and let your feet be washed; and early in the morning you may go on your way. And they said, Not so, but we will take our night's rest in the street.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: But he made his request more strongly, so they went with him into his house; and he got food ready for them, and made unleavened bread, of which they took.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: But before they had gone to bed, the men of the town, all the men of Sodom, came round the house, young and old, from every part of the town;

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: And crying out to Lot, they said, Where are the men who came to your house this night? Send them out to us, so that we may take our pleasure with them.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: And Lot went out to them in the doorway, shutting the door after him.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: And he said, My brothers, do not this evil.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: See now, I have two unmarried daughters; I will send them out to you so that you may do to them whatever seems good to you: only do nothing to these men, for this is why they have come under the shade of my roof.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: And they said, Give way there. This one man, they said, came here from a strange country, and will he now be our judge? now we will do worse to you than to them; and pushing violently against Lot, they came near to get the door broken in.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: But the men put out their hands and took Lot into the house to them, shutting the door again.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: But the men who were outside the door they made blind, all of them, small and great, so that they were tired out with looking for the door.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: Then the men said to Lot, Are there any others of your family here? sons-in-law or sons or daughters, take them all out of this place;

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: For we are about to send destruction on this place, because a great outcry against them has come to the ears of the Lord; and the Lord has sent us to put an end to the town.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: And Lot went out and said to his sons-in-law, who were married to his daughters, Come, let us go out of this place, for the Lord is about to send destruction on the town. But his sons-in-law did not take him seriously.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: And when morning came, the angels did all in their power to make Lot go, saying, Get up quickly and take your wife and your two daughters who are here, and go, for fear that you come to destruction in the punishment of the town.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: But while he was waiting, the men took him and his wife and his daughters by the hand, for the Lord had mercy on them, and put them outside the town.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: And when they had put them out, he said, Go for your life, without looking back or waiting in the lowland; go quickly to the mountain or you will come to destruction.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: And Lot said to them, Not so, O my Lord;

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: See now, your servant has had grace in your eyes and great is your mercy in keeping my life from destruction, but I am not able to get as far as the mountain before evil overtakes me and death;

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: This town, now, is near, and it is a little one: O, let me go there (is it not a little one?) so that my life may be safe.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: And he said, See, I have given you your request in this one thing more: I will not send destruction on this town.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: Go there quickly, for I am not able to do anything till you have come there. For this reason, the town was named Zoar.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: The sun was up when Lot came to Zoar.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: Then the Lord sent fire and flaming smoke raining down from heaven on Sodom and Gomorrah.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 25
text: And he sent destruction on those towns, with all the lowland and all the people of those towns and every green thing in the land.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 26
text: But Lot's wife, looking back, became a pillar of salt.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 27
text: And Abraham got up early in the morning and went to the place where he had been talking with the Lord:

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 28
text: And looking in the direction of Sodom and Gomorrah and the lowland, he saw the smoke of the land going up like the smoke of an oven.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 29
text: So it came about that when God sent destruction on the towns of the lowland, he kept his word to Abraham, and sent Lot safely away when he put an end to the towns where he was living.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 30
text: Then Lot went up out of Zoar to the mountain, and was living there with his two daughters, for fear kept him from living in Zoar: and he and his daughters made their living-place in a hole in the rock.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 31
text: And the older daughter said to her sister, Our father is old, and there is no man to be a husband to us in the natural way:

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 32
text: Come, let us give our father much wine, and we will go into his bed, so that we may have offspring by our father,

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 33
text: And that night they made their father take much wine; and the older daughter went into his bed; and he had no knowledge of when she went in or when she went away.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 34
text: And on the day after, the older daughter said to the younger, Last night I was with my father; let us make him take much wine this night again, and do you go to him, so that we may have offspring by our father.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 35
text: And that night again they made their father take much wine; and the younger daughter went into his bed; and he had no knowledge of when she went in or when she went away.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 36
text: And so the two daughters of Lot were with child by their father.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 37
text: And the older daughter had a son, and she gave him the name Moab: he is the father of the Moabites to this day.

title: Genesis Chapter 19 Verse 38
text: And the younger had a son and gave him the name Ben-ammi: from him come the children of Ammon to this day.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 1
