text: And Abraham went on his way from there to the land of the South, and was living between Kadesh and Shur, in Gerar.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: And Abraham said of Sarah, his wife, She is my sister: and Abimelech, king of Gerar, sent and took Sarah.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: But God came to Abimelech in a dream in the night, and said to him, Truly you are a dead man because of the woman whom you have taken; for she is a man's wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: Now Abimelech had not come near her; and he said, Lord, will you put to death an upright nation?

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: Did he not say to me himself, She is my sister? and she herself said, He is my brother: with an upright heart and clean hands have I done this.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: And God said to him in the dream, I see that you have done this with an upright heart, and I have kept you from sinning against me: for this reason I did not let you come near her.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: So now, give the man back his wife, for he is a prophet, and let him say a prayer for you, so your life may be safe: but if you do not give her back, be certain that death will come to you and all your house.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: So Abimelech got up early in the morning and sent for all his servants and gave them word of these things, and they were full of fear.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: Then Abimelech sent for Abraham, and said, What have you done to us? what wrong have I done you that you have put on me and on my kingdom so great a sin? You have done to me things which are not to be done.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: And Abimelech said to Abraham, Why did you do this thing?

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: And Abraham said, Because it seemed to me that there was no fear of God in this place, and that they might put me to death because of my wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: And, in fact, she is my sister, the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother; and she became my wife:

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: And when God sent me wandering from my father's house, I said to her, Let this be the sign of your love for me; wherever we go, say of me, He is my brother.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: Then Abimelech gave to Abraham sheep and oxen and men-servants and women-servants, and gave him back his wife Sarah.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: And Abimelech said, See, all my land is before you; take whatever place seems good to you.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: And he said to Sarah, See, I have given to your brother a thousand bits of silver so that your wrong may be put right; now your honour is clear in the eyes of all.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: Then Abraham made prayer to God, and God made Abimelech well again, and his wife and his women-servants, so that they had children.

title: Genesis Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: For the Lord had kept all the women of the house of Abimelech from having children, because of Sarah, Abraham's wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: And the Lord came to Sarah as he had said and did to her as he had undertaken.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: And Sarah became with child, and gave Abraham a son when he was old, at the time named by God.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: And Abraham gave to his son, to whom Sarah had given birth, the name Isaac.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: And when his son Isaac was eight days old, Abraham made him undergo circumcision, as God had said to him.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: Now Abraham was a hundred years old when the birth of Isaac took place.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: And Sarah said, God has given me cause for laughing, and everyone who has news of it will be laughing with me.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: And she said, Who would have said to Abraham that Sarah would have a child at her breast? for see, I have given him a son now when he is old.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: And when the child was old enough to be taken from the breast, Abraham made a great feast.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: And Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian playing with Isaac.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: So she said to Abraham, Send away that woman and her son: for the son of that woman is not to have a part in the heritage with my son Isaac.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: And this was a great grief to Abraham because of his son.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: But God said, Let it not be a grief to you because of the boy and Hagar his mother; give ear to whatever Sarah says to you, because it is from Isaac that your seed will take its name.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: And I will make a nation of the son of your servant-woman, because he is your seed.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: And early in the morning Abraham got up, and gave Hagar some bread and a water-skin, and put the boy on her back, and sent her away: and she went, wandering in the waste land of Beer-sheba.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: And when all the water in the skin was used up, she put the child down under a tree.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: And she went some distance away, about an arrow flight, and seating herself on the earth, she gave way to bitter weeping, saying, Let me not see the death of my child.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: And the boy's cry came to the ears of God; and the angel of God said to Hagar from heaven, Hagar, why are you weeping? have no fear, for the child's cry has come to the ears of God.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: Come, take your child in your arms, for I will make of him a great nation.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: Then God made her eyes open, and she saw a water-spring, and she got water in the skin and gave the boy a drink.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: And God was with the boy, and he became tall and strong, and he became a bowman, living in the waste land.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: And while he was in the waste land of Paran, his mother got him a wife from the land of Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: Now at that time, Abimelech and Phicol, the captain of his army, said to Abraham, I see that God is with you in all you do.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: Now, then, give me your oath, in the name of God, that you will not be false to me or to my sons after me, but that as I have been good to you, so you will be to me and to this land where you have been living.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: And Abraham said, I will give you my oath.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: But Abraham made a protest to Abimelech because of a water-hole which Abimelech's servants had taken by force.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 26
text: But Abimelech said, I have no idea who has done this thing; you never gave me word of it, and I had no knowledge of it till this day.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 27
text: And Abraham took sheep and oxen and gave them to Abimelech, and the two of them made an agreement together.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 28
text: And Abraham put seven young lambs of the flock on one side by themselves.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 29
text: Then Abimelech said, What are these seven lambs which you have put on one side?

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 30
text: And he said, Take these seven lambs from me as a witness that I have made this water-hole.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 31
text: So he gave that place the name Beer-sheba, because there the two of them had given their oaths.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 32
text: So they made an agreement at Beer-sheba, and Abimelech and Phicol, the captain of his army, went back to the land of the Philistines.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 33
text: And Abraham, after planting a holy tree in Beer-sheba, gave worship to the name of the Lord, the Eternal God.

title: Genesis Chapter 21 Verse 34
text: And Abraham went on living in the land of the Philistines as in a strange country.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: Now after these things, God put Abraham to the test, and said to him, Abraham; and he said, Here am I.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: And he said to him, Take your son, your dearly loved only son Isaac, and go to the land of Moriah and give him as a burned offering on one of the mountains of which I will give you knowledge.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: And Abraham got up early in the morning, and made ready his ass, and took with him two of his young men and Isaac, his son, and after the wood for the burned offering had been cut, he went on his way to the place of which God had given him word.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: And on the third day, Abraham, lifting up his eyes, saw the place a long way off.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: Then he said to his young men, Keep here with the ass; and I and the boy will go on and give worship and come back again to you.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: And Abraham put the wood for the burned offering on his son's back, and he himself took the fire and the knife in his hand, and the two of them went on together.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: Then Isaac said to Abraham, My father; and he said, Here am I, my son. And he said, We have wood and fire here, but where is the lamb for the burned offering?

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: And Abraham said, God himself will give the lamb for the burned offering: so they went on together.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: And they came to the place of which God had given him knowledge; and there Abraham made the altar and put the wood in place on it, and having made tight the bands round Isaac his son, he put him on the wood on the altar.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: And stretching out his hand, Abraham took the knife to put his son to death.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: But the voice of the angel of the Lord came from heaven, saying, Abraham, Abraham: and he said, Here am I.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: And he said, Let not your hand be stretched out against the boy to do anything to him; for now I am certain that the fear of God is in your heart, because you have not kept back your son, your only son, from me.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: And lifting up his eyes, Abraham saw a sheep fixed by its horns in the brushwood: and Abraham took the sheep and made a burned offering of it in place of his son.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: And Abraham gave that place the name Yahweh-yireh: as it is said to this day, In the mountain the Lord is seen.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: And the voice of the angel of the Lord came to Abraham a second time from heaven,

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: Saying, I have taken an oath by my name, says the Lord, because you have done this and have not kept back from me your dearly loved only son,

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: That I will certainly give you my blessing, and your seed will be increased like the stars of heaven and the sand by the seaside; your seed will take the land of those who are against them;

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: And your seed will be a blessing to all the nations of the earth, because you have done what I gave you orders to do.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: Then Abraham went back to his young men and they went together to Beer-sheba, the place where Abraham was living.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: After these things, Abraham had news that Milcah, the wife of his brother Nahor, had given birth to children;

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: Uz the oldest, and Buz his brother, and Kemuel, the father of Aram,

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: And Chesed and Hazo and Pildash and Jidlaph and Bethuel.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: Bethuel was the father of Rebekah: these eight were the children of Milcah and Nahor, Abraham's brother.

title: Genesis Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: And his servant Reumah gave birth to Tebah and Gaham and Tahash and Maacah.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: Now the years of Sarah's life were a hundred and twenty-seven.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: And Sarah's death took place in Kiriath-arba, that is, Hebron, in the land of Canaan: and Abraham went into his house, weeping and sorrowing for Sarah.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: And Abraham came from his dead and said to the children of Heth,

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: I am living among you as one from a strange country: give me some land here as my property, so that I may put my dead to rest.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: And in answer the children of Heth said to Abraham,

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: My lord, truly you are a great chief among us; take the best of our resting-places for your dead; not one of us will keep back from you a place where you may put your dead to rest.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: And Abraham got up and gave honour to the children of Heth, the people of that land.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: And he said to them, If you will let me put my dead to rest here, make a request for me to Ephron, the son of Zohar,

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: That he will give me the hollow in the rock named Machpelah, which is his property at the end of his field; let him give it to me for its full price as a resting-place for my dead among you.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: Now Ephron was seated among the children of Heth: and Ephron the Hittite gave Abraham his answer in the hearing of the children of Heth, and of all those who came into his town, saying,

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: No, my lord, I will give you the field with the hollow in the rock; before all the children of my people will I give it to you for a resting-place for your dead.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: And Abraham went down on his face before the people of the land.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: And Abraham said to Ephron, in the hearing of the people of the land, If only you will give ear to me, I will give you the price of the field; take it, and let me put my dead to rest there.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 14
text: So Ephron said to Abraham,

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: My lord, give ear to me: the value of the land is four hundred shekels; what is that between me and you? so put your dead to rest there.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: And Abraham took note of the price fixed by Ephron in the hearing of the children of Heth, and gave him four hundred shekels in current money.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 17
text: So Ephron's field at Machpelah near Mamre, with the hollow in the rock and all the trees in the field and round it,

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 18
text: Became the property of Abraham before the eyes of the children of Heth and of all who came into the town.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 19
text: Then Abraham put Sarah his wife to rest in the hollow rock in the field of Machpelah near Mamre, that is, Hebron in the land of Canaan.

title: Genesis Chapter 23 Verse 20
text: And the field and the hollow rock were handed over to Abraham as his property by the children of Heth.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: Now Abraham was old and far on in years: and the Lord had given him everything in full measure.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: And Abraham said to his chief servant, the manager of all his property, Come now, put your hand under my leg:

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: And take an oath by the Lord, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you will not get a wife for my son Isaac from the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I am living;

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: But that you will go into my country and to my relations and get a wife there for my son Isaac.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: And the servant said, If by chance the woman will not come with me into this land, am I to take your son back again to the land from which you came?

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: And Abraham said, Take care that you do not let my son go back to that land.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: The Lord God of heaven, who took me from my father's house and from the land of my birth, and made an oath to me, saying, To your seed I will give this land: he will send his angel before you and give you a wife for my son in that land.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: And if the woman will not come with you, then you are free from this oath; only do not take my son back there.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: And the servant put his hand under Abraham's leg, and gave him his oath about this thing.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: And the servant took ten of his master's camels, and all sorts of good things of his master's, and went to Mesopotamia, to the town of Nahor.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: And he made the camels take their rest outside the town by the water-spring in the evening, at the time when the women came to get water.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: And he said, O Lord, the God of my master Abraham, let me do well in what I have undertaken this day, and give your mercy to my master Abraham.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: See, I am waiting here by the water-spring; and the daughters of the town are coming out to get water:

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: Now, may the girl to whom I say, Let down your vessel and give me a drink, and who says in answer, Here is a drink for you and let me give water to your camels: may she be the one marked out by you for your servant Isaac: so may I be certain that you have been good to my master Abraham.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: And even before his words were ended, Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel, the son of Milcah, who was the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, came out with her water-vessel on her arm.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: She was a very beautiful girl, a virgin, who had never been touched by a man: and she went down to the spring to get water in her vessel.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: And the servant came running to her and said, Give me a little water from your vessel.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: And she said, Take a drink, my lord: and quickly letting down her vessel onto her hand, she gave him a drink.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 19
text: And having done so, she said, I will get water for your camels till they have had enough.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 20
text: And after putting the water from her vessel into the animals' drinking-place, she went quickly back to the spring and got water for all the camels.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 21
text: And the man, looking at her, said nothing, waiting to see if the Lord had given his journey a good outcome.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 22
text: And when the camels had had enough, the man took a gold nose-ring, half a shekel in weight, and two ornaments for her arms of ten shekels weight of gold;

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 23
text: And said to her, Whose daughter are you? is there room in your father's house for us?

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 24
text: And she said to him, I am the daughter of Bethuel, the son of Milcah, Nahor's wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 25
text: And she said, We have a great store of dry grass and cattle-food, and there is room for you.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 26
text: And with bent head the man gave worship to the Lord;

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 27
text: And said, Praise be to the Lord, the God of my master Abraham, who has given a sign that he is good and true to my master, by guiding me straight to the house of my master's family.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 28
text: So the girl went running and took the news of these things to her mother's house

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 29
text: Now Rebekah had a brother named Laban, and he came out quickly to the man at the water-spring.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 30
text: And when he saw the nose-ring and the ornaments on his sister's hands, and when she gave him word of what the man had said to her, then he went out to the man who was waiting with the camels by the water-spring.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 31
text: And he said to him, Come in, you on whom is the blessing of the Lord; why are you waiting outside? for I have made the house ready for you, and a place for the camels.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 32
text: Then the man came into the house, and Laban took their cords off the camels and gave them dry grass and food, and he gave to him and the men who were with him water for washing their feet.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 33
text: And meat was put before him, but he said, I will not take food till I have made my business clear to you. And they said, Do so.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 34
text: And he said, I am Abraham's servant.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 35
text: The Lord has given my master every blessing, and he has become great: he has given him flocks and herds and silver and gold, and men-servants and women-servants and camels and asses.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 36
text: And when Sarah, my master's wife, was old, she gave birth to a son, to whom he has given all he has.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 37
text: And my master made me take an oath, saying, Do not get a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I am living;

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 38
text: But go to my father's house and to my relations for a wife for my son.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 39
text: And I said to my master, What if the woman will not come with me?

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 40
text: And he said, The Lord, whom I have ever kept before me, will send his angel with you, who will make it possible for you to get a wife for my son from my relations and my father's house;

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 41
text: And you will be free from your oath to me when you come to my people; and if they will not give her to you, you will be free from your oath.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 42
text: And I came today to the water-spring, and I said, O Lord, the God of my master Abraham, if it is your purpose to give a good outcome to my journey,

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 43
text: Let it come about that, while I am waiting here by the water-spring, if a girl comes to get water and I say to her, Give me a little water from your vessel, and she says,

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 44
text: Take a drink, and I will get water for your camels; let her be the woman marked out by the Lord for my master's son.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 45
text: And even while I was saying this to myself, Rebekah came out with her vessel on her arm; and she went down to the spring to get water; and I said to her, Give me a drink.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 46
text: And straight away she took down her vessel from her arm, and said, Take a drink, and I will get water for your camels.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 47
text: And questioning her, I said, Whose daughter are you? And she said, The daughter of Bethuel, the son of Nahor, and Milcah his wife. Then I put the ring on her nose and the ornaments on her hands.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 48
text: And with bent head I gave worship and praise to the Lord, the God of my master Abraham, by whom I had been guided in the right way, to get the daughter of my master's brother for his son.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 49
text: And now, say if you will do what is good and right for my master or not, in order that it may be clear to me what I have to do.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 50
text: Then Laban and Bethuel said in answer, This is the Lord's doing: it is not for us to say Yes or No to you.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 51
text: See, here is Rebekah: take her and go, and let her be your master's son's wife, as the Lord has said.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 52
text: And at these words, Abraham's servant went down on his face and gave praise to the Lord.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 53
text: Then he took jewels of silver and jewels of gold and fair robes and gave them to Rebekah: and he gave things of value to her mother and her brother.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 54
text: Then he and the men who were with him had food and drink, and took their rest there that night; and in the morning he got up, and said, Let me now go back to my master.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 55
text: But her brother and her mother said, Let the girl be with us a week or ten days, and then she may go.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 56
text: And he said, Do not keep me; the Lord has given a good outcome to my journey; let me now go back to my master.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 57
text: And they said, We will send for the girl, and let her make the decision.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 58
text: And they sent for Rebekah and said to her, Are you ready to go with this man? And she said, I am ready.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 59
text: So they sent their sister Rebekah and her servant with Abraham's servant and his men.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 60
text: And they gave Rebekah their blessing, saying, O sister, may you be the mother of thousands and ten thousands; and may your seed overcome all those who make war against them.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 61
text: So Rebekah and her servant-women went with the man, seated on the camels; and so the servant took Rebekah and went on his way.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 62
text: Now Isaac had come through the waste land to Beer-lahai-roi; for he was living in the South.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 63
text: And when the evening was near, he went wandering out into the fields, and lifting up his eyes he saw camels coming.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 64
text: And when Rebekah, looking up, saw Isaac, she got down from her camel,

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 65
text: And said to the servant, Who is that man coming to us through the field? And the servant said, It is my master: then she took her veil, covering her face with it.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 66
text: Then the servant gave Isaac the story of all he had done.

title: Genesis Chapter 24 Verse 67
text: And Isaac took Rebekah into his tent and she became his wife; and in his love for her, Isaac was comforted after his father's death.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 1
text: And Abraham took another wife named Keturah.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 2
text: She became the mother of Zimran and Jokshan and Medan and Midian and Ishbak and Shuah.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 3
text: And Jokshan became the father of Sheba and Dedan. And from Dedan came the Asshurim and Letushim and Leummim.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 4
text: And from Midian came Ephah and Epher and Hanoch and Abida and Eldaah. All these were the offspring of Keturah.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 5
text: Now Abraham gave all his property to Isaac;

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 6
text: But to the sons of his other women he gave offerings, and sent them away, while he was still living, into the east country.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 7
text: Now the years of Abraham's life were a hundred and seventy-five.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 8
text: And Abraham came to his death, an old man, full of years; and he was put to rest with his people.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 9
text: And Isaac and Ishmael, his sons, put him to rest in the hollow rock of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron, the son of Zohar the Hittite, near Mamre;

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 10
text: The same field which Abraham got from the children of Heth: there Abraham was put to rest with Sarah, his wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 11
text: Now after the death of Abraham, the blessing of God was with Isaac, his son.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 12
text: Now these are the generations of Ishmael, the son of Abraham, whose mother was Hagar the Egyptian, the servant of Sarah:

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 13
text: These are the names of the sons of Ishmael by their generations: Ishmael's first son was Nebaioth; then Kedar and Adbeel and Mibsam

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 14
text: And Mishma and Dumah and Massa,

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 15
text: Hadad and Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah:

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 16
text: These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names in their towns and their tent-circles; twelve chiefs with their peoples.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 17
text: And the years of Ishmael's life were a hundred and thirty-seven: and he came to his end, and was put to rest with his people.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 18
text: And their country was from Havilah to Shur which is east of Egypt: they took their place to the east of all their brothers.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 19
text: Now these are the generations of Abraham's son Isaac:

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 20
text: Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel the Aramaean of Paddan-aram, and the sister of Laban the Aramaean, to be his wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 21
text: Isaac made prayer to the Lord for his wife because she had no children; and the Lord gave ear to his prayer, and Rebekah became with child.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 22
text: And the children were fighting together inside her, and she said, If it is to be so, why am I like this? So she went to put her question to the Lord.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 23
text: And the Lord said to her, Two nations are in your body, and two peoples will come to birth from you: the one will be stronger than the other, and the older will be the servant of the younger.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 24
text: And when the time came for her to give birth, there were two children in her body.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 25
text: And the first came out red from head to foot like a robe of hair, and they gave him the name of Esau.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 26
text: And after him, his brother came out, gripping Esau's foot; and he was named Jacob: Isaac was sixty years old when she gave birth to them.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 27
text: And the boys came to full growth; and Esau became a man of the open country, an expert bowman; but Jacob was a quiet man, living in tents.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 28
text: Now Isaac's love was for Esau, because Esau's meat was greatly to his taste: but Rebekah had more love for Jacob.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 29
text: And one day Jacob was cooking some soup when Esau came in from the fields in great need of food;

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 30
text: And Esau said to Jacob, Give me a full meal of that red soup, for I am overcome with need for food: for this reason he was named Edom.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 31
text: And Jacob said, First of all give me your birthright.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 32
text: And Esau said, Truly, I am at the point of death: what profit is the birthright to me?

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 33
text: And Jacob said, First of all give me your oath; and he gave him his oath, handing over his birthright to Jacob.

title: Genesis Chapter 25 Verse 34
text: Then Jacob gave him bread and soup; and he took food and drink and went away, caring little for his birthright.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 1
text: Then came a time of great need in the land, like that which had been before in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went to Abimelech, king of the Philistines, at Gerar.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 2
text: And the Lord came to him in a vision and said, Do not go down to Egypt; keep in the land of which I will give you knowledge:

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 3
text: Keep in this land, and I will be with you and give you my blessing; for to you and to your seed will I give all these lands, giving effect to the oath which I made to your father Abraham;

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 4
text: I will make your seed like the stars of heaven in number, and will give them all these lands, and your seed will be a blessing to all the nations of the earth;

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 5
text: Because Abraham gave ear to my voice and kept my words, my rules, my orders, and my laws.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 6
text: So Isaac went on living in Gerar;

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 7
text: And when he was questioned by the men of the place about his wife, he said, She is my sister; fearing to say, She is my wife; for, he said, the men of the place may put me to death on account of Rebekah; because she is very beautiful.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 8
text: And when he had been there for some time, Abimelech, king of the Philistines, looking through a window, saw Isaac playing with Rebekah his wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 9
text: And he said to Isaac, It is clear that she is your wife: why then did you say, She is my sister? And Isaac said, For fear that I might be put to death because of her.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 10
text: Then Abimelech said, What have you done to us? one of the people might well have had connection with your wife, and the sin would have been ours.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 11
text: And Abimelech gave orders to his people that anyone touching Isaac or his wife was to be put to death.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 12
text: Now Isaac, planting seed in that land, got in the same year fruit a hundred times as much, for the blessing of the Lord was on him.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 13
text: And his wealth became very great, increasing more and more;

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 14
text: For he had great wealth of flocks and herds and great numbers of servants; so that the Philistines were full of envy.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 15
text: Now all the water-holes, which his father's servants had made in the days of Abraham, had been stopped up with earth by the Philistines.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 16
text: And Abimelech said to Isaac, Go away from us, for you are stronger than we are.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 17
text: So Isaac went away from there, and put up his tents in the valley of Gerar, making his living-place there.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 18
text: And he made again the water-holes which had been made in the days of Abraham his father, and which had been stopped up by the Philistines; and he gave them the names which his father had given them.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 19
text: Now Isaac's servants made holes in the valley, and came to a spring of flowing water.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 20
text: But the herdmen of Gerar had a fight with Isaac's herdmen, for they said, The spring is ours: so he gave the spring the name of Esek, because there was a fight about it.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 21
text: Then they made another water-hole, and there was a fight about that, so he gave it the name of Sitnah.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 22
text: Then he went away from there, and made another water-hole, about which there was no fighting: so he gave it the name of Rehoboth, for he said, Now the Lord has made room for us, and we will have fruit in this land.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 23
text: And from there he went on to Beer-sheba.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 24
text: That night the Lord came to him in a vision, and said, I am the God of your father Abraham: have no fear for I am with you, blessing you, and your seed will be increased because of my servant Abraham.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 25
text: Then he made an altar there, and gave worship to the name of the Lord, and he put up his tents there, and there his servants made a water-hole.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 26
text: And Abimelech had come to him from Gerar, with Ahuzzath his friend and Phicol, the captain of his army.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 27
text: And Isaac said to them, Why have you come to me, seeing that in your hate for me you sent me away from you?

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 28
text: And they said, We saw clearly that the Lord was with you: so we said, Let there be an oath between us and you, and let us make an agreement with you;

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 29
text: That you will do us no damage, even as we put no hand on you, and did you nothing but good, and sent you away in peace: and now the blessing of the Lord is on you.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 30
text: Then he made a feast for them, and they all had food and drink.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 31
text: And early in the morning they took an oath one to the other: then Isaac sent them away and they went on their way in peace.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 32
text: And that day Isaac's servants came to him and gave him word of the water-hole which they had made, and said to him, We have come to water.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 33
text: And he gave it the name of Shibah: so the name of that town is Beer-sheba to this day.

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 34
text: And when Esau was forty years old, he took as his wives Judith, the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath, the daughter of Elon the Hittite:

title: Genesis Chapter 26 Verse 35
text: And Isaac and Rebekah had grief of mind because of them.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 1
text: Now when Isaac was old and his eyes had become clouded so that he was not able to see, he sent for Esau, his first son, and said to him, My son: and he said, Here am I.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 2
text: And he said, See now, I am old, and my death may take place at any time:

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 3
text: So take your arrows and your bow and go out to the field and get meat for me;

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 4
text: And make me food, good to the taste, such as is pleasing to me, and put it before me, so that I may have a meal and give you my blessing before death comes to me.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 5
text: Now Isaac's words to his son were said in Rebekah's hearing. Then Esau went out to get the meat.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 6
text: And Rebekah said to Jacob, her son, Your father said to your brother Esau in my hearing,

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 7
text: Go and get some roe's meat and make me a good meal, so that I may be full, and give you my blessing before the Lord before my death.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 8
text: Now, my son, do what I say.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 9
text: Go to the flock and get me two fat young goats; and I will make of them a meal to your father's taste:

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 10
text: And you will take it to him, so that he may have a good meal and give you his blessing before his death.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 11
text: And Jacob said to Rebekah, his mother, But Esau my brother is covered with hair, while I am smooth:

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 12
text: If by chance my father puts his hand on me, it will seem to him that I am tricking him, and he will put a curse on me in place of a blessing.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 13
text: And his mother said, Let the curse be on me, my son: only do as I say, and go and get them for me.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 14
text: So he went and got them and took them to his mother: and she made a meal to his father's taste.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 15
text: And Rebekah took the fair robes of her oldest son, which were with her in the house, and put them on Jacob, her younger son:

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 16
text: And she put the skins of the young goats on his hands and on the smooth part of his neck:

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 17
text: And she gave into the hand of Jacob, her son, the meat and the bread which she had made ready.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 18
text: And he came to his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I: who are you, my son?

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 19
text: And Jacob said, I am Esau, your oldest son; I have done as you said: come now, be seated and take of my meat, so that you may give me a blessing.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 20
text: And Isaac said, How is it that you have got it so quickly, my son? And he said, Because the Lord your God made it come my way.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 21
text: And Isaac said, Come near so that I may put my hand on you, my son, and see if you are truly my son Esau or not.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 22
text: And Jacob went near his father Isaac: and he put his hands on him; and he said, The voice is Jacob's voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 23
text: And he did not make out who he was, because his hands were covered with hair like his brother Esau's hands: so he gave him a blessing.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 24
text: And he said, Are you truly my son Esau? And he said, I am.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 25
text: And he said, Put it before me and I will take of my son's meat, so that I may give you a blessing. And he put it before him and he took it; and he gave him wine, and he had a drink.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 26
text: And his father Isaac said to him, Come near now, my son, and give me a kiss.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 27
text: And he came near and gave him a kiss; and smelling the smell of his clothing, he gave him a blessing, and said, See, the smell of my son is like the smell of a field on which the blessing of the Lord has come:

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 28
text: May God give you the dew of heaven, and the good things of the earth, and grain and wine in full measure:

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 29
text: Let peoples be your servants, and nations go down before you: be lord over your brothers, and let your mother's sons go down before you: a curse be on everyone by whom you are cursed, and a blessing on those who give you a blessing.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 30
text: And when Isaac had come to the end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob had not long gone away from Isaac his father, Esau came in from the field.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 31
text: And he made ready a meal, good to the taste, and took it to his father, and said to him, Let my father get up and take of his son's meat, so that you may give me a blessing.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 32
text: And Isaac his father said to him, Who are you? And he said, I am your oldest son, Esau.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 33
text: And in great fear Isaac said, Who then is he who got meat and put it before me, and I took it all before you came, and gave him a blessing, and his it will be?

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 34
text: And hearing the words of his father, Esau gave a great and bitter cry, and said to his father, Give a blessing to me, even to me, O my father!

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 35
text: And he said, Your brother came with deceit, and took away your blessing.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 36
text: And he said, Is it because he is named Jacob that he has twice taken my place? for he took away my birthright, and now he has taken away my blessing. And he said, Have you not kept a blessing for me?

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 37
text: And Isaac answering said, But I have made him your master, and have given him all his brothers for servants; I have made him strong with grain and wine: what then am I to do for you, my son?

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 38
text: And Esau said to his father, Is that the only blessing you have, my father? give a blessing to me, even me! And Esau was overcome with weeping.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 39
text: Then Isaac his father made answer and said to him, Far from the fertile places of the earth, and far from the dew of heaven on high will your living-place be:

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 40
text: By your sword will you get your living and you will be your brother's servant; but when your power is increased his yoke will be broken from off your neck.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 41
text: So Esau was full of hate for Jacob because of his father's blessing; and he said in his heart, The days of weeping for my father are near; then I will put my brother Jacob to death.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 42
text: Then Rebekah, hearing what Esau had said, sent for Jacob, her younger son, and said to him, It seems that your brother Esau is purposing to put you to death.

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 43
text: So now, my son, do what I say: go quickly to Haran, to my brother Laban;

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 44
text: And be there with him for a little time, till your brother's wrath is turned away;

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 45
text: Till the memory of what you have done to him is past and he is no longer angry: then I will send word for you to come back; are the two of you to be taken from me in one day?

title: Genesis Chapter 27 Verse 46
text: Then Rebekah said to Isaac, My life is a weariness to me because of the daughters of Heth: if Jacob takes a wife from among the daughters of Heth, such as these, the women of this land, of what use will my life be to me?

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 1
text: Then Isaac sent for Jacob, and blessing him, said, Do not take a wife from among the women of Canaan;

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 2
text: But go to Paddan-aram, to the house of Bethuel, your mother's father, and there get yourself a wife from the daughters of Laban, your mother's brother.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 3
text: And may God, the Ruler of all, give you his blessing, giving you fruit and increase, so that you may become an army of peoples.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 4
text: And may God give you the blessing of Abraham, to you and to your seed, so that the land of your wanderings, which God gave to Abraham, may be your heritage.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 5
text: So Isaac sent Jacob away: and he went to Paddan-aram, to Laban, son of Bethuel the Aramaean, the brother of Rebekah, the mother of Jacob and Esau.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 6
text: So when Esau saw that Isaac had given Jacob his blessing, and sent him away to Paddan-aram to get a wife for himself there, blessing him and saying to him, Do not take a wife from among the women of Canaan;

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 7
text: And that Jacob had done as his father and mother said and had gone to Paddan-aram;

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 8
text: It was clear to Esau that his father had no love for the women of Canaan,

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 9
text: So Esau went to Ishmael and took Mahalath, the daughter of Abraham's son Ishmael, the sister of Nebaioth, to be his wife in addition to the wives he had.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 10
text: So Jacob went out from Beer-sheba to go to Haran.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 11
text: And coming to a certain place, he made it his resting-place for the night, for the sun had gone down; and he took one of the stones which were there, and putting it under his head he went to sleep in that place.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 12
text: And he had a dream, and in his dream he saw steps stretching from earth to heaven, and the angels of God were going up and down on them.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 13
text: And he saw the Lord by his side, saying, I am the Lord, the God of Abraham your father, and the God of Isaac: I will give to you and to your seed this land on which you are sleeping.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 14
text: Your seed will be like the dust of the earth, covering all the land to the west and to the east, to the north and to the south: you and your seed will be a name of blessing to all the families of the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 15
text: And truly, I will be with you, and will keep you wherever you go, guiding you back again to this land; and I will not give you up till I have done what I have said to you.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 16
text: And Jacob, awaking from his sleep, said, Truly, the Lord is in this place and I was not conscious of it.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 17
text: And fear came on him, and he said, This is a holy place; this is nothing less than the house of God and the doorway of heaven.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 18
text: And early in the morning Jacob took the stone which had been under his head, and put it up as a pillar and put oil on it.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 19
text: And he gave that place the name of Beth-el, but before that time the town was named Luz.

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 20
text: Then Jacob took an oath, and said, If God will be with me, and keep me safe on my journey, and give me food and clothing to put on,

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 21
text: So that I come again to my father's house in peace, then I will take the Lord to be my God,

title: Genesis Chapter 28 Verse 22
text: And this stone which I have put up for a pillar will be God's house: and of all you give me, I will give a tenth part to you.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 1
text: Then Jacob went on his journey till he came to the land of the children of the East.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 2
text: And there he saw a water-hole in a field, and by the side of it three flocks of sheep, for there they got water for the sheep: and on the mouth of the water-hole there was a great stone.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 3
text: And all the flocks would come together there, and when the stone had been rolled away, they would give the sheep water, and put the stone back again in its place on the mouth of the water-hole.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 4
text: Then Jacob said to the herdmen, My brothers, where do you come from? And they said, From Haran.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 5
text: And he said to them, Have you any knowledge of Laban, the son of Nahor? And they said, We have.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 6
text: And he said to them, Is he well? And they said, He is well, and here is Rachel his daughter coming with the sheep.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 7
text: Then Jacob said, The sun is still high and it is not time to get the cattle together: get water for the sheep and go and give them their food.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 8
text: And they said, We are not able to do so till all the flocks have come together and the stone has been rolled away from the mouth of the water-hole; then we will get water for the sheep.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 9
text: While he was still talking with them, Rachel came with her father's sheep, for she took care of them.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 10
text: Then when Jacob saw Rachel, the daughter of Laban, his mother's brother, coming with Laban's sheep, he came near, and rolling the stone away from the mouth of the hole, he got water for Laban's flock.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 11
text: And weeping for joy, Jacob gave Rachel a kiss.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 12
text: And Rachel, hearing from Jacob that he was her father's relation and that he was the son of Rebekah, went running to give her father news of it.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 13
text: And Laban, hearing news of Jacob, his sister's son, came running, and took Jacob in his arms, and kissing him, made him come into his house. And Jacob gave him news of everything.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 14
text: And Laban said to him, Truly, you are my bone and my flesh. And he kept Jacob with him for the space of a month.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 15
text: Then Laban said to Jacob, Because you are my brother are you to be my servant for nothing? say now, what is your payment to be?

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 16
text: Now Laban had two daughters: the name of the older was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 17
text: And Leah's eyes were clouded, but Rachel was fair in face and form.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 18
text: And Jacob was in love with Rachel; and he said, I will be your servant seven years for Rachel, your younger daughter.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 19
text: And Laban said, It is better for you to have her than another man: go on living here with me.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 20
text: And Jacob did seven years' work for Rachel; and because of his love for her it seemed to him only a very little time.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 21
text: Then Jacob said to Laban, Give me my wife so that I may have her, for the days are ended.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 22
text: And Laban got together all the men of the place and gave a feast.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 23
text: And in the evening he took Leah, his daughter, and gave her to him, and he went in to her.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 24
text: And Laban gave Zilpah, his servant-girl, to Leah, to be her waiting-woman.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 25
text: And in the morning Jacob saw that it was Leah: and he said to Laban, What have you done to me? was I not working for you so that I might have Rachel? why have you been false to me?

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 26
text: And Laban said, In our country we do not let the younger daughter be married before the older.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 27
text: Let the week of the bride-feast come to its end and then we will give you the other in addition, if you will be my servant for another seven years.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 28
text: And Jacob did so; and when the week was ended, Laban gave him his daughter Rachel for his wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 29
text: And Laban gave Rachel his servant-girl Bilhah to be her waiting-woman.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 30
text: Then Jacob took Rachel as his wife, and his love for her was greater than his love for Leah; and he went on working for Laban for another seven years.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 31
text: Now the Lord, seeing that Leah was not loved, gave her a child; while Rachel had no children.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 32
text: And Leah was with child, and gave birth to a son to whom she gave the name Reuben: for she said, The Lord has seen my sorrow; now my husband will have love for me.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 33
text: Then she became with child again, and gave birth to a son; and said, Because it has come to the Lord's ears that I am not loved, he has given me this son in addition: and she gave him the name Simeon.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 34
text: And she was with child again, and gave birth to a son; and said, Now at last my husband will be united to me, because I have given him three sons: so he was named Levi.

title: Genesis Chapter 29 Verse 35
text: And she was with child again, and gave birth to a son: and she said, This time I will give praise to the Lord: so he was named Judah; after this she had no more children for a time.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 1
text: Now Rachel, because she had no children, was full of envy of her sister; and she said to Jacob, If you do not give me children I will not go on living.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 2
text: But Jacob was angry with Rachel, and said, Am I in the place of God, who has kept your body from having fruit?

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 3
text: Then she said, Here is my servant Bilhah, go in to her, so that she may have a child on my knees, and I may have a family by her.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 4
text: So she gave him her servant Bilhah as a wife, and Jacob went in to her.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 5
text: And Bilhah became with child, and gave birth to a son.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 6
text: Then Rachel said, God has been my judge, and has given ear to my voice, and has given me a son; so he was named Dan.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 7
text: And again Bilhah, Rachel's servant, was with child, and gave birth to a second son.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 8
text: And Rachel said, I have had a great fight with my sister, and I have overcome her: and she gave the child the name Naphtali.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 9
text: When it was clear to Leah that she would have no more children for a time, she gave Zilpah, her servant, to Jacob as a wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 10
text: And Zilpah, Leah's servant, gave birth to a son.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 11
text: And Leah said, It has gone well for me: and she gave him the name Gad.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 12
text: And Zilpah, Leah's servant, gave birth to a second son.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 13
text: And Leah said, Happy am I! and all women will give witness to my joy: and she gave him the name Asher.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 14
text: Now at the time of the grain-cutting, Reuben saw some love-fruits in the field, and took them to his mother Leah. And Rachel said to her, Let me have some of your son's love-fruits.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 15
text: But Leah said to her, Is it a small thing that you have taken my husband from me? and now would you take my son's love-fruits? Then Rachel said, You may have him tonight in exchange for your son's love-fruits.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 16
text: In the evening, when Jacob came in from the field, Leah went out to him and said, Tonight you are to come to me, for I have given my son's love-fruits as a price for you. And he went in to her that night.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 17
text: And God gave ear to her and she became with child, and gave Jacob a fifth son.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 18
text: Then Leah said, God has made payment to me for giving my servant-girl to my husband: so she gave her son the name Issachar.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 19
text: And again Leah became with child, and she gave Jacob a sixth son.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 20
text: And she said, God has given me a good bride-price; now at last will I have my husband living with me, for I have given him six sons: and she gave him the name Zebulun.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 21
text: After that she had a daughter, to whom she gave the name Dinah.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 22
text: Then God gave thought to Rachel, and hearing her prayer he made her fertile.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 23
text: And she was with child, and gave birth to a son: and she said, God has taken away my shame.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 24
text: And she gave him the name Joseph, saying, May the Lord give me another son.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 25
text: Now after the birth of Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, Let me go away to my place and my country.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 26
text: Give me my wives and my children, for whom I have been your servant, and let me go: for you have knowledge of all the work I have done for you.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 27
text: And Laban said, If you will let me say so, do not go away; for I have seen by the signs that the Lord has been good to me because of you.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 28
text: Say then what your payment is to be and I will give it.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 29
text: Then Jacob said, You have seen what I have done for you, and how your cattle have done well under my care.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 30
text: For before I came you had little, and it has been greatly increased; and the Lord has given you a blessing in everything I have done; but when am I to do something for my family?

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 31
text: And Laban said, What am I to give you? And Jacob said, Do not give me anything; but I will again take up the care of your flock if you will only do this for me:

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 32
text: Let me go through all your flock today, taking out from among them all the sheep which are marked or coloured or black, and all the marked or coloured goats: these will be my payment.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 33
text: And so you will be able to put my honour to the test in time to come; if you see among my flocks any goats which are not marked or coloured, or any sheep which is not black, you may take me for a thief.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 34
text: And Laban said, Let it be as you say.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 35
text: So that day he took all the he-goats which were banded or coloured, and all the she-goats which were marked or coloured or had white marks, and all the black sheep, and gave them into the care of his sons;

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 36
text: And sent them three days' journey away: and Jacob took care of the rest of Laban's flock.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 37
text: Then Jacob took young branches of trees, cutting off the skin so that the white wood was seen in bands.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 38
text: And he put the banded sticks in the drinking-places where the flock came to get water; and they became with young when they came to the water.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 39
text: And because of this, the flock gave birth to young which were marked with bands of colour.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 40
text: These lambs Jacob kept separate; and he put his flock in a place by themselves and not with Laban's flock.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 41
text: And whenever the stronger ones of the flock became with young, Jacob put the sticks in front of them in the drinking-places, so that they might become with young when they saw the sticks.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 42
text: But when the flocks were feeble, he did not put the sticks before them; so that the feebler flocks were Laban's and the stronger were Jacob's.

title: Genesis Chapter 30 Verse 43
text: So Jacob's wealth was greatly increased; he had great flocks and women-servants and men-servants and camels and asses.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 1
text: Now it came to the ears of Jacob that Laban's sons were saying, Jacob has taken away all our father's property, and in this way he has got all this wealth.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 2
text: And Jacob saw that Laban's feeling for him was no longer what it had been before.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 3
text: Then the Lord said to Jacob, Go back to the land of your fathers, and to your relations, and I will be with you.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 4
text: And Jacob sent for Rachel and Leah to come to him in the field among his flock.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 5
text: And he said to them, It is clear to me that your father's feeling is no longer what it was to me; but the God of my father has been with me

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 6
text: And you have seen how I have done all in my power for your father,

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 7
text: But your father has not kept faith with me, and ten times he has made changes in my payment; but God has kept him from doing me damage.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 8
text: If he said, All those in the flock which have marks are to be yours, then all the flock gave birth to marked young; and if he said, All the banded ones are to be yours, then all the flock had banded young.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 9
text: So God has taken away your father's cattle and has given them to me.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 10
text: And at the time when the flock were with young, I saw in a dream that all the he-goats which were joined with the she-goats were banded and marked and coloured.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 11
text: And in my dream the angel of the Lord said to me, Jacob: and I said, Here am I.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 12
text: And he said, See how all the he-goats are banded and marked and coloured: for I have seen what Laban has done to you.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 13
text: I am the God of Beth-el, where you put oil on the pillar and took an oath to me: now then, come out of this land and go back to the country of your birth.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 14
text: Then Rachel and Leah said to him in answer, What part or heritage is there for us in our father's house?

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 15
text: Are we not as people from a strange country to him? for he took a price for us and now it is all used up.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 16
text: For the wealth which God has taken from him is ours and our children's; so now, whatever God has said to you, do.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 17
text: Then Jacob put his wives and his sons on camels;

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 18
text: And sending on before him all his cattle and his property which he had got together in Paddan-aram, he made ready to go to Isaac his father in the land of Canaan.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 19
text: Now Laban had gone to see to the cutting of the wool of his sheep; so Rachel secretly took the images of the gods of her father's house.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 20
text: And Jacob went away secretly, without giving news of his flight to Laban the Aramaean.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 21
text: So he went away with all he had, and went across the River in the direction of the hill-country of Gilead.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 22
text: And on the third day Laban had news of Jacob's flight.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 23
text: And taking the men of his family with him, he went after him for seven days and overtook him in the hill-country of Gilead.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 24
text: Then God came to Laban in a dream by night, and said to him, Take care that you say nothing good or bad to Jacob.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 25
text: Now when Laban overtook him, Jacob had put up his tent in the hill-country; and Laban and his brothers put up their tents in the hill-country of Gilead.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 26
text: And Laban said to Jacob, Why did you go away secretly, taking my daughters away like prisoners of war?

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 27
text: Why did you make a secret of your flight, not giving me word of it, so that I might have sent you away with joy and songs, with melody and music?

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 28
text: You did not even let me give a kiss to my sons and my daughters. This was a foolish thing to do.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 29
text: It is in my power to do you damage: but the God of your father came to me this night, saying, Take care that you say nothing good or bad to Jacob.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 30
text: And now, it seems, you are going because your heart's desire is for your father's house; but why have you taken my gods?

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 31
text: And Jacob, in answer, said to Laban, My fear was that you might take your daughters from me by force.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 32
text: As for your gods, if anyone of us has them, let him be put to death: make search before us all for what is yours, and take it. For Jacob had no knowledge that Rachel had taken them.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 33
text: So Laban went into Jacob's tent and into Leah's tent, and into the tents of the two servant-women, but they were not there; and he came out of Leah's tent and went into Rachel's.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 34
text: Now Rachel had taken the images, and had put them in the camels' basket, and was seated on them. And Laban, searching through all the tent, did not come across them.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 35
text: And she said to her father, Let not my lord be angry because I do not get up before you, for I am in the common condition of women. And with all his searching, he did not come across the images.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 36
text: Then Jacob was angry with Laban, and said, What crime or sin have I done that you have come after me with such passion?

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 37
text: Now that you have made search through all my goods, what have you seen which is yours? Make it clear now before my people and your people, so that they may be judges between us.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 38
text: These twenty years I have been with you; your sheep and your goats have had young without loss, not one of your he-goats have I taken for food.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 39
text: Anything which was wounded by beasts I did not take to you, but myself made up for the loss of it; you made me responsible for whatever was taken by thieves, by day or by night.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 40
text: This was my condition, wasted by heat in the day and by the bitter cold at night; and sleep went from my eyes.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 41
text: These twenty years I have been in your house; I was your servant for fourteen years because of your daughters, and for six years I kept your flock, and ten times was my payment changed.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 42
text: If the God of my father, the God of Abraham and the Fear of Isaac, had not been with me, you would have sent me away with nothing in my hands. But God has seen my troubles and the work of my hands, and this night he kept you back.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 43
text: Then Laban, answering, said, These women are my daughters and these children my children, the flocks and all you see are mine: what now may I do for my daughters and for their children?

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 44
text: Come, let us make an agreement, you and I; and let it be for a witness between us.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 45
text: Then Jacob took a stone and put it up as a pillar.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 46
text: And Jacob said to his people, Get stones together; and they did so; and they had a meal there by the stones.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 47
text: And the name Laban gave it was Jegar-sahadutha: but Jacob gave it the name of Galeed.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 48
text: And Laban said, These stones are a witness between you and me today. For this reason its name was Galeed,

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 49
text: And Mizpah, for he said, May the Lord keep watch on us when we are unable to see one another's doings.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 50
text: If you are cruel to my daughters, or if you take other wives in addition to my daughters, then though no man is there to see, God will be the witness between us.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 51
text: And Laban said, See these stones and this pillar which I have put between you and me;

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 52
text: They will be witness that I will not go over these stones to you, and you will not go over these stones or this pillar to me, for any evil purpose.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 53
text: May the God of Abraham and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, be our judge. Then Jacob took an oath by the Fear of his father Isaac.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 54
text: And Jacob made an offering on the mountain, and gave orders to his people to take food: so they had a meal and took their rest that night on the mountain.

title: Genesis Chapter 31 Verse 55
text: And early in the morning Laban, after kissing and blessing his daughters, went on his way back to his country.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 1
text: And on his way Jacob came face to face with the angels of God.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 2
text: And when he saw them he said, This is the army of God: so he gave that place the name of Mahanaim.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 3
text: Now Jacob sent servants before him to Esau, his brother, in the land of Seir, the country of Edom;

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 4
text: And he gave them orders to say these words to Esau: Your servant Jacob says, Till now I have been living with Laban:

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 5
text: And I have oxen and asses and flocks and men-servants and women-servants: and I have sent to give my lord news of these things so that I may have grace in his eyes.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 6
text: When the servants came back they said, We have seen your brother Esau and he is coming out to you, and four hundred men with him.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 7
text: Then Jacob was in great fear and trouble of mind: and he put all the people and the flocks and the herds and the camels into two groups;

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 8
text: And said, If Esau, meeting one group, makes an attack on them, the others will get away safely.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 9
text: Then Jacob said, O God of my father Abraham, the God of my father Isaac, the Lord who said to me, Go back to your country and your family and I will be good to you:

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 10
text: I am less than nothing in comparison with all your mercies and your faith to me your servant; for with only my stick in my hand I went across Jordan, and now I have become two armies.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 11
text: Be my saviour from the hand of Esau, my brother: for my fear is that he will make an attack on me, putting to death mother and child.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 12
text: And you said, Truly, I will be good to you, and make your seed like the sand of the sea which may not be numbered.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 13
text: Then he put up his tent there for the night; and from among his goods he took, as an offering for his brother Esau,

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 14
text: Two hundred she-goats and twenty he-goats, two hundred females and twenty males from the sheep,

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 15
text: Thirty camels with their young ones, forty cows, ten oxen, twenty asses, and ten young asses.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 16
text: These he gave to his servants, every herd by itself, and he said to his servants, Go on before me, and let there be a space between one herd and another.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 17
text: And he gave orders to the first, saying, When my brother Esau comes to you and says, Whose servant are you, and where are you going, and whose are these herds?

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 18
text: Then say to him, These are your servant Jacob's; they are an offering for my lord, for Esau; and he himself is coming after us.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 19
text: And he gave the same orders to the second and the third and to all those who were with the herds, saying, This is what you are to say to Esau when you see him;

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 20
text: And you are to say further, Jacob, your servant, is coming after us. For he said to himself, I will take away his wrath by the offering which I have sent on, and then I will come before him: it may be that I will have grace in his eyes.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 21
text: So the servants with the offerings went on in front, and he himself took his rest that night in the tents with his people.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 22
text: And in the night he got up, and taking with him his two wives and the two servant-women and his eleven children, he went over the river Jabbok.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 23
text: He took them and sent them over the stream with all he had.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 24
text: Then Jacob was by himself; and a man was fighting with him till dawn.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 25
text: But when the man saw that he was not able to overcome Jacob, he gave him a blow in the hollow part of his leg, so that his leg was damaged.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 26
text: And he said to him, Let me go now, for the dawn is near. But Jacob said, I will not let you go till you have given me your blessing.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 27
text: Then he said, What is your name? And he said, Jacob.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 28
text: And he said, Your name will no longer be Jacob, but Israel: for in your fight with God and with men you have overcome.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 29
text: Then Jacob said, What is your name? And he said, What is my name to you? Then he gave him a blessing.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 30
text: And Jacob gave that place the name of Peniel, saying, I have seen God face to face, and still I am living.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 31
text: And while he was going past Peniel, the sun came up. And he went with unequal steps because of his damaged leg.

title: Genesis Chapter 32 Verse 32
text: For this reason the children of Israel, even today, never take that muscle in the hollow of the leg as food, because the hollow of Jacob's leg was touched.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 1
text: Then Jacob, lifting up his eyes, saw Esau coming with his four hundred men. So he made a division of the children between Leah and Rachel and the two women-servants.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 2
text: He put the servants and their children in front, Leah and her children after them, and Rachel and Joseph at the back.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 3
text: And he himself, going before them, went down on his face to the earth seven times till he came near his brother.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 4
text: Then Esau came running up to him, and folding him in his arms, gave him a kiss: and the two of them were overcome with weeping.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 5
text: Then Esau, lifting up his eyes, saw the women and the children, and said, Who are these with you? And he said, The children whom God in his mercy has given to your servant.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 6
text: Then the servants and their children came near, and went down on their faces.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 7
text: And Leah came near with her children, and then Joseph and Rachel, and they did the same.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 8
text: And he said, What were all those herds which I saw on the way? And Jacob said, They were an offering so that I might have grace in my lord's eyes.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 9
text: But Esau said, I have enough; keep what is yours, my brother, for yourself.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 10
text: And Jacob said, Not so; but if I have grace in your eyes, take them as a sign of my love, for I have seen your face as one may see the face of God, and you have been pleased with me.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 11
text: Take my offering then, with my blessing; for God has been very good to me and I have enough: so at his strong request, he took it.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 12
text: And he said, Let us go on our journey together, and I will go in front.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 13
text: But Jacob said, My lord may see that the children are only small, and there are young ones in my flocks and herds: one day's over-driving will be the destruction of all the flock.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 14
text: Do you, my lord, go on before your servant; I will come on slowly, at the rate at which the cattle and the children are able to go, till I come to my lord at Seir.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 15
text: And Esau said, Then keep some of my men with you. And he said, What need is there for that, if my lord is pleased with me?

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 16
text: So Esau, turning back that day, went on his way to Seir.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 17
text: And Jacob went on to Succoth, where he made a house for himself and put up tents for his cattle: for this reason the place was named Succoth.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 18
