text: So Jacob came safely from Paddan-aram to the town of Shechem in the land of Canaan, and put up his tents near the town.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 19
text: And for a hundred bits of money he got from the children of Hamor, the builder of Shechem, the field in which he had put up his tents.

title: Genesis Chapter 33 Verse 20
text: And there he put up an altar, naming it El, the God of Israel.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 1
text: Now Dinah, the daughter whom Leah had by Jacob, went out to see the women of that country.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 2
text: And when Shechem, the son of Hamor the Hivite who was the chief of that land, saw her, he took her by force and had connection with her.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 3
text: Then his heart went out in love to Dinah, the daughter of Jacob, and he said comforting words to her.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 4
text: And Shechem said to Hamor, his father, Get me this girl for my wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 5
text: Now Jacob had word of what Shechem had done to his daughter; but his sons were in the fields with the cattle, and Jacob said nothing till they came.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 6
text: Then Hamor, the father of Shechem, came out to have a talk with Jacob.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 7
text: Now the sons of Jacob came in from the fields when they had news of it, and they were wounded and very angry because of the shame he had done in Israel by having connection with Jacob's daughter; and they said, Such a thing is not to be done.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 8
text: But Hamor said to them, Shechem, my son, is full of desire for your daughter: will you then give her to him for a wife?

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 9
text: And let our two peoples be joined together; give your daughters to us, and take our daughters for yourselves.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 10
text: Go on living with us, and the country will be open to you; do trade and get property there.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 11
text: And Shechem said to her father and her brothers, If you will give ear to my request, whatever you say I will give to you.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 12
text: However great you make the bride-price and payment, I will give it; only let me have the girl for my wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 13
text: But the sons of Jacob gave a false answer to Shechem and Hamor his father, because of what had been done to Dinah their sister.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 14
text: And they said, It is not possible for us to give our sister to one who is without circumcision, for that would be a cause of shame to us:

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 15
text: But on this condition only will we come to an agreement with you: if every male among you becomes like us and undergoes circumcision;

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 16
text: Then we will give our daughters to you and take your daughters to us and go on living with you as one people.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 17
text: But if you will not undergo circumcision as we say, then we will take our daughter and go.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 18
text: And their words were pleasing to Hamor and his son Shechem.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 19
text: And without loss of time the young man did as they said, because he had delight in Jacob's daughter, and he was the noblest of his father's house.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 20
text: Then Hamor and Shechem, his son, went to the meeting-place of their town, and said to the men of the town,

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 21
text: It is the desire of these men to be at peace with us; let them then go on living in this country and doing trade here, for the country is wide open before them; let us take their daughters as wives and let us give them our daughters.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 22
text: But these men will make an agreement with us to go on living with us and to become one people, only on the condition that every male among us undergoes circumcision as they have done.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 23
text: Then will not their cattle and their goods and all their beasts be ours? so let us come to an agreement with them so that they may go on living with us.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 24
text: Then all the men of the town gave ear to the words of Hamor and Shechem his son; and every male in the town underwent circumcision.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 25
text: But on the third day after, before the wounds were well, two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brothers, took their swords and came into the town by surprise and put all the males to death.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 26
text: And Hamor and his son they put to death with the sword, and they took Dinah from Shechem's house and went away.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 27
text: And the sons of Jacob came on them when they were wounded and made waste the town because of what had been done to their sister;

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 28
text: They took their flocks and their herds and their asses and everything in their town and in their fields,

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 29
text: And all their wealth and all their little ones and their wives; everything in their houses they took and made them waste.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 30
text: And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, You have made trouble for me and given me a bad name among the people of this country, among the Canaanites and the Perizzites: and because we are small in number they will come together against me and make war on me; and it will be the end of me and all my people.

title: Genesis Chapter 34 Verse 31
text: But they said, Were we to let him make use of our sister as a loose woman?

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 1
text: And God said to Jacob, Go up now to Beth-el and make your living-place there: and put up an altar there to the God who came to you when you were in flight from your brother Esau.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 2
text: Then Jacob said to all his people, Put away the strange gods which are among you, and make yourselves clean, and put on a change of clothing:

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 3
text: And let us go up to Beth-el: and there I will make an altar to God, who gave me an answer in the day of my trouble, and was with me wherever I went.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 4
text: Then they gave to Jacob all the strange gods which they had, and the rings which were in their ears; and Jacob put them away under the holy tree at Shechem.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 5
text: So they went on their journey: and the fear of God was on the towns round about, so that they made no attack on the sons of Jacob.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 6
text: And Jacob came to Luz in the land of Canaan (which is the same as Beth-el), he and all his people.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 7
text: And there he made an altar, naming the place El-beth-el: because it was there he had the vision of God when he was in flight from his brother.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 8
text: And Deborah, the servant who had taken care of Rebekah from her birth, came to her end, and was put to rest near Beth-el, under the holy tree: and they gave it the name of Allon-bacuth.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 9
text: Now when Jacob was on his way from Paddan-aram, God came to him again and, blessing him, said,

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 10
text: Jacob is your name, but it will be so no longer; from now your name will be Israel; so he was named Israel.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 11
text: And God said to him, I am God, the Ruler of all: be fertile, and have increase; a nation, truly a group of nations, will come from you, and kings will be your offspring;

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 12
text: And the land which I gave to Abraham and Isaac, I will give to you; and to your seed after you I will give the land.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 13
text: Then God went up from him in the place where he had been talking with him.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 14
text: And Jacob put up a pillar in the place where he had been talking with God, and put a drink offering on it, and oil.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 15
text: And he gave to the place where God had been talking with him, the name of Beth-el.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 16
text: So they went on from Beth-el; and while they were still some distance from Ephrath, the pains of birth came on Rachel and she had a hard time.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 17
text: And when her pain was very great, the woman who was helping her said, Have no fear; for now you will have another son.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 18
text: And in the hour when her life went from her (for death came to her), she gave the child the name Ben-oni: but his father gave him the name of Benjamin.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 19
text: So Rachel came to her end and was put to rest on the road to Ephrath (which is Beth-lehem).

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 20
text: And Jacob put up a pillar on her resting-place; which is named, The Pillar of the resting-place of Rachel, to this day.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 21
text: And Israel went journeying on and put up his tents on the other side of the tower of the flock.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 22
text: Now while they were living in that country, Reuben had connection with Bilhah, his father's servant-woman: and Israel had news of it.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 23
text: Now Jacob had twelve sons: the sons of Leah: Reuben, Jacob's first son, and Simeon and Levi and Judah and Issachar and Zebulun;

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 24
text: The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin;

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 25
text: The sons of Bilhah, Rachel's servant: Dan and Naphtali;

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 26
text: The sons of Zilpah, Leah's servant: Gad and Asher; these are the sons whom Jacob had in Paddan-aram.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 27
text: And Jacob came to his father Isaac at Mamre, at Kiriath-arba, that is, Hebron, where Abraham and Isaac had been living.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 28
text: And Isaac was a hundred and eighty years old.

title: Genesis Chapter 35 Verse 29
text: Then Isaac came to his end and was put to rest with his father's people, an old man after a long life: and Jacob and Esau, his sons, put him in his last resting-place.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 1
text: Now these are the generations of Esau, that is to say, Edom.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 2
text: Esau's wives were women of Canaan: Adah, the daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite,

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 3
text: And Basemath, Ishmael's daughter, the sister of Nebaioth.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 4
text: Adah had a son Eliphaz; and Basemath was the mother of Reuel;

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 5
text: Oholibamah was the mother of Jeush, Jalam, and Korah; these are the sons of Esau, whose birth took place in the land of Canaan.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 6
text: Esau took his wives and his sons and his daughters, and all the people of his house, and his beasts and his cattle and all his goods which he had got together in the land of Canaan, and went into the land of Seir, away from his brother Jacob.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 7
text: For their wealth was so great that the land was not wide enough for the two of them and all their cattle.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 8
text: So Esau made his living-place in the hill-country of Seir (Esau is Edom).

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 9
text: And these are the generations of Esau, the father of the Edomites in the hill-country of Seir:

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 10
text: These are the names of Esau's sons: Eliphaz, the son of Esau's wife Adah, and Reuel, the son of Esau's wife Basemath.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 11
text: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 12
text: And Eliphaz, the son of Esau, had connection with a woman named Timna, who gave birth to Amalek: all these were the children of Esau's wife Adah.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 13
text: And these are the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah: they were the children of Esau's wife Basemath.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 14
text: And these are the sons of Esau's wife Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon: she was the mother of Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 15
text: These were the chiefs among the sons of Esau: the sons of Eliphaz, Esau's first son: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Kenaz,

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 16
text: Korah, Gatam, Amalek: all these were chiefs in the land of Edom, the offspring of Eliphaz, the seed of Adah.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 17
text: And these are the sons of Esau's son Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, Mizzah: these were the chiefs of Reuel in the land of Edom, the children of Esau's wife Basemath.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 18
text: And these are the sons of Esau's wife Oholibamah: Jeush, Jalam, and Korah: these were the chiefs who came from Esau's wife Oholibamah, daughter of Anah.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 19
text: These were the sons of Esau (that is, Edom), and these were their chiefs.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 20
text: These are the sons of Seir the Horite who were living in that country; Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 21
text: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan: these are the chiefs of the Horites, offspring of Seir in the land of Edom.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 22
text: The children of Lotan were Hori and Hemam; Lotan's sister was Timna.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 23
text: And these are the children of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 24
text: And these are the children of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah; that same Anah who made the discovery of the water-springs in the waste land, when he was looking after the asses of his father Zibeon.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 25
text: And these are the children of Anah: Dishon and Oholibamah his daughter.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 26
text: These are the children of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Keran.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 27
text: These are the children of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 28
text: These are the children of Dishan: Uz and Aran.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 29
text: These were the Horite chiefs: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 30
text: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. Such were the Horite chiefs in their order in the land of Seir.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 31
text: And these are the kings who were ruling in the land of Edom before there was any king over the children of Israel.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 32
text: Bela, son of Beor, was king in Edom, and the name of his chief town was Dinhabah.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 33
text: At his death, Jobab, son of Zerah of Bozrah, became king in his place.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 34
text: And at the death of Jobab, Husham, from the country of the Temanites, became king in his place.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 35
text: And at the death of Husham, Hadad, son of Bedad, who overcame the Midianites in the field of Moab, became king; his chief town was named Avith.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 36
text: And at the death of Hadad, Samlah of Masrekah became king.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 37
text: And at the death of Samlah, Shaul of Rehoboth by the River became king in his place.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 38
text: And at the death of Shaul, Baal-hanan, son of Achbor, became king.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 39
text: And at the death of Baal-hanan, Hadar became king in his place; his chief town was named Pau, and his wife's name was Mehetabel; she was the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-zahab.

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 40
text: These are the names of the chiefs of Esau in the order of their families and their places: Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 41
text: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 42
text: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,

title: Genesis Chapter 36 Verse 43
text: Magdiel, Iram; these are the Edomite chiefs, in their places in their heritage; this is Esau, the father of the Edomites.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 1
text: Now Jacob was living in the land where his father had made a place for himself, in the land of Canaan.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 2
text: These are the generations of Jacob: Joseph, a boy seventeen years old, was looking after the flock, together with his brothers, the sons of Bilhah and Zilpah, his father's wives; and Joseph gave their father a bad account of them.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 3
text: Now the love which Israel had for Joseph was greater than his love for all his other children, because he got him when he was an old man: and he had a long coat made for him.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 4
text: And because his brothers saw that Joseph was dearer to his father than all the others, they were full of hate for him, and would not say a kind word to him.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 5
text: Now Joseph had a dream, and he gave his brothers an account of it, which made their hate greater than ever.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 6
text: And he said to them, Let me give you the story of my dream.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 7
text: We were in the field, getting the grain stems together, and my grain kept upright, and yours came round and went down on the earth before mine.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 8
text: And his brothers said to him, Are you to be our king? will you have authority over us? And because of his dream and his words, their hate for him became greater than ever.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 9
text: Then he had another dream, and gave his brothers an account of it, saying, I have had another dream: the sun and the moon and eleven stars gave honour to me.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 10
text: And he gave word of it to his father and his brothers; but his father protesting said, What sort of a dream is this? am I and your mother and your brothers to go down on our faces to the earth before you?

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 11
text: And his brothers were full of envy; but his father kept his words in mind.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 12
text: Now his brothers went to keep watch over their father's flock in Shechem.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 13
text: And Israel said to Joseph, Are not your brothers with the flock in Shechem? come, I will send you to them. And he said to him, Here am I.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 14
text: And he said to him, Go now, and see if your brothers are well and how the flock is; then come back and give me word. So he sent him out of the valley of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 15
text: And a man saw him wandering in the country, and said to him, What are you looking for?

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 16
text: And he said, I am looking for my brothers; please give me word of where they are keeping their flock.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 17
text: And the man said, They have gone away from here, for they said in my hearing, Let us go to Dothan. So Joseph went after them and came up with them at Dothan.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 18
text: But they saw him when he was a long way off, and before he came near them they made a secret design against him to put him to death;

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 19
text: Saying to one another, See, here comes this dreamer.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 20
text: Let us now put him to death and put his body into one of these holes, and we will say, An evil beast has put him to death: then we will see what becomes of his dreams.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 21
text: But Reuben, hearing these words, got him out of their hands, saying, Let us not take his life.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 22
text: Do not put him to a violent death, but let him be placed in one of the holes; this he said to keep him safe from their hands, with the purpose of taking him back to his father again.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 23
text: So when Joseph came to his brothers, they took off his long coat which he had on;

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 24
text: And they took him and put him in the hole: now the hole had no water in it.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 25
text: Then seating themselves, they took their meal: and looking up, they saw a travelling band of Ishmaelites, coming from Gilead on their way to Egypt, with spices and perfumes on their camels.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 26
text: And Judah said to his brothers, What profit is there in putting our brother to death and covering up his blood?

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 27
text: Let us give him to these Ishmaelites for a price, and let us not put violent hands on him, for he is our brother, our flesh. And his brothers gave ear to him.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 28
text: And some traders from Midian went by; so pulling Joseph up out of the hole, they gave him to the Ishmaelites for twenty bits of silver, and they took him to Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 29
text: Now when Reuben came back to the hole, Joseph was not there; and giving signs of grief,

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 30
text: He went back to his brothers, and said, The child is gone; what am I to do?

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 31
text: Then they took Joseph's coat, and put on it some of the blood from a young goat which they had put to death,

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 32
text: And they took the coat to their father, and said, We came across this; is it your son's coat or not?

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 33
text: And he saw that it was, and said, It is my son's coat; an evil beast has put him to death; without doubt Joseph has come to a cruel end.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 34
text: Then Jacob, giving signs of grief, put on haircloth, and went on weeping for his son day after day.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 35
text: And all his sons and all his daughters came to give him comfort, but he would not be comforted, saying with weeping, I will go down to the underworld to my son. So great was his father's sorrow for him.

title: Genesis Chapter 37 Verse 36
text: And in Egypt the men of Midian gave him for a price to Potiphar, a captain of high position in Pharaoh's house.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 1
text: Now at that time, Judah went away from his brothers and became the friend of a man of Adullam named Hirah.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 2
text: And there he saw the daughter of a certain man of Canaan named Shua, and took her as his wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 3
text: And she gave birth to a son, and he gave him the name Er.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 4
text: And again she gave birth to a son, and he gave him the name Onan.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 5
text: Then she had another son, to whom she gave the name Shelah; she was at Chezib when the birth took place.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 6
text: And Judah took a wife for his first son Er, and her name was Tamar.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 7
text: Now Er, Judah's first son, did evil in the eyes of the Lord, so that he put him to death.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 8
text: Then Judah said to Onan, Go in to your brother's wife and do what it is right for a husband's brother to do; make her your wife and get offspring for your brother.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 9
text: But Onan, seeing that the offspring would not be his, went in to his brother's wife, but let his seed go on to the earth, so that he might not get offspring for his brother.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 10
text: And what he did was evil in the eyes of the Lord, so that he put him to death, like his brother.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 11
text: Then Judah said to Tamar, his daughter-in-law, Go back to your father's house and keep yourself as a widow till my son Shelah becomes a man: for he had in his mind the thought that death might come to him as it had come to his brothers. So Tamar went back to her father's house.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 12
text: And after a time, Bath-shua, Judah's wife, came to her end; and after Judah was comforted for her loss, he went to Timnah, where they were cutting the wool of his sheep, and his friend Hirah of Adullam went with him.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 13
text: And when Tamar had news that her father-in-law was going up to Timnah to the wool-cutting,

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 14
text: She took off her widow's clothing, and covering herself with her veil, she took her seat near Enaim on the road to Timnah; for she saw that Shelah was now a man, but she had not been made his wife.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 15
text: When Judah saw her he took her to be a loose woman of the town, because her face was covered.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 16
text: And turning to her by the roadside, he said to her, Let me come in to you; for he had no idea that she was his daughter-in-law. And she said, What will you give me as my price?

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 17
text: And he said, I will give you a young goat from the flock. And she said, What will you give me as a sign till you send it?

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 18
text: And he said, What would you have? And she said, Your ring and its cord and the stick in your hand. So he gave them to her and went in to her, and she became with child by him.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 19
text: Then she got up and went away and took off her veil and put on her widow's clothing.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 20
text: Then Judah sent his friend Hirah with the young goat, to get back the things which he had given as a sign to the woman: but she was not there.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 21
text: And he put questions to the men of the place, saying, Where is the loose woman who was in Enaim by the wayside? And they said, There was no such woman there.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 22
text: So he went back to Judah, and said, I have not seen her, and the men of the place say that there is no such woman there.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 23
text: And Judah said, Let her keep the things, so that we may not be shamed; I sent the young goat, but you did not see the woman.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 24
text: Now about three months after this, word came to Judah that Tamar, his daughter-in-law, had been acting like a loose woman and was with child. And Judah said, Take her out and let her be burned.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 25
text: And while she was being taken out, she sent word to her father-in-law, saying, The man whose property these things are, is the father of my child: say then, whose are this ring and this cord and this stick?

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 26
text: Then Judah said openly that they were his, and said, She is more upright than I am, for I did not give her to Shelah my son. And he had no more connection with her.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 27
text: And when the time came for her to give birth, it was clear that there were two children in her body.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 28
text: And while she was in the act of giving birth, one of them put out his hand; and the woman who was with her put a red thread round his hand, saying, This one came out first.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 29
text: But then he took his hand back again, and his brother came first to birth: and the woman said, What an opening you have made for yourself! So he was named Perez.

title: Genesis Chapter 38 Verse 30
text: And then his brother came out, with the red thread round his hand, and he was named Zerah.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 1
text: Now Joseph was taken down to Egypt; and Potiphar the Egyptian, a captain of high position in Pharaoh's house, got him for a price from the Ishmaelites who had taken him there.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 2
text: And the Lord was with Joseph, and he did well; and he was living in the house of his master the Egyptian.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 3
text: And his master saw that the Lord was with him, making everything he did go well.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 4
text: And having a high opinion of Joseph as his servant, he made him the overseer of his house and gave him control over all he had.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 5
text: And from the time when he made him overseer and gave him control of all his property, the blessing of the Lord was with the Egyptian, because of Joseph; the blessing of the Lord was on all he had, in the house and in the field.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 6
text: And he gave Joseph control of all his property, keeping no account of anything, but only the food which was put before him. Now Joseph was very beautiful in form and face.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 7
text: And after a time, his master's wife, looking on Joseph with desire, said to him, Be my lover.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 8
text: But he would not, and said to her, You see that my master keeps no account of what I do in his house, and has put all his property in my control;

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 9
text: So that no one has more authority in this house than I have; he has kept nothing back from me but you, because you are his wife; how then may I do this great wrong, sinning against God?

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 10
text: And day after day she went on requesting Joseph to come to her and be her lover, but he would not give ear to her.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 11
text: Now one day he went into the house to do his work; and not one of the men of the house was inside.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 12
text: And pulling at his coat, she said, Come to my bed; but slipping out of his coat, he went running away.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 13
text: And when she saw that he had got away, letting her keep his coat,

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 14
text: She sent for the men of her house and said to them, See, he has let a Hebrew come here and make sport of us; he came to my bed, and I gave a loud cry;

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 15
text: And hearing it he went running out without his coat.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 16
text: And she kept his coat by her, till his master came back.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 17
text: Then she gave him the same story, saying, The Hebrew servant whom you have taken into our house came in to make sport of me;

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 18
text: And when I gave a loud cry he went running out without his coat.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 19
text: And hearing his wife's account of what his servant had done, he became very angry.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 20
text: And Joseph's master took him and put him in prison, in the place where the king's prisoners were kept in chains, and he was there in the prison-house.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 21
text: But the Lord was with Joseph, and was good to him, and made the keeper of the prison his friend.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 22
text: And the keeper of the prison put all the prisoners under Joseph's control, and he was responsible for whatever was done there.

title: Genesis Chapter 39 Verse 23
text: And the keeper of the prison gave no attention to anything which was under his care, because the Lord was with him; and the Lord made everything he did go well.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 1
text: Now after these things the chief servant who had the care of the wine, and the chief bread-maker in Pharaoh's house, did something against Pharaoh's orders;

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 2
text: And Pharaoh was angry with his two servants, with the chief wine-servant and the chief bread-maker;

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 3
text: And he put them in prison under the care of the captain of the army, in the same prison where Joseph himself was shut up.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 4
text: And the captain put them in Joseph's care, and he did what was needed for them; and they were kept in prison for some time.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 5
text: And these two had a dream on the same night; the chief wine-servant and the chief bread-maker of the king of Egypt, who were in prison, the two of them had dreams with a special sense.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 6
text: And in the morning when Joseph came to them he saw that they were looking sad.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 7
text: And he said to the servants of Pharaoh who were in prison with him, Why are you looking so sad?

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 8
text: Then they said to him, We have had a dream, and no one is able to give us the sense. And Joseph said, Does not the sense of dreams come from God? what was your dream?

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 9
text: Then the chief wine-servant gave Joseph an account of his dream, and said, In my dream I saw a vine before me;

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 10
text: And on the vine were three branches; and it seemed as if it put out buds and flowers, and from them came grapes ready for cutting.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 11
text: And Pharaoh's cup was in my hand, and I took the grapes and crushing them into Pharaoh's cup, gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 12
text: Then Joseph said, This is the sense of your dream: the three branches are three days;

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 13
text: After three days Pharaoh will give you honour, and put you back into your place, and you will give him his cup as you did before, when you were his wine-servant.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 14
text: But keep me in mind when things go well for you, and be good to me and say a good word for me to Pharaoh and get me out of this prison:

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 15
text: For truly I was taken by force from the land of the Hebrews; and I have done nothing for which I might be put in prison.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 16
text: Now when the chief bread-maker saw that the first dream had a good sense, he said to Joseph, I had a dream; and in my dream there were three baskets of white bread on my head;

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 17
text: And in the top basket were all sorts of cooked meats for Pharaoh; and the birds were taking them out of the baskets on my head.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 18
text: Then Joseph said, This is the sense of your dream: the three baskets are three days;

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 19
text: After three days Pharaoh will take you out of prison, hanging you on a tree, so that your flesh will be food for birds.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 20
text: Now the third day was Pharaoh's birthday, and he gave a feast for all his servants; and he gave honour to the chief wine-servant and the chief bread-maker among the others.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 21
text: And he put the chief wine-servant back in his old place; and he gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 22
text: But the chief bread-maker was put to death by hanging, as Joseph had said.

title: Genesis Chapter 40 Verse 23
text: But the wine-servant did not keep Joseph in mind or give a thought to him.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 1
text: Now after two years had gone by, Pharaoh had a dream; and in his dream he was by the side of the Nile;

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 2
text: And out of the Nile came seven cows, good-looking and fat, and their food was the river-grass.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 3
text: And after them seven other cows came out of the Nile, poor-looking and thin; and they were by the side of the other cows.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 4
text: And the seven thin cows made a meal of the seven fat cows. Then Pharaoh came out of his sleep.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 5
text: But he went to sleep again and had a second dream, in which he saw seven heads of grain, full and good, all on one stem.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 6
text: And after them came up seven other heads, thin and wasted by the east wind.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 7
text: And the seven thin heads made a meal of the good heads. And when Pharaoh was awake he saw it was a dream.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 8
text: And in the morning his spirit was troubled; and he sent for all the wise men of Egypt and all the holy men, and put his dream before them, but no one was able to give him the sense of it.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 9
text: Then the chief wine-servant said to Pharaoh, The memory of my sin comes back to me now;

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 10
text: Pharaoh had been angry with his servants, and had put me in prison in the house of the captain of the army, together with the chief bread-maker;

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 11
text: And we had a dream on the same night, the two of us, and the dreams had a special sense.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 12
text: And there was with us a young Hebrew, the captain's servant, and when we put our dreams before him, he gave us the sense of them.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 13
text: And it came about as he said: I was put back in my place, and the bread-maker was put to death by hanging.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 14
text: Then Pharaoh sent for Joseph, and they took him quickly out of prison; and when his hair had been cut and his dress changed, he came before Pharaoh.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 15
text: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, I have had a dream, and no one is able to give me the sense of it; now it has come to my ears that you are able to give the sense of a dream when it is put before you.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 16
text: Then Joseph said, Without God there will be no answer of peace for Pharaoh.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 17
text: Then Pharaoh said, In my dream I was by the side of the Nile:

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 18
text: And out of the Nile came seven cows, fat and good-looking, and their food was the river-grass;

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 19
text: Then after them came seven other cows, very thin and poor-looking, worse than any I ever saw in the land of Egypt;

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 20
text: And the thin cows made a meal of the seven fat cows who came up first;

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 21
text: And even with the fat cows inside them they seemed as bad as before. And so I came out of my sleep.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 22
text: And again in a dream I saw seven heads of grain, full and good, coming up on one stem:

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 23
text: And then I saw seven other heads, dry, thin, and wasted by the east wind, coming up after them:

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 24
text: And the seven thin heads made a meal of the seven good heads; and I put this dream before the wise men, but not one of them was able to give me the sense of it.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 25
text: Then Joseph said, These two dreams have the same sense: God has made clear to Pharaoh what he is about to do.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 26
text: The seven fat cows are seven years, and the seven good heads of grain are seven years: the two have the same sense.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 27
text: The seven thin and poor-looking cows who came up after them are seven years; and the seven heads of grain, dry and wasted by the east wind, are seven years when there will be no food.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 28
text: As I said to Pharaoh before, God has made clear to him what he is about to do.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 29
text: Seven years are coming in which there will be great wealth of grain in Egypt;

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 30
text: And after that will come seven years when there will not be enough food; and the memory of the good years will go from men's minds; and the land will be made waste by the bad years;

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 31
text: And men will have no memory of the good time because of the need which will come after, for it will be very bitter.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 32
text: And this dream came to Pharaoh twice, because this thing is certain, and God will quickly make it come about.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 33
text: And now let Pharaoh make search for a man of wisdom and good sense, and put him in authority over the land of Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 34
text: Let Pharaoh do this, and let him put overseers over the land of Egypt to put in store a fifth part of the produce of the land in the good years.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 35
text: And let them get together all the food in those good years and make a store of grain under Pharaoh's control for the use of the towns, and let them keep it.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 36
text: And let that food be kept in store for the land till the seven bad years which are to come in Egypt; so that the land may not come to destruction through need of food.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 37
text: And this seemed good to Pharaoh and to all his servants.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 38
text: Then Pharaoh said to his servants, Where may we get such a man as this, a man in whom is the spirit of God?

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 39
text: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, Seeing that God has made all this clear to you, there is no other man of such wisdom and good sense as you:

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 40
text: You, then, are to be over my house, and all my people will be ruled by your word: only as king will I be greater than you.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 41
text: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, See, I have put you over all the land of Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 42
text: Then Pharaoh took off his ring from his hand and put it on Joseph's hand, and he had him clothed with the best linen, and put a chain of gold round his neck;

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 43
text: And he made him take his seat in the second of his carriages; and they went before him crying, Make way! So he made him ruler over all the land of Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 44
text: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, I am Pharaoh; and without your order no man may do anything in all the land of Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 45
text: And Pharaoh gave Joseph the name of Zaphnath-paaneah; and he gave him Asenath, the daughter of Poti-phera, the priest of On, to be his wife. So Joseph went through all the land of Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 46
text: Now Joseph was thirty years old when he came before Pharaoh, king of Egypt. And Joseph went out from before the face of Pharaoh and went through all the land of Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 47
text: Now in the seven good years the earth gave fruit in masses.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 48
text: And Joseph got together all the food of those seven years, and made a store of food in the towns: the produce of the fields round every town was stored up in the town.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 49
text: So he got together a store of grain like the sand of the sea; so great a store that after a time he gave up measuring it, for it might not be measured.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 50
text: And before the time of need, Joseph had two sons, to whom Asenath, the daughter of Poti-phera, priest of On, gave birth.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 51
text: And to the first he gave the name Manasseh, for he said, God has taken away from me all memory of my hard life and of my father's house.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 52
text: And to the second he gave the name Ephraim, for he said, God has given me fruit in the land of my sorrow.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 53
text: And so the seven good years in Egypt came to an end.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 54
text: Then came the first of the seven years of need as Joseph had said: and in every other land they were short of food; but in the land of Egypt there was bread.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 55
text: And when all the land of Egypt was in need of food, the people came crying to Pharaoh for bread; and Pharaoh said to the people, Go to Joseph, and whatever he says to you, do it.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 56
text: And everywhere on the earth they were short of food; then Joseph, opening all his store-houses, gave the people of Egypt grain for money; so great was the need of food in the land of Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 41 Verse 57
text: And all lands sent to Egypt, to Joseph, to get grain, for the need was great over all the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 1
text: Now Jacob, hearing that there was grain in Egypt, said to his sons, Why are you looking at one another?

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 2
text: And he said, I have had news that there is grain in Egypt: go down there and get grain for us, so that life and not death may be ours.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 3
text: So Joseph's ten brothers went down to get grain from Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 4
text: But Jacob did not send Benjamin, Joseph's brother, with them, for fear, as he said, that some evil might come to him.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 5
text: And the sons of Israel came with all the others to get grain: for they were very short of food in the land of Canaan.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 6
text: Now Joseph was ruler over all the land, and it was he who gave out the grain to all the people of the land; and Joseph's brothers came before him and went down on their faces to the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 7
text: And when Joseph saw his brothers, it was clear to him who they were, but he made himself strange to them, and talking roughly to them, said, Where do you come from? And they said, From the land of Canaan, to get food.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 8
text: Now though Joseph saw that these were his brothers, they had no idea who he was.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 9
text: Then the memory of his dreams about them came back to Joseph, and he said to them, You have come secretly to see how poor the land is.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 10
text: And they said to him, Not so, my lord: your servants have come with money to get food.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 11
text: We are all one man's sons, we are true men; we have not come with any secret purpose.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 12
text: And he said to them, No, but you have come to see how poor the land is.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 13
text: Then they said, We your servants are twelve brothers, sons of one man in the land of Canaan; the youngest of us is now with our father, and one is dead.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 14
text: And Joseph said, It is as I said; you have come with some secret purpose;

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 15
text: But in this way will you be put to the test: by the life of Pharaoh, you will not go away from this place till your youngest brother comes here.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 16
text: Send one of your number to get your brother, and the rest of you will be kept in prison, so that your words may be tested to see if you are true; if not, by the life of Pharaoh, your purpose is certainly secret.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 17
text: So he put them in prison for three days.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 18
text: And on the third day Joseph said to them, Do this, if you would keep your lives: for I am a god-fearing man:

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 19
text: If you are true men, let one of you be kept in prison, while you go and take grain for the needs of your families;

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 20
text: And come back to me with your youngest brother, so that your words may be seen to be true, and you will not be put to death. This is what you are to do.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 21
text: And they said to one another, Truly, we did wrong to our brother, for we saw his grief of mind, and we did not give ear to his prayers; that is why this trouble has come on us.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 22
text: And Reuben said to them, Did I not say to you, Do the child no wrong? but you gave no attention; so now, punishment has come on us for his blood.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 23
text: They were not conscious that the sense of their words was clear to Joseph, for he had been talking to them through one who had knowledge of their language.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 24
text: And turning away from them, he was overcome with weeping; then he went on talking to them again and took Simeon and put chains on him before their eyes.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 25
text: Then Joseph gave orders for their bags to be made full of grain, and for every man's money to be put back into his bag, and for food to be given them for the journey: which was done.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 26
text: Then they put the bags of grain on their asses and went away.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 27
text: Now at their night's resting-place one of them, opening his bag to give his ass some food, saw his money in the mouth of the bag.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 28
text: And he said to his brothers, My money has been given back: it is in my bag; then their hearts became full of fear, and turning to one another they said, What is this which God has done to us?

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 29
text: So when they came to Jacob their father, in the land of Canaan, they gave him an account of all their experiences, saying,

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 30
text: The man who is the ruler of the country was rough with us and put us in prison, saying that we had come with a secret evil purpose.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 31
text: And we said to him, We are true men, we have no evil designs;

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 32
text: We are twelve brothers, sons of our father; one is dead, and the youngest is now with our father in the land of Canaan.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 33
text: And the ruler of the land said, In this way I may be certain that you are true men; let one of you be kept here with me, while you go and take grain for the needs of your families;

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 34
text: And come back to me with your youngest brother: then I will be certain that you are true men, and I will give your brother back to you and let you do trade in the land.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 35
text: And when they took the grain out of their bags, it was seen that every man's parcel of money was in his bag; and when they and their father saw the money, they were full of fear.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 36
text: And Jacob their father said to them, You have taken my children from me: Joseph is gone and Simeon is gone, and now you would take Benjamin away; all these things have come on me.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 37
text: And Reuben said, Put my two sons to death if I do not come back to you with him; let him be in my care and I will give him safely back to you.

title: Genesis Chapter 42 Verse 38
text: And he said, I will not let my son go down with you; for his brother is dead and he is all I have: if evil overtakes him on the journey, then through you will my grey head go down to the underworld in sorrow.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 1
text: Now the land was in bitter need of food.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 2
text: And when the grain which they had got in Egypt was all used up, their father said to them, Go again and get us a little food.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 3
text: And Judah said to him, The man said to us with an oath, You are not to come before me again without your brother.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 4
text: If you will let our brother go with us, we will go down and get food:

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 5
text: But if you will not send him, we will not go down: for the man said to us, You are not to come before me if your brother is not with you.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 6
text: And Israel said, Why were you so cruel to me as to say to him that you had a brother?

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 7
text: And they said, The man put a number of questions to us about ourselves and our family, saying, Is your father still living? have you another brother? And we had to give him answers; how were we to have any idea that he would say, Come back with your brother?

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 8
text: Then Judah said to Israel, his father, Send the boy with me, and let us be up and going, so that we and you and our little ones may not come to destruction.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 9
text: Put him into my care and make me responsible for him: if I do not give him safely back to you, let mine be the sin for ever.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 10
text: Truly, if we had not let the time go by, we might have come back again by now.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 11
text: Then their father Israel said to them, If it has to be so, then do this: take of the best fruits of the land in your vessels to give the man, perfumes and honey and spices and nuts:

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 12
text: And take twice as much money with you; that is to say, take back the money which was put in your bags, for it may have been an error;

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 13
text: And take your brother and go back to the man:

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 14
text: And may God, the Ruler of all, give you mercy before the man, so that he may give you back your other brother and Benjamin. If my children are to be taken from me; there is no help for it.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 15
text: So they took what their father said for the man, and twice as much money in their hands, and Benjamin, and went on their journey to Egypt, and came before Joseph.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 16
text: And when Joseph saw Benjamin, he said to his chief servant, Take these men into my house, and make ready a meal, for they will take food with me in the middle of the day.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 17
text: And the servant did as Joseph said, and took the men into Joseph's house.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 18
text: Now the men were full of fear because they had been taken into Joseph's house and they said, It is because of the money which was put back in our bags the first time; he is looking for something against us, so that he may come down on us and take us and our asses for his use.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 19
text: So they went up to Joseph's chief servant at the door of the house,

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 20
text: And said, O my lord, we only came down the first time to get food;

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 21
text: And when we came to our night's resting-place, on opening our bags we saw that every man's money was in the mouth of his bag, all our money in full weight: and we have it with us to give it back;

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 22
text: As well as more money, with which to get food: we have no idea who put our money in our bags.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 23
text: Then the servant said, Peace be with you: have no fear: your God, even the God of your father, has put wealth in your bags for you: I had your money. Then he let Simeon come out to them.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 24
text: And the servant took them into Joseph's house, and gave them water for washing their feet; and he gave their asses food.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 25
text: And they got ready the things for Joseph before he came in the middle of the day: for word was given to them that they were to have a meal there.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 26
text: And when Joseph came in, they gave him the things which they had for him, and went down to the earth before him.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 27
text: And he said, How are you? is your father well, the old man of whom you were talking to me? is he still living?

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 28
text: And they said, Your servant, our father, is well, he is still living. And they went down on their faces before him.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 29
text: Then, lifting up his eyes, he saw Benjamin, his brother, his mother's son, and he said, Is this your youngest brother of whom you gave me word? And he said, God be good to you, my son.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 30
text: Then Joseph's heart went out to his brother, and he went quickly into his room, for he was overcome with weeping.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 31
text: Then, after washing his face, he came out, and controlling his feelings said, Put food before us.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 32
text: And they put a meal ready for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians who were with him by themselves; because the Egyptians may not take food with the Hebrews, for that would make them unclean.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 33
text: And they were all given their seats before him in order of birth, from the oldest to the youngest: so that they were looking at one another in wonder.

title: Genesis Chapter 43 Verse 34
text: And Joseph sent food to them from his table, but he sent five times as much to Benjamin as to any of the others. And they took wine freely with him.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 1
text: Then he gave orders to the servant who was over his house, saying, Put as much food into the men's bags as will go into them, and put every man's money in the mouth of his bag;

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 2
text: And put my cup, my silver cup, in the youngest one's bag, with his money. So he did as Joseph said.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 3
text: And at dawn the men, with their asses, were sent away.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 4
text: And when they had gone only a little way out of the town, Joseph said to the servant who was over his house, Go after them; and when you overtake them, say to them, Why have you done evil in reward for good?

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 5
text: Is not this the cup from which my lord takes wine and by which he gets knowledge of the future? Truly, you have done evil.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 6
text: So he overtook them and said these words to them.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 7
text: And they said to him, Why does my lord say such words as these? far be it from your servants to do such a thing:

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 8
text: See, the money which was in the mouth of our bags we gave back to you when we came again from Canaan: how then might we take silver or gold from your lord's house?

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 9
text: If it comes to light that any of your servants has done this, let him be put to death, and we will be your lord's servants.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 10
text: And he said, Let it be as you say: he in whose bag it is seen will become my servant; and you will not be responsible.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 11
text: Then every man quickly got his bag down and undid it.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 12
text: And he made a search, starting with the oldest and ending with the youngest; and the cup was in Benjamin's bag.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 13
text: Then in bitter grief they put the bags on the asses again and went back to the town.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 14
text: So Judah and his brothers came to Joseph's house; and he was still there: and they went down on their faces before him.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 15
text: And Joseph said, What is this thing which you have done? had you no thought that such a man as I would have power to see what is secret?

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 16
text: And Judah said, What are we to say to my lord? how may we put ourselves right in his eyes? God has made clear the sin of your servants: now we are in your hands, we and the man in whose bag your cup was seen.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 17
text: Then he said, Far be it from me to do so: but the man who had my cup will be my servant; and you may go back to your father in peace.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 18
text: Then Judah came near him, and said, Let your servant say a word in my lord's ears, and let not your wrath be burning against your servant: for you are in the place of Pharaoh to us.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 19
text: My lord said to his servants, Have you a father or a brother?

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 20
text: And we said to my lord, We have an old father and a young child, whom he had when he was old; his brother is dead and he is the only son of his mother, and is very dear to his father.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 21
text: And you said to your servants, Let him come down to me with you, so that I may see him.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 22
text: And we said to my lord, His father will not let him go; for if he went away his father would come to his death.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 23
text: But you said to your servants, If your youngest brother does not come with you, you will not see my face again.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 24
text: And when we went back to your servant, our father, we gave him an account of my lord's words.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 25
text: And our father said, Go again and get us a little food.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 26
text: And we said, Only if our youngest brother goes with us will we go down; for we may not see the man's face again if our youngest brother is not with us.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 27
text: And our father said to us, You have knowledge that my wife gave me two sons;

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 28
text: The one went away from me, and I said, Truly he has come to a violent death; and from that time I have not seen him,

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 29
text: If now you take this one from me, and some evil comes to him, you will make my grey head go down in sorrow to the underworld.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 30
text: If then I go back to your servant, my father, without the boy, because his life and the boy's life are one,

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 31
text: When he sees that the boy is not with us, he will come to his death, and our father's grey head will go down in sorrow to the underworld.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 32
text: For I made myself responsible for the boy to my father, saying, If I do not give him safely back to you, let mine be the sin for ever.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 33
text: So now let me be my lord's servant here in place of the boy, and let him go back with his brothers.

title: Genesis Chapter 44 Verse 34
text: For how may I go back to my father without the boy, and see the evil which will come on my father?

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 1
text: Then Joseph, unable to keep back his feelings before those who were with him, gave orders for everyone to be sent away, and no one was present when he made clear to his brothers who he was.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 2
text: And so loud was his weeping, that it came to the ears of the Egyptians and all Pharaoh's house.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 3
text: And Joseph said to his brothers, I am Joseph: is my father still living? But his brothers were not able to give him an answer for they were troubled before him.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 4
text: Then Joseph said to his brothers, Come near to me. And they came near, And he said, I am Joseph your brother, whom you sent into Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 5
text: Now do not be troubled or angry with yourselves for sending me away, because God sent me before you to be the saviour of your lives.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 6
text: For these two years have been years of need, and there are still five more years to come in which there will be no ploughing or cutting of grain.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 7
text: God sent me before you to keep you and yours living on earth so that you might become a great nation.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 8
text: So now it was not you who sent me here, but God: and he has made me as a father to Pharaoh, and lord of all his house, and ruler over all the land of Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 9
text: Now go quickly to my father, and say to him, Your son Joseph says, God has made me ruler over all the land of Egypt: come down to me straight away:

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 10
text: The land of Goshen will be your living-place, and you will be near me; you and your children and your children's children, and your flocks and herds and all you have:

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 11
text: And there I will take care of you, so that you and your family may not be in need, for there are still five bad years to come.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 12
text: Now truly, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin see, that it is my mouth which says these things to you.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 13
text: Give my father word of all my glory in Egypt and of all you have seen; and come back quickly with my father.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 14
text: Then, weeping, he took Benjamin in his arms, and Benjamin himself was weeping on Joseph's neck.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 15
text: Then he gave a kiss to all his brothers, weeping over them; and after that his brothers had no fear of talking to him.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 16
text: And news of these things went through Pharaoh's house, and it was said that Joseph's brothers were come; and it seemed good to Pharaoh and his servants.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 17
text: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, Say to your brothers, Put your goods on your beasts and go back to the land of Canaan;

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 18
text: And get your father and your families and come back to me: and I will give you all the good things of Egypt, and the fat of the land will be your food.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 19
text: And say to them, This you are to do: take carts from the land of Egypt for your little ones and for your wives, and get your father and come back.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 20
text: And take no thought for your goods, for the best of all the land of Egypt is yours.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 21
text: And the children of Israel did as he said; and Joseph gave them carts as had been ordered by Pharaoh, and food for their journey.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 22
text: To every one of them he gave three changes of clothing; but to Benjamin he gave three hundred bits of silver and five changes of clothing.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 23
text: And to his father he sent ten asses with good things from Egypt on their backs, and ten she-asses with grain and bread and food for his father on the journey.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 24
text: And he sent his brothers on their way, and said to them, See that you have no argument on the road.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 25
text: So they went up from Egypt and came to the land of Canaan, to their father Jacob.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 26
text: And they said to him, Joseph is living, and is ruler over all the land of Egypt. And at this word Jacob was quite overcome, for he had no faith in it.

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 27
text: And they gave him an account of everything Joseph had said to them; and when he saw the carts which Joseph had sent for them, his spirit came back to him:

title: Genesis Chapter 45 Verse 28
text: And Israel said, It is enough: Joseph my son is still living; I will go and see him before my death.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 1
text: And Israel went on his journey with all he had, and came to Beer-sheba, where he made offerings to the God of his father Isaac.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 2
text: And God said to Israel in a night-vision, Jacob, Jacob. And he said, Here am I.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 3
text: And he said, I am God, the God of your father: go down to Egypt without fear, for I will make a great nation of you there:

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 4
text: I will go down with you to Egypt, and I will see that you come back again, and at your death Joseph will put his hands on your eyes.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 5
text: Then Jacob went on from Beer-sheba; and the sons of Jacob took their father and their little ones and their wives in the carts which Pharaoh had sent for them.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 6
text: And they took their cattle and all the goods which they had got in the land of Canaan, and came to Egypt, even Jacob and all his seed:

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 7
text: His sons and his sons' sons, his daughters and his daughters' sons and all his family he took with him into Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 8
text: And these are the names of the children of Israel who came into Egypt, even Jacob and all his sons: Reuben, Jacob's oldest son;

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 9
text: And the sons of Reuben: Hanoch and Pallu and Hezron and Carmi;

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 10
text: And the sons of Simeon: Jemuel and Jamin and Ohad and Jachin and Zohar and Shaul, the son of a woman of Canaan;

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 11
text: And the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari;

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 12
text: And the sons of Judah: Er and Onan and Shelah and Perez and Zerah: but Er and Onan had come to their death in the land of Canaan; and the sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 13
text: And the sons of Issachar: Tola and Puah and Job and Shimron;

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 14
text: And the sons of Zebulun: Sered and Elon and Jahleel;

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 15
text: All these, together with his daughter Dinah, were the children of Leah, whom Jacob had by her in Paddan-aram; they were thirty-three in number.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 16
text: And the sons of Gad: Ziphion and Haggi, Shuni and Ezbon, Eri and Arodi and Areli;

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 17
text: And the sons of Asher: Jimnah and Ishvah and Ishvi and Beriah, and Sarah, their sister; and the sons of Beriah: Heber and Malchiel.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 18
text: These are the children of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to his daughter Leah, and Jacob had these sixteen children by her.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 19
text: The sons of Jacob's wife Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 20
text: And Joseph had Manasseh and Ephraim in the land of Egypt, by Asenath, the daughter of Poti-phera, priest of On.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 21
text: And the sons of Benjamin were Belah and Becher and Ashbel, Gera and Naaman, Ehi and Rosh, Muppim and Huppim and Ard.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 22
text: All these were the children of Rachel whom Jacob had by her, fourteen persons.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 23
text: And the son of Dan was Hushim.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 24
text: And the sons of Naphtali: Jahzeel and Guni and Jezer and Shillem.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 25
text: These were the children of Bilhah, whom Laban gave to his daughter Rachel, seven persons.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 26
text: All the persons who came with Jacob into Egypt, the offspring of his body, were sixty-six, without taking into account the wives of Jacob's sons.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 27
text: And the sons of Joseph whom he had in Egypt were two. Seventy persons of the family of Jacob came into Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 28
text: Now he had sent Judah before him to Goshen, to get word from Joseph; and so they came to the land of Goshen.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 29
text: And Joseph got his carriage ready and went to Goshen for the meeting with his father; and when he came before him, he put his arms round his neck, weeping.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 30
text: And Israel said to Joseph, Now that I have seen you living again, I am ready for death.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 31
text: And Joseph said to his brothers and to his father's people, I will go and give the news to Pharaoh, and say to him, My brothers and my father's people, from the land of Canaan, have come to me;

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 32
text: And these men are keepers of sheep and owners of cattle, and have with them their flocks and their herds and all they have.

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 33
text: Now when Pharaoh sends for you and says, What is your business?

title: Genesis Chapter 46 Verse 34
text: You are to say, Your servants have been keepers of cattle from our early days up to now, like our fathers; in this way you will be able to have the land of Goshen for yourselves; because keepers of sheep are unclean in the eyes of the Egyptians.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 1
text: Then Joseph went to Pharaoh, and said, My father and my brothers with their flocks and their herds and all they have, are come from Canaan, and are now in the land of Goshen.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 2
text: And he took five of his brothers to Pharaoh.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 3
text: And Pharaoh said to them, What is your business? And they said, Your servants are keepers of sheep, as our fathers were before us.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 4
text: And they said to Pharaoh, We have come to make a living in this land, because we have no grass for our flocks in the land of Canaan; so now let your servants make a place for themselves in the land of Goshen.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 5
text: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, Let them have the land of Goshen; and if there are any able men among them, put them over my cattle.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 6
text: And Jacob and his sons came to Joseph in Egypt, and when word of it came to the ears of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, he said to Joseph, Your father and brothers have come to you; all the land of Egypt is before you; let your father and your brothers have the best of the land for their resting-place.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 7
text: Then Joseph made his father Jacob come before Pharaoh, and Jacob gave him his blessing.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 8
text: And Pharaoh said to him, How old are you?

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 9
text: And Jacob said, The years of my wanderings have been a hundred and thirty; small in number and full of sorrow have been the years of my life, and less than the years of the wanderings of my fathers.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 10
text: And Jacob gave Pharaoh his blessing, and went out from before him.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 11
text: And Joseph made a place for his father and his brothers, and gave them a heritage in the land of Egypt, in the best of the land, the land of Rameses, as Pharaoh had given orders.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 12
text: And Joseph took care of his father and his brothers and all his father's people, giving them food for the needs of their families.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 13
text: Now there was no food to be had in all the land, so that all Egypt and Canaan were wasted from need of food.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 14
text: And all the money in Egypt and in the land of Canaan which had been given for grain, came into the hands of Joseph: and he put it in Pharaoh's house.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 15
text: And when all the money in Egypt and Canaan was gone, the Egyptians came to Joseph, and said, Give us bread; would you have us come to destruction before your eyes? for we have no more money.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 16
text: And Joseph said, Give me your cattle; I will give you grain in exchange for your cattle if your money is all gone.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 17
text: So they took their cattle to Joseph and he gave them bread in exchange for their horses and flocks and herds and asses, so all that year he gave them food in exchange for their cattle.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 18
text: And when that year was ended, they came to him in the second year, and said, We may not keep it from our lord's knowledge that all our money is gone, and all the herds of cattle are my lord's; there is nothing more to give my lord but our bodies and our land;

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 19
text: Are we to come to destruction before your eyes, we and our land? take us and our land and give us bread; and we and our land will be servants to Pharaoh; and give us seed so that we may have life and the land may not become waste.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 20
text: So Joseph got all the land in Egypt for Pharaoh; for every Egyptian gave up his land in exchange for food, because of their great need; so all the land became Pharaoh's.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 21
text: And as for the people, he made servants of them, town by town, from one end of Egypt to the other.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 22
text: Only he did not take the land of the priests, for the priests had their food given them by Pharaoh, and having what Pharaoh gave them, they had no need to give up their land.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 23
text: Then Joseph said to the people, I have made you and your land this day the property of Pharaoh; here is seed for you to put in your fields.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 24
text: And when the grain is cut, you are to give a fifth part to Pharaoh, and four parts will be yours for seed and food, and for your families and your little ones.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 25
text: And they said to him, Truly you have kept us from death; may we have grace in your eyes, and we will be Pharaoh's servants.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 26
text: Then Joseph made a law which is in force to this day, that Pharaoh was to have the fifth part; only the land of the priests did not become his.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 27
text: And so Israel was living among the Egyptians in the land of Goshen; and they got property there, and became very great in numbers and in wealth.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 28
text: And Jacob was living in the land of Goshen for seventeen years; so the years of his life were a hundred and forty-seven.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 29
text: And the time of his death came near, and he sent for his son Joseph and said to him, If now I am dear to you, put your hand under my leg and take an oath that you will not put me to rest in Egypt;

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 30
text: But when I go to my fathers, you are to take me out of Egypt and put me to rest in their last resting-place. And he said, I will do so.

title: Genesis Chapter 47 Verse 31
text: And he said, Take an oath to me; and he took an oath to him: and Israel gave worship on the bed's head.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 1
text: Now after these things, word came to Joseph that his father was ill: and he took with him his sons Manasseh and Ephraim.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 2
text: And when they said to Jacob, Your son Joseph is coming to see you: then Israel, getting all his strength together, had himself lifted up in his bed.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 3
text: And Jacob said to Joseph, God, the Ruler of all, came to me in a vision at Luz in the land of Canaan, and gave me his blessing,

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 4
text: And said to me, Truly, I will make you fertile and give you increase and will make of you a great family of nations: and I will give this land to your seed after you to be their heritage for ever.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 5
text: And now your two sons who came to birth in Egypt before I came to you here, are mine; Ephraim and Manasseh will be mine, in the same way as Reuben and Simeon are.
