title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 6
text: And any other offspring which you have after them, will be yours, and will be named after their brothers in their heritage.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 7
text: And as for me, when I came from Paddan, death overtook Rachel on the way, when we were still some distance from Ephrath; and I put her to rest there on the road to Ephrath, which is Beth-lehem.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 8
text: Then Israel, looking at Joseph's sons, said, Who are these?

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 9
text: And Joseph said to his father, They are my sons, whom God has given me in this land. And he said, Let them come near me, and I will give them a blessing.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 10
text: Now because Israel was old, his eyes were no longer clear, and he was not able to see. So he made them come near to him, and he gave them a kiss, folding them in his arms.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 11
text: And Israel said to Joseph, I had no hope of seeing your face again, but God in his mercy has let me see you and your children.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 12
text: Then Joseph took them from between his knees, and went down on his face to the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 13
text: Then taking Ephraim with his right hand, Joseph put him at Israel's left side, and with his left hand he put Manasseh at Israel's right side, placing them near him.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 14
text: And Israel, stretching out his right hand, put it on the head of Ephraim, the younger, and his left hand on the head of Manasseh, crossing his hands on purpose, for Manasseh was the older.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 15
text: And he gave Joseph a blessing, saying, May the God to whom my fathers, Abraham and Isaac, gave worship, the God who has taken care of me all my life till this day,

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 16
text: The angel who has been my saviour from all evil, send his blessing on these children: and let my name and the name of my fathers, Abraham and Isaac, be given to them; and let them become a great nation in the earth.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 17
text: Now when Joseph saw that his father had put his right hand on the head of Ephraim, it did not seem right to him; and lifting his father's hand he would have put it on the head of Manasseh.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 18
text: And Joseph said to his father, Not so, my father, for this is the older; put your right hand on his head.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 19
text: But his father would not, saying, I am doing it on purpose, my son; he will certainly become a nation and a great one; but his younger brother will be greater than he, and his seed will become a great family of nations.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 20
text: So he gave them his blessing that day, saying, You will be the sign of blessing in Israel, for they will say, May God make you like Ephraim and Manasseh; and he put Ephraim before Manasseh.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 21
text: Then Israel said to Joseph, Now my death is near; but God will be with you, guiding you back to the land of your fathers.

title: Genesis Chapter 48 Verse 22
text: And I have given you more than your brothers, even Shechem as your heritage, which I took from the Amorites with my sword and my bow.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 1
text: And Jacob sent for his sons, and said, Come together, all of you, so that I may give you news of your fate in future times.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 2
text: Come near, O sons of Jacob, and give ear to the words of Israel your father.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 3
text: Reuben, you are my oldest son, the first-fruit of my strength, first in pride and first in power:

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 4
text: But because you were uncontrolled, the first place will not be yours; for you went up to your father's bed, even his bride-bed, and made it unclean.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 5
text: Simeon and Levi are brothers; deceit and force are their secret designs.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 6
text: Take no part in their secrets, O my soul; keep far away, O my heart, from their meetings; for in their wrath they put men to death, and for their pleasure even oxen were wounded.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 7
text: A curse on their passion for it was bitter; and on their wrath for it was cruel. I will let their heritage in Jacob be broken up, driving them from their places in Israel.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 8
text: To you, Judah, will your brothers give praise: your hand will be on the neck of your haters; your father's sons will go down to the earth before you.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 9
text: Judah is a young lion; like a lion full of meat you have become great, my son; now he takes his rest like a lion stretched out and like an old lion; by whom will his sleep be broken?

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 10
text: The rod of authority will not be taken from Judah, and he will not be without a law-giver, till he comes who has the right to it, and the peoples will put themselves under his rule.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 11
text: Knotting his ass's cord to the vine, and his young ass to the best vine; washing his robe in wine, and his clothing in the blood of grapes:

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 12
text: His eyes will be dark with wine, and his teeth white with milk.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 13
text: The resting-place of Zebulun will be by the sea, and he will be a harbour for ships; the edge of his land will be by Zidon.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 14
text: Issachar is a strong ass stretched out among the flocks:

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 15
text: And he saw that rest was good and the land was pleasing; so he let them put weights on his back and became a servant.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 16
text: Dan will be the judge of his people, as one of the tribes of Israel.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 17
text: May Dan be a snake in the way, a horned snake by the road, biting the horse's foot so that the horseman has a fall.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 18
text: I have been waiting for your salvation, O Lord.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 19
text: Gad, an army will come against him, but he will come down on them in their flight.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 20
text: Asher's bread is fat; he gives delicate food for kings.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 21
text: Naphtali is a roe let loose, giving fair young ones.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 22
text: Joseph is a young ox, whose steps are turned to the fountain;

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 23
text: He was troubled by the archers; they sent out their arrows against him, cruelly wounding him:

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 24
text: But their bows were broken by a strong one, and the cords of their arms were cut by the Strength of Jacob, by the name of the Stone of Israel:

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 25
text: Even by the God of your father, who will be your help, and by the Ruler of all, who will make you full with blessings from heaven on high, blessings of the deep stretched out under the earth, blessings of the breasts and of the fertile body:

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 26
text: Blessings of sons, old and young, to the father: blessings of the oldest mountains and the fruit of the eternal hills: let them come on the head of Joseph, on the crown of him who was separate from his brothers.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 27
text: Benjamin is a wolf, searching for meat: in the morning he takes his food, and in the evening he makes division of what he has taken.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 28
text: These are the twelve tribes of Israel: and these are the words their father said to them, blessing them; to every one he gave his blessing.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 29
text: And he gave orders to them, saying, Put me to rest with my people and with my fathers, in the hollow of the rock in the field of Ephron the Hittite,

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 30
text: In the rock in the field of Machpelah, near Mamre in the land of Canaan, which Abraham got from Ephron the Hittite, to be his resting-place.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 31
text: There Abraham and Sarah his wife were put to rest, and there they put Isaac and Rebekah his wife, and there I put Leah to rest.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 32
text: In the rock in the field which was got for a price from the people of Heth.

title: Genesis Chapter 49 Verse 33
text: And when Jacob had come to the end of these words to his sons, stretching himself on his bed, he gave up his spirit, and went the way of his people.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 1
text: And Joseph put his head down on his father's face, weeping and kissing him.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 2
text: And Joseph gave orders to his servants who had the necessary knowledge, to make his father's body ready, folding it in linen with spices, and they did so.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 3
text: And the forty days needed for making the body ready went by: and there was weeping for him among the Egyptians for seventy days.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 4
text: And when the days of weeping for him were past, Joseph said to the servants of Pharaoh, If now you have love for me, say these words to Pharaoh:

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 5
text: My father made me take an oath, saying, When I am dead, put me to rest in the place I have made ready for myself in the land of Canaan. So now let me go and put my father in his last resting-place, and I will come back again.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 6
text: And Pharaoh said, Go up and put your father to rest, as you gave your oath to him.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 7
text: So Joseph went up to put his father in his last resting-place; and with him went all the servants of Pharaoh, and the chief men of his house and all the chiefs of the land of Egypt,

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 8
text: And all the family of Joseph, and his brothers and his father's people: only their little ones and their flocks and herds they did not take with them from the land of Goshen.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 9
text: And carriages went up with him and horsemen, a great army.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 10
text: And they came to the grain-floor of Atad on the other side of Jordan, and there they gave the last honours to Jacob, with great and bitter sorrow, weeping for their father for seven days.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 11
text: And when the people of the land, the people of Canaan, at the grain-floor of Atad, saw their grief, they said, Great is the grief of the Egyptians: so the place was named Abel-mizraim, on the other side of Jordan.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 12
text: So his sons did as he had given them orders to do:

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 13
text: For they took him into the land of Canaan and put him to rest in the hollow rock in the field of Machpelah, which Abraham got with the field, for a resting-place, from Ephron the Hittite at Mamre.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 14
text: And when his father had been put to rest, Joseph and his brothers and all who had gone with him, went back to Egypt.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 15
text: Now after the death of their father, Joseph's brothers said to themselves, It may be that Joseph's heart will be turned against us, and he will give us punishment for all the evil which we did to him.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 16
text: So they sent word to Joseph, saying, Your father, before his death, gave us orders, saying,

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 17
text: You are to say to Joseph, Let the wrongdoing of your brothers be overlooked, and the evil they did to you: now, if it is your pleasure, let the sin of the servants of your father's God have forgiveness. And at these words, Joseph was overcome with weeping.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 18
text: Then his brothers went, and falling at his feet, said, Truly, we are your servants.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 19
text: And Joseph said, Have no fear: am I in the place of God?

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 20
text: As for you, it was in your mind to do me evil, but God has given a happy outcome, the salvation of numbers of people, as you see today.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 21
text: So now, have no fear: for I will take care of you and your little ones. So he gave them comfort with kind words.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 22
text: Now Joseph and all his father's family went on living in Egypt: and the years of Joseph's life were a hundred and ten.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 23
text: And Joseph saw Ephraim's children of the third generation: and the children of Machir, the son of Manasseh, came to birth on Joseph's knees.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 24
text: Then Joseph said to his brothers, The time of my death has come; but God will keep you in mind and take you out of this land into the land which he gave by his oath to Abraham and Isaac and Jacob.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 25
text: Then Joseph made the children of Israel take an oath, saying, God will certainly give effect to his word, and you are to take my bones away from here.

title: Genesis Chapter 50 Verse 26
text: So Joseph came to his death, being a hundred and ten years old: and they made his body ready, and he was put in a chest in Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Now these are the names of the sons of Israel who came into Egypt; every man and his family came with Jacob.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah;

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin;

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Dan and Naphtali, Gad and Asher.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: All the offspring of Jacob were seventy persons: and Joseph had come to Egypt before them.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: Then Joseph came to his end, and all his brothers, and all that generation.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And the children of Israel were fertile, increasing very greatly in numbers and in power; and the land was full of them.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Now a new king came to power in Egypt, who had no knowledge of Joseph.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And he said to his people, See, the people of Israel are greater in number and in power than we are:

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Let us take care for fear that their numbers may become even greater, and if there is a war, they may be joined with those who are against us, and make an attack on us, and go up out of the land.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: So they put overseers of forced work over them, in order to make their strength less by the weight of their work. And they made store-towns for Pharaoh, Pithom and Raamses.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: But the more cruel they were to them, the more their number increased, till all the land was full of them. And the children of Israel were hated by the Egyptians.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And they gave the children of Israel even harder work to do:

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And made their lives bitter with hard work, making building-material and bricks, and doing all sorts of work in the fields under the hardest conditions.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And the king of Egypt said to the Hebrew women who gave help at the time of childbirth (the name of the one was Shiphrah and the name of the other Puah),

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: When you are looking after the Hebrew women in childbirth, if it is a son you are to put him to death; but if it is a daughter, she may go on living.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: But the women had the fear of God, and did not do as the king of Egypt said, but let the male children go on living.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And the king of Egypt sent for the women, and said to them, Why have you done this, and let the male children go on living?

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And they said to Pharaoh, Because the Hebrew women are not like the Egyptian women, for they are strong, and the birth takes place before we come to them.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: And the blessing of God was on these women: and the people were increased in number and became very strong.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: And because the women who took care of the Hebrew mothers had the fear of God, he gave them families.

title: Exodus Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And Pharaoh gave orders to all his people, saying, Every son who comes to birth is to be put into the river, but every daughter may go on living.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Now a man of the house of Levi took as his wife a daughter of Levi.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And she became with child and gave birth to a Son; and when she saw that he was a beautiful child, she kept him secretly for three months.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And when she was no longer able to keep him secret, she made him a basket out of the stems of water-plants, pasting sticky earth over it to keep the water out; and placing the baby in it she put it among the plants by the edge of the Nile.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And his sister took her place at a distance to see what would become of him.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: Now Pharaoh's daughter came down to the Nile to take a bath, while her women were walking by the riverside; and she saw the basket among the river-plants, and sent her servant-girl to get it.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: And opening it, she saw the child, and he was crying. And she had pity on him, and said, This is one of the Hebrews' children.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: Then his sister said to Pharaoh's daughter, May I go and get you one of the Hebrew women to give him the breast?

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And Pharaoh's daughter said to her, Go. And the girl went and got the child's mother.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And Pharaoh's daughter said to her, Take the child away and give it milk for me, and I will give you payment. And the woman took the child and gave it milk at her breast.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And when the child was older, she took him to Pharaoh's daughter and he became her son, and she gave him the name Moses, Because, she said, I took him out of the water.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: Now when Moses had become a man, one day he went out to his people and saw how hard their work was; and he saw an Egyptian giving blows to a Hebrew, one of his people.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And turning this way and that, and seeing no one, he put the Egyptian to death, covering his body with sand.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And he went out the day after and saw two of the Hebrews fighting: and he said to him who was in the wrong, Why are you fighting your brother?

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And he said, Who made you a ruler and a judge over us? are you going to put me to death as you did the Egyptian? And Moses was in fear, and said, It is clear that the thing has come to light.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: Now when Pharaoh had news of this, he would have put Moses to death. But Moses went in flight from Pharaoh into the land of Midian: and he took his seat by a water-spring.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters: and they came to get water for their father's flock.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: And the keepers of the sheep came up and were driving them away; but Moses got up and came to their help, watering their flock for them.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And when they came to Reuel their father, he said, How is it that you have come back so quickly today?

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And they said, An Egyptian came to our help against the keepers of sheep and got water for us and gave it to the flock.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: And he said to his daughters, Where is he? why have you let the man go? make him come in and give him a meal.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: And Moses was happy to go on living with the man; and he gave his daughter Zipporah to Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: And she gave birth to a son, to whom he gave the name Gershom: for he said, I have been living in a strange land.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: Now after a long time the king of Egypt came to his end: and the children of Israel were crying in their grief under the weight of their work, and their cry for help came to the ears of God.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: And at the sound of their weeping the agreement which God had made with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob came to his mind.

title: Exodus Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: And God's eyes were turned to the children of Israel and he gave them the knowledge of himself.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Now Moses was looking after the flock of Jethro, his father-in-law, the priest of Midian: and he took the flock to the back of the waste land and came to Horeb, the mountain of God.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And the angel of the Lord was seen by him in a flame of fire coming out of a thorn-tree: and he saw that the tree was on fire, but it was not burned up.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: And Moses said, I will go and see this strange thing, why the tree is not burned up,

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And when the Lord saw him turning to one side to see, God said his name out of the tree, crying, Moses, Moses. And he said, Here am I.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And he said, Do not come near: take off your shoes from your feet, for the place where you are is holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And he said, I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. And Moses kept his face covered for fear of looking on God.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And God said, Truly, I have seen the grief of my people in Egypt, and their cry because of their cruel masters has come to my ears; for I have knowledge of their sorrows;

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And I have come down to take them out of the hands of the Egyptians, guiding them out of that land into a good land and wide, into a land flowing with milk and honey; into the place of the Canaanite and the Hittite and the Amorite and the Perizzite and the Hivite and the Jebusite.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: For now, truly, the cry of the children of Israel has come to me, and I have seen the cruel behaviour of the Egyptians to them.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: Come, then, and I will send you to Pharaoh, so that you may take my people, the children of Israel, out of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And Moses said to God, Who am I to go to Pharaoh and take the children of Israel out of Egypt?

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: And he said, Truly I will be with you; and this will be the sign to you that I have sent you: when you have taken the children of Israel out of Egypt, you will give worship to God on this mountain.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And Moses said to God, When I come to the children of Israel and say to them, The God of your fathers has sent me to you: and they say to me, What is his name? what am I to say to them?

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And God said to him, I AM WHAT I AM: and he said, Say to the children of Israel, I AM has sent me to you.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And God went on to say to Moses, Say to the children of Israel, The Lord, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, has sent me to you: this is my name for ever, and this is my sign to all generations.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Go and get together the chiefs of the children of Israel, and say to them, The Lord, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, has been seen by me, and has said, Truly I have taken up your cause, because of what is done to you in Egypt;

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And I have said, I will take you up out of the sorrows of Egypt into the land of the Canaanite and the Hittite and the Amorite and the Perizzite and the Hivite and the Jebusite, into a land flowing with milk and honey.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: And they will give ear to your voice: and you, with the chiefs of Israel, will go to Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, and say to him, The Lord, the God of the Hebrews, has come to us: let us then go three days' journey into the waste land to make an offering to the Lord our God.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: And I am certain that the king of Egypt will not let you go without being forced.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: But I will put out my hand and overcome Egypt with all the wonders which I will do among them: and after that he will let you go.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: And I will give this people grace in the eyes of the Egyptians, so that when you go out you will go out with your hands full.

title: Exodus Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: For every woman will get from her neighbour and from the woman living in her house, ornaments of silver and gold, and clothing; and you will put them on your sons and your daughters; you will take the best of their goods from the Egyptians.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And Moses, answering, said, It is certain that they will not have faith in me or give ear to my voice; for they will say, You have not seen the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And the Lord said to him, What is that in your hand? And he said, A rod.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And he said, Put it down on the earth. And he put it down on the earth and it became a snake; and Moses went running from it.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Put out your hand and take it by the tail: (and he put out his hand and took a grip of it and it became a rod in his hand:)

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: So that they may be certain that the Lord, the God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, has been seen by you.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: Then the Lord said to him again, Put your hand inside your clothing. And he put his hand inside his robe: and when he took it out it was like the hand of a leper, as white as snow.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And he said, Put your hand inside your robe again. (And he put his hand into his robe again, and when he took it out he saw that it had become like his other flesh.)

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And if they do not have faith in you or give ear to the voice of the first sign, they will have faith in the second sign.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And if they have no faith even in these two signs and will not give ear to your voice, then you are to take the water of the Nile and put it on the dry land: and the water you take out of the river will become blood on the dry land.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: And Moses said to the Lord, O Lord, I am not a man of words; I have never been so, and am not now, even after what you have said to your servant: for talking is hard for me, and I am slow of tongue.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And the Lord said to him, Who has made man's mouth? who takes away a man's voice or hearing, or makes him seeing or blind? Is it not I, the Lord?

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: So go now, and I will be with your mouth, teaching you what to say.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And he said, O Lord, send, if you will, by the hand of anyone whom it seems good to you to send.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: And the Lord was angry with Moses, and said, Is there not Aaron, your brother, the Levite? To my knowledge he is good at talking. And now he is coming out to you: and when he sees you he will be glad in his heart.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: Let him give ear to your voice, and you will put my words in his mouth; and I will be with your mouth and with his, teaching you what you have to do.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: And he will do the talking for you to the people: he will be to you as a mouth and you will be to him as God.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: And take in your hand this rod with which you will do the signs.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: And Moses went back to Jethro, his father-in-law, and said to him, Let me go back now to my relations in Egypt and see if they are still living. And Jethro said to Moses, Go in peace.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: And the Lord said to Moses in Midian, Go back to Egypt, for all the men are dead who were attempting to take your life.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: And Moses took his wife and his sons and put them on an ass and went back to the land of Egypt: and he took the rod of God in his hand.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: And the Lord said to Moses, When you go back to Egypt, see that you do before Pharaoh all the wonders which I have given you power to do: but I will make his heart hard and he will not let the people go.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: And you are to say to Pharaoh, The Lord says, Israel is the first of my sons:

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: And I said to you, Let my son go, so that he may give me worship; and you did not let him go: so now I will put the first of your sons to death.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: Now on the journey, at the night's resting-place, the Lord came in his way and would have put him to death.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: Then Zipporah took a sharp stone, and cutting off the skin of her son's private parts, and touching his feet with it, she said, Truly you are a husband of blood to me.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: So he let him go. Then she said, You are a husband of blood because of the circumcision.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 27
text: And the Lord said to Aaron, Go into the waste land and you will see Moses. So he went and came across Moses at the mountain of God, and gave him a kiss.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 28
text: And Moses gave Aaron an account of all the words of the Lord which he had sent him to say, and of all the signs which he had given him orders to do.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 29
text: Then Moses and Aaron went and got together all the chiefs of the children of Israel:

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 30
text: And Aaron said to them all the words the Lord had said to Moses, and did the signs before all the people.

title: Exodus Chapter 4 Verse 31
text: And the people had faith in them; and hearing that the Lord had taken up the cause of the children of Israel and had seen their troubles, with bent heads they gave him worship.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: And after that, Moses and Aaron came to Pharaoh, and said, The Lord, the God of Israel, says, Let my people go so that they may keep a feast to me in the waste land.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: And Pharaoh said, Who is the Lord, to whose voice I am to give ear and let Israel go? I have no knowledge of the Lord and I will not let Israel go.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: And they said, The God of the Hebrews has come to us: let us then go three days' journey into the waste land to make an offering to the Lord our God, so that he may not send death on us by disease or the sword.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: And the king of Egypt said to them, Why do you, Moses and Aaron, take the people away from their work? get back to your work.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: And Pharaoh said, Truly, the people of the land are increasing in number, and you are keeping them back from their work.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: The same day Pharaoh gave orders to the overseers and those who were responsible for the work, saying,

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: Give these men no more dry stems for their brick-making as you have been doing; let them go and get the material for themselves.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: But see that they make the same number of bricks as before, and no less: for they have no love for work; and so they are crying out and saying, Let us go and make an offering to our God.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: Give the men harder work, and see that they do it; let them not give attention to false words.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And the overseers of the people and their responsible men went out and said to the people, Pharaoh says, I will give you no more dry stems.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: Go yourselves and get dry stems wherever you are able; for your work is not to be any less.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: So the people were sent in all directions through the land of Egypt to get dry grass for stems.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: And the overseers went on driving them and saying, Do your full day's work as before when there were dry stems for you.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: And the responsible men of the children of Israel, whom Pharaoh's overseers had put over them, were given blows, and they said to them, Why have you not done your regular work, in making bricks as before?

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: Then the responsible men of the children of Israel came to Pharaoh, protesting and saying, Why are you acting in this way to your servants?

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: They give us no dry stems and they say to us, Make bricks: and they give your servants blows; but it is your people who are in the wrong.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: But he said, You have no love for work: that is why you say, Let us go and make an offering to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: Go now, get back to your work; no dry stems will be given to you, but you are to make the full number of bricks.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: Then the responsible men of the children of Israel saw that they were purposing evil when they said, The number of bricks which you have to make every day will be no less than before.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: And they came face to face with Moses and Aaron, who were in their way when they came out from Pharaoh:

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: And they said to them, May the Lord take note of you and be your judge; for you have given Pharaoh and his servants a bad opinion of us, putting a sword in their hands for our destruction.

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: And Moses went back to the Lord and said, Lord, why have you done evil to this people? why have you sent me?

title: Exodus Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: For from the time when I came to Pharaoh to put your words before him, he has done evil to this people, and you have given them no help.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Now you will see what I am about to do to Pharaoh; for by a strong hand he will be forced to let them go, driving them out of his land because of my outstretched arm.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: And God said to Moses, I am Yahweh:

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: I let myself be seen by Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, as God, the Ruler of all; but they had no knowledge of my name Yahweh.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: And I made an agreement with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their wanderings.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And truly my ears are open to the cry of the children of Israel whom the Egyptians keep under their yoke; and I have kept in mind my agreement.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: Say then to the children of Israel, I am Yahweh, and I will take you out from under the yoke of the Egyptians, and make you safe from their power, and will make you free by the strength of my arm after great punishments.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And I will take you to be my people and I will be your God; and you will be certain that I am the Lord your God, who takes you out from under the yoke of the Egyptians.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: And I will be your guide into the land which I made an oath to give to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob; and I will give it to you for your heritage: I am Yahweh.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: And Moses said these words to the children of Israel, but they gave no attention to him, because of the grief of their spirit and the cruel weight of their work.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: Go in and say to Pharaoh, king of Egypt, that he is to let the children of Israel go out of his land.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And Moses, answering the Lord, said, See, the children of Israel will not give ear to me; how then will Pharaoh give ear to me, whose lips are unclean?

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And the word of the Lord came to Moses and Aaron, with orders for the children of Israel and for Pharaoh, king of Egypt, to take the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: These are the heads of their fathers' families: the sons of Reuben the oldest son of Israel: Hanoch and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi: these are the families of Reuben.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: And the sons of Simeon: Jemuel and Jamin and Ohad and Jachin and Zohar and Shaul, the son of a woman of Canaan: these are the families of Simeon.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: And these are the names of the sons of Levi in the order of their generations: Gershon and Kohath and Merari: and the years of Levi's life were a hundred and thirty-seven.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: The sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei, in the order of their families.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: And the sons of Kohath: Amram and Izhar and Hebron and Uzziel: and the years of Kohath's life were a hundred and thirty-three.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: And the sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi: these are the families of the Levites, in the order of their generations.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: And Amram took Jochebed, his father's sister, as wife; and she gave birth to Aaron and Moses: and the years of Amram's life were a hundred and thirty-seven.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: And the sons of Izhar: Korah and Nepheg and Zichri.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: And the sons of Uzziel: Mishael and Elzaphan and Sithri.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: And Aaron took as his wife Elisheba, the daughter of Amminadab, the sister of Nahshon; and she gave birth to Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: And the sons of Korah: Assir and Elkanah and Abiasaph: these are the families of the Korahites.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: And Eleazar, Aaron's son, took as his wife one of the daughters of Putiel; and she gave birth to Phinehas. These are the heads of the families of the Levites, in the order of their families.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: These are the same Aaron and Moses to whom the Lord said, Take the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt in their armies.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: These are the men who gave orders to Pharaoh to let the children of Israel go out of Egypt: these are the same Moses and Aaron.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 28
text: And on the day when the word of the Lord came to Moses in the land of Egypt,

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 29
text: The Lord said to Moses, I am the Lord: say to Pharaoh, king of Egypt, everything I am saying to you.

title: Exodus Chapter 6 Verse 30
text: And Moses said to the Lord, My lips are unclean; how is it possible that Pharaoh will give me a hearing?

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses, See I have made you a god to Pharaoh, and Aaron your brother will be your prophet.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: Say whatever I give you orders to say: and Aaron your brother will give word to Pharaoh to let the children of Israel go out of his land.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: And I will make Pharaoh's heart hard, and my signs and wonders will be increased in the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: But Pharaoh will not give ear to you, and I will put my hand on Egypt, and take my armies, my people, the children of Israel, out of Egypt, after great punishments.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: And the Egyptians will see that I am the Lord, when my hand is stretched out over Egypt, and I take the children of Israel out from among them.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: And Moses and Aaron did so: as the Lord gave them orders, so they did.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: And Moses was eighty years old, and Aaron eighty-three years old, when they gave the Lord's word to Pharaoh.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: If Pharaoh says to you, Let me see a wonder: then say to Aaron, Take your rod and put it down on the earth before Pharaoh so that it may become a snake.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: Then Moses and Aaron went in to Pharaoh and they did as the Lord had said: and Aaron put his rod down on the earth before Pharaoh and his servants, and it became a snake.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: Then Pharaoh sent for the wise men and the wonder-workers, and they, the wonder-workers of Egypt, did the same with their secret arts.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: For every one of them put down his rod on the earth, and they became snakes: but Aaron's rod made a meal of their rods.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: But Pharaoh's heart was made hard, and he did not give ear to them, as the Lord had said.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron, Pharaoh's heart is unchanged; he will not let the people go.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: Go to Pharaoh in the morning; when he goes out to the water, you will be waiting for him by the edge of the Nile, with the rod which was turned into a snake in your hand;

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: And say to him, The Lord, the God of the Hebrews, has sent me to you, saying, Let my people go so that they may give me worship in the waste land; but up to now you have not given ear to his words.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: So the Lord says, By this you may be certain that I am the Lord; see, by the touch of this rod in my hand the waters of the Nile will be turned to blood;

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: And the fish in the Nile will come to destruction, and the river will send up a bad smell, and the Egyptians will not be able, for disgust, to make use of the water of the Nile for drinking.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: And the Lord said, Say to Aaron, Let the rod in your hand be stretched out over the waters of Egypt, and over the rivers and the streams and the pools, and over every stretch of water, so that they may be turned to blood; and there will be blood through all the land of Egypt, in vessels of wood and in vessels of stone.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: And Moses and Aaron did as the Lord had said; and when his rod had been lifted up and stretched out over the waters of the Nile before the eyes of Pharaoh and his servants, all the water in the Nile was turned to blood;

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: And the fish in the Nile came to destruction, and a bad smell went up from the river, and the Egyptians were not able to make use of the water of the Nile for drinking; and there was blood through all the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: And the wonder-workers of Egypt did the same with their secret arts: but Pharaoh's heart was made hard, and he would not give ear to them, as the Lord had said.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: Then Pharaoh went into his house, and did not take even this to heart.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: And all the Egyptians made holes round about the Nile to get drinking-water, for they were not able to make use of the Nile water.

title: Exodus Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: And seven days went past, after the Lord had put his hand on the Nile.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And this is what the Lord said to Moses: Go to Pharaoh and say to him, The Lord says, Let my people go so that they may give me worship.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And if you will not let them go, see, I will send frogs into every part of your land:

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: The Nile will be full of frogs, and they will come up into your house and into your bedrooms and on your bed, and into the houses of your servants and your people, and into your ovens and into your bread-basins.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: The frogs will come up over you and your people and all your servants.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Say to Aaron, Let the rod in your hand be stretched out over the streams and the waterways and the pools, causing frogs to come up on the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: And when Aaron put out his hand over the waters of Egypt, the frogs came up and all the land of Egypt was covered with them.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And the wonder-workers did the same with their secret arts, making frogs come up over the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: Then Pharaoh sent for Moses and Aaron and said, Make prayer to the Lord that he will take away these frogs from me and my people; and I will let the people go and make their offering to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: And Moses said, I will let you have the honour of saying when I am to make prayer for you and your servants and your people, that the frogs may be sent away from you and your houses, and be only in the Nile.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And he said, By tomorrow. And he said, Let it be as you say: so that you may see that there is no other like the Lord our God.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And the frogs will be gone from you and from your houses and from your servants and from your people and will be only in the Nile.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: Then Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh; and Moses made prayer to the Lord about the frogs which he had sent on Pharaoh.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: And the Lord did as Moses said; and there was an end of all the frogs in the houses and in the open spaces and in the fields.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: And they put them together in masses, and a bad smell went up from the land.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: But when Pharaoh saw that there was peace for a time, he made his heart hard and did not give ear to them, as the Lord had said.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Say to Aaron, Let your rod be stretched out over the dust of the earth so that it may become insects through all the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: And they did so; and Aaron, stretching out the rod in his hand, gave a touch to the dust of the earth, and insects came on man and on beast; all the dust of the earth was changed into insects through all the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: And the wonder-workers with their secret arts, attempting to make insects, were unable to do so: and there were insects on man and on beast.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: Then the wonder-workers said to Pharaoh, This is the finger of God: but Pharaoh's heart was hard, and he did not give ear to them, as the Lord had said.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Get up early in the morning and take your place before Pharaoh when he comes out to the water; and say to him, This is what the Lord says: Let my people go to give me worship.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: For if you do not let my people go, see, I will send clouds of flies on you and on your servants and on your people and into their houses; and the houses of the Egyptians and the land where they are will be full of flies.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: And at that time I will make a division between your land and the land of Goshen where my people are, and no flies will be there; so that you may see that I am the Lord over all the earth.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: And I will put a division between my people and your people; tomorrow this sign will be seen.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: And the Lord did so; and great clouds of flies came into the house of Pharaoh and into his servants' houses, and all the land of Egypt was made waste because of the flies.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: And Pharaoh sent for Moses and Aaron and said, Go and make your offering to your God here in the land.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: And Moses said, It is not right to do so; for we make our offerings of that to which the Egyptians give worship; and if we do so before their eyes, certainly we will be stoned.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: But we will go three days' journey into the waste land and make an offering to the Lord our God as he may give us orders.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: Then Pharaoh said, I will let you go to make an offering to the Lord your God in the waste land; but do not go very far away, and make prayer for me.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: And Moses said, When I go out from you I will make prayer to the Lord that the cloud of flies may go away from Pharaoh and from his people and from his servants tomorrow: only let Pharaoh no longer by deceit keep back the people from making their offering to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 30
text: Then Moses went out from Pharaoh and made prayer to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 31
text: And the Lord did as Moses said, and took away the cloud of flies from Pharaoh and from his servants and from his people; not one was to be seen.

title: Exodus Chapter 8 Verse 32
text: But again Pharaoh made his heart hard and did not let the people go.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: Then the Lord said to Moses, Go in to Pharaoh and say to him, This is what the Lord, the God of the Hebrews, says: Let my people go so that they may give me worship.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: For if you will not let them go, but still keep them in your power,

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: Then the hand of the Lord will put on your cattle in the field, on the horses and the asses and the camels, on the herds and the flocks, a very evil disease.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: And the Lord will make a division between the cattle of Israel and the cattle of Egypt; there will be no loss of any of the cattle of Israel.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: And the time was fixed by the Lord, and he said, Tomorrow the Lord will do this thing in the land.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: And on the day after, the Lord did as he had said, causing the death of all the cattle of Egypt, but there was no loss of any of the cattle of Israel.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: And Pharaoh sent and got word that there was no loss of any of the cattle of Israel. But the heart of Pharaoh was hard and he did not let the people go.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And the Lord said to Moses and to Aaron, Take in your hand a little dust from the fire and let Moses send it in a shower up to heaven before the eyes of Pharaoh.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: And it will become small dust over all the land of Egypt, and will be a skin-disease bursting out in wounds on man and beast through all the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: So they took some dust from the fire, and placing themselves before Pharaoh, Moses sent it out in a shower up to heaven; and it became a skin-disease bursting out on man and on beast.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: And the wonder-workers were not able to take their places before Moses, because of the disease; for the disease was on the wonder-workers and on all the Egyptians.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And the Lord made Pharaoh's heart hard, and he would not give ear to them, as the Lord had said.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Get up early in the morning and take your place before Pharaoh, and say to him, This is what the Lord, the God of the Hebrews, says: Let my people go so that they may give me worship.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: For this time I will send all my punishments on yourself and on your servants and on your people; so that you may see that there is no other like me in all the earth.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: For if I had put the full weight of my hand on you and your people, you would have been cut off from the earth:

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: But, for this very reason, I have kept you from destruction, to make clear to you my power, and so that my name may be honoured through all the earth.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: Are you still uplifted in pride against my people so that you will not let them go?

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: Truly, tomorrow about this time I will send down an ice-storm, such as never was in Egypt from its earliest days till now.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: Then send quickly and get in your cattle and all you have from the fields; for if any man or beast in the field has not been put under cover, the ice-storm will come down on them with destruction.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: Then everyone among the servants of Pharaoh who had the fear of the Lord, made his servants and his cattle come quickly into the house:

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: And he who gave no attention to the word of the Lord, kept his servants and his cattle in the field.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Now let your hand be stretched out to heaven so that there may be an ice-storm on all the land of Egypt, on man and on beast and on every plant of the field through all the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: And Moses put out his rod to heaven: and the Lord sent thunder, and an ice-storm, and fire running down on the earth; the Lord sent an ice-storm on the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: So there was an ice-storm with fire running through it, coming down with great force, such as never was in all the land of Egypt from the time when it became a nation.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: And through all the land of Egypt the ice-storm came down on everything which was in the fields, on man and on beast; and every green plant was crushed and every tree of the field broken.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, there was no ice-storm.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: Then Pharaoh sent for Moses and Aaron, and said to them, I have done evil this time: the Lord is upright, and I and my people are sinners.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: Make prayer to the Lord; for there has been enough of these thunderings of God and this ice-storm; and I will let you go and will keep you no longer.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 29
text: And Moses said, When I am gone outside the town, my hands will be stretched out to the Lord; the thunders and the ice-storm will come to an end, so that you may see that the earth is the Lord's.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 30
text: But as for you and your servants, I am certain that even now the fear of the Lord God will not be in your hearts.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 31
text: And the flax and the barley were damaged, for the barley was almost ready to be cut and the flax was in flower.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 32
text: But the rest of the grain-plants were undamaged, for they had not come up.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 33
text: So Moses went out of the town, and stretching out his hands made prayer to God: and the thunders and the ice-storm came to an end; and the fall of rain was stopped.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 34
text: But when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the ice-storm and the thunders were ended, he went on sinning, and made his heart hard, he and his servants.

title: Exodus Chapter 9 Verse 35
text: And the heart of Pharaoh was hard, and he did not let the people go, as the Lord had said by the mouth of Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Go in to Pharaoh: for I have made his heart and the hearts of his servants hard, so that I may let my signs be seen among them:

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: And so that you may be able to give to your son and to your son's son the story of my wonders in Egypt, and the signs which I have done among them; so that you may see that I am the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: Then Moses and Aaron went in to Pharaoh, and said to him, This is what the Lord, the God of the Hebrews, says: How long will you be lifted up in your pride before me? let my people go so that they may give me worship.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: For if you will not let my people go, tomorrow I will send locusts into your land:

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: And the face of the earth will be covered with them, so that you will not be able to see the earth: and they will be the destruction of everything which up to now has not been damaged, everything which was not crushed by the ice-storm, and every tree still living in your fields.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: And your houses will be full of them, and the houses of your servants and of all the Egyptians; it will be worse than anything your fathers have seen or their fathers, from the day when they were living on the earth till this day. And so he went out from Pharaoh.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And Pharaoh's servants said to him, How long is this man to be the cause of evil to us? let the men go so that they may give worship to the Lord their God: are you not awake to Egypt's danger?

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: Then Moses and Aaron came in again before Pharaoh: and he said to them, Go and give worship to the Lord your God: but which of you are going?

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: And Moses said, We will go with our young and our old, with our sons and our daughters, with our flocks and our herds; for we are to keep a feast to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And he said to them, May the Lord be with you, if I will let you and your little ones go! take care, for your purpose clearly is evil.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: Not so; but let your males go and give worship to the Lord, as your desire is. This he said, driving them out from before him.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Let your hand be stretched out over the land of Egypt so that the locusts may come up on the land for the destruction of every green plant in the land, even everything untouched by the ice-storm.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: And Moses' rod was stretched out over the land of Egypt, and the Lord sent an east wind over the land all that day and all the night; and in the morning the locusts came up with the east wind.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: And the locusts went up over all the land of Egypt, resting on every part of the land, in very great numbers; such an army of locusts had never been seen before, and never will be again.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: For all the face of the earth was covered with them, so that the land was black; and every green plant and all the fruit of the trees which was untouched by the ice-storm they took for food: not one green thing, no plant or tree, was to be seen in all the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: Then Pharaoh quickly sent for Moses and Aaron, and said, I have done evil against the Lord your God and against you.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: Let me now have forgiveness for my sin this time only, and make prayer to the Lord your God that he will take away from me this death only.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: So he went out from Pharaoh and made prayer to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: And the Lord sent a very strong west wind, which took up the locusts, driving them into the Red Sea; not one locust was to be seen in any part of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: But the Lord made Pharaoh's heart hard, and he did not let the children of Israel go.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Let your hand be stretched out to heaven, and all the land of Egypt will be dark, so that men will be feeling their way about in the dark.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: And when Moses' hand was stretched out, dark night came over all the land of Egypt for three days;

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: They were not able to see one another, and no one got up from his place for three days: but where the children of Israel were living it was light.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: Then Pharaoh sent for Moses, and said, Go and give worship to the Lord; only let your flocks and your herds be kept here: your little ones may go with you.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: But Moses said, You will have to let us take burned offerings to put before the Lord our God.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: So our cattle will have to go with us, not one may be kept back; for they are needed for the worship of the Lord our God; we have no knowledge what offering we have to give till we come to the place.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: But the Lord made Pharaoh's heart hard, and he would not let them go.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: And Pharaoh said to him, Go away from me, take care that you come not again before me; for the day when you see my face again will be your last.

title: Exodus Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: And Moses said, You say truly; I will not see your face again.

title: Exodus Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses, I will send one more punishment on Pharaoh and on Egypt; after that he will let you go; and when he does let you go, he will not keep one of you back, but will send you out by force.

title: Exodus Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: So go now and give orders to the people that every man and every woman is to get from his or her neighbour ornaments of silver and of gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: And the Lord gave the people grace in the eyes of the Egyptians. For the man Moses was highly honoured in the land of Egypt, by Pharaoh's servants and the people.

title: Exodus Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: And Moses said, This is what the Lord says: About the middle of the night I will go out through Egypt:

title: Exodus Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And death will come to every mother's first male child in all the land of Egypt, from the child of Pharaoh on his seat of power, to the child of the servant-girl crushing the grain; and the first births of all the cattle.

title: Exodus Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And there will be a great cry through all the land of Egypt, such as never has been or will be again.

title: Exodus Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: But against the children of Israel, man or beast, not so much as the tongue of a dog will be moved: so that you may see how the Lord makes a division between Israel and the Egyptians.

title: Exodus Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: And all these your servants will come to me, going down on their faces before me and saying, Go out, and all your people with you: and after that I will go out. And he went away from Pharaoh burning with wrath.

title: Exodus Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Pharaoh will not give ear to you, so that my wonders may be increased in the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: All these wonders Moses and Aaron did before Pharaoh: but the Lord made Pharaoh's heart hard, and he did not let the children of Israel go out of his land.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt,

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: Let this month be to you the first of months, the first month of the year.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: Say to all the children of Israel when they are come together, In the tenth day of this month every man is to take a lamb, by the number of their fathers' families, a lamb for every family:

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: And if the lamb is more than enough for the family, let that family and its nearest neighbour have a lamb between them, taking into account the number of persons and how much food is needed for every man.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: Let your lamb be without a mark, a male in its first year: you may take it from among the sheep or the goats:

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: Keep it till the fourteenth day of the same month, when everyone who is of the children of Israel is to put it to death between sundown and dark.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: Then take some of the blood and put it on the two sides of the door and over the door of the house where the meal is to be taken.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: And let your food that night be the flesh of the lamb, cooked with fire in the oven, together with unleavened bread and bitter-tasting plants.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: Do not take it uncooked or cooked with boiling water, but let it be cooked in the oven; its head with its legs and its inside parts.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: Do not keep any of it till the morning; anything which is not used is to be burned with fire.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: And take your meal dressed as if for a journey, with your shoes on your feet and your sticks in your hands: take it quickly: it is the Lord's Passover.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: For on that night I will go through the land of Egypt, sending death on every first male child, of man and of beast, and judging all the gods of Egypt: I am the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: And the blood will be a sign on the houses where you are: when I see the blood I will go over you, and no evil will come on you for your destruction, when my hand is on the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: And this day is to be kept in your memories: you are to keep it as a feast to the Lord through all your generations, as an order for ever.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: For seven days let your food be unleavened bread; from the first day no leaven is to be seen in your houses: whoever takes bread with leaven in it, from the first till the seventh day, will be cut off from Israel.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: And on the first day there is to be a holy meeting and on the seventh day a holy meeting; no sort of work may be done on those days but only to make ready what is necessary for everyone's food.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: So keep the feast of unleavened bread; for on this very day I have taken your armies out of the land of Egypt: this day, then, is to be kept through all your generations by an order for ever.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: In the first month, from the evening of the fourteenth day, let your food be unleavened bread till the evening of the twenty-first day of the month.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: For seven days no leaven is to be seen in your houses: for whoever takes bread which is leavened will be cut off from the people of Israel, if he is from another country or if he is an Israelite by birth.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: Take nothing which has leaven in it; wherever you are living let your food be unleavened cakes.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: Then Moses sent for the chiefs of Israel, and said to them, See that lambs are marked out for yourselves and your families, and let the Passover lamb be put to death.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: And take some hyssop and put it in the blood in the basin, touching the two sides and the top of the doorway with the blood from the basin; and let not one of you go out of his house till the morning.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: For the Lord will go through the land, sending death on the Egyptians; and when he sees the blood on the two sides and the top of the door, the Lord will go over your door and will not let death come in for your destruction.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: And you are to keep this as an order to you and to your sons for ever.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: And when you come into the land which the Lord will make yours, as he gave his word, you are to keep this act of worship.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 26
text: And when your children say to you, What is the reason of this act of worship?

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 27
text: Then you will say, This is the offering of the Lord's Passover; for he went over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when he sent death on the Egyptians, and kept our families safe. And the people gave worship with bent heads.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 28
text: And the children of Israel went and did so; as the Lord had given orders to Moses and Aaron, so they did.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 29
text: And in the middle of the night the Lord sent death on every first male child in the land of Egypt, from the child of Pharaoh on his seat of power to the child of the prisoner in the prison; and the first births of all the cattle.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 30
text: Then Pharaoh got up in the night, he and all his servants and all the Egyptians; and a great cry went up from Egypt; for there was not a house where someone was not dead.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 31
text: And he sent for Moses and Aaron by night, and said, Get up and go out from among my people, you and the children of Israel; go and give worship to the Lord as you have said.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 32
text: And take your flocks and your herds as you have said, and be gone; and give me your blessing.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 33
text: And the Egyptians were forcing the people on, to get them out of the land quickly; for they said, We are all dead men.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 34
text: And the people took their bread-paste before it was leavened, putting their basins in their clothing on their backs.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 35
text: And the children of Israel had done as Moses had said; and they got from the Egyptians ornaments of silver and of gold, and clothing:

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 36
text: And the Lord had given the people grace in the eyes of the Egyptians so that they gave them whatever was requested. So they took away all their goods from the Egyptians.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 37
text: And the children of Israel made the journey from Rameses to Succoth; there were about six hundred thousand men on foot, as well as children.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 38
text: And a mixed band of people went with them; and flocks and herds in great numbers.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 39
text: And they made unleavened cakes from the paste which they had taken out of Egypt; it was not leavened, for they had been sent out of Egypt so quickly, that they had no time to make any food ready.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 40
text: Now the children of Israel had been living in Egypt for four hundred and thirty years.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 41
text: And at the end of four hundred and thirty years, to the very day, all the armies of the Lord went out of the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 42
text: It is a watch-night before the Lord who took them out of the land of Egypt: this same night is a watch-night to the Lord for all the children of Israel, through all their generations.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 43
text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron, This is the law of the Passover: no man who is not an Israelite is to take of it:

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 44
text: But every man's servant, whom he has got for money, may take of it, when he has had circumcision.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 45
text: A man from a strange country living among you, and a servant working for payment, may not take part in it.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 46
text: It is to be taken in one house; not a bit of the flesh is to be taken out of the house, and no bone of it may be broken.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 47
text: All Israel is to keep the feast.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 48
text: And if a man from another country is living with you, and has a desire to keep the Passover to the Lord, let all the males of his family undergo circumcision, and then let him come near and keep it; for he will then be as one of your people; but no one without circumcision may keep it.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 49
text: The law is the same for him who is an Israelite by birth and for the man from a strange country who is living with you.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 50
text: So the children of Israel did as the Lord gave orders to Moses and Aaron.

title: Exodus Chapter 12 Verse 51
text: And on that very day the Lord took the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their armies.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: Let the first male child of every mother among the children of Israel be kept holy for me, even the first male birth among man or beast; for it is mine.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: And Moses said to the people, Let this day, on which you came out of Egypt, out of your prison-house, be kept for ever in memory; for by the strength of his hand the Lord has taken you out from this place; let no leavened bread be used.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: On this day, in the month Abib, you are going out.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: And it will be that, when the Lord takes you into the land of the Canaanite and the Hittite and the Amorite and the Hivite and the Jebusite, the land which he made an oath to your fathers that he would give you, a land flowing with milk and honey, you will do this act of worship in this month.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: For seven days let your food be unleavened cakes; and on the seventh day there is to be a feast to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: Unleavened cakes are to be your food through all the seven days; let no leavened bread be seen among you, or any leaven, in any part of your land.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: And you will say to your son in that day, It is because of what the Lord did for me when I came out of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: And this will be for a sign to you on your hand and for a mark on your brow, so that the law of the Lord may be in your mouth: for with a strong hand the Lord took you out of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: So let this order be kept, at the right time, from year to year.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: And when the Lord takes you into the land of Canaan, as he made his oath to you and to your fathers, and gives it to you,

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: You are to put on one side for the Lord every mother's first male child, the first-fruit of her body, and the first young one of every beast; every male is holy to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: And for the young of an ass you may give a lamb in payment, or if you will not make payment for it, its neck is to be broken; but for all the first sons among your children, let payment be made.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: And when your son says to you in time to come, What is the reason for this? say to him, By the strength of his hand the Lord took us out of Egypt, out of the prison-house:

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: And when Pharaoh made his heart hard and would not let us go, the Lord sent death on all the first sons in Egypt, of man and of beast: and so every first male who comes to birth is offered to the Lord; but for all the first of my sons I give a price.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: And this will be for a sign on your hand and for a mark on your brow: for by the strength of his hand the Lord took us out of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: Now after Pharaoh had let the people go, God did not take them through the land of the Philistines, though that was near: for God said, If the people see war, they may have a change of heart and go back to Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: But God took the people round by the waste land near the Red Sea: and the children of Israel went up in fighting order out of the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him, for Joseph had made the children of Israel take an oath, saying, God will certainly keep you in mind; and you are to take my bones away with you.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: Then they went on their journey from Succoth, and put up their tents in Etham at the edge of the waste land.

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: And the Lord went before them by day in a pillar of cloud, guiding them on their way; and by night in a pillar of fire to give them light: so that they were able to go on day and night:

title: Exodus Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: The pillar of cloud went ever before them by day, and the pillar of fire by night.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: Give orders to the children of Israel to go back and put up their tents before Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, in front of Baal-zephon, opposite to which you are to put up your tents by the sea.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: And Pharaoh will say of the children of Israel, They are wandering without direction, they are shut in by the waste land.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: And I will make Pharaoh's heart hard, and he will come after them and I will be honoured over Pharaoh and all his army, so that the Egyptians may see that I am the Lord. And they did so.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: And word came to Pharaoh of the flight of the people: and the feeling of Pharaoh and of his servants about the people was changed, and they said, Why have we let Israel go, so that they will do no more work for us?

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: So he had his war-carriage made ready and took his people with him:

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: And he took six hundred carriages, all the carriages of Egypt, and captains over all of them.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: And the Lord made the heart of Pharaoh hard, and he went after the children of Israel: for the children of Israel had gone out without fear.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 9
