text: But the Egyptians went after them, all the horses and carriages of Pharaoh, and his horsemen, and his army, and overtook them in their tents by the sea, by Pihahiroth, before Baal-zephon.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: And when Pharaoh came near, the children of Israel, lifting up their eyes, saw the Egyptians coming after them, and were full of fear; and their cry went up to God.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: And they said to Moses, Was there no resting-place for the dead in Egypt, that you have taken us away to come to our death in the waste land? why have you taken us out of Egypt?

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: Did we not say to you in Egypt, Let us be as we are, working for the Egyptians? for it is better to be the servants of the Egyptians than to come to our death in the waste land.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: But Moses said, Keep where you are and have no fear; now you will see the salvation of the Lord which he will give you today; for the Egyptians whom you see today you will never see again.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: The Lord will make war for you, you have only to keep quiet.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Why are you crying out to me? give the children of Israel the order to go forward.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: And let your rod be lifted up and your hand stretched out over the sea, and it will be parted in two; and the children of Israel will go through on dry land.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: And I will make the heart of the Egyptians hard, and they will go in after them: and I will be honoured over Pharaoh and over his army, his war-carriages, and his horsemen.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: And the Egyptians will see that I am the Lord, when I get honour over Pharaoh and his war-carriages and his horsemen.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: Then the angel of God, who had been before the tents of Israel, took his place at their back; and the pillar of cloud, moving from before them, came to rest at their back:

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: And it came between the army of Egypt and the army of Israel; and there was a dark cloud between them, and they went on through the night; but the one army came no nearer to the other all the night.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: And when Moses' hand was stretched out over the sea, the Lord with a strong east wind made the sea go back all night, and the waters were parted in two and the sea became dry land.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: And the children of Israel went through the sea on dry land: and the waters were a wall on their right side and on their left.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: Then the Egyptians went after them into the middle of the sea, all Pharaoh's horses and his war-carriages and his horsemen.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: And in the morning watch, the Lord, looking out on the armies of the Egyptians from the pillar of fire and cloud, sent trouble on the army of the Egyptians;

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: And made the wheels of their war-carriages stiff, so that they had hard work driving them: so the Egyptians said, Let us go in flight from before the face of Israel, for the Lord is fighting for them against the Egyptians.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Let your hand be stretched out over the sea, and the waters will come back again on the Egyptians, and on their war-carriages and on their horsemen.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: And when Moses' hand was stretched out over the sea, at dawn the sea came flowing back, meeting the Egyptians in their flight, and the Lord sent destruction on the Egyptians in the middle of the sea.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: And the waters came back, covering the war-carriages and the horsemen and all the army of Pharaoh which went after them into the middle of the sea; not one of them was to be seen.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 29
text: But the children of Israel went through the sea walking on dry land, and the waters were a wall on their right side and on their left.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 30
text: So that day the Lord gave Israel salvation from the hands of the Egyptians; and Israel saw the Egyptians dead on the sea's edge.

title: Exodus Chapter 14 Verse 31
text: And Israel saw the great work which the Lord had done against the Egyptians, and the fear of the Lord came on the people and they had faith in the Lord and in his servant Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: Then Moses and the children of Israel made this song to the Lord, and said, I will make a song to the Lord, for he is lifted up in glory: the horse and the horseman he has sent down into the sea.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: The Lord is my strength and my strong helper, he has become my salvation: he is my God and I will give him praise; my father's God and I will give him glory.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: The Lord is a man of war: the Lord is his name.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: Pharaoh's war-carriages and his army he has sent down into the sea: the best of his captains have gone down into the Red Sea.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: They were covered by the deep waters: like a stone they went down under the waves.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: Full of glory, O Lord, is the power of your right hand; by your right hand those who came against you are broken.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: When you are lifted up in power, all those who come against you are crushed: when you send out your wrath, they are burned up like dry grass.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: By your breath the waves were massed together, the flowing waters were lifted up like a pillar; the deep waters became solid in the heart of the sea.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: Egypt said, I will go after them, I will overtake, I will make division of their goods: my desire will have its way with them; my sword will be uncovered, my hand will send destruction on them.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: You sent your wind and the sea came over them: they went down like lead into the great waters.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: Who is like you, O Lord, among the gods? who is like you, in holy glory, to be praised with fear, doing wonders?

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: When your right hand was stretched out, the mouth of the earth was open for them.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: In your mercy you went before the people whom you have made yours; guiding them in your strength to your holy place.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: Hearing of you the peoples were shaking in fear: the people of Philistia were gripped with pain.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: The chiefs of Edom were troubled in heart; the strong men of Moab were in the grip of fear: all the people of Canaan became like water.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: Fear and grief came on them; by the strength of your arm they were turned to stone; till your people went over, O Lord, till the people went over whom you have made yours.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: You will take them in, planting them in the mountain of your heritage, the place, O Lord, where you have made your house, the holy place, O Lord, the building of your hands.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: The Lord is King for ever and ever.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: For the horses of Pharaoh, with his war-carriages and his horsemen, went into the sea, and the Lord sent the waters of the sea back over them; but the children of Israel went through the sea on dry land.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: And Miriam, the woman prophet, the sister of Aaron, took an instrument of music in her hand; and all the women went after her with music and dances.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: And Miriam, answering, said, Make a song to the Lord, for he is lifted up in glory; the horse and the horseman he has sent into the sea.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: Then Moses took Israel forward from the Red Sea, and they went out into the waste land of Shur; and for three days they were in the waste land where there was no water.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: And when they came to Marah, the water was no good for drinking, for the waters of Marah were bitter, which is why it was named Marah.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: And the people, crying out against Moses, said, What are we to have for drink?

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: And in answer to his prayer, the Lord made him see a tree, and when he put it into the water, the water was made sweet. There he gave them a law and an order, testing them;

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: And he said, If with all your heart you will give attention to the voice of the Lord your God, and do what is right in his eyes, giving ear to his orders and keeping his laws, I will not put on you any of the diseases which I put on the Egyptians: for I am the Lord your life-giver.

title: Exodus Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: And they came to Elim where there were twelve water-springs and seventy palm-trees: and they put up their tents there by the waters.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: And they went on their way from Elim, and all the children of Israel came into the waste land of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after they went out of the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: And all the children of Israel were crying out against Moses and Aaron in the waste land:

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: And the children of Israel said to them, It would have been better for the Lord to have put us to death in the land of Egypt, where we were seated by the flesh-pots and had bread enough for our needs; for you have taken us out to this waste of sand, to put all this people to death through need of food.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: Then the Lord said to Moses, See, I will send down bread from heaven for you; and the people will go out every day and get enough for the day's needs; so that I may put them to the test to see if they will keep my laws or not.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: And on the sixth day they are to make ready what they get in, and it will be twice as much as they get on the other days.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: And Moses and Aaron said to all the children of Israel, This evening it will be clear to you that it is the Lord who has taken you out of the land of Egypt:

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: And in the morning you will see the glory of the Lord; for your angry words against the Lord have come to his ears: and what are we that you are crying out against us?

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: And Moses said, The Lord will give you meat for your food at evening, and in the morning bread in full measure; for your outcry against the Lord has come to his ears: for what are we? your outcry is not against us but against the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: And Moses said to Aaron, Say to all the people of Israel, Come near before the Lord for he has given ear to your outcry.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: And while Aaron was talking to the children of Israel, their eyes were turned in the direction of the waste land, and they saw the glory of the Lord shining in the cloud.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: The outcry of the children of Israel has come to my ears: say to them now, At nightfall you will have meat for your food, and in the morning bread in full measure; and you will see that I am the Lord your God.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: And it came about that in the evening little birds came up and the place was covered with them: and in the morning there was dew all round about the tents.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: And when the dew was gone, on the face of the earth was a small round thing, like small drops of ice on the earth.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: And when the children of Israel saw it, they said to one another, What is it? for they had no idea what it was. And Moses said to them, It is the bread which the Lord has given you for your food.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: This is what the Lord has said, Let every man take up as much as he has need of; at the rate of one omer for every person, let every man take as much as is needed for his family.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: And the children of Israel did so, and some took more and some less.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: And when it was measured, he who had taken up much had nothing over, and he who had little had enough; every man had taken what he was able to make use of.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: And Moses said to them, Let nothing be kept till the morning.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: But they gave no attention to Moses, and some of them kept it till the morning and there were worms in it and it had an evil smell: and Moses was angry with them.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: And they took it up morning by morning, every man as he had need: and when the sun was high it was gone.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: And on the sixth day they took up twice as much of the bread, two omers for every person: and all the rulers of the people gave Moses word of it.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: And he said, This is what the Lord has said, Tomorrow is a day of rest, a holy Sabbath to the Lord: what has to be cooked may be cooked; and what is over, put on one side to be kept till the morning.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 24
text: And they kept it till the morning as Moses had said: and no smell came from it, and it had no worms.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 25
text: And Moses said, Make your meal today of what you have, for this day is a Sabbath to the Lord: today you will not get any in the fields.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 26
text: For six days you will get it, but on the seventh day, the Sabbath, there will not be any.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 27
text: But still on the seventh day some of the people went out to get it, and there was not any.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 28
text: And the Lord said to Moses, How long will you go against my orders and my laws?

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 29
text: See, because the Lord has given you the Sabbath, he gives you on the sixth day bread enough for two days; let every man keep where he is; let no man go out of his place on the seventh day.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 30
text: So the people took their rest on the seventh day.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 31
text: And this bread was named manna by Israel: it was white, like a grain seed, and its taste was like cakes made with honey.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 32
text: And Moses said, This is the order which the Lord has given: Let one omer of it be kept for future generations, so that they may see the bread which I gave you for your food in the waste land, when I took you out from the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 33
text: And Moses said to Aaron, Take a pot and put one omer of manna in it, and put it away before the Lord, to be kept for future generations.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 34
text: So Aaron put it away in front of the holy chest to be kept, as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 35
text: And the children of Israel had manna for their food for forty years, till they came to a land with people in it, till they came to the edge of the land of Canaan.

title: Exodus Chapter 16 Verse 36
text: Now an omer is the tenth part of an ephah.

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: And the children of Israel went on from the waste land of Sin, by stages as the Lord gave them orders, and put up their tents in Rephidim: and there was no drinking-water for the people.

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: So the people were angry with Moses, and said, Give us water for drinking. And Moses said, Why are you angry with me? and why do you put God to the test?

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: And the people were in great need of water; and they made an outcry against Moses, and said, Why have you taken us out of Egypt to send death on us and our children and our cattle through need of water?

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: And Moses, crying out to the Lord, said, What am I to do to this people? they are almost ready to put me to death by stoning.

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Go on before the people, and take some of the chiefs of Israel with you, and take in your hand the rod which was stretched out over the Nile, and go.

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: See, I will take my place before you on the rock in Horeb; and when you give the rock a blow, water will come out of it, and the people will have drink. And Moses did so before the eyes of the chiefs of Israel.

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: And he gave that place the name Massah and Meribah, because the children of Israel were angry, and because they put the Lord to the test, saying, Is the Lord with us or not?

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: Then Amalek came and made war on Israel in Rephidim.

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: And Moses said to Joshua, Get together a band of men for us and go out, make war on Amalek: tomorrow I will take my place on the top of the hill with the rod of God in my hand.

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: So Joshua did as Moses said to him, and went to war with Amalek: and Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: Now while Moses' hand was lifted up, Israel was the stronger: but when he let his hand go down, Amalek became the stronger.

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: But Moses' hands became tired; so they put a stone under him and he took his seat on it, Aaron and Hur supporting his hands, one on one side and one on the other; so his hands were kept up without falling till the sun went down.

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: And Joshua overcame Amalek and his people with the sword.

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Make a record of this in a book, so that it may be kept in memory, and say it again in the ears of Joshua: that all memory of Amalek is to be completely uprooted from the earth.

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: Then Moses put up an altar and gave it the name of Yahweh-nissi:

title: Exodus Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: For he said, The Lord has taken his oath that there will be war with Amalek from generation to generation.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: Now news came to Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses' father-in-law, of all God had done for Moses and for Israel his people, and how the Lord had taken Israel out of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: And Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, took Zipporah, Moses' wife, after he had sent her away,

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: And her two sons, one of whom was named Gershom, for he said, I have been living in a strange land:

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: And the name of the other was Eliezer, for he said, The God of my father was my help, and kept me safe from the sword of Pharaoh:

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: And Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, came with his sons and his wife to where Moses had put up his tent in the waste land, by the mountain of God.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: And he said to Moses, I, your father-in-law, have come to you, with your wife and your two sons.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: And Moses went out to his father-in-law, and went down on his face before him and gave him a kiss; and they said to one another, Are you well? and they came into the tent.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: And Moses gave his father-in-law an account of all the Lord had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians because of Israel, and of all the troubles which had come on them by the way, and how the Lord had given them salvation.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: And Jethro was glad because the Lord had been good to Israel, freeing them from the power of the Egyptians.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: And Jethro said, Praise be to the Lord, who has taken you out of the hand of Pharaoh and out of the hand of the Egyptians; freeing the people from the yoke of the Egyptians.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: Now I am certain that the Lord is greater than all gods, for he has overcome them in their pride.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: Then Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, made a burned offering to God: and Aaron came, with the chiefs of Israel, and had a meal with Moses' father-in-law, before God.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: Now on the day after, Moses took his seat to give decisions for the people: and the people were waiting before Moses from morning till evening.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: And when Moses' father-in-law saw all he was doing, he said, What is this you are doing for the people? why are you seated here by yourself, with all the people waiting before you from morning till evening?

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: And Moses said to his father-in-law, Because the people come to me to get directions from God:

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: And if they have any question between themselves, they come to me, and I am judge between a man and his neighbour, and I give them the orders and laws of God.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: And Moses' father-in-law said to him, What you are doing is not good.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: Your strength and that of the people will be completely used up: this work is more than you are able to do by yourself.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: Give ear now to my suggestion, and may God be with you: you are to be the people's representative before God, taking their causes to him:

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: Teaching them his rules and his laws, guiding them in the way they have to go, and making clear to them the work they have to do.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: But for the rest, take from among the people able men, such as have the fear of God, true men hating profits wrongly made; and put such men over them, to be captains of thousands, captains of hundreds and of fifties and of tens;

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: And let them be judges in the causes of the people at all times: and let them put before you all important questions, but in small things let them give decisions themselves: in this way, it will be less hard for you, and they will take the weight off you.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: If you do this, and God gives approval, then you will be able to go on without weariness, and all this people will go to their tents in peace.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: So Moses took note of the words of his father-in-law, and did as he had said.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: And he made selection of able men out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people, captains of thousands, captains of hundreds and of fifties and of tens.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: And they were judges in the causes of the people at all times: the hard questions they put before Moses; but on every small point they gave decisions themselves.

title: Exodus Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: And Moses let his father-in-law go away, and he went back to his land.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: In the third month after the children of Israel went out from Egypt, on the same day, they came into the waste land of Sinai.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: And when they had gone away from Rephidim and had come into the waste land of Sinai, they put up their tents in the waste land before the mountain: there Israel put up its tents.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: And Moses went up to God, and the voice of the Lord came to him from the mountain, saying, Say to the family of Jacob, and give word to the children of Israel:

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: You have seen what I did to the Egyptians, and how I took you, as on eagles' wings, guiding you to myself.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: If now you will truly give ear to my voice and keep my agreement, you will be my special property out of all the peoples: for all the earth is mine:

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: And you will be a kingdom of priests to me, and a holy nation. These are the words which you are to say to the children of Israel.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: And Moses came and sent for the chiefs of the people and put before them all these words which the Lord had given him orders to say.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: And all the people, answering together, said, Whatever the Lord has said we will do. And Moses took back to the Lord the words of the people.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: And the Lord said to Moses, See, I will come to you in a thick cloud, so that what I say to you may come to the ears of the people and they may have belief in you for ever. And Moses gave the Lord word of what the people had said.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Go to the people and make them holy today and tomorrow, and let their clothing be washed.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: And by the third day let them be ready: for on the third day the Lord will come down on Mount Sinai, before the eyes of all the people.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: And let limits be marked out for the people round the mountain, and say to them, Take care not to go up the mountain or near the sides of it: whoever puts his foot on the mountain will certainly come to his death:

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: He is not to be touched by a hand, but is to be stoned or have an arrow put through him; man or beast, he is to be put to death: at the long sounding of a horn they may come up to the mountain.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: Then Moses went down from the mountain to the people, and made the people holy; and their clothing was washed.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: And he said to the people, Be ready by the third day: do not come near a woman.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: And when morning came on the third day, there were thunders and flames and a thick cloud on the mountain, and a horn sounding very loud; and all the people in the tents were shaking with fear.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: And Moses made the people come out of their tents and take their places before God; and they came to the foot of the mountain,

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: And all the mountain of Sinai was smoking, for the Lord had come down on it in fire: and the smoke of it went up like the smoke of a great burning; and all the mountain was shaking.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: And when the sound of the horn became louder and louder, Moses' words were answered by the voice of God.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: Then the Lord came down on to Mount Sinai, to the top of the mountain, and the Lord sent for Moses to come up to the top of the mountain, and Moses went up.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Go down and give the people orders to keep back, for fear that a great number of them, forcing their way through to see the Lord, may come to destruction.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: And let the priests who come near to the Lord make themselves holy, for fear that the Lord may come on them suddenly.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: And Moses said to the Lord, The people will not be able to come up the mountain, for you gave us orders to put limits round the mountain, marking it out and making it holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: And the Lord said to him, Go down, and you and Aaron may come up; but let not the priests and the people make their way through to the Lord, or he will come on them suddenly.

title: Exodus Chapter 19 Verse 25
text: So Moses went down to the people and said this to them.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: And God said all these words:

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: I am the Lord your God who took you out of the land of Egypt, out of the prison-house.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: You are to have no other gods but me.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: You are not to make an image or picture of anything in heaven or on the earth or in the waters under the earth:

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: You may not go down on your faces before them or give them worship: for I, the Lord your God, am a God who will not give his honour to another; and I will send punishment on the children for the wrongdoing of their fathers, to the third and fourth generation of my haters;

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: And I will have mercy through a thousand generations on those who have love for me and keep my laws.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: You are not to make use of the name of the Lord your God for an evil purpose; whoever takes the Lord's name on his lips for an evil purpose will be judged a sinner by the Lord

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: Keep in memory the Sabbath and let it be a holy day.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: On six days do all your work:

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: But the seventh day is a Sabbath to the Lord your God; on that day you are to do no work, you or your son or your daughter, your man-servant or your woman-servant, your cattle or the man from a strange country who is living among you:

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: For in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, and the sea, and everything in them, and he took his rest on the seventh day: for this reason the Lord has given his blessing to the seventh day and made it holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: Give honour to your father and to your mother, so that your life may be long in the land which the Lord your God is giving you.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: Do not put anyone to death without cause.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: Do not be false to the married relation.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: Do not take the property of another.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: Do not give false witness against your neighbour.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: Let not your desire be turned to your neighbour's house, or his wife or his man-servant or his woman-servant or his ox or his ass or anything which is his.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: And all the people were watching the thunderings and the flames and the sound of the horn and the mountain smoking; and when they saw it, they kept far off, shaking with fear.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: And they said to Moses, To your words we will give ear, but let not the voice of God come to our ears, for fear death may come on us.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: And Moses said to the people, Have no fear: for God has come to put you to the test, so that fearing him you may be kept from sin.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: And the people kept their places far off, but Moses went near to the dark cloud where God was.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Say to the children of Israel, You yourselves have seen that my voice has come to you from heaven

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: Gods of silver and gods of gold you are not to make for yourselves.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: Make for me an altar of earth, offering on it your burned offerings and your peace-offerings, your sheep and your oxen: in every place where I have put the memory of my name, I will come to you and give you my blessing.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: And if you make me an altar of stone do not make it of cut stones: for the touch of an instrument will make it unclean.

title: Exodus Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: And do not go up by steps to my altar, for fear that your bodies may be seen uncovered.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: Now these are the laws which you are to put before them.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: If you get a Hebrew servant for money, he is to be your servant for six years, and in the seventh year you are to let him go free without payment.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: If he comes to you by himself, let him go away by himself: if he is married, let his wife go away with him.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: If his master gives him a wife, and he gets sons or daughters by her, the wife and her children will be the property of the master, and the servant is to go away by himself.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: But if the servant says clearly, My master and my wife and children are dear to me; I have no desire to be free:

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: Then his master is to take him to the gods of the house, and at the door, or at its framework, he is to make a hole in his ear with a sharp-pointed instrument; and he will be his servant for ever.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: And if a man gives his daughter for a price to be a servant, she is not to go away free as the men-servants do.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: If she is not pleasing to her master who has taken her for himself, let a payment be made for her so that she may go free; her master has no power to get a price for her and send her to a strange land, because he has been false to her.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: And if he gives her to his son, he is to do everything for her as if she was his daughter.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: And if he takes another woman, her food and clothing and her married rights are not to be less.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: And if he does not do these three things for her, she has the right to go free without payment.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: He who gives a man a death-blow is himself to be put to death.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: But if he had no evil purpose against him, and God gave him into his hand, I will give you a place to which he may go in flight.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: But if a man makes an attack on his neighbour on purpose, to put him to death by deceit, you are to take him from my altar and put him to death.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: Any man who gives a blow to his father or his mother is certainly to be put to death.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: Any man who gets another into his power in order to get a price for him is to be put to death, if you take him in the act.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: Any man cursing his father or his mother is to be put to death.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: If, in a fight, one man gives another a blow with a stone, or with the shut hand, not causing his death, but making him keep in bed;

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: If he is able to get up again and go about with a stick, the other will be let off; only he will have to give him payment for the loss of his time, and see that he is cared for till he is well.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: If a man gives his man-servant or his woman-servant blows with a rod, causing death, he is certainly to undergo punishment.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: But, at the same time, if the servant goes on living for a day or two, the master is not to get punishment, for the servant is his property.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: If men, while fighting, do damage to a woman with child, causing the loss of the child, but no other evil comes to her, the man will have to make payment up to the amount fixed by her husband, in agreement with the decision of the judges.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: But if damage comes to her, let life be given in payment for life,

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: Eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: Burning for burning, wound for wound, blow for blow.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 26
text: If a man gives his man-servant or his woman-servant a blow in the eye, causing its destruction, he is to let him go free on account of the damage to his eye.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 27
text: Or if the loss of a tooth is caused by his blow, he will let him go free on account of his tooth.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 28
text: If an ox comes to be the cause of death to a man or a woman, the ox is to be stoned, and its flesh may not be used for food; but the owner will not be judged responsible.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 29
text: But if the ox has frequently done such damage in the past, and the owner has had word of it and has not kept it under control, so that it has been the cause of the death of a man or woman, not only is the ox to be stoned, but its owner is to be put to death.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 30
text: If a price is put on his life, let him make payment of whatever price is fixed.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 31
text: If the death of a son or of a daughter has been caused, the punishment is to be in agreement with this rule.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 32
text: If the death of a man-servant or of a woman-servant is caused by the ox, the owner is to give their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox is to be stoned.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 33
text: If a man makes a hole in the earth without covering it up, and an ox or an ass dropping into it comes to its death;

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 34
text: The owner of the hole is responsible; he will have to make payment to their owner, but the dead beast will be his.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 35
text: And if one man's ox does damage to another man's ox, causing its death, then the living ox is to be exchanged for money, and division made of the price of it, and of the price of the dead one.

title: Exodus Chapter 21 Verse 36
text: But if it is common knowledge that the ox has frequently done such damage in the past, and its owner has not kept it under control, he will have to give ox for ox; and the dead beast will be his.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: If a man takes without right another man's ox or his sheep, and puts it to death or gets a price for it, he is to give five oxen for an ox, or four sheep for a sheep, in payment: the thief will have to make payment for what he has taken; if he has no money, he himself will have to be exchanged for money, so that payment may be made.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: If a thief is taken in the act of forcing his way into a house, and his death is caused by a blow, the owner of the house is not responsible for his blood.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: But if it is after dawn, he will be responsible.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: If he still has what he had taken, whatever it is, ox or ass or sheep, he is to give twice its value.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: If a man makes a fire in a field or a vine-garden, and lets the fire do damage to another man's field, he is to give of the best produce of his field or his vine-garden to make up for it.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: If there is a fire and the flames get to the thorns at the edge of the field, causing destruction of the cut grain or of the living grain, or of the field, he who made the fire will have to make up for the damage.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: If a man puts money or goods in the care of his neighbour to keep for him, and it is taken from the man's house, if they get the thief, he will have to make payment of twice the value.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: If they do not get the thief, let the master of the house come before the judges and take an oath that he has not put his hand on his neighbour's goods.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: In any question about an ox or an ass or a sheep or clothing, or about the loss of any property which anyone says is his, let the two sides put their cause before God; and he who is judged to be in the wrong is to make payment to his neighbour of twice the value.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: If a man puts an ass or an ox or a sheep or any beast into the keeping of his neighbour, and it comes to death or is damaged or is taken away, without any person seeing it:

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: If he takes his oath before the Lord that he has not put his hand to his neighbour's goods, the owner is to take his word for it and he will not have to make payment for it.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: But if it is taken from him by a thief, he is to make up for the loss of it to its owner.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: But if it has been damaged by a beast, and he is able to make this clear, he will not have to make payment for what was damaged.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: If a man gets from his neighbour the use of one of his beasts, and it is damaged or put to death when the owner is not with it, he will certainly have to make payment for the loss.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: If the owner is with it, he will not have to make payment: if he gave money for the use of it, the loss is covered by the payment.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: If a man takes a virgin, who has not given her word to another man, and has connection with her, he will have to give a bride-price for her to be his wife.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: If her father will not give her to him on any account, he will have to give the regular payment for virgins.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: Any woman using unnatural powers or secret arts is to be put to death.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: Any man who has sex connection with a beast is to be put to death.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: Complete destruction will come on any man who makes offerings to any other god but the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: Do no wrong to a man from a strange country, and do not be hard on him; for you yourselves were living in a strange country, in the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: Do no wrong to a widow, or to a child whose father is dead.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: If you are cruel to them in any way, and their cry comes up to me, I will certainly give ear;

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: And in the heat of my wrath I will put you to death with the sword, so that your wives will be widows and your children without fathers.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 25
text: If you let any of the poor among my people have the use of your money, do not be a hard creditor to him, and do not take interest.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 26
text: If ever you take your neighbour's clothing in exchange for the use of your money, let him have it back before the sun goes down:

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 27
text: For it is the only thing he has for covering his skin; what is he to go to sleep in? and when his cry comes up to me, I will give ear, for my mercy is great.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 28
text: You may not say evil of the judges, or put a curse on the ruler of your people.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 29
text: Do not keep back your offerings from the wealth of your grain and your vines. The first of your sons you are to give to me.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 30
text: In the same way with your oxen and your sheep: for seven days let the young one be with its mother; on the eighth day give it to me.

title: Exodus Chapter 22 Verse 31
text: You are to be holy men to me: the flesh of no animal whose death has been caused by the beasts of the field may be used for your food; it is to be given to the dogs.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: Do not let a false statement go further; do not make an agreement with evil-doers to be a false witness.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: Do not be moved to do wrong by the general opinion, or give the support of your words to a wrong decision:

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: But, on the other hand, do not be turned from what is right in order to give support to a poor man's cause.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: If you come across the ox or the ass of one who is no friend to you wandering from its way, you are to take it back to him.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: If you see the ass of one who has no love for you bent down to the earth under the weight which is put on it, you are to come to its help, even against your desire.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: Let no wrong decisions be given in the poor man's cause.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: Keep yourselves far from any false business; never let the upright or him who has done no wrong be put to death: for I will make the evil-doer responsible for his sin.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: Take no rewards in a cause: for rewards make blind those who have eyes to see, and make the decisions of the upright false.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: Do not be hard on the man from a strange country who is living among you; for you have had experience of the feelings of one who is far from the land of his birth, because you yourselves were living in Egypt, in a strange land.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: For six years put seed into your fields and get in the increase;

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: But in the seventh year let the land have a rest and be unplanted; so that the poor may have food from it: and let the beasts of the field take the rest. Do the same with your vine-gardens and your olive-trees.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: For six days do your work, and on the seventh day keep the Sabbath; so that your ox and your ass may have rest, together with the son of your servant and the man from a strange land living among you.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: Take note of all these things which I have said to you, and let not the names of other gods come into your minds or from your lips.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 14
text: Three times in the year you are to keep a feast to me.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: You are to keep the feast of unleavened bread; for seven days let your bread be without leaven, as I gave you orders, at the regular time in the month Abib (for in it you came out of Egypt); and let no one come before me without an offering:

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: And the feast of the grain-cutting, the first-fruits of your planted fields: and the feast at the start of the year, when you have got in all the fruit from your fields.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 17
text: Three times in the year let all your males come before the Lord God.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 18
text: Do not give the blood of my offering with leavened bread; and do not let the fat of my feast be kept all night till the morning.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 19
text: The best of the first-fruits of your land are to be taken into the house of the Lord your God. The young goat is not to be cooked in its mother's milk.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 20
text: See, I am sending an angel before you, to keep you on your way and to be your guide into the place which I have made ready for you.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 21
text: Give attention to him and give ear to his voice; do not go against him; for your wrongdoing will not be overlooked by him, because my name is in him.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 22
text: But if you truly give ear to his voice, and do whatever I say, then I will be against those who are against you, fighting those who are fighting you.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 23
text: And my angel will go before you, guiding you into the land of the Amorite and the Hittite and the Perizzite and the Canaanite and the Hivite and the Jebusite, and they will be cut off by my hand.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 24
text: Do not go down on your faces and give worship to their gods, or do as they do; but overcome them completely, and let their pillars be broken down.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 25
text: And give worship to the Lord your God, who will send his blessing on your bread and on your water; and I will take all disease away from among you.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 26
text: All your animals will give birth without loss, not one will be without young in all your land; I will give you a full measure of life.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 27
text: I will send my fear before you, putting to flight all the people to whom you come; all those who are against you will go in flight, turning their backs before you.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 28
text: I will send hornets before you, driving out the Hivite and the Canaanite and the Hittite before your face.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 29
text: I will not send them all out in one year, for fear that their land may become waste, and the beasts of the field be increased overmuch against you.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 30
text: Little by little I will send them away before you, till your numbers are increased and you take up your heritage in the land.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 31
text: I will let the limits of your land be from the Red Sea to the sea of the Philistines, and from the waste land to the river Euphrates: for I will give the people of those lands into your power; and you will send them out before you.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 32
text: Make no agreement with them or with their gods.

title: Exodus Chapter 23 Verse 33
text: Let them not go on living in your land, or they will make you do evil against me: for if you give worship to their gods, it will certainly be a cause of sin to you.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: And he said to Moses, Come up to the Lord, you and Aaron, and Nadab and Abihu and seventy of the chiefs of Israel; and give me worship from a distance.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: And Moses only may come near to the Lord; but the others are not to come near, and the people may not come up with them.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: Then Moses came and put before the people all the words of the Lord and his laws: and all the people, answering with one voice, said, Whatever the Lord has said we will do.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: Then Moses put down in writing all the words of the Lord, and he got up early in the morning and made an altar at the foot of the mountain, with twelve pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: And he sent some of the young men of the children of Israel to make burned offerings and peace-offerings of oxen to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: And Moses took half the blood and put it in basins; draining out half of the blood over the altar.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: And he took the book of the agreement, reading it in the hearing of the people: and they said, Everything which the Lord has said we will do, and we will keep his laws.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: Then Moses took the blood and let it come on the people, and said, This blood is the sign of the agreement which the Lord has made with you in these words.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: Then Moses and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the chiefs of Israel went up:

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: And they saw the God of Israel; and under his feet there was, as it seemed, a jewelled floor, clear as the heavens.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: And he put not his hand on the chiefs of the children of Israel: they saw God, and took food and drink.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Come up to me on the mountain, and take your place there: and I will give you the stones on which I have put in writing the law and the orders, so that you may give the people knowledge of them.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: Then Moses and Joshua his servant got up; and Moses went up into the mountain of God.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: And he said to the chiefs, Keep your places here till we come back to you: Aaron and Hur are with you; if anyone has any cause let him go to them.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: And Moses went up into the mountain, and it was covered by the cloud.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: And the glory of the Lord was resting on Mount Sinai, and the cloud was over it for six days; and on the seventh day he said Moses' name out of the cloud.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: And the glory of the Lord was like a flame on the top of the mountain before the eyes of the children of Israel.

title: Exodus Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: And Moses went up the mountain, into the cloud, and was there for forty days and forty nights.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 2
text: Say to the children of Israel that they are to make me an offering; from every man who has the impulse in his heart take an offering for me.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 3
text: And this is the offering you are to take from them: gold and silver and brass;

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 4
text: And blue and purple and red, and the best linen, and goats' hair;

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 5
text: And sheepskins coloured red, and leather, and hard wood;

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 6
text: Oil for the light, spices for the sweet-smelling oil, sweet perfumes for burning;

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 7
text: Beryls and stones of value to be put on the ephod and on the priest's bag.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 8
text: And let them make me a holy place, so that I may be ever present among them.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 9
text: Make the House and everything in it from the designs which I will give you.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 10
text: And they are to make an ark of hard wood; two and a half cubits long, and a cubit and a half wide and high.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 11
text: It is to be plated inside and out with the best gold, with an edge of gold all round it

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 12
text: And make four rings of gold for it, to be fixed on its four feet, two rings on one side of it and two on the other.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 13
text: And make rods of the same wood, plating them with gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 14
text: And put the rods through the rings at the sides of the ark, for lifting it.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 15
text: The rods are to be kept in the rings, and never taken out.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 16
text: Inside the ark you are to put the record which I will give you.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 17
text: And you are to make a cover of the best gold, two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 18
text: And at the two ends of the cover you are to make two winged ones of hammered gold,

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 19
text: One at one end and one at the other; the winged ones are to be part of the cover.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 20
text: And their wings are to be outstretched over the cover, and the winged ones are to be opposite one another, facing the cover.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 21
text: And put the cover over the ark, and in the ark the record which I will give you.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 22
text: And there, between the two winged ones on the cover of the ark, I will come to you, face to face, and make clear to you all the orders I have to give you for the children of Israel.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 23
text: And you are to make a table of the same wood, two cubits long, a cubit wide and a cubit and a half high,

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 24
text: Plated with the best gold, with a gold edge all round it;

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 25
text: And make a frame all round it, as wide as a man's hand, with a gold edge to the frame.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 26
text: And make four gold rings and put them at the four angles, on the four feet of the table;

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 27
text: The rings are to be fixed under the frame to take the rods with which the table is to be lifted.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 28
text: Make rods of the same wood, plated with gold, for lifting the table.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 29
text: And make the table-vessels, the spoons and the cups and the basins for liquids, all of the best gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 30
text: And on the table at all times you are to keep my holy bread.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 31
text: And you are to make a support for lights, of the best gold; its base and its pillar are to be of hammered gold; its cups, its buds, and its flowers are to be made of the same metal.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 32
text: It is to have six branches coming out from its sides; three branches from one side and three from the other.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 33
text: Every branch having three cups made like almond flowers, every cup with a bud and a flower, on all the branches.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 34
text: And on the pillar, four cups like almond flowers, every one with its bud and its flower:

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 35
text: And under every two branches a bud, made with the branch, for all the six branches of it.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 36
text: The buds and the branches are to be made of the same metal; all together one complete work of hammered gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 37
text: Then you are to make its seven vessels for the lights, putting them in their place so that they give light in front of it.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 38
text: And the instruments and trays for use with it are all to be of the best gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 39
text: A talent of gold will be needed for it, with all these vessels.

title: Exodus Chapter 25 Verse 40
text: And see that you make them from the design which you saw on the mountain.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 1
text: And you are to make a House for me, with ten curtains of the best linen, blue and purple and red, worked with designs of winged ones by a good workman.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 2
text: Every curtain is to be twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits wide, all of the same measure.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 3
text: Five curtains are to be joined together, and the other five are to be joined together.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 4
text: And you are to put twists of blue cord on the edge of the outside curtain of the first group of five, and on the edge of the outside curtain of the second group of five;

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 5
text: Fifty twists on one curtain and fifty on the other, the twists to be opposite one another.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 6
text: Then make fifty gold hooks, joining the curtains together by the hooks, and in this way the House will be made.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 7
text: And you are to make curtains of goats' hair for a tent over the House, eleven curtains.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 8
text: Every curtain is to be thirty cubits long and four cubits wide, all of the same measure.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 9
text: Five of these curtains are to be joined together, and the other six are to be joined together, the sixth being folded over to make a hanging in front of the tent.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 10
text: And you are to put fifty twists of cord on the edge of the outside curtain of one group, and fifty twists on the edge of the outside curtain of the other group.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 11
text: Then make fifty brass hooks and put the hooks into the twists, joining the tent together to make it one.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 12
text: And the folded part which is over of the curtains of the tent, the half-curtain which is folded back, will be hanging down over the back of the House.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 13
text: And the cubit which is over of the ten curtains at the sides will be hanging over the two sides of the House as a cover.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 14
text: And then you are to make a cover for the tent, of sheepskins coloured red, and a cover of leather over that.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 15
text: And you are to make upright boards of hard wood for the House.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 16
text: Every board is to be ten cubits high and a cubit and a half wide.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 17
text: Every board is to be joined to the one nearest to it by two tongues, and so for every board in the House.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 18
text: These are the boards needed for the house; twenty boards for the south side,

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 19
text: With forty silver bases under the twenty boards, two bases under every board to take its tongues.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 20
text: And twenty boards for the second side of the house on the north,

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 21
text: With their forty silver bases, two under every board.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 22
text: And six boards for the back of the House on the west,

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 23
text: With two boards for the angles of the House at the back.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 24
text: The two are to be joined together at the base and at the top to one ring, forming the two angles.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 25
text: So there are to be eight boards, with their sixteen silver bases, two bases under every board.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 26
text: And make rods of the same wood, five for the boards on the one side,

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 27
text: And five for the boards on the other side of the House, and five for the west side of the House at the back.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 28
text: And the middle rod is to go through the rings of all the boards from end to end.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 29
text: And the boards are to be plated with gold, having gold rings for the rods to go through: and the rods are to be plated with gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 30
text: And you are to make the House from the design which you saw on the mountain.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 31
text: And you are to make a veil of the best linen, blue and purple and red, worked with designs of winged ones by a good workman:

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 32
text: Hanging it by gold hooks from four pillars of wood, plated with gold and fixed in silver bases.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 33
text: And you are to put up the veil under the hooks, and put inside it the ark of the law: the veil is to be a division between the holy place and the most holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 34
text: You are to put the cover on the ark of the law, inside the most holy place.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 35
text: And outside the veil you are to put the table, and the support for the lights opposite the table on the south side of the House; and the table is to be on the north side.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 36
text: And you are to make a curtain for the doorway of the Tent, of the best linen with needlework of blue and purple and red.

title: Exodus Chapter 26 Verse 37
text: And make five pillars for the curtain, of hard wood plated with gold; their hooks are to be of gold and their bases of brass

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 1
text: And make an altar of hard wood, a square altar, five cubits long, five cubits wide and three cubits high.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 2
text: Put horns at the four angles of it, made of the same, plating it all with brass.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 3
text: And make all its vessels, the baskets for taking away the dust of the fire, the spades and basins and meat-hooks and fire-trays, of brass.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 4
text: And make a network of brass, with four brass rings at its four angles.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 5
text: And put the network under the shelf round the altar so that the net comes half-way up the altar.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 6
text: And make rods for the altar, of hard wood, plated with brass.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 7
text: And put the rods through the rings at the two opposite sides of the altar, for lifting it.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 8
text: The altar is to be hollow, boarded in with wood; make it from the design which you saw on the mountain.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 9
text: And let there be an open space round the House, with hangings for its south side of the best linen, a hundred cubits long.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 10
text: Their twenty pillars and their twenty bases are to be of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their bands are to be of silver.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 11
text: And on the north side in the same way, hangings a hundred cubits long, with twenty pillars of brass on bases of brass; their hooks and their bands are to be of silver.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 12
text: And for the open space on the west side, the hangings are to be fifty cubits wide, with ten pillars and ten bases;

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 13
text: And on the east side the space is to be fifty cubits wide.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 14
text: On the one side of the doorway will be hangings fifteen cubits long, with three pillars and three bases;

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 15
text: And on the other side, hangings fifteen cubits long, with three pillars and three bases.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 16
text: And across the doorway, a veil of twenty cubits of the best linen, made of needlework of blue and purple and red, with four pillars and four bases.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 17
text: All the pillars round the open space are to have silver bands, with hooks of silver and bases of brass.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 18
text: The open space is to be a hundred cubits long, fifty cubits wide, with sides five cubits high, curtained with the best linen, with bases of brass.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 19
text: All the instruments for the work of the House, and all its nails, and the nails of the open space are to be of brass.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 20
text: Give orders to the children of Israel to give you clear olive oil for the lights, so that a light may be burning there at all times.

title: Exodus Chapter 27 Verse 21
text: Let Aaron and his sons put this in order, evening and morning, before the Lord, inside the Tent of meeting, outside the veil which is before the ark; this is to be an order for ever, from generation to generation, to be kept by the children of Israel.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 1
text: Now let Aaron your brother, and his sons with him, come near from among the children of Israel, so that they may be my priests, even Aaron, and Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar, his sons.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 2
text: And make holy robes for Aaron your brother, so that he may be clothed with glory and honour.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 3
text: Give orders to all the wise-hearted workmen, whom I have made full of the spirit of wisdom, to make robes for Aaron, so that he may be made holy as my priest.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 4
text: This is what they are to make: a priest's bag, an ephod, and a robe, and a coat of coloured needlework, a head-dress, and a linen band; they are to make holy robes for Aaron your brother and for his sons, so that they may do the work of priests for me.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 5
text: They are to take the gold and blue and purple and red and the best linen,

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 6
text: And make the ephod of gold and blue and purple and red and the best linen, the work of a designer.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 7
text: It is to have two bands stitched to it at the top of the arms, joining it together.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 8
text: And the beautifully worked band, which goes on it, is to be of the same work and the same material, of gold and blue and purple and red and twisted linen-work.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 9
text: You are to take two beryl stones, on which the names of the children of Israel are to be cut:

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 10
text: Six names on the one stone and six on the other, in the order of their birth.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 11
text: With the work of a jeweller, like the cutting of a stamp, the names of the children of Israel are to be cut on them, and they are to be fixed in twisted frames of gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 12
text: And the two stones are to be placed on the ephod, over the arm-holes, to be stones of memory for the children of Israel: Aaron will have their names on his arms when he goes in before the Lord, to keep the Lord in mind of them.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 13
text: And you are to make twisted frames of gold;

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 14
text: And two chains of the best gold, twisted like cords; and have the chains fixed on to the frames.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 15
text: And make a priest's bag for giving decisions, designed like the ephod, made of gold and blue and purple and red and the best linen.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 16
text: It is to be square, folded in two, a hand-stretch long and a hand-stretch wide.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 17
text: And on it you are to put four lines of jewels; the first line is to be a cornelian, a chrysolite, and an emerald;

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 18
text: The second, a ruby, a sapphire, and an onyx;

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 19
text: The third, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 20
text: The fourth, a topaz, a beryl, and a jasper; they are to be fixed in twisted frames of gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 21
text: The jewels are to be twelve in number, for the names of the children of Israel; every jewel having the name of one of the twelve tribes cut on it as on a stamp.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 22
text: And you are to make two chains of gold, twisted like cords, to be fixed to the priest's bag.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 23
text: And put two gold rings on the two ends of the bag.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 24
text: Put the two gold chains on the two rings at the ends of the bag;

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 25
text: Joining the other ends of the chains to the gold frames and putting them on the front of the ephod, at the top of the arms.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 26
text: Then make two gold rings and put them on the lower ends of the bag, at the edge of it on the inner side nearest to the ephod.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 27
text: And make two more gold rings and put them on the front of the ephod at the top of the arms, at the join, over the worked band:

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 28
text: So that the rings on the bag may be fixed to the rings of the ephod by a blue cord and on to the band of the ephod, so that the bag may not come loose from the ephod.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 29
text: And so Aaron will have the names of the children of Israel on the priest's bag over his heart whenever he goes into the holy place, to keep the memory of them before the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 30
text: And in the bag you are to put the Urim and Thummim, so that they may be on Aaron's heart whenever he goes in before the Lord; and Aaron may have the power of making decisions for the children of Israel before the Lord at all times.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 31
text: The robe which goes with the ephod is to be made all of blue;

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 32
text: With a hole at the top, in the middle of it; the hole is to be edged with a band to make it strong like the hole in the coat of a fighting-man, so that it may not be broken open.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 33
text: And round the skirts of it put fruits in blue and purple and red, with bells of gold between;

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 34
text: A gold bell and a fruit in turn all round the skirts of the robe.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 35
text: Aaron is to put it on for his holy work; and the sound of it will be clear, when he goes into the holy place before the Lord, and when he comes out, keeping him safe from death.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 36
text: You are to make a plate of the best gold, cutting on it, as on a stamp, these words: HOLY TO THE LORD.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 37
text: Put a blue cord on it and put it on the front of the twisted head-dress:

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 38
text: And it will be over Aaron's brow, so that Aaron will be responsible for any error in all the holy offerings made by the children of Israel; it will be on his brow at all times, so that their offerings may be pleasing to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 39
text: The coat is to be made of the best linen, worked in squares; and you are to make a head-dress of linen, and a linen band worked in needlework.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 40
text: And for Aaron's sons you are to make coats, and bands, and head-dresses, so that they may be clothed with glory and honour.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 41
text: These you are to put on Aaron, your brother, and on his sons, putting oil on them, separating them and making them holy, to do the work of priests to me.

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 42
text: And you are to make them linen trousers, covering their bodies from the middle to the knee;

title: Exodus Chapter 28 Verse 43
text: Aaron and his sons are to put these on whenever they go into the Tent of meeting or come near the altar, when they are doing the work of the holy place, so that they may be free from any sin causing death: this is to be an order for him and his seed after him for ever.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 1
text: This is what you are to do to make them holy, to do the work of priests to me: Take one young ox and two male sheep, without any mark on them,

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 2
text: And unleavened bread, and unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and thin unleavened cakes on which oil has been put, made of the best bread-meal;

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 3
text: Put these in a basket and take them, with the ox and the two sheep.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 4
text: And let Aaron and his sons come to the door of the Tent of meeting, and there let them be washed with water.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 5
text: Take the robes, and put the coat and the dress and the ephod and the priest's bag on Aaron; put the band of needlework round him,

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 6
text: And let the head-dress be placed on his head and the holy crown on the head-dress.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 7
text: Then take the oil and put it on his head.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 8
text: And take his sons and put their robes on them;

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 9
text: And put the linen bands round Aaron and his sons, and the head-dresses on them, to make them priests by my order for ever: so you are to make Aaron and his sons holy to me.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 10
text: Then let the ox be taken in front of the Tent of meeting: and let Aaron and his sons put their hands on its head.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 11
text: And you are to put the ox to death before the Lord at the door of the Tent of meeting.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 12
text: Then take some of the blood of the ox, and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger, draining out all the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 13
text: And take all the fat covering the inside of the ox, and the fat joining the liver and the two kidneys with the fat round them, and let them be burned on the altar;

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 14
text: But the flesh of the ox and its skin and its waste parts are to be burned outside the circle of the tents, for it is a sin-offering.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 15
text: Then take one of the sheep, and let Aaron and his sons put their hands on its head.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 16
text: Then let it be put to death, so that the sides of the altar are marked with its blood.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 17
text: Then the sheep is to be cut up into its parts, and after washing its legs and its inside parts, you are to put them with the parts and the head,

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 18
text: And let them all be burned on the altar as a burned offering to the Lord: a sweet smell, an offering made by fire to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 19
text: Then take the other sheep; and after Aaron and his sons have put their hands on its head,

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 20
text: You are to put the sheep to death, and take some of its blood and put it on the point of Aaron's right ear, and of the right ears of his sons, and on the thumbs of their right hands and the great toes of their right feet, dropping the rest of the blood on the sides of the altar.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 21
text: Then take some of the blood on the altar, and the oil, and put it on Aaron and his robes and on his sons and on their robes, so that he and his robes and his sons and their robes may be made holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 22
text: Then take the fat of the sheep, the fat tail, the fat covering the insides, and the fat joining the liver and the two kidneys with the fat round them, and the right leg; for by the offering of this sheep they are to be marked out as priests:

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 23
text: And take one bit of bread and one cake of oiled bread and one thin cake out of the basket of unleavened bread which is before the Lord:

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 24
text: And put them all on the hands of Aaron and of his sons, to be waved for a wave offering before the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 25
text: Then take them from their hands, and let them be burned on the burned offering on the altar, a sweet smell before the Lord, an offering made by fire to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 26
text: Then take the breast of Aaron's sheep, waving it before the Lord; and it is to be your part of the offering.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 27
text: So you are to make holy the breast of the sheep which is waved and the leg which is lifted up on high, that is, of the sheep which is offered for Aaron and his sons;

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 28
text: And it will be their part as a right for ever from the children of Israel, it is a special offering from the children of Israel, made from their peace-offerings, a special offering lifted up to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 29
text: And Aaron's holy robes will be used by his sons after him; they will put them on when they are made priests.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 30
text: For seven days the son who becomes priest in his place will put them on when he comes into the Tent of meeting to do the work of the holy place.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 31
