text: Then take the sheep of the wave offering and let its flesh be cooked in water in a holy place.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 32
text: And let Aaron and his sons make a meal of it, with the bread in the basket, at the door of the Tent of meeting.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 33
text: All those things which were used as offerings to take away sin, and to make them holy to be priests, they may have for food: but no one who is not a priest may have them, for they are holy food.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 34
text: And if any of the flesh of the offering or of the bread is over till the morning, let it be burned with fire; it is not to be used for food, for it is holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 35
text: All these things you are to do to Aaron and his sons as I have given you orders: for seven days the work of making them priests is to go on.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 36
text: Every day an ox is to be offered as a sin-offering, to take away sins: and by this offering on it, you will make the altar clean from sin; and you are to put oil on it and make it holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 37
text: For seven days you are to make offerings for the altar and make it holy, so that it may become completely holy, and anything touching it will become holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 38
text: Now this is the offering which you are to make on the altar: two lambs in their first year, every day regularly.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 39
text: One lamb is to be offered in the morning and the other in the evening:

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 40
text: And with the one lamb, a tenth part of an ephah of the best meal, mixed with a fourth part of a hin of clear oil; and the fourth part of a hin of wine for a drink offering.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 41
text: And the other lamb is to be offered in the evening, and with it the same meal offering and drink offering, for a sweet smell, an offering made by fire to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 42
text: This is to be a regular burned offering made from generation to generation, at the door of the Tent of meeting before the Lord, where I will come face to face with you and have talk with you.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 43
text: There I will come face to face with the children of Israel, and the Tent will be made holy by my glory

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 44
text: I will make holy the Tent of meeting and the altar: and Aaron and his sons I will make holy, to be my priests

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 45
text: Among the children of Israel I will make my living-place, and I will be their God.

title: Exodus Chapter 29 Verse 46
text: And they will see that I am the Lord their God, who took them out of the land of Egypt, so that I might be ever with them: I am the Lord their God.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 1
text: And you are to make an altar for the burning of perfume; of hard wood let it be made.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 2
text: The altar is to be square, a cubit long and a cubit wide, and two cubits high, and its horns are to be made of the same.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 3
text: It is to be plated with the best gold, the top of it and the sides and the horns, with an edging of gold all round it.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 4
text: Under the edge on the two opposite sides, you are to make two gold rings, to take the rods for lifting it.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 5
text: And make these rods of the same wood, plating them with gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 6
text: And let it be placed in front of the veil before the ark of the law, before the cover which is over the law, where I will come face to face with you.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 7
text: And on this altar sweet spices are to be burned by Aaron every morning when he sees to the lights.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 8
text: And every evening, when he puts the lights up in their places, the spices are to be burned, a sweet-smelling smoke going up before the Lord from generation to generation for ever.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 9
text: No strange perfume, no burned offering or meal offering, and no drink offering is to be offered on it.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 10
text: And once every year Aaron is to make its horns clean: with the blood of the sin-offering he is to make it clean once every year from generation to generation: it is most holy to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 11
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 12
text: When you are taking the number of the children of Israel, let every man who is numbered give to the Lord a price for his life, so that no disease may come on them when they are numbered.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 13
text: And this is what they are to give; let every man who is numbered give half a shekel, by the scale of the holy place: (the shekel being valued at twenty gerahs:) this money is an offering to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 14
text: Everyone who is numbered, from twenty years old and over, is to give an offering to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 15
text: The man of wealth is to give no more and the poor man no less than the half-shekel of silver, when the offering is made to the Lord as the price for your lives.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 16
text: And you are to take this money from the children of Israel to be used for the work of the Tent of meeting, to keep the memory of the children of Israel before the Lord and to be the price of your lives.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 17
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 18
text: You are to make a brass washing-vessel, with a brass base; and put it between the Tent of meeting and the altar, with water in it;

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 19
text: That it may be used by Aaron and his sons for washing their hands and feet;

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 20
text: Whenever they go into the Tent of meeting they are to be washed with water, to keep them from death; and whenever they come near to do the work of the altar, or to make an offering by fire to the Lord,

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 21
text: Their hands and feet are to be washed. so that they may be safe from death: this is an order to them for ever; to him and his seed from generation to generation.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 22
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 23
text: Take the best spices, five hundred shekels' weight of liquid myrrh, and of sweet cinnamon half as much, that is, two hundred and fifty shekels, and two hundred and fifty shekels of sweet calamus,

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 24
text: And of cassia, five hundred shekels' weight measured by the scale of the holy place, and of olive oil a hin:

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 25
text: And make these into a holy oil, a perfume made by the art of the perfume-maker; it is to be a holy oil.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 26
text: This oil is to be put on the Tent of meeting, and on the ark of the law,

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 27
text: And on the table and all its vessels, and on the support for the lights, with its vessels, and on the altar for burning spices,

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 28
text: And on the altar of burned offerings with its vessels, and on the washing-vessel and its base.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 29
text: And you are to make them most holy; anything touching them will become holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 30
text: And put the oil on Aaron and his sons, making them holy to do the work of priests to me.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 31
text: And say to the children of Israel, This is to be the Lord's holy oil, from generation to generation.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 32
text: It is not to be used for man's flesh, and no other is to be made like it: holy it is, and you are to keep it holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 33
text: Whoever makes any like it, or puts it on one who is not a priest, will be cut off from his people.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 34
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Take sweet spices, stacte and onycha and galbanum, with the best frankincense, in equal weights;

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 35
text: And make from them a perfume, such as is made by the art of the perfume-maker, mixed with salt, and clean and holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 36
text: And put some of it, crushed very small, in front of the ark in the Tent of meeting, where I will come face to face with you; it is to be most holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 37
text: You are not to make any perfume like it for yourselves: it is to be kept holy to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 30 Verse 38
text: Whoever makes any like it, for its sweet smell, will be cut off from his people.

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 2
text: I have made selection of Bezalel, the son of Uri, by name, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah:

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 3
text: And I have given him the spirit of God and made him wise and full of knowledge and expert in every sort of handwork,

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 4
text: To do all sorts of delicate work in gold and silver and brass;

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 5
text: In cutting stones for framing, and to do every form of woodwork.

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 6
text: And I have made selection of Oholiab with him, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and in the hearts of all who are wise I have put the knowledge to make whatever I have given you orders to have made;

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 7
text: The Tent of meeting, and the ark of the law, and the cover which is on it, and all the things for the tent,

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 8
text: And the table with its vessels, and the holy light-support with all its vessels, and the altar for the burning of spices,

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 9
text: And the altar of burned offerings with all its vessels, and the washing-vessel with its base,

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 10
text: And the robes of needlework, the holy robes for Aaron and for his sons, for their use when acting as priests,

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 11
text: And the holy oil, and the perfume of sweet spices for the holy place; they will do whatever I have given you orders to have done.

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 12
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 13
text: Say to the children of Israel that they are to keep my Sabbaths; for the Sabbath day is a sign between me and you through all your generations; so that you may see that I am the Lord who makes you holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 14
text: So you are to keep the Sabbath as a holy day; and anyone not honouring it will certainly be put to death: whoever does any work on that day will be cut off from his people.

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 15
text: Six days may work be done, but the seventh day is a Sabbath of complete rest, holy to the Lord; whoever does any work on the Sabbath day is to be put to death.

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 16
text: And the children of Israel are to keep the Sabbath holy, from generation to generation, by an eternal agreement.

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 17
text: It is a sign between me and the children of Israel for ever; because in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he took his rest and had pleasure in it.

title: Exodus Chapter 31 Verse 18
text: And when his talk with Moses on Mount Sinai was ended, he gave him the two stones of the law, two stones on which was the writing made by the finger of God.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 1
text: And when the people saw that Moses was a long time coming down from the mountain, they all came to Aaron and said to him, Come, make us a god to go before us: as for this Moses, who took us up out of the land of Egypt, we have no idea what has become of him.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 2
text: Then Aaron said to them, Take off the gold rings which are in the ears of your wives and your sons and your daughters, and give them to me.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 3
text: And all the people took the gold rings from their ears and gave them to Aaron.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 4
text: And he took the gold from them and, hammering it with an instrument, he made it into the metal image of a young ox: and they said, This is your god, O Israel, who took you out of the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 5
text: And when Aaron saw this, he made an altar before it, and made a public statement, saying, Tomorrow there will be a feast to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 6
text: So early on the day after they got up and made burned offerings and peace-offerings; and took their seats at the feast, and then gave themselves to pleasure.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 7
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Go down quickly; for your people, whom you took out of the land of Egypt, are turned to evil ways;

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 8
text: Even now they are turned away from the rule I gave them, and have made themselves a metal ox and given worship to it and offerings, saying, This is your god, O Israel, who took you up out of the land of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 9
text: And the Lord said to Moses, I have been watching this people, and I see that they are a stiff-necked people.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 10
text: Now do not get in my way, for my wrath is burning against them; I will send destruction on them, but of you I will make a great nation.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 11
text: But Moses made prayer to God, saying, Lord, why is your wrath burning against your people whom you took out of the land of Egypt, with great power and with the strength of your hand?

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 12
text: Why let the Egyptians say, He took them out to an evil fate, to put them to death on the mountains, cutting them off from the earth? Let your wrath be turned away from them, and send not this evil on your people.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 13
text: Have in mind Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, your servants, to whom you gave your oath, saying, I will make your seed like the stars of heaven in number, and all this land will I give to your seed, as I said, to be their heritage for ever.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 14
text: So the Lord let himself be turned from his purpose of sending punishment on his people.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 15
text: Then Moses came down the mountain with the two stones of the law in his hand; the stones had writing on their two sides, on the front and on the back.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 16
text: The stones were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, cut on the stones.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 17
text: Now when the noise and the voices of the people came to the ears of Joshua, he said to Moses, There is a noise of war in the tents.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 18
text: And Moses said, It is not the voice of men who are overcoming in the fight, or the cry of those who have been overcome; it is the sound of songs which comes to my ear.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 19
text: And when he came near the tents he saw the image of the ox, and the people dancing; and in his wrath Moses let the stones go from his hands, and they were broken at the foot of the mountain.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 20
text: And he took the ox which they had made, burning it in the fire and crushing it to powder, and he put it in the water and made the children of Israel take a drink of it.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 21
text: And Moses said to Aaron, What did the people do to you that you let this great sin come on them?

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 22
text: And Aaron said, Let not my lord be angry; you have seen how the purposes of this people are evil.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 23
text: For they said to me, Make us a god to go before us: as for this Moses, who took us up out of the land of Egypt, we have no idea what has come to him.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 24
text: Then I said to them, Whoever has any gold, let him take it off; so they gave it to me, and I put it in the fire, and this image of an ox came out.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 25
text: And Moses saw that the people were out of control, for Aaron had let them loose to their shame before their haters:

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 26
text: Then Moses took his place at the way into the tents, and said, Whoever is on the Lord's side, let him come to me. And all the sons of Levi came together to him.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 27
text: And he said to them, This is the word of the Lord, the God of Israel: Let every man take his sword at his side, and go from one end of the tents to the other, putting to death his brother and his friend and his neighbour.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 28
text: And the sons of Levi did as Moses said; and about three thousand of the people were put to death that day.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 29
text: And Moses said, You have made yourselves priests to the Lord this day; for every one of you has made the offering of his son and his brother; the blessing of the Lord is on you this day.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 30
text: And on the day after, Moses said to the people, Great has been your sin: but I will go up to the Lord, and see if I may get forgiveness for your sin.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 31
text: Then Moses went back to the Lord and said, This people has done a great sin, making themselves a god of gold;

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 32
text: But now, if you will give them forgiveness--but if not, let my name be taken out of your book.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 33
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Whoever has done evil against me will be taken out of my book.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 34
text: But now, go, take the people into that place of which I have given you word; see, my angel will go before you: but when the time of my judging has come, I will send punishment on them for their sin.

title: Exodus Chapter 32 Verse 35
text: And the Lord sent punishment on the people because they gave worship to the ox which Aaron made.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Go forward from this place, you and the people whom you have taken up out of the land of Egypt, to that land about which I made an oath to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, To your seed will I give it.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 2
text: And I will send an angel before you, driving out the Canaanite and the Amorite and the Hittite and the Perizzite and the Hivite and the Jebusite:

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 3
text: Go up to that land flowing with milk and honey; but I will not go up among you, for you are a stiff-necked people, for fear that I send destruction on you while you are on the way.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 4
text: Hearing this bad news the people were full of grief, and no one put on his ornaments.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 5
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Say to the children of Israel, You are a stiff-necked people: if I come among you, even for a minute, I will send destruction on you; so take off all your ornaments, so that I may see what to do with you.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 6
text: So the children of Israel took off their ornaments at Mount Horeb, and did not put them on again.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 7
text: Now it was Moses' way to put up the Tent of meeting outside the tent-circle, at some distance away; giving it the name of The Tent of meeting. And everyone desiring to make his prayer to the Lord went to the Tent of meeting outside the tent-circle.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 8
text: And whenever Moses went out to the Tent of meeting, all the people got up and everyone went to the door of his tent, looking after Moses till he went inside the Tent.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 9
text: And whenever Moses went into the Tent, the pillar of cloud came down, and took its place by the door of the Tent, as long as the Lord was talking with Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 10
text: And all the people saw the cloud at the door of the Tent, and they went down on their faces, everyone at the door of his tent.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 11
text: And the Lord had talk with Moses face to face, as a man may have talk with his friend. And when Moses came back to the tents, his servant, the young man Joshua, the son of Nun, did not come away from the Tent.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 12
text: And Moses said to the Lord, See, you say to me, Be this people's guide on their journey, but you have not made clear to me whom you will send with me. But you have said, I have knowledge of you by name, and you have grace in my eyes.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 13
text: If then I have grace in your eyes, let me see your ways, so that I may have knowledge of you and be certain of your grace; and my prayer is that you will keep in mind that this nation is your people.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 14
text: And he said, I myself will go with you and give you rest.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 15
text: And Moses said, If you yourself are not going with us, do not send us on from here.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 16
text: For is not the fact of your going with us the sign that I and this people have grace in your eyes, so that we, that is, I and your people, are separate from all other people on the face of the earth?

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 17
text: And the Lord said to Moses, I will do as you say: for you have grace in my eyes, and I have knowledge of you by your name.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 18
text: And Moses said, O Lord, let me see your glory.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 19
text: And he said, I will make all the light of my being come before you, and will make clear to you what I am; I will be kind to those to whom I will be kind, and have mercy on those on whom I will have mercy.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 20
text: But it is not possible for you to see my face, for no man may see me and still go on living.

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 21
text: And the Lord said, See, there is a place near me, and you may take your place on the rock:

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 22
text: And when my glory goes by, I will put you in a hole in the rock, covering you with my hand till I have gone past:

title: Exodus Chapter 33 Verse 23
text: Then I will take away my hand, and you will see my back: but my face is not to be seen.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Make two other stones like the first two; and I will put on them the words which were on the first stones, which were broken by you.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 2
text: And be ready by the morning, and come up on Mount Sinai, and come before me there in the morning, on the top of the mountain.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 3
text: No one is to come up with you, and let no man be seen anywhere on the mountain; let no flocks or herds come near to get their food at its foot.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 4
text: So Moses got two stones cut like the first; and early in the morning he went up Mount Sinai, as the Lord had said, with the two stones in his hand.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 5
text: And the Lord came down in the cloud and took his place by the side of Moses, and Moses gave worship to the name of the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 6
text: And the Lord went past before his eyes, saying, The Lord, the Lord, a God full of pity and grace, slow to wrath and great in mercy and faith;

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 7
text: Having mercy on thousands, overlooking evil and wrongdoing and sin; he will not let wrongdoers go free, but will send punishment on children for the sins of their fathers, and on their children's children to the third and fourth generation.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 8
text: Then Moses quickly went down on his face in worship.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 9
text: And he said, If now I have grace in your eyes, let the Lord go among us, for this is a stiff-necked people, and give us forgiveness for our wrongdoing and our sin, and take us for your heritage.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 10
text: And the Lord said, See, this is what I will undertake: before the eyes of your people I will do wonders, such as have not been done in all the earth or in any nation: and all your people will see the work of the Lord, for what I am about to do for you is greatly to be feared.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 11
text: Take care to do the orders which I give you today; I will send out from before you the Amorite and the Canaanite and the Hittite and the Perizzite and the Hivite and the Jebusite.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 12
text: But take care, and do not make any agreement with the people of the land where you are going, for it will be a cause of sin to you.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 13
text: But their altars are to be overturned and their pillars broken and their images cut down:

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 14
text: For you are to be worshippers of no other god: for the Lord is a God who will not give his honour to another.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 15
text: So see that you make no agreement with the people of the land, and do not go after their gods, or take part in their offerings, or be guests at their feasts,

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 16
text: Or take their daughters for your sons; for when their daughters give worship before their gods, they will make your sons take part with them.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 17
text: Make for yourselves no gods of metal.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 18
text: Keep the feast of unleavened bread; for seven days your food is to be bread without leaven, as I gave you orders, at the regular time in the month Abib; for in that month you came out of Egypt.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 19
text: Every first male child is mine; the first male birth of your cattle, the first male of every ox and sheep.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 20
text: A lamb may be given in payment for the young of an ass, but if you will not make payment for it, its neck will have to be broken. For all the first of your sons you are to make payment. No one is to come before me without an offering.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 21
text: Six days let work be done, but on the seventh day take your rest: at ploughing time and at the grain-cutting you are to have a day for rest.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 22
text: And you are to keep the feast of weeks when you get in the first-fruits of the grain, and the feast at the turn of the year when you take in the produce of your fields.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 23
text: Three times in the year let all your males come before the Lord, the God of Israel.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 24
text: For I will send out the nations before you and make wide the limits of your land; and no man will make an attempt to take your land while you go up to give worship to the Lord, three times in the year.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 25
text: No leaven is to be offered with the blood of my offering, and the offering of the Passover feast may not be kept till the morning.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 26
text: Take the first-fruits of your land as an offering to the house of the Lord your God. Let not the young goat be cooked in its mother's milk

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 27
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Put all these words in writing; for on them is based the agreement which I will make with you.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 28
text: And for forty days and forty nights Moses was there with the Lord, and in that time he had no food or drink. And he put in writing on the stones the words of the agreement, the ten rules of the law.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 29
text: Now when Moses came down from Mount Sinai, with the two stones in his hand, he was not conscious that his face was shining because of his talk with God.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 30
text: But when Aaron and all the children of Israel saw Moses, and the shining of his face, they would not come near him for fear.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 31
text: Then Moses sent for them; and Aaron, with the chiefs of the people, came to him; and Moses had talk with them.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 32
text: And later, all the children of Israel came near, and he gave them all the orders which the Lord had given him on Mount Sinai.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 33
text: And at the end of his talk with them, Moses put a veil over his face.

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 34
text: But whenever Moses went in before the Lord to have talk with him, he took off the veil till he came out. And whenever he came out he said to the children of Israel what he had been ordered to say;

title: Exodus Chapter 34 Verse 35
text: And the children of Israel saw that the face of Moses was shining: so Moses put the veil over his face again till he went to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 1
text: And Moses sent for all the children of Israel to come together, and said to them, This is what the Lord has said and these are his orders.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 2
text: Six days let work be done, but the seventh day is to be a holy day to you, a Sabbath of rest to the Lord; whoever does any work on that day is to be put to death.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 3
text: No fire is to be lighted in any of your houses on the Sabbath day.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 4
text: And Moses said to all the meeting of the children of Israel, This is the order which the Lord has given:

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 5
text: Take from among you an offering to the Lord; everyone who has the impulse in his heart, let him give his offering to the Lord; gold and silver and brass;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 6
text: And blue and purple and red and the best linen and goats' hair,

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 7
text: And sheepskins coloured red, and leather, and hard wood,

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 8
text: And oil for the lights, and spices for the holy oil and for the sweet perfumes for burning.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 9
text: And beryls and jewels to be cut for the ephod and for the priest's bag.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 10
text: And let every wise-hearted man among you come and make whatever has been ordered by the Lord;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 11
text: The House and its tent and its cover, its hooks and its boards, its rods and its pillars and its bases;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 12
text: The ark with its cover and its rods and the veil hanging before it;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 13
text: The table and its rods and all its vessels, and the holy bread;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 14
text: And the support for the lights, with its vessels and its lights and the oil for the light;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 15
text: And the altar for burning spices, with its rods, and the holy oil and the sweet perfume, and the curtain for the door, at the door of the House;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 16
text: The altar of burned offerings, with its network of brass, its rods, and all its vessels, the washing-vessel and its base;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 17
text: The hangings for the open space, its pillars and their bases, and the curtain for the doorway;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 18
text: The nails for the House, and the nails for the open space and their cords;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 19
text: The robes of needlework for the work of the holy place, the holy robes for Aaron the priest, and the robes for his sons when acting as priests.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 20
text: And all the children of Israel went away from Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 21
text: And everyone whose heart was moved, everyone who was guided by the impulse of his spirit, came with his offering for the Lord, for whatever was needed for the Tent of meeting and its work and for the holy robes.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 22
text: They came, men and women, all who were ready to give, and gave pins and nose-rings and finger-rings and neck-ornaments, all of gold; everyone gave an offering of gold to the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 23
text: And everyone who had blue and purple and red and the best linen and goats' hair and sheepskins coloured red and leather, gave them.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 24
text: Everyone who had silver and brass gave an offering of them to the Lord; and everyone who had hard wood, such as was needed for the work, gave it.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 25
text: And all the women who were expert with their hands, made cloth, and gave the work of their hands, blue and purple and red and the best linen.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 26
text: And those women who had the knowledge, made the goats' hair into cloth.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 27
text: And the rulers gave the beryls and the cut jewels for the ephod and the priest's bag;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 28
text: And the spice and the oil for the light, and the holy oil and the sweet perfumes.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 29
text: The children of Israel, every man and woman, from the impulse of their hearts, gave their offerings freely to the Lord for the work which the Lord had given Moses orders to have done.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 30
text: And Moses said to the children of Israel, See, the Lord has made selection of Bezalel, the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 31
text: And he has made him full of the spirit of God, in all wisdom and knowledge and art of every sort;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 32
text: As an expert designer of beautiful things, working in gold and silver and brass;

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 33
text: Trained in the cutting of stones and the ornamenting of wood and in every sort of handwork.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 34
text: And he has given to him, and to Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, the power of training others.

title: Exodus Chapter 35 Verse 35
text: To them he has given knowledge of all the arts of the handworker, of the designer, and the expert workman; of the maker of needlework in blue and purple and red and the best linen, and of the maker of cloth; in all the arts of the designer and the trained workman they are expert.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 1
text: So let Bezalel and Oholiab get to work, with every wise-hearted man to whom the Lord has given wisdom and knowledge, to do whatever is necessary for the ordering of the holy place, as the Lord has given orders.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 2
text: Then Moses sent for Bezalel and Oholiab, and for all the wise-hearted men to whom the Lord had given wisdom, even everyone who was moved by the impulse of his heart to come and take part in the work:

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 3
text: And they took from Moses all the offerings which the children of Israel had given for the building of the holy place. And still they went on giving him more free offerings every morning.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 4
text: Then the wise men, who were doing all the work of the holy place, came from their work;

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 5
text: And said to Moses, The people are giving much more than is needed for the work which the Lord has given us orders to do.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 6
text: So Moses made an order and had it given out through all the tents, saying, Let no man or woman make any more offerings for the holy place. So the people were kept from giving more.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 7
text: For the material they had was enough and more than enough for all the work which had to be done.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 8
text: Then all the expert workmen among them made the House with its ten curtains; of the best linen, blue and purple and red, they made them, with winged ones worked by expert designers.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 9
text: Every curtain was twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits wide, all of the same measure.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 10
text: And five curtains were joined together, and the other five curtains were joined together.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 11
text: And they put twists of blue cord on the edge of the outside curtain of the first group, and in the same way on the outside curtain of the second group.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 12
text: Fifty twists on the one curtain and fifty on the edge of the curtain of the other group; the twists being opposite to one another.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 13
text: And they made fifty hooks of gold, joining the curtains one to another with the hooks; and so the House was made.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 14
text: And they made curtains of goats' hair for the tent; eleven curtains were made.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 15
text: Every curtain was thirty cubits long and four cubits wide, all of the same measure.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 16
text: Five curtains were joined together to make one group, and six curtains were joined together to make the other group.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 17
text: And they put fifty twists of cord on the edge of the outside curtain of the first group, and fifty twists on the edge of the outside curtain of the second group,

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 18
text: And fifty hooks of brass for joining them together to make the tent.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 19
text: And they made a cover of sheepskins coloured red, to go over the tent, and a cover of leather over that.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 20
text: And for the uprights of the House they made boards of hard wood.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 21
text: The boards were ten cubits long and one cubit and a half wide.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 22
text: Every board had two tongues fixed into it; all the boards were made in this way.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 23
text: They made twenty boards for the south side of the House:

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 24
text: And for these twenty boards, forty silver bases, two bases under every board, to take its tongues.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 25
text: And for the second side of the House, on the north, they made twenty boards,

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 26
text: With their forty silver bases, two bases for every board.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 27
text: And for the west side of the House, at the back, they made six boards,

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 28
text: And two boards for the angles at the back.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 29
text: These were joined together at the base and at the top to one ring, so forming the two angles.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 30
text: So there were eight boards with sixteen bases of silver, two bases under every board.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 31
text: And they made rods of hard wood; five for the boards on one side of the House,

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 32
text: And five for the boards on the other side of the House, and five for the boards at the back, on the west.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 33
text: The middle rod was made to go right through the rings of all the boards from one end to the other.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 34
text: All the boards were plated with gold, and the rings through which the rods went were of gold, and the rods were plated with gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 35
text: And he made the veil of the best linen, blue and purple and red, worked with winged ones designed by expert workmen.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 36
text: And they made four pillars for it of hard wood plated with gold: they had hooks of gold and four silver bases.

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 37
text: And they made a curtain for the door of the tent, of the best linen with needlework of blue and purple and red;

title: Exodus Chapter 36 Verse 38
text: And five pillars for the curtain, with their hooks; the heads of the pillars were of gold and they were circled with bands of gold; and their five bases were of brass.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 1
text: And Bezalel made the ark of hard wood, two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide and a cubit and a half high;

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 2
text: Plating it inside and out with the best gold, and putting an edge of gold all round it.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 3
text: And he made four gold rings for its four angles, two on one side and two on the other,

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 4
text: And rods of the same wood plated with gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 5
text: These rods he put in the rings at the sides of the ark, for lifting it.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 6
text: And he made the cover all of gold, two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 7
text: And he made two winged ones, hammered out of one bit of gold, for the two ends of the cover;

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 8
text: Placing one at one end and one at the other; the winged ones were part of the cover.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 9
text: And their wings were stretched out over the cover; the faces of the winged ones were opposite one another and facing the cover.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 10
text: And he made the table of hard wood, two cubits long, a cubit wide and a cubit and a half high;

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 11
text: Plating it with the best gold and putting a gold edge all round it.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 12
text: And he made a frame all round it about as wide as a man's hand, edged with gold all round.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 13
text: And he made four gold rings, and put the rings at the angles of its four feet.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 14
text: The rings were fixed under the frame to take the rods with which the table was to be lifted.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 15
text: The rods for lifting the table he made of hard wood plated with gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 16
text: And all the table-vessels, the plates and spoons and basins and the cups for liquids, he made of the best gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 17
text: Then he made the support for the lights, all of the best gold; its base and its pillar were of hammered gold; its cups and buds and flowers were all made out of the same metal:

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 18
text: It had six branches coming out from its sides, three from one side and three from the other;

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 19
text: Every branch having three cups made like almond flowers, every cup with a bud and a flower on all the branches;

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 20
text: And on its pillar, four cups like almond flowers, every one with its bud and its flower;

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 21
text: And under every two branches a bud, made with the branch, for all six branches of it.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 22
text: The buds and the branches were made of the same metal, all together one complete work of the best hammered gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 23
text: And he made the seven vessels for the lights, and all the necessary instruments for it, of gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 24
text: A talent of the best gold was used for the making of it and its vessels.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 25
text: And he made the altar for the burning of spices, using the same hard wood; it was square, a cubit long and a cubit wide and two cubits high; the horns made of the same.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 26
text: The top and the sides and the horns were all plated with the best gold; and he put an edge of gold all round it.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 27
text: And he made two gold rings, placing them on the two opposite sides under the edge, to take the rods for lifting it.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 28
text: The rods he made of the same hard wood, plating them with gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 37 Verse 29
text: And he made the holy oil and the perfume of sweet spices for burning, after the art of the perfume-maker.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 1
text: The altar of burned offerings he made of hard wood; a square altar, five cubits long, five cubits wide and three cubits high,

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 2
text: And he put horns at its four angles made of the same, plating it all with brass;

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 3
text: And brass was used for all the vessels of the altar, the baskets and the spades, the basins and the meat-hooks and the fire-trays; all the vessels he made of brass

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 4
text: And he made a network of brass for the altar, under the frame round it, stretching half-way up;

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 5
text: And four rings for the four angles of this network, to take the rods.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 6
text: The rods he made of hard wood plated with brass.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 7
text: He put the rods through the rings at the opposite sides of the altar for lifting it; he made the altar hollow, boarded in with wood.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 8
text: And he made the washing-vessel of brass on a brass base, using the polished brass looking-glasses given by the women who did work at the doors of the Tent of meeting.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 9
text: To make the open space, he put hangings on the south side, of the best linen, a hundred cubits long:

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 10
text: Their twenty pillars and their twenty bases were brass; and the hooks of the pillars and their bands were of silver.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 11
text: And for the north side. hangings a hundred cubits long, on twenty brass pillars in brass bases, with silver hooks and bands.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 12
text: And on the west side, hangings fifty cubits long, on ten pillars in ten bases, with silver bands.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 13
text: And on the east side, the open space was fifty cubits long.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 14
text: The hangings on one side of the doorway were fifteen cubits long, on three pillars with their three bases;

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 15
text: And the same on the other side of the doorway; on this side and on that the hangings were fifteen cubits long, on three pillars with their three bases.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 16
text: All the hangings were of the best linen.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 17
text: And the bases of the pillars were of brass; their hooks and the bands round the tops of them were of silver; all the pillars were ringed with silver.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 18
text: And the curtain for the doorway of the open space was of the best linen, with designs of blue and purple and red in needlework; it was twenty cubits long and five cubits high, to go with the hangings round the sides.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 19
text: There were four pillars with their bases, all of brass, the hooks being of silver, and their tops and their bands being covered with silver.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 20
text: All the nails used for the House and the open space round it were of brass.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 21
text: This is the price of the making of the House, even the House of witness, as it was valued by the word of Moses, for the work of the Levites under the direction of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 22
text: Bezalel, the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made everything as the Lord had given orders to Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 23
text: And with him was Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; a designer and a trained workman, expert in needlework of blue and purple and red and the best linen.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 24
text: The gold used for all the different work done for the holy place, the gold which was given, was twenty-nine talents, and seven hundred and thirty shekels in weight, by the scale of the holy place.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 25
text: And the silver given by those who were numbered of the people was a hundred talents, and a thousand, seven hundred and seventy-five shekels in weight, by the scale of the holy place.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 26
text: A beka, that is, half a shekel by the holy scale, for everyone who was numbered; there were six hundred and three thousand, five hundred and fifty men of twenty years old and over.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 27
text: Of this silver, a hundred talents was used for making the bases of the pillars of the holy place and of the veil; a talent for every base.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 28
text: And a thousand, seven hundred and seventy-five shekels of silver was used to make the hooks for the pillars, and for plating the tops of the pillars and for making their bands.

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 29
text: The brass which was given was seventy talents, two thousand four hundred shekels;

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 30
text: From it he made the bases of the doorway of the Tent of meeting and the brass altar and the network for it and all the vessels for the altar,

title: Exodus Chapter 38 Verse 31
text: And the bases for the open space all round and for its doorway, and all the nails for the House and for the open space.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 1
text: And from the needlework of blue and purple and red they made the robes used for the work of the holy place, and the holy robes for Aaron, as the Lord had given orders to Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 2
text: The ephod he made of gold and blue and purple and red and the best linen;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 3
text: Hammering the gold into thin plates and cutting it into wires to be worked into the blue and the purple and the red and the linen by the designer.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 4
text: And they made two bands for joining its edges together at the top of the arms.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 5
text: And the beautifully worked band which went on it was of the same design and the same material, worked in gold and blue and purple and red and twisted linen-work, as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 6
text: Then they made the beryl stones, fixed in twisted frames of gold and cut like the cutting of a stamp, with the names of the children of Israel.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 7
text: These he put on the ephod, over the arm-holes, to be stones of memory for the children of Israel, as the Lord had said to Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 8
text: The priest's bag was designed like the ephod, of the best linen worked with gold and blue and purple and red.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 9
text: It was square and folded in two, as long and as wide as the stretch of a man's hand;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 10
text: And on it they put four lines of stones: in the first line was a carnelian, a chrysolite, and an emerald;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 11
text: In the second, a ruby, a sapphire, and an onyx;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 12
text: In the third, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 13
text: In the fourth, a topaz, a beryl, and a jasper; they were fixed in twisted frames of gold.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 14
text: There were twelve stones for the twelve tribes of Israel; on every one the name of one of the tribes of Israel was cut, like the cutting of a stamp.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 15
text: And on the bag they put gold chains, twisted like cords.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 16
text: And they made two gold frames and two gold rings, the rings being fixed to the ends of the priest's bag;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 17
text: And they put the two twisted chains on the two rings at the ends of the priest's bag;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 18
text: And the other two ends of the chains were joined to the two frames and fixed to the front of the ephod over the arm-holes.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 19
text: And they made two rings of gold and put them on the two lower ends of the bag, on the inner side nearest to the ephod.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 20
text: And two other gold rings were put on the front of the ephod, over the arm-holes, at the join, and over the worked band.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 21
text: And the rings on the bag were fixed to the rings of the ephod by a blue cord, keeping it in place over the band, so that the bag might not get loose, as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 22
text: The robe which went with the ephod was made all of blue;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 23
text: With a hole at the top in the middle, like the hole in the coat of a fighting-man, edged with a band to make it strong.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 24
text: The skirts of the robe were worked all round with fruits in blue and purple and red made of twisted linen.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 25
text: And between the fruits all round the skirt they put gold bells, as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 26
text: All round the skirt of the robe were bells and fruits in turn.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 27
text: The coats for Aaron and his sons they made of the best linen;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 28
text: And the twisted head-dress for Aaron, and beautiful head-dresses of linen, and linen trousers,

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 29
text: And a linen band worked with a design of blue and purple and red, as the Lord had said to Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 30
text: The plate for the holy crown was made of the best gold, and on it were cut these words, HOLY TO THE LORD.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 31
text: It was fixed to the head-dress by a blue cord, as the Lord had given orders to Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 32
text: So all the work on the House of the Tent of meeting was done; as the Lord had given orders to Moses, so the children of Israel did it.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 33
text: Then they took the House to Moses, the tent with all the things for it; its hooks, its boards, its rods, its pillars, and its bases;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 34
text: The outer cover of sheepskins coloured red, and the cover of leather, and the veil for the doorway;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 35
text: The ark of the law, with its rods and its cover;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 36
text: The table, with all its vessels and the holy bread;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 37
text: The support for the lights, with the vessels for the lights to be put in their places on it, and all its vessels, and the oil for the lights;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 38
text: And the gold altar, and the holy oil, and the sweet perfume for burning, and the curtain for the doorway of the tent;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 39
text: And the brass altar, with its network of brass, and its rods and all its vessels, and the washing-vessel and its base;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 40
text: The hangings for the open space, with the pillars and their bases, and the curtain for the doorway, and the cords and nails, and all the instruments necessary for the work of the House of the Tent of meeting;

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 41
text: The robes for use in the holy place, and the holy robes for Aaron and his sons when acting as priests.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 42
text: The children of Israel did everything as the Lord had given orders to Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 39 Verse 43
text: Then Moses, when he saw all their work and saw that they had done everything as the Lord had said, gave them his blessing.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 2
text: On the first day of the first month you are to put up the House of the Tent of meeting.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 3
text: And inside it put the ark of the law, hanging the veil before it.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 4
text: And put the table inside, placing all the things on it in order; and put in the support for the lights, and let its lights be burning.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 5
text: And put the gold altar for burning perfumes in front of the ark of the law, hanging the curtain over the doorway of the House.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 6
text: And put the altar of burned offerings before the doorway of the House of the Tent of meeting.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 7
text: And let the washing-vessel, with water in it, be put between the Tent of meeting and the altar.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 8
text: And put up the hangings forming the open space all round it, with the curtain over its doorway.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 9
text: And take the holy oil and put it on the House and everything in it, and make it and everything in it holy:

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 10
text: And put oil on the altar of burned offering, and make it and all its vessels holy; this altar is to be most holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 11
text: And put oil on the washing-vessel and its base, and make them holy.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 12
text: Then let Aaron and his sons come to the door of the Tent of meeting; and after washing them with water,

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 13
text: You are to put on Aaron the holy robes; and you are to put oil on him, and make him holy, so that he may be my priest.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 14
text: And take his sons with him and put coats on them;

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 15
text: And put oil on them as you did on their father, so that they may be my priests: the putting on of oil will make them priests for ever, from generation to generation.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 16
text: And Moses did this; as the Lord gave him orders, so he did.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 17
text: So on the first day of the first month in the second year the House was put up.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 18
text: Moses put up the House; placing its bases in position and lifting up its uprights, putting in the rods and planting the pillars in their places;

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 19
text: Stretching the outer tent over it, and covering it, as the Lord had given him orders.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 20
text: And he took the law and put it inside the ark, and put the rods at its side and the cover over it;

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 21
text: And he took the ark into the House, hanging up the veil before it as the Lord had given him orders.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 22
text: And he put the table in the Tent of meeting, on the north side outside the veil.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 23
text: And he put the bread on it in order before the Lord, as the Lord had said.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 24
text: The support for the lights he put in the Tent of meeting, opposite the table, on the south side:

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 25
text: Lighting the lights before the Lord, as the Lord had given him orders.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 26
text: And he put the gold altar in the Tent of meeting, in front of the veil:

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 27
text: Burning sweet perfumes on it, as the Lord had given him orders.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 28
text: And he put up the curtain at the doorway of the House.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 29
text: And at the door of the House of the Tent of meeting, he put the altar of burned offerings, offering on it the burned offering and the meal offering, as the Lord had given him orders.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 30
text: And between the altar and the Tent of meeting he put the vessel with water in it for washing.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 31
text: In it the hands and feet of Moses and Aaron and his sons were washed,

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 32
text: Whenever they went into the Tent of meeting, and when they came near the altar, as the Lord had given orders to Moses.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 33
text: And he put up the hangings forming the open space round the House and the altar, and put the curtain over the doorway. So Moses made the work complete.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 34
text: Then the cloud came down covering the Tent of meeting, and the House was full of the glory of the Lord;

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 35
text: So that Moses was not able to go into the Tent of meeting, because the cloud was resting on it, and the House was full of the glory of the Lord.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 36
text: And whenever the cloud was taken up from the House, the children of Israel went forward on their journey:

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 37
text: But while the cloud was there, they made no move till it was taken up.

title: Exodus Chapter 40 Verse 38
text: For the cloud of the Lord was resting on the House by day, and at night there was fire in the cloud, before the eyes of all the people of Israel, and so it was through all their journeys.

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: And the voice of the Lord came to Moses out of the Tent of meeting, saying,

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Give these orders to the children of Israel: When anyone of you makes an offering to the Lord, you are to take it from the cattle, from the herd or from the flock.

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: If the offering is a burned offering of the herd, let him give a male without a mark: he is to give it at the door of the Tent of meeting so that he may be pleasing to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And he is to put his hand on the head of the burned offering and it will be taken for him, to take away his sin.

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And the ox is to be put to death before the Lord: then Aaron's sons, the priests, are to take the blood and put some of it on and round the altar which is at the door of the Tent of meeting.

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And the burned offering is to be skinned and cut up into its parts.

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And Aaron's sons, the priests, are to put fire on the altar and put the wood in order on the fire:

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And Aaron's sons, the priests, are to put the parts, the head and the fat, in order on the wood which is on the fire on the altar:

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: But its inside parts and its legs are to be washed with water, and it will all be burned on the altar by the priest for a burned offering, an offering made by fire, for a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And if his offering is of the flock, a burned offering of sheep or goats, let him give a male without a mark.

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And he is to put it to death on the north side of the altar before the Lord: and Aaron's sons, the priests, are to put some of the blood on and round the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And the offering is to be cut into its parts, with its head and its fat; and the priest is to put them in order on the wood which is on the fire on the altar:

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: But the inside parts and the legs are to be washed with water; and the priest will make an offering of all of it, burning it on the altar: it is a burned offering, an offering made by fire, for a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And if his offering to the Lord is a burned offering of birds, then he is to make his offering of doves or of young pigeons.

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And the priest is to take it to the altar, and after its head has been twisted off, it is to be burned on the altar, and its blood drained out on the side of the altar:

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And he is to take away its stomach, with its feathers, and put it down by the east side of the altar, where the burned waste is put:

title: Leviticus Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And let it be broken open at the wings, but not cut in two; and let it be burned on the altar by the priest on the wood which is on the fire; it is a burned offering; an offering made by fire for a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And when anyone makes a meal offering to the Lord, let his offering be of the best meal, with oil on it and perfume:

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And let him take it to Aaron's sons, the priests; and having taken in his hand some of the meal and of the oil, with all the perfume, let him give it to the priest to be burned on the altar, as a sign, an offering made by fire, for a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And the rest of the meal offering will be for Aaron and his sons; it is most holy among the Lord's fire offerings.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And when you give a meal offering cooked in the oven, let it be of unleavened cakes of the best meal mixed with oil, or thin unleavened cakes covered with oil.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: And if you give a meal offering cooked on a flat plate, let it be of the best meal, unleavened and mixed with oil.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: Let it be broken into bits, and put oil on it; it is a meal offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And if your offering is of meal cooked in fat over the fire, let it be made of the best meal mixed with oil.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And you are to give the meal offering made of these things to the Lord, and let the priest take it to the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And he is to take from the meal offering a part, for a sign, burning it on the altar; an offering made by fire for a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And the rest of the meal offering will be for Aaron and his sons; it is most holy among the Lord's fire offerings.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: No meal offering which you give to the Lord is to be made with leaven; no leaven or honey is to be burned as an offering made by fire to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: You may give them as an offering of first-fruits to the Lord, but they are not to go up as a sweet smell on the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And every meal offering is to be salted with salt; your meal offering is not to be without the salt of the agreement of your God: with all your offerings give salt.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And if you give a meal offering of first-fruits to the Lord, give, as your offering of first-fruits, new grain, made dry with fire, crushed new grain.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And put oil on it and perfume: it is a meal offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And part of the meal of the offering and part of the oil and all the perfume is to be burned for a sign by the priest: it is an offering made by fire to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: And if his offering is given for a peace-offering; if he gives of the herd, male or female, let him give it without any mark on it, before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And he is to put his hand on the head of his offering and put it to death at the door of the Tent of meeting; and Aaron's sons, the priests, are to put some of the blood on and round the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: And he is to give of the peace-offering, as an offering made by fire to the Lord; the fat covering the inside parts and all the fat on the inside parts,

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And the two kidneys, and the fat on them, which is by the top part of the legs, and the fat joining the liver and the kidneys, he is to take away;

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: That it may be burned by Aaron's sons on the altar, on the burned offering which is on the wood on the fire: it is an offering made by fire of a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And if what he gives for a peace-offering to the Lord is of the flock, let him give a male or female, without any mark on it.

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: If his offering is a lamb, then let it be placed before the Lord:

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And he is to put his hand on the head of his offering and put it to death before the Tent of meeting; and Aaron's sons are to put some of its blood on and round the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: And of the peace-offering, let him give an offering made by fire to the Lord; the fat of it, all the fat tail, he is to take away near the backbone; and the fat covering the inside parts and all the fat on the inside parts,

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And the two kidneys, with the fat on them, which is by the top part of the legs, and the fat joining the liver and the kidneys, he is to take away;

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: That it may be burned by the priest on the altar; it is the food of the offering made by fire to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: And if his offering is a goat, then let it be placed before the Lord,

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And let him put his hand on the head of it and put it to death before the Tent of meeting; and the sons of Aaron are to put some of its blood on and round the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And of it let him make his offering, an offering made by fire to the Lord; the fat covering the inside parts and all the fat on the inside parts,

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And the two kidneys, with the fat on them, which is by the top part of the legs, and the fat joining the liver and the kidneys, let him take away;

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: That it may be burned by the priest on the altar; it is the food of the offering made by fire for a sweet smell: all the fat is the Lord's.

title: Leviticus Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: Let it be an order for ever, through all your generations, in all your houses, that you are not to take fat or blood for food.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: Say to the children of Israel: These are the offerings of anyone who does wrong through error, doing any of the things which by the Lord's order are not to be done:

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: If the chief priest by doing wrong becomes a cause of sin to the people, then let him give to the Lord for the sin which he has done, an ox, without any mark, for a sin-offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And he is to take the ox to the door of the Tent of meeting before the Lord; and put his hand on its head and put it to death before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: And the chief priest is to take some of its blood and take it to the Tent of meeting;

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And the priest is to put his finger in the blood, shaking drops of it before the Lord seven times, in front of the veil of the holy place.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And the priest is to put some of the blood on the horns of the altar on which perfume is burned before the Lord in the Tent of meeting, draining out all the rest of the blood of the ox at the base of the altar of burned offering which is at the door of the Tent of meeting.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And he is to take away all the fat of the ox of the sin-offering; the fat covering the inside parts and all the fat of the inside parts,

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And the two kidneys, with the fat on them, which is by the top part of the legs, and the fat joining the liver and the kidneys, he is to take away,

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: As it is taken from the ox of the peace-offering; and it is to be burned by the priest on the altar of burned offerings.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And the skin of the ox and all its flesh, with its head and its legs and its inside parts and its waste,

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: All the ox, he is to take away outside the circle of the tents into a clean place where the burned waste is put, and there it is to be burned on wood with fire.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And if all the people of Israel do wrong, without anyone's knowledge; if they have done any of the things which by the Lord's order are not to be done, causing sin to come on them;

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: When the sin which they have done comes to light, then let all the people give an ox for a sin-offering, and take it before the Tent of meeting.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: And let the chiefs of the people put their hands on its head before the Lord, and put the ox to death before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: And the priest is to take some of its blood to the Tent of meeting;

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: And put his finger in the blood, shaking drops of the blood seven times before the Lord in front of the veil.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: And he is to put some of the blood on the horns of the altar which is before the Lord in the Tent of meeting; and all the rest of the blood is to be drained out at the base of the altar of burned offering at the door of the Tent of meeting.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: And he is to take off all its fat, burning it on the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: Let him do with the ox as he did with the ox of the sin-offering; and the priest will take away their sin and they will have forgiveness.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: Then let the ox be taken away outside the tent-circle, that it may be burned as the other ox was burned; it is the sin-offering for all the people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: If a ruler does wrong, and in error does any of the things which, by the order of the Lord his God, are not to be done, causing sin to come on him;

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: When the sin which he has done is made clear to him, let him give for his offering a goat, a male without any mark.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: And he is to put his hand on the head of the goat and put it to death in the place where they put to death the burned offering before the Lord: it is a sin-offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: And the priest is to take some of the blood of the offering with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burned offering, draining out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar of burned offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: And all the fat of it is to be burned on the altar like the fat of the peace-offering; and the priest will take away his sin and he will have forgiveness.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 27
text: And if any one of the common people does wrong in error, doing any of the things which the Lord has given orders are not to be done, causing sin to come on him;

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 28
text: When the sin which he has done is made clear to him, then he is to give for his offering a goat, a female without any mark, for the sin which he has done.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 29
text: And he is to put his hand on the head of the sin-offering and put it to death in the place where they put to death the burned offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 30
text: And the priest is to take some of the blood with his finger, and put it on the horns of the altar of burned offering, and all the rest of its blood is to be drained out at the base of the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 31
text: And let all its fat be taken away, as the fat is taken away from the peace-offerings, and let it be burned on the altar by the priest for a sweet smell to the Lord; and the priest will take away his sin and he will have forgiveness.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 32
text: And if he gives a lamb as his sin-offering, let it be a female without any mark;

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 33
text: And he is to put his hand on the head of the offering and put it to death for a sin-offering in the place where they put to death the burned offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 34
text: And the priest is to take some of the blood of the offering with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burned offering, and all the rest of the blood is to be drained out at the base of the altar;

title: Leviticus Chapter 4 Verse 35
text: And let him take away all its fat, as the fat is taken away from the lamb of the peace-offerings; and let it be burned by the priest on the altar among the offerings made by fire to the Lord: and the priest will take away his sin and he will have forgiveness.

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: And if anyone does wrong by saying nothing when he is put under oath as a witness of something he has seen or had knowledge of, then he will be responsible:

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: If anyone becomes unclean through touching unconsciously some unclean thing, such as the dead body of an unclean beast or of unclean cattle or of any unclean animal which goes flat on the earth, he will be responsible:

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: Or if he becomes unclean through touching unconsciously any unclean thing of man, whatever it may be, when it is made clear to him he will be responsible:

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: Or if anyone, without thought, takes an oath to do evil or to do good, whatever he says without thought, with an oath, having no knowledge of what he is doing; when it becomes clear to him, he will be responsible for any of these things.

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: And whoever is responsible for any such sin, let him make a statement openly of his wrongdoing;

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And take to the Lord the offering for the wrong which he has done, a female from the flock, a lamb or a goat, for a sin-offering, and the priest will take away his sin.

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: And if he has not money enough for a lamb, then let him give, for his offering to the Lord, two doves or two young pigeons; one for a sin-offering and one for a burned offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: And let him take them to the priest, who will first give the sin-offering, twisting off its head from its neck, but not cutting it in two;

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: And he is to put drops of the blood of the offering on the side of the altar, and the rest of the blood is to be drained out at the base of the altar; it is a sin-offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And the second is for a burned offering, in agreement with the law; and the priest will take away his sin and he will have forgiveness.

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: But if he has not enough money for two doves or two young pigeons, then let him give, for the sin he has done, the tenth part of an ephah of the best meal, for a sin-offering; let him put no oil on it, and no perfume, for it is a sin-offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: And let him come to the priest with it, and the priest will take some of it in his hand, to be burned on the altar as a sign, among the offerings of the Lord made by fire: it is a sin-offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 13
