text: And the priest will take away his sin and he will have forgiveness: and the rest of the offering will be the priest's, in the same way as the meal offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: If anyone is untrue, sinning in error in connection with the holy things of the Lord, let him take his offering to the Lord, a male sheep from the flock, without any mark, of the value fixed by you in silver by shekels, by the scale of the holy place.

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: And he is to make payment to the priest for what he has done wrong in relation to the holy thing, together with a fifth part of its value in addition; and the priest will take away his sin by the sheep of his offering, and he will have forgiveness.

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: And if anyone does wrong, and does any of the things which the Lord has given orders are not to be done, though he has no knowledge of it, still he is in the wrong and he is responsible.

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: Let him come to the priest with a sheep, a male without any mark out of the flock, of the value fixed by you, as an offering for his error; and the priest will take away the sin which he did in error, and he will have forgiveness.

title: Leviticus Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: It is an offering for his error: he is certainly responsible before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: If anyone does wrong, and is untrue to the Lord, acting falsely to his neighbour in connection with something put in his care, or something given for a debt, or has taken away anything by force, or has been cruel to his neighbour,

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: Or has taken a false oath about the loss of something which he has come across by chance; if a man has done any of these evil things,

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: Causing sin to come on him, then he will have to give back the thing he took by force or got by cruel acts, or the goods which were put in his care or the thing he came on by chance,

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: Or anything about which he took a false oath; he will have to give it all back, with the addition of a fifth of its value, to him whose property it is, when he has been judged to be in the wrong.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: Then let him take to the Lord the offering for his wrongdoing; giving to the priest for his offering, a male sheep from the flock, without any mark, of the value fixed by you:

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And the priest will take away his sin from before the Lord, and he will have forgiveness for whatever crime he has done

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: Give orders to Aaron and to his sons, saying, This is the law for the burned offering: the offering is to be on the fire-wood on the altar all night till the morning; and the fire of the altar is to be kept burning.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And the priest is to put on his linen robes and his linen trousers, and take up what is over of the offering after it has been burned on the altar, and put it by the side of the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: Then having taken off his linen robes and put on other clothing, he is to take it away into a clean place, outside the tent-circle.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: The fire on the altar is to be kept burning; it is never to go out; every morning the priest is to put wood on it, placing the burned offering in order on it, and there the fat of the peace-offering is to be burned.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: Let the fire be kept burning on the altar at all times; it is never to go out.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: And this is the law for the meal offering: it is to be offered to the Lord before the altar by the sons of Aaron.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: The priest is to take in his hand some of the meal of the meal offering and of the oil of it, and all the perfume on it, burning it on the altar as a sign, for a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: And whatever is over Aaron and his sons may have for their food, taking it without leaven in a holy place; in the open space of the Tent of meeting they may take a meal of it.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: It is not to be cooked with leaven. I have given it to them as their part of the offerings made by fire to me; it is most holy, as are the sin-offerings and the offerings for error.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: Every male among the children of Aaron may have it for food; it is their right for ever through all your generations, from the offerings made by fire to the Lord: anyone touching them will be holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: This is the offering which Aaron and his sons are to make to the Lord on the day when he is made a priest: the tenth part of an ephah of the best meal for a meal offering for ever; half of it in the morning and half in the evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: Let it be made with oil on a flat plate; when it is well mixed and cooked, let it be broken and taken in as a meal offering, for a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: And the same offering is to be given by that one of his sons who takes his place as priest; by an order for ever, all of it is to be burned before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: Every meal offering offered for the priest is to be completely burned: nothing of it is to be taken for food.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: Say to Aaron and his sons, This is the law for the sin-offering: the sin-offering is to be put to death before the Lord in the same place as the burned offering; it is most holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: The priest by whom it is offered for sin, is to take it for his food in a holy place, in the open space of the Tent of meeting.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: Anyone touching the flesh of it will be holy: and if any of the blood is dropped on any clothing, the thing on which the blood has been dropped is to be washed in a holy place.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 28
text: But the vessel of earth in which the flesh was cooked is to be broken; or if a brass vessel was used, it is to be rubbed clean and washed out with water.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 29
text: Every male among the priests may take it for his food: it is most holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 6 Verse 30
text: No sin-offering, the blood of which is taken into the Tent of meeting, to take away sin in the holy place, may be used for food: it is to be burned with fire.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: And this is the law of the offering for wrongdoing: it is most holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: They are to put to death the offering for wrongdoing in the same place as the burned offering; and the priest is to put the blood on and round the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: And all the fat of it, the fat tail and the fat covering the inside parts, is to be given as an offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: And the two kidneys, and the fat on them, which is by the top of the legs, and the fat joining the liver and the kidneys, he is to take away:

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: They are to be burned by the priest on the altar for an offering made by fire to the Lord: it is an offering for wrongdoing.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: Every male among the priests may have it as food in a holy place: it is most holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: As is the sin-offering, so is the offering for wrongdoing; there is one law for them: the priest who makes the offering to take away sin, he is to have it.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: And the priest offering any man's burned offering for him, may have the skin of the burned offering which is offered by him.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: And every meal offering which is cooked in the oven and everything made in a cooking pot or on a flat plate, is for the priest by whom it is offered.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And every meal offering, mixed with oil or dry, is for all the sons of Aaron in equal measure.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: And this is the law for the peace-offerings offered to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: If any man gives his offering as a praise-offering, then let him give with the offering, unleavened cakes mixed with oil and thin unleavened cakes covered with oil and cakes of the best meal well mixed with oil.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: With his peace-offering let him give cakes of leavened bread, as a praise-offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: And let him give one out of every offering to be lifted up before the Lord; that it may be for the priest who puts the blood of the peace-offering on the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: And the flesh of the praise-offering is to be taken as food on the day when it is offered; no part of it may be kept till the morning.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: But if his offering is made because of an oath or given freely, it may be taken as food on the day when it is offered; and the rest may be used up on the day after:

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: But if any of the flesh of the offering is still unused on the third day, it is to be burned with fire.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: And if any of the flesh of the peace-offering is taken as food on the third day, it will not be pleasing to God and will not be put to the account of him who gives it; it will be unclean and a cause of sin to him who takes it as food.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: And flesh touched by any unclean thing may not be taken for food: it is to be burned with fire; and as for the flesh of the peace-offerings, everyone who is clean may take it as food:

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: But he who is unclean when he takes as food the flesh of the peace-offerings, which are the Lord's, will be cut off from his people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: And anyone who, after touching any unclean thing of man or an unclean beast or any unclean and disgusting thing, takes as food the flesh of the peace-offerings, which are the Lord's, will be cut off from his people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: Say to the children of Israel: You are not to take any fat, of ox or sheep or goat, for food.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: And the fat of that which comes to a natural death, and the fat of that which is attacked by beasts, may be used for other purposes, but not in any way for food.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: For anyone who takes as food the fat of any beast of which men make an offering by fire to the Lord, will be cut off from his people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: And you are not to take for food any blood, of bird or of beast, in any of your houses.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: Whoever takes any blood for food will be cut off from his people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: Say to the children of Israel: He who makes a peace-offering to the Lord, is to give an offering to the Lord out of his peace-offering:

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 30
text: He himself is to take to the Lord the offering made by fire, even the fat with the breast, so that the breast may be waved for a wave offering before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 31
text: And the fat is to be burned by the priest on the altar, but the breast is for Aaron and his sons.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 32
text: And the right leg you are to give to the priest for an offering to be lifted up out of what is given for your peace-offerings.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 33
text: That man, among the sons of Aaron, by whom the blood of the peace-offering and the fat are offered, is to have the right leg for his part.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 34
text: For the breast which is waved and the right leg which is lifted up on high I have taken from the children of Israel, from their peace-offerings, and have given them to Aaron the priest and to his sons as their right for ever from the children of Israel.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 35
text: This is the holy part given to Aaron and to his sons, out of the offerings made to the Lord by fire, on the day when they were made priests before the Lord;

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 36
text: Which the Lord said the children of Israel were to give them, on the day when he made them his priests. It is their right for ever from generation to generation.

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 37
text: These are the laws for the burned offering, the meal offering, and the offering for wrongdoing; and for the making of priests, and for the giving of peace-offerings;

title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Verse 38
text: As they were given by the Lord to Moses on Mount Sinai, on the day when the Lord gave orders to the children of Israel to make their offerings to the Lord, in the waste land of Sinai.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: Take Aaron, and his sons with him, and the robes and the holy oil and the ox of the sin-offering and the two male sheep and the basket of unleavened bread;

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And let all the people come together at the door of the Tent of meeting.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: And Moses did as the Lord said, and all the people came together at the door of the Tent of meeting.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And Moses said to the people, This is what the Lord has given orders to be done.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: Then Moses took Aaron and his sons; and after washing them with water,

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: He put the coat on him, making it tight with its band, and then the robe, and over it the ephod, with its band of needlework to keep it in place.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And he put the priest's bag on him, and in the bag he put the Urim and Thummim.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: And on his head he put the head-dress, and in front of the head-dress the plate of gold, the holy crown, as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And Moses took the holy oil and put it on the House and on all the things in it, to make them holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: Seven times he put oil on the altar and on all its vessels, and on the washing-basin and its base, to make them holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And some of the oil he put on Aaron's head, to make him holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: Then he took Aaron's sons, clothing them with the coats, and putting the bands round them, and the head-dresses on their heads, as the Lord had given him orders.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: And he took the ox of the sin-offering: and Aaron and his sons put their hands on the head of the ox,

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: And he put it to death; and Moses took the blood and put it on the horns of the altar and round it with his finger, and made the altar clean, draining out the blood at the base of the altar; so he made it holy, taking away what was unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: And he took all the fat on the inside parts, and the fat on the liver, and the two kidneys with their fat, to be burned on the altar;

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: But the ox, with its skin and its flesh and its waste, was burned with fire outside the tent-circle, as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: And he put the male sheep of the burned offering before the Lord, and Aaron and his sons put their hands on its head,

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: And he put it to death; and Moses put some of the blood on and round the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: And when the sheep had been cut into parts, the head and the parts and the fat were burned by Moses.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: And the inside parts and the legs were washed with water and all the sheep was burned by Moses on the altar; it was a burned offering for a sweet smell: it was an offering made by fire to the Lord, as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: And he put the other sheep before the Lord, the sheep with which they were made priests; and Aaron and his sons put their hands on the head of the sheep,

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: And he put it to death; and Moses took some of the blood and put it on the point of Aaron's right ear and on the thumb of his right hand and on the great toe of his right foot.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: Then he took Aaron's sons, and Moses put some of the blood on the point of their right ears and on the thumbs of their right hands and on the great toes of their right feet: and Moses put the blood on and round the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: And he took the fat, and the fat tail, and the fat on the inside parts, and the fat on the liver, and the two kidneys with their fat, and the right leg;

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: And out of the basket of unleavened bread which was before the Lord he took one unleavened cake, and one cake of bread with oil on it, and one thin cake, and put them on the fat and on the right leg:

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: And he put them all on the hands of Aaron and on the hands of his sons, waving them for a wave offering before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: And Moses took them from their hands, and they were burned on the altar on the burned offering, as a priest's offering for a sweet smell, an offering made by fire to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: And Moses took the breast, waving it for a wave offering before the Lord; it was Moses' part of the sheep of the priest's offering, as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 30
text: And Moses took some of the holy oil and of the blood which was on the altar and put it on Aaron and on his robes, and on his sons and on his sons' robes; and made Aaron holy, and his robes and his sons and his sons' robes with him.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 31
text: And Moses said to Aaron and to his sons, The flesh is to be cooked in water at the door of the Tent of meeting, and there you are to take it as food, together with the bread in the basket, as I have given orders, saying, It is the food of Aaron and his sons.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 32
text: And that which is over of the flesh and of the bread is to be burned with fire.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 33
text: And you are not to go out from the door of the Tent of meeting for seven days, till the days for making you priest are ended; for this will be the work of seven days.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 34
text: What has been done this day, has been ordered by the Lord to take away your sin.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 35
text: And you are to keep watch for the Lord at the door of the Tent of meeting day and night for seven days, so that death may not come to you: for so he has given me orders.

title: Leviticus Chapter 8 Verse 36
text: And Aaron and his sons did all the things about which the Lord had given orders through Moses.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: And on the eighth day Moses sent for Aaron and his sons and the responsible men of Israel;

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: And he said to Aaron, Take a young ox for a sin-offering and a male sheep for a burned offering, without a mark, and make an offering of them before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And say to the children of Israel: Take a he-goat for a sin-offering, and a young ox and a lamb, in their first year, without any mark on them, for a burned offering;

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: And an ox and a male sheep for peace-offerings, to be put to death before the Lord; and a meal offering mixed with oil: for this day you are to see the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: And they took the things ordered by Moses, before the Tent of meeting, and all the people came near, waiting before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: And Moses said, This is what the Lord has said you are to do; and you will see the glory of the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: And Moses said to Aaron, Come near to the altar and make your sin-offering and your burned offering to take away your sin and the sin of the people, and make the people's offering to take away their sin; as the Lord has given orders.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: So Aaron came near to the altar and put to death the ox for the sin-offering for himself;

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: And the sons of Aaron gave him the blood and he put his finger in the blood and put it on the horns of the altar, draining out the blood at the base of the altar;

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: But the fat and the kidneys and the fat on the liver of the sin-offering were burned by him on the altar as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: And the flesh and the skin were burned with fire outside the tent-circle;

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And he put to death the burned offering; and Aaron's sons gave him the blood and he put some of it on and round the altar;

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: And they gave him the parts of the burned offering, in their order, and the head, to be burned on the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: And the inside parts and the legs, when they had been washed with water, were burned on the burned offering on the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: And he made an offering for the people and took the goat of the sin-offering for the people and put it to death, offering it for sin, in the same way as the first.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: And he took the burned offering, offering it in the ordered way;

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: And he put the meal offering before the Lord, and taking some of it in his hand he had it burned on the altar, separately from the burned offering of the morning.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: And he put to death the ox and the sheep, which were the peace-offerings for the people; and Aaron's sons gave him the blood and he put some of it on and round the altar;

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: And as for the fat of the ox and the fat tail of the sheep and the fat covering the inside parts and the kidneys and the fat on the liver;

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: They put the fat on the breasts, and the fat was burned on the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: And Aaron took the breasts and the right leg, waving them for a wave offering before the Lord, as Moses gave orders.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: And Aaron, lifting up his hands to the people, gave them a blessing; and he came down from offering the sin-offering, and the burned offering, and the peace-offerings.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: And Moses and Aaron went into the Tent of meeting, and came out and gave the people a blessing, and the glory of the Lord was seen by all the people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: And fire came out from before the Lord, burning up the offering on the altar and the fat: and when all the people saw it, they gave a loud cry, falling down on their faces.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: And Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, took their vessels and put fire in them and perfume, burning strange fire before the Lord, which he had not given them orders to do.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: And fire came out from before the Lord, burning them up and causing their destruction before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: Then Moses said to Aaron, This is what the Lord said, I will be holy in the eyes of all those who come near to me, and I will be honoured before all the people. And Aaron said nothing.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: And Moses sent for Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel, the brother of Aaron's father, and said to them, Come near and take your brothers away from before the holy place, outside the tent-circle.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: So they came and took them, in their coats, outside the tent-circle, as Moses had said.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: And Moses said to Aaron and to Eleazar and Ithamar, his sons, Do not let your hair be loose, and give no signs of grief; so that death may not overtake you, and his wrath come on all the people; but let there be weeping among your brothers and all the house of Israel for this burning of the Lord's fire.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And do not go out from the door of the Tent of meeting, or death will come to you; for the holy oil of the Lord is on you. And they did as Moses said.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: And the Lord said to Aaron:

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: Take no wine, or strong drink, you or your sons with you, when you go into the Tent of meeting, that it may not be the cause of death to you; this is an order for ever through all your generations.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And make a division between the holy and the common, and between the unclean and the clean;

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: Teaching the children of Israel all the laws which the Lord has given them by the hand of Moses.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: And Moses said to Aaron and to Eleazar and Ithamar, his sons who were still living, Take the rest of the meal offering from the offerings of the Lord made by fire, and take it for your food, without leaven, at the side of the altar, for it is most holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: It is to be for your food in a holy place, because it is your right and your sons' right, from the offerings of the Lord made by fire: for so am I ordered.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: And the breast which is waved and the leg which is lifted up on high, you are to take as your food in a clean place; you and your sons and your daughters with you: for they are given to you as your right and your sons' right, from the peace-offerings of the children of Israel.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: Let them take the breast which is waved and the leg which is lifted up on high, with the fat of the burned offering, to be waved for a wave offering before the Lord; and this will be for you and for your sons with you, for a right for ever, as the Lord has given orders.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: And Moses was looking for the goat of the sin-offering, but it was burned; and he was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron, who were still living, saying,

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: Why did you not make a meal of the sin-offering in the holy place? For it is most holy and he has given it to you, so that the sin of the people may be put on it, to take away their sin before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: See, its blood was not taken into the holy place: certainly it was right for you to have taken it as food in the holy place, as I gave orders.

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: And Aaron said to Moses, You have seen that today they have made their sin-offering and their burned offering before the Lord, and such things as these have come on me. If I had taken the sin-offering as food today, would it have been pleasing to the Lord?

title: Leviticus Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: And after hearing this, Moses was no longer angry.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: Say to the children of Israel: These are the living things which you may have for food among all the beasts on the earth.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: You may have as food any beast which has a division in the horn of its foot, and whose food comes back into its mouth to be crushed again.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: But, at the same time, of those beasts, you may not take for food the camel, because its food comes back but the horn of its foot is not parted in two; it is unclean to you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And the rock-badger, for the same reason, is unclean to you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And the hare, because the horn of its foot is not parted in two, is unclean to you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: And the pig is unclean to you, because though the horn of its foot is parted, its food does not come back.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: Their flesh may not be used for food, and their dead bodies may not even be touched; they are unclean to you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: These you may have for food of all things living in the water: anything living in the water, in the seas or rivers, which has special parts for swimming and skin formed of thin plates, may be used for food.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: All other things living and moving in the water, in the sea or in the rivers, are a disgusting thing to you;

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: They may not be used for food, and their dead bodies are disgusting to you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: Anything in the water which has no special parts for swimming and no thin plates on its skin is disgusting to you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: And among birds these are to be disgusting to you, and not to be used for food: the eagle and the gier-eagle and the ospray;

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And the kite and the falcon, and birds of that sort;

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: Every raven, and birds of that sort;

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: And the ostrich and the night-hawk and the sea-hawk, and birds of that sort;

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: And the little owl and the cormorant and the great owl;

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: And the water-hen and the pelican and the vulture;

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: The stork and the heron, and birds of that sort, and the hoopoe and the bat.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: Every winged four-footed thing which goes on the earth is disgusting to you;

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: But of the winged four-footed things, those which have long legs for jumping on the earth you may have for food;

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: Such as all the different sorts of locust.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: But all other winged four-footed things which go on the earth are disgusting to you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: By these you will be made unclean; anyone touching their dead bodies will be unclean till evening:

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: Whoever takes away the dead body of one of them is to have his clothing washed, and will be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: Every beast, in the horn of whose foot there is not a complete division, and whose food does not come back, is unclean to you: anyone touching one of these will be unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: Any four-footed beast which goes on the ball of its foot, is unclean to you: anyone touching the dead body of one of these will be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: Anyone who takes away the dead body of one of these is to have his clothing washed and be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: And these are unclean to you among things which go low down on the earth; the weasel and the mouse and the great lizard, and animals of that sort;

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: And the ferret and the land crocodile and the lizard and the sand-lizard and the chameleon.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: All these are unclean to you: anyone touching them when they are dead will be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: The dead body of any of these, falling on anything, will make that thing unclean; if it is any vessel of wood, or clothing, or skin, or bag, whatever it is, if it is used for any purpose, it will have to be put into water, and will be unclean till evening; after that it will be clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: And if one of them gets into any vessel of earth, whatever is in the vessel will be unclean and the vessel will have to be broken.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 34
text: Any food in it, and anything on which water from it comes, will be unclean: any drink taken from such a vessel will be unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 35
text: Any part of the dead body of one of these, falling on anything, will make it unclean; if it is an oven or a cooking-pot it will have to be broken: they are unclean and will be unclean to you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 36
text: But at the same time a fountain or a place where water is stored for use will be clean; but anyone touching their dead bodies will be unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 37
text: If any part of the dead body of one of these gets on to any seed for planting, it is clean;

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 38
text: But if water is put on the seed, and any part of the dead body gets on to it, it will be unclean to you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 39
text: And if any beast which may be used for food comes to a natural death, anyone touching its dead body will be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 40
text: And he who makes use of any part of its body for food is to have his clothing washed and be unclean till evening; and anyone taking away its body is to have his clothing washed and be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 41
text: Everything which goes flat on its body on the earth is disgusting, and is not to be used for food.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 42
text: Whatever goes on its stomach or on four feet or has a great number of feet, even all those going flat on the earth, may not be used for food, for they are disgusting.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 43
text: You are not to make yourselves disgusting with anything which goes about flat on the earth; you may not make yourselves unclean with them, in such a way that you are not holy to me.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 44
text: For I am the Lord your God: for this reason, make and keep yourselves holy, for I am holy; you are not to make yourselves unclean with any sort of thing which goes about flat on the earth.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 45
text: For I am the Lord, who took you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God; so be you holy, for I am holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 46
text: This is the law about beasts and birds and every living thing moving in the waters, and every living thing which goes flat on the earth:

title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Verse 47
text: Marking out the unclean from the clean, and the living thing which may be used for food from that which may not.

title: Leviticus Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: Say to the children of Israel, If a woman is with child and gives birth to a male child, she will be unclean for seven days, as when she is unwell.

title: Leviticus Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: And on the eighth day let him be given circumcision.

title: Leviticus Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: And she will be unclean for thirty-three days till the flow of her blood is stopped; no holy thing may be touched by her, and she may not come into the holy place, till the days for making her clean are ended.

title: Leviticus Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: But if she gives birth to a female child, then she will be unclean for two weeks, as when she is unwell; and she will not be completely clean for sixty-six days.

title: Leviticus Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: And when the days are ended for making her clean for a son or a daughter, let her take to the priest at the door of the Tent of meeting, a lamb of the first year for a burned offering and a young pigeon or a dove for a sin-offering:

title: Leviticus Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: And the priest is to make an offering of it before the Lord and take away her sin, and she will be made clean from the flow of her blood. This is the law for a woman who gives birth to a male or a female.

title: Leviticus Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: And if she has not money enough for a lamb, then let her take two doves or two young pigeons, one for a burned offering and the other for a sin-offering, and the priest will take away her sin and she will be clean,

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: If a man has on his skin a growth or a mark or a white place, and it becomes the disease of a leper, let him be taken to Aaron the priest, or to one of the priests, his sons;

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: And if, when the priest sees the mark on his skin, the hair on the place is turned white and the mark seems to go deeper than the skin, it is the mark of a leper: and the priest, after looking at him, will say that he is unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: But if the mark on his skin is white, and does not seem to go deeper than the skin, and the hair on it is not turned white, then the priest will keep him shut up for seven days;

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: And the priest is to see him on the seventh day; and if, in his opinion, the place on his skin has not become worse and is not increased in size, then the priest will keep him shut up for seven days more:

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: And the priest is to see him again on the seventh day; and if the mark is less bright and is not increased on his skin, then let the priest say that he is clean: it is only a skin-mark, and after his clothing has been washed he will be clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: But if the size of the mark on his skin is increased after he has been seen by the priest, let him go to the priest again:

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: And if, after looking at him, he sees that the mark is increased in his skin, let the priest say that he is unclean; he is a leper.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: When the disease of a leper is seen on a man, let him be taken to the priest;

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: And if the priest sees that there is a white growth on the skin, and the hair is turned white, and there is diseased flesh in the growth,

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: It is an old disease in the skin of his flesh, and the priest will say that he is unclean; he will not have to be shut up, for he is clearly unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: And if the disease comes out all over his skin, from his head to his feet, as far as the priest is able to see,

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: And if the priest sees that all his flesh is covered with the leper's disease, the priest will say that he is clean: it is all turned white, he is clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: But whenever diseased flesh is seen on him, he will be unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: And when the priest sees the diseased flesh he will say that he is unclean; the diseased flesh is unclean, he is a leper.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: Or if the diseased flesh is turned again and changed to white then he is to come to the priest,

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: And the priest will see him: and if the place is turned white, then the priest will say that he is free from the disease.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: And if a bad place has come out on the skin and is well again,

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: And on the same place there is a white growth of a bright mark, red and white, then let the priest see it;

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: And after looking at it, if it seems to go deeper than the skin, and the hair on it is turned white, then the priest will say that the man is unclean: it is the leper's disease, it has come out in the bad place.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: But if, after looking at it, he sees that there are no white hairs on it, and it is not deeper than the skin, and it is not very bright, then let the priest keep him shut up for seven days:

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: And if it is increasing on the skin, the priest will say that he is unclean: it is a disease.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: But if the bright mark keeps in the same place and gets no greater, it is the mark of the old wound, and the priest will say that he is clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: Or if there is a burn on the skin of the flesh, and if the diseased flesh in the burn becomes a bright place, red and white or white,

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: The priest is to see it: and if the hair on the bright place is turned white and it seems to go deeper than the skin, he is a leper: it has come out in the burn, and the priest will say that he is unclean: it is the leper's disease.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 26
text: But if, after looking at it, the priest sees that there is no white hair on the bright place, and it is not deeper than the skin, and is not very bright, then let the priest keep him shut up for seven days:

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 27
text: And the priest is to see him again on the seventh day; if it is increased in the skin, then the priest will say that he is unclean: it is the leper's disease.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 28
text: And if the bright place keeps the same size and gets no greater on the skin, but is less bright, it is the effect of the burn, and the priest will say that he is clean: it is the mark of the burn.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 29
text: And when a man or a woman has a disease on the head, or in the hair of the chin,

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 30
text: Then the priest is to see the diseased place: and if it seems to go deeper than the skin, and if there is thin yellow hair in it, then the priest will say that he is unclean: he has the mark of the leper's disease on his head or in the hair of his chin.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 31
text: And after looking at the diseased place, if it does not seem to go deeper than the skin, and there is no black hair in it, then the priest will have him shut up for seven days:

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 32
text: And on the seventh day the priest will see the place: and if it is not increased, and there is no yellow hair in it, and it does not seem to go deeper than the skin,

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 33
text: Then his hair is to be cut off, but not on the diseased place, and he is to be shut up for seven days more:

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 34
text: And on the seventh day the priest will see the place: and if it is not increased, and does not seem to go deeper than the skin, the priest will say that he is clean: and after his clothing has been washed he will be clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 35
text: But if the disease in his skin becomes worse after he has been made clean,

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 36
text: Then the priest is to see him: and if the mark is increased, the priest, without looking for the yellow hair, will say that he is unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 37
text: But if, in his opinion, the growth is stopped, and black hair has come up on it, the disease has gone; he is clean and the priest will say that he is clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 38
text: And if a man or a woman has bright marks on the skin of their flesh, that is, bright white marks,

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 39
text: Then the priest is to see them: and if the white marks on their skin are not very bright, it is a skin disease which has come out on the skin; he is clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 40
text: And if a man's hair has come out and he has no hair, still he is clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 41
text: And if the hair has gone from the front part of his head, so that he has no hair there, still he is clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 42
text: But if, on his head or on his brow, where he has no hair, there is a red and white place, it is the disease of the leper coming out on his head or on his brow.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 43
text: Then if the priest sees that the growth of the disease has become red and white on his head or on his brow where there is no hair, like the mark in the skin of a leper;

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 44
text: He is a leper and unclean; the priest is to say that he is most certainly unclean: the disease is in his head.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 45
text: And the leper who has the disease on him is to go about with signs of grief, with his hair loose and his mouth covered, crying, Unclean, unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 46
text: While the disease is on him, he will be unclean. He is unclean: let him keep by himself, living outside the tent-circle.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 47
text: And any clothing of wool or of linen in which is the mark of the disease;

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 48
text: If it is in the threads of the linen or of the wool, or in leather, or in anything made of skin;

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 49
text: If there are red or green marks on the clothing, or on the leather, or in the threads of the cloth, or in anything made of skin, it is the leper's disease: let the priest see it.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 50
text: And after it has been seen by the priest, the thing which is so marked is to be shut up for seven days:

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 51
text: And he is to see the mark on the seventh day; if the mark is increased in the clothing, or in the threads of the material, or in the leather, whatever the leather is used for, it is the disease biting into it: it is unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 52
text: And the clothing, or the wool or linen material, or anything of leather in which is the disease, is to be burned: for the disease is biting into it; let it be burned in the fire.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 53
text: And if the priest sees that the mark is not increased in the clothing or in any part of the material or in the leather,

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 54
text: Then the priest will give orders for the thing on which the mark is, to be washed, and to be shut up for seven days more:

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 55
text: And if, after the mark has been washed, the priest sees that the colour of it is not changed and it is not increased, it is to be burned in the fire: the disease is working in it, though the damage may be inside or outside.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 56
text: And if the priest sees that the mark is less bright after the washing, then let him have it cut out of the clothing or the leather or from the threads of the material:

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 57
text: And if the mark is still seen in the clothing or in the threads of the material or in the leather, it is the disease coming out: the thing in which the disease is will have to be burned with fire.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 58
text: And the material of the clothing, or anything of skin, which has been washed, if the mark has gone out of it, let it be washed a second time and it will be clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 13 Verse 59
text: This is the law about the leper's disease in the thread of wool or linen material, in clothing or in anything of skin, saying how it is to be judged clean or unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: This is the law of the leper on the day when he is made clean: he is to be taken to the priest;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: And the priest is to go outside the tent-circle; and if, after looking, the priest sees that the mark of the disease has gone from him,

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: Then the priest is to give orders to take, for him who is to be made clean, two living clean birds and some cedar wood and red thread and hyssop.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: And the priest will give orders for one of the birds to be put to death in a vessel made of earth, over flowing water.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: And he will take the living bird and the wood and the red thread and the hyssop and put them in the blood of the bird which was put to death over flowing water.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: And shaking it seven times over the man who is to be made clean, he will say that he is clean and will let the living bird go free into the open country.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: And he who is to be made clean will have his clothing washed and his hair cut and have a bath, and he will be clean. And after that he will come back to the tent-circle; but he is to keep outside his tent for seven days.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: And on the seventh day he is to have all the hair cut off his head and his chin and over his eyes--all his hair is to be cut off--and he will have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water and he will be clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: And on the eighth day let him take two male lambs, without any marks on them, and one female lamb of the first year, without a mark, and three tenth parts of an ephah of the best meal, mixed with oil, and one log of oil.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: And the priest who is making him clean will put the man who is being made clean, together with these things, before the door of the Tent of meeting.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: And the priest is to take one of the male lambs and give it as an offering for wrongdoing, and the log of oil, waving them for a wave offering before the Lord;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: And he is to put the male lamb to death in the place where they put to death the sin-offering and the burned offering, in the holy place; for as the sin-offering is the property of the priest, so is the offering for wrongdoing: it is most holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: And let the priest take some of the blood of the offering for wrongdoing and put it on the point of the right ear of him who is to be made clean, and on the thumb of his right hand and on the great toe of his right foot;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: And take some of the oil and put it in the hollow of his left hand;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: And let the priest put his right finger in the oil which is in his left hand, shaking it out with his finger seven times before the Lord;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: And of the rest of the oil which is in his hand, the priest will put some on the point of the right ear of the man who is to be made clean, and on the thumb of his right hand and on the great toe of his right foot, over the blood of the offering for wrongdoing;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: And the rest of the oil in the priest's hand he will put on the head of him who is to be made clean; and so the priest will make him free from sin before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: And the priest will give the sin-offering, and take away the sin of him who is to be made clean from his unclean condition; and after that he will put the burned offering to death.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: And the priest is to have the burned offering and the meal offering burned on the altar; and the priest will take away his sin and he will be clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: And if he is poor and not able to get so much, then he may take one male lamb as an offering for wrongdoing, to be waved to take away his sin, and one tenth part of an ephah of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering, and a log of oil;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: And two doves or two young pigeons, such as he is able to get; and one will be for a sin-offering and the other for a burned offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: And on the eighth day he will take them to the priest, to the door of the Tent of meeting before the Lord, so that he may be made clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: And the priest will take the lamb of the offering for wrongdoing and the oil, waving them for a wave offering before the Lord;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: And he will put to death the lamb of the offering for wrongdoing and the priest will take some of the blood of the offering for wrongdoing and put it on the point of the right ear of him who is to be made clean, and on the thumb of his right hand and on the great toe of his right foot;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: And the priest will put out some of the oil in the hollow of his left hand,

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: Shaking out drops of oil with his right finger before the Lord seven times:

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: And the priest will put some of the oil which is in his hand on the point of the ear of the man who is to be made clean and on the thumb of his right hand and on the great toe of his right foot, on the place where the blood of the offering for wrongdoing was put;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 29
text: And the rest of the oil which is in the priest's hand he will put on the head of him who is to be made clean, to take away his sin before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 30
text: And he will make an offering of one of the doves or the young pigeons, such as he is able to get;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 31
text: And of these, he will give one for a sin-offering and one for a burned offering, with the meal offering; and the priest will take away the sin of him who is to be made clean before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 32
text: This is the law for the man who has the disease of the leper on him, and who is not able to get that which is necessary for making himself clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 33
text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 34
text: When you have come into the land of Canaan which I will give you for your heritage, if I put the leper's disease on a house in the land of your heritage,

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 35
text: Then let the owner of the house come and say to the priest, It seems to me that there is a sort of leper's disease in the house.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 36
text: And the priest will give orders for everything to be taken out of the house, before he goes in to see the disease, so that the things in the house may not become unclean; and then the priest is to go in to see the house;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 37
text: And if he sees that the walls of the house are marked with hollows of green and red, and if it seems to go deeper than the face of the wall;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 38
text: Then the priest will go out of the door of the house, and keep the house shut up for seven days:

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 39
text: And the priest is to come again on the seventh day and have a look and see if the marks on the walls of the house are increased in size;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 40
text: Then the priest will give orders to them to take out the stones in which the disease is seen, and put them out into an unclean place outside the town:

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 41
text: And he will have the house rubbed all over inside, and the paste which is rubbed off will be put out into an unclean place outside the town:

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 42
text: And they will take other stones and put them in place of those stones, and he will take other paste and put it on the walls of the house.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 43
text: And if the disease comes out again in the house after he has taken out the stones and after the walls have been rubbed and the new paste put on,

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 44
text: Then the priest will come and see it; and if the disease in the house is increased in size, it is the leper's disease working out in the house: it is unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 45
text: And the house will have to be pulled down, the stones of it and the wood and the paste; and everything is to be taken out to an unclean place outside the town.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 46
text: And, in addition, anyone who goes into the house at any time, while it is shut up, will be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 47
text: And anyone who has been sleeping in the house will have to have his clothing washed; and anyone who takes food in that house will have to have his clothing washed.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 48
text: And if the priest comes in, and sees that the disease is not increased after the new paste has been put on the house, then the priest will say that the house is clean, because the disease is gone.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 49
text: And in order to make the house clean, let him take two birds and cedar-wood and red thread and hyssop;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 50
text: And put one of the birds to death in a vessel of earth over flowing water;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 51
text: And take the cedar-wood and the hyssop and the red thread and the living bird and put them in the blood of the dead bird and in the flowing water, shaking it over the house seven times.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 52
text: And he will make the house clean with the blood of the bird and the flowing water and with the living bird and with the cedar-wood and the hyssop and the red thread.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 53
text: But he will let the living bird go out of the town into the open country; so he will take away sin from the house and it will be clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 54
text: This is the law for all signs of the leper's disease and for skin diseases;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 55
text: And for signs of disease in clothing, or in a house;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 56
text: And for a growth or a bad place or a bright mark on the skin;

title: Leviticus Chapter 14 Verse 57
text: To make clear when it is unclean and when it is clean: this is the law about the disease of the leper.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses and to Aaron,

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: Say to the children of Israel: If a man has an unclean flow from his flesh, it will make him unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: If the flow goes on or if the part is stopped up, to keep back the flow, he is still unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: Every bed on which he has been resting will be unclean, and everything on which he has been seated will be unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: And anyone touching his bed is to have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water and be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: And he who has been seated on anything on which the unclean man has been seated is to have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water and be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: And anyone touching the flesh of the unclean man is to have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water and be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: And if liquid from the mouth of the unclean man comes on to him who is clean, then he is to have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water and be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: And any leather seat on a horse on which the unclean man has been seated will be unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: And anyone touching anything which was under him will be unclean till the evening; anyone taking up any of these things is to have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water and be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: And anyone on whom the unclean man puts his hands, without washing them in water, is to have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water and be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: And any vessel of earth which has been touched by the unclean man will have to be broken and any vessel of wood washed.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: And when a man who has a flow from his body is made clean from it, he is to take seven days to make himself clean, washing his clothing and bathing his body in flowing water, and then he will be clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: And on the eighth day he is to take two doves or two young pigeons and come before the Lord to the door of the Tent of meeting and give them to the priest:

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: And they are to be offered by the priest, one for a sin-offering and one for a burned offering, and the priest will take away his sin before the Lord on account of his flow.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: And if a man's seed goes out from him, then all his body will have to be bathed in water and he will be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: And any clothing or skin on which the seed comes is to be washed with water and be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: And if a man has sex relations with a woman and his seed goes out from him, the two of them will have to be bathed in water and will be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: And if a woman has a flow of blood from her body, she will have to be kept separate for seven days, and anyone touching her will be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: And everything on which she has been resting, while she is kept separate, will be unclean, and everything on which she has been seated will be unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: And anyone touching her bed will have to have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water and be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: And anyone touching anything on which she has been seated will have to have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water and be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: Anyone touching anything on the bed or on the thing on which she has been seated, will be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: And if any man has sex relations with her so that her blood comes on him, he will be unclean for seven days and every bed on which he has been resting will be unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: And if a woman has a flow of blood for a long time, not at the time when she generally has it, or if the flow goes on longer than the normal time, she will be unclean while the flow of blood goes on, as she is at other normal times.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: Every bed on which she has been resting will be unclean, as at the times when she normally has a flow of blood, and everything on which she has been seated will be unclean, in the same way.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: And anyone touching these things will be unclean, and his clothing will have to be washed and his body bathed in water and he will be unclean till evening.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: But when her flow of blood is stopped, after seven days she will be clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: And on the eighth day let her get two doves or two young pigeons and take them to the priest to the door of the Tent of meeting,

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: To be offered by the priest, one for a sin-offering and one for a burned offering; and the priest will take away her sin before the Lord on account of her unclean condition.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: In this way may the children of Israel be made free from all sorts of unclean conditions, so that death may not overtake them when they are unclean and when they make unclean my holy place which is among them.

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: This is the law for the man who has a flow from his body, or whose seed goes from him so that he is unclean;

title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Verse 33
text: And for her who has a flow of blood, and for any man or woman who has an unclean flow, and for him who has sex relations with a woman when she is unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses, after the death of the two sons of Aaron when they took in strange fire before the Lord and death overtook them;

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: The Lord said to Moses, Say to Aaron, your brother, that he may not come at all times into the holy place inside the veil, before the cover which is on the ark, for fear that death may overtake him; for I will be seen in the cloud on the cover of the ark.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: Let Aaron come into the holy place in this way: with an ox for a sin-offering and a male sheep for a burned offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: Let him put on the holy linen coat, and the linen trousers on his body, and the linen band round him, and the linen head-dress on his head; for this is holy clothing, and before he puts them on his body is to be washed with water.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: And let him take from the children of Israel two he-goats for a sin-offering and one male sheep for a burned offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: And Aaron is to give the ox of the sin-offering for himself, to make himself and his house free from sin.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: And he is to take the two goats and put them before the Lord at the door of the Tent of meeting.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: And Aaron will make selection from the two goats by the decision of the Lord, one goat for the Lord and one for Azazel.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: And the goat which is marked out for the Lord, let Aaron give for a sin-offering.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: But the goat for Azazel is to be placed living before the Lord, for the taking away of sin, that it may be sent away for Azazel into the waste land.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: And Aaron is to give the ox of the sin-offering for himself and take away sin from himself and his house, and put to death the ox of the sin-offering which is for himself.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: And he is to take a vessel full of burning coal from the altar before the Lord and in his hand some sweet perfume crushed small, and take it inside the veil;

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: And let him put the perfume on the fire before the Lord so that the ark may be covered with a cloud of the smoke of the perfume, in order that death may not overtake him.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: And let him take some of the blood of the ox, shaking drops of it from his finger on the cover of the ark on the east side, and before it, seven times.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: Then let him put to death the goat of the sin-offering for the people, and take its blood inside the veil and do with it as he did with the blood of the ox, shaking drops of it on and before the cover of the ark.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: And let him make the holy place free from whatever is unclean among the children of Israel and from their wrongdoing in all their sins; and let him do the same for the Tent of meeting, which has its place among an unclean people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: And no man may be in the Tent of meeting from the time when Aaron goes in to take away sin in the holy place till he comes out, having made himself and his house and all the people of Israel free from sin.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: And he is to go out to the altar which is before the Lord and make it free from sin; and he is to take some of the blood of the ox and the blood of the goat and put it on the horns of the altar and round it;

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: Shaking drops of the blood from his finger on it seven times to make it holy and clean from whatever is unclean among the children of Israel.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: And when he has done whatever is necessary to make the holy place and the Tent of meeting and the altar free from sin, let him put the living goat before the Lord;

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: And Aaron, placing his two hands on the head of the living goat, will make a public statement over him of all the evil doings of the children of Israel and all their wrongdoing, in all their sins; and he will put them on the head of the goat and send him away, in the care of a man who will be waiting there, into the waste land.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: And the goat will take all their sins into a land cut off from men, and he will send the goat away into the waste land.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: Then let Aaron come into the Tent of meeting and take off the linen clothing which he put on when he went into the holy place, and put them down there;

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 24
text: And after bathing his body in water in a holy place, he is to put on his clothing and come out and give his burned offering and the burned offering of the people, to take away his sin and the sin of the people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 25
text: And the fat of the sin-offering is to be burned by him on the altar.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 26
text: And the man who takes away the goat for Azazel is to have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water and then he may come back to the tent-circle.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 27
text: And the ox of the sin-offering and the goat of the sin-offering, whose blood was taken in to make the holy place free from sin, are to be taken away outside the tent-circle and their skins and their flesh and their waste are to be burned with fire.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 28
text: And the man by whom they are burned is to have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water, and then he may come back to the tent-circle.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 29
text: And let this be an order to you for ever: in the seventh month, on the tenth day, you are to keep yourselves from pleasure and do no sort of work, those who are Israelites by birth and those from other lands who are living among you:

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 30
text: For on this day your sin will be taken away and you will be clean: you will be made free from all your sins before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 31
text: It is a special Sabbath for you, and you are to keep yourselves from pleasure; it is an order for ever.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 32
text: And the man on whose head the holy oil has been put, and who has been marked out to be a priest in his father's place, will do what is necessary to take away sin, and will put on the linen clothing, even the holy robes:

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 33
text: And he will make the holy place and the Tent of meeting and the altar free from sin; he will take away sin from the priests and from all the people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 16 Verse 34
text: And let this be an order for ever for you, so that the sin of the children of Israel may be taken away once every year. And he did as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: Say to Aaron and to his sons and to all the children of Israel: This is the order which the Lord has given.

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: If any man of Israel puts to death an ox or a lamb or a goat, in or outside the tent-circle;

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: And has not taken it to the door of the Tent of meeting, to make an offering to the Lord, before the Lord's House, its blood will be on him, for he has taken life, and he will be cut off from among his people:

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: So that the children of Israel may take to the Lord, to the door of the Tent of meeting and to the priest, the offerings which they have put to death in the open country, and that they may make their peace-offerings to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: And the priest will put blood on the altar of the Lord at the door of the Tent of meeting, burning the fat for a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: And let them make no more offerings to evil spirits, after which they have gone, turning away from the Lord. Let this be a law to them for ever, through all their generations.

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: And say to them, If any man of Israel, or any other living among them, makes a burned offering or other offering,

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: And does not take it to the door of the Tent of meeting to make an offering to the Lord, that man will be cut off from among his people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: And if any man of Israel, or any other living among them, takes any sort of blood for food, my wrath will be turned against that man and he will be cut off from among his people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: For the life of the flesh is in its blood; and I have given it to you on the altar to take away your sin: for it is the blood which makes free from sin because of the life in it.

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: For this reason I have said to the children of Israel, No man among you, or any others living with you, may take blood as food.

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: And any man of Israel, or any other living among them, who gets with his bow any beast or bird used for food, is to see that its blood is covered with earth.

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: For the blood is the life of all flesh: and so I have said to the children of Israel, You may not take any sort of blood as food, and any man who does so will be cut of.

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: And anyone who takes as food anything which has come to a natural end, or anything which has been put to death by beasts, if he is one of you by birth, or of another nation, will have to have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water and be unclean till evening, and then he will be clean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: But if his clothing is not washed and his body bathed, his sin will be on him.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: Say to the children of Israel, I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: You may not do those things which were done in the land of Egypt where you were living; and you may not do those things which are done in the land of Canaan where I am taking you, or be guided in your behaviour by their rules.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: But you are to be guided by my decisions and keep my rules, and be guided by them: I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: So keep my rules and my decisions, which, if a man does them, will be life to him: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: You may not have sex connection with anyone who is a near relation: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: You may not have sex relations with your father or your mother: she is your mother, you may not take her.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: And you may not have sex relations with your father's wife: she is your father's.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: You may not take your sister, the daughter of your father or of your mother, wherever her birth took place, among you or in another country.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: You may not have sex relations with your son's daughter or your daughter's daughter, for they are part of yourself;

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: Or your father's wife's daughter, the child of your father, for she is your sister.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: You may not have sex connection with your father's sister, for she is your father's near relation.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: You may not have sex connection with your mother's sister, for she is your mother's near relation.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: You may not have sex relations with the wife of your father's brother, for she is of your family;

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: Or with your daughter-in-law, for she is your son's wife, and you may not take her.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: You may not have sex relations with your brother's wife, for she is your brother's.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: You may not take as wife a woman and her daughter, or her son's daughter or her daughter's daughter, for they are of one family: it is an act of shame.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: And you may not take as wife a woman and at the same time her sister, to be in competition with her in her life-time.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: And you may not go near a woman or have sex relations with her when she is unclean, at her regular time.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: And you may not have sex relations with your neighbour's wife, making yourself unclean with her.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: And you may not make any of your children go through the fire as an offering to Molech, and you may not put shame on the name of your God: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: You may not have sex relations with men, as you do with women: it is a disgusting thing.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 23
