text: And you may not have sex relations with a beast, making yourself unclean with it; and a woman may not give herself to a beast: it is an unnatural act.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: Do not make yourself unclean in any of these ways; for so have those nations whom I am driving out from before you made themselves unclean:

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: And the land itself has become unclean; so that I have sent on it the reward of its wrongdoing, and the land itself puts out those who are living in it.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: So then keep my rules and my decisions, and do not do any of these disgusting things, those of you who are Israelites by birth, or any others who are living with you:

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: (For all these disgusting things were done by the men of this country who were there before you, and the land has been made unclean by them;)

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: So that the land may not put you out from it, when you make it unclean, as it put out the nations which were there before you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 29
text: For all those who do any of these disgusting things will be cut off from among their people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 18 Verse 30
text: So then, keep my orders, so that you may not do any of these disgusting things which were done before you, or make yourselves unclean through them: I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: Say to all the people of Israel, You are to be holy, for I, the Lord your God, am holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: Let every man give honour to his mother and to his father and keep my Sabbaths: I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: Do not go after false gods, and do not make metal images of gods for yourselves: I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: And when you give a peace offering to the Lord, do it in the way which is pleasing to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: Let it be used for food on the same day on which it is offered, or on the day after; and whatever is over on the third day is to be burned with fire.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: If any of it is used for food on the third day, it is a disgusting thing and will not be pleasing to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: And as for anyone who takes it for food, his sin will be on him, for he has put shame on the holy thing of the Lord: he will be cut off from his people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: And when you get in the grain from your land, do not let all the grain be cut from the edges of the field, or take up what has been dropped on the earth after the getting in of the grain.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: And do not take all the grapes from your vine-garden, or the fruit dropped on the earth; let the poor man, and the man from another country, have these: I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: Do not take anyone's property or be false in act or word to another.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: And do not take an oath in my name falsely, putting shame on the name of your God: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: Do not be cruel to your neighbour or take what is his; do not keep back a servant's payment from him all night till the morning.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: Do not put a curse on those who have no hearing, or put a cause of falling in the way of the blind, but keep the fear of your God before you: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: Do no wrong in your judging: do not give thought to the position of the poor, or honour to the position of the great; but be a judge to your neighbour in righteousness.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: Do not go about saying untrue things among your people, or take away the life of your neighbour by false witness: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: Let there be no hate in your heart for your brother; but you may make a protest to your neighbour, so that he may be stopped from doing evil.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: Do not make attempts to get equal with one who has done you wrong, or keep hard feelings against the children of your people, but have love for your neighbour as for yourself: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: Keep my laws. Do not let your cattle have offspring by those of a different sort; do not put mixed seed into your field; do not put on a robe made of two sorts of cloth.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: If any man has sex relations with a servant-woman who has given her word to be married to a man, and has not been made free for a price or in any other way, the thing will be looked into; but they will not be put to death because she was not a free woman.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: Let him take his offering for wrongdoing to the Lord, to the door of the Tent of meeting; let him give a male sheep as an offering for wrongdoing.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: And the priest will take away his sin before the Lord with the sheep which is offered for his wrongdoing, and he will have forgiveness for the sin which he has done.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: And when you have come into the land, and have put in all sorts of fruit-trees, their fruit will be as if they had not had circumcision, and for three years their fruit may not be used for food.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: And in the fourth year all the fruit will be holy as a praise-offering to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 25
text: But in the fifth year you may take the fruit and the increase of it for your food: I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 26
text: Nothing may be used for food with its blood in it; you may not make use of strange arts, or go in search of signs and wonders.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 27
text: The ends of the hair round your face and on your chin may not be cut off.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 28
text: You may not make cuts in your flesh in respect for the dead, or have marks printed on your bodies: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 29
text: Do not make your daughter common by letting her become a loose woman, for fear that the land may become full of shame.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 30
text: Keep my Sabbaths and have respect for my holy place: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 31
text: Do not go after those who make use of spirits, or wonder-workers; do not go in their ways or become unclean through them: I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 32
text: Get up from your seats before the white-haired, and give honour to the old, and let the fear of your God be before you: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 33
text: And if a man from another country is living in your land with you, do not make life hard for him;

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 34
text: Let him be to you as one of your countrymen and have love for him as for yourself; for you were living in a strange land, in the land of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 35
text: Do not make false decisions in questions of yard-sticks and weights and measures.

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 36
text: Have true scales, true weights and measures for all things: I am the Lord your God, who took you out of the land of Egypt;

title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Verse 37
text: You are to keep all my rules and my decisions and do them: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: Again, say to the children of Israel, If any man of the children of Israel, or any other man living in Israel, gives his offspring to Molech, he is certainly to be put to death: he is to be stoned by the people of the land;

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: And my face will be turned against that man, and he will be cut off from his people; because he has given his offspring to Molech, making my holy place unclean, and making my holy name common.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: And if the people of the land do not take note of that man when he gives his offspring to Molech, and do not put him to death,

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: Then my face will be turned against him and his family, and he and all those who do evil with him will be cut off from among their people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: And whoever goes after those who make use of spirits and wonder-workers, doing evil with them, against him will my face be turned, and he will be cut off from among his people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: So make and keep yourselves holy, for I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: And keep my rules and do them: I am the Lord, who make you holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: Every man cursing his father or his mother is certainly to be put to death; because of his curse on his father or his mother, his blood will be on him.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: And if a man has sex relations with another man's wife, even the wife of his neighbour, he and she are certainly to be put to death.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: And the man who has sex relations with his father's wife has put shame on his father: the two of them are to be put to death; their blood will be on them.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: And if a man has sex relations with his son's wife, the two of them are to be put to death: it is unnatural; their blood will be on them.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: And if a man has sex relations with a man, the two of them have done a disgusting thing: let them be put to death; their blood will be on them.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: And if a man takes as wife a woman and her mother, it is an act of shame; let them be burned with fire, all three of them, so that there may be no shame among you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: And if a man has sex relations with a beast, let him be put to death, and let the beast be put to destruction.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: And if a woman goes near a beast and has sex relations with it, you will put an end to the woman and the beast: their blood will be on them.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: And if a man takes his sister, daughter of his father or his mother, and has sex relations with her and she with him, it is an act of shame: they are to be cut off before the children of their people; he has had sex relations with his sister, and his sin will be on him.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: And if a man has sex relations with a woman at the time when she is unwell, he has seen her fountain and she has let the fountain of her blood be uncovered, and the two of them are to be cut off from among their people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: And you may not have sex connection with your mother's sister or your father's sister, for they are his near relations: their sin will be on them.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: And if a man has sex relations with the wife of his father's brother, he has put shame on his father's brother: their sin will be on them; till the day of their death they will have no children.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: And if a man takes his brother's wife, it is an unclean act; he has put shame on his brother; they will have no children.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: So then, keep my rules and my decisions and do them, so that the land which I am giving you as your resting-place may not violently send you out again.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: And do not keep the rules of the nations which I am driving out before you; for they did all these things, and for that reason my soul was turned against them.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: But I have said to you, You will take their land and I will give it to you for your heritage, a land flowing with milk and honey: I am the Lord your God who have made you separate from all other peoples.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: So then, make division between the clean beast and the unclean, and between the clean bird and the unclean: do not make yourselves disgusting by any beast or bird or anything which goes flat on the earth, which has been marked by me as unclean for you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: And you are to be holy to me; for I the Lord am holy and have made you separate from the nations, so that you may be my people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Verse 27
text: Any man or woman who makes use of spirits, or who is a wonder-worker, is to be put to death: they are to be stoned with stones: their blood will be on them.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Say to the priests, the sons of Aaron, Let no man make himself unclean for the dead among his people;

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: But only for his near relations, for his mother or his father, his son or his daughter, and his brother;

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: And for his sister, a virgin, for she is his near relation and has had no husband, he may make himself unclean.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: But let him, being a chief among his people, not make himself unclean in such a way as to put shame on himself.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: They are not to have their hair cut off for the dead, or the hair on their chins cut short, or make cuts in their flesh.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: Let them be holy to their God and not make the name of their God common; for the fire offerings of the Lord and the bread of their God are offered by them, and they are to be holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: They may not take as wife a loose or common woman, or one who has been put away by her husband: for the priest is holy to his God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: And he is to be holy in your eyes, for by him the bread of your God is offered; he is to be holy in your eyes, for I the Lord, who make you holy, am holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: And if the daughter of a priest makes herself common and by her loose behaviour puts shame on her father, let her be burned with fire.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: And he who is the chief priest among his brothers, on whose head the holy oil has been put, who is marked out to put on the holy robes, may not let his hair go loose or have his clothing out of order as a sign of sorrow.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: He may not go near any dead body or make himself unclean for his father or his mother;

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: He may not go out of the holy place or make the holy place of his God common; for the crown of the holy oil of his God is on him: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: And let him take as his wife one who has not had relations with a man.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: A widow, or one whose husband has put her away, or a common woman of loose behaviour, may not be the wife of a priest; but let him take a virgin from among his people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: And he may not make his seed unclean among his people, for I the Lord have made him holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: Say to Aaron, If a man of your family, in any generation, is damaged in body, let him not come near to make the offering of the bread of his God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: For any man whose body is damaged may not come near: one who is blind, or has not the use of his legs, or one who has a broken nose or any unnatural growth,

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: Or a man with broken feet or hands,

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: Or one whose back is bent, or one who is unnaturally small, or one who has a damaged eye, or whose skin is diseased, or whose sex parts are damaged;

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: No man of the offspring of Aaron whose body is damaged in any way may come near to give the fire offerings of the Lord: he is damaged, he may not come near to make the offerings.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: He may take of the bread of God, the holy and the most holy;

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: But he may not go inside the veil or come near the altar, because he is damaged; and he may not make my holy places common; for I the Lord have made them holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: These are the words which Moses said to Aaron and to his sons and to all the children of Israel.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: Give orders to Aaron and to his sons to keep themselves separate from the holy things of the children of Israel which they give to me, and not to make my holy name common: I am the Lord,

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: Say to them, If any man of all your seed through all your generations, being unclean, comes near the holy things which the children of Israel make holy to the Lord, he will be cut off from before me: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: No man of the seed of Aaron who is a leper, or who has a flow from his body, may take of the holy food till he is clean. And any man touching anything which is unclean because of the dead, or any man whose seed goes from him;

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: Or anyone touching any unclean thing which goes flat on the earth, or someone by whom he may be made unclean in any way whatever;

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: Any person touching any such unclean thing will be unclean till evening, and may not take of the holy food till his flesh has been bathed in water;

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: And when the sun has gone down he will be clean; and after that he may take part in the holy food, because it is his bread.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: That which comes to a natural death, or is attacked by beasts, he may not take as food, for it will make him unclean: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: So then, let them keep what I have put into their care, for fear that sin may come on them because of it, so causing their death because they have made it common: I am the Lord, who make them holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: No outside person may take of the holy food, or one living as a guest in the priest's house, or a servant working for payment.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: But any person for whom the priest has given money, to make him his, may take of it with him; and those who come to birth in his house may take of his bread.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: And if the daughter of a priest is married to an outside person she may not take of the holy things which are lifted up as offerings.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: But if a priest's daughter is a widow, or parted from her husband, and has no child, and has come back to her father's house as when she was a girl, she may take of her father's bread; but no outside person may do so.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: And if a man takes the holy food in error, he will have to give the holy thing back to the priest, with the addition of a fifth part.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: And they may not make common the holy things which the children of Israel give to the Lord,

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: So causing sin to come on them when they take their holy things for food: I am the Lord who make them holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: Say to Aaron and to his sons and to all the children of Israel, If any man of the children of Israel, or of another nation living in Israel, makes an offering, given because of an oath or freely given to the Lord for a burned offering;

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: So that it may be pleasing to the Lord, let him give a male, without any mark, from among the oxen or the sheep or the goats.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: But anything which has a mark you may not give; it will not make you pleasing to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: And whoever makes a peace-offering to the Lord, in payment of an oath or as a free offering, from the herd or the flock, if it is to be pleasing to the Lord, let it be free from any mark or damage.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: Anything blind or broken or damaged or having any disease or any mark on it may not be offered to the Lord; you may not make an offering of it by fire on the altar to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: An ox or a lamb which has more or less than its natural parts, may be given as a free offering; but it will not be taken in payment of an oath.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: An animal which has its sex parts damaged or crushed or broken or cut, may not be offered to the Lord; such a thing may not be done anywhere in your land.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 25
text: And from one who is not an Israelite you may not take any of these for an offering to the Lord; for they are unclean, there is a mark on them, and the Lord will not be pleased with them.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 26
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 27
text: When an ox or a sheep or a goat is given birth, let it be with its mother for seven days; and after the eighth day it may be taken as an offering made by fire to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 28
text: A cow or a sheep may not be put to death with its young on the same day.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 29
text: And when you make an offering of praise to the Lord, make it in a way which is pleasing to him.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 30
text: Let it be used for food on the same day; do not keep any part of it till the morning: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 31
text: So then, keep my orders and do them: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 32
text: And do not make my holy name common; so that it may be kept holy by the children of Israel: I am the Lord who make you holy,

title: Leviticus Chapter 22 Verse 33
text: Who took you out of the land of Egypt that I might be your God: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: Say to the children of Israel, These are the fixed feasts of the Lord, which you will keep for holy meetings: these are my feasts.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: On six days work may be done; but the seventh day is a special day of rest, a time for worship; you may do no sort of work: it is a Sabbath to the Lord wherever you may be living.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: These are the fixed feasts of the Lord, the holy days of worship which you will keep at their regular times.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at nightfall, is the Lord's Passover;

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: And on the fifteenth day of the same month is the feast of unleavened bread; for seven days let your food be unleavened bread.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: On the first day you will have a holy meeting; you may do no sort of field-work.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: And every day for seven days you will give a burned offering to the Lord; and on the seventh day there will be a holy meeting; you may do no field-work.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: Say to the children of Israel, When you have come to the land which I will give you, and have got in the grain from its fields, take some of the first-fruits of the grain to the priest;

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: And let the grain be waved before the Lord, so that you may be pleasing to him; on the day after the Sabbath let it be waved by the priest.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: And on the day of the waving of the grain, you are to give a male lamb of the first year, without any mark, for a burned offering to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: And let the meal offering with it be two tenth parts of an ephah of the best meal mixed with oil, an offering made by fire to the Lord for a sweet smell; and the drink offering with it is to be of wine, the fourth part of a hin.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 14
text: And you may take no bread or dry grain or new grain for food till the very day on which you have given the offering for your God: this is a rule for ever through all your generations wherever you are living.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: And let seven full weeks be numbered from the day after the Sabbath, the day when you give the grain for the wave offering;

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: Let fifty days be numbered, to the day after the seventh Sabbath; then you are to give a new meal offering to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 17
text: Take from your houses two cakes of bread, made of a fifth part of an ephah of the best meal, cooked with leaven, to be waved for first-fruits to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 18
text: And with the bread, take seven lambs of the first year, without any marks, and one ox and two male sheep, to be a burned offering to the Lord, with their meal offering and their drink offerings, an offering of a sweet smell made by fire to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 19
text: And you are to give one male goat for a sin-offering and two male lambs of the first year for peace-offerings.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 20
text: And these will be waved by the priest, with the bread of the first-fruits, for a wave offering to the Lord, with the two lambs: they will be holy to the Lord for the priest.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 21
text: And on the same day, let it be given out that there will be a holy meeting for you: you may do no field-work on that day: it is a rule for ever through all your generations wherever you are living.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 22
text: And when you get in the grain from your land, do not let all the grain at the edges of the field be cut, and do not take up the grain which has been dropped in the field; let that be for the poor, and for the man from another country: I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 23
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 24
text: Say to the children of Israel, In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, let there be a special day of rest for you, a day of memory, marked by the blowing of horns, a meeting for worship.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 25
text: Do no field-work and give to the Lord an offering made by fire.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 26
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 27
text: The tenth day of this seventh month is the day for the taking away of sin; let it be a holy day of worship; you are to keep from pleasure, and give to the Lord an offering made by fire.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 28
text: And on that day you may do no sort of work, for it is a day of taking away sin, to make you clean before the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 29
text: For any person, whoever he may be, who takes his pleasure on that day will be cut off from his people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 30
text: And if any person, whoever he may be, on that day does any sort of work, I will send destruction on him from among his people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 31
text: You may not do any sort of work: this is an order for ever through all your generations wherever you may be living.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 32
text: Let this be a Sabbath of special rest to you, and keep yourselves from all pleasure; on the ninth day of the month at nightfall from evening to evening, let this Sabbath be kept.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 33
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 34
text: Say to the children of Israel, On the fifteenth day of this seventh month let the feast of tents be kept to the Lord for seven days.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 35
text: On the first day there will be a holy meeting: do no field-work.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 36
text: Every day for seven days give an offering made by fire to the Lord; and on the eighth day there is to be a holy meeting, when you are to give an offering made by fire to the Lord; this is a special holy day: you may do no field-work on that day.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 37
text: These are the fixed feasts of the Lord, to be kept by you as holy days of worship, for making an offering by fire to the Lord; a burned offering, a meal offering, an offering of beasts, and drink offerings; every one on its special day;

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 38
text: In addition to the Sabbaths of the Lord, and in addition to the things you give and the oaths you make and the free offerings to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 39
text: But on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have got in all the fruits of the land, you will keep the feast of the Lord for seven days: the first day will be a Sabbath, and the eighth day the same.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 40
text: On the first day, take the fruit of fair trees, branches of palm-trees, and branches of thick trees and trees from the riverside, and be glad before the Lord for seven days.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 41
text: And let this feast be kept before the Lord for seven days in the year: it is a rule for ever from generation to generation; in the seventh month let it be kept.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 42
text: For seven days you will be living in tents; all those who are Israelites by birth are to make tents their living-places:

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 43
text: So that future generations may keep in mind how I gave the children of Israel tents as their living-places when I took them out of the land of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 23 Verse 44
text: And Moses made clear to the children of Israel the orders about the fixed feasts of the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: Give orders to the children of Israel to give you clean olive oil for the light, so that a light may be burning at all times,

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: Outside the veil of the ark in the Tent of meeting; let Aaron see that it is burning from evening till morning at all times before the Lord: it is a rule for ever through all your generations.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: Let Aaron put the lights in order on the support before the Lord at all times.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: And take the best meal and make twelve cakes of it, a fifth part of an ephah in every cake.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: And put them in two lines, six in a line, on the holy table before the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: And on the lines of cakes put clean sweet-smelling spices, for a sign on the bread, an offering made by fire to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: Every Sabbath day regularly, the priest is to put it in order before the Lord: it is offered for the children of Israel, an agreement made for ever.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: And it will be for Aaron and his sons; they are to take it for food in a holy place: it is the most holy of all the offerings made by fire to the Lord, a rule for ever.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: And a son of an Israelite woman, whose father was an Egyptian, went out among the children of Israel and had a fight with a man of Israel by the tents;

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: And the son of the Israelite woman said evil against the holy Name, with curses; and they took him to Moses. His mother's name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: And they kept him shut up, till a decision might be given by the mouth of the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: Take the curser outside the tent-circle; and let all in whose hearing the words were said put their hands on his head, and let him be stoned by all the people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: And say to the children of Israel, As for any man cursing God, his sin will be on his head.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: And he who says evil against the name of the Lord will certainly be put to death; he will be stoned by all the people; the man who is not of your nation and one who is an Israelite by birth, whoever says evil against the holy Name is to be put to death.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: And anyone who takes another's life is certainly to be put to death.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: And anyone wounding a beast and causing its death, will have to make payment for it: a life for a life.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 19
text: And if a man does damage to his neighbour, as he has done, so let it be done to him;

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 20
text: Wound for wound, eye for eye, tooth for tooth; whatever damage he has done, so let it be done to him.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 21
text: He who puts a beast to death will have to make payment for it; he who puts a man to death will himself be put to death.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 22
text: You are to have the same law for a man of another nation living among you as for an Israelite; for I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 24 Verse 23
text: And Moses said these words to the children of Israel, and they took the man who had been cursing outside the tent-circle and had him stoned. The children of Israel did as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses on Mount Sinai,

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 2
text: Say to the children of Israel, When you come into the land which I will give you, let the land keep a Sabbath to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 3
text: For six years put seed into your land, and for six years give care to your vines and get in the produce of them;

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 4
text: But let the seventh year be a Sabbath of rest for the land, a Sabbath to the Lord; do not put seed into your land or have your vines cut.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 5
text: That which comes to growth of itself may not be cut, and the grapes of your uncared-for vines may not be taken off; let it be a year of rest for the land.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 6
text: And the Sabbath of the land will give food for you and your man-servant and your woman-servant and those working for payment, and for those of another country who are living among you;

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 7
text: And for your cattle and the beasts on the land; all the natural increase of the land will be for food.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 8
text: And let seven Sabbaths of years be numbered to you, seven times seven years; even the days of seven Sabbaths of years, that is forty-nine years;

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 9
text: Then let the loud horn be sounded far and wide on the tenth day of the seventh month; on the day of taking away sin let the horn be sounded through all your land.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 10
text: And let this fiftieth year be kept holy, and say publicly that everyone in the land is free from debt: it is the Jubilee, and every man may go back to his heritage and to his family.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 11
text: Let this fiftieth year be the Jubilee: no seed may be planted, and that which comes to growth of itself may not be cut, and the grapes may not be taken from the uncared-for vines.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 12
text: For it is the Jubilee, and it is holy to you; your food will be the natural increase of the field.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 13
text: In this year of Jubilee, let every man go back to his heritage.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 14
text: And in the business of trading goods for money, do no wrong to one another.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 15
text: Let your exchange of goods with your neighbours have relation to the number of years after the year of Jubilee, and the number of times the earth has given her produce.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 16
text: If the number of years is great, the price will be increased, and if the number of years is small, the price will be less, for it is the produce of a certain number of years which the man is giving you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 17
text: And do no wrong, one to another, but let the fear of your God be before you; for I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 18
text: So keep my rules and my decisions and do them, and you will be safe in your land.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 19
text: And the land will give her fruit, and you will have food in full measure and be safe in the land.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 20
text: And if you say, Where will our food come from in the seventh year, when we may not put in seed, or get in the increase

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 21
text: Then I will send my blessing on you in the sixth year, and the land will give fruit enough for three years.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 22
text: And in the eighth year you will put in your seed, and get your food from the old stores, till the fruit of the ninth year is ready.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 23
text: No exchange of land may be for ever, for the land is mine, and you are as my guests, living with me for a time.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 24
text: Wherever there is property in land, the owner is to have the right of getting it back.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 25
text: If your brother becomes poor, and has to give up some of his land for money, his nearest relation may come and get back that which his brother has given up.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 26
text: And if he has no one to get it back for him, and later he himself gets wealth and has enough money to get it back;

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 27
text: Then let him take into account the years from the time when he gave it up, and make up the loss for the rest of the years to him who took it, and so get back his property.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 28
text: But if he is not able to get it back for himself, then it will be kept by him who gave a price for it, till the year of Jubilee; and in that year it will go back to its first owner and he will have his property again.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 29
text: And if a man gives his house in a walled town for money, he has the right to get it back for the space of a full year after he has given it up.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 30
text: And if he does not get it back by the end of the year, then the house in the town will become the property of him who gave the money for it, and of his children for ever; it will not go from him in the year of Jubilee.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 31
text: But houses in small unwalled towns will be the same as property in the country; they may be got back, and they will go back to their owners in the year of Jubilee.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 32
text: But the houses in the towns of the Levites may be got back by the Levites at any time.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 33
text: And if a Levite does not give money to get back his property, his house in the town which was exchanged for money will come back to him in the year of Jubilee. For the houses of the towns of the Levites are their property among the children of Israel.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 34
text: But the land on the outskirts of their towns may not be exchanged for money, for it is their property for ever.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 35
text: And if your brother becomes poor and is not able to make a living, then you are to keep him with you, helping him as you would a man from another country who is living among you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 36
text: Take no interest from him, in money or in goods, but have the fear of your God before you, and let your brother make a living among you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 37
text: Do not take interest on the money which you let him have or on the food which you give him.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 38
text: I am the Lord your God, who took you out of the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan, that I might be your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 39
text: And if your brother becomes poor and gives himself to you for money, do not make use of him like a servant who is your property;

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 40
text: But let him be with you as a servant working for payment, till the year of Jubilee;

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 41
text: Then he will go out from you, he and his children with him, and go back to his family and to the property of his fathers.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 42
text: For they are my servants whom I took out from the land of Egypt; they may not become the property of another.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 43
text: Do not be a hard master to him, but have the fear of God before you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 44
text: But you may get servants as property from among the nations round about; from them you may take men-servants and women-servants.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 45
text: And in addition, you may get, for money, servants from among the children of other nations who are living with you, and from their families which have come to birth in your land; and these will be your property.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 46
text: And they will be your children's heritage after you, to keep as their property; they will be your servants for ever; but you may not be hard masters to your countrymen, the children of Israel.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 47
text: And if one from another nation living among you gets wealth, and your countryman, at his side, becomes poor and gives himself for money to the man from another nation or to one of his family;

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 48
text: After he has given himself he has the right to be made free, for a price, by one of his brothers,

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 49
text: Or his father's brother, or the son of his father's brother, or any near relation; or if he gets money, he may make himself free.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 50
text: And let the years be numbered from the time when he gave himself to his owner till the year of Jubilee, and the price given for him will be in relation to the number of years, on the scale of the payment of a servant.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 51
text: If there is still a long time, he will give back, on account of it, a part of the price which was given for him.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 52
text: And if there is only a short time, he will take account of it with his master, and in relation to the number of years he will give back the price of making him free.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 53
text: And he will be with him as a servant working for payment year by year; his master is not to be cruel to him before your eyes.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 54
text: And if he is not made free in this way, he will go out in the year of Jubilee, he and his children with him.

title: Leviticus Chapter 25 Verse 55
text: For the children of Israel are servants to me; they are my servants whom I took out of the land of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 1
text: Do not make images of false gods, or put up an image cut in stone or a pillar or any pictured stone in your land, to give worship to it; for I am the Lord your God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 2
text: Keep my Sabbaths and give honour to my holy place: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 3
text: If you are guided by my rules, and keep my laws and do them,

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 4
text: Then I will give you rain at the right time, and the land will give her increase and the trees of the field will give their fruit;

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 5
text: And the crushing of the grain will overtake the cutting of the grapes, and the cutting of the grapes will overtake the planting of the seed, and there will be bread in full measure, and you will be living in your land safely.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 6
text: And I will give you peace in the land, and you will take your rest and no one will give you cause for fear; and I will put an end to all evil beasts in the land, and no sword of war will go through your land.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 7
text: And you will put to flight those who are against you, and they will be put to death by your swords.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 8
text: Then five of you will put to flight a hundred, and a hundred of you will put to flight ten thousand, and all who are against you will be put to death by your swords.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 9
text: And I will have pleasure in you and make you fertile and greater in number; and I will keep my agreement with you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 10
text: And old stores long kept will be your food, and you will take out the old because of the new;

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 11
text: And I will put my holy House among you, and my soul will not be turned away from you in disgust.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 12
text: And I will be present among you and will be your God and you will be my people.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 13
text: I am the Lord your God, who took you out of the land of Egypt so that you might not be servants to them; by me the cords of your yoke were broken and I made you go upright.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 14
text: But if you do not give ear to me, and do not keep all these my laws;

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 15
text: And if you go against my rules and if you have hate in your souls for my decisions and you do not do all my orders, but go against my agreement;

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 16
text: This will I do to you: I will put fear in your hearts, even wasting disease and burning pain, drying up the eyes and making the soul feeble, and you will get no profit from your seed, for your haters will take it for food.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 17
text: And my face will be turned from you, and you will be broken before those who are against you, and your haters will become your rulers, and you will go in flight when no man comes after you.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 18
text: And if, even after these things, you will not give ear to me, then I will send you punishment seven times more for your sins.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 19
text: And the pride of your strength will be broken, and I will make your heaven as iron and your earth as brass;

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 20
text: And your strength will be used up without profit; for your land will not give her increase and the trees of the field will not give their fruit.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 21
text: And if you still go against me and will not give ear to me, I will put seven times more punishments on you because of your sins.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 22
text: I will let loose the beasts of the field among you, and they will take away your children and send destruction on your cattle, so that your numbers will become small and your roads become waste.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 23
text: And if by these things you will not be turned to me, but still go against me;

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 24
text: Then I will go against you, and I will give you punishment, I myself, seven times for all your sins.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 25
text: And I will send a sword on you to give effect to the punishment of my agreement; and when you come together into your towns I will send disease among you and you will be given up into the hands of your haters.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 26
text: When I take away your bread of life, ten women will be cooking bread in one oven, and your bread will be measured out by weight; you will have food but never enough.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 27
text: And if, after all this, you do not give ear to me, but go against me still,

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 28
text: Then my wrath will be burning against you, and I will give you punishment, I myself, seven times for your sins.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 29
text: Then you will take the flesh of your sons and the flesh of your daughters for food;

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 30
text: And I will send destruction on your high places, overturning your perfume altars, and will put your dead bodies on your broken images, and my soul will be turned from you in disgust.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 31
text: And I will make your towns waste and send destruction on your holy places; I will take no pleasure in the smell of your sweet perfumes;

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 32
text: And I will make your land a waste, a wonder to your haters living in it.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 33
text: And I will send you out in all directions among the nations, and my sword will be uncovered against you, and your land will be without any living thing, and your towns will be made waste.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 34
text: Then will the land take pleasure in its Sabbaths while it is waste and you are living in the land of your haters; then will the land have rest.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 35
text: All the days while it is waste will the land have rest, such rest as it never had in your Sabbaths, when you were living in it.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 36
text: And as for the rest of you, I will make their hearts feeble in the land of their haters, and the sound of a leaf moved by the wind will send them in flight, and they will go in flight as from the sword, falling down when no one comes after them;

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 37
text: Falling on one another, as before the sword, when no one comes after them; you will give way before your haters.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 38
text: And death will overtake you among strange nations, and the land of your haters will be your destruction.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 39
text: And those of you who are still living will be wasting away in their sins in the land of your haters; in the sins of their fathers they will be wasting away.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 40
text: And they will have grief for their sins and for the sins of their fathers, when their hearts were untrue to me, and they went against me;

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 41
text: So that I went against them and sent them away into the land of their haters: if then the pride of their hearts is broken and they take the punishment of their sins,

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 42
text: Then I will keep in mind the agreement which I made with Jacob and with Isaac and with Abraham, and I will keep in mind the land.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 43
text: And the land, while she is without them, will keep her Sabbaths; and they will undergo the punishment of their sins, because they were turned away from my decisions and in their souls was hate for my laws.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 44
text: But for all that, when they are in the land of their haters I will not let them go, or be turned away from them, or give them up completely; my agreement with them will not be broken, for I am the Lord their God.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 45
text: And because of them I will keep in mind the agreement which I made with their fathers, whom I took out of the land of Egypt before the eyes of the nations, to be their God: I am the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 26 Verse 46
text: These are the rules, decisions, and laws, which the Lord made between himself and the children of Israel in Mount Sinai, by the hand of Moses.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 2
text: Say to the children of Israel, If a man makes a special oath, you will give your decision as to the value of the persons for the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 3
text: And you will put the value of a male from twenty years to sixty years old at fifty shekels of silver, by the scale of the holy place.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 4
text: And if it is a female, the value will be thirty shekels.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 5
text: And if the person is from five to twenty years old, the value will be twenty shekels for a male, and ten for a female.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 6
text: And if the person is from one month to five years old, then the value for a male will be five shekels of silver, and for a female three shekels.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 7
text: And for sixty years old and over, for a male the value will be fifteen shekels, and for a female, ten.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 8
text: But if he is poorer than the value which you have put on him, then let him be taken to the priest, and the priest will put a value on him, such as it is possible for him to give.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 9
text: And if it is a beast of which men make offerings to the Lord, whatever any man gives of such to the Lord will be holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 10
text: It may not be changed in any way, a good given for a bad, or a bad for a good; if one beast is changed for another, the two will be holy.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 11
text: And if it is any unclean beast, of which offerings are not made to the Lord, then let him take the beast before the priest;

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 12
text: And let the priest put a value on it, if it is good or bad; whatever value the priest puts on it, so will it be.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 13
text: But if he has a desire to get it back for himself, let him give a fifth more than your value.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 14
text: And if a man has given his house as holy to the Lord, then the priest will put a value on it, if it is good or bad; as the priest gives decision so will the value be fixed.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 15
text: And if the owner has a desire to get back his house, let him give a fifth more than your value, and it will be his.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 16
text: And if a man gives to the Lord part of the field which is his property, then let your value be in relation to the seed which is planted in it; a measure of barley grain will be valued at fifty shekels of silver.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 17
text: If he gives his field from the year of Jubilee, the value will be fixed by your decision.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 18
text: But if he gives his field after the year of Jubilee, the amount of the money will be worked out by the priest in relation to the number of years till the coming year of Jubilee, and the necessary amount will be taken off your value.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 19
text: And if the man who has given the field has a desire to get it back, let him give a fifth more than the price at which it was valued and it will be his.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 20
text: But if he has no desire to get it back, or if he has given it for a price to another man, it may not be got back again.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 21
text: But the field, when it becomes free at the year of Jubilee, will be holy to the Lord, as a field given under oath: it will be the property of the priest.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 22
text: And if a man gives to the Lord a field which he has got for money from another, which is not part of his heritage;

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 23
text: Then the value fixed by you up to the year of Jubilee will be worked out for him by the priest, and in that day he will give the amount of your value as holy to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 24
text: In the year of Jubilee the field will go back to him from whom he got it, that is, to him whose heritage it was.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 25
text: And let all your values be based on the shekel of the holy place, that is, twenty gerahs to the shekel.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 26
text: But a man may not give by oath to the Lord the first-fruits of cattle which are offered to the Lord: if it is an ox or a sheep it is the Lord's.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 27
text: And if it is an unclean beast, then the owner of it may give money to get it back, in agreement with the value fixed by you, by giving a fifth more; or if it is not taken back, let it be given for money in agreement with your valuing.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 28
text: But nothing which a man has given completely to the Lord, out of all his property, of man or beast, or of the land which is his heritage, may be given away or got back in exchange for money; anything completely given is most holy to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 29
text: Any man given completely to the Lord may not be got back: he is certainly to be put to death.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 30
text: And every tenth part of the land, of the seed planted, or of the fruit of trees, is holy to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 31
text: And if a man has a desire to get back any of the tenth part which he has given, let him give a fifth more.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 32
text: And a tenth part of the herd and of the flock, whatever goes under the rod of the valuer, will be holy to the Lord.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 33
text: He may not make search to see if it is good or bad, or make any changes in it; and if he makes exchange of it for another, the two will be holy; he will not get them back again.

title: Leviticus Chapter 27 Verse 34
text: These are the orders which the Lord gave to Moses for the children of Israel in Mount Sinai.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses in the waste land of Sinai, in the Tent of meeting, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they came out of the land of Egypt,

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Take the full number of the children of Israel, by their families, and by their fathers' houses, every male by name;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: All those of twenty years old and over, who are able to go to war in Israel, are to be numbered by you and Aaron.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And to give you help, take one man from every tribe, the head of his father's house.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: These are the names of those who are to be your helpers: from Reuben, Elizur, the son of Shedeur;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: From Simeon, Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: From Judah, Nahshon, the son of Amminadab;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: From Issachar, Nethanel, the son of Zuar;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: From Zebulun, Eliab, the son of Helon;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Of the children of Joseph: from Ephraim, Elishama, the son of Ammihud; from Manasseh, Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur,

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: From Benjamin, Abidan, the son of Gideoni;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: From Dan, Ahiezer, the son of Ammi-shaddai;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: From Asher, Pagiel, the son of Ochran;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: From Gad, Eliasaph, the son of Reuel;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: From Naphtali, Ahira, the son of Enan.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: These are the men named out of all the people, chiefs of their fathers' houses, heads of the tribes of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And Moses and Aaron took these men, marked out by name;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And they got together all the people on the first day of the second month; and everyone made clear his family and his father's house, by the number of the names, from twenty years old and over.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: As the Lord had given orders to Moses, so they were numbered by him in the waste place of Sinai.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: The generations of the sons of Reuben, the oldest son of Israel, were numbered by their families and their fathers' houses, every male of twenty years old and over, who was able to go to war;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: Forty-six thousand, five hundred of the tribe of Reuben were numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: The generations of the sons of Simeon were numbered by their families and their fathers' houses, every male of twenty years old and over, who was able to go to war;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: Fifty-nine thousand, three hundred of the tribe of Simeon were numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: The generations of the sons of Gad were numbered by their families and their fathers' houses, every male of twenty years old and over who was able to go to war;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: Forty-five thousand, six hundred and fifty of the tribe of Gad were numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: The generations of the sons of Judah were numbered by their families and their fathers' houses, every male of twenty years old and over who was able to go to war;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: Seventy-four thousand, six hundred of the tribe of Judah were numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 28
text: The generations of the sons of Issachar were numbered by their families and their fathers' houses, every male of twenty years old and over who was able to go to war;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 29
text: Fifty-four thousand, four hundred of the tribe of Issachar were numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 30
text: The generations of the sons of Zebulun were numbered by their families and their fathers' houses, every male of twenty years old and over who was able to go to war;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 31
text: Fifty-seven thousand, four hundred of the tribe of Zebulun were numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 32
text: The generations of the sons of Joseph were numbered by their families and their fathers' houses, every male of twenty years old and over who was able to go to war;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 33
text: Forty thousand, five hundred of the tribe of Ephraim were numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 34
text: The generations of the sons of Manasseh were numbered by their families and their fathers' houses, every male of twenty years old and over who was able to go to war;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 35
text: Thirty-two thousand, two hundred of the tribe of Manasseh were numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 36
text: The generations of the sons of Benjamin were numbered by their families and their fathers' houses, every male of twenty years old and over who was able to go to war;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 37
text: Thirty-five thousand, four hundred of the tribe of Benjamin were numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 38
text: The generations of the sons of Dan were numbered by their families and their fathers' houses, every male of twenty years and over who was able to go to war;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 39
text: Sixty-two thousand, seven hundred of the tribe of Dan were numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 40
text: The generations of the sons of Asher were numbered by their families and their fathers' houses, every male of twenty years old and over who was able to go to war;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 41
text: Forty-one thousand, five hundred of the tribe of Asher were numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 42
text: The generations of the sons of Naphtali were numbered by their families and their fathers' houses, every male of twenty years old and over who was able to go to war;

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 43
text: Fifty-three thousand, four hundred of the tribe of Naphtali were numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 44
text: These are they who were numbered by Moses and Aaron and by the twelve chiefs of Israel, one from every tribe.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 45
text: So all those who were numbered of the children of Israel, by their families, all those of twenty years old and over who were able to go to war,

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 46
text: Were six hundred and three thousand, five hundred and fifty.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 47
text: But the Levites, of the tribe of their fathers, were not numbered among them.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 48
text: For the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 49
text: Only the tribe of Levi is not to be numbered among the children of Israel,

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 50
text: But to them you are to give the care of the Tent of meeting with its vessels and everything in it: they are to take up the Tent, and be responsible for everything to do with it, and put up their tents round it.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 51
text: And when the Tent of meeting goes forward, the Levites are to take it down; and when it is to be put up, they are to do it: any strange person who comes near it is to be put to death.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 52
text: The children of Israel are to put up their tents, every man in his tent-circle round his flag.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 53
text: But the tents of the Levites are to be round the Tent of meeting, so that wrath may not come on the children of Israel: the Tent of meeting is to be in the care of the Levites.

title: Numbers Chapter 1 Verse 54
text: So the children of Israel did as the Lord had given orders to Moses.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: The children of Israel are to put up their tents in the order of their families, by the flags of their fathers' houses, facing the Tent of meeting on every side.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: Those whose tents are on the east side, looking to the dawn, will be round the flag of the children of Judah, with Nahshon, the son of Amminadab, as their chief.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: The number of his army was seventy-four thousand, six hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: And nearest to him will be the tribe of Issachar, with Nethanel, the son of Zuar, as their chief.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: The number of his army was fifty-four thousand, four hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: After him, the tribe of Zebulun, with Eliab, the son of Helon, as their chief.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: The number of his army was fifty-seven thousand, four hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: The number of all the armies of Judah was a hundred and eighty-six thousand, four hundred. They go forward first.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: On the south side is the flag of the children of Reuben, in the order of their armies, with Elizur, the son of Shedeur, as their chief.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: The number of his army was forty-six thousand, five hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And nearest to him, the tribe of Simeon, with Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai, as their chief.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: The number of his army was fifty-nine thousand, three hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: Then the tribe of Gad, with Eliasaph, son of Reuel, as their chief.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: The number of his army was forty-five thousand, six hundred and fifty.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: The number of all the armies of Reuben together came to a hundred and fifty-one thousand, four hundred and fifty. They go forward second.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: Then the Tent of meeting is to go forward, with the tents of the Levites, in the middle of the armies; in the same order as their tents are placed, they are to go forward, every man under his flag.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: On the west side will be the flag of the children of Ephraim, with Elishama, the son of Ammihud, as their chief.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: The number of his army was forty thousand, five hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: And by him the tribe of Manasseh with Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur, as their chief.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: The number of his army was thirty-two thousand, two hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: Then the tribe of Benjamin, with Abidan, the son of Gideoni, as their chief.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: The number of his army was thirty-five thousand, four hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: The number of all the armies of Ephraim was a hundred and eight thousand, one hundred. They go forward third.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: On the north side will be the flag of the children of Dan, with Ahiezer, the son of Ammishaddai, as their chief.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: The number of his army was sixty-two thousand, seven hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 27
text: Nearest to him will be the tribe of Asher, with Pagiel, the son of Ochran, as their chief.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 28
text: The number of his army was forty-one thousand, five hundred;

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 29
text: Then the tribe of Naphtali, with Ahira, the son of Enan, as their chief.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 30
text: The number of his army was fifty-three thousand, four hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 31
text: The number of all the armies in the tents of Dan was a hundred and fifty-seven thousand, six hundred. They will go forward last, by their flags.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 32
text: These are all who were numbered of the children of Israel, in the order of their fathers' families: all the armies in their tents together came to six hundred and three thousand, five hundred and fifty.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 33
text: But the Levites were not numbered among the children of Israel, as the Lord said to Moses.

title: Numbers Chapter 2 Verse 34
text: So the children of Israel did as the Lord said to Moses, so they put up their tents by their flags, and they went forward in the same order, by their families, and by their fathers' houses.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Now these are the generations of Aaron and Moses, in the day when the word of the Lord came to Moses on Mount Sinai.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab the oldest, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the priests, on whom the holy oil was put, who were marked out as priests.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And Nadab and Abihu were put to death before the Lord when they made an offering of strange fire before the Lord, in the waste land of Sinai, and they had no children: and Eleazar and Ithamar did the work of priests before Aaron their father.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: Make the tribe of Levi come near, and put them before Aaron the priest, to be his helpers,

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: In order that they may be responsible to him and to all Israel for the care of the Tent of meeting, and to do the work of the House;

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And they will have the care of all the vessels of the Tent of meeting, and will do for the children of Israel all the necessary work of the House.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Give the Levites to Aaron and his sons; so that they may be his without question from among the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And give orders that Aaron and his sons are to keep their place as priests; any strange person who comes near is to be put to death.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: See, I have taken the Levites out of the children of Israel to be mine in place of the first sons of the children of Israel;

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: For all the first sons are mine; on the day when I put to death all the first sons in the land of Egypt, I took for myself every first male birth of man and beast. They are mine; I am the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And the Lord said to Moses in the waste land of Sinai,

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: Let all the children of Levi be numbered by their families and their fathers' houses; let every male of a month old and over be numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: So Moses did as the Lord said, numbering them as he had been ordered.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: These were the sons of Levi by name: Gershon and Kohath and Merari.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: And these are the names of the sons of Gershon, by their families: Libni and Shimei.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: And the sons of Kohath, by their families: Amram and Izhar and Hebron and Uzziel.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: And the sons of Merari by their families: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites in the order of their fathers' houses.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: From Gershon come the Libnites and the Shimeites; these are the families of the Gershonites.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: Those who were numbered of them, the males from one month old and over, were seven thousand, five hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: The tents of the Gershonites are to be placed at the back of the House, to the west.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: The chief of the Gershonites is Eliasaph, the son of Lael.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: In the Tent of meeting, the Gershonites are to have the care of the House, and the Tent with its cover, and the veil for the door of the Tent of meeting,

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: And the hangings for the open space round the House and the altar, and the curtain for its doorway, and all the cords needed for its use.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 27
text: From Kohath come the Amramites and the Izharites and the Hebronites and the Uzzielites; these are the families of the Kohathites.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 28
text: Those who were numbered of them, the males from one month old and over, were eight thousand, six hundred, who were responsible for the care of the holy place.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 29
text: The tents of the Kohathites are to be placed on the south side of the House.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 30
text: Their chief is Elizaphan, the son of Uzziel.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 31
text: In their care are the ark, and the table, and the lights, and the altars, and all the vessels used in the holy place, and the veil, and all they are used for.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 32
text: Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, will be head over all the Levites and overseer of those responsible for the care of the holy place.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 33
text: From Merari come the Mahlites and the Mushites; these are the families of Merari.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 34
text: Those who were numbered of them, the males of a month old and over, were six thousand, two hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 35
text: The chief of the families of Merari was Zuriel, the son of Abihail: their tents are to be placed on the north side of the House.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 36
text: And in their care are to be all the boards of the Tent, with their rods and pillars and bases, and all the instruments, and all they are used for,

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 37
text: And the pillars of the open space round it, with their bases and nails and cords.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 38
text: And those whose tents are to be placed on the east side of the House in front of the Tent of meeting, looking to the dawn, are Moses and Aaron and his sons, who will do the work of the holy place for the children of Israel; and any strange person who comes near will be put to death.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 39
text: All the Levites numbered by Moses and Aaron at the order of the Lord, all the males of one month old and over numbered in the order of their families, were twenty-two thousand.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 40
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Let all the first male children be numbered, and take the number of their names.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 41
text: And give to me the Levites (I am the Lord) in place of the first sons of the children of Israel; and the cattle of the Levites in place of the first births among the cattle of the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 42
text: So Moses had all the first sons among the children of Israel numbered, as the Lord said to him.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 43
text: Every first son from a month old and over was numbered by name, and the number came to twenty-two thousand, two hundred and seventy-three.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 44
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 45
text: Take the Levites in place of all the first sons of the children of Israel, and the cattle of the Levites in place of their cattle; the Levites are to be mine; I am the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 46
text: And the price you have to give for the two hundred and seventy-three first sons of the children of Israel which are in addition to the number of the Levites,

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 47
text: Will be five shekels for every one, by the scale of the holy place (the shekel is twenty gerahs);

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 48
text: And this money, the price of those over the number of the Levites, is to be given to Aaron and his sons.

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 49
text: So Moses took the money, the price of those whose place had not been taken by the Levites;

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 50
text: From the first sons of Israel he took it, a thousand, three hundred and sixty-five shekels, by the scale of the holy place;

title: Numbers Chapter 3 Verse 51
text: And he gave the money to Aaron and his sons, as the Lord had said.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 1
