text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: Let the sons of Kohath, from among the sons of Levi, be numbered by their families, in the order of their fathers' houses;

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: All those from thirty to fifty years old who are able to do the work of the Tent of meeting.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And this is to be the work of the sons of Kohath in connection with the most holy things.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: When all the people go forward, Aaron is to go in with his sons, and take down the veil of the curtain, covering the ark of witness with it;

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And putting over it the leather cover and over that a blue cloth; and putting its rods in place.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And on the table of the holy bread they are to put a blue cloth, and on it all the vessels, the spoons and the basins and the cups; and the holy bread with them;

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And over them they are to put a red cloth, covering it with a leather cover, and putting its rods in their places.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And they are to take a blue cloth, covering with it the light-support with its lights and its instruments and its trays and all the oil vessels which are used for it:

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: All these they are to put in a leather cover, and put it on the frame.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: On the gold altar they are to put a blue cloth, covering it with a leather cover; and they are to put its rods in their places.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: All the vessels which are used in the holy place they are to put in a blue cloth, covering them with a leather cover, and put them on the frame.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And they are to take away the burned waste from the altar, and put a purple cloth on it;

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: Placing on the cloth all its vessels, the fire-baskets, the meat-hooks, the spades, and the basins; all the vessels of the altar; they are to put a leather cover over all these, and put its rods in their places.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: And after the holy place and all its vessels have been covered up by Aaron and his sons, when the tents of the people go forward, the sons of Kohath are to come and take it up; but the holy things may not be touched by them for fear of death.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: And Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, is to be responsible for the oil for the light, and the sweet perfumes for burning, and the regular meal offering, and the holy oil; the House and the holy place and everything in it will be in his care.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: Do not let the family of the Kohathites be cut off from among the Levites;

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: But do this to them, so that life and not death may be theirs when they come near the most holy things; let Aaron and his sons go in and give to every one his work and that which he is to take up;

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: But they themselves are not to go in to see the holy place, even for a minute, for fear of death.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: Let the sons of Gershon be numbered by families, in the order of their fathers' houses;

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: All those from thirty to fifty years old who are able to do the work of the Tent of meeting.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: This is to be the work of the Gershonites, the things they are to do and take up.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: They are to take up the curtains of the House, and the Tent of meeting with its cover and the leather cover over it, and the hangings for the door of the Tent of meeting;

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: And the hangings for the open space round the House and the altar, and the curtain for its doorway, with the cords and all the things used for them; whatever is necessary for these, they are to do.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 27
text: From the mouth of Aaron and his sons the Gershonites will have word about all the things they are to do and take up; you are to give them their orders.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 28
text: This is the work of the family of the Gershonites in the Tent of meeting, and they will be under the direction of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 29
text: The sons of Merari are to be numbered by families, in the order of their fathers' houses;

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 30
text: Every one from thirty to fifty years old who is able to do the work of the Tent of meeting.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 31
text: And this is their part in the work of the Tent of meeting: the transport of the boards and the rods of the Tent, with the pillars and their bases;

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 32
text: And the pillars of the open space outside it, with their bases and their nails and cords and all the instruments used, and everything which has to be done there; all the instruments for which they are responsible are to be numbered by name.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 33
text: This is the work which the sons of Merari are to do in connection with the Tent of meeting, under the direction of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 34
text: So Moses and Aaron and the chiefs of the people took in hand the numbering of the sons of the Kohathites, by families, in the order of their fathers' houses;

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 35
text: Numbering all those from thirty to fifty years old who were able to do the work in the Tent of meeting;

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 36
text: And the number of all these was two thousand, seven hundred and fifty.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 37
text: This is the number of those of the Kohathites who did the work in the Tent of meeting, as they were numbered by Moses and Aaron at the order of the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 38
text: And those of the sons of Gershon who were numbered by families,

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 39
text: All those from thirty to fifty years old who were able to do the work in the Tent of meeting,

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 40
text: Who were numbered by families in the order of their fathers' houses, were two thousand, six hundred and thirty.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 41
text: This is the number of the sons of Gershon who did the work in the Tent of meeting, as they were numbered by Moses and Aaron at the order of the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 42
text: And those of the sons of Merari who were numbered by families, in the order of their fathers' houses,

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 43
text: All those from thirty to fifty years old who did the work in the Tent of meeting,

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 44
text: Who were numbered by families, were three thousand, two hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 45
text: This is the number of the sons of Merari, numbered by Moses and Aaron at the order of the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 46
text: And all the Levites who were numbered by Moses and Aaron and the chiefs of the people, by families, in the order of their fathers' houses,

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 47
text: Those from thirty to fifty years old who were able to do the work of the Tent of meeting and of its transport,

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 48
text: Came to eight thousand, five hundred and eighty.

title: Numbers Chapter 4 Verse 49
text: At the order of the Lord they were numbered by Moses, every one in relation to his work and to his part in the transport; so they were numbered by Moses at the order of the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: Give orders to the children of Israel to put outside the tent-circle every leper, and anyone who has any sort of flow from his body, and anyone who is unclean from the touch of the dead;

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: Male or female they are to be put outside the tent-circle, so that they may not make unclean my resting-place among them.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: So the children of Israel did as the Lord had said to Moses, and put them outside the tent-circle.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: Say to the children of Israel, If a man or a woman does any of the sins of men, going against the word of the Lord, and is in the wrong;

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: Let them say openly what they have done; and make payment for the wrong done, with the addition of a fifth part, and give it to him to whom the wrong was done.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: But if the man has no relation to whom the payment may be made, then the payment for sin made to the Lord will be the priest's, in addition to the sheep offered to take away his sin.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: And every offering lifted up of all the holy things which the children of Israel give to the priest, will be his.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And every man's holy things will be his: whatever a man gives to the priest will be his.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: Say to the children of Israel, If any man's wife does wrong, sinning against him

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: By taking as her lover another man, and keeps it secret so that her husband has no knowledge of it, and there is no witness against her, and she is not taken in the act;

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: If the spirit of doubt comes into her husband's heart, and he has doubts of his wife, with good cause; or if he has doubts of her without cause:

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: Then let him take her to the priest, offering for her the tenth part of an ephah of barley meal, without oil or perfume; for it is a meal offering of a bitter spirit, a meal offering keeping wrongdoing in mind.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: And the priest will make her come near and put her before the Lord;

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: And the priest will take holy water in a pot and put in it dust from the floor of the House;

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: And he will make the woman come before the Lord with her hair loose, and will put the meal offering, the offering of a bitter spirit, in her hands; and the priest will take in his hand the bitter water causing the curse;

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: And he will make her take an oath, and say to her, If no man has been your lover and you have not been with another in place of your husband, you are free from this bitter water causing the curse;

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: But if you have been with another in place of your husband and have made yourself unclean with a lover:

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: Then the priest will put the oath of the curse on the woman, and say to her, May the Lord make you a curse and an oath among your people, sending on you wasting of the legs and disease of the stomach;

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: And this water of the curse will go into your body, causing disease of your stomach and wasting of your legs: and the woman will say, So be it.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: And the priest will put these curses in a book, washing out the writing with the bitter water;

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: And he will give to the woman the bitter water for drink; and the bitter water causing the curse will go into her.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: And the priest will take from her hand the meal offering of doubt, waving it before the Lord, and will take it to the altar;

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: And he will take some of it in his hand, burning it on the altar as a sign, and then he will give the woman the bitter water.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: And it will be that if the woman has become unclean, sinning against her husband, when she has taken the bitter water it will go into her body, causing disease of the stomach and wasting of the legs, and she will be a curse among her people.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 28
text: But if she is clean she will be free and will have offspring.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 29
text: This is the law for testing a wife who goes with another in place of her husband and becomes unclean;

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 30
text: Or for a husband who, in a bitter spirit, has doubts in his heart about his wife; let him take her to the priest, who will put in force this law.

title: Numbers Chapter 5 Verse 31
text: Then the man will be free from all wrong, and the woman's sin will be on her.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: Say to the children of Israel, If a man or a woman takes an oath to keep himself separate and give himself to the Lord;

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: He is to keep himself from wine and strong drink, and take no mixed wine or strong drink or any drink made from grapes, or any grapes, green or dry.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: All the time he is separate he may take nothing made from the grape-vine, from its seeds to its skin.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: All the time he is under his oath let no blade come near his head; till the days while he is separate are ended he is holy and his hair may not be cut.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: All the time he is separate he may not come near any dead body.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: He may not make himself unclean for his father or his mother, his sister or his brother, if death comes to them; because he is under an oath to keep himself separate for God.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: All the time he is separate he is holy to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: If death comes suddenly to a man at his side, so that he becomes unclean, let his hair be cut off on the day when he is made clean, on the seventh day.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And on the eighth day let him take to the priest, at the door of the Tent of meeting, two doves or two young pigeons;

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And the priest will give one for a sin-offering and the other for a burned offering to take away the sin which came on him on account of the dead, and he will make his head holy that same day.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And he will give to the Lord his days of being separate, offering a he-lamb of the first year as an offering for error: but the earlier days will be a loss, because he became unclean.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And this is the law for him who is separate, when the necessary days are ended: he is to come to the door of the Tent of meeting,

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: And make his offering to the Lord; one he-lamb of the first year, without a mark, for a burned offering, and one female lamb of the first year, without a mark, for a sin-offering, and one male sheep, without a mark, for peace-offerings,

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: And a basket of unleavened bread, cakes of the best meal mixed with oil, and thin unleavened cakes covered with oil, with their meal offering and drink offerings.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: And the priest will take them before the Lord, and make his sin-offering and his burned offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: Giving the sheep of the peace-offerings, with the basket of unleavened bread; and at the same time, the priest will make his meal offering and his drink offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: Then let his long hair, the sign of his oath, be cut off at the door of the Tent of meeting, and let him put it on the fire on which the peace-offerings are burning.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: And the priest will take the cooked leg of the sheep and one unleavened cake and one thin cake out of the basket, and put them on the hands of the separate one after his hair has been cut,

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: Waving them for a wave offering before the Lord; this is holy for the priest, together with the waved breast and the leg which is lifted up; after that, the man may take wine.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: This is the law for him who takes an oath to keep himself separate, and for his offering to the Lord on that account, in addition to what he may be able to get; this is the law of his oath, which he will have to keep.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: Say to Aaron and his sons, These are the words of blessing which are to be used by you in blessing the children of Israel; say to them,

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: May the Lord send his blessing on you and keep you:

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: May the light of the Lord's face be shining on you in grace:

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: May the Lord's approval be resting on you and may he give you peace.

title: Numbers Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: So they will put my name on the children of Israel, and I will give them my blessing.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: And when Moses had put up the House completely, and had put oil on it and made it holy, with all the things in it, and had made the altar and all its vessels holy with oil;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: Then the chiefs of Israel, the heads of their fathers' houses, made offerings; these were the chiefs of the tribes, who were over those who were numbered.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: And they came with their offerings before the Lord, six covered carts and twelve oxen; a cart for every two of the chiefs, and for every one an ox.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: Take the things from them, to be used for the work of the Tent of meeting; and give them to the Levites, to every man what is needed for his work.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: So Moses took the carts and the oxen and gave them to the Levites.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: Two carts and four oxen he gave to the sons of Gershon for their work;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: And four carts and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari for their work, under the direction of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: But to the sons of Kohath he gave nothing; because they had the care of the holy place, taking it about on their backs.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And the chiefs gave an offering for the altar on the day when the holy oil was put on it; they made their offering before the altar.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Let every chief on his day give his offering to make the altar holy.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: And he who made his offering on the first day was Nahshon, the son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah:

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: And his offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice for burning;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Nahshon, the son of Amminadab.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: On the second day Nethanel, the son of Zuar, chief of Issachar, made his offering:

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: He gave one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Nethanel, the son of Zuar.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: On the third day Eliab, the son of Helon, chief of the children of Zebulun:

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Eliab, the son of Helon.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 30
text: On the fourth day Elizur, the son of Shedeur, chief of the children of Reuben:

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 31
text: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 32
text: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 33
text: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 34
text: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 35
text: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Elizur, the son of Shedeur.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 36
text: On the fifth day Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai, chief of the children of Simeon:

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 37
text: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 38
text: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 39
text: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 40
text: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 41
text: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 42
text: On the sixth day Eliasaph, the son of Reuel, chief of the children of Gad:

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 43
text: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 44
text: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 45
text: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 46
text: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 47
text: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Eliasaph, the son of Reuel

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 48
text: On the seventh day Elishama, the son of Ammihud, chief of the children of Ephraim:

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 49
text: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 50
text: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 51
text: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 52
text: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 53
text: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Elishama, the son of Ammihud.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 54
text: On the eighth day Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur, chief of the children of Manasseh:

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 55
text: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 56
text: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 57
text: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 58
text: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 59
text: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 60
text: On the ninth day Abidan, the son of Gideoni, chief of the children of Benjamin:

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 61
text: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 62
text: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 63
text: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year for a burned offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 64
text: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 65
text: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Abidan, the son of Gideoni.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 66
text: On the tenth day Ahiezer; the son of Ammishaddai, chief of the children of Dan:

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 67
text: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 68
text: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 69
text: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 70
text: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 71
text: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Ahiezer, the son of Ammishaddai.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 72
text: On the eleventh day Pagiel, the son of Ochran, chief of the children of Asher:

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 73
text: His offering was one silver plate; a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 74
text: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 75
text: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 76
text: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 77
text: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Pagiel, the son of Ochran.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 78
text: On the twelfth day Ahira, the son of Enan, chief of the children of Naphtali:

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 79
text: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 80
text: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 81
text: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 82
text: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 83
text: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Ahira, the son of Enan.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 84
text: These were the offerings given for the altar by the chiefs of Israel, when the holy oil was put on it: twelve silver plates, twelve silver basins, twelve gold spoons;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 85
text: The weight of every silver plate was a hundred and thirty shekels, and of every basin seventy; the weight of all the silver of the vessels was two thousand and four hundred shekels, by the scale of the holy place;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 86
text: The weight of the twelve gold spoons of spice for burning was ten shekels for every one, by the scale of the holy place; all the gold of the spoons was a hundred and twenty shekels;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 87
text: All the oxen, for the burned offering were twelve, the male sheep twelve, the he-lambs of the first year twelve, with their meal offering; and the males of the goats for sin-offering twelve;

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 88
text: And all the oxen for the peace-offerings, twenty-four oxen, the male sheep sixty, and the he-goats sixty, the he-lambs of the first year sixty. This was given for the altar after the holy oil was put on it.

title: Numbers Chapter 7 Verse 89
text: And when Moses went into the Tent of meeting to have talk with him, then the Voice came to his ears from over the cover which was on the ark of witness, from between the two winged ones. And he had talk with him.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: Say to Aaron, When you put the lights in their places, the seven lights will give light in front of the support.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And Aaron did so; he put the lights in their places so that they gave light in front of the support, as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: The support for the lights was of hammered gold work, from its base to its flowers it was of hammered work; from the design which the Lord had given to Moses, he made the support for the lights.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: Take the Levites out from among the children of Israel and make them clean.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And this is how you are to make them clean: let the holy water which takes away sin be put on them, and let the hair all over their bodies be cut off with a sharp blade, and let their clothing be washed and their bodies made clean.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: Then let them take a young ox and its meal offering, crushed grain mixed with oil, and take another ox for a sin-offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: And make the Levites come forward in front of the Tent of meeting, and let all the children of Israel come together:

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And you are to take the Levites before the Lord: and the children of Israel are to put their hands on them:

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And Aaron is to give the Levites to the Lord as a wave offering from the children of Israel, so that they may do the Lord's work.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And the Levites are to put their hands on the heads of the oxen, and one of the oxen is to be offered for a sin-offering and the other for a burned offering to the Lord to take away the sin of the Levites.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: Then the Levites are to be put before Aaron and his sons, to be offered as a wave offering to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: So you are to make the Levites separate from the children of Israel, and the Levites will be mine.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: After that, the Levites will go in to do whatever has to be done in the Tent of meeting; you are to make them clean and give them as a wave offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: For they have been given to me from among the children of Israel; in place of every mother's first son, the first to come to birth in Israel, I have taken them for myself.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: For every mother's first son among the children of Israel is mine, the first male birth of man or beast: on the day when I sent death on all the first sons in the land of Egypt, I made them mine.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: And in place of the first sons among the children of Israel, I have taken the Levites.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: And I have given them to Aaron and to his sons, from among the children of Israel, to undertake for them all the work of the Tent of meeting, and to take away sin from the children of Israel so that no evil may come on them when they come near the holy place.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: All these things Moses and Aaron and the children of Israel did to the Levites; as the Lord gave orders to Moses about the Levites, so the children of Israel did.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: And the Levites were made clean from sin, and their clothing was washed, and Aaron gave them for a wave offering before the Lord; and Aaron took away their sin and made them clean.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: And then the Levites went in to do their work in the Tent of meeting before Aaron and his sons: all the orders which the Lord had given Moses about the Levites were put into effect.

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: This is the rule for the Levites: those of twenty-five years old and over are to go in and do the work of the Tent of meeting;

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: But after they are fifty years old, they are to give up their work and do no more;

title: Numbers Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: But be with their brothers in the Tent of meeting, taking care of it but doing no work. This is what you are to do in connection with the Levites and their work.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses, in the waste land of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt,

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: Let the children of Israel keep the Passover at its regular time.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: In the fourteenth day of this month, at evening, you are to keep it at the regular time, and in the way ordered in the law.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: And Moses gave orders to the children of Israel to keep the Passover.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: So they kept the Passover in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at evening, in the waste land of Sinai: as the Lord gave orders to Moses, so the children of Israel did.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: And there were certain men who were unclean because of a dead body, so that they were not able to keep the Passover on that day; and they came before Moses and before Aaron on that day:

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: And these men said to him, We have been made unclean by the dead body of a man; why may we not make the offering of the Lord at the regular time among the children of Israel?

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And Moses said to them, Do nothing till the Lord gives me directions about you.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: Say to the children of Israel, If any one of you or of your families is unclean because of a dead body, or is on a journey far away, still he is to keep the Passover to the Lord:

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: In the second month, on the fourteenth day, in the evening, they are to keep it, taking it with unleavened bread and bitter-tasting plants;

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: Nothing of it is to be kept till the morning, and no bone of it is to be broken: they are to keep it by the rules of the Passover.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: But the man who, not being unclean or on a journey, does not keep the Passover, will be cut off from his people: because he did not make the offering of the Lord at the regular time, his sin will be on him.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: And if a man from another country is among you and has a desire to keep the Passover to the Lord, let him do as is ordered in the law of the Passover: there is to be the same rule for the man from another nation and for him who had his birth in the land.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: And on the day when the House was put up, the cloud came down on it, on the Tent of witness; and in the evening there was a light like fire over the House till the morning.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: And so it was at all times: it was covered by the cloud, and by a light as of fire by night.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: And whenever the cloud was taken up from over the House, then the children of Israel went journeying on; and in the place where the cloud came to rest, there the children of Israel put up their tents.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: At the order of the Lord the children of Israel went forward, and at the order of the Lord they put up their tents: as long as the cloud was resting on the House, they did not go away from that place.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: When the cloud was resting on the House for a long time the children of Israel, waiting for the order of the Lord, did not go on.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: Sometimes the cloud was resting on the House for two or three days; then, by the order of the Lord, they kept their tents in that place, and when the Lord gave the order they went on.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: And sometimes the cloud was there only from evening to morning; and when the cloud was taken up in the morning they went on their journey again: or if it was resting there by day and by night, whenever the cloud was taken up they went forward.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: Or if the cloud came to rest on the House for two days or a month or a year without moving, the children of Israel went on waiting there and did not go on; but whenever it was taken up they went forward on their journey.

title: Numbers Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: At the word of the Lord they put up their tents, and at the word of the Lord they went forward on their journey: they kept the orders of the Lord as he gave them by Moses.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: Make two silver horns of hammered work, to be used for getting the people together and to give the sign for the moving of the tents.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: When they are sounded, all the people are to come together to you at the door of the Tent of meeting.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: If only one of them is sounded, then the chiefs, the heads of the thousands of Israel, are to come to you.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: When a loud note is sounded, the tents placed on the east side are to go forward.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: At the sound of a second loud note, the tents on the south side are to go forward: the loud note will be the sign to go forward.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: But when all the people are to come together, the horn is to be sounded but not loudly.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: The horns are to be sounded by the sons of Aaron, the priests; this is to be a law for you for ever, from generation to generation.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: And if you go to war in your land against any who do you wrong, then let the loud note of the horn be sounded; and the Lord your God will keep you in mind and give you salvation from those who are against you.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And on days of joy and on your regular feasts and on the first day of every month, let the horns be sounded over your burned offerings and your peace-offerings; and they will put the Lord in mind of you: I am the Lord your God.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: Now in the second year, on the twentieth day of the second month, the cloud was taken up from over the Tent of witness.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: And the children of Israel went on their journey out of the waste land of Sinai; and the cloud came to rest in the waste land of Paran.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: They went forward for the first time on their journey as the Lord had given orders by the hand of Moses.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: First the flag of the children of Judah went forward with their armies: and at the head of his army was Nahshon, the son of Amminadab.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: And at the head of the army of the children of Issachar was Nethanel, the son of Zuar.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: And at the head of the army of the children of Zebulun was Eliab, the son of Helon.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: Then the House was taken down; and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari, who were responsible for moving the House, went forward.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: Then the flag of the children of Reuben went forward with their armies: and at the head of his army was Elizur, the son of Shedeur.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: And at the head of the army of the children of Simeon was Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: At the head of the army of the children of Gad was Eliasaph, the son of Reuel.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: Then the Kohathites went forward with the holy place; the others put up the House ready for their coming.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: Then the flag of the children of Ephraim went forward with their armies: and at the head of his army was Elishama, the son of Ammihud.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: At the head of the army of the children of Manasseh was Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: At the head of the army of the children of Benjamin was Abidan, the son of Gideoni.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: And the flag of the children of Dan, whose tents were moved last of all, went forward with their armies: and at the head of his army was Ahiezer, the son of Ammishaddai.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: At the head of the army of the children of Asher was Pagiel, the son of Ochran.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: And at the head of the army of the children of Naphtali was Ahira, the son of Enan.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: This was the order in which the children of Israel were journeying by armies; so they went forward.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: Then Moses said to Hobab, the son of his father-in-law Reuel the Midianite, We are journeying to that place of which the Lord has said, I will give it to you: so come with us, and it will be for your profit: for the Lord has good things in store for Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: But he said, I will not go with you, I will go back to the land of my birth and to my relations.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: And he said, Do not go from us; for you will be eyes for us, guiding us to the right places in the waste land to put up our tents.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: And if you come with us, we will give you a part in whatever good the Lord does for us.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 33
text: So they went forward three days' journey from the mountain of the Lord; and the ark of the Lord's agreement went three days' journey before them, looking for a resting-place for them;

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 34
text: And by day the cloud of the Lord went over them, when they went forward from the place where they had put up their tents.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 35
text: And when the ark went forward Moses said, Come up, O Lord, and let the armies of those who are against you be broken, and let your haters go in flight before you.

title: Numbers Chapter 10 Verse 36
text: And when it came to rest, he said, Take rest, O Lord, and give a blessing to the families of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Now the people were saying evil against the Lord; and the Lord, hearing it, was angry and sent fire on them, burning the outer parts of the tent-circle.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: And the people made an outcry to Moses, and Moses made prayer to the Lord, and the fire was stopped.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: So that place was named Taberah, because of the fire of the Lord which had been burning among them.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: And the mixed band of people who went with them were overcome by desire: and the children of Israel, weeping again, said, Who will give us flesh for our food?

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: Sweet is the memory of the fish we had in Egypt for nothing, and the fruit and green plants of every sort, sharp and pleasing to the taste:

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: But now our soul is wasted away; there is nothing at all: we have nothing but this manna before our eyes.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: Now the manna was like a seed of grain, like small clear drops.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: The people went about taking it up from the earth, crushing it between stones or hammering it to powder, and boiling it in pots, and they made cakes of it: its taste was like the taste of cakes cooked with oil.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: When the dew came down on the tents at night, the manna came down with it.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: And at the sound of the people weeping, every man at his tent-door, the wrath of the Lord was great, and Moses was very angry.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: And Moses said to the Lord, Why have you done me this evil? and why have I not grace in your eyes, that you have put on me the care of all this people?

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: Am I the father of all this people? have I given them birth, that you say to me, Take them in your arms, like a child at the breast, to the land which you gave by an oath to their fathers?

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: Where am I to get flesh to give to all this people? For they are weeping to me and saying, Give us flesh for our food.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: I am not able by myself to take the weight of all this people, for it is more than my strength.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: If this is to be my fate, put me to death now in answer to my prayer, if I have grace in your eyes; and let me not see my shame.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Send for seventy of the responsible men of Israel, who are in your opinion men of weight and authority over the people; make them come to the Tent of meeting and be there with you.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: And I will come down and have talk with you there: and I will take some of the spirit which is on you and put it on them, and they will take part of the weight of the people off you, so that you do not have to take it by yourself.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: And say to the people, Make yourselves clean before tomorrow and you will have flesh for your food: for in the ears of the Lord you have been weeping and saying, Who will give us flesh for food? for we were well off in Egypt: and so the Lord will give you flesh, and it will be your food;

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: Not for one day only, or even for five or ten or twenty days;

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: But every day for a month, till you are tired of it, turning from it in disgust: because you have gone against the Lord who is with you, and have been weeping before him saying, Why did we come out of Egypt?

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: Then Moses said, The people, among whom I am, are six hundred thousand men on foot; and you have said, I will give them flesh to be their food for a month.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: Are flocks and herds to be put to death for them? or are all the fish in the sea to be got together so that they may be full?

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Has the Lord's hand become short? Now you will see if my word comes true for you or not.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: And Moses went out and gave the people the words of the Lord: and he took seventy of the responsible men of the people, placing them round the Tent.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: Then the Lord came down in the cloud and had talk with him, and put on the seventy men some of the spirit which was on him: now when the spirit came to rest on them, they were like prophets, but only at that time.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: But two men were still in the tent-circle one of them named Eldad and the other Medad: and the spirit came to rest on them; they were among those who had been sent for, but they had not gone out to the Tent: and the prophet's power came on them in the tent-circle.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: And a young man went running to Moses and said, Eldad and Medad are acting as prophets in the tent-circle.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: Then Joshua, the son of Nun, who had been Moses' servant from the time when he was a child, said, My lord Moses, let them be stopped.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: And Moses said to him, Are you moved by envy on my account? If only all the Lord's people were prophets, and the Lord might put his spirit on them!

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: Then Moses, with the responsible men of Israel, went back to the tent-circle.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: Then the Lord sent a wind, driving little birds from the sea, so that they came down on the tents, and all round the tent-circle, about a day's journey on this side and on that, in masses about two cubits high over the face of the earth.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: And all that day and all night and the day after, the people were taking up the birds; the smallest amount which anyone got was ten homers: and they put them out all round the tents.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: But while the meat was still between their teeth, before it was tasted, the wrath of the Lord was moved against the people and he sent a great outburst of disease on them.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 34
text: So that place was named Kibroth-hattaavah; because there they put in the earth the bodies of the people who had given way to their desires.

title: Numbers Chapter 11 Verse 35
text: From Kibroth-hattaavah the people went on to Hazeroth; and there they put up their tents.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: Now Miriam and Aaron said evil against Moses, because of the Cushite woman to whom he was married, for he had taken a Cushite woman as his wife.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: And they said, Have the words of the Lord been given to Moses only? have they not come to us? And the Lord took note of it.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: Now the man Moses was more gentle than any other man on earth.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: And suddenly the Lord said to Moses and Aaron and Miriam, Come out, you three, to the Tent of meeting. And the three of them went out.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: And the Lord came down in a pillar of cloud, taking his place at the door of the Tent, and made Aaron and Miriam come before him.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: And he said, Now give ear to my words: if there is a prophet among you I will give him knowledge of myself in a vision and will let my words come to him in a dream.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: My servant Moses is not so; he is true to me in all my house:

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: With him I will have talk mouth to mouth, openly and not in dark sayings; and with his eyes he will see the form of the Lord: why then had you no fear of saying evil against my servant Moses?

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: And burning with wrath against them, the Lord went away.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: And the cloud was moved from over the Tent; and straight away Miriam became a leper, as white as snow: and Aaron, looking at Miriam, saw that she was a leper.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: Then Aaron said to Moses, O my lord, let not our sin be on our heads, for we have done foolishly and are sinners.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: Let her not be as one dead, whose flesh is half wasted when he comes out from the body of his mother.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: And Moses, crying to the Lord, said, Let my prayer come before you, O God, and make her well.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: And the Lord said to Moses, If her father had put a mark of shame on her, would she not be shamed for seven days? Let her be shut up outside the tent-circle for seven days, and after that she may come in again.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: So Miriam was shut up outside the tent-circle for seven days: and the people did not go forward on their journey till Miriam had come in again.

title: Numbers Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: After that, the people went on from Hazeroth and put up their tents in the waste land of Paran.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: Send men to get knowledge about the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the children of Israel; from every tribe of their fathers you are to send a man, every one a chief among them.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: And Moses sent them from the waste land of Paran as the Lord gave orders, all of them men who were heads of the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: And these were their names: of the tribe of Reuben, Shammua, the son of Zaccur.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: Of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat, the son of Hori.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb, the son of Jephunneh.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: Of the tribe of Issachar, Igal, the son of Joseph.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: Of the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea, the son of Nun.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Palti, the son of Raphu.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: Of the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel, the son of Sodi.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: Of the tribe of Joseph, that is of the family of Manasseh, Gaddi, the son of Susi.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: Of the tribe of Dan, Ammiel, the son of Gemalli.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: Of the tribe of Asher, Sethur, the son of Michael

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: Of the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi, the son of Vophsi.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: Of the tribe of Gad, Gevel, the son of Machi.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: These are the names of the men whom Moses sent to get knowledge about the land. And Moses gave to Hoshea, the son of Nun, the name of Joshua.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: So Moses sent them to have a look at the land of Canaan, and said to them, Go up into the South and into the hill-country;

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: And see what the land is like; and if the people living in it are strong or feeble, small or great in number;

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: And what sort of land they are living in, if it is good or bad; and what their living-places are, tent-circles or walled towns;

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: And if the land is fertile or poor, and if there is wood in it or not. And be of good heart, and come back with some of the produce of the land. Now it was the time when the first grapes were ready.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: So they went up and got a view of the land, from the waste land of Zin to Rehob, on the way to Hamath.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: They went up into the South and came to Hebron; and Ahiman and Sheshai and Talmai, the children of Anak, were living there. (Now the building of Hebron took place seven years before that of Zoan in Egypt.)

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: And they came to the valley of Eshcol, and cutting down a vine-branch with its grapes, two of them took it on a rod between them; and they took some pomegranates and figs.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: That place was named the valley of Eshcol because of the grapes which the children of Israel took from there.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: At the end of forty days they came back from viewing the land.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 26
text: And they came back to Moses and Aaron and all the children of Israel, to Kadesh in the waste land of Paran; and gave an account to them and to all the people and let them see the produce of the land.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 27
text: And they said, We came to the land where you sent us, and truly it is flowing with milk and honey: and here is some of the produce of it.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 28
text: But the people living in the land are strong, and the towns are walled and very great; further, we saw the children of Anak there.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 29
text: And the Amalekites are in the South; and the Hittites and the Jebusites and the Amorites are living in the hill-country; and the Canaanites by the sea and by the side of Jordan.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 30
text: Then Caleb made signs to the people to keep quiet, and said to Moses, Let us go up straight away and take this land; for we are well able to overcome it.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 31
text: But the men who had gone up with him said, We are not able to go up against the people, for they are stronger than we.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 32
text: And they gave the children of Israel a bad account of the land they had been to see, saying, This land through which we went is a land causing destruction to those living in it; and all the people we saw there are men of more than common size.

title: Numbers Chapter 13 Verse 33
text: There we saw those great men, the sons of Anak, offspring of the Nephilim: and we seemed to ourselves no more than insects, and so we seemed to them.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: Then all the people gave load cries of grief, and all that night they gave themselves up to weeping.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: And all the children of Israel, crying out against Moses and Aaron, said, If only we had come to our death in the land of Egypt, or even in this waste land!

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: Why is the Lord taking us into this land to come to our death by the sword? Our wives and our little ones will get into strange hands: would it not be better for us to go back to Egypt?

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: And they said to one another, Let us make a captain over us, and go back to Egypt.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: Then Moses and Aaron went down on their faces before the meeting of the people.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: And Joshua, the son of Nun, and Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, two of those who had been to see the land, giving signs of grief,

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: Said to all the children of Israel, This land which we went through to see is a very good land.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: And if the Lord has delight in us, he will take us into this land and give it to us, a land flowing with milk and honey.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: Only, do not go against the Lord or go in fear of the people of the land, for they will be our food; their strength has been taken from them and the Lord is with us: have no fear of them.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: But all the people said they were to be stoned. Then the glory of the Lord was seen in the Tent of meeting, before the eyes of all the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: And the Lord said to Moses, How long will this people have no respect for me? how long will they be without faith, in the face of all the signs I have done among them?

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: I will send disease on them for their destruction, and take away their heritage, and I will make of you a nation greater and stronger than they.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: And Moses said to the Lord, Then it will come to the ears of the Egyptians; for by your power you took this people out from among them;

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: And they will give the news to the people of this land: they have had word that you, Lord, are present with this people, letting yourself be seen face to face, and that your cloud is resting over them, and that you go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: Now if you put to death all this people as one man, then the nations who have had word of your glory will say,

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: Because the Lord was not able to take this people into the land which he made an oath to give them, he sent destruction on them in the waste land.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: So now, may my prayer come before you, and let the power of the Lord be great, as you said:

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: The Lord is slow to wrath and great in mercy, overlooking wrongdoing and evil, and will not let wrongdoers go free; sending punishment on children for the sins of their fathers, to the third and fourth generation.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: May the sin of this people have forgiveness, in the measure of your great mercy, as you have had mercy on them from Egypt up till now.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: And the Lord said, I have had mercy, as you say:

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: But truly, as I am living, and as all the earth will be full of the glory of the Lord;

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: Because all these men, having seen my glory and the signs which I have done in Egypt and in the waste land, still have put me to the test ten times, and have not given ear to my voice;

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: They will not see the land about which I made an oath to their fathers; not one of these by whom I have not been honoured will see it.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: But my servant Caleb, because he had a different spirit in him, and has been true to me with all his heart, him I will take into that land into which he went, and his seed will have it for their heritage.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites are in the valley; tomorrow, turning round, go into the waste land by the way to the Red Sea.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: Then the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: How long am I to put up with this evil people and their outcries against me? The words which they say against me have come to my ears.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: Say to them, By my life, says the Lord, as certainly as your words have come to my ears, so certainly will I do this to you:

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 29
text: Your dead bodies will be stretched out in this waste land; and of all your number, all those of twenty years old and over who have been crying out against me,

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 30
text: Not one will come into the land which I gave my word you would have for your resting-place, but only Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua, the son of Nun.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 31
text: And your little ones, whom you said would come into strange hands, I will take in, and they will see the land which you would not have.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 32
text: But as for you, your dead bodies will be stretched in this waste land.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 33
text: And your children will be wanderers in the waste land for forty years, undergoing punishment for your false ways, till your bodies become dust in the waste land.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 34
text: And as you went through the land viewing it for forty days, so for forty years, a year for every day, you will undergo punishment for your wrongdoing, and you will see that I am against you.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 35
text: I the Lord have said it, and this I will certainly do to all this evil people who have come together against me: in this waste land destruction will come on them, and death will be their fate.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 36
text: And the men whom Moses sent to see the land, and who, by the bad account they gave of the land, were the cause of the outcry the people made against Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 37
text: Those same men who said evil of the land, came to their death by disease before the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 38
text: But Joshua, the son of Nun, and Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, of those who went to see the land, were not touched by disease.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 39
text: And when Moses put these words before the children of Israel, the people were full of grief.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 40
text: And early in the morning they got up and went to the top of the mountain, saying, We are here and we will go up to the place which the Lord said he would give us: for we have done wrong.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 41
text: And Moses said, Why are you now acting against the Lord's order, seeing that no good will come of it?

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 42
text: Go not up, for the Lord is not with you, and you will be overcome by those who are fighting against you.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 43
text: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and you will be put to death by their swords: because you have gone back from the way of the Lord, the Lord will not be with you.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 44
text: But they gave no attention to his words and went to the top of the mountain, though Moses and the ark of the Lord's agreement did not go out of the tent-circle.

title: Numbers Chapter 14 Verse 45
text: Then the Amalekites came down, and the Canaanites who were living in the hill-country, and overcame them completely, driving them back as far as Hormah.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: Say to the children of Israel, When you have come into the land which I am giving to you for your resting-place,

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: And are going to make an offering by fire to the Lord, a burned offering or an offering in connection with an oath, or an offering freely given, or at your regular feasts, an offering for a sweet smell to the Lord, from the herd or the flock:

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: Then let him who is making his offering, give to the Lord a meal offering of a tenth part of a measure of the best meal mixed with a fourth part of a hin of oil:

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: And for the drink offering, you are to give with the burned offering or other offering, the fourth part of a hin of wine for every lamb.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: Or for a male sheep, give as a meal offering two tenth parts of a measure of the best meal mixed with a third part of a hin of oil:

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: And for the drink offering give a third part of a hin of wine, for a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: And when you make ready a young ox for a burned or other offering, or for the effecting of an oath, or for peace-offerings to the Lord:

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: Then with the ox give a meal offering of three tenth parts of a measure of the best meal mixed with half a hin of oil.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: And for the drink offering: give half a hin of wine, for an offering made by fire for a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: This is to be done for every young ox and for every male sheep or he-lamb or young goat.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: Whatever number you make ready, so you are to do for every one.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: All those who are Israelites by birth are to do these things in this way, when giving an offering made by fire of a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: And if a man from another country or any other person living among you, through all your generations, has the desire to give an offering made by fire of a sweet smell to the Lord, let him do as you do.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: There is to be one law for you and for the man of another country living with you, one law for ever from generation to generation; as you are, so is he to be before the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: The law and the rule are to be the same for you and for those from other lands living with you.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: Say to the children of Israel, When you come into the land where I am guiding you,

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: Then, when you take for your food the produce of the land, you are to give an offering lifted up before the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: Of the first of your rough meal you are to give a cake for a lifted offering, lifting it up before the Lord as the offering of the grain-floor is lifted up.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: From generation to generation you are to give to the Lord a lifted offering from the first of your rough meal.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: And if in error you go against any of these laws which the Lord has given to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: All the laws which the Lord has given you by the hand of Moses, from the day when the Lord gave them, and ever after from generation to generation;

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: Then, if the wrong is done in error, without the knowledge of the meeting of the people, let all the meeting give a young ox as a burned offering, a sweet smell to the Lord, with its meal offering and its drink offering, as is ordered in the law, together with a he-goat for a sin-offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: So the priest will make the people free from sin, and they will have forgiveness; for it was an error, and they have given their offering made by fire to the Lord, and their sin-offering before the Lord, on account of their error:

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: And all the meeting of the children of Israel, as well as those from other lands living among them, will have forgiveness; for it was an error on the part of the people.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: And if one person does wrong, without being conscious of it, then let him give a she-goat of the first year for a sin-offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: And the priest will take away the sin of the person who has done wrong, if the wrong was done unconsciously, and he will have forgiveness.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: The law in connection with wrong done unconsciously is to be the same for him who is an Israelite by birth and for the man from another country who is living among them.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: But the person who does wrong in the pride of his heart, if he is one of you or of another nation by birth, is acting without respect for the Lord, and will be cut off from his people.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: Because he had no respect for the word of the Lord, and did not keep his law, that man will be cut off without mercy and his sin will be on him.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: Now while the children of Israel were in the waste land, they saw a man who was getting sticks on the Sabbath day.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 33
text: And those who saw him getting sticks took him before Moses and Aaron and all the people.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 34
text: And they had him shut up, because they had no directions about what was to be done with him.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 35
text: Then the Lord said to Moses, Certainly the man is to be put to death: let him be stoned by all the people outside the tent-circle.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 36
text: So all the people took him outside the tent-circle and he was stoned to death there, as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 37
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 38
text: Say to the children of Israel that through all their generations they are to put on the edges of their robes an ornament of twisted threads, and in every ornament a blue cord;

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 39
text: So that, looking on these ornaments, you may keep in mind the orders of the Lord and do them; and not be guided by the desires of your hearts and eyes, through which you have been untrue to me:

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 40
text: And that you may keep in mind all my orders and do them and be holy to your God.

title: Numbers Chapter 15 Verse 41
text: I am the Lord your God, who took you out of the land of Egypt, so that I might be your God: I am the Lord your God.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: Now Korah, the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, with Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and On, the son of Pallu, the son of Reuben, made themselves ready,

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: And came before Moses, with certain of the children of Israel, two hundred and fifty chiefs of the people, men of good name who had a place in the meeting of the people.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: They came together against Moses and against Aaron, and said to them, You take overmuch on yourselves, seeing that all the people are holy, every one of them, and the Lord is among them; why then have you put yourselves in authority over the people of the Lord?

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: And Moses, hearing this, went down on his face;

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: And he said to Korah and his band, In the morning the Lord will make clear who are his, and who is holy, and who may come near him: the man of his selection will be caused to come near him.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: So do this: let Korah and all his band take vessels for burning perfumes;

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: And put spices on the fire in them before the Lord tomorrow; then the man marked out by the Lord will be holy: you take overmuch on yourselves, you sons of Levi.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: And Moses said to Korah, Give ear now, you sons of Levi:

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: Does it seem only a small thing to you that the God of Israel has made you separate from the rest of Israel, letting you come near himself to do the work of the House of the Lord, and to take your place before the people to do what has to be done for them;

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: Letting you, and all your brothers the sons of Levi, come near to him? and would you now be priests?

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: So you and all your band have come together against the Lord; and Aaron, who is he, that you are crying out against him?

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: Then Moses sent for Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab: and they said, We will not come up:

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: Is it not enough that you have taken us from a land flowing with milk and honey, to put us to death in the waste land, but now you are desiring to make yourself a chief over us?

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: And more than this, you have not taken us into a land flowing with milk and honey, or given us a heritage of fields and vine-gardens: will you put out the eyes of these men? We will not come up.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: Then Moses was very angry, and said to the Lord, Give no attention to their offering: not one of their asses have I taken, or done wrong to any of them.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: And Moses said to Korah, You and all your band are to come before the Lord tomorrow, you and they and Aaron:

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: And let every man take a vessel for burning perfumes, and put sweet spices in them; let every man take his vessel before the Lord, two hundred and fifty vessels; you and Aaron and everyone with his vessel.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: So every man took his vessel and they put fire in them, with spices, and came to the door of the Tent of meeting with Moses and Aaron.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: And Korah made all the people come together against them to the door of the Tent of meeting: and the glory of the Lord was seen by all the people.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: Come out from among this people, so that I may send sudden destruction on them.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: Then falling down on their faces they said, O God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, because of one man's sin will your wrath be moved against all the people?

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 24
