text: Say to the people, Come away from the tent of Korah Dathan, and Abiram.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 25
text: So Moses got up and went to Dathan and Abiram, and the responsible men of Israel went with him.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 26
text: And he said to the people, Come away now from the tents of these evil men, without touching anything of theirs, or you may be taken in the punishment of their sins.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 27
text: So on every side they went away from the tent of Korah Dathan, and Abiram: and Dathan and Abiram came out to the door of their tents, with their wives and their sons and their little ones.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 28
text: And Moses said, Now you will see that the Lord has sent me to do all these works, and I have not done them of myself.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 29
text: If these men have the common death of men, or if the natural fate of all men overtakes them, then the Lord has not sent me.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 30
text: But if the Lord does something new, opening the earth to take them in, with everything which is theirs, and they go down living into the underworld, then it will be clear to you that the Lord has not been honoured by these men.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 31
text: And while these words were on his lips, the earth under them was parted in two;

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 32
text: And the earth, opening her mouth, took them in, with their families, and all the men who were joined to Korah, and their goods.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 33
text: So they and all theirs went down living into the underworld, and the earth was shut over them, and they were cut off from among the meeting of the people.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 34
text: And all Israel round about them went in flight at their cry, For fear, said they, that we go down into the heart of the earth.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 35
text: Then fire came out from the Lord, burning up the two hundred and fifty men who were offering the perfume.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 36
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 37
text: Say to Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, that he is to take out of the flames the vessels with the perfumes in them, turning the fire out of them, for they are holy;

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 38
text: And let the vessels of those men, who with their lives have made payment for their sin, be hammered out into plates as a cover for the altar; for they have been offered before the Lord and are holy; so that they may be a sign to the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 39
text: So Eleazar the priest took the brass vessels which had been offered by those who were burned up, and they were hammered out to make a cover for the altar:

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 40
text: To be a sign, kept in memory for ever by the children of Israel, that no man who is not of the seed of Aaron has the right of burning spices before the Lord, so that he may not be like Korah and his band: as the Lord said to him by the mouth of Moses.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 41
text: But on the day after, all the children of Israel made an outcry against Moses and against Aaron, saying, You have put to death the Lord's people.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 42
text: Now when the people had come together against Moses and Aaron, looking in the direction of the Tent of meeting, they saw the cloud covering it, and the glory of the Lord came before their eyes.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 43
text: Then Moses and Aaron came to the front of the Tent of meeting.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 44
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 45
text: Come out from among this people, so that I may send sudden destruction on them. And they went down on their faces.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 46
text: And Moses said to Aaron, Take your vessel and put in it fire from the altar, and sweet spices, and take it quickly into the meeting of the people, and make them free from sin: for wrath has gone out from the Lord, and the disease is starting.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 47
text: And at the words of Moses, Aaron took his vessel, and went running among the people; and even then the disease had made a start among them; and he put spices in his vessel to take away the sin of the people.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 48
text: And he took his place between the dead and the living: and the disease was stopped.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 49
text: Now fourteen thousand, seven hundred deaths were caused by that disease, in addition to those who came to their end because of what Korah had done.

title: Numbers Chapter 16 Verse 50
text: Then Aaron went back to Moses to the door of the Tent of meeting: and the disease came to a stop.

title: Numbers Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: Say to the children of Israel that they are to give you rods, one for every family, for every chief, the head of his father's house, making twelve rods; let every man's name be placed on his rod.

title: Numbers Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: And let Aaron's name be placed on the rod of Levi: for there is to be one rod for the head of every family.

title: Numbers Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: And let them be stored up in the Tent of meeting, in front of the ark of witness where I come to you.

title: Numbers Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: And the rod of that man who is marked out by me for myself will have buds on it; so I will put a stop to the outcries which the children of Israel make to me against you.

title: Numbers Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: So Moses gave these orders to the children of Israel, and all their chiefs gave him rods, one for the head of every family, making twelve rods: and Aaron's rod was among them.

title: Numbers Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: And Moses put the rods before the Lord in the Tent of witness.

title: Numbers Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: Now on the day after, Moses went into the Tent of witness; and he saw that Aaron's rod, the rod of the house of Levi, had put out buds, and was covered with buds and flowers and fruit.

title: Numbers Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: Then Moses took out all the rods from before the Lord, and gave them back to the children of Israel: and they saw them, and every man took his rod.

title: Numbers Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Put Aaron's rod back in front of the ark of witness, to be kept for a sign against this false-hearted people, so that you may put a stop to their outcries against me, and death may not overtake them.

title: Numbers Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: This Moses did: as the Lord gave orders, so he did.

title: Numbers Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: And the children of Israel said to Moses, Truly, destruction has come on us; an evil fate has overtaken us all.

title: Numbers Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: Death will overtake everyone who comes near, who comes near the House of the Lord: are we all to come to destruction?

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Aaron, You and your sons and your father's family are to be responsible for all wrongdoing in relation to the holy place: and you and your sons are to be responsible for the errors which come about in your work as priests.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: Let your brothers, the family of Levi, come near with you, so that they may be joined with you and be your servants: but you and your sons with you are to go in before the ark of witness.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: They are to do your orders and be responsible for the work of the Tent; but they may not come near the vessels of the holy place or the altar, so that death may not overtake them or you.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: They are to be joined with you in the care of the Tent of meeting, doing whatever is needed for the Tent: and no one of any other family may come near you.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: You are to be responsible for the holy place and the altar, so that wrath may never again come on the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: Now, see, I have taken your brothers the Levites from among the children of Israel: they are given to you and to the Lord, to do the work of the Tent of meeting.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: And you and your sons with you are to be responsible as priests for the altar and everything on it, and everything inside the veil; you are to do the work of priests; I have given you your position as priests; and any other man who comes near will be put to death.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: And the Lord said to Aaron, See, I have given into your care my lifted offerings; even all the holy things of the children of Israel I have given to you and to your sons as your right for ever, because you have been marked with the holy oil.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: This is to be yours of the most holy things, out of the fire offerings; every offering of theirs, every meal offering and sin-offering, and every offering which they make on account of error, is to be most holy for you and your sons.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: As most holy things they are to be your food: let every male have them for food; it is to be holy to you.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: And this is yours: the lifted offering which they give and all the wave offerings of the children of Israel I have given to you and to your sons and to your daughters as your right for ever: everyone in your house who is clean may have them for food.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: All the best of the oil and the wine and the grain, the first-fruits of them which they give to the Lord, to you have I given them.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: The earliest produce from their land which they take to the Lord is to be yours; everyone in your house who is clean may have it for his food.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: Everything given by oath to the Lord in Israel is to be yours.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: The first birth of every living thing which is offered to the Lord, of man or beast, is to be yours; but for the first sons of man payment is to be made, and for the first young of unclean beasts.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: Payment is to be made for these when they are a month old, at the value fixed by you, a price of five shekels by the scale of the holy place, that is, twenty gerahs to the shekel.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: But no such payment may be made for the first birth of an ox or a sheep or a goat; these are holy: their blood is to be dropped on the altar, and their fat burned for an offering made by fire, a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: Their flesh is to be yours; like the breast of the wave offering and the right leg, it is to be yours.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: All the lifted offerings of the holy things which the children of Israel give to the Lord, I have given to you and to your sons and to your daughters as a right for ever. This is an agreement made with salt before the Lord, to you and to your seed for ever.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: And the Lord said to Aaron, You will have no heritage in their land, or any part among them; I am your part and your heritage among the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: And to the children of Levi I have given as their heritage all the tenths offered in Israel, as payment for the work they do, the work of the Tent of meeting.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: In future the children of Israel are not to come near the Tent of meeting, so that death may not come to them because of sin.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: But the Levites are to do the work of the Tent of meeting, and be responsible for errors in connection with it: this is a law for ever through all your generations; and among the children of Israel they will have no heritage.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: For the tenths which the children of Israel give as a lifted offering to the Lord I have given to the Levites as their heritage. and so I have said to them, Among the children of Israel they will have no heritage.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: Say to the Levites, When you take from the children of Israel the tenth which I have given to you from them as your heritage, a tenth part of that tenth is to be offered as an offering lifted up before the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: And this lifted offering is to be put to your credit as if it was grain from the grain-floor and wine from the vines.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: So you are to make an offering lifted up to the Lord from all the tenths which you get from the children of Israel, giving out of it the Lord's lifted offering to Aaron the priest.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 29
text: From everything given to you, let the best of it, the holy part of it, be offered as a lifted offering to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 30
text: Say to them, then, When the best of it is lifted up on high, it is to be put to the account of the Levites as the increase of the grain-floor and of the place where the grapes are crushed.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 31
text: It is to be your food, for you and your families in every place: it is your reward for your work in the Tent of meeting.

title: Numbers Chapter 18 Verse 32
text: And no sin will be yours on account of it, when the best of it has been lifted up on high; you are not to make a wrong use of the holy things of the children of Israel, so that death may not overtake you.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: This is the rule of the law which the Lord has made, saying, Give orders to the children of Israel to give you a red cow without any mark on her, and on which the yoke has never been put:

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: Give her to Eleazar the priest and let him take her outside the tent-circle and have her put to death before him.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: Then let Eleazar the priest take some of her blood on his finger, shaking the blood seven times in the direction of the front of the Tent of meeting:

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: And the cow is to be burned before him, her skin and her flesh and her blood and her waste are to be burned:

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: Then let the priest take cedar-wood and hyssop and red thread, and put them into the fire where the cow is burning.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: And the priest, after washing his clothing and bathing his body in water, may come back to the tent-circle, and will be unclean till evening.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: And he who does the burning is to have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water and be unclean till evening.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: Then let a man who is clean take the dust of the burned cow and put it outside the tent-circle in a clean place, where it is to be kept for the children of Israel and used in making the water which takes away what is unclean: it is a sin-offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: And he who takes up the dust of the burned cow is to have his clothing washed with water and be unclean till evening: this is to be a law for ever, for the children of Israel as well as for the man from another country who is living among them.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: Anyone touching a dead body will be unclean for seven days:

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: On the third day and on the seventh day he is to make himself clean with the water, and so he will be clean: but if he does not do this on the third day and on the seventh day, he will not be clean.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: Anyone touching the body of a dead man without making himself clean in this way, makes the House of the Lord unclean; and that man will be cut off from Israel: because the water was not put on him, he will be unclean; his unclean condition is unchanged.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: This is the law when death comes to a man in his tent: everyone who comes into the tent, and everyone who is in the tent, will be unclean for seven days.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: And every open vessel without a cover fixed on it will be unclean.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: And anyone touching one who has been put to death with the sword in the open country, or the body of one who has come to his end by a natural death, or a man's bone, or the resting-place of a dead body, will be unclean for seven days.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: And for the unclean, they are to take the dust of the burning of the sin-offering, and put flowing water on it in a vessel:

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: And a clean person is to take hyssop and put it in the water, shaking it over the tent, and all the vessels, and the people who were there, and over him by whom the bone, or the body of one who has been put to death with the sword, or the body of one who has come to his end by a natural death, or the resting-place was touched.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: Let the clean person do this to the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day: and on the seventh day he is to make him clean; and after washing his clothing and bathing himself in water, he will be clean in the evening.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: But the man who, being unclean, does not make himself clean in this way, will be cut off from the meeting of the people, because he has made the holy place of the Lord unclean: the water has not been put on him, he is unclean.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: This is to be a law for them for ever: he who puts the water on the unclean person is to have his clothing washed; and anyone touching the water will be unclean till evening.

title: Numbers Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: Anything touched by the unclean person will be unclean; and any person touching it will be unclean till evening.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: In the first month all the children of Israel came into the waste land of Zin, and put up their tents in Kadesh; there death came to Miriam, and they put her body to rest in the earth.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: And there was no water for the people: and they came together against Moses and against Aaron.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: And the people were angry with Moses and said, If only death had overtaken us when our brothers came to their death before the Lord!

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: Why have you taken the Lord's people into this waste, for death to come to us and to our cattle there?

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: Why have you made us come out of Egypt into this evil place? This is no place of seed or figs or vines or other fruits, and there is no water for drinking.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: Then Moses and Aaron went away from the people to the door of the Tent of meeting; and, falling on their faces there, they saw the glory of the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: Take the rod, you and Aaron, your brother, and make all the people come together, and before their eyes give orders to the rock to give out its water; and so make water come out of the rock for them, and give the people and their cattle drink.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: And Moses took the rod from before the Lord as he gave him orders.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: Then Moses and Aaron made the people come together in front of the rock, and he said to them, Give ear now, you people whose hearts are turned from the Lord; are we to get water for you out of the rock?

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: And lifting up his hand, Moses gave the rock two blows with his rod: and water came streaming out, and the people and their cattle had drink enough.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: Then the Lord said to Moses and Aaron, Because you had not enough faith in me to keep my name holy before the children of Israel, you will not take this people into the land which I have given them.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: These are the waters of Meribah; because the children of Israel went against the Lord, and they saw that he was holy among them.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: Then Moses sent men from Kadesh to the king of Edom to say to him, Your brother Israel says, You have knowledge of all the things we have been through;

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: How our fathers went down into Egypt, and we were living in Egypt for a long time; and the Egyptians were cruel to us and to our fathers:

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: And the Lord gave ear to the voice of our cry, and sent an angel and took us out of Egypt: and now we are in Kadesh, a town on the edge of your land;

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: Let us now go through your land: we will not go into field or vine-garden, or take the water of the springs; we will go by the highway, not turning to the right or to the left, till we have gone past the limits of your land.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: And Edom said, You are not to go through my land, for if you do I will come out against you with the sword.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: And the children of Israel said to him, We will go up by the highway: and if we or our cattle take of your water, we will give you a price for it: only let us go through on our feet, nothing more.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: But he said, You are not to go through. And Edom came out against them in his strength, with a great army.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: So Edom would not let Israel go through his land; and Israel went in another direction.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: And they went on from Kadesh, and came, with all their people, to Mount Hor.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: And at Mount Hor, at the edge of the land of Edom, the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: Aaron will be put to rest with his people; he will not go into the land which I have given to the children of Israel, because you went against my word at the waters of Meribah.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: So take Aaron and Eleazar, his son, up into Mount Hor;

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: And take Aaron's robes off him and put them on Eleazar, his son: and death will come to Aaron there, and he will be put to rest with his people.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 27
text: So Moses did as the Lord had said, and before the eyes of all the people they went up Mount Hor.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 28
text: And Moses took off Aaron's robes, and put them on Eleazar, his son; and there on the top of the mountain death came to Aaron: then Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain.

title: Numbers Chapter 20 Verse 29
text: And when the people saw that Aaron was dead, all the children of Israel gave themselves up to weeping for him for thirty days.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: And it came to the ears of the Canaanite, the king of Arad, living in the South, that Israel was coming by the way of Atharim, and he came out against them and took some of them prisoners.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: Then Israel made an oath to the Lord, and said, If you will give up this people into my hands, then I will send complete destruction on all their towns.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: And the Lord, in answer to the voice of Israel, gave the Canaanites up to them; and they put them and their towns completely to destruction: and that place was named Hormah.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: Then they went on from Mount Hor by the way to the Red Sea, going round the land of Edom: and the spirit of the people was overcome with weariness on the way.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: And crying out against God and against Moses, they said, Why have you taken us out of Egypt to come to our death in the waste land? For there is no bread and no water, and this poor bread is disgusting to us.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: Then the Lord sent poison-snakes among the people; and their bites were a cause of death to numbers of the people of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: Then the people came to Moses and said, We have done wrong in crying out against the Lord and against you: make prayer to the Lord to take away the snakes from us. So Moses made prayer for the people.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Make an image of a snake and put it on a rod, and anyone who has been wounded by the snakes, looking on it will be made well.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: So Moses made a snake of brass and put it on a rod; and anyone who had a snakebite, after looking on the snake of brass, was made well.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: Then the children of Israel went on and put up their tents in Oboth.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: And journeying on again from Oboth, they put up their tents in Iye-abarim, in the waste land before Moab looking east.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: And moving on from there, they put up their tents in the valley of Zered.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: From there they went on and put up their tents on the other side of the Arnon, which is on the waste land at the edge of the land of the Amorites; for the Arnon is the line of division between Moab and the Amorites:

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: As it says in the book of the Wars of the Lord, Vaheb in Suphah, and the valley of the Amon;

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: The slope of the valleys going down to the tents of Ar and touching the edge of Moab.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: From there they went on to Beer, the water-spring of which the Lord said to Moses, Make the people come together and I will give them water.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: Then Israel gave voice to this song: Come up, O water-spring, let us make a song to it:

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: The fountain made by the chiefs, made deep by the great ones of the people, with the law-givers' rod, and with their sticks. Then from the waste land they went on to Mattanah:

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: And from Mattanah to Nahaliel: and from Nahaliel to Bamoth:

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: And from Bamoth to the valley in the open country of Moab, and to the top of Pisgah looking over Jeshimon.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: And Israel sent men to Sihon, king of the Amorites, saying,

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: Let me go through your land: we will not go into field or vine-garden, or take the water of the springs; we will go by the highway till we have gone past the limits of your land.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: And Sihon would not let Israel go through his land; but got all his people together and went out against Israel into the waste land, as far as Jahaz, to make war on Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: But Israel overcame him, and took all his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, as far as the country of the children of Ammon, for the country of the children of Ammon was strongly armed.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: And Israel took all their towns, living in Heshbon and all the towns and small places of the Amorites.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 26
text: For Heshbon was the town of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who had made war against an earlier king of Moab and taken from him all his land as far as the Arnon.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 27
text: So the makers of wise sayings say, Come to Heshbon, building up the town of Sihon and making it strong:

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 28
text: For a fire has gone out of Heshbon, a flame from the town of Sihon: for the destruction of Ar in Moab, and the lords of the high places of the Arnon.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 29
text: Sorrow is yours, O Moab! Destruction is your fate, O people of Chemosh: his sons have gone in flight, and his daughters are prisoners, in the hands of Sihon, king of the Amorites.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 30
text: They are wounded with our arrows; destruction has come on Heshbon, even to Dibon; and we have made the land waste as far as Nophah, stretching out to Medeba.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 31
text: So Israel put up their tents in the land of the Amorites.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 32
text: And Moses sent men secretly to Jazer, and they took its towns, driving out the Amorites who were living there.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 33
text: Then turning they went up by the way of Bashan; and Og, king of Bashan, went out against them with all his people, to the fight at Edrei.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 34
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Have no fear of him: for I have given him up into your hands, with all his people and his land; do to him as you did to Sihon, king of the Amorites, at Heshbon.

title: Numbers Chapter 21 Verse 35
text: So they overcame him and his sons and his people, driving them all out: and they took his land for their heritage.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: Then the children of Israel, journeying on, put up their tents in the lowlands of Moab, on the other side of Jordan at Jericho.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: Now Balak, the son of Zippor, saw what Israel had done to the Amorites.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: And in Moab there was great fear of the people, because their numbers were so great: and the feeling of Moab was bitter against the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: Then Moab said to the responsible men of Midian, It is clear that this great people will be the destruction of everything round us, making a meal of us as the ox does of the grass of the field. At that time Balak, the son of Zippor, was king of Moab.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: So he sent men to Balaam, son of Beor, at Pethor by the River in the land of the children of his people, saying to him, See, a people has come out of Egypt, covering all the face of the earth, and they have put up their tents opposite to me:

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: Come now, in answer to my prayer, and put a curse on this people, for they are greater than I: and then I may be strong enough to overcome them and send them out of the land: for it is clear that good comes to him who has your blessing, but he on whom you put your curse is cursed.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: So the responsible men of Moab and Midian went away, taking in their hands rewards for the prophet; and they came to Balaam and said to him what Balak had given them orders to say.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: And he said to them, Take your rest here tonight, and I will give you an answer after hearing what the Lord says; so the chiefs of Moab kept there with Balaam that night.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: And God came to Balaam and said, Who are these men with you?

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: And Balaam said to God, Balak, the son of Zippor, king of Moab, has sent them to me, saying,

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: See, the people who have come out of Egypt are covering all the earth: now, put a curse on this people for me, so that I may be able to make war on them, driving them out of the land.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: And God said to Balaam, You are not to go with them, or put a curse on this people, for they have my blessing.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: In the morning Balaam got up and said to the chiefs of Balak, Go back to your land, for the Lord will not let me go with you.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: So the chiefs of Moab went back to Balak and said, Balaam will not come with us.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: So Balak sent more chiefs, greater in number and of higher position than the others.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: And they came to Balaam and said, Balak, son of Zippor, says, Let nothing keep you from coming to me:

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: For I will give you a place of very great honour, and whatever you say to me I will do; so come, in answer to my prayer, and put a curse on this people.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: But Balaam, in answer; said to the servants of Balak, Even if Balak gave me his house full of silver and gold, it would not be possible for me to do anything more or less than the orders of the Lord my God.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: So take your rest here this night, till I have knowledge what more the Lord has to say to me.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: And that night God came to Balaam and said to him, If these men have come for you, go with them: but do only what I say to you.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: So in the morning Balaam got up and, making his ass ready, went with the chiefs of Moab.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: But God was moved to wrath because he went: and the angel of the Lord took up a position in the road to keep him from his purpose. Now he was seated on his ass, and his two servants were with him.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: And the ass saw the angel of the Lord waiting in the road with his sword in his hand; and turning from the road, the ass went into the field; and Balaam gave the ass blows, to get her back on to the road.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: Then the angel of the Lord took up his position in a narrow road through the vine-gardens, with a wall on this side and on that.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 25
text: And the ass saw the angel of the Lord, and went near the wall, crushing Balaam's foot against the wall; and he gave her more blows.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 26
text: Then the angel of the Lord went further, stopping in a narrow place where there was no room for turning to the right or to the left.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 27
text: And the ass saw the angel of the Lord and went down on the earth under Balaam; and full of wrath, Balaam gave her hard blows with his stick.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 28
text: Then the Lord gave the ass the power of talking, and opening her mouth she said to Balaam, What have I done to you that you have given me blows these three times?

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 29
text: And Balaam said to the ass, You have made me seem foolish: if only I had a sword in my hand I would put you to death.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 30
text: And the ass said to Balaam, Am I not your ass upon which you have gone all your life till this day? and have I ever done this to you before? And he said, No.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 31
text: Then the Lord made Balaam's eyes open, and he saw the angel of the Lord in the way with his sword in his hand: and he went down on his face to the earth.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 32
text: And the angel of the Lord said to him, Why have you given your ass blows these three times? See, I have come out against you to keep you back, because your purpose is not pleasing to me.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 33
text: And the ass saw me, turning to one side from me three times: if she had not gone to one side, I would certainly have put you to death and kept her safe.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 34
text: And Balaam said to the angel of the Lord, I have done wrong, for I did not see that you were in the way against me: but now, if it is evil in your eyes, I will go back again.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 35
text: And the angel of the Lord said to Balaam, Go with the men; but say only what I give you to say. Then Balaam went on with the chiefs of Balak.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 36
text: Now Balak, hearing that Balaam had come, went to the chief town of Moab, on the edge of the Arnon, in the farthest part of the land, for the purpose of meeting him.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 37
text: And Balak said to Balaam, Did I not send to you, requesting you with all my heart to come to me? why did you not come? am I not able to give you a place of honour?

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 38
text: Then Balaam said to Balak, Now I have come to you; but have I power to say anything? Only what God puts into my mouth may I say.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 39
text: And Balaam went with Balak to Kiriath-huzoth.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 40
text: And Balak made offerings of oxen and sheep, and sent to Balaam and the chiefs who were with him.

title: Numbers Chapter 22 Verse 41
text: And in the morning Balak took Balaam up to the high places of Baal, and from there he was able to see the outer limits of the people.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: And Balaam said to Balak, Make me here seven altars and get ready seven oxen and seven male sheep.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: And Balak did as Balaam had said; and Balak and Balaam made an offering on every altar of an ox and a male sheep.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: Then Balaam said to Balak, Take your place by your burned offering, and I will go and see if the Lord comes to me: and I will give you word of whatever he says to me. And he went to an open place on a hill.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: And God came to Balaam, and Balaam said to him, I have made ready seven altars, offering an ox and a male sheep on every altar.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: And the Lord put words in Balaam's mouth, and said, Go back to Balak, and this is what you are to say.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: So he went back to him where he was waiting by his burned offering with all the chiefs of Moab.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: And in the words which the Lord had given him he said, From Aram Balak has sent for me, the king of Moab from the mountains of the East: come, put curses on Jacob for me and be angry with Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: How may I put curses on him who is not cursed by God? how may I be angry with him with whom the Lord is not angry?

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: From the top of the rocks I see him, looking down on him from the hills: it is a people made separate, not to be numbered among the nations.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: Who is able to take the measure of the dust of Jacob or the number of the thousands of Israel? May my death be the death of the upright and my last end like his!

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: Then Balak said to Balaam, What have you done to me? I sent for you so that my haters might be cursed, and see, you have given them a blessing.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: And in answer he said, Am I not ordered to say only what the Lord puts into my mouth?

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: And Balak said to him, Come with me now into another place from which you will not be able to see them all, but only the outskirts of them; and you will send curses on them from there.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 14
text: So he took him into the country of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and there they made seven altars, offering an ox and a male sheep on every altar.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: Then he said to Balak, Take your place here by your burned offering, while I go over there to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: And the Lord came to Balaam, and put words in his mouth, and said, Go back to Balak, and this is what you are to say.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 17
text: So he came to him where he was waiting by his burned offering with the chiefs of Moab by his side. And Balak said to him, What has the Lord said?

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 18
text: And in the words which the Lord had given him he said, Up! Balak, and give ear; give attention to me, O son of Zippor:

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 19
text: God is not a man, to say what is false; or the son of man, that his purpose may be changed: what he has said, will he not do? and will he not give effect to the words of his mouth?

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 20
text: See, I have had orders to give blessing: and he has given a blessing which I have no power to take away.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 21
text: He has seen no evil in Jacob or wrongdoing in Israel: the Lord his God is with him, and the glad cry of a king is among them.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 22
text: It is God who has taken them out of Egypt; his horns are like those of the mountain ox.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 23
text: No evil power has effect against Jacob, no secret arts against Israel; at the right time it will be said of Jacob and of Israel, See what God has done!

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 24
text: See, Israel comes up like a she-lion, lifting himself up like a lion: he will take no rest till he has made a meal of those he has overcome, drinking the blood of those he has put to death.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 25
text: Then Balak said to Balaam, If you will not put a curse on them, at all events do not give them a blessing.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 26
text: But Balaam in answer said to Balak, Did I not say to you, I may only do what the Lord says?

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 27
text: Then Balak said to Balaam, Come now, I will take you to another place; it may be that God will let you put a curse on them from there.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 28
text: So Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, looking down over the waste land.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 29
text: And Balaam said to Balak, Make me seven altars here and get seven oxen and seven male sheep ready for me.

title: Numbers Chapter 23 Verse 30
text: And Balak did as Balaam said, offering an ox and a male sheep on every altar.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: Now when Balaam saw that it was the Lord's pleasure to give his blessing to Israel, he did not, as at other times, make use of secret arts, but turning his face to the waste land,

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: And lifting up his eyes, he saw Israel there, with their tents in the order of their tribes: and the spirit of God came on him.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: And moved by the spirit, he said, These are the words of Balaam, son of Beor, the words of the man whose eyes are open:

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: He says, whose ears are open to the words of God, who has seen the vision of the Ruler of all, falling down, but having his eyes open:

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: How fair are your tents, O Jacob, your houses, O Israel!

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: They are stretched out like valleys, like gardens by the riverside, like flowering trees planted by the Lord, like cedar-trees by the waters.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: Peoples will be in fear before his strength, his arm will be on great nations: his king will be higher than Agag, and his kingdom made great in honour.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: It is God who has taken him out of Egypt; his horns are like those of the mountain ox; the nations warring against him will be his food, their bones will be broken, they will be wounded with his arrows.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: He took his sleep stretched out like a lion, and like a she-lion: by whom will his rest be broken? May a blessing be on everyone who gives you blessing, and a curse on everyone by whom you are cursed.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: Then Balak was full of wrath against Balaam, and angrily waving his hands he said to Balaam, I sent for you so that those who are against me might be cursed, but now, see, three times you have given them a blessing.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: Go back quickly to the place you came from: it was my purpose to give you a place of honour, but now the Lord has kept you back from honour.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: Then Balaam said to Balak, Did I not say to the men you sent to me,

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: Even if Balak gave me his house full of silver and gold, it would not be possible for me to go outside the orders of the Lord, doing good or evil at the impulse of my mind; whatever the Lord says I will say?

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: So now I will go back to my people: but first let me make clear to you what this people will do to your people in days to come.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: Then he went on with his story and said, These are the words of Balaam, the son of Beor, the words of him whose eyes are open:

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: He says, whose ear is open to the words of God, who has knowledge of the Most High, who has seen the vision of the Ruler of all, falling down and having his eyes open:

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: I see him, but not now: looking on him, but not near: a star will come out of Jacob, and a rod of authority out of Israel, sending destruction to the farthest limits of Moab and on the head of all the sons of Sheth.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: Edom will be his heritage, and he will put an end to the last of the people of Seir.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 19
text: And Israel will go on in strength, and Jacob will have rule over his haters.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 20
text: Then, turning his eyes to Amalek, he went on with his story and said, Amalek was the first of the nations, but his part will be destruction for ever.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 21
text: And looking on the Kenites he went on with his story and said, Strong is your living-place, and your secret place is safe in the rock.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 22
text: But still the Kenites will be wasted, till Asshur takes you away prisoner.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 23
text: Then he went on with his story and said, But who may keep his life when God does this?

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 24
text: But ships will come from the direction of Kittim, troubling Asshur and troubling Eber, and like the others their fate will be destruction.

title: Numbers Chapter 24 Verse 25
text: Then Balaam got up and went back to his place: and Balak went away.

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 1
text: Now when Israel was living in Shittim the people became false to the Lord, doing evil with the daughters of Moab:

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 2
text: For they sent for the people to be present at the offerings made to their gods; and the people took part in their feasts and gave honour to their gods.

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 3
text: So Israel had relations with the women of Moab in honour of the Baal of Peor: and the Lord was moved to wrath against Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 4
text: Then the Lord said to Moses, Take all the chiefs of the people, hanging them up in the sun before the Lord, so that the wrath of the Lord may be turned from Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 5
text: So Moses said to the judges of Israel, Let everyone put to death those of his men who have had relations with the women of Moab in honour of the Baal of Peor.

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 6
text: Then one of the children of Israel came to his brothers, taking with him a woman of Midian, before the eyes of Moses and all the meeting of the people, while they were weeping at the door of the Tent of meeting.

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 7
text: And Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, seeing it, got up from among the people and took a spear in his hand,

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 8
text: And went after the man of Israel into the tent, driving the spear through the two of them, through the man of Israel and through the stomach of the woman. So the disease was stopped among the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 9
text: But twenty-four thousand of them had come to their death by the disease.

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 10
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 11
text: Through Phinehas, and because of his passion for my honour, my wrath has been turned away from the children of Israel, so that I have not sent destruction on them all in my wrath.

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 12
text: So say to them that I will make with him an agreement of peace:

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 13
text: And by this agreement, he and his sons after him have the right to be priests for ever; because, by his care for the honour of his God, he took away the sin of the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 14
text: Now the man of Israel who was put to death with the woman of Midian was Zimri, the son of Salu, a chief of one of the families of the Simeonites.

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 15
text: And the woman of Midian who was put to death was Cozbi, the daughter of Zur; he was the head of a family in Midian.

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 16
text: Then the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 17
text: Take up arms against the Midianites and overcome them;

title: Numbers Chapter 25 Verse 18
text: For they are a danger to you with their false ways, causing sin to come on you in the question of Peor, and because of Cozbi, their sister, the daughter of the chief of Midian, who was put to death at the time of the disease which came on you because of Peor.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 1
text: Now after the disease was over, the Lord said to Moses and Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest,

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 2
text: Let all the children of Israel be numbered, by the names of their fathers' families, all those of twenty years old and over who are able to go to war in Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 3
text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest gave them the order in the lowlands of Moab by Jordan at Jericho, saying,

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 4
text: Let all the people of twenty years old and over be numbered, as the Lord has given orders to Moses and the children of Israel who have come out of Egypt.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 5
text: Reuben, the first son of Israel: the sons of Reuben by their families: of Hanoch, the family of the Hanochites: of Pallu, the family of the Palluites:

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 6
text: Of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites: of Carmi, the family of the Carmites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 7
text: These are the families of the Reubenites: their number was forty-three thousand, seven hundred and thirty.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 8
text: And the sons of Pallu, Eliab

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 9
text: And the sons of Eliab: Nemuel and Dathan and Abiram. These are the same Dathan and Abiram who had a place in the meeting of the people, who together with Korah made an outcry against Moses and Aaron and against the Lord:

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 10
text: And they went down into the open mouth of the earth, together with Korah, when death overtook him and all his band; at the time when two hundred and fifty men were burned in the fire, and they became a sign.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 11
text: But death did not overtake the sons of Korah.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 12
text: The sons of Simeon by their families: of Nemuel, the family of the Nemuelites: of Jamin, the family of the Jaminites: of Jachin, the family of the Jachinites:

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 13
text: Of Zerah, the family of the Zerahites: of Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 14
text: These are the families of the Simeonites, twenty-two thousand, two hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 15
text: The sons of Gad by their families: of Zephon, the family of the Zephonites: of Haggi, the family of the Haggites: of Shuni, the family of the Shunites:

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 16
text: Of Ozni, the family of the Oznites: of Eri, the family of the Erites:

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 17
text: Of Arod, the family of the Arodites: of Areli, the family of the Arelites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 18
text: These are the families of the sons of Gad as they were numbered, forty thousand, five hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 19
text: The sons of Judah, Er and Onan: and Er and Onan had come to their death in the land of Canaan.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 20
text: And the sons of Judah by their families were: of Shelah, the family of the Shelahites: of Perez, the family of the Perezites: of Zerah, the family of the Zerahites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 21
text: And the sons of Perez were: of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites: of Hamul, the family of the Hamulites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 22
text: These are the families of Judah as they were numbered, seventy-six thousand, five hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 23
text: The sons of Issachar by their families: of Tola, the family of the Tolaites: of Puvah, the family of the Punites:

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 24
text: Of Jashub, the family of the Jashubites: of Shimron, the family of the Shimronites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 25
text: These are the families of Issachar, as they were numbered, sixty-four thousand, three hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 26
text: The sons of Zebulun by their families: of Sered, the family of the Seredites: of Elon, the family of the Elonites: of Jahleel, the family of the Jahleelites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 27
text: These are the families of the Zebulunites as they were numbered, sixty thousand, five hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 28
text: The sons of Joseph by their families: Manasseh and Ephraim.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 29
text: The sons of Manasseh: of Machir, the family of the Machirites: and Machir was the father of Gilead: of Gilead, the family of the Gileadites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 30
text: These are the sons of Gilead: of Iezer, the family of the Iezerites: of Helek, the family of the Helekites:

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 31
text: And of Asriel, the family of the Asrielites: and of Shechem, the family of the Shechemites:

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 32
text: And of Shemida, the family of the Shemidaites: and of Hepher, the family of the Hepherites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 33
text: And Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, had no sons, but only daughters, and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 34
text: These are the families of Manasseh; and those who were numbered of them were fifty-two thousand, seven hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 35
text: These are the sons of Ephraim by their families: of Shuthelah, the family of the Shuthelahites: of Becher, the family of the Becherites: of Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 36
text: And these are the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the family of the Eranites:

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 37
text: These are the families of Ephraim as they were numbered, thirty-two thousand, five hundred. These are the sons of Joseph by their families.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 38
text: The sons of Benjamin by their families: of Bela, the family of the Belaites: of Ashbel, the family of the Ashbelites: of Ahiram, the family of the Ahiramites:

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 39
text: Of Shephupham, the family of the Shuphamites: and of Hupham, the family of the Huphamites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 40
text: And the sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: of Ard, the family of the Ardites: of Naaman, the family of the Naamites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 41
text: These are the sons of Benjamin by their families: and those who were numbered of them were forty-five thousand, six hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 42
text: These are the sons of Dan by their families: of Shuham, the family of the Shuhamites. These are the families of Dan by their families.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 43
text: All the families of the Shuhamites, as they were numbered, were sixty-four thousand, four hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 44
text: The sons of Asher by their families: of Imnah, the family of the Imnites: of Ishvi, the family of the Ishvites: of Beriah, the family of the Beriites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 45
text: Of the sons of Beriah: of Heber, the family of the Heberites: of Malchiel, the family of the Malchielites:

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 46
text: And the name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 47
text: These are the families of the sons of Asher as they were numbered, fifty-three thousand, four hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 48
text: The sons of Naphtali by their families: of Jahzeel, the family of the Jahzeelites: of Guni, the family of the Gunites:

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 49
text: Of Jezer, the family of the Jezerites: of Shillem, the family of the Shillemites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 50
text: These are the families of Naphtali by their families: and those who were numbered of them were forty-five thousand, four hundred.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 51
text: Those who were numbered of the children of Israel were six hundred and one thousand, seven hundred and thirty.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 52
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 53
text: Let there be a division of the land among these, for their heritage, in relation to the number of names.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 54
text: To those families who are more in number, give a greater heritage; to those who are less in number, a smaller part: to every one let the heritage be given in relation to the number in his family.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 55
text: But let the distribution of the land be made by the decision of the Lord: by the names of the tribes of their fathers let their heritage be given them.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 56
text: As it is ordered by the decision of the Lord, let distribution be made between those who are more in number and those who are less.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 57
text: These were those of the Levites who were numbered by their families: of Gershon, the family of the Gershonites: of Kohath, the family of the Kohathites: of Merari, the family of the Merarites.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 58
text: These are the families of Levi: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, the family of the Korahites. And Kohath was the father of Amram.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 59
text: Amram's wife was Jochebed, the daughter of Levi, whom he had in Egypt: by Amram she had Moses and Aaron and their sister Miriam.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 60
text: Aaron's sons were Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 61
text: Death overtook Nadab and Abihu when they made an offering of strange fire before the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 62
text: Of these, twenty-three thousand males, from one month old and over, were numbered: they were not numbered with the rest of the children of Israel, for they had no heritage among the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 63
text: All these were numbered by Moses and Eleazar the priest when the children of Israel were numbered in the lowlands of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 64
text: But among all these was not one of those numbered by Moses and Aaron the priest when the children of Israel were numbered in the waste land of Sinai.

title: Numbers Chapter 26 Verse 65
text: For the Lord had said of them, Death will certainly overtake them in the waste land. And of them all, only Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua, the son of Nun, were still living.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 1
text: Then the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh, the son of Joseph, came forward: their names are Mahlah, Noah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Tirzah.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 2
text: They came before Moses and Eleazar the priest and the chiefs and all the people at the door of the Tent of meeting, and said,

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 3
text: Death overtook our father in the waste land; he was not among those who were banded together with Korah against the Lord; but death came to him in his sin; and he had no sons.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 4
text: Why is the name of our father to be taken away from among his family, because he had no son? Give us a heritage among our father's brothers.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 5
text: So Moses put their cause before the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 6
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 7
text: What the daughters of Zelophehad say is right: certainly you are to give them a heritage among their father's brothers: and let the property which would have been their father's go to them.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 8
text: And say to the children of Israel, If a man has no son at the time of his death, let his heritage go to his daughter.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 9
text: And if he has no daughter, then give his heritage to his brothers.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 10
text: And if he has no brothers, then give his heritage to his father's brothers.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 11
text: And if his father has no brothers, then give it to his nearest relation in the family, as his heritage: this is to be a decision made by law for the children of Israel, as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 12
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Go up into this mountain of Abarim so that you may see the land which I have given to the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 13
text: And when you have seen it, you will be put to rest with your people, as your brother Aaron was:

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 14
text: Because in the waste land of Zin, when the people were angry, you and he went against my word and did not keep my name holy before their eyes, at the waters. (These are the waters of Meribah in Kadesh in the waste land of Zin.)

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 15
text: Then Moses said to the Lord,

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 16
text: Let the Lord, the God of the spirits of all flesh, put a man at the head of this people,

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 17
text: To go out and come in before them and be their guide; so that the people of the Lord may not be like sheep without a keeper.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 18
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Take Joshua, the son of Nun, a man in whom is the spirit, and put your hand on him;

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 19
text: And take him before Eleazar the priest and all the meeting of the people, and give him his orders before their eyes.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 20
text: And put your honour on him, so that all the children of Israel may be under his authority.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 21
text: He will take his place before Eleazar the priest, so that he may get directions from the Lord for him, with the Urim: at his word they will go out, and at his word they will come in, he and all the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 22
text: So Moses did as the Lord said: he took Joshua and put him before Eleazar the priest and the meeting of the people:

title: Numbers Chapter 27 Verse 23
text: And he put his hands on him and gave him his orders, as the Lord had said by Moses.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 2
text: Give orders to the children of Israel and say to them, Let it be your care to give me my offerings at their regular times, the food of the offerings made by fire to me for a sweet smell.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 3
text: Say to them, This is the offering made by fire which you are to give to the Lord; he-lambs of the first year without any mark, two every day as a regular burned offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 4
text: Let one be offered in the morning, and the other at evening;

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 5
text: And the tenth part of an ephah of the best meal for a meal offering mixed with the fourth part of a hin of clear oil.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 6
text: It is a regular burned offering, as it was ordered in Mount Sinai, for a sweet smell, an offering made by fire to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 7
text: And for its drink offering take the fourth part of a hin for one lamb: in the holy place let the wine be drained out for a drink offering for the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 8
text: Let the other lamb be offered at evening; like the meal offering of the morning and its drink offering, let it be offered as an offering made by fire for a sweet smell to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 9
text: And on the Sabbath day, two he-lambs of the first year, without any mark, and two tenth parts of the best meal for a meal offering mixed with oil, and its drink offering:

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 10
text: This is the burned offering for every Sabbath day, in addition to the regular burned offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 11
text: And on the first day of every month you are to give a burned offering to the Lord; two oxen, one male sheep, and seven he-lambs of the first year, without any mark;

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 12
text: And three tenth parts of the best meal for a meal offering mixed with oil, for every ox; and two tenth parts of the best meal for a meal offering mixed with oil, for the one sheep;

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 13
text: And a separate tenth part of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering for every lamb; for a burned offering of a sweet smell, an offering made by fire to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 14
text: And their drink offerings are to be half a hin of wine for an ox, and the third part of a hin for a male sheep, and the fourth part of a hin for a lamb: this is the burned offering for every month through all the months of the year.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 15
text: And one he-goat for a sin-offering to the Lord; it is to be offered in addition to the regular burned offering and its drink offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 16
text: And in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, is the Lord's Passover.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 17
text: On the fifteenth day of this month there is to be a feast; for seven days let your food be unleavened cakes.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 18
text: On the first day there is to be a holy meeting: you may do no sort of field-work:

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 19
text: And you are to give an offering made by fire, a burned offering to the Lord; two oxen, one male sheep, and seven he-lambs of the first year, without any mark:

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 20
text: And their meal offering, the best meal mixed with oil: let three tenth parts of an ephah be offered for an ox and two tenth parts for a male sheep;

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 21
text: And a separate tenth part for every one of the seven lambs;

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 22
text: And one he-goat for a sin-offering to take away your sin.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 23
text: These are to be offered in addition to the morning burned offering, which is a regular burned offering at all times.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 24
text: In this way, every day for seven days, give the food of the offering made by fire, a sweet smell to the Lord: it is to be offered in addition to the regular burned offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 25
text: Then on the seventh day there will be a holy meeting; you may do no field-work.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 26
text: And at the time of the first-fruits, when you give an offering of new meal to the Lord at your feast of weeks, there is to be a holy meeting: you may do no field-work:

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 27
text: And give a burned offering for a sweet smell to the Lord; two oxen, one male sheep, and seven he-lambs of the first year;

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 28
text: And their meal offering, the best meal mixed with oil, three tenth parts for an ox, two tenth parts for a male sheep,

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 29
text: And a separate tenth part for every one of the seven lambs;

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 30
text: And one he-goat to take away your sin.

title: Numbers Chapter 28 Verse 31
text: These are in addition to the regular burned offering and its meal offering; take care that they are without any mark, and let them be offered with their drink offerings.

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 1
text: In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, let there be a holy meeting; on it you may do no field-work; let the day be marked by the blowing of horns;

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 2
text: And give to the Lord a burned offering for a sweet smell; one ox, one male sheep, seven he-lambs of the first year, without any mark on them:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 3
text: And their meal offering, the best meal mixed with oil, three tenth parts for an ox, two tenth parts for a male sheep,

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 4
text: And a separate tenth part for every one of the seven lambs;

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 5
text: And one he-goat for a sin-offering, to take away your sin:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 6
text: In addition to the burned offering of the new moon, and its meal offering, and the regular burned offering and its meal offering, and their drink offerings, as they are ordered, for a sweet smell, an offering made by fire to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 7
text: And on the tenth day of this seventh month there will be a holy meeting; keep yourselves from pleasure, and do no sort of work;

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 8
text: And give to the Lord a burned offering for a sweet smell; one ox, one male sheep, seven he-lambs of the first year: only those without any mark on them may be used:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 9
text: And their meal offering, the best meal mixed with oil, three tenth parts for an ox, two tenth parts for a male sheep,

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 10
text: A separate tenth part for every one of the seven lambs;

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 11
text: One he-goat for a sin-offering; in addition to the offering for taking away your sin, and the regular burned offering and its meal offering, and their drink offerings.

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 12
text: And on the fifteenth day of the seventh month let there be a holy meeting; do no field-work, and keep a feast to the Lord for seven days;

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 13
text: And give a burned offering, an offering made by fire of a sweet smell to the Lord, thirteen oxen, two male sheep, fourteen he-lambs of the first year, all without any mark on them;

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 14
text: And their meal offering, the best meal mixed with oil, three tenth parts for every one of the thirteen oxen, two tenth parts for every male sheep,

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 15
text: And a separate tenth part for every one of the fourteen lambs;

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 16
text: And one he-goat for a sin-offering; in addition to the regular burned offering, and its meal offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 17
text: On the second day of the feast give an offering of twelve oxen, two male sheep, fourteen he-lambs of the first year, without any mark on them;

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 18
text: And their meal offering and their drink offerings for the oxen and the sheep and the lambs, in relation to their number, as it is ordered:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 19
text: And one he-goat for a sin-offering in addition to the regular burned offering, and its meal offering, and their drink offerings.

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 20
text: And on the third day eleven oxen, two male sheep, fourteen he-lambs of the first year, without any mark;

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 21
text: And their meal offering and drink offerings for the oxen, for the male sheep, and for the lambs, in relation to their number, as it is ordered:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 22
text: And one he-goat for a sin-offering; in addition to the regular burned offering, and its meal offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 23
text: And on the fourth day ten oxen, two male sheep, fourteen he-lambs of the first year, without any mark:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 24
text: And their meal offering and their drink offerings for the oxen, for the male sheep, and for the lambs, in relation to their number, as it is ordered.

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 25
text: And one he-goat for a sin-offering; in addition to the regular burned offering, and its meal offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 26
text: And on the fifth day nine oxen, two male sheep, fourteen he-lambs of the first year, without any mark:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 27
text: And their meal offering and their drink offerings for the oxen, for the male sheep, and for the lambs, in relation to their number, as it is ordered:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 28
text: And one he-goat for a sin-offering; in addition to the regular burned offering, and its meal offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 29
text: And on the sixth day eight oxen, two male sheep, fourteen he-lambs of the first year, without any mark:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 30
text: And their meal offering and their drink offerings for the oxen, for the male sheep, and for the lambs, in relation to their number, as it is ordered:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 31
text: And one he-goat for a sin-offering; in addition to the regular burned offering, its meal offering, and its drink offerings.

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 32
text: And on the seventh day seven oxen, two male sheep, fourteen he-lambs of the first year, without any mark:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 33
text: And their meal offering and their drink offerings for the oxen, for the male sheep, and for the lambs, in relation to their number, as it is ordered:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 34
text: And one he-goat for a sin-offering; in addition to the regular burned offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 35
text: On the eighth day let there be a holy meeting: you may do no field-work;

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 36
text: And give a burned offering, an offering made by fire of a sweet smell to the Lord: one ox, one male sheep, seven he-lambs of the first year, without any mark:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 37
text: With the meal offering and the drink offerings for the ox, the male sheep, and the lambs, in relation to their number, as it is ordered:

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 38
text: And one he-goat for a sin-offering; in addition to the regular burned offering, and its meal offering, and its drink offering.

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 39
text: These are the offerings which you are to give to the Lord at your regular feasts, in addition to the offerings for an oath, and the free offerings you give, for your burned offerings and your drink offerings and your peace-offerings.

title: Numbers Chapter 29 Verse 40
text: So Moses gave the children of Israel all these directions as the Lord had given him orders.

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 1
text: And Moses said to the heads of the tribes of the children of Israel, This is the order of the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 2
text: When a man takes an oath to the Lord, or gives an undertaking having the force of an oath, let him not go back from his word, but let him do whatever he has said he will do.

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 3
text: If a woman, being young and under the authority of her father, takes an oath to the Lord or gives an undertaking;

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 4
text: If her father, hearing of her oath or the undertaking she has given, says nothing to her, then all her oaths and every undertaking she has given will have force.

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 5
text: But if her father, hearing of it, makes her take back her word, then the oaths or the undertakings she has given will have no force; and she will have forgiveness from the Lord, because her oath was broken by her father.

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 6
text: And if she is married to a husband at the time when she is under an oath or an undertaking given without thought;

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 7
text: If her husband, hearing of it, says nothing to her at the time, then the oaths she made and the undertakings she gave will have force.

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 8
text: But if her husband, hearing of it, makes her take it back, then the oath she made and the undertaking she gave without thought will have no force or effect, and she will have the Lord's forgiveness.

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 9
text: But an oath made by a widow or one who is no longer married to her husband, and every undertaking she has given, will have force.

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 10
text: If she made an oath while she was under the authority of her husband,

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 11
text: And her husband, hearing of it, said nothing to her and did not put a stop to it, then all her oaths and every undertaking she gave will have force.

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 12
text: But if her husband, on hearing of it, made them without force or effect, then whatever she has said about her oaths or her undertaking has no force: her husband has made them without effect, and she will have the Lord's forgiveness.

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 13
text: Every oath, and every undertaking which she gives, to keep herself from pleasure, may be supported or broken by her husband.

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 14
text: But if the days go on, and her husband says nothing whatever to her, then he is giving the support of his authority to her oaths and undertakings, because at the time of hearing them he said nothing to her.

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 15
text: But if at some time after hearing of them, he makes them without force, then he is responsible for her wrongdoing.

title: Numbers Chapter 30 Verse 16
text: These are the laws which the Lord gave Moses in relation to a man and his wife, or a father and a young daughter who is under his authority.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 1
text: Then the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 2
text: Give the Midianites punishment for the wrong they did to the children of Israel: and after that you will go to rest with your people.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 3
