text: So Moses said to the people, Let men from among you be armed for war to put into effect against Midian the Lord's punishment on them.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 4
text: From every tribe of Israel send a thousand to the war.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 5
text: So from the thousands of Israel a thousand were taken from every tribe, twelve thousand men armed for war.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 6
text: And Moses sent them out to war, a thousand from every tribe, and with them Phinehas, the son of Eleazar the priest, taking in his hands the vessels of the holy place and the horns for sounding the note of war.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 7
text: And they made war on Midian, as the Lord gave orders to Moses; and they put to death every male.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 8
text: They put the kings of Midian to death with the rest, Evi and Reken and Zur and Hur and Reba, the five kings of Midian: and Balaam, the son of Beor, they put to death with the sword.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 9
text: The women of Midian with their little ones the children of Israel took prisoner; and all their cattle and flocks and all their goods they took for themselves;

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 10
text: And after burning all their towns and all their tent-circles,

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 11
text: They went away with the goods they had taken, man and beast.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 12
text: And the prisoners and the goods and everything they had taken, they took to Moses and Eleazar the priest and the people of Israel, to the tent-circle in the lowlands of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 13
text: Then Moses and Eleazar the priest and the chiefs of the people went out to them before they had come into the tent-circle.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 14
text: And Moses was angry with the chiefs of the army, the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds who had come back from the war.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 15
text: And Moses said to them, Why have you kept all the women safe?

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 16
text: It was these who, moved by Balaam, were the cause of Israel's sin against the Lord in the question of Peor, because of which disease came on the people of the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 17
text: So now put every male child to death, and every woman who has had sex relations with a man.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 18
text: But all the female children who have had no sex relations with men, you may keep for yourselves.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 19
text: You yourselves will have to keep outside the tent-circle for seven days, anyone of you who has put any person to death or come near a dead body; and on the third day and on the seventh day make yourselves and your prisoners clean.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 20
text: And every bit of clothing, and anything made of leather or goats' hair or wood, you are to make clean.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 21
text: Then Eleazar the priest said to the men of war who had been to the fight, This is the rule of the law which the Lord has given to Moses:

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 22
text: But gold and silver and brass and iron and tin and lead,

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 23
text: And anything which may be heated, is to go through the fire and be made clean; but in addition it is to be put in the water of cleaning: and anything which may not go through the fire is to be put in the water.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 24
text: And on the seventh day, after washing your clothing, you will be clean, and then you may come into the tent-circle.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 25
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 26
text: Get an account of everything which was taken in the war, of man and of beast, you and Eleazar the priest and the heads of families of the people:

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 27
text: And let division be made of it into two parts, one for the men of war who went out to the fight, and one for all the people:

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 28
text: And from the men of war who went out let there be offered to the Lord one out of every five hundred, from the persons, and from the oxen and asses and sheep:

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 29
text: Take this from their part and give it to Eleazar the priest as an offering to be lifted up to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 30
text: And from the part given to the children of Israel, take one out of every fifty, from the persons, and from the oxen and asses and sheep, and give it to the Levites who have the care of the House of the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 31
text: So Eleazar and Moses did as the Lord had given orders to Moses.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 32
text: Now the beasts taken, in addition to what the fighting-men took for themselves, were six hundred and seventy-five thousand sheep,

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 33
text: And seventy-two thousand oxen,

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 34
text: And sixty-one thousand asses;

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 35
text: And thirty-two thousand persons, that is, women who had never had sex relations with a man.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 36
text: And the half given as their part to the men who went to the war, was three hundred and thirty-seven thousand, five hundred sheep,

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 37
text: Of which the Lord's part was six hundred and seventy-five.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 38
text: The number of oxen was thirty-six thousand, of which the Lord's part was seventy-two;

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 39
text: The number of asses was thirty thousand, five hundred, of which the Lord's part was sixty-one.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 40
text: And the number of persons was sixteen thousand, of which the Lord's part was thirty-two persons.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 41
text: And Moses gave the Lord's part, lifted up as an offering, to Eleazar the priest, as the Lord had given orders to Moses.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 42
text: And from the half given to the children of Israel, which Moses had kept separate from that given to the fighting-men,

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 43
text: (Now the people's half was three hundred and thirty-seven thousand, five hundred sheep,

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 44
text: And thirty-six thousand oxen,

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 45
text: And thirty thousand, five hundred asses,

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 46
text: And sixteen thousand persons;)

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 47
text: Even from the children of Israel's half, Moses took one out of every fifty, men and beasts, and gave them to the Levites who had the care of the House of the Lord; as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 48
text: Then the men in authority over the thousands of the army, the captains of thousands and captains of hundreds, came to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 49
text: And said to him, Your servants have taken note of the number of all the fighting-men under our orders, and every one is present;

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 50
text: And we have here an offering for the Lord from what every man took in the war, ornaments of gold, leg-chains and arm-rings, finger-rings, ear-rings, and neck-ornaments, to make our souls free from sin before the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 51
text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold from them, even all the worked ornaments.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 52
text: And the gold which the captains of thousands and captains of hundreds gave, as an offering to be lifted up before the Lord, came to sixteen thousand, seven hundred and fifty shekels.

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 53
text: (For every man of the army had taken goods for himself in the war.)

title: Numbers Chapter 31 Verse 54
text: Then Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold given by the captains of thousands and captains of hundreds, and took it into the Tent of meeting, to be a sign in memory of the children of Israel before the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 1
text: Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a great number of cattle: and when they saw that the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead was a good place for cattle;

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 2
text: The children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and said to Moses and to Eleazar the priest and to the chiefs of the meeting,

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 3
text: Ataroth, and Dibon, and Jazer, and Nimrah, and Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Sebam, and Nebo, and Beon,

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 4
text: The land which the Lord gave into the hands of the children of Israel, is a land for cattle, and your servants have cattle.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 5
text: And they said, With your approval, let this land be given to your servants as their heritage: do not take us over Jordan.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 6
text: And Moses said to the children of Gad and the children of Reuben, Are your brothers to go to the war, while you take your rest here?

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 7
text: Why would you take from the children of Israel the desire to go over into the land which the Lord has given them?

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 8
text: So did your fathers, when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to see the land.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 9
text: For when they went up to the valley of Eshcol, and saw the land, they took from the children of Israel the desire to go into the land which the Lord had given them.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 10
text: And at that time the Lord was moved to wrath, and made an oath, saying,

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 11
text: Truly, not one of the men of twenty years old and over who came out of Egypt will see the land which I gave by oath to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; because they have not been true to me with all their heart;

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 12
text: But only Caleb, the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, and Joshua, the son of Nun: because they have been true to the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 13
text: Then the Lord was angry with Israel, and he made them wanderers in the waste land for forty years? till all that generation who had done evil in the eyes of the Lord was dead.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 14
text: And now you have come to take the place of your fathers, another generation of sinners, increasing the wrath of the Lord against Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 15
text: For if you are turned away from him, he will send them wandering again in the waste land; and you will be the cause of the destruction of all this people.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 16
text: Then they came to him, and said, We will make safe places for our cattle here, and towns for our little ones;

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 17
text: But we ourselves will be ready armed to go before the children of Israel till we have taken them to their place: but our little ones will be safe in the walled towns against the people of the land.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 18
text: We will not come back to our houses till every one of the children of Israel has come into his heritage.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 19
text: For we will not have our heritage with them on the other side of Jordan and forward; because our heritage has come to us on this side of Jordan to the east.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 20
text: Then Moses said to them, If you will do this, arming yourselves to go before the Lord to the war,

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 21
text: Every armed man of you going across Jordan before the Lord till he has overcome and sent in flight all who are against him,

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 22
text: And the land is under the rule of the Lord: then after that you may come back, having done no wrong to the Lord and to Israel; and this land will be yours for your heritage before the Lord.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 23
text: But if you do not do this, then you are sinners against the Lord; and you may be certain that your sin will have its reward.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 24
text: So get to work building your towns for your little ones, and safe places for your sheep; and do as you have said.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 25
text: And the children of Gad and the children of Reuben said to Moses, Your servants will do as my lord says.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 26
text: Our little ones, our wives, and our flocks, and all our cattle, will be there in the towns of Gilead;

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 27
text: But your servants will go over, every man armed for war, before the Lord to the fight, as my lord says.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 28
text: So Moses gave orders about them to Eleazar the priest and to Joshua, the son of Nun, and to the heads of families of the tribes of the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 29
text: And Moses said to them, If the children of Gad and the children of Reuben go with you over Jordan, every man armed for the fight before the Lord, and all the land is given into your hands, then let them have the land of Gilead for a heritage:

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 30
text: But if they do not go over with you armed, they will have to take their heritage with you in the land of Canaan.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 31
text: Then the children of Gad and the children of Reuben said, As the Lord has said to your servants, so will we do.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 32
text: We will go over armed before the Lord into the land of Canaan, and you will give us our heritage on this side of Jordan.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 33
text: So Moses gave to them, even to the children of Gad and the children of Reuben and to the half-tribe of Manasseh, the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon, king of the Amorites and Og, king of Bashan, all the land with its towns and the country round them.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 34
text: And the children of Gad were the builders of Dibon and Ataroth and Aroer;

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 35
text: And Atroth-shophan and Jazer and Jogbehah;

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 36
text: And Beth-nimrah and Beth-haran: walled towns and shut-in places for sheep.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 37
text: And the children of Reuben were the builders of Heshbon and Elealeh and Kiriathaim;

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 38
text: And Nebo and Baal-meon, (their names being changed,) and Sibmah: and they gave other names to the towns they made.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 39
text: And the children of Machir, the son of Manasseh, went to Gilead and took it, driving out the Amorites who were living there.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 40
text: And Moses gave Gilead to Machir, the son of Manasseh; and he made it his living-place.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 41
text: And Jair, the son of Manasseh, went and took the towns of Gilead, naming them Havvoth-Jair.

title: Numbers Chapter 32 Verse 42
text: And Nobah went and took Kenath and its small towns, naming it Nobah, after himself.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 1
text: These are the journeys of the children of Israel, when they went out of the land of Egypt in their armies, under the direction of Moses and Aaron.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 2
text: And the stages of their journey on their way out were put down in writing by Moses at the order of the Lord: these are the stages of their journey and the way they went.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 3
text: On the fifteenth day of the first month they went out from Rameses; on the day after the Passover the children of Israel went out by the power of the Lord before the eyes of all the Egyptians,

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 4
text: While the Egyptians were placing in the earth the bodies of their sons on whom the Lord had sent destruction: and their gods had been judged by him.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 5
text: So the children of Israel went from Rameses and put up their tents in Succoth.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 6
text: And they went on from Succoth and put up their tents in Etham on the edge of the waste land.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 7
text: And from Etham, turning back to Pi-hahiroth which is before Baal-zephon, they put up their tents before Migdol.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 8
text: And journeying on from before Hahiroth, they went through the sea into the waste land: they went three days' journey through the waste land of Etham and put up their tents in Marah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 9
text: And from Marah they went on to Elim: and in Elim there were twelve water-springs and seventy palm-trees; and they put up their tents there.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 10
text: And they went on from Elim and put up their tents by the Red Sea.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 11
text: Then from the Red Sea they went on and put up their tents in the waste land of Sin.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 12
text: And they went on from the waste land of Sin, and put up their tents in Dophkah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 13
text: And they went on from Dophkah, and put up their tents in Alush.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 14
text: And they went on from Alush, and put up their tents in Rephidim, where there was no drinking-water for the people.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 15
text: And they went on from Rephidim, and put up their tents in the waste land of Sinai.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 16
text: And they went on from the waste land of Sinai and put up their tents in Kibroth-hattaavah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 17
text: And they went on from Kibroth-hattaavah, and put up their tents in Hazeroth.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 18
text: And they went on from Hazeroth, and put up their tents in Rithmah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 19
text: And they went on from Rithmah, and put up their tents in Rimmon-perez.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 20
text: And they went on from Rimmon-perez, and put up their tents in Libnah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 21
text: And they went on from Libnah, and put up their tents in Rissah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 22
text: And they went on from Rissah, and put up their tents in Kehelathah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 23
text: And they went on from Kehelathah, and put up their tents in Mount Shepher.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 24
text: And they went on from Mount Shepher, and put up their tents in Haradah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 25
text: And they went on from Haradah, and put up their tents in Makheloth.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 26
text: And they went on from Makheloth, and put up their tents in Tahath.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 27
text: And they went on from Tahath, and put up their tents in Terah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 28
text: And they went on from Terah, and put up their tents in Mithkah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 29
text: And they went on from Mithkah, and put up their tents in Hashmonah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 30
text: And they went on from Hashmonah, and put up their tents in Moseroth.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 31
text: And they went on from Moseroth, and put up their tents in Bene-jaakan.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 32
text: And they went on from Bene-jaakan, and put up their tents in Hor-haggidgad.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 33
text: And they went on from Hor-haggidgad, and put up their tents in Jotbathah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 34
text: And they went on from Jotbathah, and put up their tents in Abronah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 35
text: And they went on from Abronah, and put up their tents in Ezion-geber.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 36
text: And they went on from Ezion-geber, and put up their tents in the waste land of Zin (which is Kadesh).

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 37
text: And they went on from Kadesh, and put up their tents in Mount Hor, on the edge of the land of Edom.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 38
text: And Aaron the priest went up into the mountain at the order of the Lord, and came to his death there, in the fortieth year after the children of Israel had come out of the land of Egypt, in the fifth month, on the first day of the month.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 39
text: Aaron was a hundred and twenty-three years old at the time of his death in Mount Hor.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 40
text: And news of the coming of the children of Israel came to the king of Arad, the Canaanite, who was living in the South in the land of Canaan.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 41
text: And from Mount Hor they went on, and put up their tents in Zalmonah.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 42
text: And they went on from Zalmonah, and put up their tents in Punon.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 43
text: And they went on from Punon, and put up their tents in Oboth.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 44
text: And they went on from Oboth, and put up their tents in Iye-abarim at the edge of Moab.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 45
text: And they went on from Iyim, and put up their tents in Dibon-gad.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 46
text: And from Dibon-gad they went on, and put up their tents in Almon-diblathaim.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 47
text: And from Almon-diblathaim they went on, and put up their tents in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 48
text: And they went on from the mountains of Abarim, and put up their tents in the lowlands of Moab by Jordan at Jericho;

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 49
text: Planting their tents by the side of Jordan from Beth-jeshimoth as far as Abel-shittim in the lowlands of Moab.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 50
text: And in the lowlands of Moab by Jordan at Jericho, the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 51
text: Say to the children of Israel, When you go over Jordan into the land of Canaan,

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 52
text: See that all the people of the land are forced out from before you, and put to destruction all their pictured stones, and all their metal images, and all their high places:

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 53
text: And take the land for yourselves, for your resting-place: for to you I have given the land as your heritage.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 54
text: And you will take up your heritage in the land by the decision of the Lord, to every family its part; the greater the family the greater its heritage, and the smaller the family the smaller will be its heritage; wherever the decision of the Lord gives to any man his part, that will be his; distribution will be made to you by your fathers' tribes.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 55
text: But if you are slow in driving out the people of the land, then those of them who are still there will be like pin-points in your eyes and like thorns in your sides, troubling you in the land where you are living.

title: Numbers Chapter 33 Verse 56
text: And it will come about that as it was my purpose to do to them, so I will do to you.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 2
text: Give orders to the children of Israel and say to them, When you come into the land of Canaan; (this is the land which is to be your heritage, the land of Canaan inside these limits,)

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 3
text: Then your south quarter will be from the waste land of Zin by the side of Edom, and your limit on the south will be from the east end of the Salt Sea,

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 4
text: And round to the south of the slope of Akrabbim, and on to Zin: and its direction will be south of Kadesh-barnea, and it will go as far as Hazar-addar and on to Azmon:

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 5
text: And from Azmon it will go round to the stream of Egypt as far as the sea.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 6
text: And for your limit on the west you will have the Great Sea and its edge: this will be your limit on the west.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 7
text: And your limit on the north will be the line from the Great Sea to Mount Hor:

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 8
text: And from Mount Hor the line will go in the direction of Hamath; the farthest point of it will be at Zedad:

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 9
text: And the limit will go on to Ziphron, with its farthest point at Hazar-enan: this will be your limit on the north.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 10
text: And on the east, your limit will be marked out from Hazar-enan to Shepham,

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 11
text: Going down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain, and on as far as the east side of the sea of Chinnereth:

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 12
text: And so down to Jordan, stretching to the Salt Sea: all the land inside these limits will be yours.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 13
text: And Moses gave orders to the children of Israel saying, This is the land which is to be your heritage, by the decision of the Lord, which by the Lord's order is to be given to the nine tribes and the half-tribe:

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 14
text: For the tribe of the children of Reuben, by their fathers' families, and the tribe of the children of Gad, by their fathers' families, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, have been given their heritage:

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 15
text: The two tribes and the half-tribe have been given their heritage on the other side of Jordan at Jericho, on the east looking to the dawn.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 16
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 17
text: These are the names of the men who are to make the distribution of the land among you: Eleazar the priest and Joshua, the son of Nun.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 18
text: And you are to take one chief from every tribe to make the distribution of the land.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 19
text: And these are the names of the men: of the tribe of Judah, Caleb, the son of Jephunneh.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 20
text: And of the tribe of the children of Simeon, Shemuel, the son of Ammihud.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 21
text: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad, the son of Chislon.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 22
text: And of the tribe of the children of Dan, a chief, Bukki, the son of Jogli.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 23
text: Of the children of Joseph: of the tribe of the children of Manasseh, a chief, Hanniel, the son of Ephod:

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 24
text: And of the tribe of the children of Ephraim, a chief, Kemuel, the son of Shiphtan.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 25
text: And of the tribe of the children of Zebulun, a chief, Elizaphan, the son of Parnach.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 26
text: And of the tribe of the children of Issachar, a chief, Paltiel, the son of Azzan.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 27
text: And of the tribe of the children of Asher, a chief, Ahihud, the son of Shelomi.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 28
text: And of the tribe of the children of Naphtali, a chief, Pedahel, the son of Ammihud.

title: Numbers Chapter 34 Verse 29
text: These are they to whom the Lord gave orders to make the distribution of the heritage among the children of Israel in the land of Canaan.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Moses in the lowlands of Moab by Jordan at Jericho,

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 2
text: Give orders to the children of Israel to give to the Levites, from the heritage which is theirs, towns for themselves, with land on the outskirts of the towns.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 3
text: These towns are to be their living-places, with land round them for their cattle and their food and all their beasts,

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 4
text: Stretching from the wall of the towns a distance of a thousand cubits all round.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 5
text: The measure of this space of land is to be two thousand cubits outside the town on the east, and two thousand cubits on the south and on the west and on the north, the town being in the middle. This space will be the outskirts of their towns.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 6
text: And the towns which you give the Levites are to be the six safe places to which the taker of life may go in flight; and in addition you are to give them forty-two towns.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 7
text: Forty-eight towns are to be given to the Levites, all with land round them.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 8
text: And these towns are to be given out of the heritage of the children of Israel, taking the greater number from those who have much, and a smaller number from those who have little: everyone, in the measure of his heritage, is to give of his property to the Levites.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 9
text: And the Lord said to Moses,

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 10
text: Say to the children of Israel, when you have gone over Jordan into the land of Canaan;

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 11
text: Then let certain towns be marked out as safe places to which anyone who takes the life of another in error may go in flight.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 12
text: In these towns you may be safe from him who has the right of punishment; so that death may not overtake the taker of life till he has been judged by the meeting of the people.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 13
text: Six of the towns which you give will be such safe places;

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 14
text: Three on the other side of Jordan and three in the land of Canaan, to be safe places for flight.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 15
text: For the children of Israel and for the man from another country who is living among them, these six towns are to be safe places, where anyone causing the death of another through error may go in flight.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 16
text: But if a man gives another man a blow with an iron instrument, causing his death, he is a taker of life and is certainly to be put to death.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 17
text: Or if he gives him a blow with a stone in his hand, causing his death, he is a taker of life and is certainly to be put to death.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 18
text: Or if he gave him blows with a wood instrument in his hands, causing his death, he is a taker of life and is certainly to be put to death.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 19
text: He whose right it is to give punishment for blood, may himself put to death the taker of life when he comes face to face with him.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 20
text: If in his hate he put a sword through him, or waiting secretly for him sent a spear or stone at him, causing his death;

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 21
text: Or in hate gave him blows with his hand, causing death; he who gave the death-blow is to be put to death; he is a taker of life: he whose right it is to give punishment for blood may put to death the taker of life when he comes face to face with him.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 22
text: But if a man has given a wound to another suddenly and not in hate, or without design has sent something against him,

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 23
text: Or has given him a blow with a stone, without seeing him, so causing his death, though he had nothing against him and no desire to do him evil:

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 24
text: Then let the meeting of the people be judge between the man responsible for the death and him who has the right of punishment for blood, acting by these rules:

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 25
text: And let the people keep the man responsible for the death safe from the hands of him who has the right of punishment for blood, and send him back to his safe town where he had gone in flight: there let him be till the death of the high priest who was marked with the holy oil.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 26
text: But if ever he goes outside the walls of the safe town where he had gone in flight,

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 27
text: And the giver of punishment, meeting him outside the walls of the town, puts him to death, he will not be responsible for his blood:

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 28
text: Because he had been ordered to keep inside the safe town till the death of the high priest: but after the death of the high priest the taker of life may come back to the place of his heritage.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 29
text: These rules are to be your guide in judging through all your generations wherever you may be living.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 30
text: Anyone causing the death of another is himself to be put to death on the word of witnesses: but the word of one witness is not enough.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 31
text: Further, no price may be given for the life of one who has taken life and whose right reward is death: he is certainly to be put to death.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 32
text: And no price may be offered for one who has gone in flight to a safe town, for the purpose of letting him come back to his place before the death of the high priest.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 33
text: So do not make the land where you are living unholy: for blood makes the land unholy: and there is no way of making the land free from the blood which has come on it, but only by the death of him who was the cause of it.

title: Numbers Chapter 35 Verse 34
text: Do not make unclean the land where you are living and in which is my House: for I the Lord am present among the children of Israel.

title: Numbers Chapter 36 Verse 1
text: Now the heads of the families of the children of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came to Moses, the chiefs and the heads of families of the children of Israel being present,

title: Numbers Chapter 36 Verse 2
text: And said, The Lord gave orders to my lord to make distribution of the land as their heritage to the children of Israel: and my lord was ordered by the Lord to give the heritage of Zelophehad, our brother, to his daughters.

title: Numbers Chapter 36 Verse 3
text: Now if they get married to any of the sons of other tribes of the children of Israel, then their property will be taken away from the heritage of our fathers, and become part of the heritage of the tribe into which they get married: and their heritage will be taken away from the heritage of our tribe.

title: Numbers Chapter 36 Verse 4
text: And at the time of the Jubilee of the children of Israel, their property will be joined to the heritage of the tribe of which they are part and will be taken away from the heritage of the tribe of our fathers.

title: Numbers Chapter 36 Verse 5
text: So by the direction of the Lord, Moses gave orders to the children of Israel, saying, What the tribe of the sons of Joseph have said is right.

title: Numbers Chapter 36 Verse 6
text: This is the order of the Lord about the daughters of Zelophehad: The Lord says, Let them take as their husbands whoever is most pleasing to them, but only among the family of their father's tribe.

title: Numbers Chapter 36 Verse 7
text: And so no property will be handed from tribe to tribe among the children of Israel; but every one of the children of Israel will keep the heritage of his father's tribe.

title: Numbers Chapter 36 Verse 8
text: And every daughter owning property in any tribe of the children of Israel is to be married to one of the family of her father's tribe, so that every man of the children of Israel may keep the heritage of his fathers.

title: Numbers Chapter 36 Verse 9
text: And no property will be handed from one tribe to another, but every tribe of the children of Israel will keep its heritage.

title: Numbers Chapter 36 Verse 10
text: So the daughters of Zelophehad did as the Lord gave orders to Moses:

title: Numbers Chapter 36 Verse 11
text: For Mahlah, Tirzah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, took as their husbands the sons of their father's brothers:

title: Numbers Chapter 36 Verse 12
text: And were married into the families of the sons of Manasseh, the son of Joseph, and their property was kept in the tribe of their father's family

title: Numbers Chapter 36 Verse 13
text: These are the laws and the orders which the Lord gave to the children of Israel by Moses, in the lowlands of Moab by Jordan at Jericho.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: These are the words which Moses said to all Israel on the far side of Jordan, in the waste land in the Arabah opposite Suph, between Paran on the one side, and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab on the other.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: It is eleven days' journey from Horeb by the way of Mount Seir to Kadesh-barnea.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Now in the fortieth year, on the first day of the eleventh month, Moses gave to the children of Israel all the orders which the Lord had given him for them;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: After he had overcome Sihon, king of the Amorites, ruling in Heshbon, and Og, king of Bashan, ruling in Ashtaroth, at Edrei:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: On the far side of Jordan in the land of Moab, Moses gave the people this law, saying,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: The Lord our God said to us in Horeb, You have been long enough in this mountain:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: Make a move now, and go on your way into the hill-country of the Amorites and the places near it, in the Arabah and the hill-country and in the lowlands and in the South and by the seaside, all the land of the Canaanites, and Lebanon, as far as the great river, the river Euphrates.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: See, all the land is before you: go in and take for yourselves the land which the Lord gave by an oath to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and to their seed after them.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: At that time I said to you, I am not able to undertake the care of you by myself;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: The Lord your God has given you increase, and now you are like the stars of heaven in number.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: May the Lord, the God of your fathers, make you a thousand times greater in number than you are, and give you his blessing as he has said!

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: How is it possible for me by myself to be responsible for you, and undertake the weight of all your troubles and your arguments?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Take for yourselves men who are wise, far-seeing, and respected among you, from your tribes, and I will make them rulers over you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And you made answer and said to me, It is good for us to do as you say.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: So I took the heads of your tribes, wise men and respected, and made them rulers over you, captains of thousands and captains of hundreds and captains of fifties and captains of tens, and overseers of your tribes.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And at that time I gave orders to your judges, saying, Let all questions between your brothers come before you for hearing, and give decisions uprightly between a man and his brother or one from another nation who is with him.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: In judging, do not let a man's position have any weight with you; give hearing equally to small and great; have no fear of any man, for it is God who is judge: and any cause in which you are not able to give a decision, you are to put before me and I will give it a hearing.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And at that time I gave you all the orders which you were to do.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: Then we went on from Horeb, through all that great and cruel waste which you saw, on our way to the hill-country of the Amorites, as the Lord gave us orders; and we came to Kadesh-barnea.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: And I said to you, You have come to the hill-country of the Amorites, which the Lord our God is giving us.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: See now, the Lord your God has put the land into your hands: go up and take it, as the Lord, the God of your fathers, has said to you; have no fear and do not be troubled.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And you came near to me, every one of you, and said, Let us send men before us to go through the land with care and give us an account of the way we are to go and the towns to which we will come.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: And what you said seemed good to me, and I took twelve men from among you, one from every tribe;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: And they went up into the hill-country and came to the valley of Eshcol, and saw what was there.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: And taking in their hands some of the fruit of the land, they came down again to us, and gave us their account, saying, It is a good land which the Lord our God is giving us.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: But going against the order of the Lord your God, you would not go up:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: And you made an angry outcry in your tents, and said, In his hate for us the Lord has taken us out of the land of Egypt, to give us up into the hands of the Amorites for our destruction.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 28
text: Where are we going up? Our brothers have made our hearts feeble with fear by saying, The people are greater and taller than we are, and the towns are great and walled up to heaven; and more than this, we have seen the sons of the Anakim there.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 29
text: Then I said to you, Have no fear of them.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 30
text: The Lord your God who goes before you will be fighting for you, and will do such wonders as he did for you in Egypt before your eyes;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 31
text: And in the waste land, where you have seen how the Lord was supporting you, as a man does his son, in all your journeying till you came to this place.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 32
text: But for all this, you had no faith in the Lord your God,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 33
text: Who goes before you on your way, looking for a place where you may put up your tents, in fire by night, lighting up the way you are to go, and in a cloud by day.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 34
text: And the Lord, hearing your words, was angry, and said with an oath,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 35
text: Truly, not one of this evil generation will see that good land which I said I would give to your fathers,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 36
text: But only Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, he will see it; and to him and to his children I will give the land over which his feet have gone, because he has been true to the Lord with all his heart.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 37
text: And, in addition, the Lord was angry with me because of you, saying, You yourself will not go into it:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 38
text: Joshua, the son of Nun, your servant, he will go into the land: say to him that he is to be strong, for he will be Israel's guide into their heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 39
text: And your little ones, who, you said, would come into strange hands, your children, who now have no knowledge of good or evil, they will go into that land, and to them I will give it and it will be theirs.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 40
text: But as for you, go back, journeying into the waste land by the way of the Red Sea.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 41
text: Then you said to me, We have done evil against the Lord, we will go up to the attack, as the Lord our God has given us orders. And arming yourselves every one, you made ready to go up without care into the hill-country.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 42
text: And the Lord said to me, Say to them, Do not go up to the attack; for I am not among you, and you will be overcome by those who are against you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 43
text: This I said to you, but you gave no attention and went against the orders of the Lord, and in your pride went up into the hill-country.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 44
text: And the Amorites who were in the hill-country came out against you and put you to flight, rushing after you like bees, and overcame you in Seir, driving you even as far as Hormah.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 45
text: And you came back, weeping before the Lord; but the Lord gave no attention to your cries and did not give ear to you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 1 Verse 46
text: So you were kept waiting in Kadesh for a long time.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Then we went back, journeying into the waste land by the way to the Red Sea, as the Lord had said to me: and we were a long time going round Mount Seir.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And the Lord said to me,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: You have been journeying round this mountain long enough: now go to the north;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And give the people orders, saying, You are about to go through the land of your brothers, the children of Esau, who are living in Seir; and they will have fear of you; so take care what you do:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: Make no attack on them, for I will not give you any of their land, not even space enough for a man's foot: because I have given Mount Seir to Esau for his heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: You may get food for your needs from them for a price, and water for drinking.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: For the blessing of the Lord your God has been on you in all the work of your hands: he has knowledge of your wanderings through this great waste: these forty years the Lord your God has been with you, and you have been short of nothing.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: So we went on past our brothers, the children of Esau, living in Seir, by the road through the Arabah, from Elath and Ezion-geber. And turning, we went by the road through the waste land of Moab.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And the Lord said to me, Make no attack on Moab and do not go to war with them, for I will not give you any of his land: because I have given Ar to the children of Lot for their heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: (In the past the Emim were living there; a great people, equal in numbers to the Anakim and as tall;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: They are numbered among the Rephaim, like the Anakim; but are named Emim by the Moabites.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And the Horites in earlier times were living in Seir, but the children of Esau took their place; they sent destruction on them and took their land for themselves, as Israel did to the land of his heritage which the Lord gave them.)

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: Get up now, and go over the stream Zered. So we went over the stream Zered.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: Thirty-eight years had gone by from the time when we came away from Kadesh-barnea till we went over the stream Zered; by that time all the generation of the men of war among us were dead, as the Lord had said.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: For the hand of the Lord was against them, working their destruction, till all were dead.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: So when death had overtaken all the men of war among the people,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: The word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: You are about to go by Ar, the limit of the country of Moab;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And when you come near the land of the children of Ammon, give them no cause of trouble and do not make war on them, for I will not give you any of the land of the children of Ammon for your heritage: because I have given it to the children of Lot.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: (That land is said to have been a land of the Rephaim, for Rephaim had been living there in earlier times, but they were named Zamzummim by the Ammonites;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: They were a great people, tall as the Anakim, and equal to them in number; but the Lord sent destruction on them and the children of Ammon took their place, living in their land;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: As he did for the children of Esau living in Seir, when he sent destruction on the Horites before them, and they took their land where they are living to this day:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: And the Avvim, living in the small towns as far as Gaza, came to destruction by the hands of the Caphtorim who came out from Caphtor and took their land.)

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: Get up now, and go on your journey, crossing over the valley of the Arnon: see, I have given into your hands Sihon, the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and all his land: go forward to make it yours, and make war on him,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: From now on I will put the fear of you in all peoples under heaven, who, hearing of you, will be shaking with fear and grief of heart because of you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: Then from the waste land of Kedemoth I sent representatives to Sihon, king of Heshbon, with words of peace, saying,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 27
text: Let me go through your land: I will keep to the highway, not turning to the right or to the left;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 28
text: Let me have food, at a price, for my needs, and water for drinking: only let me go through on foot;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 29
text: As the children of Esau did for me in Seir and the Moabites in Ar; till I have gone over Jordan into the land which the Lord our God is giving us.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 30
text: But Sihon, king of Heshbon, would not let us go through; for the Lord your God made his spirit hard and his heart strong, so that he might give him up into your hands as at this day.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 31
text: And the Lord said to me, See, from now on I have given Sihon and his land into your hands: go forward now to take his land and make it yours.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 32
text: Then Sihon came out against us with all his people, to make an attack on us at Jahaz.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 33
text: And the Lord our God gave him into our hands; and we overcame him and his sons and all his people.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 34
text: At that time we took all his towns, and gave them over to complete destruction, together with men, women, and children; we had no mercy on any:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 35
text: Only the cattle we took for ourselves, with the goods from the towns we had taken.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 36
text: From Aroer on the edge of the valley of the Arnon and from the town in the valley as far as Gilead, no town was strong enough to keep us out; the Lord our God gave them all into our hands:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 2 Verse 37
text: But you did not go near the land of the children of Ammon, that is, all the side of the river Jabbok or the towns of the hill-country, wherever the Lord our God had said we were not to go.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Then turning we took the road to Bashan: and Og, king of Bashan, came out against us with all his people, and made an attack on us at Edrei.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And the Lord said to me, Have no fear of him: for I have given him and all his people and his land into your hands; do to him as you did to Sihon, king of the Amorites, who was ruling in Heshbon.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: So the Lord our God gave up Og, king of Bashan, and all his people into our hands; and we overcame him so completely that all his people came to their end in the fight.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: At that time we took all his towns; there was not one town of the sixty towns, all the country of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan, which we did not take.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: All these towns had high walls round them with doors and locks; and in addition we took a great number of unwalled towns.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And we put them to the curse, every town together with men, women, and children.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: But we took for ourselves all the cattle and the stored wealth of the towns.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: At that time we took their land from the two kings of the Amorites on the far side of Jordan, from the valley of the Arnon to Mount Hermon;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: (By the Sidonians, Hermon is named Sirion, and by the Amorites Shenir;)

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: All the towns of the table-land and all Gilead and Bashan as far as Salecah and Edrei, towns of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: (For Og, king of Bashan, was the last of all the Rephaim; his bed was made of iron; is it not in Rabbah, in the land of the children of Ammon? It was nine cubits long and four cubits wide, measured by the common cubit.)

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: And this land which we took at that time, from Aroer by the valley of the Arnon, and half the hill-country of Gilead with its towns, I gave to the Reubenites and the Gadites.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: The rest of Gilead and all Bashan, the kingdom of Og, all the land of Argob, together with Bashan, I gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh. (This land is named the land of the Rephaim.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: Jair, the son of Manasseh, took all the land of Argob, as far as the country of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, naming it, Bashan, Havvoth-Jair after himself, as it is to this day.)

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And Gilead I gave to Machir.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: And the land from Gilead to the valley of the Arnon, with the middle of the valley as a limit, as far as the river Jabbok which is the limit of the country of the children of Ammon, I gave to the Reubenites and the Gadites;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: As well as the Arabah, with the river Jordan as their limit, from Chinnereth to the Salt Sea, under the slopes of Pisgah to the east.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: At that time I gave you orders, saying, The Lord has given you this land for your heritage: all the men of war are to go over armed before your brothers the children of Israel.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: But your wives and your little ones and your cattle (for it is clear that you have much cattle) may go on living in the towns I have given you;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: Till the Lord has given rest to your brothers as to you, and till they have taken for themselves the land which the Lord your God is giving them on the other side of Jordan: then you may go back, every man of you, to the heritage which I have given you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: And I gave orders to Joshua at that time, saying, Your eyes have seen what the Lord your God has done to these two kings: so will the Lord do to all the kingdoms into which you come.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: Have no fear of them, for the Lord your God will be fighting for you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: And at that time I made request to the Lord, saying,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: O Lord God, you have now for the first time let your servant see your great power and the strength of your hand; for what god is there in heaven or on earth able to do such great works and such acts of power?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: Let me go over, O Lord, and see the good land on the other side of Jordan, and that fair mountain country, even Lebanon.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: But the Lord was angry with me because of you and would not give ear to my prayer; and the Lord said to me, Let it be enough, say no more about this thing.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 27
text: Go up to the top of Pisgah, and turning your eyes to the west and the north, to the south and the east, see the land with your eyes: for you are not to go over Jordan.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 28
text: But give my orders to Joshua, comforting him and making him strong; for he is to go over Jordan at the head of this people, and he will give them this land which you will see for their heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 3 Verse 29
text: So we were waiting in the valley facing Beth-peor.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And now give ear, O Israel, to the laws and the decisions which I am teaching you, and do them; so that life may be yours, and you may go in and take for yourselves the land which the Lord, the God of your fathers, is giving you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: Make no addition to the orders which I give you, and take nothing from them, but keep the orders of the Lord your God which I give you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: Your eyes have seen what the Lord did because of Baal-peor: for destruction came from the Lord on all those among you who went after Baal-peor.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: But you who kept faith with the Lord are living, every one of you, today.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: I have been teaching you laws and decisions, as I was ordered to do by the Lord my God, so that you might keep them in the land to which you are going to take it for your heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: So keep these laws and do them; for so will your wisdom and good sense be clear in the eyes of the peoples, who hearing all these laws will say, Truly, this great nation is a wise and far-seeing people.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: For what great nation has a god so near to them as the Lord our God is, whenever we are turned to him in prayer?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And what great nation has laws and decisions so right as all this law which I put before you today?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: Only take care, and keep watch on your soul, for fear that the things which your eyes have seen go from your memory and from your heart all the days of your life; but let the knowledge of them be given to your children and to your children's children;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: That day when you were waiting before the Lord your God in Horeb, and the Lord said to me, Make all the people come together, so that hearing my words they may go in fear of me all the days of their life on earth and give this teaching to their children.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And you came near, waiting at the foot of the mountain; and flames of fire went up from the mountain to the heart of heaven, with dark clouds, and all was black as night.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And the voice of the Lord came to you out of the fire: the sound of his words came to your ears but you saw no form; there was nothing but a voice.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And he gave you his agreement with you, the ten rules which you were to keep, which he put in writing on the two stones of the law.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: And the Lord gave me orders at that time to make clear to you these laws and decisions, so that you might do them in the land to which you are going, and which is to be your heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: So keep watch on yourselves with care; for you saw no form of any sort on the day when the voice of the Lord came to you in Horeb out of the heart of the fire:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: So that you may not be turned to evil ways and make for yourselves an image in the form of any living thing, male or female,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: Or any beast of the earth, or winged bird of the air,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: Or of anything which goes flat on the earth, or any fish in the water under the earth.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: And when your eyes are lifted up to heaven, and you see the sun and the moon and the stars, all the army of heaven, do not let yourselves be moved to give them worship, or become the servants of what the Lord has given equally to all peoples under heaven.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: But the Lord has taken you out of the flaming fire, out of Egypt, to be to him the people of his heritage, as you are today.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: And the Lord was angry with me because of you, and made an oath that I was not to go over Jordan into the good land which the Lord is giving you for your heritage:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: But death is to come to me in this land, I may not go over Jordan: but you will go over and take that good land for your heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: Take care that you do not let the agreement of the Lord your God, which he has made with you, go out of your mind, or make for yourselves images of any sort, against the orders which the Lord your God has given you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: For the Lord your God is an all-burning fire, and he will not let the honour which is his be given to any other.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: If, when you have had children and children's children, and have been living a long time in the land, you are turned to evil ways, and make an image of any sort, and do evil in the eyes of the Lord your God, moving him to wrath:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: May heaven and earth be my witnesses against you today, that destruction will quickly overtake you, cutting you off from that land which you are going over Jordan to take; your days will not be long in that land, but you will come to a complete end.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 27
text: And the Lord will send you wandering among the peoples; only a small band of you will be kept from death among the nations where the Lord will send you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 28
text: There you will be the servants of gods, made by men's hands, of wood and stone, having no power of seeing or hearing or taking food or smelling.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 29
text: But if in those lands you are turned again to the Lord your God, searching for him with all your heart and soul, he will not keep himself from you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 30
text: When you are in trouble and all these things have come on you, if, in the future, you are turned again to the Lord your God, and give ear to his voice:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 31
text: Because the Lord your God is a God of mercy, he will not take away his help from you or let destruction overtake you, or be false to the agreement which he made by an oath with your fathers.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 32
text: Give thought now to the days which are past, before your time, from the day when God first gave life to man on the earth, and searching from one end of heaven to the other, see if such a great thing as this has ever been, or if anything like it has been talked of in story.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 33
text: Has any people ever gone on living after hearing the voice of God out of the heart of the fire as you did?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 34
text: Has God ever before taken a nation for himself from out of another nation, by punishments and signs and wonders, by war and by a strong hand and a stretched-out arm and great acts of wonder and fear, as the Lord your God did for you in Egypt, before your very eyes?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 35
text: All this he let you see, so that you might be certain that the Lord is God and there is no other.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 36
text: Out of heaven itself his voice came to you, teaching you; and on earth he let you see his great fire; and his words came to your ears out of the heart of the fire.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 37
text: And because of his love for your fathers, he took their seed and made it his, and he himself, present among you, took you out of Egypt by his great power;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 38
text: Driving out before you nations greater and stronger than you, to take you into their land and give it to you for your heritage, as at this day.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 39
text: So today be certain, and keep the knowledge deep in your hearts, that the Lord is God, in heaven on high and here on earth; there is no other God.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 40
text: Then keep his laws and his orders which I give you today, so that it may be well for you and for your children after you, and that your lives may be long in the land which the Lord your God is giving you for ever.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 41
text: Then Moses had three towns marked out on the far side of Jordan looking to the east;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 42
text: To which anyone causing the death of his neighbour in error and not through hate, might go in flight; so that in one of these towns he might be kept from death:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 43
text: The names of the towns were Bezer in the waste land, in the table-land, for the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan for Manasseh.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 44
text: This is the law which Moses put before the children of Israel:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 45
text: These are the rules and the laws and the decisions which Moses gave to the children of Israel after they came out of Egypt;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 46
text: On the far side of Jordan, in the valley facing Beth-peor, in the land of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who was ruling in Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel overcame after they had come out of Egypt:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 47
text: And they took his land for a heritage, and the land of Og, king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, whose lands were on the other side of Jordan to the east;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 48
text: From Aroer on the edge of the valley of the Arnon as far as Mount Sion, which is Hermon,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 4 Verse 49
text: And all the Arabah on the far side of Jordan to the east, as far as the sea of the Arabah under the slopes of Pisgah.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: And Moses sent for all Israel, and said to them, Give ear, O Israel, to the laws and the decisions which I give you today, and give attention to them so that you may keep and do them.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: The Lord our God made an agreement with us in Horeb.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: The Lord did not make this agreement with our fathers but with us, who are all living and present here today.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: The word of the Lord came to you face to face on the mountain, out of the heart of the fire,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: (I was between the Lord and you at that time, to make clear to you the word of the Lord: because, through fear of the fire, you did not go up the mountain;) saying,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: I am the Lord your God, who took you out of the land of Egypt, out of the prison-house.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: You are to have no other gods but me.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: You may not make for yourselves an image in the form of anything in heaven or on earth or in the waters under the earth:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: You may not go down on your faces before them or give them worship: for I, the Lord your God, am a God who will not give his honour to another; and I will send punishment on the children for the wrongdoing of their fathers, to the third and fourth generation of my haters;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And I will have mercy through a thousand generations on those who have love for me and keep my laws.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: You are not to make use of the name of the Lord your God for an evil purpose; whoever takes the Lord's name on his lips for an evil purpose will be judged as a sinner by the Lord.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: Keep the Sabbath day as a holy day, as you have been ordered by the Lord your God.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: On six days do all your work:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: But the seventh day is a Sabbath to the Lord your God; on that day do no work, you or your son or your daughter, or your man-servant or your woman-servant, or your ox or your ass or any of your cattle, or the man from a strange country who is living among you; so that your man-servant and your woman-servant may have rest as well as you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: And keep in mind that you were a servant in the land of Egypt, and that the Lord your God took you out of that land by his strong hand and his stretched-out arm: for this reason the Lord has given you orders to keep the Sabbath day.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: Give honour to your father and your mother, as you have been ordered by the Lord your God; so that your life may be long and all may be well for you in the land which the Lord your God is giving you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: Do not put anyone to death without cause.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: Do not be false to the married relation.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: Do not take the property of another.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: Do not give false witness against your neighbour;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: Or let your desire be turned to your neighbour's wife, or his house or his field or his man-servant or his woman-servant or his ox or his ass or anything which is your neighbour's.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: These words the Lord said to all of you together on the mountain, out of the heart of the fire, out of the cloud and the dark, with a great voice: and he said no more; he put them in writing on the two stones of the law and gave them to me.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: And after hearing the voice which came out of the dark while the mountain was burning with fire, all the heads of your tribes and your chiefs came to me,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: And said, The Lord has let us see his glory and his power, and his voice has come to us out of the fire: today we have seen that a man may go on living even after hearing the voice of God.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: Why then is death to be our fate? For if the voice of the Lord our God comes to us any more, death will overtake us, and we will be burned up in this great fire.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: For what man is there in all the earth, who, hearing the voice of the living God as we have, out of the heart of the fire, has been kept from death?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: Do you go near: and after hearing everything which the Lord our God has to say, give us an account of all he has said to you, and we will give ear, and do it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 28
text: Then the Lord, hearing your words to me, said to me, The words which this people have said to you have come to my ears: what they have said is well said.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 29
text: If only they had such a heart in them at all times, so that they might go in fear of me and keep my orders and that it might be well for them and for their children for ever!

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 30
text: Now say to them, Go back to your tents.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 31
text: But as for you, keep your place here by me, and I will give you all the orders and the laws and the decisions which you are to make clear to them, so that they may do them in the land which I am giving them for their heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 32
text: Take care, then, to do whatever the Lord your God has given you orders to do; let there be no turning away to the right hand or to the left.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 5 Verse 33
text: Go on walking in the way ordered for you by the Lord your God, so that life may be yours and it may be well for you, and your days may be long in the land of your heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Now these are the orders and the laws and the decisions which the Lord your God gave me for your teaching, so that you might do them in the land of your heritage to which you are going:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: So that living in the fear of the Lord your God, you may keep all his laws and his orders, which I give you: you and your son and your son's son, all the days of your life; and so that your life may be long.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: So give ear, O Israel, and take care to do this; so that it may be well for you, and you may be greatly increased, as the Lord the God of your fathers has given you his word, in a land flowing with milk and honey.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: Give ear, O Israel: the Lord our God is one Lord:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And the Lord your God is to be loved with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: Keep these words, which I say to you this day, deep in your hearts;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: Teaching them to your children with all care, talking of them when you are at rest in your house or walking by the way, when you go to sleep and when you get up.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: Let them be fixed as a sign on your hand, and marked on your brow;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: Have them lettered on the pillars of your houses and over the doors of your towns.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And when the Lord your God has taken you into the land which he gave his oath to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, that he would give you; with great and fair towns which were not of your building;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And houses full of good things not stored up by you, and places for storing water which you did not make, and vine-gardens and olive-trees not of your planting; and you have taken food and are full;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: Then take care that you keep your hearts true to the Lord, who took you out of the land of Egypt, out of the prison-house.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: Let the fear of the Lord your God be in your hearts, and be his servants, taking your oaths by his name.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: Do not go after other gods, the gods of the peoples round about you;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: For the Lord your God who is with you is a God who will not let his honour be given to another; or the wrath of the Lord will be burning against you, causing your destruction from the face of the earth.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: Do not put the Lord your God to the test as you did in Massah.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: Keep with care the orders of the Lord your God, and his rules and his laws which he has given you;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: And do what is upright and good in the eyes of the Lord your God, so that it may be well for you and you may go in and take for your heritage that good land from which the Lord undertook by an oath to your fathers,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: To send out from before you all those who are against you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: And when your son says to you in time to come, What is the reason for these rules and laws and decisions which the Lord our God has given you?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: Then you will say to your son, We were servants under Pharaoh's yoke in Egypt; and the Lord took us out of Egypt with a strong hand:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: And the Lord did great signs and wonders against Egypt, and against Pharaoh and all his house, before our eyes:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: And he took us out from that place, guiding us here to give us this land, as he said in his oath to our fathers.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: And the Lord gave us orders to keep all these laws, in the fear of the Lord our God, so that it might be well for us for ever, and that he might keep us from death, as he has done to this day.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: And it will be our righteousness if we take care to keep all this order before the Lord our God as he has given it to us.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: When the Lord your God takes you into the land where you are going, which is to be your heritage, and has sent out the nations before you, the Hittites and the Girgashites and the Amorites and the Canaanites and the Perizzites and the Hivites and the Jebusites, seven nations greater and stronger than you;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And when the Lord has given them up into your hands and you have overcome them, give them up to complete destruction: make no agreement with them, and have no mercy on them:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Do not take wives or husbands from among them; do not give your daughters to their sons, or take their daughters for your sons.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: For through them your sons will be turned from me to the worship of other gods: and the Lord will be moved to wrath against you and send destruction on you quickly.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: But this is what you are to do to them: their altars are to be pulled down and their pillars broken, and their holy trees cut down and their images burned with fire.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: For you are a holy people to the Lord your God: marked out by the Lord your God to be his special people out of all the nations on the face of the earth.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: The Lord did not give you his love or take you for himself because you were more in number than any other people; for you were the smallest of the nations:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: But because of his love for you, and in order to keep his oath to your fathers, the Lord took you out with the strength of his hand, making you free from the prison-house and from the hand of Pharaoh, king of Egypt.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 7 Verse 9
