text: Whatever your lips have said, see that you do it; for you gave your word freely to the Lord your God.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 23 Verse 24
text: When you go into your neighbour's vine-garden, you may take of his grapes at your pleasure, but you may not take them away in your vessel.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 23 Verse 25
text: When you go into your neighbour's field, you may take the heads of grain with your hand; but you may not put your blade to his grain.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: If a man takes a wife, and after they are married she is unpleasing to him because of some bad quality in her, let him give her a statement in writing and send her away from his house.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: And when she has gone away from him, she may become another man's wife.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: And if the second husband has no love for her and, giving her a statement in writing, sends her away; or if death comes to the second husband to whom she was married;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: Her first husband, who had sent her away, may not take her back after she has been wife to another; for that is disgusting to the Lord: and you are not to be a cause of sin in the land which the Lord your God is giving you for your heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: A newly married man will not have to go out with the army or undertake any business, but may be free for one year, living in his house for the comfort of his wife.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: No one is to take, on account of a debt, the stones with which grain is crushed: for in doing so he takes a man's living.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: If a man takes by force one of his countrymen, the children of Israel, using him as his property or getting a price for him, that thief is to be put to death: so you are to put away evil from among you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: In connection with the leper's disease, take care to keep and do every detail of the teaching of the priests, the Levites: as I gave them orders, so you are to do.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: Keep in mind what the Lord your God did to Miriam on the way, when you came out of Egypt.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: If you let your brother have the use of anything which is yours, do not go into his house and take anything of his as a sign of his debt;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: But keep outside till he comes out and gives it to you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: If he is a poor man, do not keep his property all night;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: But be certain to give it back to him when the sun goes down, so that he may have his clothing for sleeping in, and will give you his blessing: and this will be put to your account as righteousness before the Lord your God.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: Do not be hard on a servant who is poor and in need, if he is one of your countrymen or a man from another nation living with you in your land.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: Give him his payment day by day, not keeping it back over night; for he is poor and his living is dependent on it; and if his cry against you comes to the ears of the Lord, it will be judged as sin in you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: Fathers are not to be put to death for their children or children for their fathers: every man is to be put to death for the sin which he himself has done.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: Be upright in judging the cause of the man from a strange country and of him who has no father; do not take a widow's clothing on account of a debt:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: But keep in mind that you were a servant in the land of Egypt, and the Lord your God made you free: for this is why I give you orders to do this.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 19
text: When you get in the grain from your field, if some of the grain has been dropped by chance in the field, do not go back and get it, but let it be for the man from a strange land, the child without a father, and the widow: so that the blessing of the Lord your God may be on all the work of your hands.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 20
text: When you are shaking the fruit from your olive-trees, do not go over the branches a second time: let some be for the man from a strange land, the child without a father, and the widow.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 21
text: When you are pulling the grapes from your vines, do not take up those which have been dropped; let them be for the man from a strange land, the child without a father, and the widow.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 24 Verse 22
text: Keep in mind that you were a servant in the land of Egypt: for this is why I give you orders to do this.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 1
text: If there is an argument between men and they go to law with one another, let the judges give their decision for the upright, and against the wrongdoer.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 2
text: And if the wrongdoer is to undergo punishment by whipping, the judge will give orders for him to go down on his face and be whipped before him, the number of the blows being in relation to his crime.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 3
text: He may be given forty blows, not more; for if more are given, your brother may be shamed before you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 4
text: Do not keep the ox from taking the grain when he is crushing it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 5
text: If brothers are living together and one of them, at his death, has no son, the wife of the dead man is not to be married outside the family to another man: let her husband's brother go in to her and make her his wife, doing as it is right for a brother-in-law to do.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 6
text: Then the first male child she has will take the rights of the brother who is dead, so that his name may not come to an end in Israel.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 7
text: But if the man says he will not take his brother's wife, then let the wife go to the responsible men of the town, and say, My husband's brother will not keep his brother's name living in Israel; he will not do what it is right for a husband's brother to do.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 8
text: Then the responsible men of the town will send for the man, and have talk with him: and if he still says, I will not take her;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 9
text: Then his brother's wife is to come to him, before the responsible men of the town, and take his shoe off his foot, and put shame on him, and say, So let it be done to the man who will not take care of his brother's name.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 10
text: And his family will be named in Israel, The house of him whose shoe has been taken off.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 11
text: If two men are fighting, and the wife of one of them, coming to the help of her husband, takes the other by the private parts;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 12
text: Her hand is to be cut off; have no pity on her.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 13
text: Do not have in your bag different weights, a great and a small;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 14
text: Or in your house different measures, a great and a small.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 15
text: But have a true weight and a true measure: so that your life may be long in the land which the Lord your God is giving you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 16
text: For all who do such things, and all whose ways are not upright, are disgusting to the Lord your God.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 17
text: Keep in mind what Amalek did to you on your way from Egypt;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 18
text: How, meeting you on the way, he made an attack on you when you were tired and without strength, cutting off all the feeble ones at the end of your line; and the fear of God was not in him.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 25 Verse 19
text: So when the Lord your God has given you rest from all who are against you on every side, in the land which the Lord your God is giving you for your heritage, see to it that the memory of Amalek is cut off from the earth; keep this in mind.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 1
text: Now when you have come into the land which the Lord is giving you for your heritage, and you have made it yours and are living in it;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 2
text: You are to take a part of the first-fruits of the earth, which you get from the land which the Lord your God is giving you, and put it in a basket, and go to the place marked out by the Lord your God, as the resting-place of his name.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 3
text: And you are to come to him who is priest at that time, and say to him, I give witness today before the Lord your God, that I have come into the land which the Lord made an oath to our fathers to give us.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 4
text: Then the priest will take the basket from your hand and put it down in front of the altar of the Lord your God.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 5
text: And these are the words which you will say before the Lord your God: My father was a wandering Aramaean, and he went down with a small number of people into Egypt; there he became a great and strong nation:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 6
text: And the Egyptians were cruel to us, crushing us under a hard yoke:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 7
text: And our cry went up to the Lord, the God of our fathers, and the Lord's ear was open to the voice of our cry, and his eyes took note of our grief and the crushing weight of our work:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 8
text: And the Lord took us out of Egypt with a strong hand and a stretched-out arm, with works of power and signs and wonders:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 9
text: And he has been our guide to this place, and has given us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 10
text: So now, I have come here with the first of the fruits of the earth which you, O Lord, have given me. Then you will put it down before the Lord your God and give him worship:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 11
text: And you will have joy in every good thing which the Lord your God has given to you and to your family; and the Levite, and the man from a strange land who is with you, will take part in your joy.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 12
text: When you have taken out a tenth from the tenth of all your produce in the third year, which is the year when this has to be done, give it to the Levite, and the man from a strange land, and the child without a father, and the widow, so that they may have food in your towns and be full;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 13
text: And say before the Lord your God, I have taken all the holy things out of my house and have given them to the Levite, and the man from a strange land, and him who has no father, and the widow, as you have given me orders: I have kept in mind all your orders, in nothing have I gone against them:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 14
text: No part of these things has been used for food in a time of weeping, or put away when I was unclean, or given for the dead: I have given ear to the voice of the Lord my God, and have done all you have given me orders to do.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 15
text: So, looking down from your holy place in heaven, send your blessing on your people Israel and on the land which you have given us, as you said in your oath to our fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 16
text: Today the Lord your God gives you orders to keep all these laws and decisions: so then keep and do them with all your heart and all your soul.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 17
text: Today you have given witness that the Lord is your God, and that you will go in his ways and keep his laws and his orders and his decisions and give ear to his voice:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 18
text: And the Lord has made it clear this day that you are a special people to him, as he gave you his word; and that you are to keep all his orders;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 26 Verse 19
text: And that he will make you high over all the nations he has made, in praise, in name, and in honour, and that you are to be a holy people to the Lord your God as he has said.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 1
text: Then Moses and the responsible men of Israel gave the people these orders: Keep all the orders which I have given you this day;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 2
text: And on the day when you go over Jordan into the land which the Lord your God is giving you, put up great stones, coating them with building-paste,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 3
text: And writing on them all the words of this law, after you have gone over; so that you may take the heritage which the Lord your God is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey, as the Lord, the God of your fathers, has said.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 4
text: And when you have gone over Jordan, you are to put up these stones, as I have said to you today, in Mount Ebal, and have them coated with building-paste.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 5
text: There you are to make an altar to the Lord your God, of stones on which no iron instrument has been used.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 6
text: You are to make the altar of the Lord your God of uncut stones; offering on it burned offerings to the Lord your God:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 7
text: And you are to make your peace-offerings, feasting there with joy before the Lord your God.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 8
text: And put on the stones all the words of this law, writing them very clearly.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 9
text: Then Moses and the priests, the Levites, said to all Israel, Be quiet and give ear, O Israel; today you have become the people of the Lord your God.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 10
text: For this cause you are to give ear to the voice of the Lord your God, and do his orders and his laws which I give you this day.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 11
text: That same day Moses said to the people,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 12
text: These are to take their places on Mount Gerizim for blessing the people when you have gone over Jordan: Simeon and Levi and Judah and Issachar and Joseph and Benjamin;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 13
text: And these are to be on Mount Ebal for the curse: Reuben, Gad, and Asher, and Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 14
text: Then the Levites are to say in a loud voice to all the men of Israel,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 15
text: Cursed is the man who makes any image of wood or stone or metal, disgusting to the Lord, the work of man's hands, and puts it up in secret. And let all the people say, So be it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 16
text: Cursed is he who does not give honour to his father or mother. And let all the people say, So be it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 17
text: Cursed is he who takes his neighbour's landmark from its place. And let all the people say, So be it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 18
text: Cursed is he by whom the blind are turned out of the way. And let all the people say, So be it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 19
text: Cursed is he who gives a wrong decision in the cause of a man from a strange land, or of one without a father, or of a widow. And let all the people say, So be it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 20
text: Cursed is he who has sex relations with his father's wife, for he has put shame on his father. And let all the people say, So be it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 21
text: Cursed is he who has sex relations with any sort of beast. And let all the people say, So be it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 22
text: Cursed is he who has sex relations with his sister, the daughter of his father or of his mother. And let all the people say, So be it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 23
text: Cursed is he who has sex relations with his mother-in-law. And let all the people say, So be it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 24
text: Cursed is he who takes his neighbour's life secretly. And let all the people say, So be it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 25
text: Cursed is he who for a reward puts to death one who has done no wrong. And let all the people say, So be it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 27 Verse 26
text: Cursed is he who does not take this law to heart to do it. And let all the people say, So be it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 1
text: Now if you give ear to the voice of the Lord your God, and keep with care all these orders which I have given you today, then the Lord your God will put you high over all the nations of the earth:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 2
text: And all these blessings will come on you and overtake you, if your ears are open to the voice of the Lord your God.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 3
text: A blessing will be on you in the town, and a blessing in the field.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 4
text: A blessing will be on the fruit of your body, and on the fruit of your land, on the fruit of your cattle, the increase of your herd, and the young of your flock.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 5
text: A blessing will be on your basket and on your bread-basin.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 6
text: A blessing will be on your coming in and on your going out.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 7
text: By the power of the Lord, those who take arms against you will be overcome before you: they will come out against you one way, and will go in flight from you seven ways.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 8
text: The Lord will send his blessing on your store-houses and on everything to which you put your hand: his blessing will be on you in the land which the Lord your God is giving you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 9
text: The Lord will keep you as a people holy to himself, as he has said to you in his oath, if you keep the orders of the Lord your God and go on walking in his ways.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 10
text: And all the peoples of the earth will see that the name of the Lord is on you, and they will go in fear of you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 11
text: And the Lord will make you fertile in every good thing, in the fruit of your body, and the fruit of your cattle, and the fruit of your fields, in the land which the Lord, by his oath to your fathers, said he would give you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 12
text: Opening his store-house in heaven, the Lord will send rain on your land at the right time, blessing all the work of your hands: other nations will make use of your wealth, and you will have no need of theirs.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 13
text: The Lord will make you the head and not the tail; and you will ever have the highest place, if you give ear to the orders of the Lord your God which I give you today, to keep and to do them;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 14
text: Not turning away from any of the orders which I give you today, to the right hand or to the left, or going after any other gods to give them worship.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 15
text: But if you do not give ear to the voice of the Lord your God, and take care to do all his orders and his laws which I give you today, then all these curses will come on you and overtake you:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 16
text: You will be cursed in the town and cursed in the field.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 17
text: A curse will be on your basket and on your bread-basin.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 18
text: A curse will be on the fruit of your body, and on the fruit of your land, on the increase of your cattle, and the young of your flock.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 19
text: You will be cursed when you come in and cursed when you go out.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 20
text: The Lord will send on you cursing and trouble and punishment in everything to which you put your hand, till sudden destruction overtakes you; because of your evil ways in which you have been false to me.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 21
text: The Lord will send disease after disease on you, till you have been cut off by death from the land to which you are going.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 22
text: The Lord will send wasting disease, and burning pain, and flaming heat against you, keeping back the rain till your land is waste and dead; so will it be till your destruction is complete.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 23
text: And the heaven over your heads will be brass, and the earth under you hard as iron.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 24
text: The Lord will make the rain of your land powder and dust, sending it down on you from heaven till your destruction is complete.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 25
text: The Lord will let you be overcome by your haters: you will go out against them one way, and you will go in flight before them seven ways: you will be the cause of fear among all the kingdoms of the earth.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 26
text: Your bodies will be meat for all the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth; there will be no one to send them away.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 27
text: The Lord will send on you the disease of Egypt, and other sorts of skin diseases which nothing will make well.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 28
text: He will make your minds diseased, and your eyes blind, and your hearts wasted with fear:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 29
text: You will go feeling your way when the sun is high, like a blind man for whom all is dark, and nothing will go well for you: you will be crushed and made poor for ever, and you will have no saviour.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 30
text: You will take a wife, but another man will have the use of her: the house which your hands have made will never be your resting-place: you will make a vine-garden, and never take the fruit of it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 31
text: Your ox will be put to death before your eyes, but its flesh will not be your food: your ass will be violently taken away before your face, and will not be given back to you: your sheep will be given to your haters, and there will be no saviour for you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 32
text: Your sons and your daughters will be given to another people, and your eyes will be wasted away with looking and weeping for them all the day: and you will have no power to do anything.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 33
text: The fruit of your land and all the work of your hands will be food for a nation which is strange to you and to your fathers; you will only be crushed down and kept under for ever:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 34
text: So that the things which your eyes have to see will send you out of your minds.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 35
text: The Lord will send a skin disease, attacking your knees and your legs, bursting out from your feet to the top of your head, so that nothing will make you well.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 36
text: And you, and the king whom you have put over you, will the Lord take away to a nation strange to you and to your fathers; there you will be servants to other gods of wood and stone.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 37
text: And you will become a wonder and a name of shame among all the nations where the Lord will take you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 38
text: You will take much seed out into the field, and get little in; for the locust will get it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 39
text: You will put in vines and take care of them, but you will get no wine or grapes from them; for they will be food for worms.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 40
text: Your land will be full of olive-trees, but there will be no oil for the comfort of your body; for your olive-tree will give no fruit.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 41
text: You will have sons and daughters, but they will not be yours; for they will go away prisoners into a strange land.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 42
text: All your trees and the fruit of your land will be the locust's.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 43
text: The man from a strange land who is living among you will be lifted up higher and higher over you, while you go down lower and lower.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 44
text: He will let you have his wealth at interest, and will have no need of yours: he will be the head and you the tail.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 45
text: And all these curses will come after you and overtake you, till your destruction is complete; because you did not give ear to the voice of the Lord your God, or keep his laws and his orders which he gave you:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 46
text: These things will come on you and on your seed, to be a sign and a wonder for ever;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 47
text: Because you did not give honour to the Lord your God, worshipping him gladly, with joy in your hearts on account of all your wealth of good things;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 48
text: For this cause you will become servants to those whom the Lord your God will send against you, without food and drink and clothing, and in need of all things: and he will put a yoke of iron on your neck till he has put an end to you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 49
text: The Lord will send a nation against you from the farthest ends of the earth, coming with the flight of an eagle; a nation whose language is strange to you;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 50
text: A hard-faced nation, who will have no respect for the old or mercy for the young:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 51
text: He will take the fruit of your cattle and of your land till death puts an end to you: he will let you have nothing of your grain or wine or oil or any of the increase of your cattle or the young of your flock, till he has made your destruction complete.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 52
text: Your towns will be shut in by his armies, till your high walls, in which you put your faith, have come down: his armies will be round your towns, through all your land which the Lord your God has given you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 53
text: And your food will be the fruit of your body, the flesh of the sons and daughters which the Lord your God has given you; because of your bitter need and the cruel grip of your haters.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 54
text: That man among you who is soft and used to comfort will be hard and cruel to his brother, and to his dear wife, and to of those his children who are still living;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 55
text: And will not give to any of them the flesh of his children which will be his food because he has no other; in the cruel grip of your haters on all your towns.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 56
text: The most soft and delicate of your women, who would not so much as put her foot on the earth, so delicate is she, will be hard-hearted to her husband and to her son and to her daughter;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 57
text: And to her baby newly come to birth, and to the children of her body; for having no other food, she will make a meal of them secretly, because of her bitter need and the cruel grip of your haters on all your towns.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 58
text: If you will not take care to do all the words of this law, recorded in this book, honouring that name of glory and of fear, THE LORD YOUR GOD;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 59
text: Then the Lord your God will make your punishment, and the punishment of your seed, a thing to be wondered at; great punishments and cruel diseases stretching on through long years.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 60
text: He will send on you again all the diseases of Egypt, which were a cause of fear to you, and they will take you in their grip.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 61
text: And all the diseases and the pains not recorded in the book of this law will the Lord send on you till your destruction is complete.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 62
text: And you will become a very small band, though your numbers were like the stars of heaven; because you did not give ear to the voice of the Lord your God.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 63
text: And as the Lord took delight in doing you good and increasing you, so the Lord will take pleasure in cutting you off and causing your destruction, and you will be uprooted from the land which you are about to take as your heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 64
text: And the Lord will send you wandering among all peoples, from one end of the earth to the other: there you will be servants to other gods, of wood and stone, gods of which you and your fathers had no knowledge.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 65
text: And even among these nations there will be no peace for you, and no rest for your feet: but the Lord will give you there a shaking heart and wasting eyes and weariness of soul:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 66
text: Your very life will be hanging in doubt before you, and day and night will be dark with fears, and nothing in life will be certain:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 67
text: In the morning you will say, If only it was evening! And at evening you will say, If only morning would come! Because of the fear in your hearts and the things which your eyes will see.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 28 Verse 68
text: And the Lord will take you back to Egypt again in ships, by the way of which I said to you, You will never see it again: there you will be offering yourselves as men-servants and women-servants to your haters for a price, and no man will take you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 1
text: These are the words of the agreement which Moses was ordered by the Lord to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, in addition to the agreement which he made with them in Horeb.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 2
text: And Moses said in the hearing of all Israel, You have seen all the Lord did before your eyes in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh and to all his servants and all his land;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 3
text: The great tests which your eyes saw, and the signs and wonders:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 4
text: But even to this day the Lord has not given you a mind open to knowledge, or seeing eyes or hearing ears.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 5
text: For forty years I have been your guide through the waste land: your clothing has not become old on your backs, or your shoes on your feet.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 6
text: You have had no bread, or wine, or strong drink: so that you might see that I am the Lord your God.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 7
text: When you came to this place, Sihon, king of Heshbon, and Og, king of Bashan, came out to make war against us and we overcame them:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 8
text: And we took their land and gave it to the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh, for their heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 9
text: So keep the words of this agreement and do them, so that it may be well for you in everything you do.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 10
text: You have come here today, all of you, before the Lord your God; the heads of your tribes, the overseers, and those who are in authority over you, with all the men of Israel,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 11
text: And your little ones, your wives, and the men of other lands who are with you in your tents, down to the wood-cutter and the servant who gets water for you:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 12
text: With the purpose of taking part in the agreement of the Lord your God, and his oath which he makes with you today:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 13
text: And so that he may make you his people today, and be your God, as he has said to you, and as he made an oath to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 14
text: And not with you only do I make this agreement and this oath;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 15
text: But with everyone who is here with us today before the Lord our God, as well as with those who are not here:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 16
text: (For you have in mind how we were living in the land of Egypt; and how we came through all the nations which were on your way;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 17
text: And you have seen their disgusting doings, and the images of wood and stone and silver and gold which were among them:)

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 18
text: So that there may not be among you any man or woman or family or tribe whose heart is turned away from the Lord our God today, to go after other gods and give them worship; or any root among you whose fruit is poison and bitter sorrow;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 19
text: If such a man, hearing the words of this oath, takes comfort in the thought that he will have peace even if he goes on in the pride of his heart, taking whatever chance may give him:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 20
text: The Lord will have no mercy on him, but the wrath of the Lord will be burning against that man, and all the curses recorded in this book will be waiting for him, and the Lord will take away his name completely from the earth.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 21
text: He will be marked out by the Lord, from all the tribes of Israel, for an evil fate, in keeping with all the curses of the agreement recorded in this book of the law.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 22
text: And future generations, your children coming after you, and travellers from far countries, will say, when they see the punishments of that land and the diseases which the Lord has sent on it;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 23
text: And that all the land is a salt and smoking waste, not planted or giving fruit or clothed with grass, but wasted like Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, on which the Lord sent destruction in the heat of his wrath:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 24
text: Truly all the nations will say, Why has the Lord done so to this land? what is the reason for this great and burning wrath?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 25
text: Then men will say, Because they gave up the agreement of the Lord, the God of their fathers, which he made with them when he took them out of the land of Egypt:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 26
text: And they went after other gods and gave them worship, gods who were strange to them, and whom he had not given them:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 27
text: And so the wrath of the Lord was moved against this land, to send on it all the curse recorded in this book:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 28
text: Rooting them out of their land, in the heat of his wrath and passion, and driving them out into another land, as at this day.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 29 Verse 29
text: The secret things are the Lord our God's: but the things which have been made clear are ours and our children's for ever, so that we may do all the words of this law.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 1
text: Now when all these things have come on you, the blessing and the curse which I have put before you, if the thought of them comes back to your minds, when you are living among the nations where the Lord your God has sent you,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 2
text: And your hearts are turned again to the Lord your God, and you give ear to his word which I give you today, you and your children, with all your heart and with all your soul:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 3
text: Then the Lord will have pity on you, changing your fate, and taking you back again from among all the nations where you have been forced to go.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 4
text: Even if those who have been forced out are living in the farthest part of heaven, the Lord your God will go in search of you, and take you back;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 5
text: Placing you again in the land of your fathers as your heritage; and he will do you good, increasing you till you are more in number than your fathers were.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 6
text: And the Lord your God will give to you and to your seed a circumcision of the heart, so that, loving him with all your heart and all your soul, you may have life.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 7
text: And the Lord your God will put all these curses on those who are against you, and on your haters who put a cruel yoke on you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 8
text: And you will again give ear to the voice of the Lord, and do all his orders which I have given you today.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 9
text: And the Lord your God will make you fertile in all good things, blessing the work of your hands, and the fruit of your body, and the fruit of your cattle, and the fruit of your land: for the Lord will have joy in you, as he had in your fathers:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 10
text: If you give ear to the voice of the Lord your God, keeping his orders and his laws which are recorded in this book of the law, and turning to the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 11
text: For these orders which I have given you today are not strange and secret, and are not far away.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 12
text: They are not in heaven, for you to say, Who will go up to heaven for us and give us knowledge of them so that we may do them?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 13
text: And they are not across the sea, for you to say, Who will go over the sea for us and give us news of them so that we may do them?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 14
text: But the word is very near you, in your mouth and in your heart, so that you may do it.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 15
text: See, I have put before you today, life and good, and death and evil;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 16
text: In giving you orders today to have love for the Lord your God, to go in his ways and keep his laws and his orders and his decisions, so that you may have life and be increased, and that the blessing of the Lord your God may be with you in the land where you are going, the land of your heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 17
text: But if your heart is turned away and your ear is shut, and you go after those who would make you servants and worshippers of other gods:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 18
text: I give witness against you this day that destruction will certainly be your fate, and your days will be cut short in the land where you are going, the land of your heritage on the other side of Jordan.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 19
text: Let heaven and earth be my witnesses against you this day that I have put before you life and death, a blessing and a curse: so take life for yourselves and for your seed:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 30 Verse 20
text: In loving the Lord your God, hearing his voice and being true to him: for he is your life and by him will your days be long: so that you may go on living in the land which the Lord gave by an oath to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 1
text: So Moses said all these things to Israel.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 2
text: Then he said to them, I am now a hundred and twenty years old; I am no longer able to go out and come in: and the Lord has said to me, You are not to go over Jordan.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 3
text: The Lord your God, he will go over before you; he will send destruction on all those nations, and you will take their land as your heritage: and Joshua will go over at your head as the Lord has said.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 4
text: The Lord will do to them as he did to Sihon and to Og, the kings of the Amorites, and to their land, whom he put to destruction.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 5
text: The Lord will give them up into your hands, and you are to do to them as I have given you orders.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 6
text: Be strong and take heart, and have no fear of them: for it is the Lord your God who is going with you; he will not take away his help from you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 7
text: Then Moses sent for Joshua, and before the eyes of all Israel said to him, Be strong and take heart: for you are to go with this people into the land which the Lord, by his oath to their fathers, has given them; by your help they will take it for their heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 8
text: It is the Lord who goes before you; he will be with you, he will not take away his help from you or give you up: so have no fear.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 9
text: Then Moses put all this law in writing, and gave it to the priests, the sons of Levi, who take up the ark of the Lord's agreement, and to all the responsible men of Israel.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 10
text: And Moses said to them, At the end of every seven years, at the time fixed for the ending of debts, at the feast of tents,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 11
text: When all Israel has come before the Lord your God in the place named by him, let a reading be given of this law in the hearing of all Israel.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 12
text: Make all the people come together, men and women and children, and anyone from another country who is with you, so that hearing they may become wise in the fear of the Lord your God, and take care to do all the words of this law;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 13
text: And so that your children, to whom it is new, may give ear and be trained in the fear of the Lord your God, while you are living in the land which you are going over Jordan to take for your heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 14
text: At that time the Lord said to Moses, The day of your death is near: send for Joshua, and come to the Tent of meeting so that I may give him his orders. So Moses and Joshua went to the Tent of meeting.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 15
text: And the Lord was seen in the Tent in a pillar of cloud resting by the door of the Tent.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 16
text: And the Lord said to Moses, Now you are going to rest with your fathers; and this people will be false to me, uniting themselves to the strange gods of the land where they are going; they will be turned away from me and will not keep the agreement I have made with them.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 17
text: In that day my wrath will be moved against them, and I will be turned away from them, veiling my face from them, and destruction will overtake them, and unnumbered evils and troubles will come on them; so that in that day they will say, Have not these evils come on us because our God is not with us?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 18
text: Truly, my face will be turned away from them in that day, because of all the evil they have done in going after other gods.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 19
text: Make then this song for yourselves, teaching it to the children of Israel: put it in their mouths, so that this song may be a witness for me against the children of Israel.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 20
text: For when I have taken them into the land named in my oath to their fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey, and they have made themselves full of food and are fat, then they will be turned to other gods and will give them worship, no longer honouring me or keeping my agreement.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 21
text: Then when evils and troubles without number have overtaken them, this song will be a witness to them, for the words of it will be clear in the memories of their children: for I see the thoughts which are moving in their hearts even now, before I have taken them into the land of my oath.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 22
text: So that same day Moses made this song, teaching it to the children of Israel.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 23
text: Then he gave orders to Joshua, the son of Nun, saying to him, Be strong and take heart: for you are to go at the head of the children of Israel into the land which I made an oath to give them; and I will be with you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 24
text: Now after writing all the words of this law in a book till the record of them was complete,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 25
text: Moses said to the Levites who were responsible for taking up the ark of the Lord's agreement,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 26
text: Take this book of the law and put it by the ark of the Lord's agreement, so that it may be a witness against you.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 27
text: For I have knowledge of your hard and uncontrolled hearts: even now, while I am still living, you will not be ruled by the Lord; how much less after my death?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 28
text: Get together before me all those who are in authority in your tribes, and your overseers, so that I may say these things in their hearing, and make heaven and earth my witnesses against them.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 29
text: For I am certain that after my death you will give yourselves up to sin, wandering from the way which I have given you; and evil will overtake you in the end, because you will do evil in the eyes of the Lord, moving him to wrath by the work of your hands.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 31 Verse 30
text: Then in the hearing of all the meeting of Israel, Moses said the words of this song, to the end.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 1
text: Give ear, O heavens, to my voice; let the earth take note of the words of my mouth:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 2
text: My teaching is dropping like rain, coming down like dew on the fields; like rain on the young grass and showers on the garden plants:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 3
text: For I will give honour to the name of the Lord: let our God be named great.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 4
text: He is the Rock, complete is his work; for all his ways are righteousness: a God without evil who keeps faith, true and upright is he.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 5
text: They have become false, they are not his children, the mark of sin is on them; they are an evil and hard-hearted generation.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 6
text: Is this your answer to the Lord, O foolish people and unwise? Is he not your father who has given you life? He has made you and given you your place.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 7
text: Keep in mind the days of the past, give thought to the years of generations gone by: go to your father and he will make it clear to you, to the old men and they will give you the story.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 8
text: When the Most High gave the nations their heritage, separating into groups the children of men, he had the limits of the peoples marked out, keeping in mind the number of the children of Israel.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 9
text: For the Lord's wealth is his people; Jacob is the land of his heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 10
text: He came to him in the waste land, in the unpeopled waste of sand: putting his arms round him and caring for him, he kept him as the light of his eye.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 11
text: As an eagle, teaching her young to make their flight, with her wings outstretched over them, takes them up on her strong feathers:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 12
text: So the Lord only was his guide, no other god was with him.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 13
text: He put him on the high places of the earth, his food was the increase of the field; honey he gave him out of the rock and oil out of the hard rock;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 14
text: Butter from his cows and milk from his sheep, with fat of lambs and sheep of Bashan, and goats, and the heart of the grain; and for your drink, wine from the blood of the grape.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 15
text: But Jeshurun became fat and would not be controlled: you have become fat, you are thick and full of food: then he was untrue to the God who made him, giving no honour to the Rock of his salvation.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 16
text: The honour which was his they gave to strange gods; by their disgusting ways he was moved to wrath.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 17
text: They made offerings to evil spirits which were not God, to gods who were strange to them, which had newly come up, not feared by your fathers.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 18
text: You have no thought for the Rock, your father, you have no memory of the God who gave you birth.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 19
text: And the Lord saw with disgust the evil-doing of his sons and daughters.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 20
text: And he said, My face will be veiled from them, I will see what their end will be: for they are an uncontrolled generation, children in whom is no faith.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 21
text: They have given my honour to that which is not God, moving me to wrath with their false worship: I will give their honour to those who are not a people, moving them to wrath by a foolish nation,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 22
text: For my wrath is a flaming fire, burning to the deep parts of the underworld, burning up the earth with her increase, and firing the deep roots of the mountains.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 23
text: I will send a rain of troubles on them, my arrows will be showered on them.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 24
text: They will be wasted from need of food, and overcome by burning heat and bitter destruction; and the teeth of beasts I will send on them, with the poison of the worms of the dust.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 25
text: Outside they will be cut off by the sword, and in the inner rooms by fear; death will take the young man and the virgin, the baby at the breast and the grey-haired man.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 26
text: I said I would send them wandering far away, I would make all memory of them go from the minds of men:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 27
text: But for the fear that their haters, uplifted in their pride, might say, Our hand is strong, the Lord has not done all this.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 28
text: For they are a nation without wisdom; there is no sense in them.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 29
text: If only they were wise, if only this was clear to them, and they would give thought to their future!

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 30
text: How would it be possible for one to overcome a thousand, and two to send ten thousand in flight, if their rock had not let them go, if the Lord had not given them up?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 31
text: For their rock is not like our Rock, even our haters themselves being judges.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 32
text: For their vine is the vine of Sodom, from the fields of Gomorrah: their grapes are the grapes of evil, and the berries are bitter:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 33
text: Their wine is the poison of dragons, the cruel poison of snakes.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 34
text: Is not this among my secrets, kept safe in my store-house?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 35
text: Punishment is mine and reward, at the time of the slipping of their feet: for the day of their downfall is near, sudden will be their fate.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 36
text: For the Lord will be judge of his people, he will have pity for his servants; when he sees that their power is gone, there is no one, shut up or free.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 37
text: And he will say, Where are their gods, the rock in which they put their faith?

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 38
text: Who took the fat of their offerings, and the wine of their drink offering? Let them now come to your help, let them be your salvation.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 39
text: See now, I myself am he; there is no other god but me: giver of death and life, wounding and making well: and no one has power to make you free from my hand.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 40
text: For lifting up my hand to heaven I say, By my unending life,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 41
text: If I make sharp my shining sword, and my hand is outstretched for judging, I will give punishment to those who are against me, and their right reward to my haters.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 42
text: I will make my arrows red with blood, my sword will be feasting on flesh, with the blood of the dead and the prisoners, of the long-haired heads of my haters.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 43
text: Be glad, O you his people, over the nations; for he will take payment for the blood of his servants, and will give punishment to his haters, and take away the sin of his land, for his people.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 44
text: So Moses said all the words of this song in the hearing of the people, he and Hoshea, the son of Nun.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 45
text: And after saying all this to the people,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 46
text: Moses said to them, Let the words which I have said to you today go deep into your hearts, and give orders to your children to do every word of this law.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 47
text: And this is no small thing for you, but it is your life, and through this you may make your days long in the land which you are going over Jordan to take for your heritage.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 48
text: That same day the Lord said to Moses,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 49
text: Go up into this mountain of Abarim, to Mount Nebo in the land of Moab opposite Jericho; there you may see the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the children of Israel for their heritage:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 50
text: And let death come to you on the mountain where you are going, and be put to rest with your people; as death came to Aaron, your brother, on Mount Hor, where he was put to rest with his people:

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 51
text: Because of your sin against me before the children of Israel at the waters of Meribath Kadesh in the waste land of Zin; because you did not keep my name holy among the children of Israel.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 32 Verse 52
text: So you will see the land before you, but you will not go into the land which I am giving to the children of Israel.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 1
text: Now this is the blessing which Moses, the man of God, gave to the children of Israel before his death.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 2
text: He said, The Lord came from Sinai, dawning on them from Seir; shining out from Mount Paran, coming from Meribath Kadesh: from his right hand went flames of fire: his wrath made waste the peoples.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 3
text: All his holy ones are at his hand; they go at his feet; they are lifted up on his wings.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 4
text: Moses gave us a law, a heritage for the people of Jacob.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 5
text: And there was a king in Jeshurun, when the heads of the people and the tribes of Israel came together.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 6
text: Let life not death be Reuben's, let not the number of his men be small.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 7
text: And this is the blessing of Judah: he said, Give ear, O Lord, to the voice of Judah and make him one with his people: let your hands take up his cause, and be his help against his attackers.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 8
text: And of Levi he said, Give your Thummim to Levi and let the Urim be with your loved one, whom you put to the test at Massah, with whom you were angry at the waters of Meribah;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 9
text: Who said of his father, Who is he? and of his mother, I have not seen her; he kept himself separate from his brothers and had no knowledge of his children: for they have given ear to your word and kept your agreement.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 10
text: They will be the teachers of your decisions to Jacob and of your law to Israel: the burning of perfumes before you will be their right, and the ordering of burned offerings on your altar.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 11
text: Let your blessing, O Lord, be on his substance, may the work of his hands be pleasing to you: may those who take up arms against him and all who have hate for him, be wounded through the heart, never to be lifted up again.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 12
text: And of Benjamin he said, Benjamin is the loved one of the Lord, he will be kept safe at all times; he will be covered by the Most High, resting between his arms.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 13
text: And of Joseph he said, Let the blessing of the Lord be on his land; for the good things of heaven on high, and the deep waters flowing under the earth,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 14
text: And the good things of the fruits of the sun, and the good things of the growth of the moons,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 15
text: And the chief things of the oldest mountains, and the good things of the eternal hills,

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 16
text: The good things of the earth and all its wealth, the good pleasure of him who was seen in the burning tree: may they come on the head of Joseph, on the head of him who was prince among his brothers.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 17
text: He is a young ox, glory is his; his horns are the horns of the mountain ox, with which all peoples will be wounded, even to the ends of the earth: they are the ten thousands of Ephraim and the thousands of Manasseh.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 18
text: And of Zebulun he said, Be glad, Zebulun, in your going out; and, Issachar, in your tents.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 19
text: They will send out the word for the people to come to the mountain, taking there the offerings of righteousness: for the store of the seas will be theirs, and the secret wealth of the sand.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 20
text: Of Gad he said, A blessing be on him who makes wide the limits of Gad: he takes his rest like a she-lion, taking for himself the arm and the crown of the head.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 21
text: He kept for himself the first part, for his was the ruler's right: he put in force the righteousness of the Lord, and his decisions for Israel.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 22
text: And of Dan he said, Dan is a young lion, springing out from Bashan.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 23
text: And of Naphtali he said, O Naphtali, made glad with grace and full of the blessing of the Lord: the sea and its fishes will be his.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 24
text: And of Asher he said, Let Asher have the blessing of children; may he be pleasing to his brothers, and let his foot be wet with oil.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 25
text: Your shoes will be iron and brass; and as your days, so may your work be.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 26
text: No other is like the God of Jeshurun, coming on the heavens to your help, and letting his glory be seen in the skies.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 27
text: The God of your fathers is your safe resting-place, and under you are his eternal arms: driving out the forces of your haters from before you, he said, Let destruction overtake them.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 28
text: And Israel is living in peace, the fountain of Jacob by himself, in a land of grain and wine, with dew dropping from the heavens.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 33 Verse 29
text: Happy are you, O Israel: who is like you, a people whose saviour is the Lord, whose help is your cover, whose sword is your strength! All those who are against you will put themselves under your rule, and your feet will be planted on their high places.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 34 Verse 1
text: And Moses went up from the table-lands of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah which is facing Jericho. And the Lord let him see all the land, the land of Gilead as far as Dan;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 34 Verse 2
text: And all Naphtali and the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, and all the land of Judah, as far as the Great Sea of the west;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 34 Verse 3
text: And the South, and the circle of the valley of Jericho, the town of palm-trees, as far as Zoar.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 34 Verse 4
text: And the Lord said to him, This is the land about which I made an oath to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, I will give it to your seed: now I have let you see it with your eyes, but you will not go in there.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 34 Verse 5
text: So death came to Moses, the servant of the Lord, there in the land of Moab, as the Lord had said.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 34 Verse 6
text: And the Lord put him to rest in the valley in the land of Moab opposite Beth-peor: but no man has knowledge of his resting-place to this day.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 34 Verse 7
text: And Moses at his death was a hundred and twenty years old: his eye had not become clouded, or his natural force become feeble.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 34 Verse 8
text: For thirty days the children of Israel were weeping for Moses in the table-lands of Moab, till the days of weeping and sorrow for Moses were ended.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 34 Verse 9
text: And Joshua, the son of Nun, was full of the spirit of wisdom; for Moses had put his hands on him: and the children of Israel gave ear to him, and did as the Lord had given orders to Moses.

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 34 Verse 10
text: There has never been another prophet in Israel like Moses, whom the Lord had knowledge of face to face;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 34 Verse 11
text: In all the signs and wonders which the Lord sent him to do in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh and to all his servants and all his land;

title: Deuteronomy Chapter 34 Verse 12
text: And in all the acts of power and fear which Moses did before the eyes of all Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Now after the death of Moses, the servant of the Lord, the word of the Lord came to Joshua, the son of Nun, Moses' helper, saying,

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Moses my servant is dead; so now get up! Go over Jordan, you and all this people, into the land which I am giving to them, to the children of Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Every place on which you put your foot I have given to you, as I said to Moses.

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: From the waste land and this mountain Lebanon, as far as the great river, the river Euphrates, and all the land of the Hittites to the Great Sea, in the west, will be your country.

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: While you are living, all will give way before you: as I was with Moses, so I will be with you; I will not take away my help from you or give you up.

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: Take heart and be strong; for you will give to this people for their heritage the land which I gave by an oath to their fathers.

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: Only take heart and be very strong; take care to do all the law which Moses my servant gave you, not turning from it to the right hand or to the left, so that you may do well in all your undertakings.

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Let this book of the law be ever on your lips and in your thoughts day and night, so that you may keep with care everything in it; then a blessing will be on all your way, and you will do well.

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: Have I not given you your orders? Take heart and be strong; have no fear and do not be troubled; for the Lord your God is with you wherever you go,

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Then Joshua gave their orders to those who were in authority over the people, saying,

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Go through the tents and give orders to the people, saying, Get ready a store of food; for in three days you are to go over this river Jordan and take for your heritage the land which the Lord your God is giving you.

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And to the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joshua said,

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Keep in mind what Moses, the servant of the Lord, said to you, The Lord your God is sending you rest and will give you this land.

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: Your wives, your little ones, and your cattle will be kept here in the land which Moses gave you on this side of Jordan; but you, the fighting-men, are to go over before your brothers, armed, to give them help;

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: Till the Lord has given your brothers rest, as he has given it to you, and they have taken their heritage in the land which the Lord your God is giving them: then you will go back to the land of your heritage which Moses, the servant of the Lord, gave you on the east side of Jordan.

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: Then they said to Joshua in answer, Whatever you say to us we will do, and wherever you send us we will go.

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: As we gave attention to Moses in all things, so we will give attention to you: and may the Lord your God be with you as he was with Moses.

title: Joshua Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: Whoever goes against your orders, and does not give attention to all your words, will be put to death: only take heart and be strong.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Then Joshua, the son of Nun, sent two men from Shittim secretly, with the purpose of searching out the land, and Jericho. So they went and came to the house of a loose woman of the town, named Rahab, where they took their rest for the night.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And it was said to the king of Jericho, See, some men have come here tonight from the children of Israel with the purpose of searching out the land.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: Then the king of Jericho sent to Rahab, saying, Send out the men who have come to you and are in your house; for they have come with the purpose of searching out all the land.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And the woman took the two men and put them in a secret place; then she said, Yes, the men came to me, but I had no idea where they came from;

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: And when it was the time for shutting the doors at dark, they went out; I have no idea where the men went: but if you go after them quickly, you will overtake them.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: But she had taken them up to the roof, covering them with the stems of flax which she had put out in order there.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: So the men went after them on the road to Jordan as far as the river-crossing: and when they had gone out after them, the door into the town was shut.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And before the men went to rest, she came up to them on the roof,

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And said to them, It is clear to me that the Lord has given you the land, and that the fear of you has come on us;

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: For we have had news of how the Lord made the Red Sea dry before you when you came out of Egypt; and what you did to the two kings of the Amorites, on the other side of Jordan, to Sihon and Og, whom you gave up to the curse.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And because of this news, our hearts became like water, and there was no more spirit in any of us because of you; for the Lord your God is God in heaven on high and here on earth.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: So now, will you give me your oath by the Lord, that, because I have been kind to you, you will be kind to my father's house,

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And that you will keep safe my father and mother and my brothers and sisters and all they have, so that death may not come on us?

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And the men said to her, Our life for yours if you keep our business secret; and when the Lord has given us the land, we will keep faith and be kind to you.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: Then she let them down from the window by a cord, for the house where she was living was on the town wall.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And she said to them, Get away into the hill-country, or the men who have gone after you will overtake you; keep yourselves safe there for three days, till the searchers have come back, and then go on your way.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: And the men said to her, We will only be responsible for this oath which you have made us take,

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: If, when we come into the land, you put this cord of bright red thread in the window from which you let us down; and get your father and mother and your brothers and all your family into the house;

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: Then if anyone goes out of your house into the street, his blood will be on his head, we will not be responsible; but if any damage comes to anyone in the house, his blood will be on our heads.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: But if you say anything about our business here, then we will be free from the oath you have made us take.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: And she said, Let it be as you say. Then she sent them away, and they went; and she put the bright red cord in the window.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: And they went into the hill-country and were there three days, till the men who had gone after them had come back; and those who went after them were searching for them everywhere without coming across them.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: Then the two men came down from the hill-country and went over and came back to Joshua, the son of Nun; and they gave him a complete account of what had taken place.

title: Joshua Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: And they said to Joshua, Truly, the Lord has given all the land into our hands; and all the people of the land have become like water because of us.

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Then Joshua got up early in the morning, and, moving on from Shittim, he and all the children of Israel came to Jordan and were there for the night before going over.

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And at the end of three days, the men in authority over the people went through the tents,

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Giving the people their orders, and saying, When you see the ark of the agreement of the Lord your God lifted up by the priests, the Levites, then get up from your places and go after it;

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: But let there be a space between you and it of about two thousand cubits: come no nearer to it, so that you may see the way you have to go, for you have not been over this way before.

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And Joshua said to the people, Make yourselves holy, for tomorrow the Lord will do works of wonder among you.

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: Then Joshua said to the priests, Take up the ark of the agreement and go over in front of the people. So they took up the ark of the agreement and went in front of the people.

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And the Lord said to Joshua, From now on I will give you glory in the eyes of all Israel, so that they may see that, as I was with Moses, so I will be with you.

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And you are to give orders to the priests who take up the ark of the agreement, and say, When you come to the edge of the waters of Jordan, go no further.

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: And Joshua said to the children of Israel, Come to me here: and give ear to the words of the Lord your God.

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And Joshua said, By this you will see that the living God is among you, and that he will certainly send out from before you the Canaanite and the Hittite and the Hivite and the Perizzite and the Girgashite and the Amorite and the Jebusite.

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: See, the ark of the agreement of the Lord of all the earth is going over before you into Jordan.

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: So take twelve men out of the tribes of Israel, a man from every tribe.

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And when the feet of the priests who take up the ark of the Lord, the Lord of all the earth, come to rest in the waters of Jordan, the waters of Jordan will be cut off, all the waters flowing down from higher up, and will come together in a mass.

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: So when the people went out from their tents to go over Jordan, the priests who took up the ark of the agreement were in front of the people;

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And when those who took up the ark came to Jordan, and the feet of the priests who took up the ark were touching the edge of the water (for the waters of Jordan are overflowing all through the time of the grain-cutting),

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Then the waters flowing down from higher up were stopped and came together in a mass a long way back at Adam, a town near Zarethan; and the waters flowing down to the sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, were cut off: and the people went across opposite Jericho.

title: Joshua Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And the priests who took up the ark of the agreement of the Lord kept their places, with their feet on dry land in the middle of Jordan, while all Israel went over on dry land, till all the nation had gone over Jordan.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Now when all the nation had come to the other side of Jordan, the Lord said to Joshua,

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: Take twelve men from the people, a man for every tribe,

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And say to them, Take up from the middle of Jordan, from the place where the feet of the priests were resting, twelve stones, and take them over with you and put them down in the place where you take your rest tonight.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: So Joshua sent for the twelve men, whom he had ready, one man out of every tribe of the children of Israel,

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: And he said to them, Go over before the ark of the Lord your God into the middle of Jordan, and let every one of you take up a stone on his back, one for every tribe of the children of Israel:

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: So that this may be a sign among you; when your children say to you in time to come, What is the reason for these stones?

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: Then you will say to them, Because the waters of Jordan were cut off before the ark of the Lord's agreement; when it went over Jordan the waters of Jordan were cut off: and these stones will be a sign for the children of Israel, keeping it in their memory for ever.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: So the children of Israel did as Joshua gave them orders, and took twelve stones from the middle of Jordan, as the Lord had said to Joshua, one for every tribe of the children of Israel; these they took across with them to their night's resting-place and put them down there.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And Joshua put up twelve stones in the middle of Jordan, where the feet of the priests who took up the ark of the agreement had been placed: and there they are to this day.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: For the priests who took up the ark kept there in the middle of Jordan till all the orders given to Joshua by Moses from the Lord had been done: then the people went over quickly.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And when all the people had come to the other side, the ark of the Lord went over, and the priests, before the eyes of the people.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh went over armed before the children of Israel as Moses had said to them:

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: About forty thousand armed for war went over before the Lord to the fight, to the lowlands of Jericho.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: That day the Lord made Joshua great in the eyes of all Israel; and all the days of his life they went in fear of him, as they had gone in fear of Moses.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: Then the Lord said to Joshua,

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: Give orders to the priests who take up the ark of witness, to come up out of Jordan.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: So Joshua gave orders to the priests, saying, Come up now out of Jordan.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: And when the priests who took up the ark of the Lord's agreement came up out of Jordan and their feet came out on to dry land, the waters of Jordan went back to their place, overflowing its edges as before.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: So on the tenth day of the first month the people came up out of Jordan, and put up their tents in Gilgal, on the east side of Jericho.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: And the twelve stones which they took out of Jordan, Joshua put up in Gilgal.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: And he said to the children of Israel, When your children say to their fathers in time to come, What is the reason for these stones?

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: Then give your children the story, and say, Israel came over this river Jordan on dry land.

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: For the Lord your God made the waters of Jordan dry before you till you had gone across, as he did to the Red Sea, drying it up before us till we had gone across:

title: Joshua Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: So that all the peoples of the earth may see that the hand of the Lord is strong; and that they may go in fear of the Lord your God for ever.

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Now when the news came to all the kings of the Amorites on the west side of Jordan, and all the kings of the Canaanites living by the sea, how the Lord had made the waters of Jordan dry before the children of Israel, till they had gone across, their hearts became like water, and there was no more spirit in them, because of the children of Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: At that time the Lord said to Joshua, Make yourself stone knives and give the children of Israel circumcision a second time.

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: So Joshua made stone knives and gave the children of Israel circumcision at Gibeath-ha-araloth.

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 4
