text: And this is the reason why Joshua did so: all the males of the people who came out of Egypt, all the fighting-men, had been overtaken by death in the waste land on the way, after they came out of Egypt.

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: All the people who came out had undergone circumcision; but all the people whose birth had taken place in the waste land on their journey from Egypt had not.

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: For the children of Israel were wandering in the waste land for forty years, till all the nation, that is, all the fighting-men, who had come out of Egypt, were dead, because they did not give ear to the voice of the Lord: to whom the Lord said, with an oath, that he would not let them see the land which the Lord had given his word to their fathers to give us, a land flowing with milk and honey.

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: And their children, who came up in their place, now underwent circumcision by the hands of Joshua, not having had it before: for there had been no circumcision on the journey.

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: So when all the nation had undergone circumcision, they kept in their tents till they were well again.

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: And the Lord said to Joshua, Today the shame of Egypt has been rolled away from you. So that place was named Gilgal, to this day.

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: So the children of Israel put up their tents in Gilgal; and they kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the month, in the evening, in the lowlands of Jericho.

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: And on the day after the Passover, they had for their food the produce of the land, unleavened cakes and dry grain on the same day.

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: And there was no more manna from the day after they had for their food the produce of the land; the children of Israel had manna no longer, but that year the produce of the land of Canaan was their food.

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: Now when Joshua was near Jericho, lifting up his eyes he saw a man in front of him, with his sword uncovered in his hand: and Joshua went up to him and said, Are you for us or against us?

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: And he said, No; but I have come as captain of the armies of the Lord. Then Joshua, falling down with his face to the earth in worship, said, What has my lord to say to his servant?

title: Joshua Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: And the captain of the Lord's army said to Joshua, Take off your shoes from your feet, for the place where you are is holy. And Joshua did so.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: (Now Jericho was all shut up because of the children of Israel: there was no going out or coming in.)

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: And the Lord said to Joshua, See, I have given into your hands Jericho with its king and all its men of war.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: Now let all your fighting-men make a circle round the town, going all round it once. Do this for six days.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: And let seven priests go before the ark with seven loud-sounding horns in their hands: on the seventh day you are to go round the town seven times, the priests blowing their horns.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And at the sound of a long note on the horns, let all the people give a loud cry; and the wall of the town will come down flat, and all the people are to go straight forward.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: Then Joshua, the son of Nun, sent for the priests and said to them, Take up the ark of the agreement, and let seven priests take seven horns in their hands and go before the ark of the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And he said to the people, Go forward, circling the town, and let the armed men go before the ark of the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: So after Joshua had said this to the people, the seven priests with their seven horns went forward before the Lord, blowing on their horns: and the ark of the Lord's agreement went after them.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: And the armed men went before the priests who were blowing the horns, and the mass of the people went after the ark, blowing their horns.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And to the people Joshua gave an order, saying, You will give no cry, and make no sound, and let no word go out of your mouth till the day when I say, Give a loud cry; then give a loud cry.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: So he made the ark of the Lord go all round the town once: then they went back to the tents for the night.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And early in the morning Joshua got up, and the priests took up the ark of the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And the seven priests with their seven horns went on before the ark of the Lord, blowing their horns: the armed men went before them, and the mass of the people went after the ark of the Lord, blowing their horns.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: The second day they went all round the town once, and then went back to their tents: and so they did for six days.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: Then on the seventh day they got up early, at the dawn of the day, and went round the town in the same way, but that day they went round it seven times.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: And the seventh time, at the sound of the priests' horns, Joshua said to the people, Now give a loud cry; for the Lord has given you the town.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: And the town will be put to the curse, and everything in it will be given to the Lord: only Rahab, the loose woman, and all who are in the house with her, will be kept safe, because she kept secret the men we sent.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: And as for you, keep yourselves from the cursed thing, for fear that you may get a desire for it and take some of it for yourselves, and so be the cause of a curse and great trouble on the tents of Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: But all the silver and gold and the vessels of brass and iron are holy to the Lord: they are to come into the store-house of the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: So the people gave a loud cry, and the horns were sounded; and on hearing the horns the people gave a loud cry, and the wall came down flat, so that the people went up into the town, every man going straight before him, and they took the town.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: And they put everything in the town to the curse; men and women, young and old, ox and sheep and ass, they put to death without mercy.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: Then Joshua said to the two men who had been sent to make a search through the land, Go into the house of the loose woman, and get her out, and all who are with her, as you gave her your oath.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: So the searchers went in and got out Rahab and her father and mother and her brothers and all she had, and they got out all her family; and they took them outside the tents of Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: Then, after burning up the town and everything in it, they put the silver and gold and the vessels of brass and iron into the store-house of the Lord's house.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: But Joshua kept Rahab, the loose woman, and her father's family and all she had, from death, and so she got a living-place among the children of Israel to this day; because she kept safe the men whom Joshua had sent to make a search through the land.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: Then Joshua gave the people orders with an oath, saying, Let that man be cursed before the Lord who puts his hand to the building up of this town: with the loss of his first son will he put the first stone of it in place, and with the loss of his youngest son he will put up its doors.

title: Joshua Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: So the Lord was with Joshua; and news of him went through all the land.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: But the children of Israel did wrong about the cursed thing: for Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the family of Judah, took of the cursed thing, moving the Lord to wrath against the children of Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: Now Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is by the side of Beth-aven, on the east side of Beth-el, and said to them, Go up and make a search through the land. And the men went up and saw how Ai was placed.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Then they came back to Joshua and said to him, Do not send all the people up, but let about two or three thousand men go up and make an attack on Ai; there is no need for all the people to be tired with the journey there, for it is only a small town.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: So about three thousand of the people went up, and were sent in flight by the men of Ai.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: The men of Ai put to death about thirty-six of them, driving them from before the town as far as the stoneworks, and overcoming them on the way down: and the hearts of the people became like water.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: Then Joshua, in great grief, went down on the earth before the ark of the Lord till the evening, and all the chiefs of Israel with him, and they put dust on their heads.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: And Joshua said, O Lord God, why have you taken us over Jordan only to give us up into the hands of the Amorites for our destruction? If only it had been enough for us to keep on the other side of Jordan!

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: O Lord, what am I to say now that Israel have given way before their attackers?

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: For when the news comes to the Canaanites and all the people of the land, they will come up, shutting us in and cutting off our name from the earth: and what will you do for the honour of your great name?

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: Then the Lord said to Joshua, Get up; what are you doing with your face to the earth?

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: Israel has done wrong, sinning against the agreement which I made with them: they have even taken of the cursed thing; acting falsely like thieves they have put it among their goods.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: For this reason the children of Israel have given way, turning their backs in flight before their attackers, because they are cursed: I will no longer be with you, if you do not put the cursed thing away from among you.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: Up! make the people holy; say to them, Make yourselves holy before tomorrow, for the Lord, the God of Israel, has said, There is a cursed thing among you, O Israel, and you will give way before your attackers in the fight till the cursed thing has been taken away from among you.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: So in the morning you are to come near, tribe by tribe; and the tribe marked out by the Lord is to come near, family by family; and the family marked out by the Lord is to come near, house by house; and the house marked out by the Lord is to come near, man by man.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: Then the man who is taken with the cursed thing is to be burned, with everything which is his; because he has gone against the agreement of the Lord and has done an act of shame in Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: So Joshua got up early in the morning, and made Israel come before him by their tribes; and the tribe of Judah was taken;

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: Then he made Judah come forward, and the family of the Zerahites was taken; and he made the family of the Zerahites come forward man by man; and Zabdi was taken;

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: Then the house of Zabdi came forward man by man, and Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was taken.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: And Joshua said to Achan, My son, give glory and praise to the Lord, the God of Israel; give me word now of what you have done, and keep nothing back from me.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: And Achan, answering, said to Joshua, Truly I have done wrong against the Lord, the God of Israel, and this is what I have done:

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: When I saw among their goods a fair robe of Babylon and two hundred shekels of silver, and a mass of gold, fifty shekels in weight, I was overcome by desire and took them; and they are put away in the earth in my tent, and the silver is under it.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: So Joshua sent men quickly, and looking in his tent, they saw where the robe had been put away secretly with the silver under it.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: And they took them from the tent and came back with them to Joshua and the children of Israel, and put them before the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: Then Joshua and all Israel took Achan, the son of Zerah, and the silver and the robe and the mass of gold, and his sons and his daughters and his oxen and his asses and his sheep and his tent and everything he had; and they took them up into the valley of Achor.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: And Joshua said, Why have you been a cause of trouble to us? Today the Lord will send trouble on you. And all Israel took part in stoning him; they had him stoned to death and then burned with fire.

title: Joshua Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: And over him they put a great mass of stones, which is there to this day; then the heat of the Lord's wrath was turned away. So that place was named, The Valley of Achor, to this day.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: Then the Lord said to Joshua, Have no fear and do not be troubled: take with you all the fighting-men and go up against Ai: for I have given into your hands the king of Ai and his people and his town and his land:

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And you are to do to Ai and its king as you did to Jericho and its king: but their goods and their cattle you may take for yourselves: let a secret force be stationed to make a surprise attack on the town from the back.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: So Joshua and the fighting-men got ready to go up against Ai; and Joshua took thirty thousand men of war, and sent them out by night.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: And he gave them their orders, saying, Go and take up your position secretly at the back of the town: do not go very far away, and let all of you be ready:

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And I and all the people with me will come near the town, and when they come out against us as they did before, we will go in flight from them;

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: And they will come out after us, till we have got them away from the town; for they will say, They have gone in flight from us as before; so we will go in flight before them;

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: Then you will get up from your secret position and take the town, for the Lord your God will give it up into your hands.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And when you have taken the town, put fire to it, as the Lord has said: see, I have given you your orders.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: So Joshua sent them out: and they took up a secret position between Beth-el and Ai, on the west side of Ai: but Joshua kept with the people that night.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And early in the morning Joshua got up, and put the people in order, and he and the chiefs of Israel went up before the people to Ai.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And all the fighting-men who were with him went up and came near the town, and took up a position on the north side of Ai facing the town, with a valley between him and the town.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And taking about five thousand men, he put them in position for a surprise attack on the west side of Ai, between Beth-el and Ai.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: So all the people were in their places, the army on the north side of the town and the secret force on the west; and that night Joshua went down into the valley.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: Now when the king of Ai saw it, he got up quickly and went out to war against Israel, he and all his people, to the slope going down to the valley; but he had no idea that a secret force was waiting at the back of the town.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: Then Joshua and all Israel, acting as if they were overcome before them, went in flight by way of the waste land.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: And all the people in Ai came together to go after them; and they went after Joshua, moving away from the town.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: There was not a man in Ai and Beth-el who did not go out after Israel; and the town was open and unwatched while they went after Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: And the Lord said to Joshua, Let your spear be stretched out against Ai; for I will give it into your hands. So Joshua took up his spear, stretching it out in the direction of the town.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: Then the secret force came quickly from their place, and running forward when they saw his hand stretched out, went into the town and took it, and put fire to it straight away.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: Then the men of Ai, looking back, saw the smoke of the town going up to heaven, and were unable to go this way or that: and the people who had gone in flight to the waste land were turned back on those who were coming after them.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: And when Joshua and all Israel saw that the town had been taken by the surprise attack, and that the smoke of the town had gone up, turning round they overcame the men of Ai.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: Then the other force came out of the town against them, so that they were being attacked on this side and on that: and Israel overcame them and let not one of them get away with his life.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: But the king of Ai they made prisoner, and took him to Joshua.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: Then, after the destruction of all the people of Ai in the field and in the waste land where they went after them, and when all the people had been put to death without mercy, all Israel went back to Ai, and put to death all who were in it without mercy.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: On that day twelve thousand were put to death, men and women, all the people of Ai.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: For Joshua did not take back his hand with the outstretched spear till the destruction of the people of Ai was complete.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: But the cattle and the goods from that town, Israel took for themselves, as the Lord had given orders to Joshua.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: So Joshua gave Ai to the flames, and made it a waste mass of stones for ever, as it is to this day.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: And he put the king of Ai to death, hanging him on a tree till evening: and when the sun went down, Joshua gave them orders to take his body down from the tree, and put it in the public place of the town, covering it with a great mass of stones, which is there to this day.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 30
text: Then Joshua put up an altar to the Lord, the God of Israel, in Mount Ebal,

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 31
text: In the way ordered by Moses, the servant of the Lord, as it is recorded in the book of the law of Moses, an altar of uncut stones, untouched by any iron instrument: and on it they made burned offerings and peace-offerings to the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 32
text: And he made there on the stones a copy of the law of Moses, writing it before the eyes of the children of Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 33
text: And all Israel, those who were Israelites by birth, as well as the men from other lands living with them, and their responsible men and their overseers and judges, took their places round the ark, in front of the priests, the Levites, whose work it was to take up the ark of the Lord's agreement; half of them were stationed in front of Mount Gerizim and half in front of Mount Ebal, in agreement with the orders for the blessing of the children of Israel which Moses, the servant of the Lord, had given.

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 34
text: And after, he gave them all the words of the law, the blessing and the curse, as it is all recorded in the book of the law;

title: Joshua Chapter 8 Verse 35
text: Reading to all the meeting of Israel, with the women and the children and the men from other lands who were living among them, every word of the orders which Moses had given.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: Now on hearing the news of these things, all the kings on the west side of Jordan, in the hill-country and the lowlands and by the Great Sea in front of Lebanon, the Hittites and the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites,

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: Came together with one purpose, to make war against Joshua and Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And the men of Gibeon, hearing what Joshua had done to Jericho and Ai,

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: Acting with deceit, got food together as if for a long journey; and took old food-bags for their asses, and old and cracked wine-skins kept together with cord;

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: And put old stitched-up shoes on their feet, and old clothing on their backs; and all the food they had with them was dry and broken up.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: And they came to Joshua to the tent-circle at Gilgal, and said to him and to the men of Israel, We have come from a far country: so now make an agreement with us.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: And the men of Israel said to the Hivites, It may be that you are living among us; how then may we make an agreement with you?

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And they said to Joshua, We are your servants. Then Joshua said to them, Who are you and where do you come from?

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: And they said to him, Your servants have come from a very far country, because of the name of the Lord your God: for the story of his great name, and of all he did in Egypt has come to our ears,

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And what he did to the two kings of the Amorites east of Jordan, to Sihon, king of Heshbon, and to Og, king of Bashan, at Ashtaroth.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: So the responsible men and all the people of our country said to us, Take food with you for the journey and go to them, and say to them, We are your servants: so now make an agreement with us.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: This bread which we have with us for our food, we took warm and new from our houses when starting on our journey to you; but now see, it has become dry and broken up.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: And these wine-skins were new when we put the wine in them, and now they are cracked as you see; and our clothing and our shoes have become old because of our very long journey here.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: And the men took some of their food, without requesting directions from the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: So Joshua made peace with them, and made an agreement with them that they were not to be put to death: and the chiefs of the people took an oath to them.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: Now three days after, when they had made this agreement with them, they had word that these men were their neighbours, living near them.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: And the children of Israel went forward on their journey, and on the third day came to their towns. Now their towns were Gibeon and Chephirah and Beeroth and Kiriath-jearim.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: And the children of Israel did not put them to death, because the chiefs of the people had taken an oath to them by the Lord, the God of Israel. And all the people made an outcry against the chiefs.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: But all the chiefs said to the people, We have taken an oath to them by the Lord, the God of Israel, and so we may not put our hands on them.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: This is what we will do to them: we will not put them to death, for fear that wrath may come on us because of our oath to them.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: Keep them living, and let them be servants, cutting wood and getting water for all the people. And all the people did as the chiefs had said to them.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: Then Joshua sent for them, and said to them, Why have you been false to us, saying, We are very far from you, when you are living among us?

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: Now because of this you are cursed, and you will for ever be our servants, cutting wood and getting water for the house of my God.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: And, answering Joshua, they said, Because it came to the ears of your servants that the Lord your God had given orders to his servant Moses to give you all this land, and to send destruction on all the people living in it, because of you; so, fearing greatly for our lives because of you, we have done this.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: And now we are in your hands: do to us whatever seems good and right to you.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: So he kept them safe from the children of Israel, and did not let them be put to death.

title: Joshua Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: And that day Joshua made them servants, cutting wood and getting water for the people and for the altar of the Lord, in the place marked out by him, to this day.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Now when it came to the ears of Adoni-zedek, king of Jerusalem, that Joshua had taken Ai, and had given it up to the curse (for as he had done to Jericho and its king, so he had done to Ai and its king); and that the people of Gibeon had made peace with Israel and were living among them;

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: He was in great fear, because Gibeon was a great town, like one of the king's towns, greater than Ai, and all the men in it were men of war.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: So Adoni-zedek, king of Jerusalem, sent to Hoham, king of Hebron, and to Piram, king of Jarmuth, and to Japhia, king of Lachish, and to Debir, king of Eglon, saying,

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: Come up to me and give me help, and let us make an attack on Gibeon: for they have made peace with Joshua and the children of Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: So the five kings of the Amorites, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon, were banded together, and went up with all their armies and took up their position before Gibeon and made war against it.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: And the men of Gibeon sent to Joshua to the tent-circle at Gilgal, saying, Be not slow to send help to your servants; come up quickly to our support and keep us safe: for all the kings of the Amorites from the hill-country have come together against us.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: So Joshua went up from Gilgal with all his army and all his men of war.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: And the Lord said to Joshua, Have no fear of them, for I have given them into your hands; they will all give way before you.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: So Joshua, having come up from Gilgal all night, made a sudden attack on them.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And the Lord made them full of fear before Israel, and they put great numbers of them to death at Gibeon, and went after them by the way going up to Beth-horon, driving them back to Azekah and Makkedah

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: And in their flight before Israel, on the way down from Beth-horon, the Lord sent down great stones from heaven on them all the way to Azekah, causing their death: those whose death was caused by the stones were more than those whom the children of Israel put to death with the sword.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: It was on the day when the Lord gave up the Amorites into the hands of the children of Israel that Joshua said to the Lord, before the eyes of Israel, Sun, be at rest over Gibeon; and you, O moon, in the valley of Aijalon.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: And the sun was at rest and the moon kept its place till the nation had given punishment to their attackers. (Is it not recorded in the book of Jashar?) So the sun kept its place in the middle of the heavens, and was waiting, and did not go down, for the space of a day.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: And there was no day like that, before it or after it, when the Lord gave ear to the voice of a man; for the Lord was fighting for Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: And Joshua, with all Israel, went back to the tent-circle at Gilgal.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: But these five kings went in flight secretly to a hole in the rock at Makkedah.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: And word was given to Joshua that the five kings had been taken in a hole in the rock at Makkedah.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: And Joshua said, Let great stones be rolled against the mouth of the hole, and let men keep watch by it:

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: But do you, without waiting, go after their army, attacking them from the back; do not let them get into their towns, for the Lord your God has given them into your hands.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: Now when Joshua and the children of Israel had come to the end of their war of complete destruction, and had put to death all but a small band who had got safely into the walled towns,

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: All the people went back to Joshua to the tent-circle at Makkedah in peace: and no one said a word against the children of Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: Then Joshua said, Take away the stones from the mouth of the hole in the rock, and make those five kings come out to me.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: And they did so, and made those five kings come out of the hole to him, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: And when they had made those kings come out to Joshua, Joshua sent for all the men of Israel, and said to the chiefs of the men of war who had gone with him, Come near and put your feet on the necks of these kings. So they came near and put their feet on their necks.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: And Joshua said to them, Have no fear and do not be troubled; be strong and take heart: for so will the Lord do to all against whom you make war.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: Then Joshua had them put to death, hanging them on five trees, where they were till evening.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: And when the sun went down, they were taken down from the trees, by Joshua's orders, and put into the hole where they had gone to be safe; and great stones were placed at the mouth of the hole, where they are to this day.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: That day Joshua took Makkedah, and put it and its king to the sword; every soul in it he gave up to the curse without mercy: and he did to the king of Makkedah as he had done to the king of Jericho.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: Then Joshua and all Israel with him went on from Makkedah and came to Libnah, and made an attack on it;

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: And again the Lord gave it and its king into the hands of Israel; and he put it and every person in it to the sword, till their destruction was complete; and he did to its king as he had done to the king of Jericho.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: Then Joshua and all Israel with him went on from Libnah to Lachish, and took up their position against it and made an attack on it,

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: And the Lord gave Lachish into the hands of Israel, and on the second day he took it, putting it and every person in it to the sword without mercy, as he had done to Libnah.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 33
text: Then Horam, king of Gezer, came up to the help of Lachish; and Joshua overcame him and his people, putting all of them to death.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 34
text: And Joshua and all Israel with him went on from Lachish to Eglon: and they took up their position against it and made an attack on it;

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 35
text: And that day they took it, putting it and every person in it to the sword, as he had done to Lachish.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 36
text: And Joshua and all Israel with him went up from Eglon to Hebron, and made an attack on it;

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 37
text: And took it, overcoming it and putting it and its king and its towns and every person in it to the sword: as he had done to Eglon, he put them all to death, and gave it up to the curse with every person in it.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 38
text: And Joshua and all Israel with him went on to make an attack on Debir;

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 39
text: And he took it, with its king and all its towns: and he put them to the sword, giving every person in it to the curse; all were put to death: as he had done to Hebron, so he did to Debir and its king.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 40
text: So Joshua overcame all the land, the hill-country and the South and the lowland and the mountain slopes, and all their kings; all were put to death: and every living thing he gave up to the curse, as the Lord, the God of Israel, had given him orders.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 41
text: Joshua overcame them from Kadesh-barnea to Gaza, and all the land of Goshen as far as Gibeon.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 42
text: And all these kings and their land Joshua took at the same time, because the Lord, the God of Israel, was fighting for Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 10 Verse 43
text: Then Joshua and all Israel with him went back to their tents at Gilgal.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Now Jabin, king of Hazor, hearing of these things, sent to Jobab, king of Madon, and to the king of Shimron, and to the king of Achshaph,

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: And to the kings on the north in the hill-country, and in the Arabah south of Chinneroth, and in the lowland, and in the highlands of Dor on the west,

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: And to the Canaanites on the east and on the west, and to the Amorites and the Hittites and the Perizzites, and the Jebusites in the hill-country, and the Hivites under Hermon in the land of Mizpah.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: And they went out, they and all their armies with them, a great people, in number like the sand on the seaside, with horses and war-carriages in great number.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And all these kings came together, and put their forces in position at the waters of Merom, to make war on Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And the Lord said to Joshua, Have no fear of them: for tomorrow at this time I will give them all up dead before Israel; you are to have the leg-muscles of their horses cut and their war-carriages burned with fire.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: So Joshua and all the men of war with him came against them suddenly at the waters of Merom, and made an attack on them.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: And the Lord gave them up into the hands of Israel, and they overcame them driving them back to great Zidon and to Misrephoth-maim and into the valley of Mizpeh to the east; and they put them all to death, no man got away safely.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And Joshua did to them as the Lord had said to him; he had the leg-muscles of their horses cut and their war-carriages burned with fire.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: At that time, Joshua went on to take Hazor and put its king to the sword: for in earlier times Hazor was the chief of all those kingdoms.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: And they put every person in it to death without mercy, giving every living thing up to the curse, and burning Hazor.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And all the towns of these kings, and all the kings, Joshua took, and put them to the sword: he gave them up to the curse, as Moses, the servant of the Lord, had said.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: As for the towns made on hills of earth, not one was burned by Israel but Hazor, which was burned by Joshua.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And all the goods taken from these towns, and their cattle, the children of Israel kept for themselves; but every man they put to death without mercy, till their destruction was complete, and there was no one living.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: As the Lord had given orders to Moses his servant, so Moses gave orders to Joshua, and so Joshua did; every order which the Lord had given to Moses was done.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: So Joshua took all that land, the hill-country and all the South, and all the land of Goshen, and the lowland and the Arabah, the hill-country of Israel and its lowland;

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: From Mount Halak, which goes up to Seir, as far as Baal-gad in the valley of Lebanon under Mount Hermon: and all their kings he overcame and put to death.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: For a long time Joshua made war on all those kings.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: Not one town made peace with the children of Israel, but only the Hivites of Gibeon: they took them all in war.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: For the Lord made them strong in heart to go to war against Israel, so that he might give them up to the curse without mercy, and that destruction might come on them, as the Lord had given orders to Moses.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: And Joshua came at that time and put an end to the Anakim in the hill-country, in Hebron, in Debir, in Anab, and in all the hill-country of Judah and Israel: Joshua gave them and their towns to the curse.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: Not one of the Anakim was to be seen in the land of the children of Israel: only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod, some were still living.

title: Joshua Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: So Joshua took all the land, as the Lord had said to Moses; and Joshua gave it to the children of Israel as their heritage, making division of it among them by their tribes. And the land had rest from war.

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: Now these are the kings of the land whom the children of Israel overcame, taking as their heritage their land on the east side of Jordan, from the valley of the Arnon to Mount Hermon, and all the Arabah to the east:

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: Sihon, king of the Amorites, who was living in Heshbon, ruling from Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, and the town in the middle of the valley, and half Gilead, as far as the river Jabbok, the limits of the children of Ammon;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: And the Arabah to the sea of Chinneroth, to the east, and to the sea of the Arabah, that is the Salt Sea, to the east, the way to Beth-jeshimoth; and on the south, under the slopes of Pisgah:

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: And the land of Og, king of Bashan, of the rest of the Rephaim, who was living at Ashtaroth and at Edrei,

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: Ruling in the mountain of Hermon, and in Salecah, and in all Bashan, as far as the limits of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and half Gilead, to the land of Sihon, king of Heshbon.

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: Moses, the servant of the Lord, and the children of Israel overcame them; and Moses, the servant of the Lord, gave their land for a heritage to the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: And these are the kings of the land whom Joshua and the children of Israel overcame on the west side of Jordan, from Baal-gad in the valley of Lebanon to Mount Halak, which goes up to Seir; and Joshua gave the land to the tribes of Israel for a heritage, in keeping with their divisions;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: In the hill-country, and in the lowland, and in the Arabah, and on the mountain slopes, and in the waste land, and in the South; the Hittites, the Amorites, and the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: The king of Jericho, one; the king of Ai, which is near Beth-el, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: The king of Jerusalem, one; the king of Hebron, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: The king of Jarmuth, one; the king of Lachish, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: The king of Eglon, one; the king of Gezer, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: The king of Debir, one; the king of Geder, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: The king of Hormah, one; the king of Arad, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: The king of Libnah, one; the king of Adullam, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: The king of Makkedah, one; the king of Beth-el, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: The king of Tappuah, one; the king of Hepher, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: The king of Aphek, one; the king of Lassharon, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: The king of Madon, one; the king of Hazor, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: The king of Shimron-meron, one; the king of Achshaph, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: The king of Taanach, one; the king of Megiddo, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: The king of Kedesh, one; the king of Jokneam in Carmel, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: The king of Dor on the hill of Dor, one; the king of Goiim in Gilgal, one;

title: Joshua Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: The king of Tirzah, one; all the kings together were thirty-one.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: Now Joshua was old and full of years; and the Lord said to him, You are old and full of years, and there is still very much land to be taken.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: This is the land which is still to be taken: all the country of the Philistines, and all the Geshurites;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: From the Shihor, which is before Egypt, to the edge of Ekron to the north, which is taken to be Canaanite property: the five chiefs of the Philistines; the Gazites, and the Ashdodites, the Ashkelonites, the Gittites, and the Ekronites, as well as the Avvim;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: On the south: all the land of the Canaanites, and Mearah which is the property of the Zidonians, to Aphek, as far as the limit of the Amorites:

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: And the land of the Gebalites, and all Lebanon, looking east, from Baal-gad under Mount Hermon as far as Hamath:

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: All the people of the hill-country from Lebanon to Misrephoth-maim, all the Zidonians; them will I send out from before the children of Israel: only make division of it to Israel for a heritage, as I have given you orders to do.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: So now make division of this land for a heritage to the nine tribes, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: With him the Reubenites and the Gadites have been given their heritage, which Moses gave them, on the east side of Jordan, as Moses, the servant of the Lord, gave them;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: From Aroer, on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, and the town in the middle of the valley, and all the table-land from Medeba to Dibon;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: And all the towns of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who was ruling in Heshbon, to the limits of the children of Ammon;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: And Gilead, and the land of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and all Mount Hermon, and all Bashan to Salecah;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: All the kingdom of Og in Bashan, who was ruling in Ashtaroth and in Edrei (he was one of the last of the Rephaim); these did Moses overcome, driving them out of their country.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: However, the people of Israel did not send out the Geshurites, or the Maacathites: but Geshur and Maacath are living among Israel to this day.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: Only to the tribe of Levi he gave no heritage; the offerings of the Lord, the God of Israel, made by fire are his heritage, as he said to him.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: And Moses gave their heritage to the tribe of Reuben by their families.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: Their limit was from Aroer, on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, and the town in the middle of the valley, and all the table-land by Medeba;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: Heshbon and all her towns in the table-land; Dibon, and Bamoth-baal, and Beth-baal-meon;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: And Jahaz, and Kedemoth, and Mephaath;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: And Kiriathaim, and Sibmah, and Zereth-shahar in the mountain of the valley;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: And Beth-peor, and the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth-jeshimoth;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: And all the towns of the table-land, and all the kingdom of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who was ruling in Heshbon, whom Moses overcame, together with the chiefs of Midian, Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, the chiefs of Sihon, who were living in the land.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: And Balaam, the son of Beor, the prophet, the children of Israel put to death with the sword.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: And the limit of the children of Reuben was the edge of Jordan. This was the heritage of the children of Reuben by their families, with its towns and its unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: And Moses gave their heritage to the tribe of Gad by their families.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: And their limit was Jazer, and all the towns of Gilead, and half the land of the children of Ammon, to Aroer before Rabbah;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 26
text: And from Heshbon to Ramath-mizpeh, and Betonim; and from Mahanaim to the edge of Debir;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 27
text: And in the valley, Beth-haram, and Beth-nimrah, and Succoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of Sihon, king of Heshbon, having Jordan for its limit, to the end of the sea of Chinnereth on the east side of Jordan.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 28
text: This is the heritage of the children of Gad by their families, with its towns and its unwalled places

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 29
text: And Moses gave their heritage to the half-tribe of Manasseh by their families.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 30
text: And their limit was from Mahanaim, all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og, king of Bashan, and all Havvoth-Jair, in Bashan, sixty towns;

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 31
text: And half Gilead, and Ashtaroth, and Edrei, towns of the kingdom of Og in Bashan, were for the children of Machir, the son of Manasseh, for half of the children of Machir by their families.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 32
text: These are the heritages of which Moses made distribution in the lowlands of Moab, on the other side of Jordan in Jericho, to the east.

title: Joshua Chapter 13 Verse 33
text: But to the tribe of Levi Moses gave no heritage: the Lord, the God of Israel, is their heritage, as he said to them.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: And these are the heritages which the children of Israel took in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar, the priest, and Joshua, the son of Nun, and the heads of the tribes of the children of Israel, gave out to them;

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: Their heritage by the Lord's decision, as he gave orders by Moses, for the nine tribes and the half-tribe.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: For Moses had given their heritage to the two tribes and the half-tribe on the other side of Jordan, but to the Levites he gave no heritage among them.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: Because the children of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim; and they gave the Levites no part in the land, only towns for their living-places, with the grass-lands for their cattle and for their property.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: As the Lord had given orders to Moses, so the people of Israel did, and they made division of the land.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: Then the children of Judah went to Joshua in Gilgal; and Caleb, the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, said to him, You have knowledge of what the Lord said to Moses, the man of God, about me and about you in Kadesh-barnea.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: I was forty years old when Moses, the servant of the Lord, sent me from Kadesh-barnea to make a search through the land; and the account which I gave him was in keeping with his desire.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: My brothers, however, who went up with me, made the heart of the people like water: but I was true to the Lord with all my heart.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: And on that day Moses took an oath, saying, Truly the land where your feet have been placed will become a heritage for you and your children for ever, because you have been true to the Lord your God with all your heart.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: And now, as you see, the Lord has kept me safe these forty-five years, from the time when the Lord said this to Moses, while Israel was wandering in the waste land: and now I am eighty-five years old.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: And still, I am as strong today as I was when Moses sent me out: as my strength was then, so is it now, for war and for all the business of life.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: So now, give me this hill-country named by the Lord at that time; for you had an account of it then, how the Anakim were there, and great walled towns: it may be that the Lord will be with me, and I will be able to take their land, as the Lord said.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: And Joshua gave him his blessing; and he gave Hebron to Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, for his heritage.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: So Hebron became the heritage of Caleb, the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, to this day, because with all his heart he was true to the Lord, the God of Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: In earlier times the name of Hebron had been Kiriath-arba, named after Arba, the greatest of the Anakim. And the land had rest from war.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: Now the part of the land marked out for the children of Judah by families, went up to the edge of Edom, as far as the waste land of Zin to the south, to the farthest point of it on the south.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: Their south limit was from the farthest part of the Salt Sea, from the inlet looking to the south:

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: From there it goes south of the slope up to Akrabbim, and on to Zin, then south past Kadesh-barnea, and on by Hezron and up to Addar, turning in the direction of Karka:

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: Then on to Azmon, ending at the stream of Egypt: and the end of the limit is at the sea; this will be your limit on the south.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: And the east limit is the Salt Sea as far as the end of Jordan. And the limit of the north part of the land is from the inlet of the sea at the end of Jordan:

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: Then the line goes up to Beth-hoglah, past the north of Beth-arabah, and up to the stone of Bohan, the son of Reuben;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: Then the line goes up to Debir from the valley of Achor, and so to the north, in the direction of Gilgal, which is opposite the slope up to Adummim, on the south side of the river: and the line goes on to the waters of En-shemesh, ending at En-rogel:

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: Then the line goes up by the valley of the son of Hinnom to the south side of the Jebusite (which is Jerusalem): then up to the top of the mountain in front of the valley of Hinnom to the west, which is at the farthest point of the valley of Rephaim on the north:

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: And the limit is marked out from the top of the mountain to the fountain of the waters of Nephtoah, and out to the towns of Mount Ephron, as far as Baalah (which is Kiriath-jearim):

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: Then turning west, the line goes from Baalah to Mount Seir, and on to the side of Mount Jearim (which is Chesalon) on the north, then down to Beth-shemesh, and on past Timnah:

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: And out to the side of Ekron to the north: then it is marked out to Shikkeron and on to Mount Baalah, ending at Jabneel; the end of the line is at the sea.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: And the limit on the west is the edge of the Great Sea. This is the line going round the land marked out for the children of Judah, by their families.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: And to Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, he gave a part among the children of Judah, as the Lord had given orders to Joshua, that is, Kiriath-arba, named after Arba, the father of Anak which is Hebron.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: And the three sons of Anak, Sheshai and Ahiman and Talmai, the children of Anak, were forced out from there by Caleb.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: From there he went up against the people of Debir: (now the name of Debir before that was Kiriath-sepher.)

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: And Caleb said, I will give Achsah, my daughter, as wife to the man who overcomes Kiriath-sepher and takes it.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: And Othniel, the son of Kenaz, Caleb's brother, took it: so he gave him his daughter Achsah for his wife.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: Now when she came to him, he put into her mind the idea of requesting a field from her father: and she got down from her ass; and Caleb said to her, What is it?

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: And she said, Give me a blessing; because you have put me in dry south-land, now give me springs of water. So he gave her the higher spring and the lower spring.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: This is the heritage of the tribe of Judah, by their families.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: The farthest towns of the tribe of Judah in the direction of the limits of Edom to the south, were Kabzeel, and Eder, and Jagur;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: And Kinah, and Dimonah, and Adadah;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: And Kedesh, and Hazor, and Ithnan;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: Ziph, and Telem, and Bealoth;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: And Hazor-hadattah, and Kerioth-hezron (which is Hazor);

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: Amam, and Shema, and Moladah;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: And Hazar-gaddah, and Heshmon, and Beth-pelet;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: And Hazar-shual, and Beer-sheba, and Biziothiah;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: Baalah, and Iim, and Ezem;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: And Eltolad, and Chesil, and Hormah;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: And Ziklag, and Madmannah, and Sansannah;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: And Lebaoth, and Shilhim, and Ain, and Rimmon; all the towns are twenty-nine, with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 33
text: In the lowland, Eshtaol, and Zorah, and Ashnah;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 34
text: And Zanoah, and En-gannim, Tappuah, and Enam;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 35
text: Jarmuth, and Adullam, Socoh, and Azekah;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 36
text: And Shaaraim, and Adithaim, and Gederah, and Gederothaim; fourteen towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 37
text: Zenan, and Hadashah, and Migdal-gad;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 38
text: And Dilan, and Mizpeh, and Joktheel;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 39
text: Lachish, and Bozkath, and Eglon;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 40
text: And Cabbon, and Lahmas, and Chithlish;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 41
text: And Gederoth, Beth-dagon, and Naamah, and Makkedah; sixteen towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 42
text: Libnah, and Ether, and Ashan;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 43
text: And Iphtah, and Ashnah, and Nezib;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 44
text: And Keilah, and Achzib, and Mareshah; nine towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 45
text: Ekron, with her daughter-towns and her unwalled places;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 46
text: From Ekron to the sea, all the towns by the side of Ashdod, with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 47
text: Ashdod, with her daughter-towns and her unwalled places; Gaza, with her daughter-towns and her unwalled places, to the stream of Egypt, with the Great Sea as a limit.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 48
text: And in the hill-country, Shamir, and Jattir, and Socoh;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 49
text: And Dannah, and Kiriath-sannah (which is Debir);

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 50
text: And Anab, and Eshtemoh, and Anim;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 51
text: And Goshen, and Holon, and Giloh; eleven towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 52
text: Arab, and Dumah, and Eshan;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 53
text: And Janim, and Beth-tappuah, and Aphekah;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 54
text: And Humtah, and Kiriath-arba (which is Hebron), and Zior; nine towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 55
text: Maon, Carmel, and Ziph, and Jutah;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 56
text: And Jezreel, and Jokdeam, and Zanoah;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 57
text: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah; ten towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 58
text: Halhul, Beth-zur, and Gedor;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 59
text: And Maarath, and Beth-anoth, and Eltekon; six towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 60
text: Kiriath-baal (which is Kiriath-jearim), and Rabbah; two towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 61
text: In the waste land, Beth-arabah, Middin, and Secacah;

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 62
text: And Nibshan, and the Town of Salt, and En-gedi; six towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 15 Verse 63
text: And as for the Jebusites living in Jerusalem, the children of Judah were unable to make them go out; but the Jebusites are living with the children of Judah at Jerusalem, to this day.

title: Joshua Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: And the limit of the land marked out for the children of Joseph went out from Jordan at Jericho, at the waters of Jericho on the east, in the waste land, going up from Jericho through the hill-country to Beth-el;

title: Joshua Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: And it goes out from Beth-el to Luz, and on as far as the limit of the Archites to Ataroth;

title: Joshua Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: And it goes down to the west to the limit of the Japhletites, to the limit of Beth-horon the lower, as far as Gezer; ending at the sea.

title: Joshua Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: And the children of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, took their heritage.

title: Joshua Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: And the limit of the land of the children of Ephraim by their families was marked out in this way: the limit of their heritage to the east was Ataroth-addar, to Beth-horon the higher;

title: Joshua Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: The line goes out to the west at Michmethath on the north; then turning to the east to Taanath-shiloh, going past it on the east of Janoah;

title: Joshua Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: And from Janoah down to Ataroth, and to Naarah, and touching Jericho, it goes on to Jordan.

title: Joshua Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: From Tappuah the line goes on to the west to the river of Kanah; ending at the sea. This is the heritage of the children of Ephraim by their families;

title: Joshua Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: Together with the towns marked out for the children of Ephraim in the heritage of Manasseh, all the towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: And the Canaanites who were living in Gezer were not forced out; but the Canaanites have been living among Ephraim, to this day, as servants, doing forced work.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: And this was the part marked out for the tribe of Manasseh, because he was the oldest son of Joseph. As for Machir, the oldest son of Manasseh, the father of Gilead, because he was a man of war he had Gilead and Bashan.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: And as for the rest of the children of Manasseh, their heritage was given to them by families; for the children of Abiezer, and for the children of Helek, and for the children of Asriel, and for the children of Shechem, and for the children of Hepher, and for the children of Shemida: these were the male children of Manasseh, the son of Joseph, by their families.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: But Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons, but only daughters; and these are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: And they came before Eleazar the priest, and Joshua, the son of Nun, and before the chiefs, saying, The Lord gave orders to Moses to give us a heritage among our brothers: so in agreement with the orders of the Lord he gave them a heritage among their father's brothers.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: And ten parts were given to Manasseh, in addition to the land of Gilead and Bashan, which is on the other side of Jordan;

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: Because the daughters of Manasseh had a heritage among his sons, and the land of Gilead was the property of the other sons of Manasseh.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: And the limit of Manasseh's land was from Asher to Michmethath, which is before Shechem; the line goes on to the right hand, to the people of En-tappuah.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: The land of Tappuah was the property of Manasseh; but Tappuah on the edge of Manasseh was the property of the children of Ephraim.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: And the limit goes down to the stream Kanah, to the south of the stream: these towns were Ephraim's among the towns of Manasseh; Manasseh's limit was on the north side of the stream, ending at the sea:

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: To the south it is Ephraim's, and to the north it is Manasseh's, and the sea is his limit; and they are touching Asher on the north, and Issachar on the east.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: In Issachar and Asher, Manasseh had Beth-shean and its daughter-towns, and Ibleam and its daughter-towns, and the people of Dor and its daughter-towns, and the people of En-dor and its daughter-towns, and the people of Taanach and its daughter-towns, and the people of Megiddo and its daughter-towns, that is, the three hills.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: But the children of Manasseh were not able to make the people of those towns go out; but the Canaanites would go on living in that land.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: And when the children of Israel had become strong, they put the Canaanites to forced work, in place of driving them out.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: Then the children of Joseph said to Joshua, Why have you given me only one part and one stretch of land for my heritage? For through the blessing given to me by the Lord up to now, I am a great people.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: Then Joshua said to them, If you are such a great people, go up into the woodlands, clearing a place there for yourselves in the land of the Perizzites and the Rephaim, if the hill-country of Ephraim is not wide enough for you.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: And the children of Joseph said, The hill-country is not enough for us: and all the Canaanites living in the valley have iron war-carriages, those in Beth-shean and its towns as well as those in the valley of Jezreel.

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: Then Joshua said to the children of Joseph, to Ephraim and Manasseh, You are a great people, and have great power: you are not to have one property only,

title: Joshua Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: For the hill-country of Gilead will be yours ... the woodland and cut down ... its outskirts will be yours ... get the Canaanites out, for they have iron war-carriages ... strong.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: And all the meeting of the children of Israel came together at Shiloh and put up the Tent of meeting there: and the land was crushed before them.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: But there were still seven tribes among the children of Israel who had not taken up their heritage.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: Then Joshua said to the children of Israel, Why are you so slow to go in and take up your heritage in the land which the Lord, the God of your fathers, has given you?

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: Take from among you three men from every tribe; and I will send them to go through the land and make a record of it for distribution as their heritage; then let them come back to me.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: And let them make division of it into seven parts: let Judah keep inside his limit on the south, and let the children of Joseph keep inside their limit on the north.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: And you are to have the land marked out in seven parts, and come back to me with the record; and I will make the distribution for you here by the decision of the Lord our God.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: For the Levites have no part among you; to be the Lord's priests is their heritage; and Gad and Reuben and the half-tribe of Manasseh have had their heritage on the east side of Jordan, given to them by Moses, the servant of the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: So the men got up and went; and Joshua gave orders to those who went, to make a record of the land, saying, Go up and down through the land, and make a record of it and come back here to me, and I will make the distribution for you here by the decision of the Lord in Shiloh.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: So the men went, travelling through the land, and made a record of it by towns in seven parts in a book, and came back to Joshua to the tent-circle at Shiloh.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: And Joshua made the distribution for them in Shiloh by the decision of the Lord, marking out the land for the children of Israel by their divisions.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: And the first heritage came out for the tribe of Benjamin by their families: and the limit of their heritage went between the children of Judah and the children of Joseph.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: And their limit on the north was from the Jordan, and the line goes up to the side of Jericho on the north and through the hill-country to the west, ending at the waste land of Beth-aven.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: And from there the line goes south to Luz, to the side of Luz (which is Beth-el), then down to Ataroth-addar, by the mountain to the south of Beth-horon the lower.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: And the limit is marked as coming round to the south on the west side from the mountain which is south of Beth-horon, and ending at Kiriath-baal (which is Kiriath-jearim), a town of the children of Judah: this is the west part.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: And the south part is from the farthest point of Kiriath-jearim, and the line goes out to the west to the fountain of the waters of Nephtoah:

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: And the line goes down to the farthest part of the mountain facing the valley of the son of Hinnom, which is on the north of the valley of Rephaim: from there it goes down to the valley of Hinnom, to the side of the Jebusite on the south as far as En-rogel;

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: And it goes to En-shemesh and on to Geliloth, opposite the way up to Adummim, and it goes down to the stone of Bohan, the son of Reuben;

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: And it goes on to the side facing the Arabah to the north, and down to the Arabah;

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: And on to the north side of Beth-hoglah, ending at the north inlet of the Salt Sea at the south end of Jordan; this is their limit on the south.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: And the limit of the east part is the Jordan. This is the heritage of the children of Benjamin, marked out for their families by these limits on all sides.

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: And the towns of the children of Benjamin, given to them in the order of their families, are Jericho and Beth-hoglah and Emek-kezziz

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: And Beth-arabah and Zemaraim and Beth-el

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: And Avvim and Parah and Ophrah

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: And Chephar-Ammoni and Ophni and Geba; twelve towns with their unwalled places;

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: Gibeon and Ramah and Beeroth

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: And Mizpeh and Chephirah and Mozah

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: And Rekem and Irpeel and Taralah

title: Joshua Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: And Zela, Eleph and the Jebusite (which is Jerusalem), Gibeath and Kiriath; fourteen towns with their unwalled places. This is the heritage of the children of Benjamin by their families.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: And the second heritage came out for the tribe of Simeon by their families; and their heritage was in the middle of the heritage of the children of Judah.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: And they had for their heritage Beer-sheba and Shema and Moladah

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: And Hazar-shual and Balah and Ezem

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: And Eltolad and Bethul and Hormah

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: And Ziklag and Beth-marcaboth and Hazar-susah

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: And Beth-lebaoth and Sharuhen; thirteen towns with their unwalled places;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: Ain, Rimmon, and Ether and Ashan; four towns with their unwalled places;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: And all the unwalled places round about these towns as far as Baalath-beer-ramah to the south. This is the heritage of the tribe of Simeon by their families.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: The heritage of Simeon was taken out of Judah's stretch of land, for Judah's part was more than they had need of, so the heritage of the children of Simeon was inside their heritage.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: And the third heritage came out for Zebulun by their families; the limit of their heritage was as far as Sarid;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: And their limit goes up to the west to Maralah, stretching to Dabbesheth, and to the stream in front of Jokneam;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: Then turning east from Sarid to the limit of Chisloth-tabor, it goes out to Daberath, and up to Japhia;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: And from there it goes on east to Gath-hepher, to Eth-kazin; ending at Rimmon which goes as far as Neah;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: And the line goes round it on the north to Hannathon, ending at the valley of Iphtah-el;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: And Kattath and Nahalal and Shimron and Idalah and Beth-lehem; twelve towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: This is the heritage of the children of Zebulun by their families, these towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: For Issachar the fourth heritage came out, for the children of Issachar by their families;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: And their limit was to Jezreel and Chesulloth and Shunem

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: And Hapharaim and Shion and Anaharath

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: And Rabbith and Kishion and Ebez

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: And Remeth and En-gannim and En-haddah and Beth-pazzez;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: And their limit goes as far as Tabor and Shahazimah and Beth-shemesh, ending at Jordan; sixteen towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: This is the heritage of the tribe of the children of Issachar by their families, these towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: And the fifth heritage came out for the tribe of Asher by their families.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 25
text: And their limit was Helkath and Hali and Beten and Achshaph

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 26
text: And Alammelech and Amad and Mishal, stretching to Carmel on the west and Shihor-libnath;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 27
text: Turning to the east to Beth-dagon and stretching to Zebulun and the valley of Iphtah-el as far as Beth-emek and Neiel to the north; on the left it goes as far as Cabul

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 28
text: And Ebron and Rehob and Hammon and Kanah, to great Zidon;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 29
text: And the limit goes round to Ramah and the walled town of Tyre and Hosah, ending at the sea by Heleb and Achzib;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 30
text: And Ummah and Aphek and Rehob; twenty-two towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 31
text: This is the heritage of the tribe of the children of Asher by their families, these towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 32
text: For the children of Naphtali the sixth heritage came out, for the children of Naphtali by their families;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 33
text: And their limit was from Heleph, from the oak-tree in Zaanannim, and Adami-hannekeb and Jabneel, as far as Lakkum, ending at Jordan;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 34
text: And turning west to Aznoth-tabor, the limit goes out from there to Hukkok, stretching to Zebulun on the south, and Asher on the west, and Judah at Jordan on the east.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 35
text: And the walled towns are Ziddim, Zer, and Hammath, Rakkath, and Chinnereth

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 36
text: And Adamah and Ramah and Hazor

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 37
text: And Kedesh and Edrei and En-Hazor

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 38
text: And Iron and Migdal-el, Horem and Beth-anath and Beth-shemesh; nineteen towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 39
text: This is the heritage of the tribe of the children of Naphtali by their families, these towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 40
text: For the tribe of Dan by their families the seventh heritage came out;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 41
text: And the limit of their heritage was Zorah and Eshtaol and Ir-shemesh

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 42
text: And Shaalabbin and Aijalon and Ithlah

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 43
text: And Elon and Timnah and Ekron

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 44
text: And Eltekeh and Gibbethon and Baalath

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 45
text: And Jehud and Bene-berak and Gath-rimmon;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 46
text: And on the west was ... opposite Joppa.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 47
text: (But the limit of the children of Dan was not wide enough for them; so the children of Dan went up and made war on Leshem and took it, putting it to the sword without mercy, and they took it for their heritage and made a place for themselves there, giving it the name of Leshem-dan, after the name of their father, Dan.)

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 48
text: This is the heritage of the tribe of the children of Dan by their families, these towns with their unwalled places.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 49
text: So the distribution of the land and its limits was complete; and the children of Israel gave Joshua, the son of Nun, a heritage among them;

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 50
text: By the orders of the Lord they gave him the town for which he made request, Timnath-serah in the hill-country of Ephraim: there, after building the town, he made his living-place.

title: Joshua Chapter 19 Verse 51
text: These are the heritages which Eleazar the priest and Joshua, the son of Nun, and the heads of families of the tribes of the children of Israel gave out at Shiloh, by the decision of the Lord, at the door of the Tent of meeting. So the distribution of the land was complete.

title: Joshua Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Joshua,

title: Joshua Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: Say to the children of Israel, Let certain towns be marked out as safe places, as I said to you by the mouth of Moses,

title: Joshua Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: So that any man who in error and without design has taken the life of another, may go in flight to them: and they will be safe places for you from him who has the right of punishment for blood.

title: Joshua Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: And if anyone goes in flight to one of those towns, and comes into the public place of the town, and puts his cause before the responsible men of the town, they will take him into the town and give him a place among them where he may be safe.

title: Joshua Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: And if the one who has the right of punishment comes after him, they are not to give the taker of life up to him; because he was the cause of his neighbour's death without designing it and not in hate.

title: Joshua Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: And he is to go on living in that town till he has to come before the meeting of the people to be judged; (till the death of him who is high priest at that time:) then the taker of life may come back to his town and to his house, to the town from which he had gone in flight.

title: Joshua Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: So they made selection of Kedesh in Galilee in the hill-country of Naphtali, and Shechem in the hill-country of Ephraim, and Kiriath-arba (which is Hebron) in the hill-country of Judah.

title: Joshua Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: And on the east side of Jordan at Jericho, they made selection of Bezer in the waste land, in the table-land, out of the tribe of Reuben, and Ramoth in Gilead out of the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan out of the tribe of Manasseh.

title: Joshua Chapter 20 Verse 9
