text: These were the towns marked out for all the children of Israel and for the man from a strange country living among them, so that anyone causing the death of another in error, might go in flight there, and not be put to death by him who has the right of punishment for blood till he had come before the meeting of the people.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: Then the heads of the families of the Levites came to Eleazar the priest and Joshua, the son of Nun, and to the heads of families of the tribes of the children of Israel;

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: And said to them in Shiloh in the land of Canaan, The Lord gave orders by Moses that we were to have towns for living in, with their grass-lands for our cattle.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: And the children of Israel out of their heritage gave to the Levites these towns with their grass-lands, by the order of the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: And the heritage came out for the families of the Kohathites: the children of Aaron the priest, who were of the Levites, were given thirteen towns from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: The rest of the children of Kohath by their families were given ten towns from the tribes of Ephraim and Dan and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: The children of Gershon by their families were given thirteen towns from the tribes of Issachar and Asher and Naphtali and the half-tribe of Manasseh which was in Bashan.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: The children of Merari by their families were given twelve towns from the tribes of Reuben and Gad and Zebulun.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: All these towns with their grass-lands the children of Israel gave by the decision of the Lord to the Levites, as the Lord had given orders by Moses.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: From the tribes of the children of Judah and the children of Simeon they gave these towns, listed here by name:

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: These were for the children of Aaron among the families of the Kohathites, of the children of Levi: for they came first in the distribution.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: They gave them Kiriath-arba, the town of Arba, the father of Anak, (which is Hebron) in the hill-country of Judah, with its grass-lands.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: But the open country round the town, and its unwalled places, they gave to Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, as his property.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: And to the children of Aaron the priest they gave Hebron with its grass-lands, the town where the taker of life might be safe, and Libnah with its grass-lands;

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: And Jattir with its grass-lands, and Eshtemoa with its grass-lands;

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: And Holon with its grass-lands, and Debir with its grass-lands;

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: And Ain, and Juttah, and Beth-shemesh, with their grass-lands; nine towns from those two tribes.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: And from the tribe of Benjamin they gave Gibeon and Geba with their grass-lands;

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: Anathoth and Almon with their grass-lands, four towns.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: Thirteen towns with their grass-lands were given to the children of Aaron, the priests.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: The rest of the families of the children of Kohath, the Levites, were given towns from the tribe of Ephraim.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: And they gave them Shechem with its grass-lands in the hill-country of Ephraim, the town where the taker of life might be safe, and Gezer with its grass-lands;

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: And Kibzaim and Beth-horon with their grass-lands, four towns.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: And from the tribe of Dan, Elteke and Gibbethon with their grass-lands;

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: Aijalon and Gath-rimmon with their grass-lands, four towns.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: And from the half-tribe of Manasseh, Taanach and Gath-rimmon with their grass-lands, two towns.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 26
text: All the towns of the rest of the families of the children of Kohath were ten with their grass-lands.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 27
text: And to the children of Gershon, of the families of the Levites, they gave from the half-tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan with its grass-lands, the town where the taker of life might be safe, and Ashtaroth with its grass-lands, two towns.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 28
text: And from the tribe of Issachar, Kishion and Daberath with their grass-lands;

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 29
text: Jarmuth and En-gannim with their grass-lands, four towns.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 30
text: And from the tribe of Asher, Mishal and Abdon, with their grass-lands:

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 31
text: Helkath and Rehob with their grass-lands, four towns.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 32
text: And from the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee with its grass-lands, the town where the taker of life might be safe, and Hammoth-dor and Kartan with their grass-lands, three towns.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 33
text: All the towns of the Gershonites with their families were thirteen with their grass-lands.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 34
text: And to the rest of the Levites, that is, the families of the children of Merari, they gave from the tribe of Zebulun, Jokneam and Kartah with their grass-lands;

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 35
text: Dimnah and Nahalal with their grass-lands, four towns.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 36
text: And from the tribe of Reuben, Bezer and Jahaz with their grass-lands;

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 37
text: Kedemoth and Mephaath with their grass-lands, four towns.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 38
text: And from the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead, the town where the taker of life might be safe, and Mahanaim with their grass-lands;

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 39
text: Heshbon and Jazer with their grass-lands, four towns.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 40
text: All these towns were given to the children of Merari by their families, that is, the rest of the families of the Levites; and their heritage was twelve towns.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 41
text: All the towns of the Levites, among the heritage of the children of Israel, were forty-eight towns with their grass-lands.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 42
text: Every one of these towns had grass-lands round it.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 43
text: So the Lord gave to Israel all the land which he gave by oath to their fathers; so it became their heritage and their living-place.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 44
text: And the Lord gave them peace on every side, as he had said to their fathers: all those who were against them gave way before them, for the Lord gave them all up into their hands.

title: Joshua Chapter 21 Verse 45
text: The Lord kept faith with the house of Israel about all the good which he said he would do for them, and all his words came true.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: Then Joshua sent for the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh,

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: And said to them, You have kept all the orders of Moses, the Lord's servant, and have done everything I gave you orders to do:

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: You have now been with your brothers for a long time; till this day you have been doing the orders of the Lord your God.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: And now the Lord your God has given your brothers rest, as he said: so now you may go back to your tents, to the land of your heritage, which Moses, the Lord's servant, gave to you on the other side of Jordan.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: Only take great care to do the orders and the law which Moses, the Lord's servant, gave you; to have love for the Lord your God and to go in all his ways; and to keep his laws and to be true to him and to be his servants with all your heart and with all your soul.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: Then Joshua gave them his blessing and sent them away: and they went back to their tents.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: Now to the one half of the tribe of Manasseh, Moses had given a heritage in Bashan; but to the other half, Joshua gave a heritage among their brothers on the west side of Jordan. Now when Joshua sent them away to their tents, he gave them his blessing,

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: And said to them, Go back with much wealth to your tents, and with very much cattle, with silver and gold and brass and iron, and with a very great store of clothing; give your brothers a part of the goods taken in the war.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: So Reuben and Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh went back, parting from the children of Israel at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, to go to the land of Gilead, to the land of their heritage which had been given to them by the Lord's order to Moses.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: Now when they came to the country by Jordan in the land of Canaan, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh put up there, by Jordan, a great altar, seen from far.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: And news came to the children of Israel, See, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh have put up an altar opposite the land of Canaan, in the country by Jordan on the side which is Israel's.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: Then all the meeting of the children of Israel, hearing this, came together at Shiloh to go up against them to war.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: And the children of Israel sent Phinehas, the son of Eleazar the priest, to the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh, to the land of Gilead,

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: And with him they sent ten chiefs, one for every tribe of the children of Israel, every one of them the head of his house among the families of Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: And they came to the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh, to the land of Gilead, and said to them,

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: This is what all the meeting of the people of the Lord has said, What is this wrong which you have done against the God of Israel, turning back this day from the Lord and building an altar for yourselves, and being false to the Lord?

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: Was not the sin of Baal-peor great enough, from which we are not clear even to this day, though punishment came on the people of the Lord,

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: That now you are turned back from the Lord? and, because you are false to him today, tomorrow his wrath will be let loose on all the people of Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: But if the land you now have is unclean, come over into the Lord's land where his House is, and take up your heritage among us: but do not be false to the Lord and to us by building yourselves an altar in addition to the altar of the Lord our God.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: Did not Achan, the son of Zerah, do wrong about the cursed thing, causing wrath to come on all the people of Israel? And not on him only came the punishment of death.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: Then the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh said in answer to the heads of the families of Israel,

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: God, even God the Lord, God, even God the Lord, he sees, and Israel will see--if it is in pride or in sin against the Lord,

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: That we have made ourselves an altar, being false to the Lord, keep us not safe from death this day; and if for the purpose of offering burned offerings on it and meal offerings, or peace-offerings, let the Lord himself send punishment for it;

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: And if we have not, in fact, done this designedly and with purpose, having in our minds the fear that in time to come your children might say to our children, What have you to do with the Lord, the God of Israel?

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 25
text: For the Lord has made Jordan a line of division between us and you, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad; you have no part in the Lord: so your children will make our children give up fearing the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 26
text: So we said, Let us now make an altar for ourselves, not for burned offerings or for the offerings of beasts:

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 27
text: But to be a witness between us and you, and between the future generations, that we have the right of worshipping the Lord with our burned offerings and our offerings of beasts and our peace-offerings; so that your children will not be able to say to our children in time to come, You have no part in the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 28
text: For we said to ourselves, If they say this to us or to future generations, then we will say, See this copy of the Lord's altar which our fathers made, not for burned offerings or offerings of beasts, but for a witness between us and you.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 29
text: Never let it be said that we were false to the Lord, turning back this day from him and building an altar for burned offerings and meal offerings and offerings of beasts, in addition to the altar of the Lord our God which is before his House.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 30
text: Then Phinehas the priest and the chiefs of the meeting and the heads of the families of Israel who were with him, hearing what the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the children of Manasseh said, were pleased.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 31
text: And Phinehas, the son of Eleazar the priest, said to the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the children of Manasseh, Now we are certain that the Lord is among us, because you have not done this wrong against the Lord: and you have kept us from falling into the hands of the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 32
text: Then Phinehas, the son of Eleazar the priest, and the chiefs went back from the land of Gilead, from the children of Reuben and the children of Gad, and came to the children of Israel in Canaan and gave them the news.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 33
text: And the children of Israel were pleased about this; and they gave praise to God, and had no more thought of going to war against the children of Reuben and the children of Gad for the destruction of their land.

title: Joshua Chapter 22 Verse 34
text: And the children of Reuben and the children of Gad gave to that altar the name of Ed. For, they said, It is a witness between us that the Lord is God.

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: Now after a long time, when the Lord had given Israel rest from wars on every side, and Joshua was old and full of years,

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: Joshua sent for all Israel, for their responsible men and their chiefs and their judges and their overseers, and said to them, I am old, and full of years:

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: You have seen everything the Lord your God has done to all these nations because of you; for it is the Lord your God who has been fighting for you.

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: Now I have given to you, as the heritage of your tribes, all these nations which are still in the land, together with those cut off by me, from Jordan as far as the Great Sea on the west.

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: The Lord your God will send them away by force, driving them out before you; and you are to take their land for your heritage, as the Lord your God said to you.

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: So be very strong to keep and do whatever is recorded in the book of the law of Moses, not turning away from it to the right or to the left;

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: Have nothing to do with these nations who still are living among you; let not their gods be named by you or used in your oaths; do not be their servants or give them worship:

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: But be true to the Lord your God as you have been till this day.

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: For the Lord has sent out from before you nations great and strong: and they have all given way before you till this day.

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: One man of you is able to put to flight a thousand; for it is the Lord your God who is fighting for you, as he has said to you.

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: So keep watch on yourselves, and see that you have love for the Lord your God.

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: For if you go back, joining yourselves to the rest of these nations who are still among you, getting married to them and living with them and they with you:

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: Then you may be certain that the Lord your God will not go on driving these nations out from before you; but they will become a danger and a cause of sin to you, a whip for your sides and thorns in your eyes, till you are cut off from this good land which the Lord your God has given you.

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 14
text: Now I am about to go the way of all the earth: and you have seen and are certain, all of you, in your hearts and souls, that in all the good things which the Lord said about you, he has kept faith with you; everything has come true for you.

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: And you will see that, as all the good things which the Lord your God undertook to do for you, have come to you, so the Lord will send down on you all the evil things till he has made your destruction complete, and you are cut off from the good land which the Lord your God has given you.

title: Joshua Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: If the agreement of the Lord your God, which was given to you by his orders, is broken, and you become the servants of other gods and give them worship, then the wrath of the Lord will be burning against you, and you will quickly be cut off from the good land which he has given you.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: Then Joshua got all the tribes of Israel together at Shechem; and he sent for the responsible men of Israel and their chiefs and their judges and their overseers; and they took their place before God.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: And Joshua said to all the people, These are the words of the Lord, the God of Israel: In the past your fathers, Terah, the father of Abraham, and the father of Nahor, were living on the other side of the River: and they were worshipping other gods.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: And I took your father Abraham from the other side of the River, guiding him through all the land of Canaan; I made his offspring great in number, and gave him Isaac.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: And to Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau: to Esau I gave Mount Seir, as his heritage; but Jacob and his children went down to Egypt.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: And I sent Moses and Aaron, troubling Egypt by all the signs I did among them: and after that I took you out.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: I took your fathers out of Egypt: and you came to the Red Sea; and the Egyptians came after your fathers to the Red Sea, with their war-carriages and their horsemen.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: And at their cry, the Lord made it dark between you and the Egyptians, and made the sea go over them, covering them with its waters; your eyes have seen what I did in Egypt: then for a long time you were living in the waste land.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: And I took you into the lands of the Amorites on the other side of Jordan; and they made war on you, and I gave them into your hands and you took their land; and I sent destruction on them before you.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: Then Balak, the son of Zippor, king of Moab, went up to war against Israel; and he sent for Balaam, the son of Beor, to put a curse on you:

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: But I did not give ear to Balaam; and so he went on blessing you; and I kept you safe from him.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: Then you went over Jordan and came to Jericho: and the men of Jericho made war on you, the Amorites and the Perizzites and the Canaanites and the Hittites and the Girgashites and the Hivites and the Jebusites: and I gave them up into your hands.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: And I sent the hornet before you, driving out the two kings of the Amorites before you, not with your sword and your bow.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: And I gave you a land on which you had done no work, and towns not of your building, and you are now living in them; and your food comes from vine-gardens and olive-gardens not of your planting.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: So now, go in fear of the Lord, and be his servants with true hearts: put away the gods worshipped by your fathers across the River and in Egypt, and be servants of the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: And if it seems evil to you to be the servants of the Lord, make the decision this day whose servants you will be: of the gods whose servants your fathers were across the River, or of the gods of the Amorites in whose land you are living: but I and my house will be the servants of the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: Then the people in answer said, Never will we give up the Lord to be the servants of other gods;

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: For it is the Lord our God who has taken us and our fathers out of the land of Egypt, out of the prison-house, and who did all those great signs before our eyes, and kept us safe on all our journeys, and among all the peoples through whom we went:

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: And the Lord sent out from before us all the peoples, the Amorites living in the land: so we will be the servants of the Lord, for he is our God.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 19
text: And Joshua said to the people, You are not able to be the servants of the Lord, for he is a holy God, a God who will not let his honour be given to another: he will have no mercy on your wrongdoing or your sins.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 20
text: If you are turned away from the Lord and become the servants of strange gods, then turning against you he will do you evil, cutting you off, after he has done you good.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 21
text: And the people said to Joshua, No! But we will be the servants of the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 22
text: And Joshua said to the people, You are witnesses against yourselves that you have made the decision to be the servants of the Lord. And they said, We are witnesses.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 23
text: Then, he said, put away the strange gods among you, turning your hearts to the Lord, the God of Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 24
text: And the people said to Joshua, We will be the servants of the Lord our God, and we will give ear to his voice.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 25
text: So Joshua made an agreement with the people that day, and gave them a rule and a law in Shechem.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 26
text: And Joshua put these words on record, writing them in the book of the law of God; and he took a great stone, and put it up there under the oak-tree which was in the holy place of the Lord.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 27
text: And Joshua said to all the people, See now, this stone is to be a witness against us; for all the words of the Lord have been said to us in its hearing: so it will be a witness against you if you are false to the Lord your God.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 28
text: Then Joshua let the people go away, every man to his heritage.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 29
text: Now after these things, the death of Joshua, the son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, took place, he being then a hundred and ten years old.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 30
text: And they put his body in the earth in the land of his heritage in Timnath-serah, in the hill-country of Ephraim, to the north of Mount Gaash.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 31
text: And Israel was true to the Lord all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the older men who were still living after Joshua's death, and had seen what the Lord had done for Israel.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 32
text: And the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel had taken up from Egypt, they put in the earth in Shechem, in the property which Jacob had got from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem, for a hundred shekels: and they became the heritage of the children of Joseph.

title: Joshua Chapter 24 Verse 33
text: Then the death of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, took place; and his body was put in the earth in the hill of Phinehas his son, which had been given to him in the hill-country of Ephraim.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Now after the death of Joshua, the children of Israel made request to the Lord, saying, Who is to go up first to make war for us against the Canaanites?

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: And the Lord said, Judah is to go up: see, I have given the land into his hands.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Then Judah said to Simeon his brother, Come up with me into my heritage, so that we may make war against the Canaanites; and I will then go with you into your heritage. So Simeon went with him.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And Judah went up; and the Lord gave the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hands; and they overcame ten thousand of them in Bezek.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And they came across Adoni-zedek, and made war on him; and they overcame the Canaanites and the Perizzites.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: But Adoni-zedek went in flight; and they went after him and overtook him, and had his thumbs and his great toes cut off.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And Adoni-zedek said, Seventy kings, whose thumbs and great toes had been cut off, got broken meat under my table: as I have done, so has God done to me in full. And they took him to Jerusalem, and he came to his end there.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Then the children of Judah made an attack on Jerusalem, and took it, burning down the town after they had put its people to the sword without mercy.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: After that the children of Judah went down to make war on the Canaanites living in the hill-country and in the south and in the lowlands.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And Caleb went against the Canaanites of Hebron: (now in earlier times Hebron was named Kiriath-arba:) and he put Sheshai and Ahiman and Talmai to the sword.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And from there he went up against the people of Debir. (Now the name of Debir in earlier times was Kiriath-sepher.)

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And Caleb said, I will give Achsah, my daughter, as wife to the man who overcomes Kiriath-sepher and takes it.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And Othniel, the son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother, took it; so he gave him his daughter Achsah for his wife.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: Now when she came to him, he put into her mind the idea of requesting a field from her father: and she got down from her ass; and Caleb said to her, What is it?

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And she said to him, Give me a blessing; because you have put me in a dry south-land, now give me springs of water. So Caleb gave her the higher spring and the lower spring.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: Now Hobab the Kenite, Moses' father-in-law, had come up out of the town of palm-trees, with the children of Judah, into the waste land of Arad; and he went and was living among the Amalekites;

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And Judah went with Simeon, his brother, and overcame the Canaanites living in Zephath, and put it under the curse; and he gave the town the name of Hormah.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: Then Judah took Gaza and its limit, and Ashkelon and its limit, and Ekron and its limit.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And the Lord was with Judah; and he took the hill-country for his heritage; but he was unable to make the people of the valley go out, for they had war-carriages of iron.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: And they gave Hebron to Caleb, as Moses had said; and he took the land of the three sons of Anak, driving them out from there.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: And the children of Judah did not make the Jebusites who were living in Jerusalem go out; the Jebusites are still living with the children of Benjamin in Jerusalem.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And the family of Joseph went up against Beth-el, and the Lord was with them.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: So they sent men to make a search round Beth-el. (Now the name of the town in earlier times was Luz.)

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: And the watchers saw a man coming out of the town, and said to him, If you will make clear to us the way into the town, we will be kind to you.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: So he made clear to them the way into the town, and they put it to the sword; but they let the man and all his family get away safe.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: And he went into the land of the Hittites, building a town there and naming it Luz: which is its name to this day.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: And Manasseh did not take away the land of the people of Beth-shean and its daughter-towns, or of Taanach and its daughter-towns, or of the people of Dor and its daughter-towns, or of the people of Ibleam and its daughter-towns, or of the people of Megiddo and its daughter-towns, driving them out; but the Canaanites would go on living in that land.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 28
text: And whenever Israel became strong, they put the Canaanites to forced work, without driving them out completely.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 29
text: And Ephraim did not make the Canaanites who were living in Gezer go out; but the Canaanites went on living in Gezer among them.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 30
text: Zebulun did not make the people of Kitron or the people of Nahalol go out; but the Canaanites went on living among them and were put to forced work.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 31
text: And Asher did not take the land of the people of Acco, or Zidon, or Ahlab, or Achzib, or Helbah, or Aphik, or Rehob, driving them out;

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 32
text: But the Asherites went on living among the Canaanites, the people of the land, without driving them out.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 33
text: Naphtali did not take the land of the people of Beth-shemesh or of Beth-anath, driving them out; but he was living among the Canaanites in the land; however, the people of Beth-shemesh and Beth-anath were put to forced work.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 34
text: And the children of Dan were forced into the hill-country by the Amorites, who would not let them come down into the valley;

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 35
text: For the Amorites would go on living in Mount Heres, in Aijalon, and in Shaalbim; but the children of Joseph became stronger than they, and put them to forced work.

title: Judges Chapter 1 Verse 36
text: And the limit of the Edomites went from the slope of Akrabbim from Sela and up.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Now the angel of the Lord came up from Gilgal to Bochim. And he said, *** I took you out of Egypt, guiding you into the land which I gave by an oath to your fathers; and I said, My agreement with you will never be broken by me:

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And you are to make no agreement with the people of this land; you are to see that their altars are broken down: but you have not given ear to my voice: what have you done?

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And so I have said, I will not send them out from before you; but they will be a danger to you, and their gods will be a cause of falling to you.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: Now on hearing these words which the angel of the Lord said to all the children of Israel, the people gave themselves up to loud crying and weeping.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: And they gave that place the name of Bochim, and made offerings there to the Lord.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: And Joshua let the people go away, and the children of Israel went, every man to his heritage, to take the land for themselves.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And the people were true to the Lord all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the responsible men who were still living after the death of Joshua, and had seen all the great work of the Lord which he had done for Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And death came to Joshua, the son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, he being a hundred and ten years old.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And they put his body in the earth in the land of his heritage in Timnath-heres, in the hill-country of Ephraim to the north of Mount Gaash.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And in time death overtook all that generation; and another generation came after them, having no knowledge of the Lord or of the things which he had done for Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And the children of Israel did evil in the eyes of the Lord and became servants to the Baals;

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And they gave up the Lord, the God of their fathers, who had taken them out of the land of Egypt, and went after other gods, the gods of the peoples round about them, worshipping them and moving the Lord to wrath.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And they gave up the Lord, and became the servants of Baal and the Astartes.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And the wrath of the Lord was burning against Israel, and he gave them up into the hands of those who violently took their property, and into the hands of their haters all round them, so that they were forced to give way before them.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: Wherever they went out, the hand of the Lord was against them for evil, as the Lord had taken his oath it would be; and things became very hard for them.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: Then the Lord gave them judges, as their saviours from the hands of those who were cruel to them.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: But still they would not give ear to their judges, but went after other gods and gave them worship; quickly turning from the way in which their fathers had gone, keeping the orders of the Lord; but they did not do so.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And whenever the Lord gave them judges, then the Lord was with the judge, and was their saviour from the hands of their haters all the days of the judge; for the Lord was moved by their cries of grief because of those who were cruel to them.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: But whenever the judge was dead, they went back and did more evil than their fathers, going after other gods, to be their servants and their worshippers; giving up nothing of their sins and their hard-hearted ways.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: And the wrath of the Lord was burning against Israel, and he said, Because this nation has not been true to my agreement which I made with their fathers, and has not given ear to my voice;

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: From now on I will not go on driving out from before them any of the nations which at the death of Joshua were still living in this land;

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: In order to put Israel to the test, and see if they will keep the way of the Lord, walking in it as their fathers did, or not.

title: Judges Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: So the Lord let those nations go on living in the land, not driving them out quickly, and did not give them up into the hands of Joshua.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Now these are the nations which the Lord kept in the land for the purpose of testing Israel by them, all those who had had no experience of all the wars of Canaan;

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: Only because of the generations of the children of Israel, for the purpose of teaching them war--only those who up till then had no experience of it;

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: The five chiefs of the Philistines, and all the Canaanites and the Zidonians and the Hivites living in Mount Lebanon, from the mountain Baal-hermon as far as Hamath:

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: For the purpose of testing Israel by them, to see if they would give ear to the orders of the Lord, which he had given to their fathers by the hand of Moses.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: Now the children of Israel were living among the Canaanites, the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites:

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And they took as wives the daughters of these nations and gave their daughters to their sons, and became servants to their gods.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And the children of Israel did evil in the eyes of the Lord, and put out of their minds the Lord their God, and became servants to the Baals and the Astartes.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: So the wrath of the Lord was burning against Israel, and he gave them up into the hands of Cushan-rishathaim, king of Mesopotamia; and the children of Israel were his servants for eight years.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: And when the children of Israel made prayer to the Lord, he gave them a saviour, Othniel, the son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And the spirit of the Lord came on him and he became judge of Israel, and went out to war, and the Lord gave up Cushan-rishathaim, king of Mesopotamia, into his hands and he overcame him.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Then for forty years the land had peace, till the death of Othniel, the son of Kenaz.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Then the children of Israel again did evil in the eyes of the Lord; and the Lord made Eglon, king of Moab, strong against Israel, because they had done evil in the Lord's eyes.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And Eglon got together the people of Ammon and Amalek, and they went and overcame Israel and took the town of palm-trees.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And the children of Israel were servants to Eglon, king of Moab, for eighteen years.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: Then when the children of Israel made prayer to the Lord, he gave them a saviour, Ehud, the son of Gera, the Benjamite, a left-handed man; and the children of Israel sent an offering by him to Eglon, king of Moab.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: So Ehud made himself a two-edged sword, a cubit long, which he put on at his right side under his robe.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And he took the offering to Eglon, king of Moab, who was a very fat man.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: And after giving the offering, he sent away the people who had come with the offering.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: But he himself, turning back from the stone images at Gilgal, said, I have something to say to you in secret, O king. And he said, Let there be quiet. Then all those who were waiting before him went out.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: Then Ehud came in to him while he was seated by himself in his summer-house. And Ehud said, I have a word from God for you. And he got up from his seat.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: And Ehud put out his left hand, and took the sword from his right side, and sent it into his stomach;

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: And the hand-part went in after the blade, and the fat was joined up over the blade; for he did not take the sword out of his stomach. And he went out into the ...

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: Then Ehud went out into the covered way, shutting the doors of the summer-house on him and locking them.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: Now when he had gone, the king's servants came, and saw that the doors of the summer-house were locked; and they said, It may be that he is in his summer-house for a private purpose.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: And they went on waiting till they were shamed, but the doors were still shut; so they took the key, and, opening them, saw their lord stretched out dead on the floor.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: But Ehud had got away while they were waiting and had gone past the stone images and got away to Seirah.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 27
text: And when he came there, he had a horn sounded in the hill-country of Ephraim, and all the children of Israel went down with him from the hill-country, and he at their head.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 28
text: And he said to them, Come after me; for the Lord has given the Moabites, your haters, into your hands. So they went down after him and took the crossing-places of Jordan against Moab, and let no one go across.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 29
text: At that time they put about ten thousand men of Moab to the sword, every strong man and every man of war; not a man got away.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 30
text: So Moab was broken that day under the hand of Israel. And for eighty years the land had peace.

title: Judges Chapter 3 Verse 31
text: And after him came Shamgar, the son of Anath, who put to death six hundred Philistines with an ox-stick; and he was another saviour of Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And the children of Israel again did evil in the eyes of the Lord when Ehud was dead.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And the Lord gave them up into the hands of Jabin, king of Canaan, who was ruling in Hazor; the captain of his army was Sisera, who was living in Harosheth of the Gentiles.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: Then the children of Israel made prayer to the Lord; for he had nine hundred iron war-carriages, and for twenty years he was very cruel to the children of Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Now Deborah, a woman prophet, the wife of Lapidoth, was judge of Israel at that time.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: (And she had her seat under the palm-tree of Deborah between Ramah and Beth-el in the hill-country of Ephraim; and the children of Israel came up to her to be judged.)

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And she sent for Barak, the son of Abinoam, from Kedesh-naphtali, and said to him, Has not the Lord, the God of Israel, given orders saying, Go and get your force into line in Mount Tabor, and take with you ten thousand men of the children of Naphtali and of the children of Zebulun?

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And I will make Sisera, the captain of Jabin's army, with his war-carriages and his forces, come against you at the river Kishon, where I will give him into your hands.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And Barak said to her, If you will go with me then I will go; but if you will not go with me I will not go.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And she said, I will certainly go with you: though you will get no honour in your undertaking, for the Lord will give Sisera into the hands of a woman. So Deborah got up and went with Barak to Kedesh.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: Then Barak sent for Zebulun and Naphtali to come to Kedesh; and ten thousand men went up after him, and Deborah went up with him.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: Now Heber the Kenite, separating himself from the rest of the Kenites, from the children of Hobab, the brother-in-law of Moses, had put up his tent as far away as the oak-tree in Zaanannim, by Kedesh.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And word was given to Sisera that Barak, the son of Abinoam, had gone up to Mount Tabor.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: So Sisera got together all his war-carriages, nine hundred war-carriages of iron, and all the people who were with him, from Harosheth of the Gentiles as far as the river Kishon.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: Then Deborah said to Barak, Up! for today the Lord has given Sisera into your hands: has not the Lord gone out before you? So Barak went down from Mount Tabor and ten thousand men after him.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: And the Lord sent fear on Sisera and all his war-carriages and all his army before Barak; and Sisera got down from his war-carriage and went in flight on foot.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: But Barak went after the war-carriages and the army as far as Harosheth of the Gentiles; and all Sisera's army was put to the sword; not a man got away.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: But Sisera went in flight on foot to the tent of Jael, the wife of Heber the Kenite; for there was peace between Jabin, king of Hazor, and the family of Heber the Kenite.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: And Jael went out to Sisera, and said to him, Come in, my lord, come in to me without fear. So he went into her tent, and she put a cover over him.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: Then he said to her, Give me now a little water, for I have need of a drink. And opening a skin of milk, she gave him drink, and put the cover over him again.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: And he said to her, Take your place at the door of the tent, and if anyone comes and says to you, Is there any man here, say, No.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: Then Jael, Heber's wife, took a tent-pin and a hammer and went up to him quietly, driving the pin into his head, and it went through his head into the earth, for he was in a deep sleep from weariness; and so he came to his end.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: Then Jael went out, and meeting Barak going after Sisera, said to him, Come, and I will let you see the man you are searching for. So he came into her tent and saw, and there was Sisera stretched out dead with the tent-pin in his head.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: So that day God overcame Jabin, king of Canaan, before the children of Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: And the power of the children of Israel went on increasing against Jabin, king of Canaan, till he was cut off.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: At that time Deborah and Barak, the son of Abinoam, made this song, saying:

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: Because of the flowing hair of the fighters in Israel, because the people gave themselves freely, give praise to the Lord.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: Give attention, O kings; give ear, O rulers; I, even I, will make a song to the Lord; I will make melody to the Lord, the God of Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: Lord, when you went out from Seir, moving like an army from the field of Edom, the earth was shaking and the heavens were troubled, and the clouds were dropping water.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: The mountains were shaking before the Lord, before the Lord, the God of Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: In the days of Shamgar, the son of Anath, in the days of Jael, the highways were not used, and travellers went by side roads.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: Country towns were no more in Israel, *** were no more, till you, Deborah, came up, till you came up as a mother in Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: They had no one to make arms, there were no more armed men in the towns; was there a body-cover or a spear to be seen among forty thousand in Israel?

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: Come, you rulers of Israel, you who gave yourselves freely among the people: give praise to the Lord.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: Let them give thought to it, who go on white asses, and those who are walking on the road.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: Give ear to the women laughing by the water-springs; there they will give again the story of the upright acts of the Lord, all the upright acts of his arm in Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: Awake! awake! Deborah: awake! awake! give a song: Up! Barak, and take prisoner those who took you prisoner, O son of Abinoam.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: Then the chiefs went down to the doors; the Lord's people went down among the strong ones.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: Out of Ephraim they came down into the valley; after you, Benjamin, among your tribesmen; from Machir came down the captains, and from Zebulun those in whose hand is the ruler's rod.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: Your chiefs, Issachar, were with Deborah; and Naphtali was true to Barak; into the valley they went rushing out at his feet. In Reuben there were divisions, and great searchings of heart.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: Why did you keep quiet among the sheep, hearing nothing but the watchers piping to the flocks?

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: Gilead was living over Jordan; and Dan was waiting in his ships; Asher kept in his place by the sea's edge, living by his inlets.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: It was the people of Zebulun who put their lives in danger, even to death, with Naphtali on the high places of the field.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: The kings came on to the fight, the kings of Canaan were warring; in Taanach by the waters of Megiddo: they took no profit in money.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: The stars from heaven were fighting; from their highways they were fighting against Sisera.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: The river Kishon took them violently away, stopping their flight, the river Kishon. Give praise, O my soul, to the strength of the Lord!

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: Then loudly the feet of the horses were sounding with the stamping, the stamping of their war-horses.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: A curse, a curse on Meroz! said the angel of the Lord. A bitter curse on her townspeople! Because they came not to the help of the Lord, to the help of the Lord among the strong ones.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: Blessings be on Jael, more than on all women! Blessings greater than on any in the tents!

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: His request was for water, she gave him milk; she put butter before him on a fair plate.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: She put out her hand to the tent-pin, and her right hand to the workman's hammer; and she gave Sisera a blow, crushing his head, wounding and driving through his brow.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: Bent at her feet he went down, he was stretched out; bent at her feet he went down; where he was bent down, there he went down in death.

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 28
text: Looking out from the window she gave a cry, the mother of Sisera was crying out through the window, Why is his carriage so long in coming? When will the noise of his wheels be sounding?

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 29
text: Her wise women gave answer to her, yes, she made answer again to herself,

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 30
text: Are they not getting, are they not parting the goods among them: a young girl or two to every man; and to Sisera robes of coloured needlework, worked in fair colours on this side and on that, for the neck of the queen?

title: Judges Chapter 5 Verse 31
text: So may destruction come on all your haters, O Lord; but let your lovers be like the sun going out in his strength. And for forty years the land had peace.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: And the children of Israel did evil in the eyes of the Lord; and the Lord gave them up into the hand of Midian for seven years.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: And Midian was stronger than Israel; and because of the Midianites, the children of Israel made holes for themselves in the mountains, and hollows in the rocks, and strong places.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: And whenever Israel's grain was planted, the Midianites and the Amalekites and the people of the east came up against them;

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: And put their army in position against them; and they took all the produce of the earth as far as Gaza, till there was no food in Israel, or any sheep or oxen or asses.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: For they came up regularly with their oxen and their tents; they came like the locusts in number; they and their camels were without number; and they came into the land for its destruction.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: And Israel was in great need because of Midian; and the cry of the children of Israel went up to the Lord.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And when the cry of the children of Israel, because of Midian, came before the Lord,

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: The Lord sent a prophet to the children of Israel, who said to them, The Lord the God of Israel, has said, I took you up from Egypt, out of the prison-house;

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: And I took you out of the hands of the Egyptians and out of the hands of all who were cruel to you, and I sent them out by force from before you and gave you their land;

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And I said to you, I am the Lord your God; you are not to give worship to the gods of the Amorites in whose land you are living, but you did not give ear to my voice.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: Now the angel of the Lord came and took his seat under the oak-tree in Ophrah, in the field of Joash the Abiezrite; and his son Gideon was crushing grain in the place where the grapes were crushed, so that the Midianites might not see it.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And the angel of the Lord came before his eyes, and said to him, The Lord is with you, O man of war.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: Then Gideon said to him, O my lord, if the Lord is with us why has all this come on us? And where are all his works of power, of which our fathers have given us word, saying, Did not the Lord take us out of Egypt? But now he has given us up, handing us over to the power of Midian.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: And the Lord, turning to him, said, Go in the strength you have and be Israel's saviour from Midian: have I not sent you?

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: And he said to him, O Lord, how may I be the saviour of Israel? See, my family is the poorest in Manasseh, and I am the least in my father's house.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: Then the Lord said to him, Truly, I will be with you, and you will overcome the Midianites as if they were one man.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: So he said to him, If now I have grace in your eyes, then give me a sign that it is you who are talking to me.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: Do not go away till I come with my offering and put it before you. And he said, I will not go away before you come back.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: Then Gideon went in and made ready a young goat, and with an ephah of meal he made unleavened cakes: he put the meat in a basket and the soup in which it had been cooked he put in a pot, and he took it out to him under the oak-tree and gave it to him there.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: And the angel of God said to him, Take the meat and the unleavened cakes and put them down on the rock over there, draining out the soup over them. And he did so.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: Then the angel of the Lord put out the stick which was in his hand, touching the meat and the cakes with the end of it; and a flame came up out of the rock, burning up the meat and the cakes: and the angel of the Lord was seen no longer.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: Then Gideon was certain that he was the angel of the Lord; and Gideon said, I am in fear, O Lord God! for I have seen the angel of the Lord face to face.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: But the Lord said to him, Peace be with you; have no fear: you are in no danger of death.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: Then Gideon made an altar there to the Lord, and gave it the name Yahweh-shalom; to this day it is in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: The same night the Lord said to him, Take ten men of your servants and an ox seven years old, and after pulling down the altar of Baal which is your father's, and cutting down the holy tree by its side,

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: Make an altar to the Lord your God on the top of this rock, in the ordered way and take the ox and make a burned offering with the wood of the holy tree which has been cut down.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: Then Gideon took ten of his servants and did as the Lord had said to him; but fearing to do it by day, because of his father's people and the men of the town, he did it by night.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 28
text: And the men of the town got up early in the morning, and they saw the altar of Baal broken down, and the holy tree which was by it cut down, and the ox offered on the altar which had been put up there.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 29
text: And they said to one another, Who has done this thing? And after searching with care, they said, Gideon, the son of Joash, has done this thing.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 30
text: Then the men of the town said to Joash, Make your son come out to be put to death, for pulling down the altar of Baal and cutting down the holy tree which was by it.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 31
text: But Joash said to all those who were attacking him, Will you take up the cause of Baal? will you be his saviour? Let anyone who will take up his cause be put to death while it is still morning: if he is a god, let him take up his cause himself because of the pulling down of his altar.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 32
text: So that day he gave him the name of Jerubbaal, saying, Let Baal take up his cause against him because his altar has been broken down.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 33
text: Then all the Midianites and the Amalekites and the people of the east, banding themselves together, went over and put up their tents in the valley of Jezreel.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 34
text: But the spirit of the Lord came on Gideon; and at the sound of his horn all Abiezer came together after him.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 35
text: And he sent through all Manasseh, and they came after him; and he sent to Asher and Zebulun and Naphtali, and they came up and were joined to the others.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 36
text: Then Gideon said to God, If you are going to give Israel salvation by my hand, as you have said,

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 37
text: See, I will put the wool of a sheep on the grain-floor; if there is dew on the wool only, while all the earth is dry, then I will be certain that it is your purpose to give Israel salvation by my hand as you have said.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 38
text: And it was so: for he got up early on the morning after, and twisting the wool in his hands, he got a basin full of water from the dew on the wool.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 39
text: Then Gideon said to God, Do not be moved to wrath against me if I say only this: let me make one more test with the wool; let the wool now be dry, while the earth is covered with dew.

title: Judges Chapter 6 Verse 40
text: And that night God did so; for the wool was dry, and there was dew on all the earth round it.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: Then Jerubbaal, that is, Gideon, and all the people with him, got up early and put up their tents by the side of the water-spring of Harod; the tents of Midian were on the north side of him, under the hill of Moreh in the valley.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And the Lord said to Gideon, So great is the number of your people, that if I give the Midianites into their hands they will be uplifted in pride over me and will say, I myself have been my saviour.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: So now, let it be given out to the people that anyone who is shaking with fear is to go back from Mount Galud. So twenty-two thousand of the people went back, but there were still ten thousand.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: Then the Lord said to Gideon, There are still more people than is necessary; take them down to the water so that I may put them to the test for you there; then whoever I say is to go with you will go, and whoever I say is not to go will not go.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: So he took the people down to the water; and the Lord said to Gideon, Put on one side by themselves all those drinking up the water with their tongues like a dog; and in the same way, all those who go down on their knees to the water while drinking.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: Now the number of those who took up the water with their tongues was three hundred; all the rest of the people went down on their knees to the water.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: And the Lord said to Gideon, By those three hundred who were drinking with their tongues I will give you salvation and give the Midianites into your hands; let the rest of the people go away, every man to his place.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: So they took the vessels of the people, and their horns from their hands, and he sent them away, every man to his tent, keeping only the three hundred; and the tents of Midian were lower down in the valley.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: The same night the Lord said to him, Up! go down now against their army, for I have given them into your hands.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: But if you have fear of going down, take your servant Purah with you and go down to the tents;

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: And after hearing what they are saying, you will get strength to go down against the army. So he went down with his servant Purah to the outer line of the tents of the armed men.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: Now the Midianites and the Amalekites and all the people of the east were covering the valley like locusts; and their camels were like the sand by the seaside, without number.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: When Gideon came there, a man was giving his friend an account of his dream, saying, See, I had a dream about a cake of barley bread which, falling into the tents of Midian, came on to the tent, overturning it so that it was stretched out flat on the earth.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: And his friend in answer said, This is certainly the sword of Gideon, the son of Joash, the men of Israel: into their hands God has given up all the army of Midian.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: Then Gideon, hearing the story of the dream and the sense in which they took it, gave worship; then he went back to the tents of Israel, and said, Up! for the Lord has given the army of Midian into your hands.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: Then separating the three hundred men into three bands, he gave every man a horn, and a vessel in which was a flaming branch.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: And he said to them, Keep your eyes on me, and do what I do; when I come to the outer line of tents, whatever I do, you are to do the same.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: At the sound of my horn, and the horns of those who are with me, let your horns be sounded all round the tents, and say, For the Lord and for Gideon.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: So Gideon and the three hundred men who were with him came to the outer line of tents, at the start of the middle watch, when the watchmen had only then taken their stations; and the horns were sounded and the vessels broken.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: So the three bands all gave a loud note on their horns, and when the vessels had been broken, they took the flaming branches in their left hands, and the horns in their right hands ready for blowing, crying out, For the Lord and for Gideon.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: Then they made a line round the tents, every man in his place; and all the army, awaking from sleep, came running out, and with loud cries went in flight.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: And the three hundred gave a loud note on their horns, and every man's sword was turned by the Lord against his brother all through the army; and the army went in flight as far as Beth-shittah in the direction of Zeredah, to the edge of Abel-meholah by Tabbath.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: And the men of Israel came together from Naphtali and from Asher and all Manasseh, and went after Midian.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: Then Gideon sent through all the hill-country of Ephraim saying, Come down against Midian, and keep the ways across Jordan before they come. So all the men of Ephraim, massing themselves together, kept the ways across Jordan.

title: Judges Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: And they took the two chiefs of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb; and they put Oreb to death at the rock of Oreb, and Zeeb they put to death at the place of the grape-crushing in Zeeb, and they went after Midian; but the heads of Oreb and Zeeb they took across Jordan to Gideon.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And the men of Ephraim came and said to him, Why did you not send for us when you went to war against Midian? And they said sharp and angry words to him.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And he said to them, What have I done in comparison with you? Is not that which Ephraim took up after the grape-cutting better than all the grapes which Abiezer got in from the grape-cutting?

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: God has given into your hands the chiefs of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb; what have I been able to do in comparison with you? And when he said this, their feeling about him became kinder.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: Then Gideon came to Jordan and went over it with his three hundred, overcome with weariness and in need of food.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And he said to the men of Succoth, Give bread cakes to my people, for they are overcome with weariness, and I am going on after Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: But the chiefs of Succoth said, Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna even now in your hand that we are to give bread to your army?

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: Then Gideon said, Because of this, when the Lord has given Zebah and Zalmunna into my hands, I will have you stretched on a bed of thorns of the waste land and on sharp stems, and have you crushed as grain is crushed on a grain-floor.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: So he went up from there to Penuel and made the same request to the men of Penuel; but they gave him the same answer as the men of Succoth had given.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: So he said to the men of Penuel, When I come back in peace, I will have this tower broken down.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor and their armies with them, about fifteen thousand men, those of all the army of the children of the east who were still living; for a hundred and twenty thousand of their swordsmen had been put to death.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And Gideon went up by the way used by the people living in tents on the east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and made an attack on the army when they had no thought of danger.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And Zebah and Zalmunna went in flight; and he went after them, and took the two kings of Midian, Zebah and Zalmunna, and put all the army to the curse.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: Then Gideon, the son of Joash, went back from the fight:

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: And taking prisoner a young man of the people of Succoth, he got from him, in answer to his questions, a list of the chiefs of Succoth and the responsible men, seventy-seven men.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: So he came to the men of Succoth and said, Here are Zebah and Zalmunna, on account of whom you made sport of me, saying, Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna even now in your hand, that we are to give bread to your army who are overcome with weariness?

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: Then he took the responsible men of the town and had them crushed on a bed of thorns and sharp stems.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: And he had the tower of Penuel broken down and the men of the town put to death.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: Then he said to Zebah and Zalmunna, Where are the men whom you put to death at Tabor? And they gave answer, As you are, so were they; every one of them was like a king's son.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: And he said, They were my brothers, my mother's sons: by the life of the Lord, if you had kept them safe, I would not put you to death.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: Then he said to Jether, his oldest son, Up! Put them to death. But the boy did not take out his sword, fearing because he was still a boy.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, Up! Put an end to us yourself: for you have a man's strength. Then Gideon got up and put Zebah and Zalmunna to death and took the ornaments which were on their camels' necks.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: Then the men of Israel said to Gideon, Be our ruler, you and your son and your son's son after him; for you have been our saviour from the hands of Midian.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: But Gideon said to them, I will not be a ruler over you, and my son will not be a ruler over you: it is the Lord who will be ruler over you.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: Then Gideon said to them, I have a request to make to you; let every man give me the ear-rings he has taken. (For they had gold ear-rings, because they were Ishmaelites.)

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: And they gave answer, We will gladly give them. So they put down a robe, every man dropping into it the ear-rings he had taken.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: The weight of the gold ear-rings which he got from them was one thousand, seven hundred shekels of gold; in addition to the moon-ornaments and jewels and the purple robes which were on the kings of Midian, and the chains on their camels' necks.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: And Gideon made an ephod from them and put it up in his town Ophrah; and all Israel went after it there and were false to the Lord; and it became a cause of sin to Gideon and his house.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: So Midian was broken before the children of Israel and the Midianites never got back their strength. And the land had peace for forty years, in the days of Gideon.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: And Jerubbaal, the son of Joash, went back to his house and was living there.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 30
text: Gideon had seventy sons, the offspring of his body; for he had a number of wives.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 31
text: And the servant-wife he had in Shechem had a son by him, to whom he gave the name Abimelech.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 32
text: And Gideon, the son of Joash, came to his end when he was very old, and his body was put in the resting-place of Joash his father, in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 33
text: And after the death of Gideon, the children of Israel again went after the gods of Canaan and were false to the Lord, and made Baal-berith their god.

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 34
text: And the children of Israel did not keep in their minds the Lord their God, who had been their saviour from all their haters on every side;

title: Judges Chapter 8 Verse 35
text: And they were not kind to the house of Jerubbaal, that is, Gideon, in reward for all the good he had done to Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: Now Abimelech, the son of Jerubbaal, went to Shechem to his mother's family, and said to them and to all the family of his mother's father,

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: Say now in the ears of all the townsmen of Shechem, Is it better for you to be ruled by all the seventy sons of Jerubbaal or by one man only? And keep in mind that I am your bone and your flesh.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: So his mother's family said all this about him in the ears of all the townsmen of Shechem: and their hearts were turned to Abimelech, for they said, He is our brother.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: And they gave him seventy shekels of silver from the house of Baal-berith, with which Abimelech got the support of a number of uncontrolled and good-for-nothing persons.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: Then he went to his father's house at Ophrah, and put his brothers, the seventy sons of Jerubbaal, to death on the same stone; however, Jotham, the youngest, kept himself safe by going away to a secret place.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: And all the townsmen of Shechem and all Beth-millo came together and went and made Abimelech their king, by the oak of the pillar in Shechem.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: Now Jotham, on hearing of it, went to the top of Mount Gerizim, and crying out with a loud voice said to them, Give ear to me, you townsmen of Shechem, so that God may give ear to you.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: One day the trees went out to make a king for themselves; and they said to the olive-tree, Be king over us.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: But the olive-tree said to them, Am I to give up my wealth of oil, by which men give honour to God, and go waving over the trees?

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: Then the trees said to the fig-tree, You come and be king over us.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: But the fig-tree said to them, Am I to give up my sweet taste and my good fruit and go waving over the trees?

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: Then the trees said to the vine, You come and be king over us.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: But the vine said to them, Am I to give up my wine, which makes glad God and men, to go waving over the trees?

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: Then all the trees said to the thorn, You come and be king over us.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: And the thorn said to the trees, If it is truly your desire to make me your king, then come and put your faith in my shade; and if not, may fire come out of the thorn, burning up the cedars of Lebanon.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: So now, if you have done truly and uprightly in making Abimelech king, and if you have done well to Jerubbaal and his house in reward for the work of his hands;

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: (For my father made war for you, and put his life in danger, and made you free from the hands of Midian;

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: And you have gone against my father's family this day, and have put to death his sons, even seventy men on one stone, and have made Abimelech, the son of his servant-wife, king over the townsmen of Shechem because he is your brother;)

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: If then you have done what is true and upright to Jerubbaal and his family this day, may you have joy in Abimelech, and may he have joy in you;

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: But if not, may fire come out from Abimelech, burning up the townsmen of Shechem and Beth-millo; and may fire come out from the townsmen of Shechem and Beth-millo, for the destruction of Abimelech.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: Then Jotham straight away went in flight to Beer, and was living there for fear of his brother Abimelech.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: So Abimelech was chief over Israel for three years.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: And God sent an evil spirit between Abimelech and the townsmen of Shechem; and the townsmen of Shechem were false to Abimelech;

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: So that punishment for the violent attack made on the seventy sons of Jerubbaal, and for their blood, might come on Abimelech, their brother, who put them to death, and on the townsmen of Shechem who gave him their help in putting his brothers to death.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: And the townsmen of Shechem put secret watchers on the tops of the mountains, and they made attacks on all who went by on the road and took their goods; and word of this came to Abimelech.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: Then Gaal, the son of Ebed, came with his brothers, and went over to Shechem; and the men of Shechem put their faith in him.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: And they went out into their fields and got in the fruit of their vines, and when the grapes had been crushed, they made a holy feast and went into the house of their god, and over their food and drink they were cursing Abimelech.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: And Gaal, the son of Ebed, said, Who is Abimelech and who is Shechem, that we are to be his servants? Is it not right for the son of Jerubbaal and Zebul his captain to be servants to the men of Hamor, the father of Shechem? But why are we to be his servants?

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 29
text: If only I had authority over this people! I would put Abimelech out of the way, and I would say to Abimelech, Make your army strong, and come out.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 30
text: Now Zebul, the ruler of the town, hearing what Gaal, the son of Ebed, had said, was moved to wrath.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 31
text: And he sent to Abimelech at Arumah, saying, See, Gaal, the son of Ebed, and his brothers have come to Shechem, and they are working up the town against you.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 32
text: So now, get up by night, you and your people, and keep watch in the field secretly;

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 33
text: And in the morning, when the sun is up, get up early and make a rush on the town; and when he and his people come out against you, do to them whatever you have a chance to do.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 34
text: So Abimelech and the people with him got up by night, in four bands, to make a surprise attack on Shechem.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 35
text: And Gaal, the son of Ebed, went out, and took his place at the doorway into the town; then Abimelech and his people got up from the place where they had been waiting.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 36
text: And when Gaal saw the people, he said to Zebul, See! people are coming down from the tops of the mountains. And Zebul said to him, You see the shade of the mountains like men.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 37
text: And Gaal said again, See! people are coming down from the middle of the land, and one band is coming by way of the oak-tree of the Seers.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 38
