text: Then Zebul said to him, Now where is your loud talk when you said, Who is Abimelech that we are to be his servants? Is this not the people whom you were rating so low? Go out now, and make war on them.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 39
text: So Gaal went out at the head of the townsmen of Shechem and made war on Abimelech.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 40
text: And Abimelech went after him and he went in flight before him; and a great number were falling by the sword all the way up to the town.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 41
text: Then Abimelech went back to Arumah; and Zebul sent Gaal and his brothers away and would not let them go on living in Shechem.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 42
text: Now the day after, the people went out into the fields; and news of it came to Abimelech.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 43
text: And he took his people, separating them into three bands, and was waiting secretly in the field; and when he saw the people coming out of the town, he went up and made an attack on them.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 44
text: And Abimelech with his band made a rush, and took up their position at the doorway into the town; and the other two bands made a rush on all those who were in the fields, and overcame them.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 45
text: And all that day Abimelech was fighting against the town; and he took it, and put to death the people who were in it, and had the town pulled down and covered with salt.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 46
text: Then all the townsmen of the tower of Shechem, hearing of it, went into the inner room of the house of El-berith.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 47
text: And word was given to Abimelech that all the men of the tower of Shechem were there together.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 48
text: Then Abimelech went up to Mount Zalmon, with all his people; and Abimelech took an axe in his hand and, cutting down branches of trees, took them and put them on his back. And he said to the people who were with him, Be quick and do as you have seen me do.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 49
text: So all the people got branches, every man cutting down a branch, and they went with Abimelech at their head and, massing the branches against the inner room, put fire to the room over them; so all those who were in the tower of Shechem, about a thousand men and women, were burned to death with it.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 50
text: Then Abimelech went to Thebez, and put his army in position against Thebez and took it.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 51
text: But in the middle of the town there was a strong tower, to which all the men and women of the town went in flight and, shutting themselves in, went up to the roof of the tower.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 52
text: And Abimelech came to the tower and made an attack on it, and got near to the door of the tower for the purpose of firing it.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 53
text: But a certain woman sent a great stone, such as is used for crushing grain, on to the head of Abimelech, cracking the bone.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 54
text: Then quickly crying out to his body-servant, he said to him, Take out your sword and put an end to me straight away, so that men may not say of me, His death was the work of a woman. So the young man put his sword through him, causing his death.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 55
text: And when the men of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead, they went away, every man to his place.

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 56
text: In this way Abimelech was rewarded by God for the evil he had done to his father in putting his seventy brothers to death;

title: Judges Chapter 9 Verse 57
text: And God sent back on to the heads of the men of Shechem all the evil they had done, and the curse of Jotham, the son of Jerubbaal, came on them.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Now after Abimelech, Tola, the son of Puah, the son of Dodo, a man of Issachar, became the saviour of Israel; he was living in Shamir in the hill-country of Ephraim.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: He was judge over Israel for twenty-three years; and at his death his body was put to rest in the earth in Shamir.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: And after him came Jair the Gileadite, who was judge over Israel for twenty-two years.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: And he had thirty sons, who went on thirty young asses; and they had thirty towns in the land of Gilead, which are named Havvoth-Jair to this day.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: And at the death of Jair his body was put to rest in the earth in Kamon.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: And again the children of Israel did evil in the eyes of the Lord, worshipping the Baals and Astartes, and the gods of Aram and the gods of Zidon and the gods of Moab and the gods of the children of Ammon and the gods of the Philistines; they gave up the Lord and were servants to him no longer.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And the wrath of the Lord was burning against Israel, and he gave them up into the hands of the Philistines and into the hands of the children of Ammon.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: And that year the children of Israel were crushed under their yoke; for eighteen years all the children of Israel on the other side of Jordan, in the land of the Amorites which is in Gilead, were cruelly crushed down.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: And the children of Ammon went over Jordan, to make war against Judah and Benjamin and the house of Ephraim; and Israel was in great trouble.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: Then the children of Israel, crying out to the Lord, said, Great is our sin against you, for we have given up our God and have been servants to the Baals.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: And the Lord said to the children of Israel, Were not the Egyptians and the Amorites and the children of Ammon and the Philistines

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: And the Zidonians and Amalek and Midian crushing you down, and in answer to your cry did I not give you salvation from their hands?

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: But, for all this, you have given me up and have been servants to other gods: so I will be your saviour no longer.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: Go, send up your cry for help to the gods of your selection; let them be your saviours in the time of your trouble.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: And the children of Israel said to the Lord, We are sinners; do to us whatever seems good to you: only give us salvation this day.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: So they put away the strange gods from among them, and became the Lord's servants; and his soul was angry because of the sorrows of Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: Then the children of Ammon came together and put their army in position in Gilead. And the children of Israel came together and put their army in position in Mizpah.

title: Judges Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: And the people of Israel said to one another, Who will be the first to make an attack on the children of Ammon? We will make him head over all Gilead.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a great man of war; he was the son of a loose woman, and Gilead was his father.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: And Gilead's wife gave birth to sons, and when her sons became men, they sent Jephthah away, saying, You have no part in the heritage of our father's house, for you are the son of another woman.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: So Jephthah went in flight from his brothers and was living in the land of Tob, where a number of good-for-nothing men, joining Jephthah, went out with him on his undertakings.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: Now after a time the children of Ammon made war against Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And when the children of Ammon made war against Israel, the responsible men of Gilead went to get Jephthah back from the land of Tob;

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And they said to Jephthah, Come and be our chief so that we may make war against the children of Ammon.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: But Jephthah said to the responsible men of Gilead, Did you not, in your hate for me, send me away from my father's house? Why do you come to me now when you are in trouble?

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: And the responsible men of Gilead said to Jephthah, That is the reason we have come back to you; so go with us and make war against the children of Ammon, and we will make you our head over all the people of Gilead.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: Then Jephthah said to the responsible men of Gilead, If you take me back to make war against the children of Ammon, and if with the help of the Lord I overcome them, will you make me your head?

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: And the responsible men of Gilead said to Jephthah, May the Lord be our witness: we will certainly do as you say.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: So Jephthah went with the responsible men of Gilead, and the people made him head and chief over them; and Jephthah said all these things before the Lord in Mizpah.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: Then Jephthah sent men to the king of the children of Ammon, saying, What have you against me that you have come to make war against my land?

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: And the king of the children of Ammon said to the men sent by Jephthah, Because Israel, when he came up out of Egypt, took away my land, from the Arnon as far as the Jabbok and as far as Jordan: so now, give me back those lands quietly.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And Jephthah sent again to the king of the children of Ammon,

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: And said to him, This is the word of Jephthah: Israel did not take away the land of Moab or the land of the children of Ammon;

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: But when they came up from Egypt, Israel went through the waste land to the Red Sea and came to Kadesh;

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: Then Israel sent men to the king of Edom saying, Let me now go through your land; but the king of Edom did not give ear to them. And in the same way he sent to the king of Moab, but he would not; so Israel went on living in Kadesh.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: Then he went on through the waste land and round the land of Edom and the land of Moab, and came by the east side of the land of Moab, and put up their tents on the other side of the Arnon; they did not come inside the limit of Moab, for the Arnon was the limit of Moab.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: And Israel sent men to Sihon, king of the Amorites, the king of Heshbon; and Israel said to him, Let me now go through your land to my place.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: But Sihon would not give way and let Israel go through his land; and Sihon got together all his people, and put his army in position in Jahaz, and made war on Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: And the Lord, the God of Israel, gave Sihon and all his people into the hands of Israel, and they overcame them; so all the land of the Amorites, the people of that land, became Israel's.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: All the limit of the Amorites was theirs, from the Arnon as far as the Jabbok and from the waste land even to Jordan.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: So now the Lord, the God of Israel, has taken away their land from the Amorites and given it to his people Israel; are you then to have it?

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: Do you not keep the lands of those whom Chemosh your god sends out from before you? So we will keep all the lands of those whom the Lord our God sends out from before us.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: What! are you any better than Balak, the son of Zippor, king of Moab? Did he ever take up a cause against Israel or make war against them?

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: While Israel was living in Heshbon and its daughter-towns and in Aroer and its daughter-towns and in all the towns which are by the side of the Arnon, for three hundred years, why did you not get them back at that time?

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: So I have done no wrong against you, but you are doing wrong to me in fighting against me: may the Lord, who is Judge this day, be judge between the children of Israel and the children of Ammon.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: The king of the children of Ammon, however, did not give ear to the words which Jephthah sent to him.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: Then the spirit of the Lord came on Jephthah, and he went through Gilead and Manasseh, and came to Mizpeh of Gilead; and from Mizpeh of Gilead he went over to the children of Ammon.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: And Jephthah took an oath to the Lord, and said, If you will give the children of Ammon into my hands,

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: Then whoever comes out from the door of my house, meeting me when I come back in peace from the children of Ammon, will be the Lord's and I will give him as a burned offering.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: So Jephthah went over to the children of Ammon to make war on them; and the Lord gave them into his hands.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: And he made an attack on them from Aroer all the way to Minnith, overrunning twenty towns, as far as Abel-cheramim, and put great numbers to the sword. So the children of Ammon were crushed before the children of Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 34
text: Then Jephthah came back to his house in Mizpah, and his daughter came out, meeting him on his way with music and with dances; she was his only child; he had no other sons or daughters.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 35
text: And when he saw her he was overcome with grief, and said, Ah! my daughter! I am crushed with sorrow, and it is you who are the chief cause of my trouble; for I have made an oath to the Lord and I may not take it back.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 36
text: And she said to him, My father, you have made an oath to the Lord; do then to me whatever you have said; for the Lord has sent a full reward on your haters, on the children of Ammon.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 37
text: Then she said to her father, Only do this for me: let me have two months to go away into the mountains with my friends, weeping for my sad fate.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 38
text: And he said, Go then. So he sent her away for two months; and she went with her friends to the mountains, weeping for her sad fate.

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 39
text: And at the end of two months she went back to her father, who did with her as he had said in his oath: and she had never been touched by a man. So it became a rule in Israel,

title: Judges Chapter 11 Verse 40
text: For the women to go year by year sorrowing for the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite, four days in every year.

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: Now the men of Ephraim came together and took up arms and went over to Zaphon; and they said to Jephthah, Why did you go over to make war against the children of Ammon without sending for us to go with you? Now we will put your house on fire over you.

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: And Jephthah said to them, I and my people were in danger, and the children of Ammon were very cruel to us, and when I sent for you, you gave me no help against them.

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: So when I saw that there was no help to be had from you, I put my life in my hand and went over against the children of Ammon, and the Lord gave them into my hands: why then have you come up to me this day to make war on me?

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: Then Jephthah got together all the men of Gilead and made war on Ephraim; and the men of Gilead overcame Ephraim.

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: And the Gileadites took the crossing-places of Jordan against the Ephraimites; and when any of the men of Ephraim who had gone in flight said, let me go over; the men of Gilead said to him, Are you an Ephraimite? And if he said, No;

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: Then they said to him, Now say Shibboleth; and he said Sibboleth, and was not able to say it in the right way; then they took him and put him to death at the crossing-places of Jordan; and at that time forty-two thousand Ephraimites were put to death.

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: Now Jephthah was judge of Israel for six years. And Jephthah the Gileadite came to his death, and his body was put to rest in his town, Mizpeh of Gilead.

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: And after him, Ibzan of Beth-lehem was judge of Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: He had thirty sons, and thirty daughters whom he sent to other places, and he got thirty wives from other places for his sons. And he was judge of Israel for seven years.

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: And Ibzan came to his death and his body was put to rest at Beth-lehem.

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: And after him, Elon the Zebulonite was judge of Israel; and he was judge of Israel for ten years.

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: And Elon the Zebulonite came to his death, and his body was put to rest in Aijalon in the land of Zebulun.

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: And after him, Abdon, the son of Hillel, the Pirathonite, was judge of Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: He had forty sons and thirty sons' sons who went on seventy young asses; and he was judge of Israel for eight years.

title: Judges Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: And Abdon, the son of Hillel, came to his death, and his body was put to rest in Pirathon in the land of Ephraim, in the hill-country of the Amalekites.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: And the children of Israel again did evil in the eyes of the Lord; and the Lord gave them into the hands of the Philistines for forty years.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: Now there was a certain man of Zorah of the family of the Danites, and his name was Manoah; and his wife had never given birth to a child.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: And the angel of the Lord came to the woman, and said to her, See now! though you have never given birth to children, you will be with child and give birth to a son.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: Now then take care to have no wine or strong drink and to take no unclean thing for food;

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: For you are with child and will give birth to a son; his hair is never to be cut, for the child is to be separate to God from his birth; and he will take up the work of freeing Israel from the hands of the Philistines.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: Then the woman came in, and said to her husband, A man came to me, and his form was like the form of a god, causing great fear; I put no question to him about where he came from, and he did not give me his name;

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: But he said to me, You are with child and will give birth to a son; and now do not take any wine or strong drink or let anything unclean be your food; for the child will be separate to God from his birth to the day of his death.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: Then Manoah made prayer to the Lord, and said, O Lord, let the man of God whom you sent come to us again and make clear to us what we are to do for the child who is to come.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: And God gave ear to the voice of Manoah; and the angel of God came to the woman again when she was seated in the field; but her husband Manoah was not with her.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: So the woman, running quickly, gave her husband the news, saying, I have seen the man who came to me the other day.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: And Manoah got up and went after his wife, and came up to the man and said to him, Are you the man who was talking to this woman? And he said, I am.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: And Manoah said, Now when your words come true, what is to be the rule for the child and what will be his work?

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: And the angel of the Lord said to Manoah, Let the woman take note of what I have said to her.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: She is to have nothing which comes from the vine for her food, and let her take no wine or strong drink or anything which is unclean; let her take care to do all I have given her orders to do.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: And Manoah said to the angel of the Lord, Now let us keep you while we make ready a young goat for you.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: And the angel of the Lord said to Manoah, Though you keep me I will not take of your food; but if you will make a burned offering, let it be offered to the Lord. For it had not come into Manoah's mind that he was the angel of the Lord.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: Then Manoah said to the angel of the Lord, What is your name, so that when your words come true we may give you honour?

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: But the angel of the Lord said to him, Why are you questioning me about my name, seeing that it is a wonder?

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: So Manoah took the young goat with its meal offering, offering it on the rock to the Lord, who did strange things.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: And when the flame went up to heaven from the altar, the angel of the Lord went up in the flame of the altar, while Manoah and his wife were looking on; and they went down on their faces to the earth.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: But the angel of the Lord was seen no more by Manoah and his wife. Then it was clear to Manoah that he was the angel of the Lord.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: And Manoah said to his wife, Death will certainly be our fate, for it is a god whom we have seen.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: But his wife said to him, If the Lord was purposing our death, he would not have taken our burned offering and our meal offering, or have given us such orders about the child.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: So the woman gave birth to a son, and gave him the name Samson; and he became a man and the blessing of the Lord was on him.

title: Judges Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: And the spirit of the Lord first came on him in Mahaneh-dan, between Zorah and Eshtaol.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: Now Samson went down to Timnah, and saw a woman in Timnah, of the daughters of the Philistines;

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: And when he came back he said to his father and mother, I have seen a woman in Timnah, of the daughters of the Philistines: get her now for me for my wife.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: Then his father and mother said to him, Is there no woman among the daughters of your relations or among all my people, that you have to go for your wife to the Philistines, who are without circumcision? But Samson said to his father, Get her for me, for she is pleasing to me.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: Now his father and mother had no knowledge that this was the purpose of the Lord, who had the destruction of the Philistines in mind. Now the Philistines at that time were ruling over Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: Then Samson went down to Timnah (and his father and his mother,) and came to the vine-gardens of Timnah; and a young lion came rushing out at him.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: And the spirit of the Lord came on him with power, and, unarmed as he was, pulling the lion in two as one might do to a young goat, he put him to death; (but he said nothing to his father and mother of what he had done.)

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: So he went down and had talk with the woman; and she was pleasing to Samson.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: Then after a time he went back to take her; and turning from the road to see the dead body of the lion, he saw a mass of bees in the body of the lion, and honey there.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: And he took the honey in his hand, and went on, tasting it on the way; and when he came to his father and mother he gave some to them; but did not say that he had taken the honey from the body of the lion.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: Then Samson went down to the woman, and made a feast there, as was the way among young men.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: And he took thirty friends, and they were with him.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: And Samson said, Now I have a hard question for you: if you are able to give me the answer before the seven days of the feast are over, I will give you thirty linen robes and thirty changes of clothing;

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: But if you are not able to give me the answer, then you will have to give me thirty linen robes and thirty changes of clothing. And they said to him, Put your hard question and let us see what it is.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: And he said, Out of the taker of food came food, and out of the strong came the sweet. And at the end of three days they were still not able to give the answer.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: So on the fourth day they said to Samson's wife, Get from your husband the answer to his question by some trick or other, or we will have you and your father's house burned with fire; did you get us here to take all we have?

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: Then Samson's wife, weeping over him, said, Truly you have no love for me but only hate; you have put a hard question to the children of my people and have not given me the answer. And he said to her, See, I have not given the answer even to my father or my mother; am I to give it to you?

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: And all the seven days of the feast she went on weeping over him; and on the seventh day he gave her the answer, because she gave him no peace; and she sent word of it to the children of her people.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: Then on the seventh day, before he went into the bride's room, the men of the town said to him, What is sweeter than honey? and what is stronger than a lion? And he said to them, If you had not been ploughing with my cow you would not have got the answer to my question.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: And the spirit of the Lord came rushing on him, and he went down to Ashkelon and, attacking thirty men there, took their clothing from them, and gave it to the men who had given the answer to his hard question. Then, full of wrath, he went back to his father's house.

title: Judges Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: But Samson's wife was given to the friend who had been his best man.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: Now a short time after, at the time of the grain-cutting, Samson, taking with him a young goat, went to see his wife; and he said, I will go in to my wife into the bride's room. But her father would not let him go in.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: And her father said, It seemed to me that you had only hate for her; so I gave her to your friend: but is not her younger sister fairer than she? so please take her in place of the other.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: Then Samson said to them, This time I will give payment in full to the Philistines, for I am going to do them great evil.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: So Samson went and got three hundred foxes and some sticks of fire-wood; and he put the foxes tail to tail with a stick between every two tails;

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: Then firing the sticks, he let the foxes loose among the uncut grain of the Philistines, and all the corded stems as well as the living grain and the vine-gardens and the olives went up in flames.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: Then the Philistines said, Who has done this? And they said, Samson, the son-in-law of the Timnite, because he took his wife and gave her to his friend. So the Philistines came up and had her and her father's house burned.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: And Samson said to them, If you go on like this, truly I will take my full payment from you; and that will be the end of it.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: And he made an attack on them, driving them in uncontrolled flight, and causing great destruction; then he went away to his safe place in the crack of the rock at Etam.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: Then the Philistines went and put up their tents in Judah, all round Lehi.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: And the men of Judah said, Why have you come up against us? And they said, We have come up to take Samson, and to do to him as he has done to us.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: Then three thousand of the men of Judah went down to the crack of the rock of Etam, and said to Samson, Is it not clear to you that the Philistines are our rulers? What is this you have done to us? And he said to them, I only did to them as they did to me.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: Then they said to him, We have come down to take you and give you up into the hands of the Philistines. And Samson said to them, Give me your oath that you will not make an attack on me yourselves.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: And they said, No; we will take you and give you up into their hands, but truly we will not put you to death. So knotting two new cords round him they took him up from the rock.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: And when he came to Lehi, the Philistines came out, meeting him with loud cries; then the spirit of the Lord came rushing on him, and the cords on his arms became like grass which has been burned with fire, and the bands came falling off his hands.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: And taking up the mouth-bone of an ass newly dead, which he saw by chance on the earth, he put to death a thousand men with it.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: And Samson said, With a red ass's mouth-bone I have made them red with blood, with a red ass's mouth-bone I have sent destruction on a thousand men.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: And having said these words, he let the mouth-bone go out of his hand; so that place was named Ramath-lehi.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: After this, he was in great need of water, and crying out to the Lord, he said, You have given this great salvation by the hand of your servant, and now need of water will be my death; and I will be given into the hands of this people who are without circumcision.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: Then God made a crack in the hollow rock in Lehi and water came out of it; and after drinking, his spirit came back to him and he was strong again; so that place was named En-hakkore; it is in Lehi to this day.

title: Judges Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: And he was judge of Israel in the days of the Philistines for twenty years.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: Now Samson went to Gaza, and there he saw a loose woman and went in to her.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: And it was said to the Gazites, Samson is here. So they went round, watching for him all day at the doorway of the town, but at night they kept quiet, saying, When daylight comes we will put him to death.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: And Samson was there till the middle of the night; then he got up, and took a grip on the doors of the town, pulling them up, together with their two supports and their locks, and put them on his back and took them up to the top of the hill in front of Hebron.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: Now after this, he was in love with a woman in the valley of Sorek, named Delilah.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: And the chiefs of the Philistines came up to her, and said to her, Make use of your power over him and see what is the secret of his great strength, and how we may get the better of him, and put bands on him, so that we may make him feeble; and every one of us will give you eleven hundred shekels of silver.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: So Delilah said to Samson, Make clear to me now what is the secret of your great strength, and how you may be put in bands and made feeble.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: And Samson said to her, If seven new bow-cords which have never been made dry are knotted round me, I will become feeble and will be like any other man.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: So the chiefs of the Philistines gave her seven new bow-cords which had never been made dry, and she had them tightly knotted round him.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: Now she had men waiting secretly in the inner room; and she said to him, The Philistines are on you, Samson. And the cords were broken by him as a twist of thread is broken when touched by a flame. So the secret of his strength did not come to light.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: Then Delilah said to Samson, See, you have been making sport of me with false words; now, say truly how may you be put in bands?

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: And he said to her, If they only put round me new thick cords which have never been used, then I will become feeble and will be like any other man.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: So Delilah took new thick cords, knotting them tightly round him, and said to him, The Philistines are on you, Samson. And men were waiting secretly in the inner room. And the cords were broken off his arms like threads.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: Then Delilah said to Samson, Up to now you have made sport of me with false words; now say truly, how may you be put in bands? And he said to her, If you get the seven twists of my hair worked into the cloth you are making and fixed with the pin, I will become feeble and will be like any other man.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: So while he was sleeping she got the seven twists of his hair worked into her cloth and fixed with the pin, and said to him, The Philistines are on you, Samson. Then awaking from his sleep, he got up quickly, pulling up cloth and machine together.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: And she said to him, Why do you say you are my lover when your heart is not mine? Three times you have made sport of me, and have not made clear to me the secret of your great strength.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: So day after day she gave him no peace, for ever questioning him till his soul was troubled to death.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: And opening all his heart to her, he said to her, My head has never been touched by a blade, for I have been separate to God from the day of my birth: if my hair is cut off, then my strength will go from me and I will become feeble, and will be like any other man.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: And when Delilah saw that he had let her see into his heart, she sent word to the chiefs of the Philistines saying, Come up this time, for he has let out all his heart to me. Then the chiefs of the Philistines came to her, with the money in their hands.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: And she made him go to sleep on her knees; and she sent for a man and had his seven twists of hair cut off; and while it was being done he became feeble and his strength went from him.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: Then she said, The Philistines are on you, Samson. And awaking from his sleep, he said, I will go out as at other times, shaking myself free. But he was not conscious that the Lord had gone from him.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: So the Philistines took him and put out his eyes; then they took him down to Gaza, and, chaining him with bands of brass, put him to work crushing grain in the prison-house.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: But the growth of his hair was starting again after it had been cut off.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: And the chiefs of the Philistines came together to make a great offering to Dagon their god, and to be glad; for they said, Our god has given into our hands Samson our hater.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 24
text: And when the people saw him, they gave praise to their god; for they said, Our god has given into our hands the one who was fighting against us, who made our country waste, and who put great numbers of us to death.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 25
text: Now when their hearts were full of joy, they said, Send for Samson to make sport for us. And they sent for Samson out of the prison-house, and he made sport before them; and they put him between the pillars.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 26
text: And Samson said to the boy who took him by the hand, Let me put my hand on the pillars supporting the house, so that I may put my back against them.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 27
text: Now the house was full of men and women; and all the lords of the Philistines were there; and about three thousand men and women were on the roof, looking on while Samson made sport.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 28
text: And Samson, crying out to the Lord, said, O Lord God, do have me now in mind, and do make me strong only this once, O God, so that I may take one last payment from the Philistines for my two eyes.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 29
text: Then Samson put his arms round the two middle pillars supporting the house, putting his weight on them, on one with his right hand and on the other with his left.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 30
text: And Samson said, Let death overtake me with the Philistines. And he put out all his strength, and the house came down on the chiefs and on all the people who were in it. So the dead whom he sent to destruction by his death were more than all those on whom he had sent destruction in his life.

title: Judges Chapter 16 Verse 31
text: Then his brothers and his father's people came down and took him up and put his body to rest in the earth between Zorah and Eshtaol in the resting-place of Manoah his father. And he had been judge of Israel for twenty years.

title: Judges Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: Now there was a man of the hill-country of Ephraim named Micah.

title: Judges Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: And he said to his mother, The eleven hundred shekels of silver which were taken from you, about which you took an oath and said in my hearing, I have given this silver to the Lord from my hand for myself, to make a pictured image and a metal image: see, I have the silver, for I took it: so now I will give it back to you. And his mother said, May the blessing of the Lord be on my son.

title: Judges Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: And he gave back the eleven hundred shekels of silver to his mother, and his mother said, I have made the silver holy to the Lord from me for my son, to make a pictured image and a metal image.

title: Judges Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: So he gave the silver back to his mother. Then his mother took two hundred shekels of silver and gave them to a metal-worker who made a pictured image and a metal image from them: and it was in the house of Micah.

title: Judges Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: And the man Micah had a house of gods; and he made an ephod and family gods and put one of his sons in the position of priest.

title: Judges Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: In those days there was no king in Israel: every man did as seemed right to him.

title: Judges Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: Now there was a young man living in Beth-lehem-judah, of the family of Judah and a Levite, who was not a townsman of the place.

title: Judges Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: And he went away from the town of Beth-lehem-judah, looking for somewhere to make his living-place; and on his journey he came to the hill-country of Ephraim, to the house of Micah.

title: Judges Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: And Micah said to him, Where do you come from? And he said to him, I am a Levite from Beth-lehem-judah, and I am looking for a living-place.

title: Judges Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: Then Micah said to him, Make your living-place with me, and be a father and a priest to me, and I will give you ten shekels of silver a year and your clothing and food.

title: Judges Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: And the Levite said he would make his living-place with the man, and he became to him as one of his sons.

title: Judges Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: And Micah gave the position to the Levite, and the young man became his priest, and was in the house of Micah.

title: Judges Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: Then Micah said, Now I am certain that the Lord will do me good, seeing that the Levite has become my priest.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: In those days there was no king in Israel, and in those days the Danites were looking for a heritage for themselves, to be their living-place; for up to that time no distribution of land had been made to them among the tribes of Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: So the children of Dan sent five men from among their number, strong men, from Zorah and from Eshtaol, to take a look at the land and make a search through it; and they said to them, Go and make a search through the land; and they came to the hill-country of Ephraim, to the house of Micah, where they made a stop for the night.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: When they were near the house of Micah, hearing a voice which was not strange to them, that of the young Levite, they went out of their road to his place, and said to him, How did you come here? and what are you doing in this place? and why are you here?

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: And he said to them, This is what Micah did for me, and he gave me payment and I became his priest.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: Then they said, Do get directions from God for us, to see if the journey on which we are going will have a good outcome.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: And the priest said to them, Go in peace: your way is guided by the Lord.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: Then the five men went on their way and came to Laish and saw the people who were there, living without thought of danger, like the Zidonians, quiet and safe; for they had everything on earth for their needs, and they were far from the Zidonians and had no business with Aram.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: So they came back to their brothers in Zorah and Eshtaol, and their brothers said to them, What news have you?

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: And they said, Up! and let us go against Laish; for we have seen the land, and it is very good: why are you doing nothing? Do not be slow to go in and take the land for your heritage.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: When you come there you will come to a people living without thought of danger; and the land is wide, and God has given it into your hands: a place where there is everything on earth for man's needs.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: So six hundred men of the Danites from Zorah and Eshtaol went out armed with instruments of war.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: And they went up and put up their tents in Kiriath-jearim in Judah: so that place is named Mahaneh-dan to this day. It is to the west of Kiriath-jearim.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: From there they went on to the hill-country of Ephraim and came to the house of Micah.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: Then the five men who had gone to make a search through the country of Laish, said to their brothers, Have you knowledge that in these houses there is an ephod and family gods and a pictured image and a metal image? So now you see what to do.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: And turning from their road they came to the house of the young Levite, the house of Micah, and said to him, Is it well with you?

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: And the six hundred armed men of the Danites took their places by the doorway.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: Then the five men who had gone to make a search through the land, went in and took the pictured image and the ephod and the family gods and the metal image; and the priest was by the doorway with the six hundred armed men.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: And when they went into Micah's house and took out the pictured image and the ephod and the family gods and the metal image, the priest said to them, What are you doing?

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: And they said to him, Be quiet; say nothing, and come with us and be our father and priest; is it better for you to be priest to one man's house or to be priest to a tribe and a family in Israel?

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: Then the priest's heart was glad, and he took the ephod and the family gods and the pictured image and went with the people.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: So they went on their way again, putting the little ones and the oxen and the goods in front of them.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: When they had gone some way from the house of Micah, the men from the houses near Micah's house came together and overtook the children of Dan,

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: Crying out to them. And the Danites, turning round, said to Micah, What is your trouble, that you have taken up arms?

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: And he said, You have taken my gods which I made, and my priest, and have gone away; what is there for me now? Why then do you say to me, What is your trouble?

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: And the children of Dan said to him, Say no more, or men of bitter spirit may make an attack on you, causing loss of your life and the lives of your people.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: Then the children of Dan went on their way; and when Micah saw that they were stronger than he, he went back to his house.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: And they took that which Micah had made, and his priest, and came to Laish, to a people living quietly and without thought of danger, and they put them to the sword without mercy, burning down their town.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: And they had no saviour, because it was far from Zidon, and they had no business with Aram; and it was in the valley which is the property of Beth-rehob. And building up the town again they took it for their living-place.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 29
text: And they gave the town the name of Dan, after Dan their father, who was the son of Israel: though the town had been named Laish at first.

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 30
text: (And the children of Dan put up the pictured image for themselves; and Jonathan, the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, and his sons were priests for the tribe of the Danites till the day when the ark was taken prisoner.)

title: Judges Chapter 18 Verse 31
text: And they put up for themselves the image which Micah had made, and it was there all the time that the house of God was in Shiloh.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: Now in those days, when there was no king in Israel, a certain Levite was living in the inmost parts of the hill-country of Ephraim, and he got for himself a servant-wife from Beth-lehem-judah.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: And his servant-wife was angry with him, and went away from him to her father's house at Beth-lehem-judah, and was there for four months.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: Then her husband got up and went after her, with the purpose of talking kindly to her, and taking her back with him; he had with him his young man and two asses: and she took him into her father's house, and her father, when he saw him, came forward to him with joy.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: And his father-in-law, the girl's father, kept him there for three days; and they had food and drink and took their rest there.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: Now on the fourth day they got up early in the morning and he made ready to go away; but the girl's father said to his son-in-law, Take a little food to keep up your strength, and then go on your way.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: So seating themselves they had food and drink, the two of them together; and the girl's father said to the man, If it is your pleasure, take your rest here tonight, and let your heart be glad.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: And the man got up to go away, but his father-in-law would not let him go, so he took his rest there again for the night.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: Then early on the morning of the fifth day he got up to go away; but the girl's father said, Keep up your strength; so the two of them had a meal, and the man and his woman and his servant did not go till after the middle of the day.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: And when they got up to go away, his father-in-law, the girl's father, said to him, Now evening is coming on, so do not go tonight; see, the day is almost gone; take your rest here and let your heart be glad, and tomorrow early, go on your way back to your house.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: But the man would not be kept there that night, and he got up and went away and came opposite to Jebus (which is Jerusalem); and he had with him the two asses, ready for travelling, and his woman.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: When they got near Jebus the day was far gone; and the servant said to his master, Now let us go from our road into this town of the Jebusites and take our night's rest there.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: But his master said to him, We will not go out of our way into a strange town, whose people are not of the children of Israel; but we will go on to Gibeah.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: And he said to his servant, Come, let us go on to one of these places, stopping for the night in Gibeah or Ramah.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: So they went on their way; and the sun went down when they were near Gibeah in the land of Benjamin.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: And they went off the road there with the purpose of stopping for the night in Gibeah: and he went in, seating himself in the street of the town, for no one took them into his house for the night.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: Now when it was evening they saw an old man coming back from his work in the fields; he was from the hill-country of Ephraim and was living in Gibeah: but the men of the place were Benjamites.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: And when he saw the traveller in the street of the town, the old man said, Where are you going? and where do you come from?

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: And he said to him, We are on our way from Beth-lehem-judah to the inmost parts of the hill-country of Ephraim: I came from there and went to Beth-lehem-judah: now I am on my way back to my house, but no man will take me into his house.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: But we have dry grass and food for our asses, as well as bread and wine for me, and for the woman, and for the young man with us: we have no need of anything.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: And the old man said, Peace be with you; let all your needs be my care; only do not take your rest in the street.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: So he took them into his house and gave the asses food; and after washing their feet they took food and drink.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: While they were taking their pleasure at the meal, the good-for-nothing men of the town came round the house, giving blows on the door; and they said to the old man, the master of the house, Send out that man who came to your house, so that we may take our pleasure with him.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: So the man, the master of the house, went out to them, and said, No, my brothers, do not this evil thing; this man has come into my house, and you are not to do him this wrong.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: See, here is my daughter, a virgin, and his servant-wife: I will send them out for you to take them and do with them whatever you will. But do no such thing of shame to this man.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 25
text: But the men would not give ear to him: so the man took his woman and sent her out to them; and they took her by force, using her for their pleasure all night till the morning; and when dawn came they let her go.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 26
text: Then at the dawn of day the woman came, and, falling down at the door of the man's house where her master was, was stretched there till it was light.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 27
text: In the morning her master got up, and opening the door of the house went out to go on his way; and he saw his servant-wife stretched on the earth at the door of the house with her hands on the step.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 28
text: And he said to her, Get up and let us be going; but there was no answer; so he took her up and put her on the ass, and went on his way and came to his house.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 29
text: And when he had come to his house, he got his knife, and took the woman, cutting her up bone by bone into twelve parts, which he sent through all Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 19 Verse 30
text: And he gave orders to the men whom he sent, saying, This is what you are to say to all the men of Israel, Has ever an act like this been done from the day when the children of Israel came out of Egypt to this day? Give thought to it, turning it over in your minds, and give your opinion of it.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: Then all the children of Israel took up arms, and the people came together like one man, from Dan to Beer-sheba, and the land of Gilead, before the Lord at Mizpah.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: And the chiefs of the people, out of all the tribes of Israel, took their places in the meeting of the people of God, four hundred thousand footmen armed with swords.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: (Now the children of Benjamin had word that the children of Israel had gone up to Mizpah.) And the children of Israel said, Make clear how this evil thing took place.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: Then the Levite, the husband of the dead woman, said in answer, I came to Gibeah in the land of Benjamin, I and my servant-wife, for the purpose of stopping there for the night.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: And the townsmen of Gibeah came together against me, going round the house on all sides by night; it was their purpose to put me to death, and my servant-wife was violently used by them and is dead.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: So I took her, cutting her into parts which I sent through all the country of the heritage of Israel: for they have done an act of shame in Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: Here you all are, you children of Israel; give now your suggestions about what is to be done.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: Then all the people got up as one man and said, Not one of us will go to his tent or go back to his house:

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: But this is what we will do to Gibeah: we will go up against it by the decision of the Lord;

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: And we will take ten men out of every hundred, through all the tribes of Israel, a hundred out of every thousand, a thousand out of every ten thousand, to get food for the people, so that they may give to Gibeah of Benjamin the right punishment for the act of shame they have done in Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: So all the men of Israel were banded together against the town, united like one man.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: And the tribes of Israel sent men through all the tribe of Benjamin saying, What is this evil which has been done among you?

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: Now give up those good-for-nothing persons in Gibeah so that we may put them to death, clearing away the evil from Israel. But the children of Benjamin would not give ear to the voice of their brothers, the children of Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: And the children of Benjamin came together from all their towns to Gibeah, to go to war with the children of Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: And the children of Benjamin who came that day from the towns were twenty-six thousand men armed with swords, in addition to the people of Gibeah, numbering seven hundred of the best fighting-men,

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: Who were left-handed, able to send a stone at a hair without error.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: And the men of Israel, other than Benjamin, were four hundred thousand in number, all armed with swords; they were all men of war.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: And they got up and went up to Beth-el to get directions from God, and the children of Israel said, Who is to be the first to go up to the fight against the children of Benjamin? And the Lord said, Judah is to go up first.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: So the children of Israel got up in the morning and put themselves in position against Gibeah.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: And the men of Israel went out to war against Benjamin (and the men of Israel put their forces in fighting order against them at Gibeah).

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: Then the children of Benjamin came out from Gibeah, cutting down twenty-two thousand of the Israelites that day.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: But the people, the men of Israel, taking heart again, put their forces in order and took up the same position as on the first day.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: Now the children of Israel went up, weeping before the Lord till evening, requesting the Lord and saying, Am I to go forward again to the fight against the children of Benjamin my brother? And the Lord said, Go up against him.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: So the children of Israel went forward against the children of Benjamin the second day.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: And the second day Benjamin went out against them from Gibeah, cutting down eighteen thousand men of the children of Israel, all swordsmen.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: Then all the children of Israel, and all the people, went up to Beth-el, weeping and waiting there before the Lord, going without food all day till evening, and offering burned offerings and peace-offerings before the Lord.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 27
text: And the children of Israel made request to the Lord, (for the ark of the agreement of the Lord was there in those days,

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 28
text: And Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, was in his place before it,) and said, Am I still to go on with the fight against the children of Benjamin my brother, or am I to give it up? And the Lord said, Go on; for tomorrow I will give him into your hands.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 29
text: So Israel put men secretly all round Gibeah to make a surprise attack on it.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 30
text: And the children of Israel went up against the children of Benjamin on the third day, and put themselves in fighting order against Gibeah as before.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 31
text: And the children of Benjamin went out against the people, moving away from the town; and as before, at their first attack, they put to death about thirty men of Israel on the highways, of which one goes up to Beth-el and the other to Gibeah, and in the open country.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 32
text: And the children of Benjamin said, They are giving way before us as at first. But the children of Israel said, Let us go in flight and get them away from the town, into the highways.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 33
text: So all the men of Israel got up and put themselves in fighting order at Baal-tamar: and those who had been waiting secretly to make a surprise attack came rushing out of their place on the west of Geba.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 34
text: And they came in front of Gibeah, ten thousand of the best men in all Israel, and the fighting became more violent; but the children of Benjamin were not conscious that evil was coming on them.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 35
text: Then the Lord sent sudden fear on Benjamin before Israel; and that day the children of Israel put to death twenty-five thousand, one hundred men of Benjamin, all of them swordsmen.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 36
text: So the children of Benjamin saw that they were overcome: and the men of Israel had given way before Benjamin, putting their faith in the watchers who were to make the surprise attack on Gibeah.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 37
text: And the watchers, rushing on Gibeah and overrunning it, put all the town to the sword without mercy.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 38
text: Now the sign fixed between the men of Israel and those making the surprise attack was that when they made a pillar of smoke go up from the town,

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 39
text: The men of Israel were to make a turn about in the fight. And Benjamin had overcome and put to death about thirty of the men of Israel, and were saying, Certainly they are falling back before us as in the first fight.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 40
text: Then the sign went up out of the town in the pillar of smoke, and the Benjamites, turning back, saw all the town going up in smoke to heaven.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 41
text: And the men of Israel had made a turn about, and the men of Benjamin were overcome with fear, for they saw that evil had overtaken them.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 42
text: So turning their backs on the men of Israel, they went in the direction of the waste land; but the fight overtook them; and those who came out of the town were heading them off and putting them to the sword.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 43
text: And crushing Benjamin down, they went after them, driving them from Nohah as far as the east side of Gibeah.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 44
text: Eighteen thousand men of Benjamin came to their death, all strong men of war.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 45
text: And turning, they went in flight to the rock of Rimmon in the waste land: and on the highways five thousand of them were cut off by the men of Israel, who, pushing on hard after them to Geba, put to death two thousand more.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 46
text: So twenty-five thousand of the swordsmen of Benjamin came to their end that day, all strong men of war.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 47
text: But six hundred men, turning back, went in flight to the rock of Rimmon in the waste land, and were living on the rock of Rimmon for four months.

title: Judges Chapter 20 Verse 48
text: And the men of Israel, turning again against the children of Benjamin, put to the sword without mercy all the towns and the cattle and everything there was, burning every town which came into their hands.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: Now the men of Israel had taken an oath in Mizpah, saying, Not one of us will give his daughter as a wife to Benjamin.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: And the people came to Beth-el, waiting there till evening before God, and gave themselves up to bitter weeping.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: And they said, O Lord, the God of Israel, why has this fate come on Israel, that today one tribe has been cut off from Israel?

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: Then on the day after, the people got up early and made an altar there, offering burned offerings and peace-offerings.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: And the children of Israel said, Who is there among all the tribes of Israel, who did not come up to the Lord at the meeting of all Israel? For they had taken a great oath that whoever did not come up to Mizpah to the Lord was to be put to death.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: And the children of Israel were moved with pity for Benjamin their brother, saying, Today one tribe has been cut off from Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: What are we to do about wives for those who are still living? For we have taken an oath by the Lord that we will not give them our daughters for wives.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: And they said, Which one of the tribes of Israel did not come up to Mizpah to the Lord? And it was seen that no one had come from Jabesh-gilead to the meeting.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: For when the people were numbered, not one man of the people of Jabesh-gilead was present.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: So they (the meeting) sent twelve thousand of the best fighting-men, and gave them orders, saying, Go and put the people of Jabesh-gilead to the sword without mercy, with their women and their little ones.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: And this is what you are to do: every male, and every woman who has had sex relations with a man, you are to put to the curse, but you are to keep safe the virgins. And they did so.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: Now there were among the people of Jabesh-gilead four hundred young virgins who had never had sex relations with a man; these they took to their tents in Shiloh in the land of Canaan.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: And all the meeting sent to the men of Benjamin who were in the rock of Rimmon, offering them peace.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: Then Benjamin came back; and they gave them the women whom they had kept from death among the women of Jabesh-gilead: but still there were not enough for them.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: And the people were moved with pity for Benjamin, because the Lord had let his wrath loose on the tribes of Israel.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: Then the responsible men of the meeting said, What are we to do about wives for the rest of them, seeing that the women of Benjamin are dead?

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: And they said, How is the rest of Benjamin to be given offspring so that one tribe of Israel may not be put out of existence,

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: Seeing that we may not give them our daughters as wives? For the children of Israel had taken an oath, saying, Cursed is he who gives a wife to Benjamin.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: And they said, See, every year there is a feast of the Lord in Shiloh, which is to the north of Beth-el, on the east side of the highway which goes up from Beth-el to Shechem, and on the south of Lebonah.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: And they said to the men of Benjamin, Go into the vine-gardens, waiting there secretly,

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: And watching; and if the daughters of Shiloh come out to take part in the dances, then come from the vine-gardens and take a wife for every one of you from among the daughters of Shiloh, and go back to the land of Benjamin.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: And when their fathers or their brothers come and make trouble, you are to say to them, Give them to us as an act of grace; for we did not take them as wives for ourselves in war; and if you yourselves had given them to us you would have been responsible for the broken oath.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: So the men of Benjamin did this, and got wives for themselves for every one of their number, taking them away by force from the dance; then they went back to their heritage, building up their towns and living in them.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: Then the children of Israel went away from there, every man to his tribe and his family, every man went back to his heritage.

title: Judges Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: In those days there was no king in Israel: every man did what seemed right to him.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Now there came a time, in the days of the judges, when there was no food in the land. And a certain man went from Beth-lehem-judah, he and his wife and his two sons, to make a living-place in the country of Moab.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: And the name of the man was Elimelech, and the name of his wife Naomi, and the name of his two sons Mahlon and Chilion, Ephrathites of Beth-lehem-judah. And they came into the country of Moab, and were there for some time.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: And Elimelech, Naomi's husband, came to his end; and only her two sons were with her.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And they took two women of Moab as their wives: the name of the one was Orpah, and the name of the other Ruth; and they went on living there for about ten years.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And Mahlon and Chilion came to their end; and the woman was without her two sons and her husband.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: So she and her daughters-in-law got ready to go back from the country of Moab, for news had come to her in the country of Moab that the Lord, in mercy for his people, had given them food.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And she went out of the place where she was, and her two daughters-in-law with her; and they went on their way to go back to the land of Judah.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And Naomi said to her two daughters-in-law, Go back to your mothers' houses: may the Lord be good to you as you have been good to the dead and to me:

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: May the Lord give you rest in the houses of your husbands. Then she gave them a kiss; and they were weeping bitterly.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And they said to her, No, but we will go back with you to your people.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: But Naomi said, Go back, my daughters; why will you come with me? Have I more sons in my body, to become your husbands?

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: Go back, my daughters, and go on your way; I am so old now that I may not have another husband. If I said, I have hopes, if I had a husband tonight, and might have sons,

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Would you keep yourselves till they were old enough? would you keep from having husbands for them? No, my daughters; but I am very sad for you that the hand of the Lord is against me.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: Then again they were weeping; and Orpah gave her mother-in-law a kiss, but Ruth would not be parted from her.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And Naomi said, See, your sister-in-law has gone back to her people and to her gods: go back after your sister-in-law.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: But Ruth said, Give up requesting me to go away from you, or to go back without you: for where you go I will go; and where you take your rest I will take my rest; your people will be my people, and your God my God.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: Wherever death comes to you, death will come to me, and there will be my last resting-place; the Lord do so to me and more if we are parted by anything but death.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And when she saw that Ruth was strong in her purpose to go with her she said no more.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: So the two of them went on till they came to Beth-lehem. And when they came to Beth-lehem all the town was moved about them, and they said, Is this Naomi?

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: And she said to them, Do not let my name be Naomi, but Mara, for the Ruler of all has given me a bitter fate.

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: I went out full, and the Lord has sent me back again with nothing; why do you give me the name Naomi, seeing that the Lord has given witness against me, and the Ruler of all has sent sorrow on me?

title: Ruth Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: So Naomi came back out of the country of Moab, and Ruth the Moabitess, her daughter-in-law, with her; and they came to Beth-lehem in the first days of the grain-cutting.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And Naomi had a relation of her husband, a man of wealth, of the family of Elimelech; and his name was Boaz.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And Ruth the Moabitess said to Naomi, Now let me go into the field and take up the heads of grain after him in whose eyes I may have grace. And she said to her, Go, my daughter.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And she went, and came and took up the heads of grain in the field after the cutters; and by chance she went into that part of the field which was the property of Boaz, who was of the family of Elimelech.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And Boaz came from Beth-lehem, and said to the grain-cutters, The Lord be with you. And they made answer, The Lord give you his blessing.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: Then Boaz said to his servant who was in authority over the cutters, Whose girl is this?

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: And the servant who was in authority over the cutters said, It is a Moabite girl who came back with Naomi out of the country of Moab;

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And she said to me, Let me come into the grain-field and take up the grain after the cutters. So she came, and has been here from morning till now, without resting even for a minute.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: Then said Boaz to Ruth, Give ear to me, my daughter: do not go to take up the grain in another field, or go away from here, but keep here by my young women:

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: Keep your eyes on the field they are cutting, and go after them; have I not given orders to the young men not to put a hand on you? And when you are in need of drink go to the vessels and take of what the young men have put there.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: Then she went down on her face to the earth, and said to him, Why have I grace in your eyes, that you give attention to me, seeing I am from a strange people?

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And Boaz answering said to her, I have had news of everything you have done for your mother-in-law after the death of your husband; how you went away from your father and mother and the land of your birth, and came to a people who are strange to you.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: The Lord give you a reward for what you have done, and may a full reward be given to you by the Lord, the God of Israel, under whose wings you have come to take cover.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: Then she said, May I have grace in your eyes, my lord, for you have given me comfort, and you have said kind words to your servant, though I am not like one of your servants.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And at meal-time Boaz said to her, Come here, and take some of the bread, and put your bit into the wine. And she took her seat among the grain-cutters: and he gave her dry grain, and she took it, and there was more than enough for her meal.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And when she got ready to take up the grain, Boaz gave his young men orders, saying, Let her take it even from among the cut grain, and say nothing to her.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And let some heads of grain be pulled out of what has been corded up, and dropped for her to take, and let no sharp word be said to her.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: So she went on getting together the heads of grain till evening; and after crushing out the seed it came to about an ephah of grain.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And she took it up and went into the town; and she let her mother-in-law see what she had got, and after taking enough for herself she gave her the rest.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And her mother-in-law said to her, Where did you take up the grain today, and where were you working? May a blessing be on him who gave such attention to you. And she gave her mother-in-law an account of where she had been working, and said, The name of the man with whom I was working today is Boaz.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: And Naomi said to her daughter-in-law, May the blessing of the Lord, who has at all times been kind to the living and to the dead, be on him. And Naomi said to her, The man is of our family, one of our near relations.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: And Ruth the Moabitess said, Truly, he said to me, Keep near my young men till all my grain is cut.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: And Naomi said to Ruth, her daughter-in-law, It is better, my daughter, for you to go out with his servant-girls, so that no danger may come to you in another field.

title: Ruth Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: So she kept near the servant-girls of Boaz to take up the grain till the cutting of the early grain and the cutting of the late grain were ended; and she went on living with her mother-in-law.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: And Naomi, her mother-in-law, said to her, My daughter, am I not to get you a resting-place where you may be in comfort?

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And now, is there not Boaz, our relation, with whose young women you were? See, tonight he is separating the grain from the waste in his grain-floor.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: So take a bath, and, after rubbing your body with sweet oil, put on your best robe, and go down to the grain-floor; but do not let him see you till he has come to the end of his meal.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: But see to it, when he goes to rest, that you take note of the place where he is sleeping, and go in there, and, uncovering his feet, take your place by him; and he will say what you are to do.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And she said, I will do all you say.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: So she went down to the grain-floor and did all her mother-in-law had said to her.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: Now when Boaz had taken meat and drink, and his heart was glad, he went to take his rest at the end of the mass of grain; then she came softly and, uncovering his feet, went to rest.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Now in the middle of the night, the man awaking from his sleep in fear, and lifting himself up, saw a woman stretched at his feet.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: And he said, Who are you? And she answering said, I am your servant Ruth: take your servant as wife, for you are a near relation.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And he said, May the Lord give you his blessing, my daughter: even better than what you did at the first is this last kind act you have done, in not going after young men, with or without wealth.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And now, my daughter, have no fear; I will do for you whatever you say: for it is clear to all my townspeople that you are a woman of virtue.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Now it is true that I am a near relation: but there is a relation nearer than I.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Take your rest here tonight; and in the morning, if he will do for you what it is right for a relation to do, very well, let him do so: but if he will not, then by the living Lord I myself will do so.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And she took her rest at his feet till the morning: and she got up before it was light enough for one to see another. And he said, Let it not come to anyone's knowledge that the woman came to the grain-floor.
