title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And he said, Take your robe, stretching it out in your hands: and she did so, and he took six measures of grain and put them into it, and gave it her to take: and she went back to the town.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: And when she came back her mother-in-law said to her, How did it go with you, my daughter? And she gave her an account of all the man had done to her.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And she said, He gave me these six measures of grain, saying, Do not go back to your mother-in-law with nothing in your hands.

title: Ruth Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: Then she said, Do nothing now, my daughter, till you see what will come of this; for the man will take no rest till he has put this thing through.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And Boaz went up to the public place of the town, and took his seat there: and the near relation of whom he had been talking came by; and Boaz, crying out to him by name, said, Come and be seated here. And he came and was seated.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: Then he got ten of the responsible men of the town, and said, Be seated here. And they took their seats.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: Then he said to the near relation, Naomi, who has come back from the country of Moab, is offering for a price that bit of land which was our brother Elimelech's:

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And it was in my mind to give you the chance of taking it, with the approval of those seated here and of the responsible men of my people. If you are ready to do what it is right for a relation to do, then do it: but if you will not do it, say so to me now; for there is no one who has the right to do it but you, and after you myself. And he said, I will do it.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Then Boaz said, On the day when you take this field, you will have to take with it Ruth, the Moabitess, the wife of the dead, so that you may keep the name of the dead living in his heritage.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And the near relation said, I am not able to do the relation's part, for fear of damaging the heritage I have: you may do it in my place, for I am not able to do it myself.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: Now, in earlier times this was the way in Israel when property was taken over by a near relation, or when there was a change of owner. To make the exchange certain one man took off his shoe and gave it to the other; and this was a witness in Israel.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: So the near relation said to Boaz, Take it for yourself. And he took off his shoe.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: Then Boaz said to the responsible men and to all the people, You are witnesses today that I have taken at a price from Naomi all the property which was Elimelech's, and everything which was Chilion's and Mahlon's.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: And, further, I have taken Ruth, the Moabitess, who was the wife of Mahlon, to be my wife, to keep the name of the dead man living in his heritage, so that his name may not be cut off from among his countrymen, and from the memory of his town: you are witnesses this day.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And all the people who were in the public place, and the responsible men, said, We are witnesses. May the Lord make this woman, who is about to come into your house, like Rachel and Leah, which two were the builders of the house of Israel: and may you have wealth in Ephrathah, and be great in Beth-lehem;

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: May your family be like the family of Perez, the son whom Tamar gave to Judah, from the offspring which the Lord may give you by this young woman.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: So Boaz took Ruth and she became his wife; and he went in to her, and the Lord made her with child and she gave birth to a son.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: And the women said to Naomi, A blessing on the Lord, who has not let you be this day without a near relation, and may his name be great in Israel.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: He will be a giver of new life to you, and your comforter when you are old, for your daughter-in-law, who, in her love for you, is better than seven sons, has given birth to him.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: And Naomi took the child and put her arms round it, and she took care of it.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: And the women who were her neighbours gave it a name, saying, Naomi has a child; and they gave him the name of Obed: he is the father of Jesse, the father of David.

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: Now these are the generations of Perez: Perez became the father of Hezron;

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: And Hezron became the father of Ram, and Ram became the father of Amminadab;

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: And Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, and Nahshon became the father of Salmon;

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: And Salmon became the father of Boaz, and Boaz became the father of Obed;

title: Ruth Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: And Obed became the father of Jesse, and Jesse became the father of David.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Now there was a certain man of Ramathaim, a Zuphite of the hill-country of Ephraim, named Elkanah; he was the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: And he had two wives, one named Hannah and the other Peninnah: and Peninnah was the mother of children, but Hannah had no children.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Now this man went up from his town every year to give worship and to make offerings to the Lord of armies in Shiloh. And the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, the priests of the Lord, were there.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And when the day came for Elkanah to make his offering, he gave to Peninnah his wife, and to all her sons and daughters, their part of the feast:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: But to Hannah he gave one part, though Hannah was very dear to him, but the Lord had not let her have children.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And the other wife did everything possible to make her unhappy, because the Lord had not let her have children;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And year by year, whenever she went up to the house of the Lord, she kept on attacking her, so that Hannah gave herself up to weeping and would take no food.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Then her husband Elkanah said to her, Hannah, why are you weeping? and why are you taking no food? why is your heart troubled? am I not more to you than ten sons?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: So after they had taken food and wine in the guest room, Hannah got up. Now Eli the priest was seated by the pillars of the doorway of the Temple of the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And with grief in her soul, weeping bitterly, she made her prayer to the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And she made an oath, and said, O Lord of armies, if you will truly take note of the sorrow of your servant, not turning away from me but keeping me in mind, and will give me a man-child, then I will give him to the Lord all the days of his life, and his hair will never be cut.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: Now while she was a long time in prayer before the Lord, Eli was watching her mouth.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: For Hannah's prayer came from her heart, and though her lips were moving she made no sound: so it seemed to Eli that she was overcome with wine.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And Eli said to her, How long are you going to be the worse for drink? Put away the effects of your wine from you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And Hannah, answering him, said, No, my lord, I am a woman whose spirit is broken with sorrow: I have not taken wine or strong drink, but I have been opening my heart before the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: Do not take your servant to be a good-for-nothing woman: for my words have come from my stored-up sorrow and pain.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: Then Eli said to her, Go in peace: and may the God of Israel give you an answer to the prayer you have made to him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And she said, May your servant have grace in your eyes. So the woman went away, and took part in the feast, and her face was no longer sad.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And early in the morning they got up, and after worshipping before the Lord they went back to Ramah, to their house: and Elkanah had connection with his wife; and the Lord kept her in mind.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: Now the time came when Hannah, being with child, gave birth to a son; and she gave him the name Samuel, Because, she said, I made a prayer to the Lord for him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: And the man Elkanah with all his family went up to make the year's offering to the Lord, and to give effect to his oath.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: But Hannah did not go, for she said to her husband, I will not go till the child has been taken from the breast, and then I will take him with me and put him before the Lord, where he may be for ever.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: And her husband Elkanah said to her, Do whatever seems right to you, but not till you have taken him from the breast; only may the Lord do as he has said. So the woman, waiting there, gave her son milk till he was old enough to be taken from the breast.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: Then when she had done so, she took him with her, with a three-year old ox and an ephah of meal and a skin full of wine, and took him to the house of the Lord at Shiloh: now the child was still very young.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: And when they had made an offering of the ox, they took the child to Eli.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: And she said, O my lord, as your soul is living, my lord, I am that woman who was making a prayer to the Lord here by your side:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: My prayer was for this child; and the Lord has given him to me in answer to my request:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 28
text: So I have given him to the Lord; for all his life he is the Lord's. Then he gave the Lord worship there.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And Hannah, in prayer before the Lord, said, My heart is glad in the Lord, my horn is lifted up in the Lord: my mouth is open wide over my haters; because my joy is in your salvation.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: No other is holy as the Lord, for there is no other God but you: there is no Rock like our God.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: Say no more words of pride; let not uncontrolled sayings come out of your mouths: for the Lord is a God of knowledge, by him acts are judged.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: The bows of the men of war are broken, and the feeble are clothed with strength.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: Those who were full are offering themselves as servants for bread; those who were in need are at rest; truly, she who had no children has become the mother of seven; and she who had a family is wasted with sorrow.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: The Lord is the giver of death and life: sending men down to the underworld and lifting them up.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: The Lord gives wealth and takes a man's goods from him: crushing men down and again lifting them up;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: Lifting the poor out of the dust, and him who is in need out of the lowest place, to give them their place among rulers, and for their heritage the seat of glory: for the pillars of the earth are the Lord's and he has made them the base of the world.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: He will keep the feet of his holy ones, but the evil-doers will come to their end in the dark night, for by strength no man will overcome.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: Those who make war against the Lord will be broken; against them he will send his thunder from heaven: the Lord will be judge of the ends of the earth, he will give strength to his king, lifting up the horn of him on whom the holy oil has been put.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: Then Elkanah went to Ramah to his house. And the child became the servant of the Lord under the direction of Eli the priest.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: Now the sons of Eli were evil and good-for-nothing men, having no knowledge of the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And the priests' way with the people was this: when any man made an offering, the priest's servant came while the flesh was being cooked, having in his hand a meat-hook with three teeth;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: This he put into the pot, and everything which came up on the hook the priest took for himself. This they did in Shiloh to all the Israelites who came there.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And more than this, before the fat was burned, the priest's servant would come and say to the man who was making the offering, Give me some of the flesh to be cooked for the priest; he has no taste for meat cooked in water, but would have you give it uncooked.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And if the man said to him, First let the fat be burned, then take as much as you will; then the servant would say, No, you are to give it to me now, or I will take it by force.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: And the sin of these young men was very great before the Lord; for they gave no honour to the Lord's offerings.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: But Samuel did the work of the Lord's house, while he was a child, dressed in a linen ephod.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And his mother made him a little robe and took it to him every year when she came with her husband for the year's offering.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: And every year Eli gave Elkanah and his wife a blessing, saying, May the Lord give you offspring by this woman in exchange for the child you have given to the Lord. And they went back to their house.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: And the Lord had mercy on Hannah and she gave birth to three sons and two daughters. And the young Samuel became older before the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: Now Eli was very old; and he had news from time to time of what his sons were doing to all Israel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: And he said to them, Why are you doing such things? for from all this people I get accounts of your evil ways.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: No, my sons, the account which is given me, which the Lord's people are sending about, is not good.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: If one man does wrong to another, God will be his judge: but if a man's sin is against the Lord, who will take up his cause? But they gave no attention to the voice of their father, for it was the Lord's purpose to send destruction on them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: And the young Samuel, becoming older, had the approval of the Lord and of men.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 27
text: And a man of God came to Eli and said to him, The Lord says, Did I let myself be seen by your father's people when they were in Egypt, servants in Pharaoh's house?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 28
text: Did I take him out of all the tribes of Israel to be my priest and to go up to my altar to make the smoke of the offerings go up and to take up the ephod? Did I give to your father's family all the offerings made by fire by the children of Israel?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 29
text: Why then are you looking with envy on my offerings of meat and of meal which were ordered by my word, honouring your sons before me, and making yourselves fat with all the best of the offerings of Israel, my people?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 30
text: For this reason the Lord God of Israel has said, Truly I did say that your family and your father's people would have their place before me for ever: but now the Lord says, Let it not be so; I will give honour to those by whom I am honoured, and those who have no respect for me will be of small value in my eyes.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 31
text: See, the days are coming when your arm and the arm of your father's people will be cut off;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 32
text: And never again will there be an old man in your family.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 33
text: But one man of your family will not be cut off by my hand, and his eyes will be made dark, and grief will be in his heart: and all the offspring of your family will come to their end by the sword of men.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 34
text: And this will be the sign to you, which will come on Hophni and Phinehas, your sons; death will overtake them on the same day.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 35
text: And I will make a true priest for myself, one who will do what is in my heart and in my mind: and I will make for him a family which will not come to an end; and his place will be before my holy one for ever.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 36
text: Then it will be that the rest of your family, anyone who has not been cut off, will go down on his knees to him for a bit of silver or a bit of bread, and say, Be pleased to put me into one of the priest's places so that I may have a little food.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Now the young Samuel was the servant of the Lord before Eli. In those days the Lord kept his word secret from men; there was no open vision.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And at that time, when Eli was resting in his place, (now his eyes were becoming clouded so that he was not able to see,)

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: And the light of God was still burning, while Samuel was sleeping in the Temple of the Lord where the ark of God was,

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: The voice of the Lord said Samuel's name; and he said, Here am I.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And running to Eli he said, Here am I, for you said my name. And Eli said, I did not say your name; go to your rest again. So he went back to his bed.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And again the Lord said, Samuel. And Samuel got up and went to Eli and said, Here am I; for you certainly said my name. But he said in answer, I said nothing, my son; go to your rest again.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: Now at that time Samuel had no knowledge of the Lord, and the revelation of the word of the Lord had not come to him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And for the third time the Lord said Samuel's name. And he got up and went to Eli and said, Here am I; for you certainly said my name. Then it was clear to Eli that the voice which had said the child's name was the Lord's.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: So Eli said to Samuel, Go back: and if the voice comes again, let your answer be, Say on, Lord; for the ears of your servant are open. So Samuel went back to his bed.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: Then the Lord came and said as before, Samuel, Samuel. Then Samuel made answer, Say on, Lord; for the ears of your servant are open.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And the Lord said to Samuel, See, I will do a thing in Israel at which the ears of everyone hearing of it will be burning.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: In that day I will do to Eli everything which I have said about his family, from first to last.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And you are to say to him that I will send punishment on his family for ever, for the sin which he had knowledge of; because his sons have been cursing God and he had no control over them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: So I have made an oath to the family of Eli that no offering of meat or of meal which they may make will ever take away the sin of his family.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And Samuel kept where he was, not moving till the time came for opening the doors of the house of God in the morning. And fear kept him from giving Eli an account of his vision.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Then Eli said, Samuel, my son. And Samuel answering said, Here am I.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And he said, What did the Lord say to you? Do not keep it from me: may God's punishment be on you if you keep from me anything he said to you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: Then Samuel gave him an account of everything, keeping nothing back. And he said, It is the Lord; let him do what seems good to him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: And Samuel became older, and the Lord was with him and let not one of his words be without effect.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: And it was clear to all Israel from Dan to Beer-sheba that Samuel had been made a prophet of the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: And the Lord was seen again in Shiloh; for the Lord gave to Samuel in Shiloh the revelation of his word.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Now at that time the Philistines came together to make war against Israel, and the men of Israel went out to war against the Philistines and took up their position at the side of Eben-ezer: and the Philistines put their forces in position in Aphek.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And the Philistines put their forces in order against Israel, and the fighting was hard, and Israel was overcome by the Philistines, who put to the sword about four thousand of their army in the field.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And when the people came back to their tents, the responsible men of Israel said, Why has the Lord let the Philistines overcome us today? Let us get the ark of the Lord's agreement here from Shiloh, so that it may be with us and give us salvation from the hands of those who are against us.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: So the people sent to Shiloh and got the ark of the agreement of the Lord of armies whose resting-place is between the winged ones; and Hophni and Phinehas, the two sons of Eli, were there with the ark of God's agreement.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: And when the ark of the Lord's agreement came into the tent-circle, all Israel gave a great cry, so that the earth was sounding with it.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And the Philistines, hearing the noise of their cry, said, What is this great cry among the tents of the Hebrews? Then it became clear to them that the ark of the Lord had come to the tent-circle.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And the Philistines, full of fear, said, God has come into their tents. And they said, Trouble is ours! for never before has such a thing been seen.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: Trouble is ours! Who will give us salvation from the hands of these great gods? These are the gods who sent all sorts of blows on the Egyptians in the waste land.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: Be strong, O Philistines, be men! Do not be servants to the Hebrews as they have been to you: go forward to the fight without fear.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: So the Philistines went to the fight, and Israel was overcome, and every man went in flight to his tent: and great was the destruction, for thirty thousand footmen of Israel were put to the sword.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And the ark of God was taken; and Hophni and Phinehas, the sons of Eli, were put to the sword.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And a man of Benjamin went running from the fight and came to Shiloh the same day with his clothing out of order and earth on his head.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And when he came, Eli was seated by the wayside watching: and in his heart was fear for the ark of God. And when the man came into the town and gave the news, there was a great outcry.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: And Eli, hearing the noise and the cries, said, What is the reason of this outcry? And the man came quickly and gave the news to Eli.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: Now Eli was ninety-eight years old, and his eyes were fixed so that he was not able to see.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: And the man said to Eli, I have come from the army and have come in flight today from the fight. And he said, How did it go, my son?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: And the man said, Israel went in flight from the Philistines, and there has been great destruction among the people, and your two sons, Hophni and Phinehas, are dead, and the ark of God has been taken.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: And at these words about the ark of God, Eli, falling back off his seat by the side of the doorway into the town, came down on the earth so that his neck was broken and death overtook him, for he was an old man and of great weight. He had been judging Israel for forty years.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: And his daughter-in-law, the wife of Phinehas, was with child and near the time when she would give birth; and when she had the news that the ark of God had been taken and that her father-in-law and her husband were dead, her pains came on her suddenly and she gave birth.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: And when she was very near death the women who were with her said, Have no fear, for you have given birth to a son. But she made no answer and gave no attention to it.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: And she gave the child the name of Ichabod, saying, The glory has gone from Israel: because the ark of God was taken and because of her father-in-law and her husband.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: And she said, The glory is gone from Israel, for the ark of God has been taken.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Now the Philistines, having taken the ark of God, took it with them from Eben-ezer to Ashdod.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: They took the ark of God into the house of Dagon and put it by the side of Dagon.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: And when the people of Ashdod got up early on the morning after, they saw that Dagon had come down to the earth on his face before the ark of the Lord. And they took Dagon up and put him in his place again.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: And when they got up early on the morning after, Dagon had come down to the earth on his face before the ark of the Lord; and his head and his hands were broken off on the doorstep; only the base was in its place.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: So to this day no priest of Dagon, or any who come into Dagon's house, will put his foot on the doorstep of the house of Dagon in Ashdod.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: But the hand of the Lord was hard on the people of Ashdod and he sent disease on them through all the country of Ashdod.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: And when the men of Ashdod saw how it was, they said, Let not the ark of the God of Israel be with us, for his hand is hard on us and on Dagon our god.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: So they sent for all the lords of the Philistines to come together there, and said, What are we to do with the ark of the God of Israel? And their answer was, Let the ark of the God of Israel be taken away to Gath. So they took the ark of the God of Israel away.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: But after they had taken it away, the hand of the Lord was stretched out against the town for its destruction: and the signs of disease came out on all the men of the town, small and great.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: So they sent the ark of God to Ekron. And when the ark of God came to Ekron, the people of the town made an outcry, saying, They have sent the ark of the God of Israel to us for the destruction of us and of our people.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: So they sent and got together all the lords of the Philistines, and they said, Send away the ark of the God of Israel, and let it go back to its place, so that it may not be the cause of death to us and to our people: for there was a great fear of death through all the town; the hand of God was very hard on them there.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: And those men who were not overtaken by death were cruelly diseased: and the cry of the town went up to heaven.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Now the ark of the Lord was in the country of the Philistines for seven months.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: And the Philistines sent for the priests and those who were wise in secret arts, and said to them, What are we to do with the ark of the Lord? How are we to send it away to its place?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: And they said, If you send away the ark of the God of Israel, do not send it without an offering, but send him a sin-offering with it: then you will have peace again, and it will be clear to you why the weight of his hand has not been lifted from you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: Then they said, What sin-offering are we to send to him? And they said, Five gold images of the growths caused by your disease and five gold mice, one for every lord of the Philistines: for the same disease came on you and on your lords.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: So make images of the growths caused by your disease and of the mice which are damaging your land; and give glory to the God of Israel: it may be that the weight of his hand will be lifted from you and from your gods and from your land.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: Why do you make your hearts hard, like the hearts of Pharaoh and the Egyptians? When he had made sport of them, did they not let the people go, and they went away?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: So now, take and make ready a new cart, and two cows which have never come under the yoke, and have the cows yoked to the cart, and take their young ones away from them:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: And put the ark of the Lord on the cart, and the gold images which you are sending as a sin-offering in a chest by its side; and send it away so that it may go.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: If it goes by the land of Israel to Beth-shemesh, then this great evil is his work; but if not, then we may be certain that the evil was not his doing, but was the working of chance.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And the men did so; they took two cows, yoking them to the cart and shutting up their young ones in their living-place:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And they put the ark of the Lord on the cart and the chest with the gold images.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And the cows took the straight way, by the road to Beth-shemesh; they went by the highway, not turning to the right or to the left, and the sound of their voices was clear on the road; and the lords of the Philistines went after them as far as the edge of Beth-shemesh.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And the people of Beth-shemesh were cutting their grain in the valley, and lifting up their eyes they saw the ark and were full of joy when they saw it.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: And the cart came into the field of Joshua the Beth-shemite, and came to a stop there by a great stone: and cutting up the wood of the cart they made a burned offering of the cows to the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: Then the Levites took down the ark of the Lord and the chest in which were the gold images, and put them on the great stone: and the men of Beth-shemesh made burned offerings and gave worship that day before the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: And the five lords of the Philistines, having seen it, went back to Ekron the same day.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: Now these are the gold images which the Philistines sent as a sin-offering to the Lord; one for Ashdod, one for Gaza, one for Ashkelon, one for Gath, one for Ekron;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: And the gold mice, one for every town of the Philistines, the property of the five lords, walled towns as well as country places: and the great stone where they put the ark of the Lord is still in the field of Joshua the Beth-shemite to this day.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: But the Lord sent destruction on seventy men of the people of Beth-shemesh for looking into the ark of the Lord; and great was the sorrow of the people for the destruction which the Lord had sent on them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: And the men of Beth-shemesh said, Who is able to keep his place before the Lord, this holy God? and to whom may he go from us?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: And they sent men to the people living in Kiriath-jearim, saying, The Philistines have sent back the ark of the Lord; come and take it up to your country.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: So the men of Kiriath-jearim came and took the ark of the Lord to the house of Abinadab in Gibeah, and they made his son Eleazar holy and put the ark in his care.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And the ark was in Kiriath-jearim for a long time, as much as twenty years: and all Israel was searching after the Lord with weeping.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Then Samuel said to all Israel, If with all your hearts you would come back to the Lord, then put away all the strange gods and the Astartes from among you, and let your hearts be turned to the Lord, and be servants to him only: and he will make you safe from the hands of the Philistines.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: So the children of Israel gave up the worship of Baal and Astarte, and became worshippers of the Lord only.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: Then Samuel said, Let all Israel come to Mizpah and I will make prayer to the Lord for you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: So they came together to Mizpah, and got water, draining it out before the Lord, and they took no food that day, and they said, We have done evil against the Lord. And Samuel was judge of the children of Israel in Mizpah.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: Now when the Philistines had news that the children of Israel had come together at Mizpah, the lords of the Philistines went up against Israel. And the children of Israel, hearing of it, were full of fear.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: And the children of Israel said to Samuel, Go on crying to the Lord our God for us to make us safe from the hands of the Philistines.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: And Samuel took a young lamb, offering all of it as a burned offering to the Lord; and Samuel made prayers to the Lord for Israel and the Lord gave him an answer.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And while Samuel was offering the burned offering, the Philistines came near for the attack on Israel; but at the thunder of the Lord's voice that day the Philistines were overcome with fear, and they gave way before Israel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: And the men of Israel went out from Mizpah and went after the Philistines, attacking them till they came under Beth-car.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: Then Samuel took a stone and put it up between Mizpah and Jeshanah, naming it Eben-ezer, and saying, Up to now the Lord has been our help.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: So the Philistines were overcome, and did not come into the country of Israel again: and all the days of Samuel the hand of the Lord was against the Philistines.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: And the towns which the Philistines had taken were given back to Israel, from Ekron to Gath, and all the country round them Israel made free from the power of the Philistines. And there was peace between Israel and the Amorites.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: And Samuel was judge of Israel all the days of his life.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: From year to year he went in turn to Beth-el and Gilgal and Mizpah, judging Israel in all those places.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: And his base was at Ramah, where his house was; there he was judge of Israel and there he made an altar to the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: Now when Samuel was old, he made his sons judges over Israel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: The name of his first son was Joel and the name of his second Abijah: they were judges in Beer-sheba.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And his sons did not go in his ways, but moved by the love of money took rewards, and were not upright in judging.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: Then all the responsible men of Israel got together and went to Samuel at Ramah,

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And said to him, See now, you are old, and your sons do not go in your ways: give us a king now to be our judge, so that we may be like the other nations.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: But Samuel was not pleased when they said to him, Give us a king to be our judge. And Samuel made prayer to the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And the Lord said to Samuel, Give ear to the voice of the people and what they say to you: they have not been turned away from you, but they have been turned away from me, not desiring me to be king over them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: As they have done from the first, from the day when I took them out of Egypt till this day, turning away from me and worshipping other gods, so now they are acting in the same way to you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: Give ear now to their voice: but make a serious protest to them, and give them a picture of the sort of king who will be their ruler.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And Samuel said all these words of the Lord to the people who were desiring a king.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And he said, This is the sort of king who will be your ruler: he will take your sons and make them his servants, his horsemen, and drivers of his war-carriages, and they will go running before his war-carriages;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And he will make them captains of thousands and of fifties; some he will put to work ploughing and cutting his grain and making his instruments of war and building his war-carriages.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: Your daughters he will take to be makers of perfumes and cooks and bread-makers.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: He will take your fields and your vine-gardens and your olive-gardens, all the best of them, and give them to his servants.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: He will take a tenth of your seed and of the fruit of your vines and give it to his servants.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: He will take your men-servants and your servant-girls, and the best of your oxen and your asses and put them to his work.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: He will take a tenth of your sheep: and you will be his servants.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: Then you will be crying out because of your king whom you have taken for yourselves; but the Lord will not give you an answer in that day.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: But the people gave no attention to the voice of Samuel; and they said, No, but we will have a king over us,

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: So that we may be like the other nations, and so that our king may be our judge and go out before us to war.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: Then Samuel, after hearing all the people had to say, went and gave an account of it to the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: And the Lord said to Samuel, Give ear to their voice and make a king for them. Then Samuel said to the men of Israel, Let every man go back to his town.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: Now there was a man of Benjamin named Kish, the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Becorath, the son of Aphiah, a Benjamite, a man of wealth.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: He had a son named Saul, a specially good-looking young man; there was no one better-looking among the children of Israel: he was taller by a head than any other of the people.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: Now the asses of Saul's father Kish had gone wandering away. And Kish said to his son Saul, Take one of the servants with you, and get up and go in search of the asses.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: So they went through the hill-country of Ephraim and through the land of Shalishah, but they saw no sign of them: then they went through the land of Shaalim, but they were not there: and they went through the land of the Benjamites, but they did not come across them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: And when they had come to the land of Zuph, Saul said to the servant who was with him, Come, let us go back, or my father may give up caring about the asses and be troubled about us.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: But the servant said to him, See now, in this town there is a man of God, who is highly honoured, and everything he says comes true: let us go there now; it may be that he will give us directions about our journey.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: Then Saul said to his servant, But if we go, what are we to take the man? all our bread is gone, and we have no offering to take to the man of God: what are we to do?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: But the servant said in answer, I have here a fourth part of a shekel of silver: I will give that to the man of God, and he will give us directions about our way.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: (In the past in Israel, when a man went to get directions from God, he said, Come let us go to the Seer, for he who now is named Prophet was in those days given the name of Seer.)

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: Then Saul said to his servant, You have said well; come, let us go. So they went to the town where the man of God was.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: And when they were on the way up to the town, they saw some young girls going out to get water and said to them, Is the seer here?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And they said, He is; in fact he is before you: go quickly now, for he has come into the town today, for the people are making an offering in the high place today:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: When you come into the town you will see him straight away, before he goes up to the high place for the feast: the people are waiting for his blessing before starting the feast, and after that the guests will take part in it. So go up now and you will see him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: So they went up to the town, and when they came inside the town, Samuel came face to face with them on his way to the high place.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: Now the day before Saul came, the word of God had come to Samuel, saying,

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: Tomorrow about this time I will send you a man from the land of Benjamin, and on him you are to put the holy oil, making him ruler over my people Israel, and he will make my people safe from the hands of the Philistines: for I have seen the sorrow of my people, whose cry has come up to me.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: And when Samuel saw Saul, the Lord said to him, This is the man of whom I gave you word! he it is who is to have authority over my people.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: Then Saul came up to Samuel in the doorway of the town and said, Give me directions, if you will be so good, to the house of the seer.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: Then Samuel said to Saul, I am the seer; go up before me to the high place and take food with me today: and in the morning I will let you go, after opening to you all the secrets of your heart.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: As for your asses which have been wandering for three days, give no thought to them, for they have come back. And for whom are all the desired things in Israel? are they not for you and your father's family?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: And Saul said, Am I not a man of Benjamin, the smallest of all the tribes of Israel? and my family the least of the families of Benjamin? why then do you say these words to me?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: Then Samuel took Saul and his servant into the guest room, and made them take the chief place among all the guests who were there, about thirty persons.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: And Samuel said to the cook, Give me that part which I gave you orders to keep by you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: And the cook took up the leg with the fat tail on it, and put it before Saul. And Samuel said, This is the part which has been kept for you: take it as your part of the feast; because it has been kept for you till the right time came and till the guests were present. So that day Saul took food with Samuel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: And when they had come down from the high place into the town, where a bed was made ready for Saul, he went to rest.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: And about dawn Samuel said to Saul on the roof, Get up so that I may send you away. So Saul got up, and he and Samuel went out together.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: And on their way down to the end of the town, Samuel said to Saul, Give your servant orders to go on in front of us, (so he went on,) but you keep here, so that I may give you the word of God.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Then Samuel took the bottle of oil, and put the oil on his head and gave him a kiss and said, Is not the Lord with the holy oil making you ruler over Israel, his people? and you will have authority over the people of the Lord, and you will make them safe from the hands of their attackers round about them, and this will be the sign for you:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: When you have gone away from me today, you will see two men by the resting-place of Rachel's body, in the land of Benjamin at Zelzah; and they will say to you, The asses which you went in search of have come back, and now your father, caring no longer for the asses, is troubled about you, saying, What am I to do about my son?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: Then you are to go on from there, and when you come to the oak-tree of Tabor, you will see three men going up to God to Beth-el, one having with him three young goats and another three cakes of bread and another a skin full of wine:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: They will say, Peace be with you, and will give you two cakes of bread, which you are to take from them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: After that you will come to Gibeah, the hill of God, where an armed force of the Philistines is stationed: and when you come to the town, you will see a band of prophets coming down from the high place with instruments of music before them; and they will be acting like prophets:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: And the spirit of the Lord will come on you with power, and you will be acting like a prophet with them, and will be changed into another man.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And when these signs come to you, see that you take the chance which is offered you; for God is with you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: Then you are to go down before me to Gilgal, where I will come to you, for the offering of burned offerings and peace-offerings: go on waiting there for seven days till I come to you and make clear to you what you have to do.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: And it came about, that when he went away from Samuel, God gave him a changed heart: and all those signs took place that day.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And when they came to Gibeah, a band of prophets came face to face with him; and the spirit of God came on him with power and he took his place among them as a prophet.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: Now when Saul's old friends saw him among the band of prophets, the people said to one another, What has come to Saul, the son of Kish? Is even Saul among the prophets?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: And one of the people of that place said in answer, And who is their father? So it became a common saying, Is even Saul among the prophets?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: Then going away from the prophets, he came to the house.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: And Saul's father's brother said to him and his servant, Where have you been? And he said, Searching for the asses: and when we saw no sign of them, we came to Samuel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: Then he said, And what did Samuel say to you?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: And Saul, answering him, said, He gave us word that the asses had come back. But he said nothing to him of Samuel's words about the kingdom.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: Then Samuel sent for the people to come together before the Lord at Mizpah;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: And he said to the children of Israel, The Lord, the God of Israel, has said, I took Israel out of Egypt, and made you free from the hands of the Egyptians and from all the kingdoms which kept you down:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: But today you are turned away from your God, who himself has been your saviour from all your troubles and sorrows; and you have said to him, Put a king over us. So now, take your places before the Lord by your tribes and by your thousands.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: So Samuel made all the tribes of Israel come near, and the tribe of Benjamin was taken.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: Then he made the tribe of Benjamin come near by families, and the family of the Matrites was taken: and from them, Saul, the son of Kish, was taken: but when they went in search of him he was nowhere to be seen.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: So they put another question to the Lord, Is the man present here? And the answer of the Lord was, He is keeping himself from view among the goods.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: So they went quickly and made him come out; and when he took his place among the people, he was taller by a head than any of the people.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: And Samuel said to all the people, Do you see the man of the Lord's selection, how there is no other like him among all the people? And all the people with loud cries said, Long life to the king!

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: Then Samuel gave the people the laws of the kingdom, writing them in a book which he put in a safe place before the Lord. And Samuel sent all the people away, every man to his house.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: And Saul went to Gibeah, to his house; and with him went the men of war whose hearts had been touched by God.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: But certain good-for-nothing persons said, How is this man to be our saviour? And having no respect for him, they gave him no offering.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Then about a month after this, Nahash the Ammonite came up and put his forces in position for attacking Jabesh-gilead: and all the men of Jabesh said to Nahash, Make an agreement with us and we will be your servants.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: And Nahash the Ammonite said to them, I will make an agreement with you on this condition, that all your right eyes are put out; so that I may make it a cause of shame to all Israel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: Then the responsible men of Jabesh said to him, Give us seven days, so that we may send men to every part of Israel: and then, if no one comes to our help, we will come out to you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: So they sent representatives to Saul's town Gibeah, and these gave the news to the people: and all the people gave themselves to weeping.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: Now Saul came from the field, driving the oxen before him; and he said, Why are the people weeping? And they gave him word of what the men of Jabesh had said.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And at their words, the spirit of God came on Saul with power, and he became very angry.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: And he took two oxen and, cutting them up, sent them through all the land of Israel by the hand of runners, saying, If any man does not come out after Saul and Samuel, this will be done to his oxen. And the fear of the Lord came on the people and they came out like one man.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: And he had them numbered in Bezek: the children of Israel were three hundred thousand, and the men of Judah thirty thousand.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: Then he said to the representatives who had come, Say to the men of Jabesh-gilead, Tomorrow, by the time the sun is high, you will be made safe. And the representatives came and gave the news to the men of Jabesh; and they were glad.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: So the men of Jabesh said, Tomorrow we will come out to you, and you may do to us whatever seems good to you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: Now on the day after, Saul put the people into three bands, and in the morning watch they came to the tents of the Ammonites, and they went on attacking them till the heat of the day: and those who were not put to death were put to flight in every direction, so that no two of them were together.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And the people said to Samuel, Who was it who said, Is Saul to be our king? give the men up, so that we may put them to death.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: And Saul said, Not a man is to be put to death today: for today the Lord has made Israel safe.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: Then Samuel said to the people, Come, let us go to Gilgal and there make the kingdom strong in the hands of Saul.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: So all the people went to Gilgal; and there in Gilgal they made Saul king before the Lord; and peace-offerings were offered before the Lord; and there Saul and all the men of Israel were glad with great joy.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: And Samuel said to all Israel, You see that I have given ear to everything you said to me, and have made a king over you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: And now, see, the king is before you: and I am old and grey-headed, and my sons are with you: I have been living before your eyes from my early days till now.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: Here I am: give witness against me before the Lord and before the man on whom he has put the holy oil: whose ox or ass have I taken? to whom have I been untrue? who has been crushed down by me? from whose hand have I taken a price for the blinding of my eyes? I will give it all back to you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: And they said, You have never been untrue to us or cruel to us; you have taken nothing from any man.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: Then he said, The Lord is witness against you, and the man on whom he has put the holy oil is witness this day that you have seen no wrong in me. And they said, He is witness.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: And Samuel said to the people, The Lord is witness, who gave authority to Moses and Aaron, and who took your fathers up out of the land of Egypt.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: Keep your places now, while I take up the argument with you before the Lord, and give you the story of the righteousness of the Lord, which he has made clear by his acts to you and to your fathers.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: When Jacob and his sons had come into Egypt, and were crushed by the Egyptians, the prayers of your fathers came up to the Lord, and the Lord sent Moses and Aaron, who took your fathers out of Egypt, and he put them into this place.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: But they were false to the Lord their God, and he gave them up into the hands of Sisera, captain of the army of Jabin, king of Hazor, and into the hands of the Philistines, and into the hands of the king of Moab, who made war against them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: Then crying out to the Lord, they said, We have done evil, because we have been turned away from the Lord, worshipping the Baals and the Astartes: but now, make us safe from those who are against us and we will be your servants.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: So the Lord sent Jerubbaal and Barak and Jephthah and Samuel and took you out of the power of those who were fighting against you on every side, and made you safe.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: And when you saw that Nahash, the king of the Ammonites, was coming against you, you said to me, No more of this; we will have a king for our ruler: when the Lord your God was your king.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: Here, then, is the king marked out by you: the Lord has put a king over you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: If in the fear of the Lord you are his servants, hearing his voice and not going against the orders of the Lord, but being true to the Lord your God, you and the king ruling over you, then all will be well:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: But if you do not give ear to the voice of the Lord, but go against his orders, then the hand of the Lord will be against you and against your king for your destruction, as it was against your fathers.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: Now keep where you are and see this great thing which the Lord will do before your eyes.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: Is it not now the time of the grain cutting? My cry will go up to the Lord and he will send thunder and rain: so that you may see and be conscious of your great sin which you have done in the eyes of the Lord in desiring a king for yourselves.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: So Samuel made prayer to the Lord; and the Lord sent thunder and rain that day: and all the people were in fear of the Lord and of Samuel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: And all the people said to Samuel, Make prayer for us to the Lord your God so that death may not overtake us: for in addition to all our sins we have done this evil, in desiring a king.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: Then Samuel said to the people, Have no fear: truly you have done evil, but do not be turned away from the Lord; be his servants with all your heart;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: And do not go from the right way turning to those false gods in which there is no profit and no salvation, for they are false.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: For the Lord will not give his people up, because of the honour of his name; for it was the Lord's pleasure to make of you a people for himself.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: And as for me, never will I go against the orders of the Lord by giving up my prayers for you: but I will go on teaching you the good and right way.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: Only go in the fear of the Lord, and be his true servants with all your heart, keeping in mind what great things he has done for you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: But if you still do evil, destruction will overtake you and your king.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: And Saul took for himself three thousand men of Israel, of whom he kept two thousand with him in Michmash and in the mountain of Beth-el, and a thousand were with Jonathan in Gibeah in the land of Benjamin: the rest of the people he sent back to their tents.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: And Jonathan made an attack on the armed force of the Philistines stationed at Gibeah; and news was given to the Philistines that the Hebrews were turned against them. And Saul had a horn sounded through all the land,

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: And all Israel had the news that Saul had made an attack on the Philistines, and that Israel was bitterly hated by the Philistines. And the people came together after Saul to Gilgal.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: And the Philistines came together to make war on Israel, three thousand war-carriages and six thousand horsemen and an army of people like the sands of the sea in number: they came up and took up their position in Michmash, to the east of Beth-aven.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: When the men of Israel saw the danger they were in, (for the people were troubled,) they took cover in cracks in the hillsides and in the woods and in rocks and holes and hollows.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: And a great number of the people had gone over Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead; but Saul was still in Gilgal, and all the people went after him shaking in fear.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: And he went on waiting there for seven days, the time fixed by Samuel: but Samuel did not come to Gilgal; and the people were starting to go away from him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: Then Saul said, Come here and give me the burned offering and the peace-offerings. And he made a burned offering to the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: And when the burned offering was ended, Samuel came; and Saul went out to see him and to give him a blessing.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: And Samuel said, What have you done? And Saul said, Because I saw that the people were going away from me, and you had not come at the time which had been fixed, and the Philistines had come together at Michmash;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: I said, Now the Philistines will come down on me at Gilgal, and I have made no prayer for help to the Lord: and so, forcing myself to do it, I made a burned offering.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: And Samuel said to Saul, You have done a foolish thing: you have not kept the rules which the Lord your God gave you; it was the purpose of the Lord to make your authority over Israel safe for ever.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: But now, your authority will not go on: the Lord, searching for a man who is pleasing to him in every way, has given him the place of ruler over his people, because you have not done what the Lord gave you orders to do.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: Then Samuel went up from Gilgal and the rest of the people went up after Saul against the men of war, and they came from Gilgal to Gibeah in the land of Benjamin: and Saul took the number of the people who were with him, about six hundred men.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: And Saul, with Jonathan his son and the people who were with them, was waiting in Geba in the land of Benjamin: but the tents of the Philistines were in Michmash.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: And three bands of men came out from the Philistines to make an attack; one band went by the road which goes to Ophrah, into the land of Shual:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: And another went in the direction of Beth-horon: and another went by the hill looking down on the valley of Zeboiim, in the direction of the waste land.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: Now there was no iron-worker in all the land of Israel: for the Philistines said, For fear the Hebrews make themselves swords or spears:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: But all the Israelites had to go to the Philistines to get their ploughs and blades and axes and hooks made sharp;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: For they had instruments for putting an edge on their ploughs and blades and forks and axes, and for putting iron points on their ox-driving rods.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: So on the day of the fight at Michmash, not a sword or a spear was to be seen in the hands of any of the people with Saul and Jonathan: only Saul and his son Jonathan had them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: And the armed force of the Philistines went out to the narrow way of Michmash.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: Now one day Jonathan, the son of Saul, said to the young man who was with him, looking after his arms, Come, let us go over to the Philistine force over there. But he said nothing to his father.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: And Saul was still waiting in the farthest part of Geba, under the fruit-tree in Migron: there were about six hundred men with him;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: And Ahijah, the son of Ahitub, brother of Ichabod, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eli, the priest of the Lord in Shiloh, who had the ephod. And the people had no idea that Jonathan had gone.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: Now between the narrow roads over the mountains by which Jonathan was making his way to the Philistines' forces, there was a sharp overhanging rock on one side, and a sharp rock on the other side: one was named Bozez and the other Seneh.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: The one rock went up on the north in front of Michmash and the other on the south in front of Geba.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: And Jonathan said to his young servant who had his arms, Come, let us go over to the armies of these men who have no circumcision: it may be that the Lord will give us help, for there is no limit to his power; the Lord is able to give salvation by a great army or by a small band.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: And his servant said to him, Do whatever is in your mind: see, I am with you in every impulse of your heart.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: Then Jonathan said, Now we will go over to these men and let them see us.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: If they say to us, Keep quiet where you are till we come to you; then we will keep our places and not go up to them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: But if they say, Come up to us; then we will go up, for the Lord has given them into our hands: and this will be the sign to us.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: And they let the Philistine force see the two of them: and the Philistines said, Look! the Hebrews are coming out of the holes where they have taken cover.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: And the armed men of the force gave Jonathan and his servant their answer, saying, Come up here to us, and we will let you see something. Then Jonathan said to his servant, Come up after me: for the Lord has given them up into the hands of Israel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: And Jonathan went up, gripping with his hands and his feet, his servant going up after him; and the Philistines gave way before Jonathan when he made an attack on them, and his servant put them to death after him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: And at their first attack, Jonathan and his servant put to the sword about twenty men, all inside the space of half an acre of land.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: And there was great fear in the tents and in the field and among all the men of the armed force, and the attackers were shaking with fear; even the earth was moved with a great shaking and there was a fear as from God.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: And the watchmen of Saul, looking out from Geba in the land of Benjamin, saw all the army flowing away and running here and there.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: Then Saul said to the people who were with him, Let everyone be numbered and let us see who has gone from us. And when they had been numbered, it was seen that Jonathan and his servant were not there.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: And Saul said to Ahijah, Let the ephod come here. For he went before Israel with the ephod at that time.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: Now while Saul was talking to the priest, the noise in the tents of the Philistines became louder and louder; and Saul said to the priest, Take back your hand.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: And Saul and all the people with him came together and went forward to the fight: and every man's sword was turned against the man at his side, and there was a very great noise.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: Then the Hebrews who had been with the Philistines for some time, and had gone up with them to their tents, turning round were joined to those who were with Saul and Jonathan.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: And all the men of Israel who had taken cover in the hill-country of Ephraim, hearing that the Philistines had been put to flight, went after them, attacking them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: So the Lord made Israel safe that day: and the fight went over to Beth-aven.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: And all the people were with Saul, about twenty thousand men, and the fight was general through all the hill-country of Ephraim; but Saul made a great error that day, by putting the people under an oath, saying, Let that man be cursed who takes food before evening comes and I have given punishment to those who are against me. So the people had not a taste of food.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: And there was honey on the face of the field, and all the people came to the honey, the bees having gone from it;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: But not a man put his hand to his mouth for fear of the curse.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: But Jonathan, having no knowledge of the oath his father had put on the people, stretching out the rod which was in his hand, put the end of it in the honey, and put it to his mouth; then his eyes were made bright.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: Then one of the people said to him, Your father put the people under an oath, saying, Let that man be cursed who takes any food this day. And the people were feeble, needing food.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 29
text: Then Jonathan said, My father has made trouble come on the land: now see how bright my eyes have become because I have taken a little of this honey.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 30
text: How much more if the people had freely taken their food from the goods of those who were fighting against them! would there not have been much greater destruction among the Philistines?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 31
text: That day they overcame the Philistines from Michmash to Aijalon: and the people were feeble from need of food.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 32
text: And rushing at the goods taken in the fight, the people took oxen and sheep and young oxen, and put them to death there on the earth, and had a meal, taking the flesh with the blood in it.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 33
text: Then it was said to Saul, See, the people are sinning against the Lord, taking the blood with the flesh. And he said to those who gave him the news, Now let a great stone be rolled to me here.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 34
text: And Saul said, Go about among the people and say to them, Let every man come here to me with his ox and his sheep, and put them to death here, and take his meal: do no sin against the Lord by taking the blood with the flesh. So all the people took their oxen with them that night and put them to death there.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 35
text: And Saul put up an altar to the Lord: this was the first altar which he put up to the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 36
text: And Saul said, Let us go down after the Philistines by night, attacking them till the morning, till there is not a man of them living. And they said, Do whatever seems right to you. Then the priest said, Let us come near to God.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 37
text: And Saul, desiring directions from God, said, Am I to go down after the Philistines? will you give them up into the hands of Israel? But he gave him no answer that day.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 38
text: And Saul said, Come near, all you chiefs of the people, and let us get word from God and see in whom is this sin today.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 39
text: For, by the living Lord, the saviour of Israel, even if the sinner is Jonathan, my son, death will certainly be his fate. But not a man among all the people gave him any answer.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 40
text: Then he said to all Israel, You be on one side, and I with Jonathan my son will be on the other side. And the people said to Saul, Do whatever seems good to you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 41
text: Then Saul said to the Lord, the God of Israel, Why have you not given me an answer today? If the sin is in me or in Jonathan my son, O Lord God of Israel, give Urim, and if it is in your people Israel, give Thummim. And by the decision of the Lord, Saul and Jonathan were marked out, and the people went free.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 42
text: And Saul said, Give your decision between my son Jonathan and me. And Jonathan was taken.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 43
text: Then Saul said to Jonathan, Give me an account of what you have done. And Jonathan gave him the story and said, Certainly I took a little honey on the end of my rod; and now death is to be my fate.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 44
text: And Saul said, May God's punishment be on me if death is not your fate, Jonathan.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 45
text: And the people said to Saul, Is death to come to Jonathan, the worker of this great salvation for Israel? Let it not be so: by the living Lord, not one hair of his head is to be touched, for he has been working with God today. So the people kept Jonathan from death.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 46
text: Then Saul, turning back, went after the Philistines no longer: and the Philistines went back to their place.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 47
text: Now when Saul had taken his place as ruler of Israel, he made war on those who were against him on every side, Moab and the Ammonites and Edom and the kings of Zobah and the Philistines: and whichever way he went, he overcame them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 48
text: And he did great things, and overcame the Amalekites, and made Israel safe from the hands of their attackers.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 49
text: Now the sons of Saul were Jonathan and Ishvi and Malchi-shua; and these are the names of his daughters: the older was named Merab and the younger Michal;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 50
text: The name of Saul's wife was Ahinoam, the daughter of Ahimaaz; the captain of his army was Abner, the son of Ner, brother of Saul's father.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 51
text: Kish, the father of Saul, and Ner, the father of Abner, were sons of Abiel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 52
text: All through the life of Saul there was bitter war against the Philistines; and whenever Saul saw any strong man or any good fighting man, he kept him near himself.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: And Samuel said to Saul, The Lord sent me to put the holy oil on you and to make you king over his people, over Israel: so give ear now to the words of the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: The Lord of armies says, I will give punishment to Amalek for what he did to Israel, fighting against him on the way when Israel came out of Egypt.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: Go now and put Amalek to the sword, putting to the curse all they have, without mercy: put to death every man and woman, every child and baby at the breast, every ox and sheep, camel and ass.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: And Saul sent for the people and had them numbered in Telaim, two hundred thousand footmen and ten thousand men of Judah.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: And Saul came to the town of Amalek, and took up his position in the valley secretly.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: And Saul said to the Kenites, Go away, take yourselves out from among the Amalekites, or destruction will overtake you with them: for you were kind to the children of Israel when they came out of Egypt. So the Kenites went away from among the Amalekites.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: And Saul made an attack on the Amalekites from Havilah on the road to Shur, which is before Egypt.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: He took Agag, king of the Amalekites, prisoner, and put all the people to the sword without mercy.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: But Saul and the people did not put Agag to death, and they kept the best of the sheep and the oxen and the fat beasts and the lambs, and whatever was good, not desiring to put them to the curse: but everything which was bad and of no use they put to the curse.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: Then the Lord said to Samuel,

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: It is no longer my pleasure for Saul to be king; for he is turned back from going in my ways, and has not done my orders. And Samuel was very sad, crying to the Lord in prayer all night.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: And early in the morning he got up and went to Saul; and word was given to Samuel that Saul had come to Carmel and put up a pillar, and had gone from there down to Gilgal.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: And Samuel came to Saul; and Saul said to him, May the blessing of the Lord be with you: I have done what was ordered by the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: And Samuel said, What then is this sound of the crying of sheep and the noise of oxen which comes to my ears?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: And Saul said, They have taken them from the Amalekites: for the people have kept the best of the sheep and of the oxen as an offering to the Lord your God; all the rest we have given up to destruction.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: Then Samuel said to Saul, Say no more! Let me give you word of what the Lord has said to me this night. And he said to him, Say on.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: And Samuel said, Though you may seem little to yourself, are you not head of the tribes of Israel? for the Lord with the holy oil made you king over Israel,

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: And the Lord sent you on a journey and said, Go and put to the curse those sinners, the Amalekites, fighting against them till every one is dead.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: Why then did you not do the orders of the Lord, but by violently taking their goods did evil in the eyes of the Lord?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: And Saul said, Truly, I have done the orders of the Lord and have gone the way the Lord sent me; I have taken Agag, the king of Amalek, and have given the Amalekites up to destruction.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 21
