text: But the people took some of their goods, sheep and oxen, the chief of the things which were put to the curse, to make an offering of them to the Lord your God in Gilgal.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: And Samuel said, Has the Lord as much delight in offerings and burned offerings as in the doing of his orders? Truly, to do his pleasure is better than to make offerings, and to give ear to him than the fat of sheep.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: For to go against his orders is like the sin of those who make use of secret arts, and pride is like giving worship to images. Because you have put away from you the word of the Lord, he has put you from your place as king.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: And Saul said to Samuel, Great is my sin: for I have gone against the orders of the Lord and against your words: because, fearing the people, I did what they said.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: So now, let my sin have forgiveness, and go back with me to give worship to the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: And Samuel said to Saul, I will not go back with you: for you have put away from you the word of the Lord, and the Lord has put you from your place as king over Israel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: And when Samuel was turning round to go away, Saul took the skirt of his robe in his hand, and the cloth came away.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: And Samuel said to him, The Lord has taken away the kingdom of Israel from you this day by force, and has given it to a neighbour of yours who is better than you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: And further, the Glory of Israel will not say what is false, and his purpose may not be changed: for he is not a man, whose purpose may be changed.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: Then he said, Great is my sin: but still, give me honour now before the heads of my people and before Israel, and come back with me so that I may give worship to the Lord your God.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: So Samuel went back after Saul, and Saul gave worship to the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: Then Samuel said, Make Agag, the king of the Amalekites, come here to me. And Agag came to him shaking with fear. And Agag said, Truly the pain of death is past.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 33
text: And Samuel said, As your sword has made women without children, so now your mother will be without children among women. And Agag was cut up by Samuel, bone from bone, before the Lord in Gilgal.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 34
text: Then Samuel went to Ramah; and Saul went up to his house in Gibeah, in the land of Saul.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 35
text: And Samuel never saw Saul again till the day of his death; but Samuel was sorrowing for Saul: and it was no longer the Lord's pleasure for Saul to be king over Israel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to Samuel, How long will you go on sorrowing for Saul, seeing that I have put him from his place as king over Israel? Take oil in your vessel and go; I will send you to Jesse, the Beth-lehemite: for I have got a king for myself among his sons.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: And Samuel said, How is it possible for me to go? If Saul gets news of it he will put me to death. And the Lord said, Take a young cow with you and say, I have come to make an offering to the Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: And send for Jesse to be present at the offering, and I will make clear to you what you are to do: and you are to put the holy oil on him whose name I give you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: And Samuel did as the Lord said and came to Beth-lehem. And the responsible men of the town came out to him in fear and said, Do you come in peace?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: And he said, In peace: I have come to make an offering to the Lord: make yourselves clean and come with me to make the offering. And he made Jesse and his sons clean, and sent for them to be present at the offering.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: Now when they came, looking at Eliab, he said, Clearly the man of the Lord's selection is before him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: But the Lord said to Samuel, Do not take note of his face or how tall he is, because I will not have him: for the Lord's view is not man's; man takes note of the outer form, but the Lord sees the heart.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: Then Jesse sent for Abinadab and made him come before Samuel. And he said, The Lord has not taken this one.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: Then Jesse made Shammah come before him. And he said, The Lord has not taken this one.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: And Jesse made his seven sons come before Samuel. And Samuel said to Jesse, The Lord has not taken any of these.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: Then Samuel said to Jesse, Are all your children here? And he said, There is still the youngest, and he is looking after the sheep. And Samuel said to Jesse, Send and make him come here: for we will not take our seats till he is here.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: So he sent and made him come in. Now he had red hair and beautiful eyes and pleasing looks. And the Lord said, Come, put the oil on him, for this is he.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: Then Samuel took the bottle of oil, and put the oil on him there among his brothers: and from that day the spirit of the Lord came on David with power. So Samuel went back to Ramah.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: Now the spirit of the Lord had gone from Saul, and an evil spirit from the Lord was troubling him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: And Saul's servants said to him, See now, an evil spirit from God is troubling you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: Now give orders to your servants who are here before you to go in search of a man who is an expert player on a corded instrument: and it will be that when the evil spirit from God is on you, he will make music for you on his instrument, and you will get well.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: And Saul said to his servants, Then get me a man who is an expert player, and make him come to me.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: Then one of the servants in answer said, I have seen a son of Jesse, the Beth-lehemite, who is expert at playing, and a strong man and a man of war; and he is wise in his words, and pleasing in looks, and the Lord is with him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: So Saul sent his servants to Jesse and said, Send me your son David who is with the sheep.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: And Jesse took five cakes of bread and a skin of wine and a young goat and sent them to Saul by David.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: And David came to Saul, waiting before him: and he became very dear to Saul, who made him his servant, giving him the care of his arms.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: And Saul sent to Jesse saying, Let David be with me, for he is pleasing to me.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: And whenever the evil spirit from God came on Saul, David took his instrument and made music: so new life came to Saul, and he got well, and the evil spirit went away from him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: Now the Philistines got their armies together for war, and came together at Socoh in the land of Judah, and took up their position between Socoh and Azekah in Ephes-dammim.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: And Saul and the men of Israel came together and took up their position in the valley of Elah, and put their forces in order against the Philistines.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: The Philistines were stationed on the mountain on one side and Israel on the mountain on the other side: and there was a valley between them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: And a fighter came out from the tents of the Philistines, named Goliath of Gath; he was more than six cubits tall.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: And he had a head-dress of brass on his head, and he was dressed in a coat of metal, the weight of which was five thousand shekels of brass.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: His legs were covered with plates of brass and hanging on his back was a javelin of brass.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: The stem of his spear was as long as a cloth-worker's rod, and its head was made of six hundred shekels' weight of iron: and one went before him with his body-cover.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: He took up his position and in a loud voice said to the armies of Israel, Why have you come out to make war? Am I not a Philistine and you servants of Saul? Send out a man for yourselves and let him come down to me.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: If he is able to have a fight with me and overcome me, then we will be your servants: but if I am able to overcome him, then you will be our servants and do work for us.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: And the Philistine said, I have put to shame the armies of Israel this day; give me a man so that we may have a fight together.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: And Saul and all Israel, hearing those words of the Philistine, were troubled and full of fear.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Beth-lehem-judah named Jesse, who had eight sons; and he was an old man in Saul's day, and far on in years.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: And the three oldest sons of Jesse had gone with Saul to the fight: the names of the three who went to the fight were Eliab, the oldest, and Abinadab the second, and Shammah the third.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: And David was the youngest: and the three oldest were with Saul's army.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: Now David went to and from Saul, looking after his father's sheep at Beth-lehem.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: And the Philistine came near every morning and evening for forty days.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: And Jesse said to his son David, Take now for your brothers an ephah of this dry grain and these ten cakes of bread, and go quickly with them to the tents to your brothers;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: And take these ten cheeses to the captain of their thousand, and see how your brothers are and come back with a sign to say how they are.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 19
text: Now Saul, and they, and all the men of Israel were in the valley of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 20
text: And David got up early in the morning, and, giving the sheep into the care of a keeper, took the things and went as Jesse had said; and he came to the lines where the carts were, when the army was going out to the fight giving their war-cry.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 21
text: And Israel and the Philistines had put their forces in position, army against army.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 22
text: And David gave his parcels into the hands of the keeper of the army stores, and went running to the army and came to his brothers to get knowledge about them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 23
text: And while he was talking to them, the fighter, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, came out from the Philistines' lines and said the same words, in David's hearing.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 24
text: And all the men of Israel, when they saw him, went in flight, overcome with fear.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 25
text: And the men of Israel said, Have you seen this man? Clearly he has come out to put shame on Israel: and it is certain that if any man overcomes him, the king will give that man great wealth, and will give him his daughter, and make his father's family free in Israel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 26
text: And David said to the men near him, What will be done to the man who overcomes this Philistine and takes away the shame from Israel? for who is this Philistine, a man without circumcision, that he has put shame on the armies of the living God?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 27
text: And the people gave him this answer, So it will be done to the man who overcomes him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 28
text: And Eliab, his oldest brother, hearing what David said to the men, was moved to wrath against David, and said, Why have you come here? Into whose care have you given that little flock of sheep in the waste land? I have knowledge of your pride and the evil of your heart, you have come down to see the fight.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 29
text: And David said, What have I done now? was it not only a word?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 30
text: And turning away from him to one of the other men, he said the same words: and the people gave him the same answer.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 31
text: And, hearing what David said, they gave Saul word of it: and he sent for him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 32
text: And David said to Saul, Let no man's heart become feeble because of him; I, your servant, will go out and have a fight with this Philistine.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 33
text: And Saul said to David, You are not able to go out against this Philistine and have a fight with him: for you are only a boy, and he has been a man of war from his earliest days.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 34
text: And David said to Saul, Your servant has been keeper of his father's sheep; and if a lion or a bear came and took a lamb from the flock,

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 35
text: I went out after him, and overcame him, and took it out of his mouth: and if, turning on me, he came at me, I took him by the hair and overcame him and put him to death.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 36
text: Your servant has overcome lion and bear: and the fate of this Philistine, who is without circumcision, will be like theirs, seeing that he has put shame on the armies of the living God.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 37
text: And David said, The Lord, who kept me safe from the grip of the lion and the bear, will be my saviour from the hands of this Philistine. And Saul said to David, Go! and may the Lord be with you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 38
text: Then Saul gave David his clothing of war, and put a head-dress of brass on his head and had him clothed with a coat of metal.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 39
text: And David took Saul's sword and put the band round him over the metal coat, and was unable to go forward; for he was not used to them. Then David said to Saul, It is not possible for me to go out with these, for I am not used to them. So David took them off.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 40
text: Then he took his stick in his hand, and got five smooth stones from the bed of the stream and put them in a bag such as is used by sheep-keepers; and in his hand was a leather band used for sending stones: and so he went in the direction of the Philistine.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 41
text: And the Philistine came nearer to David; and the man who had his body-cover went before him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 42
text: And when the Philistine, taking note, saw David, he had a poor opinion of him: for he was only a boy, red-haired and good-looking.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 43
text: And the Philistine said to David, Am I a dog, that you come out to me with sticks? And the Philistine put curses on David by all his gods.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 44
text: And the Philistine said to David, Come here to me, and I will give your flesh to the birds of the air and the beasts of the field.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 45
text: Then David said to the Philistine, You come to me with a sword and a spear and a javelin: but I come to you in the name of the Lord of armies, the God of the armies of Israel on which you have put shame.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 46
text: This day the Lord will give you up into my hands, and I will overcome you, and take your head off you; and I will give the bodies of the Philistine army to the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth today, so that all the earth may see that Israel has a God;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 47
text: And all these people who are here today may see that the Lord does not give salvation by sword and spear: for the fight is the Lord's, and he will give you up into our hands.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 48
text: Now when the Philistine made a move and came near to David, David quickly went at a run in the direction of the army, meeting the Philistine face to face.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 49
text: And David put his hand in his bag and took out a stone and sent it from his leather band straight at the Philistine, and the stone went deep into his brow, and he went down to the earth, falling on his face.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 50
text: So David overcame the Philistine with his leather band and a stone, wounding the Philistine and causing his death: but David had no sword in his hand.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 51
text: So running up to the Philistine and putting his foot on him, David took his sword out of its cover, and put him to death, cutting off his head with it. And when the Philistines saw that their fighter was dead, they went in flight.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 52
text: And the men of Israel and of Judah got up, and gave a cry, and went after the Philistines as far as Gath and the town doors of Ekron. And the wounded of the Philistines were falling down by the road from Shaaraim all the way to Gath and Ekron.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 53
text: Then the children of Israel came back from going after the Philistines, and took their goods from the tents.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 54
text: And David took the head of the Philistine to Jerusalem, but the metal war-dress and the arms he put in his tent.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 55
text: And when Saul saw David going out against the Philistine, he said to Abner, the captain of the army, Abner, whose son is this young man? And Abner said, On your life, O king, I have no idea.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 56
text: And the king said, Make search and see whose son this young man is.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 57
text: And when David was coming back after the destruction of the Philistine, Abner took him to Saul, with the head of the Philistine in his hand.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 58
text: And Saul said to him, Young man, whose son are you? And David in answer said, I am the son of your servant Jesse of Beth-lehem.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: Now after David's talk with Saul was ended, the soul of Jonathan was joined with the soul of David, and David became as dear to him as his very life.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: And that day Saul took David and would not let him go back to his father's house.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: Then Jonathan and David made an agreement together, because of Jonathan's love for David.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: And Jonathan took off the robe he had on and gave it to David, with all his military dress, even to his sword and his bow and the band round his body.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: And David went wherever Saul sent him, and did wisely: and Saul put him at the head of his men of war, and this was pleasing to all the people as well as to Saul's servants.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: Now on their way, when David came back after the destruction of the Philistine, the women came out of all the towns of Israel, with songs and dances, meeting David with melody and joy and instruments of music.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: And the women, answering one another in their song, said, Saul has put to death his thousands and David his tens of thousands.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: And Saul was very angry and this saying was unpleasing to him; and he said, They have given David credit for tens of thousands, and to me for only thousands: what more is there for him but the kingdom?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: And from that day Saul was looking with envy on David.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: Now on the day after, an evil spirit from God came on Saul with great force and he was acting like a prophet among the men of his house, while David was making music for him, as he did day by day: and Saul had his spear in his hand.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: And Saul, balancing the spear in his hand, said, I will give David a blow, pinning him to the wall. And David got away from him twice.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: And Saul went in fear of David, because the Lord was with David and had gone away from Saul.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: So Saul sent him away, and made him a captain over a thousand; and he went about his business before the people.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: And in all his undertakings David did wisely; and the Lord was with him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: And when Saul saw how wisely he did, he was in fear of him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: But David was loved by all Israel and Judah, for he went out and came in before them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: And Saul said to David, Here is my oldest daughter Merab, whom I will give you for your wife: only be strong for me, fighting in the Lord's wars. For Saul said, Let it not be through me that his fate comes to him, but through the Philistines.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: And David said to Saul, Who am I, and what is my father's family in Israel, that I am to be son-in-law to the king?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: But when the time came to give Merab, Saul's daughter, to David, she was given to Adriel of Meholath.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: And Saul's daughter Michal was in love with David: and Saul had word of it and was pleased.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: And Saul said, I will give her to him, so that she may be a cause of danger to him, and so that the hands of the Philistines may be against him. So Saul said to David, Today you are to become my son-in-law for the second time.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: And Saul gave his servants orders saying, Have talk with David secretly and say to him, See how the king has delight in you, and how you are loved by all his servants: then be the king's son-in-law.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: And Saul's servants said these things to David. And David said, Does it seem to you a small thing to be the king's son-in-law, seeing that I am a poor man, of no great name?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: And the servants of Saul gave him an account of what David had said.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: And Saul said, Then say to David, The king has no desire for any bride-price, but only for the private parts of a hundred Philistines so that the king may get the better of his haters. But it was in Saul's mind that David might come to his end by the hands of the Philistines.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: And when his servants said these words to David, he was well pleased to be the son-in-law of the king. And the days were still not past.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: So David and his men got up and went, and put to death two hundred of the Philistines; and David took their private parts and gave the full number of them to the king, so that he might be the king's son-in-law. And Saul gave him his daughter Michal for his wife.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: And it was clear to Saul that the Lord was with David; and he was loved by all Israel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 29
text: And Saul's fear of David became all the greater, and he went on hating him, day by day.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 30
text: Then the rulers of the Philistines went out to war: and whenever they went out, David did more wisely than all the other servants of Saul, so that his name became greatly honoured.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: And Saul gave orders to his son Jonathan and to all his servants to put David to death. But Saul's son Jonathan had great delight in David.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: And Jonathan said to David, Saul, my father, is purposing your death: so now, take care in the morning, and keep yourself safe in a secret place:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: And I will go out and take my place by my father's side in the field near where you are; and I will get into talk with my father about you, and when I see how things are, I will give you word.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: And Jonathan gave his father Saul a good account of David, and said to him, Let not the king do wrong against his servant, against David; because he has done you no wrong, and all his acts have had a good outcome for you:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: For he put his life in danger and overcame the Philistine, and the Lord gave all Israel salvation: you saw it and were glad: why then are you sinning against him who has done no wrong, desiring the death of David without cause?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: And Saul gave ear to the voice of Jonathan, and said with an oath, By the living Lord, he is not to be put to death.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: Then Jonathan sent for David and gave him word of all these things. And Jonathan took David to Saul, who kept him by his side as in the past.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: And there was war again: and David went out fighting the Philistines, causing great destruction among them; and they went in flight before him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: And an evil spirit from the Lord came on Saul, when he was seated in his house with his spear in his hand; and David made music for him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: And Saul would have sent his spear through him, pinning him to the wall, but he got away and the spear went into the wall: and that night David went in flight and got away.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: Then in that night Saul sent men to David's house to keep watch on him so as to put him to death in the morning: and David's wife Michal said to him, If you do not go away to a safe place tonight you will be put to death in the morning.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: So Michal let David down through the window, and he went in flight and got away.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: Then Michal took the image and put it in the bed, with a cushion of goat's hair at its head, and she put clothing over it.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: And when Saul sent men to take David, she said, He is ill.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: And Saul sent his men to see David, saying, Do not come back without him, take him in his bed, so that I may put him to death.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: And when the men came in, there was the image in the bed, with the cushion of goat's hair at its head

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: And Saul said to Michal, why have you been false to me, letting my hater go and get safely away? And in answer Michal said to Saul, He said to me, Let me go, or I will put you to death.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: So David went in flight and got away and came to Ramah, to Samuel, and gave him an account of all Saul had done to him. And he and Samuel went and were living in Naioth.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: And word was given to Saul that David was at Naioth in Ramah.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: And Saul sent men to take David; and when they saw the band of prophets at work, with Samuel in his place at their head, the spirit of God came on Saul's men, and they became like prophets.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: And Saul, having news of this, sent other men, who in the same way became like prophets. And a third time Saul sent men, and they like the others became like prophets.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: Then he himself went to Ramah, and came to the great water-spring in Secu; and questioning the people he said, Where are Samuel and David? And one said, They are at Naioth in Ramah.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: And he went on from there to Naioth in Ramah: and the spirit of God came on him, and he went on, acting like a prophet, till he came to Naioth in Ramah.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: And he took off his clothing, acting like a prophet before Samuel, and falling down he was stretched out, without his clothing, all that day and all that night. This is the reason for the saying, Is even Saul among the prophets?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: And David went in flight from Naioth in Ramah and came to Jonathan and said, What have I done? What is my crime and my sin against your father that he is attempting to take my life?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: And he said to him, Far be the thought: you will not be put to death: see, my father does nothing, great or small, without giving me word of it: would he keep this secret from me? It is not so.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: But David took his oath again and said, Your father sees that I am dear to you; so he says to himself, Let Jonathan have no idea of this, for it will be a grief to him; but as the Lord is living, and as your soul is living, there is only a step between me and death.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: Then Jonathan said to David, Whatever your desire is, I will do it for you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: And David said to Jonathan, Tomorrow is the new moon, and I will not be seated with the king at his table: but let me go to a safe place in the country till the evening.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: And if your father takes note of the fact that I am away, say, David made a request to me for himself that he might go to Beth-lehem, to his town: for it is the time when his family make their offering year by year.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: If he says, It is well, your servant will be at peace: but if he is angry, then it will be clear to you that he has an evil purpose in mind against me.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: So, then, be kind to your servant; for you have been united with your servant in an agreement made before the Lord: but if there is any wrongdoing in me, put me to death yourself; why take me to your father?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: And Jonathan said, Do not have such a thought: for if I saw that my father was designing evil against you, would I not give you word of it?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: Then David said to Jonathan, Who will give me word if your father gives you a rough answer?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: And Jonathan said to David, Come, let us go out into the country. And the two of them went out together into the open country.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: And Jonathan said to David, May the Lord, the God of Israel, be witness; when I have had a chance of talking to my father, about this time tomorrow, if his feelings to David are good, will I not send and give you the news?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: May the Lord's punishment be on Jonathan, if it is my father's pleasure to do you evil and I do not give you word of it and send you away so that you may go in peace: and may the Lord be with you, as he has been with my father.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: And may you, while I am still living, O may you be kind to me, as the Lord is kind, and keep me from death!

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: And let not your mercy ever be cut off from my family, even when the Lord has sent destruction on all David's haters, cutting them off from the face of the earth.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: And if it comes about that the name of Jonathan is cut off from the family of David, the Lord will make David responsible.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: And Jonathan again took an oath to David, because of his love for him: for David was as dear to him as his very soul.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: Then Jonathan said to him, Tomorrow is the new moon: and it will be seen that you are not present, for there will be no one in your seat.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: And on the third day it will be specially noted, and you will go to the place where you took cover when the other business was in hand, waiting by the hill over there.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: And on the third day I will send arrows from my bow against its side as if at a mark.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: And I will send my boy to have a look for the arrow. And if I say to him, See, the arrow is on this side of you; take it up! then you may come; for there is peace for you and no evil, by the living Lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: But if I say to the boy, See, the arrow has gone past you: then go on your way, for the Lord has sent you away.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: As for what you and I were talking of, the Lord is between you and me for ever.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: So David went to a secret place in the country: and when the new moon came, the king took his place at the feast.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: And the king took his seat, as at other times, by the wall: and Jonathan was in front, and Abner was seated by Saul's side, but there was no one in David's seat.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: But Saul said nothing that day, for his thought was, Something has taken place making him unclean; it is clear that he is not clean.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 27
text: And on the day after the new moon, that is, the second day, there was still no one in David's seat: and Saul said to his son Jonathan, Why has the son of Jesse not come to the feast yesterday or today?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 28
text: And answering Saul, Jonathan said, He made a request to me that he might go to Beth-lehem,

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 29
text: Saying, Our family is making an offering in the town, and my brothers have given me orders to be there: so now, if I have grace in your eyes, let me go away and see my brothers. This is why he has not come to the king's table.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 30
text: Then Saul was moved to wrath against Jonathan, and he said to him, You son of an evil and uncontrolled woman, have I not seen how you have given your love to the son of Jesse, to your shame and the shame of your mother?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 31
text: For while the son of Jesse is living on the earth, your position is unsafe and your kingdom is in danger. So make him come here to me, for it is certainly right for him to be put to death.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 32
text: And Jonathan, answering his father Saul, said to him, Why is he to be put to death? What has he done?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 33
text: And Saul, pointing his spear at him, made an attempt to give him a wound: from which it was clear to Jonathan that his father's purpose was to put David to death.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 34
text: So Jonathan got up from the table, burning with wrath, and took no part in the feast the second day of the month, being full of grief for David because his father had put shame on him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 35
text: Now in the morning, Jonathan went out into the fields at the time he had said to David, and he had a little boy with him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 36
text: And he said to the boy, Go and get the arrow I let loose from my bow. And while the boy was running, he sent an arrow past him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 37
text: And when the boy came to the place where the arrow was, Jonathan, crying out after the boy, said, Has it not gone past you?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 38
text: And Jonathan went on crying out after the boy, Be quick, do not keep waiting about, go quickly. And Jonathan's boy got the arrow and came back to his master.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 39
text: But the boy had no idea what was going on; only Jonathan and David had knowledge of it.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 40
text: And Jonathan gave his bow and arrows to the boy, and said to him, Take these and go back to the town.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 41
text: And when the boy had gone, David came from his secret place by the hill, and falling to the earth went down on his face three times: and they gave one another a kiss, weeping together, till David's grief was the greater.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 42
text: And Jonathan said to David, Go in peace, for we two have taken an oath, in the name of the Lord, saying, The Lord will be between me and you, and between my seed and your seed for ever. Then David went away, and Jonathan went into the town.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: Then David came to Nob, to Ahimelech the priest: and Ahimelech was full of fear at meeting David, and said to him, Why are you by yourself, having no man with you?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: And David said to Ahimelech the priest, The king has given me orders and has said to me, Say nothing to anyone about the business on which I am sending you and the orders I have given you: and a certain place has been fixed to which the young men are to go.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: So now, if you have here five cakes of bread, give them into my hand, or whatever you have.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: And the priest, answering David, said, I have no common bread here but there is holy bread; if only the young men have kept themselves from women.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: And David in answer said to the priest, Certainly women have been kept from us; and as has been done before when I have gone out the arms of the young men were made holy, even though it was a common journey; how much more today will their arms be made holy.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: So the priest gave him the holy bread: there was no other, only the holy bread which had been taken from before the Lord, so that new bread might be put in its place on the day when it was taken away.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: Now a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day, kept back before the Lord; his name was Doeg, an Edomite, the strongest of Saul's runners.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: And David said to Ahimelech, Have you no sword or spear with you here? for I have come without my sword and other arms, because the king's business had to be done quickly.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: And the priest said, The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom you put to death in the valley of Elah, is here folded in a cloth at the back of the ephod: take that, if you will, for there is no other sword here. And David said, there is no other sword like that; give it to me.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: Then David got up and went in flight that day for fear of Saul, and went to Achish, the king of Gath.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: And the servants of Achish said to him, Is not this David, the king of the land? did they not make songs about him in their dances, saying, Saul has put to death thousands, and David tens of thousands?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: And David took these words to heart, fearing Achish, the king of Gath.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: So changing his behaviour before them, he made it seem as if he was off his head, hammering on the doors of the town, and letting the water from his mouth go down his chin.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: Then Achish said to his servants, Look! the man is clearly off his head; why have you let him come before me?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: Are there not enough unbalanced men about me, that you have let this person come and do such tricks before me? is such a man to come into my house?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: So David went away from there and took cover in a strong place at Adullam; and his brothers and all his father's people, hearing of it, went down to him there.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: And everyone who was in trouble, and everyone who was in debt, and everyone who was bitter in soul, came together to him, and he became captain over them: about four hundred men were joined to him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: And from there David went to Mizpeh in the land of Moab: and he said to the king of Moab, Let my father and mother come and make their living-place with you till it is clear to me what God will do for me.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: And he took them to the king of Moab and they went on living with him while David was in his safe place.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: And the prophet Gad said to David, Do not go on living in this place but go into the land of Judah. Then David went away and came to the woodland of Hereth.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: And news was given to Saul that David had been seen, and the men who were with him: now Saul was in Gibeah, seated under the tree in the high place, with his spear in his hand, and all his servants were in their places before him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: Then Saul said to his servants who were there about him, Give ear now, you Benjamites; will the son of Jesse give to every one of you fields and vine-gardens, will he make you all captains of hundreds and captains of thousands;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: That all of you have made designs against me, and not one of you gave me word when my son made an agreement with the son of Jesse, and not one of you has pity for me or has made my eyes open to the fact that my servant has been moved by my son against me, as at this day?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: Then Doeg, the Edomite, who was by the side of the servants of Saul, in answer said, I saw the son of Jesse coming to Nob, to Ahimelech, the son of Ahitub.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: And he got directions from the Lord for him, and gave him food, and put in his hand the sword of Goliath the Philistine.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: Then the king sent for Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and for all the men of his father's family who were priests in Nob: and they all came to the king.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: And Saul said, Give ear now, O son of Ahitub. And answering he said, Here I am, my lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: And Saul said to him, Why have you made designs against me with the son of Jesse, giving him food and a sword and getting directions from the Lord for him, and helping him to take up arms against me, and to be on the watch to make a secret attack on me as he is doing now?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: Then Ahimelech answering said to the king, Who among all your servants is so true to you as David, who is the king's son-in-law, and is a captain of your armed men, and has a place of honour in your house?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: Is this the first time I have got directions from God for him? Far be the thought! let the king make no such statement against his servant or my father's family, for your servant has no knowledge, great or small, of this thing.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: And the king said, You will certainly be put to death, Ahimelech, you and all your father's family.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: Then the king said to the runners who were waiting near him, Put the priests of the Lord to death; because they are on David's side, and having knowledge of his flight, did not give me word of it. But the king's servants would not put out their hands to make an attack on the Lord's priests.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: Then the king said to Doeg, You are to put the priests to death. And Doeg the Edomite, turning on the priests and attacking them, put to death that day eighty-five men who took up the ephod.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: And Nob, the town of the priests, he put to the sword, all the men and women, children and babies at the breast, and oxen and asses and sheep.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: And Abiathar, one of the sons of Ahimelech, the son of Ahitub, got away and went in flight after David;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: And gave him the news of how Saul had put to death the Lord's priests.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: And David said to Abiathar, I was certain that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would take the news to Saul: I am responsible for the lives of all your father's family.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: Keep here with me and have no fear; for he who has designs on my life has designs on yours: but with me you will be safe.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: And they sent word to David, saying, The Philistines are fighting against Keilah and taking the grain from the grain-floors.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: So David, questioning the Lord, said, Am I to go and make an attack on these Philistines? And the Lord said to David, Go and make an attack on the Philistines so that Keilah may be kept from falling into their hands.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: And David's men said to him, Even here in Judah we are full of fear: how much more then if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: Then David put the question to the Lord again, and the Lord answering said, Up! go down to Keilah; for I will give the Philistines into your hands.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: So David and his men went to Keilah, and had a fight with the Philistines, and took away their cattle, and put them to the sword with great destruction. So David was the saviour of the people of Keilah.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: Now when Abiathar, the son of Ahimelech, went in flight to David, he came down to Keilah with the ephod in his hand.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: And news was given to Saul that David had come to Keilah. And Saul said, Now God has given him into my hands; for by going into a walled town with locked doors, he has let himself be shut in.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: And Saul sent for all the people to come to the fight, and go down to Keilah to make an attack on David and his men.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: And it was clear to David that Saul had evil designs against him, and he said to Abiathar the priest, Come here with the ephod.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: Then David said, O Lord, the God of Israel, news has been given to your servant that it is Saul's purpose to come to Keilah and send destruction on the town because of me.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: And now, is it true, as they have said to me, that Saul is coming? O Lord, the God of Israel, give ear to your servant, and say if these things are so. And the Lord said, He is coming down.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: Then David said, Will the men of Keilah give me and my men up to Saul? and the Lord said, They will give you up.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: Then David and his men, about six hundred of them, went out of Keilah, and got away wherever they were able to go. And Saul, hearing that David had got away from Keilah, did not go there.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 14
text: And David kept in the waste land, in safe places, waiting in the hill-country in the waste land of Ziph. And Saul was searching for him every day, but God did not give him up into his hands.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: And David was full of fear, in the knowledge that Saul had come out to take his life; and David was in the waste land of Ziph, in Horesh.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: And Saul's son Jonathan went to David in Horesh, and made his hands strong in God;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 17
text: And said to him, Have no fear, for Saul my father will not get you into his power; and you will be king of Israel, and I will be by your side, and my father Saul is certain of this.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 18
text: And the two of them made an agreement before the Lord: and David went on living in Horesh, and Jonathan went back to his house.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 19
text: Then the Ziphites came up to Gibeah to see Saul, and said, Is not David living secretly among us in the strong places in Horesh, in the hill of Hachilah to the south of the waste land?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 20
text: So now, O king, have your soul's desire and come down, and we, for our part, will give him up into the king's hands.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 21
text: And Saul said, The Lord's blessing will be yours, for you have had pity on me.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 22
text: Go now, and take more steps, and see where he is living: for they say that he is expert in deceit.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 23
text: So take care to get knowledge of all the secret places where he is taking cover, and be certain to come back to me, and I will go with you: and without doubt, if he is anywhere in the land, I will get him, among all the families of Judah.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 24
text: And they went back and came to Ziph before Saul: but David and his men were in the waste land of Maon, in the dry land south of the waste land.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 25
text: And Saul and his men went in search of him. And David had word of it, so he came down to the rock in the waste land of Maon. And Saul, hearing of this, went after David into the waste land of Maon.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 26
text: And Saul and his men went on one side of the mountain, and David and his men went on the other: and David's purpose was to get away as quickly as possible, for fear of Saul; for Saul and his men were making a circle round David and his men in order to take them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 27
text: But a man came to Saul saying, Be quick and come; for the Philistines have made an attack on the land.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 28
text: So turning back from going after David, Saul went against the Philistines: so that place was named Sela-hammah-lekoth.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 29
text: And from there, David went up and took cover in the safe place of En-gedi.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: Now when Saul came back from fighting the Philistines, news was given him that David was in the waste land of En-gedi.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: Then Saul took three thousand of the best men out of all Israel, and went in search of David and his men on the rocks of the mountain goats.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: And on the way he came to a place where sheep were kept, where there was a hollow in the rock; and Saul went in for a private purpose. Now David and his men were in the deepest part of the hollow.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: And David's men said to him, Now is the time when the Lord says to you, I will give up your hater into your hands to do with him whatever seems good to you. Then David, getting up, took the skirt of Saul's robe in his hand, cutting off the end of it without his knowledge.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: And later, David was full of regret for cutting off Saul's skirt.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: And David said to his men, Before the Lord, never let it be said that my hand was lifted up against my lord, the man of the Lord's selection, for the Lord's holy oil has been put on him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: So with these words David kept his servants back, and did not let them make an attack on Saul. And Saul got up and went on his way.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: And after that David came out of the hollow rock, and crying after Saul said, My lord the king. And when Saul gave a look back, David went down on his face and gave him honour.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: And David said to Saul, Why do you give any attention to those who say that it is my desire to do you wrong?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: Look! you have seen today how the Lord gave you up into my hands even now in the hollow of the rocks: and some would have had me put you to death, but I had pity on you: for I said, Never will my hand be lifted up against my lord, who has been marked with the holy oil.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: And see, my father, see the skirt of your robe in my hand: for the fact that I took off the skirt of your robe and did not put you to death is witness that I have no evil purpose, and I have done you no wrong, though you are waiting for my life to take it.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: May the Lord be judge between me and you, and may the Lord give me my rights against you, but my hand will never be lifted up against you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: There is an old saying, From the evil-doer comes evil: but my hand will never be lifted up against you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: After whom has the king of Israel come out? for whom are you searching? for a dead dog, an insect.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: So let the Lord be judge, and give a decision between me and you, and see and give support to my cause, and keep me from falling into your hands.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: Now when David had said these words to Saul, Saul said, Is this your voice, David, my son? And Saul was overcome with weeping.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: And he said to David, You are right and I am wrong: for you have given me back good, but I have given you evil.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: And you have made clear to me how good you have been to me today: because, when the Lord gave me up into your hands, you did not put me to death.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 19
text: If a man comes across his hater, will he let him get away safe? so may you be rewarded by the Lord for what you have done for me today.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 20
text: And now I am certain that you will be king, and that the kingdom of Israel will be made strong under your authority.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 21
text: So give me your oath by the Lord, that you will not put an end to my seed after me or let my name be cut off from my father's family.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 22
text: And David gave Saul his oath. And Saul went back to his house; but David and his men went up to their safe place.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 1
text: And death came to Samuel; and all Israel came together, weeping for him, and put his body in its resting-place in his house at Ramah. Then David went down to the waste land of Maon.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 2
text: Now there was a man in Maon whose business was in Carmel; he was a great man and had three thousand sheep and a thousand goats: and he was cutting the wool of his sheep in Carmel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 3
text: Now this man was named Nabal, and his wife's name was Abigail: she was a woman of good sense and pleasing looks: but the man was cruel and evil in his ways; he was of the family of Caleb.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 4
text: And David had word in the waste land that Nabal was cutting the wool of his sheep.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 5
text: And David sent ten young men, and said to them, Go up to Carmel and go to Nabal, and say kind words to him in my name;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 6
text: And say this to my brother, May all be well for you: peace be to you and your house and all you have.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 7
text: I have had word that you have wool-cutters: now the keepers of your sheep have been with us, and we have done them no evil, and taken nothing of theirs while they were in Carmel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 8
text: If your young men are questioned they will say the same thing. So now, let my young men have grace in your eyes, for we are come at a good time; please give anything you may have by you to your servants and to your son David.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 9
text: And when David's young men came, they said all this to Nabal, in David's name, and said nothing more.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 10
text: And Nabal gave them his answer and said, Who is David? who is the son of Jesse? there are a number of servants in these days running away from their masters.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 11
text: Am I to take my bread and my wine and the meat I have got ready for my wool-cutters and give it to men coming from I have no idea where?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 12
text: So David's young men, turning away, went back and gave him an account of everything he had said.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 13
text: And David said to his men, Put on your swords, every one of you. And every man put on his sword; and David did the same; and about four hundred men went up with David, and two hundred kept watch over their goods.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 14
text: But one of the young men said to Nabal's wife Abigail, David sent men from the waste land to say kind words to our master, and he gave them a rough answer.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 15
text: But these men have been very good to us; they did us no wrong and nothing of ours was touched while we were with them in the fields:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 16
text: But day and night they were like a wall round us while we were with them, looking after the sheep.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 17
text: So now, give thought to what you are going to do; for evil is in store for our master and all his house: for he is such a good-for-nothing person that it is not possible to say anything to him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 18
text: Then Abigail quickly took two hundred cakes of bread and two skins full of wine and five sheep ready for cooking and five measures of dry grain and a hundred parcels of dry grapes and two hundred cakes of figs, and put them on asses.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 19
text: And she said to her young men, Go on in front of me and I will come after you. But she said nothing to her husband Nabal.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 20
text: Now while she was going down under cover of the mountain on her ass, David and his men came down against her, and suddenly she came face to face with them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 21
text: Now David had said, What was the use of my taking care of this man's goods in the waste land, so that there was no loss of anything which was his? he has only given me back evil for good.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 22
text: May God's punishment be on David, if when morning comes there is so much as one male of his people still living.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 23
text: And when Abigail saw David, she quickly got off her ass, falling down on her face before him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 24
text: And falling at his feet she said, May the wrong be on me, my lord, on me: let your servant say a word to you, and give ear to the words of your servant.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 25
text: Let my lord give no attention to Nabal, that good-for-nothing: for as his name is, so is he, a man without sense: but I, your servant, did not see the young men whom my lord sent.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 26
text: So now, my lord, by the living God and by your living soul, seeing that the Lord has kept you from the crime of blood and from taking into your hands the punishment for your wrongs, may all your haters, and those who would do evil to my lord, be like Nabal.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 27
text: And let this offering, which your servant gives to my lord, be given to the young men who are with my lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 28
text: And may the sin of your servant have forgiveness: for the Lord will certainly make your family strong, because my lord is fighting in the Lord's war; and no evil will be seen in you all your days.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 29
text: And though a man has taken up arms against you, putting your life in danger, still the soul of my lord will be kept safe among the band of the living with the Lord your God; and the souls of those who are against you he will send violently away from him, like stones from a bag.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 30
text: And when the Lord has done for my lord all those good things which he has said he will do for you, and has made you a ruler over Israel;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 31
text: Then you will have no cause for grief, and my lord's heart will not be troubled because you have taken life without cause and have yourself given punishment for your wrongs: and when the Lord has been good to you, then give a thought to your servant.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 32
text: And David said to Abigail, May the Lord, the God of Israel, be praised, who sent you to me today:

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 33
text: A blessing on your good sense and on you, who have kept me today from the crime of blood and from taking into my hands the punishment for my wrongs.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 34
text: For truly, by the living Lord, the God of Israel, who has kept me from doing you evil, if you had not been so quick in coming to me and meeting me, by dawn there would not have been in Nabal's house so much as one male living.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 35
text: Then David took from her hands her offering: and he said to her, Go back to your house in peace; see, I have given ear to your voice, and taken your offering with respect.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 36
text: And Abigail went back to Nabal; and he was feasting in his house like a king; and Nabal's heart was full of joy, for he had taken much wine; so she said nothing to him till dawn came.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 37
text: And in the morning, when the effect of the wine was gone, Nabal's wife gave him an account of all these things, and all the heart went out of him, and he became like stone.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 38
text: And about ten days after, the Lord sent disease on Nabal and death came to him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 39
text: And David, hearing that Nabal was dead, said, May the Lord be praised, who has taken up my cause against Nabal for the shame which he put on me, and has kept back his servant from evil, and has sent on Nabal's head the reward of his evil-doing. And David sent word to Abigail, desiring to take her as his wife.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 40
text: And when David's servants came to Carmel, to Abigail, they said to her, David has sent us to you to take you to him as his wife.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 41
text: And she got up, and going down on her face to the earth, said, See, I am ready to be a servant-girl, washing the feet of the servants of my lord.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 42
text: Then Abigail got up quickly and went on her ass, with five of her young women, after the men whom David had sent; and she became David's wife.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 43
text: And David had taken Ahinoam of Jezreel, to be his wife; these two were his wives.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 25 Verse 44
text: Now Saul had given his daughter Michal, David's wife, to Palti the son of Laish of Gallim.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 1
text: And the Ziphites came to Saul at Gibeah, and said, Is not David waiting secretly near us in the hill of Hachilah, before the waste land?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 2
text: Then Saul went down to the waste land of Ziph, taking with him three thousand of the best men of Israel, to make search for David in the waste land of Ziph.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 3
text: And Saul put up his tents on the hill of Hachilah, which is in front of the waste land on the road. But David was in the waste land, and he saw that Saul was coming after him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 4
text: And so David sent out watchers, and got word from them that Saul was certainly coming.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 5
text: And David got up and came to the place where Saul's tents were: and David had a view of the place where Saul was sleeping with Abner, the son of Ner, the captain of his army: and Saul was sleeping inside the ring of carts, and the tents of the people were all round him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 6
text: Then David said to Ahimelech the Hittite, and to Abishai, the son of Zeruiah, brother of Joab, Who will go down with me to the tents of Saul? And Abishai said, I will go down with you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 7
text: So David and Abishai came down to the army by night: and Saul was sleeping inside the ring of carts with his spear planted in the earth by his head: and Abner and the people were sleeping round him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 8
text: Then Abishai said to David, God has given up your hater into your hands today; now let me give him one blow through to the earth with his spear, and there will be no need to give him a second.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 9
text: And David said to Abishai Do not put him to death; for who, without sin, may put out his hand against the man on whom the Lord has put the holy oil?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 10
text: And David said, By the living Lord, the Lord will send destruction on him; the natural day of his death will come, or he will go into the fight and come to his end.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 11
text: Never will my hand be stretched out against the man marked with the holy oil; but take the spear which is by his head and the vessel of water, and let us go.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 12
text: So David took the spear and the vessel of water from Saul's head; and they got away without any man seeing them, or being conscious of their coming, or awaking; for they were all sleeping because a deep sleep from the Lord had come on them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 13
text: Then David went over to the other side, and took his place on the top of a mountain some distance away, with a great space between them;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 14
text: And crying out to the people and to Abner, the son of Ner, David said, Have you no answer to give, Abner? Then Abner said, Who is that crying out to the king?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 15
text: And David said to Abner, Are you not a man of war? is there any other like you in Israel? why then have you not kept watch over your lord the king? for one of the people came in to put the king your lord to death.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 16
text: What you have done is not good. By the living Lord, death is the right fate for you, because you have not kept watch over your lord, the man on whom the Lord has put the holy oil. Now see, where is the king's spear, and the vessel of water which was by his head?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 17
text: And Saul, conscious that the voice was David's, said, Is that your voice, David, my son? And David said, It is my voice, O my lord king.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 18
text: And he said, Why does my lord go armed against his servant? what have I done? or what evil is there in me?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 19
text: Let my lord the king give ear now to the words of his servant. If it is the Lord who is moving you against me, let him take an offering: but if it is the children of men, may they be cursed before the Lord, for driving me out today and keeping me from my place in the heritage of the Lord, saying, Go, be the servant of other gods.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 20
text: Then do not let my blood be drained out on the earth away from the face of the Lord: for the king of Israel has come out to take my life, like one going after birds in the mountains.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 21
text: Then Saul said, I have done wrong: come back to me, David my son: I will do you no more wrong, because my life was dear to you today truly, I have been foolish and my error is very great.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 22
text: Then David said, Here is the king's spear! let one of the young men come over and get it.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 23
text: And the Lord will give to every man the reward of his righteousness and his faith: because the Lord gave you into my hands today, and I would not put out my hand against the man who has been marked with the holy oil.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 24
text: And so, as your life was dear to me today, may my life be dear to the Lord, and may he make me free from all my troubles.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 26 Verse 25
text: Then Saul said to David, May a blessing be on you, David, my son; you will do great things and without doubt you will overcome. Then David went on his way, and Saul went back to his place.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 27 Verse 1
text: And David said to himself, Some day death will come to me by the hand of Saul: the only thing for me to do is to get away into the land of the Philistines; then Saul will give up hope of taking me in any part of the land of Israel: and so I may be able to get away from him.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 27 Verse 2
text: So David and the six hundred men who were with him went over to Achish, the son of Maoch, king of Gath.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 27 Verse 3
text: And David and his men were living with Achish at Gath; every man had his family with him, and David had his two wives, Ahinoam of Jezreel, and Abigail of Carmel, who had been the wife of Nabal.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 27 Verse 4
text: And Saul, hearing that David had gone to Gath, went after him no longer.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 27 Verse 5
text: Then David said to Achish, If now I have grace in your eyes, let me have a place in one of the smaller towns of your land, to be my living-place; for it is not right for your servant to be living with you in the king's town.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 27 Verse 6
text: So Achish straight away gave him Ziklag: and for that reason Ziklag has been the property of the kings of Judah to this day.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 27 Verse 7
text: And David was living in the land of the Philistines for the space of a year and four months.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 27 Verse 8
text: And David and his men went up and made attacks on the Geshurites and the Girzites and the Amalekites; for these were the people who were living in the land from Telam on the way to Shur, as far as Egypt.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 27 Verse 9
text: And David again and again made attacks on the land till not a man or a woman was still living; and he took away the sheep and the oxen and the asses and the camels and the clothing; and he came back to Achish.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 27 Verse 10
text: And every time Achish said, Where have you been fighting today? David said, Against the South of Judah and the South of the Jerahmeelites and the South of the Kenites.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 27 Verse 11
text: Not one living man or woman did David ever take back with him to Gath, fearing that they might give an account of what had taken place, and say, This is what David did, and so has he been doing all the time while he has been living in the land of the Philistines.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 27 Verse 12
text: And Achish had belief in what David said, saying, He has made himself hated by all his people Israel, and so he will be my servant for ever.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 1
text: Now in those days the Philistines got their forces together to make war on Israel. And Achish said to David, Certainly you and your men are to go out with me to the fight.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 2
text: And David said to Achish, You will see now what your servant will do. And Achish said to David, Then I will make you keeper of my head for ever.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 3
text: Now Samuel was dead, and all Israel, after weeping for him, had put his body in its last resting-place in Ramah, his town. And Saul had put away from the land all those who had control of spirits and who made use of secret arts.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 4
text: And the Philistines came together and put their forces in position in Shunem; and Saul got all Israel together and they took up their positions in Gilboa.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 5
text: And when Saul saw the Philistine army he was troubled, and his heart was moved with fear.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 6
text: And when Saul went for directions to the Lord, the Lord gave him no answer, by a dream or by the Urim or by the prophets.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 7
text: Then Saul said to his servants, Get me a woman who has control of a spirit so that I may go to her and get directions. And his servants said to him, There is such a woman at En-dor.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 8
text: So Saul, putting on other clothing, so that he might not be seen to be the king, took two men with him and went to the woman by night; and he said, Now, with the help of the spirit which you have, make the person whose name I will give you come up.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 9
text: And the woman said to him, But you have knowledge of what Saul has done, how he has put away out of the land those who have control of spirits and the users of secret arts: why would you, by a trick, put me in danger of death?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 10
text: And Saul made an oath to her by the Lord, saying, By the living Lord, no punishment will come to you for this.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 11
text: Then the woman said, Who am I to let you see? And he said, Make Samuel come up for me.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 12
text: And the woman saw that it was Saul, and she gave a loud cry, and said to Saul, Why have you made use of deceit? for you are Saul.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 13
text: And the king said to her, Have no fear: what do you see? And the woman said to Saul, I see a god coming up out of the earth.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 14
text: And he said to her, What is his form? And she said, It is an old man coming up covered with a robe. And Saul saw that it was Samuel, and with his face bent down to the earth he gave him honour.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 15
text: And Samuel said to Saul, Why have you made me come up, troubling my rest? And Saul in answer said, I am in great danger; for the Philistines are making war on me, and God has gone away from me and will no longer give me any answer, by the prophets or by dreams: so I have sent for you to make clear to me what I am to do.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 16
text: And Samuel said, Why do you put your questions to me, seeing that God has gone away from you and is on the side of him who is against you?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 17
text: And the Lord himself has done what I said: the Lord has taken the kingdom out of your hand and given it to your neighbour David;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 18
text: Because you did not do what the Lord said, and did not give effect to his burning wrath against Amalek. So the Lord has done this thing to you today.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 19
text: And more than this, the Lord will give Israel up with you into the hands of the Philistines: and tomorrow you and your sons will be with me: and the Lord will give up the army of Israel into the hands of the Philistines.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 20
text: Then Saul went down flat on the earth, and was full of fear because of Samuel's words: and there was no strength in him, for he had taken no food all that day or all that night.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 21
text: And the woman came to Saul and saw that he was in great trouble, and said to him, See now, your servant has given ear to your words, and I have put my life in danger by doing what you said.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 22
text: So now, give ear to the voice of your servant, and let me give you a little bread; and take some food to give you strength when you go on your way.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 23
text: But he would not, saying, I have no desire for food. But his servants, together with the woman, made him take food, and he gave way to them. So he got up from the earth, and took his seat on the bed.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 24
text: And the woman had in the house a young cow, made fat for food; and she put it to death straight away; and she took meal and got it mixed and made unleavened bread;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 28 Verse 25
text: And she put it before Saul and his servants, and they had a meal. Then they got up and went away the same night.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 29 Verse 1
text: Now the Philistines got all their army together at Aphek: and the Israelites put their forces in position by the fountain in Jezreel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 29 Verse 2
text: And the lords of the Philistines went on with their hundreds and their thousands, and David and his men came after with Achish.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 29 Verse 3
text: Then the rulers of the Philistines said, What are these Hebrews doing here? And Achish said to the rulers of the Philistines, Is this not David, the servant of Saul the king of Israel, who has been with me for a year or two, and I have never seen any wrong in him from the time when he came to me till now?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 29 Verse 4
text: But the rulers of the Philistines were angry with him, and said to him, Make the man go back to the place you have given him; do not let him go down with us to the fight, or he may be turned against us and be false to us: for how will this man make peace with his lord? will it not be with the heads of these men?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 29 Verse 5
text: Is this not David, who was named in their songs, when in the dance they said to one another, Saul has put to death thousands, and David tens of thousands?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 29 Verse 6
text: Then Achish sent for David and said to him, By the living Lord, you are upright, and everything you have done with me in the army has been pleasing to me: I have seen no evil in you from the day when you came to me till now: but still, the lords are not pleased with you.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 29 Verse 7
text: So now go back, and go in peace, so that you do not make the lords of the Philistines angry.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 29 Verse 8
text: And David said to Achish, But what have I done? what have you seen in your servant while I have been with you till this day, that I may not go and take up arms against those who are now making war on my lord the king?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 29 Verse 9
text: And Achish in answer said, It is true that in my eyes you are good, like an angel of God: but still, the rulers of the Philistines have said, He is not to go up with us to the fight.
