title: 1 Samuel Chapter 29 Verse 10
text: So get up early in the morning, with the servants of your lord who are with you, and go to the place I have given you, and have no evil design in your heart, for you are good in my eyes; but when there is light enough in the morning, go away.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 29 Verse 11
text: So David and his men got up early in the morning to go back to the land of the Philistines. And the Philistines went up to Jezreel.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 1
text: Now when David and his men came to Ziklag on the third day, the Amalekites had made an attack on the South and on Ziklag, and had overcome Ziklag and put it on fire;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 2
text: And had made the women and all who were there, small and great, prisoners: they had not put any of them to death, but had taken them all away.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 3
text: And when David and his men came to the town, they saw that it had been burned down, and their wives and their sons and daughters had been made prisoners.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 4
text: Then David and the people who were with him gave themselves up to weeping till they were able to go on weeping no longer.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 5
text: And David's two wives, Ahinoam of Jezreel and Abigail, the wife of Nabal of Carmel, had been made prisoners.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 6
text: And David was greatly troubled; for the people were talking of stoning him, because their hearts were bitter, every man sorrowing for his sons and his daughters: but David made himself strong in the Lord his God.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 7
text: And David said to Abiathar the priest, the son of Ahimelech, Come here to me with the ephod. And Abiathar took the ephod to David.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 8
text: Then David, questioning the Lord, said, Am I to go after this band? will I be able to overtake them? And in answer he said, Go after them, for you will certainly overtake them, and get back everything.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 9
text: So David went, and his six hundred men went with him, and they came to the stream Besor.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 10
text: And David, with four hundred men, went on: but two hundred of them were overcome with weariness, and not able to go across the stream.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 11
text: And in the fields they saw an Egyptian whom they took to David, and they gave him bread, and he had a meal, and they gave him water for drink;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 12
text: And they gave him part of a cake of figs and some dry grapes; and after the food, his spirit came back to him, for he had had no food or drink for three days and nights.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 13
text: And David said to him, Whose man are you and where do you come from? And he said, I am a young man of Egypt, servant to an Amalekite; and my master went on without me because three days back I became ill.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 14
text: We made an attack on the south part of the country of the Cherethites, and on the land which is Judah's, and on the south of Caleb; and we put Ziklag on fire.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 15
text: And David said to him, Will you take me down to this band? And he said, If you give me your oath that you will not put me to death or give me up to my master, I will take you to them.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 16
text: And when he had taken him down, they saw them all, seated about on all sides, feasting and drinking among all the mass of goods which they had taken from the land of the Philistines and the land of Judah.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 17
text: And David went on fighting them from evening till the evening of the day after; and not one of them got away but only four hundred young men who went in flight on camels.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 18
text: And David got back everything the Amalekites had taken; and he got back his two wives.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 19
text: There was no loss of anything, small or great, sons or daughters or goods or anything which they had taken away: David got it all back.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 20
text: And they took all the flocks and herds, and driving them in front of him, said, These are David's.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 21
text: And David came to the two hundred men, who because of weariness had not gone with him, but were waiting at the stream Besor: and they went out, meeting David and the people who were with him; and when they came near them, they said, How are you?

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 22
text: Then the bad and good-for-nothing men among those who went with David said, Because they did not go with us, we will give them nothing of the goods which we have got back, but only to every man his wife and children, so that he may take them and go.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 23
text: Then David said, You are not to do this, my brothers, after what the Lord has given us, who has kept us safe and given up the band which came against us into our hands.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 24
text: Who is going to give any attention to you in this question? for an equal part will be given to him who went to the fight and to him who was waiting by the goods: they are all to have the same.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 25
text: And so he made it a rule and an order for Israel from that day till now.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 26
text: And when David came to Ziklag, he sent some of the goods to the responsible men of Judah, and to his friends, saying, Here is an offering for you from the goods of those who were fighting against the Lord;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 27
text: He sent to those who were in Beth-el, and in Ramah of the South, and in Jattir;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 28
text: And to those in Arara and Eshtemoa

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 29
text: and Carmel and in the towns of the Jerahmeelites, and in the towns of the Kenites;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 30
text: And to those who were in Hormah and in Bor-ashan and in Athach;

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 30 Verse 31
text: And in Hebron, and to all the places where David and his men had been living.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 31 Verse 1
text: Now the Philistines were fighting against Israel: and the men of Israel went in flight before the Philistines, falling down wounded in Mount Gilboa.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 31 Verse 2
text: And the Philistines overtook Saul and his sons; and they put to death Jonathan and Abinadab and Malchi-shua, the sons of Saul.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 31 Verse 3
text: And the fight was going badly for Saul, and the archers came across him, and he was wounded by the archers.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 31 Verse 4
text: Then Saul said to the servant who had the care of his arms, Take out your sword and put it through me, before these men without circumcision come and make sport of me. But his servant, full of fear, would not do so. Then Saul took out his sword, and falling on it, put an end to himself.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 31 Verse 5
text: And when his servant saw that Saul was dead, he did the same, and was united with him in death.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 31 Verse 6
text: So death overtook Saul and his three sons and his servant on the same day.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 31 Verse 7
text: And when the men of Israel across the valley and on the other side of Jordan saw that the army of Israel was in flight and that Saul and his sons were dead, they came out of their towns and went in flight; and the Philistines came and took them for themselves.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 31 Verse 8
text: Now on the day after, when the Philistines came to take their goods from the dead, they saw Saul and his three sons dead on the earth in Mount Gilboa.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 31 Verse 9
text: And cutting off his head and taking away his war-dress, they sent word into the land of the Philistines round about, to take the news to their gods and to the people.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 31 Verse 10
text: His war-dress they put in the house of Astarte; and his body was fixed on the wall of Beth-shan.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 31 Verse 11
text: And when the people of Jabesh-gilead had news of what the Philistines had done to Saul,

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 31 Verse 12
text: All the fighting men got up and, travelling all night, took Saul's body and the bodies of his sons from the wall of Beth-shan; and they came to Jabesh and had them burned there.

title: 1 Samuel Chapter 31 Verse 13
text: And their bones they put in the earth under a tree in Jabesh; and for seven days they took no food.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Now after the death of Saul, when David, having come back from the destruction of the Amalekites, had been in Ziklag for two days;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: On the third day a man came from Saul's tents, with his clothing out of order and earth on his head: and when he came to David, he went down on the earth and gave him honour.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: And David said to him, Where have you come from? And he said, I have come in flight from the tents of Israel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And David said to him, How did things go? Give me the news. And in answer he said, The people have gone in flight from the fight, and a great number of them are dead; and Saul and his son Jonathan are dead.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And David said to the young man who gave him the news, Why are you certain that Saul and his son Jonathan are dead?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And the young man said, I came by chance to Mount Gilboa, and I saw Saul supporting himself on his spear; and the war-carriages and horsemen overtook him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And looking back, he saw me and gave a cry to me. And answering him I said, Here am I.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And he said to me, Who are you? And I said, I am an Amalekite.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: Then he said to me, Come here to my side, and put me to death, for the pain of death has me in its grip but my life is still strong in me.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: So I put my foot on him and gave him his death-blow, because I was certain that he would not go on living after his fall: and I took the crown from his head and the band from his arm, and I have them here for my lord.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Then David gave way to bitter grief, and so did all the men who were with him:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And till evening they gave themselves to sorrow and weeping, and took no food, weeping for Saul and for Jonathan, his son, and for the people of the Lord and for the men of Israel; because they had come to their end by the sword.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And David said to the young man who had given him the news, Where do you come from? And he said, I am the son of a man from a strange land; I am an Amalekite.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And David said to him, Had you no fear of stretching out your hand to put to death the one marked with the holy oil?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And David sent for one of his young men and said, Go near and put an end to him. And he put him to death.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And David said to him, May your blood be on your head; for your mouth has given witness against you, saying, I have put to death the man marked with the holy oil.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: Then David made this song of grief for Saul and Jonathan, his son:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: (It is recorded in the book of Jashar for teaching to the sons of Judah) and he said:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: The glory, O Israel, is dead on your high places! How have the great ones been made low!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: Give no news of it in Gath, let it not be said in the streets of Ashkelon; or the daughters of the Philistines will be glad, the daughters of men without circumcision will be uplifted in joy.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: O mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew or rain on you, you fields of death: for there the arms of the strong have been shamed, the arms of Saul, as if he had not been marked with the holy oil.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: From the blood of the dead, from the fat of the strong, the bow of Jonathan was not turned back, the sword of Saul did not come back unused.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: Saul and Jonathan were loved and pleasing; in their lives and in their death they were not parted; they went more quickly than eagles, they were stronger than lions.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: O daughters of Israel, have sorrow for Saul, by whom you were delicately clothed in robes of red, with ornaments of gold on your dresses.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: How have the great ones been made low in the fight! Jonathan is dead on your high places.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: I am full of grief for you, my brother Jonathan: very dear have you been to me: your love for me was a wonder, greater than the love of women.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: How have the great ones been made low, and the arms of war broken!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Now after this, David, questioning the Lord, said, Am I to go up into any of the towns of Judah? And the Lord said to him, Go up. And David said, Where am I to go? And he said, To Hebron.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: So David went there, taking with him his two wives, Ahinoam of Jezreel, and Abigail, the wife of Nabal of Carmel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And David took all his men with him, every man with his family: and they were living in the towns round Hebron.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And the men of Judah came there, and with the holy oil made David king over the people of Judah. And word came to David that it was the men of Jabesh-gilead who put Saul's body in its last resting-place.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: And David sent to the men of Jabesh-gilead and said to them, May the Lord give you his blessing, because you have done this kind act to Saul your lord, and have put his body to rest!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: May the Lord be good and true to you: and I myself will see that your kind act is rewarded, because you have done this thing.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: Then let your hands be strong, and have no fear: though Saul your lord is dead, the people of Judah have made me their king.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: Now Abner, the son of Ner, captain of Saul's army, had taken Saul's son Ish-bosheth over to Mahanaim,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And made him king over Gilead and the Asherites and over Jezreel and Ephraim and Benjamin, that is, over all Israel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: (Saul's son Ish-bosheth was forty years old when he became king over Israel, and he was ruler for two years.) But Judah was on the side of David.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And the time when David was king in Hebron over the people of Judah was seven years and six months.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And Abner, the son of Ner, with the servants of Saul's son Ish-bosheth, went out from Mahanaim to Gibeon.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And Joab, the son of Zeruiah, and the servants of David, went out and came face to face with them by the pool of Gibeon; and they took up their position, facing one another on opposite sides of the pool.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And Abner said to Joab, Let the young men give a test of their strength before us. And Joab said, Let them do so.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: So they got up and went over by number: twelve for Benjamin and Ish-bosheth and twelve of the servants of David.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And every one got the other by the head, driving his sword into the other's side, so they all went down together: and that place was named the Field of Sides, and it is in Gibeon.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: And there was hard fighting that day; and Abner and the men of Israel gave way before the servants of David.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: There were three sons of Zeruiah there, Joab and Abishai and Asahel: and Asahel was as quick-footed as a roe of the fields.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: Asahel went running after Abner, not turning to the right or to the left.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: Then Abner, looking back, said, Is it you, Asahel? And he said, It is I.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: And Abner said, Then go to the right or to the left and put your hands on one of the fighting-men and take his arms. But Asahel would not be turned away from going after Abner.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: Then again Abner said to Asahel, Go to one side, do not keep on coming after me: why will you make me put an end to you? for then I will be shamed before your brother Joab.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: But still he did not go to one side: so Abner gave him a back blow in the stomach with his spear, so that the spear came out at his back; and he went down on the earth, wounded to death: and all those who came to the place where Asahel went down dead, came to a stop.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: But Joab and Abishai went after Abner: and the sun went down when they came to the hill of Ammah, which is to the east of the road through the waste land of Geba.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: And the men of Benjamin came together after Abner in one band, and took their places on the top of a hill.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: Then crying out to Joab, Abner said, Are fighting and destruction to go on for ever? do you not see that the end will only be bitter? how long will it be before you send the people back and make them give up attacking their countrymen?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 27
text: And Joab said, By the living God, if you had not given the word, the people would have gone on attacking their countrymen till the morning.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 28
text: So Joab had a horn sounded, and all the people came to a stop, and gave up going after Israel and fighting them.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 29
text: And all that night Abner and his men went through the Arabah; they went over Jordan and through all Bithron and came to Mahanaim.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 30
text: And Joab came back from fighting Abner: and when he had got all his men together, it was seen that nineteen of David's men, in addition to Asahel, were not with them.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 31
text: But David's men had put to death three hundred and sixty of the men of Benjamin and of Abner's men

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 2 Verse 32
text: And they took Asahel's body and put it in the last resting-place of his father in Beth-lehem. And Joab and his men, travelling all night, came to Hebron at dawn.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Now there was a long war between Saul's people and David's people; and David became stronger and stronger, but those on Saul's side became more and more feeble.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: While David was in Hebron he became the father of sons: the oldest was Amnon, son of Ahinoam of Jezreel;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: And the second, Chileab, whose mother was Abigail, the wife of Nabal the Carmelite; and the third, Absalom, son of Maacah, the daughter of Talmai, king of Geshur;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And the fourth, Adonijah, the son of Haggith; and the fifth, Shephatiah, the son of Abital;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And the sixth, Ithream, whose mother was David's wife Eglah. These were the sons of David, whose birth took place in Hebron.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: Now while there was war between Saul's people and David's people, Abner was making himself strong among the supporters of Saul.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: Now Saul had among his wives a woman named Rizpah, the daughter of Aiah: and Ish-bosheth said to Abner, Why have you taken my father's wife?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And Abner was very angry at the words of Ish-bosheth, and he said, Am I a dog's head of Judah? I am this day doing all in my power for the cause of your father Saul and for his brothers and his friends, and have not given you up into the hands of David, and now you say I have done wrong with a woman.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: May God's punishment be on Abner, if I do not for David as the Lord in his oath has said,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And if I do not take away the kingdom from the family of Saul and make David ruler over Israel and Judah from Dan as far as Beer-sheba!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And so great was Ish-bosheth's fear of Abner that he was not able to say a word in answer.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: And Abner sent men to David at Hebron, saying, Make an agreement with me, and I will give you my support in getting all Israel on your side.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And he said, It is well; I will make an agreement with you, but on one condition, which is, that when you come before me, Saul's daughter Michal is to come with you; till she comes you will not see my face.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And David sent men to Saul's son Ish-bosheth, saying, Give me back Michal, my wife, whom I made mine for the price of the private parts of a hundred Philistines.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: So Ish-bosheth sent and took her from her husband Paltiel, the son of Laish.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: And her husband went with her as far as Bahurim, weeping while he went. Then Abner said to him, Go back. And he went back.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: Then Abner had a talk with the chief men of Israel, saying, In the past it was your desire to make David your king: so now, do it:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: For the Lord has said of David, By the hand of my servant David I will make my people Israel safe from the Philistines, and from all who are against them.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: And Abner said the same things to Benjamin: and he went to David in Hebron to make clear to him what seemed good to Israel and to all the people of Benjamin.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: So Abner, with twenty men, came to Hebron, to David. And David made a feast for Abner and the men who were with him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: And Abner said to David, Now I will go, and make all Israel come to my lord the king, so that they may make an agreement with you, and your kingdom may be as wide as your heart's desire. Then David sent Abner away and he went in peace.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: Now the servants of David and Joab had been out attacking a band of armed men, and they came back with a great store of goods taken in the fight: but Abner was no longer in Hebron with David, for he had sent him away and he had gone in peace.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: When Joab and his men came, news was given them that Abner, the son of Ner, had come to the king, who had let him go away again in peace.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: Then Joab came to the king, and said, What have you done? when Abner came to you why did you send him away and let him go?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: Is it not clear to you that Abner, the son of Ner, came with deceit to get knowledge of your going out and your coming in and of all you are doing?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: And when Joab had come out from David, he sent men after Abner, and they overtook him at the water-spring of Sirah, and made him come back with them: but David had no knowledge of it.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 27
text: And when Abner was back in Hebron, Joab took him on one side by the doorway of the town to have a word with him quietly, and there he gave him a wound in the stomach, causing his death in payment for the death of his brother Asahel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 28
text: And when David had word of it he said, May I and my kingdom be clear for ever in the eyes of the Lord from the blood of Abner, the son of Ner:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 29
text: May it come on the head of Joab and all his father's family: among the men of Joab's family may there ever be some who are diseased or lepers, or who do the work of women, or are put to the sword, or are wasted from need of food!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 30
text: So Joab and Abishai his brother put Abner to death, because he had put to death their brother Asahel in the fight at Gibeon.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 31
text: And David said to Joab and all the people who were with him, Go in grief and put haircloth about you, in sorrow for Abner. And King David went after the dead body.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 32
text: And they put Abner's body to rest in Hebron; and the king and all the people were weeping loudly by the resting-place of Abner's body.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 33
text: And the king made a song of grief for Abner and said, Was the death of Abner to be like the death of a foolish man?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 34
text: Your hands were free, your feet were not chained: like the downfall of a man before evil men, so was your fall. And the weeping of the people over him went on again.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 35
text: And the people came to make David take food, while it was still day, but David with an oath said, May God's punishment be on me if I take a taste of bread or any other thing till the sun has gone down!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 36
text: And all the people took note of it and were pleased: like everything the king did, it was pleasing to the people.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 37
text: So it was clear to Israel and to all the people on that day that the king was not responsible for the death of Abner, the son of Ner.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 38
text: And the king said to his servants, Do you not see that a chief and a great man has come to his end today in Israel?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 3 Verse 39
text: While I, though I am crowned king, have little strength, and these men, the sons of Zeruiah, are out of my control: may the Lord give to the evil-doer the reward of his evil-doing!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And when Saul's son Ish-bosheth had news that Abner was dead in Hebron, his hands became feeble, and all the Israelites were troubled.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And Saul's son had two men, captains of bands, one named Baanah and the other Rechab, sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, of the tribe of Benjamin; (for Beeroth was at one time taken to be part of Benjamin:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: But the people of Beeroth had gone in flight to Gittaim, where they have been living to this day.)

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Now Jonathan, Saul's son, had a son whose feet were damaged. He was five years old when news of the death of Saul and Jonathan came from Jezreel, and the woman who took care of him took him up and went in flight: and while she was getting him away as quickly as she was able, he had a fall and his feet were damaged. His name was Mephibosheth.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: And Rechab and Baanah, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, went out and came to the house of Ish-bosheth in the heat of the day, when he was resting in the middle of the day. Now the woman who kept the door was cleaning grain, and sleep overcame her.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And Rechab and his brother Baanah got in without being seen.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And when they came into the house, Ish-bosheth was stretched on his bed in his bedroom; and they made an attack on him and put him to death, and, cutting off his head, they took it with them and went by the road through the Arabah all night.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And they took the head of Ish-bosheth to David in Hebron, and said to the king, Here is the head of Ish-bosheth, the son of Saul your hater, who would have taken your life; the Lord has taken payment for the wrongs of my lord the king from Saul and his seed today.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And David made answer to Rechab and his brother Baanah, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, and said to them, By the living Lord, who has kept me safe from all my trouble,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: When one came to me with the news of Saul's death, in the belief that it would be good news, I took him and put him to death in Ziklag, which was the reward I gave him for his news:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: How much more, when evil men have put an upright person to death, in his house, sleeping on his bed, will I take payment from you for his blood, and have you cut off from the earth?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And David gave orders to his young men and they put them to death, cutting off their hands and their feet and hanging them up by the side of the pool in Hebron. But they took the head of Ish-bosheth and put it in its last resting-place with Abner's body in Hebron.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Then all the tribes of Israel came to David in Hebron and said, Truly, we are your bone and your flesh.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: In the past when Saul was king over us, it was you who went at the head of Israel when they went out or came in: and the Lord said to you, You are to be the keeper of my people Israel and their ruler.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: So all the responsible men of Israel came to the king at Hebron; and King David made an agreement with them in Hebron before the Lord: and they put the holy oil on David and made him king over Israel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: David was thirty years old when he became king, and he was king for forty years,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: Ruling over Judah in Hebron for seven years and six months, and in Jerusalem, over all Israel and Judah, for thirty-three years.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And the king and his men went to Jerusalem against the Jebusites, the people of the land: and they said to David, You will not come in here, but the blind and the feeble-footed will keep you out; for they said, David will not be able to come in here.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: But David took the strong place of Zion, which is the town of David.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: And that day David said, Whoever makes an attack on the Jebusites, let him go up by the water-pipe, and put to death all the blind and feeble-footed who are hated by David. And this is why they say, The blind and feeble-footed may not come into the house.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: So David took the strong tower for his living-place, naming it the town of David. And David took in hand the building of the town all round, starting from the Millo.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And David became greater and greater; for the Lord, the God of armies, was with him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: And Hiram, king of Tyre, sent men to David, with cedar-trees and woodworkers and stoneworkers: and they made David a house.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: And David saw that the Lord had made his position safe as king over Israel, and that he had made his kingdom great because of his people Israel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: And David took more women and wives in Jerusalem, after he had come from Hebron: and he had more sons and daughters.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: These are the names of those whose birth took place in Jerusalem: Shammua and Shobab and Nathan and Solomon

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: And Ibhar and Elishua and Nepheg and Japhia

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: And Elishama and Eliada and Eliphelet.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: And when the Philistines had news that David had been made king over Israel, they all went up in search of David; and David, hearing of it, went down to the strong place.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: And when the Philistines came, they went in every direction in the valley of Rephaim.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: And David, desiring directions from the Lord, said, Am I to go up against the Philistines? will you give them up into my hands? And the Lord said, Go up, for I will certainly give up the Philistines into your hands.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: And David went to Baal-perazim, and overcame them there; and he said, The Lord has let the forces fighting against me be broken before me as a wall is broken by rushing waters. So that place was named Baal-perazim.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: And the Philistines, when they went in flight, did not take their images with them, and David and his men took them away.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: And the Philistines came up again, and went in every direction in the valley of Rephaim.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: And when David went for directions to the Lord, he said, You are not to go up against them in front; but make a circle round them from the back and come on them opposite the spice-trees.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: Then at the sound of footsteps in the tops of the trees, go forward quickly, for the Lord has gone out before you to overcome the army of the Philistines.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: And David did as the Lord had said; and he overcame the Philistines, attacking them from Gibeon to near Gezer.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: And David got together all the fighting-men of Israel to the number of thirty thousand;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: And David, and all the people who were with him, went to Baal of Judah to get the ark of God, over which the holy name is named, the name of the Lord of armies, whose place is between the winged ones.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: And they put the ark of God on a new cart and took it out of the house of Abinadab which was on the hill: and Uzzah and Ahio, the sons of Abinadab, were the drivers of the cart.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: And Uzzah went by the side of the ark, while Ahio went before it.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And David and all the men of Israel made melody before the Lord with all their power, with songs and with corded instruments and instruments of brass.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: And when they came to Nacon's grain-floor, Uzzah put his hand on the ark of God to keep it safe in its place, for the oxen were out of control.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And the wrath of the Lord, burning against Uzzah, sent destruction on him because he had put his hand on the ark, and death came to him there by the ark of God.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: And David was angry because of the Lord's outburst of wrath against Uzzah: and he gave that place the name Perez-uzzah, which is its name to this day.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: And such was David's fear of the Lord that day, that he said, How may I let the ark of God come to me?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: So David did not let the ark of the Lord come back to him to the town of David: but had it turned away and put into the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And the ark of the Lord was in the house of Obed-edom the Gittite for three months: and the Lord sent a blessing on Obed-edom and all his family.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And they said to King David, The blessing of the Lord is on the family of Obed-edom and on all he has, because of the ark of God. And David went and took the ark of God from the house of Obed-edom into the town of David with joy.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And when those who were lifting the ark of the Lord had gone six steps, he made an offering of an ox and a fat young beast.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: And David, clothed in a linen ephod, was dancing before the Lord with all his strength.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: So David and all the men of Israel took up the ark of the Lord with cries of joy and sounding of horns.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: And when the ark of the Lord came into the town of David, Michal, Saul's daughter, looking out of the window, saw King David dancing and jumping before the Lord; and to her mind he seemed foolish.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: And they took in the ark of the Lord, and put it in its place inside the tent which David had put up for it: and David made burned offerings and peace-offerings to the Lord.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: And after David had made the burned offerings and the peace-offerings, he gave the people a blessing in the name of the Lord of armies.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: And he gave to every man and woman among all the people, among all the masses of Israel, a cake of bread and a measure of wine and a cake of dry grapes. Then all the people went away, every man to his house.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: Then David came back to give a blessing to his family. And Michal, Saul's daughter, came out to him and said, How full of glory was the king of Israel today, who let himself be seen uncovered by his servant-girls like a foolish person uncovering himself without shame!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: And David said to Michal, I was dancing before the Lord, who put me over your father and all his sons, to make me a ruler over the people of the Lord, over his people Israel: and I will go on playing before the Lord;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: And I will do even worse than this, and make myself even lower in your eyes: but the servant-girls of whom you were talking will give me honour.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: And Michal, Saul's daughter, had no child till the day of her death.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: Now when the king was living in his house, and the Lord had given him rest from war on every side;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: The king said to Nathan the prophet, See now, I am living in a house of cedar, but the ark of God is housed inside the curtains of a tent.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: And Nathan said to the king, Go and do whatever is in your heart; for the Lord is with you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: Now that night the word of the Lord came to Nathan, saying,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: Go and say to my servant David, The Lord says, Are you to be the builder of a house, a living-place for me?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: For from the day when I took the children of Israel up out of Egypt till this day, I have had no house, but have gone from place to place in a tent.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: In all the places where I went with all the children of Israel, did I ever say to any of the judges of Israel, to whom I gave the care of my people Israel, Why have you not made me a house of cedar?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: Then say these words to my servant David, The Lord of armies says, I took you from the fields, from keeping the sheep, so that you might be a ruler over my people, over my people Israel:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: And I have been with you wherever you went, cutting off before you all those who were against you; and I will make your name great, like the name of the greatest ones of the earth.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And I will make a resting-place for my people Israel, planting them there, so that they may be living in the place which is theirs, and never again be moved; and never again will they be troubled by evil men as they were at the first,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: From the time when I put judges over my people Israel; and I will give you peace from all who are against you. And the Lord says to you that he will make you the head of a line of kings.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: And when the time comes for you to go to rest with your fathers, I will put in your place your seed after you, the offspring of your body, and I will make his kingdom strong.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: He will be the builder of a house for my name, and I will make the seat of his authority certain for ever.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: I will be to him a father and he will be to me a son: if he does wrong, I will give him punishment with the rod of men and with the blows of the children of men;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: But my mercy will not be taken away from him, as I took it from him who was before you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: And your family and your kingdom will keep their place before me for ever: the seat of your authority will never be overturned.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: So Nathan gave David an account of all these words and this vision.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: Then David the king went in and took his seat before the Lord, and said, Who am I, O Lord God, and what is my family, that you have been my guide till now?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: And this was only a small thing to you, O Lord God; but your words have even been about the far-off future of your servant's family, O Lord God!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: What more may David say to you? for you have knowledge of your servant, O Lord God.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: Because of your word and from your heart, you have done all this great work, and let your servant see it.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: Truly you are great, O Lord God: there is no one like you and no other God but you, as is clear from everything which has come to our ears.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: And what other nation in the earth, like your people Israel, did a god go out to take for himself, to be his people, and to make a name for himself, and to do great and strange things for them, driving out a nation and its gods from before his people?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: But you took and made strong for yourself your people Israel, to be your people for ever; and you, Lord, became their God.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: And now, O Lord God, may the word which you have said about your servant and about his family, be made certain for ever, and may you do as you have said!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: And let your name be made great for ever, and let men say, The Lord of armies is God over Israel: and let the family of David your servant be made strong before you!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: For you, O Lord of armies, the God of Israel, have clearly said to your servant, I will make you the head of a family of kings: and so it has come into your servant's heart to make this prayer to you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: And now, O Lord God, you are God and your words are true and you have said you will give your servant this good thing;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: So may it be your pleasure to give your blessing to the family of your servant, so that it may go on for ever before you: (for you, O Lord God, have said it,) and may your blessing be on your servant's family line for ever!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And it came about after this that David made an attack on the Philistines and overcame them; and David took the authority of the mother-town from the hands of the Philistines.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And he overcame the Moabites, and he had them measured with a line when they were stretched out on the earth; marking out two lines for death and one full line for life. So the Moabites became servants to David and gave him offerings.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And David overcame Hadadezer, the son of Rehob, king of Zobah, when he went to make his power seen by the River.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: And David took from him one thousand, seven hundred horsemen and twenty thousand footmen: and David had the leg-muscles of the horses cut, only keeping enough of them for a hundred war-carriages.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And when the Aramaeans of Damascus came to the help of Hadadezer, king of Zobah, David put to the sword twenty-two thousand of the Aramaeans.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: And David put armed forces in Aram of Damascus: and the Aramaeans became servants to David and gave him offerings. And the Lord made David overcome wherever he went.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And David took their gold body-covers from the servants of Hadadezer and took them to Jerusalem.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And from Tebah and Berothai, towns of Hadadezer, King David took a great store of brass.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: And when Tou, king of Hamath, had news that David had overcome all the army of Hadadezer,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: He sent his son Hadoram to David, with words of peace and blessing, because he had overcome Hadadezer in the fight, for Hadadezer had wars with Tou; and Hadoram took with him vessels of silver and gold and brass:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: These King David made holy to the Lord, together with the silver and gold which he had taken from the nations he had overcome--

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: The nations of Edom and Moab, and the children of Ammon and the Philistines and the Amalekites and the goods he had taken from Hadadezer, the son of Rehob, king of Zobah.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: And David got great honour for himself, when he came back, by the destruction of Edom in the valley of Salt, to the number of eighteen thousand men.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: And he put armed forces in Edom; all through Edom he had armed forces stationed, and all the Edomites became servants to David. And the Lord made David overcome wherever he went.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: And David was king over all Israel, judging and giving right decisions for all his people.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: And Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief of the army; and Jehoshaphat, the son of Ahilud, was keeper of the records;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: And Zadok and Abiathar, the son of Ahimelech, the son of Ahitub, were priests; and Seraiah was the scribe;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: And Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David's sons were priests.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: And David said, Is there still anyone of Saul's family living, so that I may be a friend to him, because of Jonathan?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: Now there was of Saul's people a servant named Ziba, and they sent him to David; and the king said to him, Are you Ziba? And he said, I am.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And the king said, Is there anyone of Saul's family still living, to whom I may be a friend in God's name? And Ziba said, There is a son of Jonathan, whose feet are damaged.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: And the king said to him, Where is he? And Ziba said to the king, He is in the house of Machir, the son of Ammiel, in Lo-debar.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: Then King David sent, and had him taken from Lo-debar, from the house of Machir, the son of Ammiel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: And Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan, came to David, and falling down on his face, gave him honour. And David said, Mephibosheth. And answering he said, Your servant is here.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: And David said to him, Have no fear: for truly I will be good to you, because of your father Jonathan, and I will give back to you all the land which was Saul's; and you will have a place at my table at all times.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And he went down on his face before the king, and said, What is your servant, for you to take note of a dead dog such as I am?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: Then the king sent for Ziba, Saul's servant, and said to him, All the property of Saul and of his family I have given to your master's son.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And you and your sons and your servants are to take care of the land for him, and get in the fruit of it, so that your master's son may have food: but Mephibosheth, your master's son, will have a place at my table at all times. Now Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty servants.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: Then Ziba said to the king, Every order which you have given to your servant will be done. As for Mephibosheth, he had a place at David's table, like one of the king's sons.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And Mephibosheth had a young son named Mica. And all the people living in the house of Ziba were servants to Mephibosheth.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: So Mephibosheth went on living in Jerusalem; for he took all his meals at the king's table; and he had not the use of his feet.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Now after this, death came to the king of the children of Ammon, and Hanun, his son, became king in his place.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: And David said, I will be a friend to Hanun, the son of Nahash, as his father was a friend to me. So David sent his servants, to give him words of comfort on account of his father. And David's servants came into the land of the children of Ammon.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: But the chiefs of the children of Ammon said to Hanun their lord, Does it seem to you that David is honouring your father by sending comforters to you? has he not sent his servants to go through the town and make secret observation of it, and overcome it?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: So Hanun took David's servants, and after cutting off half the hair on their chins, and cutting off the skirts of their robes up to the middle, he sent them away.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: When David had news of it, he sent men out with the purpose of meeting them on their way, for the men were greatly shamed: and the king said, Go to Jericho till your hair is long again, and then come back.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves hated by David, they sent to the Aramaeans of Beth-rehob and Zobah, and got for payment twenty thousand footmen, and they got from the king of Maacah a thousand men, and from Tob twelve thousand.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And hearing of this, David sent Joab and all the army and the best fighting-men.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: And the children of Ammon came out and put their forces in position at the way into the town: and the Aramaeans of Zobah and of Rehob, with the men of Tob and Maacah, were by themselves in the field.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: Now when Joab saw that their forces were in position against him in front and at his back, he took the best of the men of Israel and put them in line against the Aramaeans;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And the rest of the people he put in position against the children of Ammon, with Abishai, his brother, at their head.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: And he said, If the Aramaeans are stronger and get the better of me, then you are to come to my help; but if the children of Ammon get the better of you, I will come to your help.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: Take heart, and let us be strong for our people and for the towns of our God, and may the Lord do what seems good to him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: Then Joab and the people with him went forward to the fight against the Aramaeans, and they went in flight before him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: And when the children of Ammon saw the flight of the Aramaeans, they themselves went in flight from Abishai, and came into the town. So Joab went back from fighting the children of Ammon and came to Jerusalem.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: And when the Aramaeans saw that Israel had overcome them, they got themselves together.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: And Hadadezer sent for the Aramaeans who were on the other side of the River: and they came to Helam, with Shobach, the captain of Hadadezer's army, at their head.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: And word of this was given to David: and he got all Israel together and went over Jordan and came to Helam. And the Aramaeans put their forces in position against David, and made an attack on him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: And the Aramaeans went in flight before Israel; and David put to the sword the men of seven hundred Aramaean war-carriages and forty thousand footmen, and Shobach, the captain of the army, was wounded, and came to his death there.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: And when all the kings who were servants of Hadadezer saw that they were overcome by Israel, they made peace with Israel and became their servants. So the Aramaeans, in fear, gave no more help to the children of Ammon.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Now in the spring, at the time when kings go out to war, David sent Joab and his servants and all Israel with him; and they made waste the land of the children of Ammon, and took up their position before Rabbah, shutting it in. But David was still at Jerusalem.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: Now one evening, David got up from his bed, and while he was walking on the roof of the king's house, he saw from there a woman bathing; and the woman was very beautiful.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: And David sent to get knowledge who the woman was. And one said, Is this not Bath-sheba, the daughter of Eliam and wife of Uriah the Hittite?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: And David sent and took her; and she came to him, and he took her to his bed: (for she had been made clean;) then she went back to her house.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And the woman became with child; and she sent word to David that she was with child.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And David sent to Joab saying, Send Uriah the Hittite to me. And Joab sent Uriah to David.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: And when Uriah came to him, David put questions to him about how Joab and the people were, and how the war was going.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: And David said to Uriah, Go down to your house and let your feet be washed. And Uriah went away from the king's house, and an offering from the king was sent after him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: But Uriah took his rest at the door of the king's house, with all the servants of his lord, and did not go down to his house.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: And when word was given to David that Uriah had not gone down to his house, David said to Uriah, Have you not come from a journey? why did you not go down to your house?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: And Uriah said to David, Israel and Judah with the ark are living in tents, and my lord Joab and the other servants of my lord are sleeping in the open field; and am I to go to my house and take food and drink, and go to bed with my wife? By the living Lord, and by the life of your soul, I will not do such a thing.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And David said to Uriah, Be here today, and after that I will let you go. So Uriah was in Jerusalem that day and the day after.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: And when David sent for him, he took meat and drink with him, and David made him the worse for drink: and when evening came, he went to rest on his bed with the servants of his lord, but he did not go down to his house.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: Now in the morning, David gave Uriah a letter to take to Joab.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: And in the letter he said, Take care to put Uriah in the very front of the line, where the fighting is most violent, and go back from him, so that he may be overcome and put to death.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: So while Joab was watching the town, he put Uriah in the place where it was clear to him the best fighters were.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: And the men of the town went out and had a fight with Joab: and a number of David's men came to their death in the fight, and with them Uriah the Hittite.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: Then Joab sent David news of everything which had taken place in the war:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: And he gave orders to the man who took the news, saying, After you have given the king all the news about the war,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: If the king is angry and says, Why did you go so near the town for the fight? was it not certain that their archers would be on the wall?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: Who put Abimelech, the son of Jerubbaal, to death? did not a woman send a great stone down on him from the wall, putting him to death at Thebez? why did you go so near the wall? Then say to him, Your servant Uriah the Hittite is among the dead.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: So the man went, and came to David, and gave him all the news which Joab had sent him to give; then David was angry with Joab and said, Why did you go so near the town for the fight? was it not certain that their archers would be on the wall? who put Abimelech, the son of Jerubbaal, to death? did not a woman send a great stone down on him from the wall, putting him to death at Thebez? why did you go so near the wall?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: And the man said to David, Truly the men got the better of us, and came out against us into the open country, but we sent them back to the very doors of the town.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: And the archers sent their arrows at your servants from the wall, and some of the king's servants are dead, and among them is your servant Uriah the Hittite.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: Then David said to the man, Go and say to Joab, Do not let this be a grief to you; for one man may come to his death by the sword like another: put up an even stronger fight against the town, and take it: and do you put heart into him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: And when the wife of Uriah had news that her husband was dead, she gave herself up to weeping for him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: And when the days of weeping were past, David sent for her, and took her into his house, and she became his wife and gave him a son. But the Lord was not pleased with the thing David had done.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: And the Lord sent Nathan to David. And Nathan came to him and said, There were two men in the same town: one a man of great wealth, and the other a poor man.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: The man of wealth had great numbers of flocks and herds;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: But the poor man had only one little she-lamb, which he had got and taken care of: from its birth it had been with him like one of his children; his meat was its food, and from his cup it took its drink, resting in his arms, and it was like a daughter to him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: Now a traveller came to the house of the man of wealth, but he would not take anything from his flock or his herd to make a meal for the traveller who had come to him, but he took the poor man's lamb and made it ready for the man who had come.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: And David was full of wrath against that man; and he said to Nathan, By the living Lord, death is the right punishment for the man who has done this:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: And he will have to give back four times the value of the lamb, because he has done this and because he had no pity.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: And Nathan said to David, You are that man. The Lord God of Israel says, I made you king over Israel, putting holy oil on you, and I kept you safe from the hands of Saul;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: I gave you your master's daughter and your master's wives for yourself, and I gave you the daughters of Israel and Judah; and if that had not been enough, I would have given you such and such things.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: Why then have you had no respect for the word of the Lord, doing what is evil in his eyes? You have put Uriah the Hittite to death with the sword, and have taken his wife to be your wife; you have put him to death with the sword of the children of Ammon.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: So now the sword will never be turned away from your family; because you have had no respect for me, and have taken the wife of Uriah the Hittite to be your wife.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: The Lord says, From those of your family I will send evil against you, and before your very eyes I will take your wives and give them to your neighbour, and he will take your wives to his bed by the light of this sun.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: You did it secretly; but I will do this thing before all Israel and in the light of the sun.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: And David said to Nathan, Great is my sin against the Lord. And Nathan said to David, The Lord has put away your sin; death will not come on you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: But still, because you have had no respect for the Lord, death will certainly overtake the child who has newly come to birth.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: Then Nathan went back to his house. And the hand of the Lord was on David's son, the child of Uriah's wife, and it became very ill.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: So David made prayer to God for the child; and he took no food day after day, and went in and, stretching himself out on the earth, was there all night.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: And the chief men of his house got up and went to his side to make him get up from the earth, but he would not; and he would not take food with them.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: And then on the seventh day the child's death took place. And David's servants were in fear of giving him the news of the child's death: for they said, Truly, while the child was still living he gave no attention when we said anything to him: what will he do to himself if we give him word that the child is dead?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: But when David saw that his servants were talking together quietly, he was certain that the child was dead: and he said to his servants, Is the child dead? and they said, He is.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: Then David got up from the earth, and after washing and rubbing himself with oil and changing his clothing, he went into the house of the Lord and gave worship: then he went back to his house, and at his order they put food before him and he had a meal.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: Then his servants said to him, Why have you been acting in this way? you were weeping and going without food while the child was still living; but when the child was dead, you got up and had a meal.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: And he said, While the child was still living I went without food and gave myself up to weeping: for I said, Who is able to say that the Lord will not have mercy on me and give the child life?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: But now that the child is dead there is no reason for me to go without food; am I able to make him come back to life? I will go to him, but he will never come back to me.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: And David gave comfort to his wife Bath-sheba, and he went in to her and had connection with her: and she had a son to whom she gave the name Solomon. And he was dear to the Lord.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: And he sent word by Nathan the prophet, who gave him the name Jedidiah, by the word of the Lord.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 26
text: Now Joab was fighting against Rabbah, in the land of the children of Ammon, and he took the water-town.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 27
text: And Joab sent men to David, saying, I have made war against Rabbah and have taken the water-town.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 28
text: So now, get the rest of the people together, and put them in position against the town and take it, for if I take it, it will be named after my name.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 29
text: Then David got all the people together and went to Rabbah and made war on it and took it.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 30
text: And he took the crown of Milcom from his head; the weight of it was a talent of gold, and in it were stones of great price; and it was put on David's head. And he took a great store of goods from the town.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 12 Verse 31
text: And he took the people out of the town and put them to work with wood-cutting instruments, and iron grain-crushers, and iron axes, and at brick-making: this he did to all the towns of the children of Ammon. Then David and all the people went back to Jerusalem.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: Now after this, it came about that Absalom, David's son, had a beautiful sister, whose name was Tamar; and David's son Amnon was in love with her.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: And he was so deeply in love that he became ill because of his sister Tamar; for she was a virgin, and so it seemed hard to Amnon to do anything to her.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: But Amnon had a friend whose name was Jonadab, the son of Shimeah, David's brother: and Jonadab was a very wise man.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: And he said to him, O son of the king, why are you getting thinner day by day? will you not say what your trouble is? And Amnon said to him, I am in love with Tamar, my brother Absalom's sister.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: Then Jonadab said to him, Go to your bed, and let it seem that you are ill: and when your father comes to see you, say to him, Let my sister Tamar come and give me bread, and get the food ready before my eyes, so that I may see it and take it from her hand.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: So Amnon went to bed and made himself seem ill: and when the king came to see him, Amnon said to the king, Please let my sister Tamar come and make me one or two cakes before my eyes, so that I may take food from her hand.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: Then David sent to the house for Tamar and said, Go now to your brother Amnon's house and get a meal for him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: So Tamar went to her brother Amnon's house; and he was in bed. And she took paste and made cakes before his eyes, cooking them over the fire.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: And she took the cooking-pot, and put the cakes before him, but he would not take them. And Amnon said, Let everyone go away from me. So they all went out.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: Then Amnon said to Tamar, Take the food and come into my bedroom, so that I may take it from your hand. So Tamar took the cakes she had made and went with them into her brother Amnon's bedroom.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: And when she took them to give them to him, he put his arms round her and said, Come to bed, my sister.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: And answering him, she said, O my brother, do not put shame on me; it is not right for such a thing to be done in Israel: do not this evil thing.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: What will become of me in my shame? and as for you, you will be looked down on with disgust by all Israel. Now then, go and make your request to the king, for he will not keep me from you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: But he would not give attention to what she said: but being stronger than she, he took her by force, and had connection with her.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: Then Amnon was full of hate for her, hating her with a hate greater than his earlier love for her. And he said to her, Get up and be gone.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: And she said to him, Not so, my brother, for this great wrong in sending me away is worse than what you did to me before. But he gave no attention to her.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: Then he gave a cry to the servant who was waiting on him and said, Put this woman out, and let the door be locked after her.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: Now she had on a long robe, such as in past times the king's virgin daughters were dressed in. Then the servant put her out, locking the door after her.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: And Tamar, in her grief, put dust on her head; and she put her hand on her head and went away crying loudly.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: And her brother Absalom said to her, Has your brother Amnon been with you? but now, let there be an end to your crying, my sister: he is your brother, do not take this thing to heart. So Tamar went on living uncomforted in her brother's house.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: But when King David had news of all these things he was very angry; but he did not make trouble for Amnon his son, for he was dear to David, being his oldest son.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: But Absalom said nothing to his brother Amnon, good or bad: for he was full of hate for him, because he had taken his sister Tamar by force.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: Now after two full years, Absalom had men cutting the wool of his sheep in Baal-hazor, which is near Ephraim: and he sent for all the king's sons to come to his feast.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: And Absalom came to the king and said, See now, your servant is cutting the wool of his sheep; will the king and his servants be pleased to come?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: And the king said to Absalom, No, my son, let us not all go, or the number will be over-great for you. And he made his request again, but he would not go, but he gave him his blessing.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 26
text: Then Absalom said, If you will not go, then let my brother Amnon go with us. And the king said to him, Is there any reason for him to go with you?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 27
text: But Absalom went on requesting him till he let Amnon and all the king's sons go with him. And Absalom made a great feast like a feast for a king.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 28
text: Now Absalom had given orders to his servants, saying, Now take note when Amnon's heart is glad with wine; and when I say to you, Make an attack on Amnon, then put him to death without fear: have I not given you orders? be strong and without fear.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 29
text: So Absalom's servants did to Amnon as Absalom had given them orders. Then all the king's sons got up, and every man got on his beast and went in flight.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 30
text: Now while they were on their way, news was given to David that Absalom had put to death all the sons of the king and that not one of them was still living.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 31
text: Then the king got up in great grief, stretching himself out on the earth: and all his servants were by his side, with their clothing parted.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 32
text: And Jonadab, the son of Shimeah, David's brother, said, Let not my lord have the idea that all the sons of the king have been put to death; for only Amnon is dead: this has been purposed by Absalom from the day when he took his sister Tamar by force.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 33
text: So now, let not my lord the king take this thing to heart, with the idea that all the king's sons are dead: for only Amnon is dead.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 34
text: But Absalom went in flight. And the young man who kept the watch, lifting up his eyes, saw that a great band of people was coming down the slope by the way of the Horons; and the watchman came and gave word to the king, saying, I saw men coming down by the way of the Horons, from the hillside.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 35
text: And Jonadab said to the king, See, the king's sons are coming; as your servant said, so it is.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 36
text: And while he was talking, the king's sons came, with weeping and loud cries: and the king and all his servants were weeping bitterly.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 37
text: So Absalom went in flight and came to Talmai, the son of Ammihud, the king of Geshur, where he was for three years.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 38
text: And the king was sorrowing for his son all the time.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 13 Verse 39
text: And the heart of David was wasted with desire for Absalom: for he was comforted for the death of Amnon.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: Now it was clear to Joab, the son of Zeruiah, that the king's heart was turning to Absalom.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: And Joab sent to Tekoa and got from there a wise woman, and said to her, Now make yourself seem like one given up to grief, and put on the clothing of sorrow, not using any sweet oil for your body, but looking like one who for a long time has been weeping for the dead:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: And come to the king and say these words to him. So Joab gave her words to say.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: And the woman of Tekoa came to the king, and falling on her face, gave him honour and said, Give me help, O king.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: And the king said to her, What is your trouble? And her answer was, Truly I am a widow, and my husband is dead.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: And I had two sons, and the two of them had a fight in the field, and there was no one to come between them, and one with a blow put the other to death.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: And now all the family is turned against me, your servant, saying, Give up him who was the cause of his brother's death, so that we may put him to death in payment for the life of his brother, whose life he took; and we will put an end to the one who will get the heritage: so they will put out my last burning coal, and my husband will have no name or offspring on the face of the earth.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: And the king said to the woman, Go to your house and I will give orders about this.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: And the woman of Tekoa said to the king, My lord, O king, may the sin be on me and on my family, and may the king and the seat of his kingdom be clear of sin!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: And the king said, If anyone says anything to you, make him come to me, and he will do you no more damage.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: Then she said, Let the king keep in mind the Lord your God, so that he who gives punishment for blood may be kept back from further destruction and that no one may send death on my son. And he said, By the living Lord, not a hair of your son's head will come to the earth.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: Then the woman said, Will the king let his servant say one word more? And he said, Say on.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: And the woman said, Why have you had such a thought about the people of God? (for in saying these very words the king has put himself in the wrong because he has not taken back the one whom he sent far away.)

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: For death comes to us all, and we are like water drained out on the earth, which it is not possible to take up again; and God will not take away the life of the man whose purpose is that he who has been sent away may not be completely cut off from him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: And now it is my fear of the people which has made me come to say these words to my lord the king: and your servant said, I will put my cause before the king, and it may be that he will give effect to my request.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: For the king will give ear, and take his servant out of the power of the man whose purpose is the destruction of me and my son together from the heritage of God.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: Then your servant said, May the word of my lord the king give me peace! for my lord the king is as the angel of God in his hearing of good and bad: and may the Lord your God be with you!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: Then the king said to the woman, Now give me an answer to the question I am going to put to you; keep nothing back. And the woman said, Let my lord the king say on.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: And the king said, Is not the hand of Joab with you in all this? And the woman in answer said, By the life of your soul, my lord the king, it is not possible for anyone to go to the right hand or to the left from anything said by the king: your servant Joab gave me orders, and put all these words in my mouth:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: This he did, hoping that the face of this business might be changed: and my lord is wise, with the wisdom of the angel of God, having knowledge of everything on earth.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: And the king said to Joab, See now, I will do this thing: go then and Come back with the young man Absalom.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: Then Joab, falling down on his face on the earth, gave the king honour and blessing; and Joab said, Today it is clear to your servant that I have grace in your eyes, my lord king, because the king has given effect to the request of his servant.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: So Joab got up and went to Geshur and came back again to Jerusalem with Absalom.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: And the king said, Let him go to his house, but let him not see my face. So Absalom went back to his house and did not see the face of the king.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: Now in all Israel there was no one so greatly to be praised for his beautiful form as Absalom: from his feet to the crown of his head he was completely beautiful.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: And when he had his hair cut, (which he did at the end of every year, because of the weight of his hair;) the weight of the hair was two hundred shekels by the king's weight.
