title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: And Absalom was the father of three sons and of one daughter named Tamar, who was very beautiful.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: For two full years Absalom was living in Jerusalem without ever seeing the face of the king.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 29
text: Then Absalom sent for Joab to send him to the king, but he would not come to him: and he sent again a second time, but he would not come.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 30
text: So he said to his servants, See, Joab's field is near mine, and he has barley in it; go and put it on fire. And Absalom's servants put the field on fire.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 31
text: Then Joab came to Absalom in his house and said to him, Why have your servants put my field on fire?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 32
text: And Absalom's answer was, See, I sent to you saying, Come here, so that I may send you to the king to say, Why have I come back from Geshur? it would be better for me to be there still: let me now see the king's face, and if there is any sin in me, let him put me to death.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 14 Verse 33
text: So Joab went to the king and said these words to him: and when the king had sent for him, Absalom came, and went down on his face on the earth before the king: and the king gave him a kiss.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: Now after this, Absalom got for himself a carriage and horses, and fifty runners to go before him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: And Absalom got up early, morning after morning, and took his place at the side of the public meeting-place: and when any man had a cause which had to come to the king to be judged, then Absalom, crying out to him, said, What is your town? and he would say, Your servant is of one of the tribes of Israel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: And Absalom would say to him, See, your cause is true and right; but no man has been named by the king to give you a hearing.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: And more than this, Absalom said, If only I was made judge in the land, so that every man who has any cause or question might come to me, and I would give a right decision for him!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: And if any man came near to give him honour, he took him by the hand and gave him a kiss.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: And this Absalom did to everyone in Israel who came to the king to have his cause judged: so Absalom, like a thief, took away the hearts of the men of Israel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: Now at the end of four years, Absalom said to the king, Let me go to Hebron and give effect to the oath which I made to the Lord:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: For while I was living in Geshur in Aram, your servant made an oath, saying, If ever the Lord lets me come back to Jerusalem, I will give him worship in Hebron.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: And the king said to him, Go in peace. So he got up and went to Hebron.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: But Absalom at the same time sent watchers through all the tribes of Israel to say, At the sound of the horn you are to say, Absalom is king in Hebron.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: And with Absalom, at his request, went two hundred men from Jerusalem, who were completely unconscious of his designs.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: And Absalom sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite, one of David's helpers, from Giloh his town, while he was making the offerings. And the design against David became strong, for more and more people were joined to Absalom.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: And one came to David and said, The hearts of the men of Israel have gone after Absalom.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: And David said to all his servants who were with him at Jerusalem, Come, let us go in flight, or not one of us will be safe from Absalom: let us go without loss of time, or he will overtake us quickly and send evil on us, and put the town to the sword.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: And the king's servants said to the king, See, your servants are ready to do whatever the king says is to be done.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: So the king went out, taking with him all the people of his house, but for ten of his women, who were to take care of the house.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: And the king went out, and all his servants went after him, and made a stop at the Far House.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: And all the people went on by his side; and all the Cherethites and all the Pelethites and all the men of Ittai of Gath, six hundred men who came after him from Gath, went on before the king.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: Then the king said to Ittai the Gittite, Why are you coming with us? go back and keep with the king: for you are a man of another country, you are far from the land of your birth.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: It was only yesterday you came to us; why then am I to make you go up and down with us? for I have to go where I may; go back then, and take your countrymen with you, and may the Lord's mercy and good faith be with you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: And Ittai the Gittite in answer said, By the living Lord, and by the life of my lord the king, in whatever place my lord the king may be, for life or death, there will your servant be.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: And David said to Ittai, Go forward, then. And Ittai the Gittite went on, with all his men and all the little ones he had with him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: And there was great weeping in all the country when all the people went through; and the king himself was waiting in the Kidron valley and all the people went by him in the direction of the olive-tree on the edge of the waste land.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: Then Zadok came, and Abiathar, and with them the ark of God's agreement: and they put down the ark of God, till all the people from the town had gone by.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: And the king said to Zadok, Take the ark of God back into the town: if I have grace in the eyes of the Lord, he will let me come back and see it and his House again:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: But if he says, I have no delight in you: then, here I am; let him do to me what seems good to him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: The king said further to Zadok the priest, See, you and Abiathar are to go back to the town in peace, with your two sons, Ahimaaz, your son, and Jonathan, the son of Abiathar.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: See, I will be waiting at the way across the river, in the waste land, till I get news from you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: So Zadok and Abiathar took the ark of God back to Jerusalem, and did not go away from there.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: And David went up the slopes of the Mount of Olives weeping all the way, with his head covered and no shoes on his feet: and all the people who were with him, covering their heads, went up weeping.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: And word came to David, saying, Ahithophel is among those who are joined to Absalom. And David said, O Lord, let the wisdom of Ahithophel be made foolish.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: Now when David had come to the top of the slope, where they gave worship to God, Hushai the Archite came to him in great grief with dust on his head:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 33
text: David said to him, If you go on with me, you will be a trouble to me:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 34
text: But if you go back to the town and say to Absalom, I will be your servant, O king; as in the past I have been your father's servant, so now I will be yours: then you will be able to keep Ahithophel's designs against me from being put into effect.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 35
text: And have you not there Zadok and Abiathar the priests? so whatever comes to your ears from the king's house, give word of it to Zadok and Abiathar the priests.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 36
text: See, they have with them their two sons, Ahimaaz, Zadok's son, and Jonathan, the son of Abiathar; by them you may send word to me of everything which comes to your ears.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 15 Verse 37
text: So Hushai, David's friend, went into the town, and Absalom came to Jerusalem.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: And when David had gone a little way past the top of the slope, Ziba, the servant of Mephibosheth, came to him, with two asses on which were two hundred cakes of bread and a hundred stems of dry grapes and a hundred summer fruits and a skin of wine.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: And David said to Ziba, What is your reason for this? And Ziba said, The asses are for the use of the king's people, and the bread and the fruit are food for the young men; and the wine is for drink for those who are overcome by weariness in the waste land.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: And the king said, And where is your master's son? And Ziba said, He is still at Jerusalem: for he said, Today Israel will give back to me the kingdom of my father.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: Then the king said to Ziba, Truly everything which was Mephibosheth's is yours. And Ziba said, I give honour to my lord, may I have grace in your eyes, my lord, O king!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: And when King David came to Bahurim, a man of Saul's family named Shimei, the son of Gera, came out from there, calling curses after him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: And he sent stones at David and at all the king's servants and at all the people and at all the men of war by his side, on the right hand and on the left.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: And Shimei said, with curses, Be gone, be gone, you man of blood, you good-for-nothing:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: The Lord has sent punishment on you for all the blood of the family of Saul, whose kingdom you have taken; and the Lord has given the kingdom to Absalom, your son: now you yourself are taken in your evil, because you are a man of blood.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: Then Abishai, the son of Zeruiah, said to the king, Is this dead dog to go on cursing my lord the king? let me go over and take off his head.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: And the king said, What have I to do with you, you sons of Zeruiah? Let him go on cursing, for the Lord has said, Put a curse on David, and who then may say, Why have you done so?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: And David said to Abishai and to all his servants, You see how my son, the offspring of my body, has made designs against my life: how much more then may this Benjamite do so? Let him be, and let him go on cursing; for the Lord has given him orders.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: It may be that the Lord will take note of my wrongs, and give me back good in answer to his cursing of me today.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: So David and his men went on their way: and Shimei went by the hillside parallel with them, cursing and sending stones and dust at him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: And the king and his people came tired to Jordan, and took their rest there.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: And Absalom and the men of Israel came to Jerusalem, and Ahithophel was with him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: Then Hushai the Archite, David's friend, came to Absalom and said, Long life to the king, long life to the king!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: And Absalom said, Is this your love for your friend? why did you not go with your friend?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: And Hushai said to Absalom, Not so; I am for that man whom the Lord and this people and all the men of Israel have taken as king, and I will take my place with him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: And more than this! where is my place as a servant? is it not before his son? as I have been your father's servant, so will I be yours.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: Then Absalom said to Ahithophel, Give your opinion now, what are we to do?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: And Ahithophel said to Absalom, Go in to your father's women who are here looking after his house; then all Israel will have the news that you are hated by your father, and the hands of your supporters will be strong.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: So they put up the tent for Absalom on the top of the house, and Absalom went in to his father's women before the eyes of all Israel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: In those days the opinions of Ahithophel were valued as highly as if through him a man might get direction from God; so were they valued by David as much as by Absalom.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: Then Ahithophel said to Absalom, Let me take out twelve thousand men and this very night I will go after David:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: And I will come up with him when he is tired and feeble, and make him full of fear: and all the people with him will go in flight; and I will make an attack on the king only:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: And I will make all the people come back to you as a bride comes back to her husband: it is the life of only one man you are going after; so all the people will be at peace.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: And the saying was pleasing to Absalom and to the responsible men of Israel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: Then Absalom said, Now send for Hushai the Archite, and let us give ear to what he has to say.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: And when Hushai came, Absalom said to him, This is what Ahithophel has said: are we to do as he says? if not, what is your suggestion?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: And Hushai said to Absalom, Ahithophel's idea is not a good one at this time.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: Hushai said further, You have knowledge of your father and his men, that they are men of war, and that their feelings are bitter, like those of a bear in the field whose young ones have been taken from her: and your father is a man of war, and will not take his night's rest with the people;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: But he will certainly have taken cover now in some hole or secret place; and if some of our people, at the first attack, are overcome, then any hearing of it will say, There is destruction among the people who are on Absalom's side.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: Then even the strongest, whose heart is like the heart of a lion, will become like water; for all Israel is conscious that your father is a man of war, and those who are with him are strong and without fear.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: But my suggestion is that all Israel, from Dan as far as Beer-sheba, comes together to you, a great army like the sands of the sea in number; and that you yourself go out among them.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: Then we will come on him in some place, wherever he may be, falling on him as the dew comes on the earth: and of him and all the men who are with him not one will get away with his life.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: And if he has gone into some town, then let all Israel take strong cords to that town, and we will have it pulled into the valley, till not one small stone is to be seen there.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: Then Absalom and all the men of Israel said, Hushai's suggestion is better than that of Ahithophel. For it was the purpose of the Lord to make the wise designs of Ahithophel without effect, so that the Lord might send evil on Absalom.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: Then Hushai said to Zadok and Abiathar, the priests, This is the suggestion made by Ahithophel to Absalom and the responsible men of Israel, and this is what I said to them.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: So now send the news quickly to David, and say, Do not take your night's rest by the way across the river to the waste land, but be certain to go over; or the king and all the people with him will come to destruction.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: Now Jonathan and Ahimaaz were waiting by En-rogel; and a servant-girl went from time to time and gave them news and they went with the news to King David, for it was not wise for them to let themselves be seen coming into the town.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: But a boy saw them, and gave word of it to Absalom: so the two of them went away quickly, and came to the house of a man in Bahurim who had a water-hole in his garden, and they went down into it.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 19
text: And a woman put a cover over the hole, and put crushed grain on top of it, and no one had any knowledge of it.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 20
text: And Absalom's servants came to the woman at the house and said, Where are Ahimaaz and Jonathan? And the woman said to them, They have gone from here to the stream. And after searching for them, and seeing nothing of them, they went back to Jerusalem.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 21
text: Then after the servants had gone away, they came up out of the water-hole and went to give King David the news; and they said, Get up and go quickly over the water, for such and such are Ahithophel's designs against you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 22
text: So David and all the people who were with him went up over Jordan: when dawn came, every one of them had gone over Jordan.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 23
text: Now when Ahithophel saw that his suggestion was not acted on, he got his ass ready, and went back to his house, to the town where he came from, and having put his house in order, he put himself to death by hanging; so he came to his end and was put in the resting-place of his father.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 24
text: And David came to Mahanaim. And Absalom, with all the men of Israel, went over Jordan.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 25
text: And Absalom put Amasa at the head of the army in place of Joab. Now Amasa was the son of a man named Ithra the Ishmaelite, who had been the lover of Abigail, the daughter of Jesse, sister of Zeruiah, Joab's mother.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 26
text: And Israel and Absalom put up their tents in the land of Gilead.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 27
text: Now when David had come to Mahanaim, Shobi, the son of Nahash of Rabbah, the Ammonite, and Machir, the son of Ammiel of Lo-debar, and Barzillai the Gileadite of Rogelim,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 28
text: Came with beds and basins and pots, and grain and meal, and all sorts of dry foods,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Verse 29
text: And honey and butter and sheep and milk-cheeses, for David and his people: for they said, This people is in the waste land, needing food and drink and rest.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: And David had the people who were with him numbered, and he put over them captains of thousands and captains of hundreds.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: And David sent the people out, a third of them under the orders of Joab, and a third under the orders of Abishai, son of Zeruiah, Joab's brother, and a third under Ittai the Gittite. And the king said to the people, And I myself will certainly go out with you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: But the people said, It is better for you not to go out: for if we are put to flight, they will not give a thought to us, and if death overtakes half of us, it will be nothing to them: but you are of more value than ten thousand of us: so it is better for you to be ready to come to our help from this town.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: And the king said to them, I will do whatever seems best to you. So the king took his place by the door of the town, and all the people went out by hundreds and by thousands.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: And the king gave orders to Joab and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Because of me, be gentle to the young man Absalom. And this order about Absalom was given in the hearing of all the people.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: So the people went out into the field against Israel, and the fight took place in the woods of Ephraim.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: And the people of Israel were overcome there by the servants of David, and there was a great destruction that day, and twenty thousand men were put to the sword.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: And the fighting went on over all the face of the country: and the woods were responsible for more deaths than the sword.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: And Absalom came across some of David's men. And Absalom was seated on his mule, and the mule went under the thick branches of a great tree, and his head became fixed in the tree and he was lifted up between earth and heaven, and the beast under him went on.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: And a certain man saw it and said to Joab, I saw Absalom hanging in a tree.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: And Joab said to the man who had given him the news, If you saw this, why did you not put your sword through him, and I would have given you ten bits of silver and a band for your robe?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: And the man said to Joab, Even if you gave me a thousand bits of silver, I would not put out my hand against the king's son: for in our hearing the king gave orders to you and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Take care that the young man Absalom is not touched.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: And if I had falsely put him to death (and nothing may be kept secret from the king), you would have had nothing to do with me.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: Then Joab said, I would have made it safe for you. And he took three spears in his hand, and put them through Absalom's heart, while he was still living, in the branches of the tree.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: And ten young men, servants of Joab, came round Absalom and put an end to him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: And Joab had the horn sounded, and the people came back from going after Israel, for Joab kept them back.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: And they took Absalom's body and put it into a great hole in the wood, and put a great mass of stones over it: and every man of Israel went in flight to his tent.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: Now Absalom, before his death, had put up for himself a pillar in the king's valley, naming it after himself; for he said, I have no son to keep my name in memory: and to this day it is named Absalom's pillar.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: Then Ahimaaz, the son of Zadok, said, Let me go and give the king news of how the Lord has done right in his cause against those who took up arms against him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: And Joab said, You will take no news today; another day you may give him the news, but you will take no news today, because the king's son is dead.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: Then Joab said to the Cushite, Go and give the king word of what you have seen. And the Cushite, making a sign of respect to Joab, went off running.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: Then Ahimaaz, the son of Zadok, said to Joab again, Whatever may come of it, let me go after the Cushite. And Joab said, Why have you a desire to go, my son, seeing that you will get no reward for your news?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: Whatever may come of it, he said, I will go. Then he said to him, Go. So Ahimaaz went running by the lowland road and overtook the Cushite.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: Now David was seated between the two town doors; and the watchman went up to the roof of the doorways, on the wall, and, lifting up his eyes, saw a man running by himself.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: And the watchman gave news of it to the king. And the king said, If he is coming by himself, then he has news. And the man was travelling quickly, and came near.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: Then the watchman saw another man running: and crying out in the direction of the door he said, Here is another man running by himself. And the king said, He, like the other, comes with news.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: And the watchman said, It seems to me that the running of the first is like the running of Ahimaaz, the son of Zadok. And the king said, He is a good man, and his news will be good.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: And Ahimaaz, crying out to the king, said, It is well. And falling down before the king, with his face to the earth, he said, May the Lord your God be praised, who has given up the men who took up arms against my lord the king!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 29
text: And the king said, Is it well with the young man Absalom? And Ahimaaz said in answer, When Joab sent me, your servant, I saw a great outcry going on, but I had no knowledge of what it was.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 30
text: And the king said, Get back and take your place here. So turning to one side, he took his place there.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 31
text: And then the Cushite came and said, I have news for my lord the king: today the Lord has done right in your cause against all those who took up arms against you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 32
text: And the king said to the Cushite, Is the young man Absalom safe? And the Cushite said in answer, May all the king's haters and those who do evil against the king, be as that young man is!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 18 Verse 33
text: Then the king was much moved, and went up into the room over the door, weeping, and saying, O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! if only my life might have been given for yours, O Absalom, my son, my son!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: And word was given to Joab that the king was weeping and sorrowing for Absalom.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: And the salvation of that day was changed to sorrow for all the people: for it was said to the people, The king is in bitter grief for his son.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: And the people made their way back to the town quietly and secretly, as those who are shamed go secretly when they go in flight from the war.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: But the king, covering his face, gave a great cry, O my son Absalom, O Absalom, my son, my son!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: And Joab came into the house to the king and said, Today you have put to shame the faces of all your servants who even now have kept you and your sons and your daughters and your wives and all your women safe from death;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: For your haters, it seems, are dear to you, and your friends are hated. For you have made it clear that captains and servants are nothing to you: and now I see that if Absalom was living and we had all been dead today, it would have been right in your eyes.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: So get up now, and go out and say some kind words to your servants; for, by the Lord, I give you my oath, that if you do not go out, not one of them will keep with you tonight; and that will be worse for you than all the evil which has overtaken you from your earliest years.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: Then the king got up and took his seat near the town-door. And word was given to all the people that the king was in the public place: and all the people came before the king. Now all the men of Israel had gone back in flight to their tents.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: And through all the tribes of Israel the people were having arguments, saying, The king made us safe from the hands of those who were against us and made us free from the hands of the Philistines; and now he has gone in flight from the land, because of Absalom.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: And Absalom, whom we made a ruler over us, is dead in the fight. So now why do you say nothing about getting the king back? And word of what all Israel was saying came to the king.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: And King David sent word to Zadok and Abiathar, the priests, Say to the responsible men of Judah, Why are you the last to take steps to get the king back to his house?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: You are my brothers, my bone and my flesh; why are you the last to get the king back again?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: And say to Amasa, Are you not my bone and my flesh? May God's punishment be on me, if I do not make you chief of the army before me at all times in place of Joab!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: And the hearts of the men of Judah were moved like one man; so that they sent to the king, saying, Come back, with all your servants.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: So the king came back, and came as far as Jordan. And Judah came to Gilgal, meeting the king there, to take him back with them over Jordan.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: And Shimei, the son of Gera, the Benjamite from Bahurim, got up quickly and went down with the men of Judah for the purpose of meeting King David;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: And with him a thousand men of Benjamin, and Ziba, the servant of Saul, with his fifteen sons and twenty servants, came rushing to Jordan before the king,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: And kept going across the river to take the people of the king's house over, and to do whatever was desired by the king. And Shimei, the son of Gera, went down on his face in the dust before the king, when he was about to go over Jordan,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: And said to him, Let me not be judged as a sinner in your eyes, O my lord, and do not keep in mind the wrong I did on the day when my lord the king went out of Jerusalem, or take it to heart.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: For your servant is conscious of his sin: and so, as you see, I have come today, the first of all the sons of Joseph, for the purpose of meeting my lord the king.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: But Abishai, the son of Zeruiah, said, Is not death the right fate for Shimei, because he has been cursing the one marked by the holy oil?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: And David said, What have I to do with you, you sons of Zeruiah, that you put yourselves against me today? is it right for any man in Israel to be put to death today? for I am certain today that I am king in Israel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: So the king said to Shimei, You will not be put to death. And the king gave him his oath.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: And Mephibosheth, the son of Saul's son, came down for the purpose of meeting the king; his feet had not been cared for or his hair cut or his clothing washed from the day when the king went away till the day when he came back in peace.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 25
text: Now when he had come from Jerusalem to see the king, the king said to him, Why did you not come with me, Mephibosheth?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 26
text: And he said in answer, Because of the deceit of my servant, my lord king: for I, your servant, said to him, You are to make ready an ass and on it I will go with the king, for your servant has not the use of his feet.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 27
text: He has given you a false account of me: but my lord the king is like the angel of God: do then whatever seems good to you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 28
text: For all my father's family were only dead men before my lord the king: and still you put your servant among those whose place is at the king's table. What right then have I to say anything more to the king?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 29
text: And the king said, Say nothing more about these things. I say, Let there be a division of the land between Ziba and you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 30
text: And Mephibosheth said, Let him take it all, now that my lord the king has come back to his house in peace!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 31
text: And Barzillai the Gileadite came down from Rogelim; and he went on as far as Jordan with the king to take him across Jordan.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 32
text: Now Barzillai was a very old man, as much as eighty years old: and he had given the king everything he had need of, while he was at Mahanaim, for he was a very great man.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 33
text: And the king said to Barzillai, Come over with me, and I will take care of you in Jerusalem.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 34
text: And Barzillai said to the king, How much of my life is still before me, for me to go up to Jerusalem with the king?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 35
text: I am now eighty years old: good and bad are the same to me; have meat and drink any taste for me now? am I able to take pleasure in the voices of men or women in song? why then am I to be a trouble to my lord the king?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 36
text: Your servant's desire was only to take the king over Jordan; why is the king to give me such a reward?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 37
text: Let your servant now go back again, so that when death comes to me, it may be in my town and by the resting-place of my father and mother. But here is your servant Chimham: let him go with my lord the king, and do for him what seems good to you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 38
text: And the king said in answer, Let Chimham go over with me, and I will do for him whatever seems good to you: and whatever your desire is, I will do it for you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 39
text: Then all the people went over Jordan, and the king went over: and the king gave Barzillai a kiss, with his blessing; and he went back to his place.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 40
text: So the king went over to Gilgal, and Chimham went with him: and all the people of Judah, as well as half the people of Israel, took the king on his way.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 41
text: Then the men of Israel came to the king and said, Why have our countrymen of Judah taken you away in secret and come over Jordan with the king and all his family, because all his people are David's men?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 42
text: And all the men of Judah gave this answer to the men of Israel, Because the king is our near relation: why then are you angry about this? have we taken any of the king's food, or has he given us any offering?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 19 Verse 43
text: And in answer to the men of Judah, the men of Israel said, We have ten parts in the king, and we are the first in order of birth: why did you make nothing of us? and were we not the first to make suggestions for getting the king back? And the words of the men of Judah were more violent than the words of the men of Israel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: Now by chance there was present a good-for-nothing person named Sheba, the son of Bichri, a Benjamite: and he, sounding the horn, said, We have no part in David, or any interest in the son of Jesse: let every man go to his tent, O Israel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: So all the men of Israel, turning away from David, went after Sheba, the son of Bichri: but the men of Judah were true to their king, going with him from Jordan as far as Jerusalem.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: And David came to his house at Jerusalem: and the king took the ten women to whom he had given the care of the house, and had them shut up, and gave them the necessaries of life, but did not go near them. So they were shut up till the day of their death, living as widows.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: Then the king said to Amasa, Get all the men of Judah together, and in three days be here yourself.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: So Amasa went to get all the men of Judah together, but he took longer than the time David had given him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: And David said to Abishai, Sheba, the son of Bichri, will do us more damage than Absalom did; so take some of your lord's servants and go after him, before he makes himself safe in the walled towns, and gets away before our eyes.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: So there went after Abishai, Joab and the Cherethites and the Pelethites and all the fighting-men; they went out of Jerusalem to overtake Sheba, the son of Bichri.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: When they were at the great stone which is in Gibeon, Amasa came face to face with them. Now Joab had on his war-dress, and round him a band from which his sword was hanging in its cover; and while he was walking, it came out, falling to the earth.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: And Joab said to Amasa, Is it well, my brother? And with his right hand he took him by the hair of his chin to give him a kiss.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: But Amasa did not see danger from the sword which was now in Joab's left hand, and Joab put it through his stomach so that his inside came out on to the earth, and he did not give him another blow. So Joab and his brother Abishai went on after Sheba, the son of Bichri.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: And one of Joab's young men, taking his place at Amasa's side, said, Whoever is for Joab and for David, let him go after Joab!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: And Amasa was stretched out in a pool of blood in the middle of the highway. And when the man saw that all the people were stopping, he took Amasa out of the highway and put him in a field, with a cloth over him, when he saw that everyone who went by came to a stop.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: When he had been taken off the road, all the people went on after Joab in search of Sheba, the son of Bichri.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: And Sheba went through all the tribes of Israel, to Abel of Beth-maacah; and all the Bichrites came together and went in after him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: And Joab and his men got him shut up in Abel of Beth-maacah, and put up an earthwork against the town: and all Joab's men did their best to get the wall broken down.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: Then a wise woman got up on the wall, and crying out from the town, said, Give ear, give ear; say now to Joab, Come near, so that I may have talk with you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: And he came near, and the woman said, Are you Joab? And he said in answer, I am. Then she said, Give ear to your servant's words. And he said, I am giving ear.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: Then she said, In the old days, there was a saying, Let them put the question in Abel and in Dan, saying, Has what was ordered by men of good faith in Israel ever come to an end?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: Your purpose is the destruction of a mother-town in Israel: why would you put an end to the heritage of the Lord?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: And Joab, answering her, said, Far, far be it from me to be a cause of death or destruction;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: Not so: but a man of the hill-country of Ephraim, Sheba, son of Bichri, by name, has taken up arms against the king, against David: give up this man only, and I will go away from the town. And the woman said to Joab, His head will be dropped over the wall to you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: Then the woman in her wisdom had talk with all the town. And they had Sheba's head cut off and sent out to Joab. And he had the horn sounded, and sent them all away from the town, every man to his tent. And Joab went back to Jerusalem to the king.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: Now Joab was over all the army; and Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, was at the head of the Cherethites and the Pelethites;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: And Adoram was overseer of the forced work; and Jehoshaphat, the son of Ahilud, was the recorder;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: And Sheva was the scribe, and Zadok and Abiathar were priests;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: And in addition, Ira the Jairite was a priest to David.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: In the days of David they were short of food for three years, year after year; and David went before the Lord for directions. And the Lord said, On Saul and on his family there is blood, because he put the Gibeonites to death.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: Then the king sent for the Gibeonites; (now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but were the last of the Amorites, to whom the children of Israel had given an oath; but Saul, in his passion for the children of Israel and Judah, had made an attempt on their lives:)

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: So David said to the Gibeonites, What may I do for you? how am I to make up to you for your wrongs, so that you may give a blessing to the heritage of the Lord?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: And the Gibeonites said to him, It is not a question of silver and gold between us and Saul or his family; and it is not in our power to put to death any man in Israel. And he said, Say, then, what am I to do for you?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: And they said to the king, As for the man by whom we were wasted, and who made designs against us to have us completely cut off from the land of Israel,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: Let seven men of his family be given up to us and we will put an end to them by hanging them before the Lord in Gibeon, on the hill of the Lord. And the king said, I will give them.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: But the king did not give up Mephibosheth, the son of Saul's son Jonathan, because of the Lord's oath made between David and Jonathan, the son of Saul.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: But the king took Armoni and Mephibosheth, the two sons of Saul to whom Rizpah, the daughter of Aiah, had given birth; and the five sons of Saul's daughter Merab, whose father was Adriel, the son of Barzillai the Meholathite:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: And he gave them up to the Gibeonites, and they put them to death, hanging them on the mountain before the Lord; all seven came to their end together in the first days of the grain-cutting, at the start of the cutting of the barley.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: And Rizpah, the daughter of Aiah, took haircloth, placing it on the rock as a bed for herself, from the start of the grain-cutting till rain came down on them from heaven; and she did not let the birds of the air come near them by day, or the beasts of the field by night.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: And news was given to David of what Rizpah, the daughter of Aiah, one of Saul's wives, had done.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: And David went and took the bones of Saul and his son Jonathan from the men of Jabesh-gilead, who had taken them away secretly from the public place of Beth-shan, where the Philistines had put them, hanging up the bodies there on the day when they put Saul to death in Gilboa:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: And he took the bones of Saul and his son Jonathan from that place; and they got together the bones of those who had been put to death by hanging.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: And they put them with the bones of Saul and his son Jonathan in the resting-place of Kish, his father, in Zela in the country of Benjamin; they did all the king had given them orders to do. And after that, God gave ear to their prayers for the land.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: And the Philistines went to war again with Israel; and David went down with his people, and while they were at Gob they had a fight with the Philistines:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: And there came against David one of the offspring of the Rephaim, whose spear was three hundred shekels of brass in weight, and having a new sword, he made an attempt to put David to death.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: But Abishai, the son of Zeruiah, came to his help, and, turning on the Philistine, gave him his death-blow. Then David's men took an oath, and said, Never again are you to go out with us to the fight, so that you may not put out the light of Israel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: Now after this there was war with the Philistines again at Gob, and Sibbecai the Hushathite put to death Saph, one of the offspring of the Rephaim.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: And again there was war with the Philistines at Gob, and Elhanan, the son of Jair the Beth-lehemite, put to death Goliath the Gittite, the stem of whose spear was like a cloth-worker's rod.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: And again there was war at Gath, where there was a very tall man, who had twenty-four fingers and toes, six fingers on his hands and six toes on his feet; he was one of the offspring of the Rephaim.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: And when he was purposing to put shame on Israel, Jonathan, the son of Shimei, David's brother, put him to death.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: These four were of the offspring of the Rephaim in Gath; and they came to their end by the hands of David and his servants.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: And David made a song to the Lord in these words, on the day when the Lord made him free from the hands of all his haters, and from the hand of Saul:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: And he said, The Lord is my Rock, my walled town, and my saviour, even mine;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: My God, my Rock, in him will I put my faith; my breastplate, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower, and my safe place; my saviour, who keeps me safe from the violent man.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: I will send up my cry to the Lord, who is to be praised; so will I be made safe from those who are against me.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: For the waves of death came round me, and the seas of evil put me in fear;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: The cords of hell were round me: the nets of death came on me.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: In my trouble my voice went up to the Lord, and my cry to my God: my voice came to his hearing in his holy Temple, and my prayer came to his ears.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: Then the earth was moved with a violent shock; the bases of heaven were moved and shaking, because he was angry.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: There went up a smoke from his nose, and a fire of destruction from his mouth: coals were lighted by it.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: The heavens were bent, so that he might come down; and it was dark under his feet.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: And he went through the air, seated on a storm-cloud: going quickly on the wings of the wind.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: And he made the dark his tent round him, a mass of waters, thick clouds of the skies.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: Before his shining light his dark clouds went past, raining ice and coals of fire.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: The Lord made thunder in the heavens, and the voice of the Highest was sounding out.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: And he sent out his arrows, driving them in all directions; by his flames of fire they were troubled.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: Then the deep beds of the sea were seen, and the bases of the world were uncovered, because of the Lord's wrath, because of the breath of his mouth.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: He sent from on high, he took me, pulling me out of great waters.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: He made me free from my strong hater, from those who were against me, because they were stronger than I.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: They came on me in the day of my trouble: but the Lord was my support.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: He took me out into a wide place; he was my saviour because he had delight in me.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: The Lord gives me the reward of my righteousness, because my hands are clean before him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: For I have kept the ways of the Lord; I have not been turned away in sin from my God.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: For all his decisions were before me, and I did not put away his laws from me.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: And I was upright before him, and I kept myself from sin.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 25
text: Because of this the Lord has given me the reward of my righteousness, because my hands are clean in his eyes.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 26
text: On him who has mercy you will have mercy; to the upright you will be upright;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 27
text: He who is holy will see that you are holy; but to the man whose way is not straight you will be a hard judge.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 28
text: For you are the saviour of those who are in trouble; but your eyes are on men of pride, to make them low.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 29
text: For you are my light, O Lord; and the Lord will make the dark bright for me.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 30
text: By your help I have made a way through the wall which was shutting me in: by the help of my God I have gone over a wall.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 31
text: As for God, his way is all good: the word of the Lord is tested; he is a safe cover for all those who put their faith in him.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 32
text: For who is God but the Lord? and who is a Rock but our God?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 33
text: God puts a strong band about me, guiding me in a straight way.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 34
text: He makes my feet like roes' feet, and puts me on high places.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 35
text: He makes my hands expert in war, so that a bow of brass is bent by my arms.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 36
text: You have given me the breastplate of your salvation, and your mercy has made me great.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 37
text: You have made my steps wide under me, so that my feet make no slip.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 38
text: I go after my haters and overtake them; not turning back till they are all overcome.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 39
text: I have sent destruction on them and given them wounds, so that they are not able to get up: they are stretched under my feet.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 40
text: For I have been armed by you with strength for the fight: you have made low under me those who came out against me.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 41
text: By you their backs are turned in flight, so that my haters are cut off.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 42
text: They were crying out, but there was no one to come to their help: even to the Lord, but he gave them no answer.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 43
text: Then they were crushed as small as the dust of the earth, stamped down under my feet like the waste of the streets.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 44
text: You have made me free from the fightings of my people; you have made me the head of the nations: a people of whom I had no knowledge will be my servants.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 45
text: Men of other countries will, with false hearts, put themselves under my authority: from the time when my name comes to their ears, they will be ruled by me.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 46
text: They will be wasted away, they will come out of their secret places shaking with fear.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 47
text: The Lord is living; praise be to my Rock, and let the God of my salvation be honoured:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 48
text: It is God who sends punishment on my haters, and puts peoples under my rule.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 49
text: He makes me free from my haters: I am lifted up over those who come up against me: you have made me free from the violent man.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 50
text: Because of this I will give you praise, O Lord, among the nations, and will make a song of praise to your name.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 22 Verse 51
text: Great salvation does he give to his king; he has mercy on the king of his selection, David, and on his seed for ever.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: Now these are the last words of David. David, the son of Jesse, says, the man who was lifted up on high, the man on whom the God of Jacob put the holy oil, the loved one of Israel's songs, says:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: The spirit of the Lord had voice through me, his word was on my tongue.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: The God of Israel said, the word of the Rock of Israel came to me: When an upright king is ruling over men, when he is ruling in the fear of God,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: It is as the light of the morning, when the sun comes up, a morning without clouds; making young grass come to life from the earth.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: For is not my house so with God? For he has made with me an eternal agreement, ordered in all things and certain: as for all my salvation and all my desire, will he not give it increase?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: But the evil-doers, all of them, will be like thorns to be pushed away, because they may not be gripped in the hand:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: But anyone touching them has to be armed with iron and the rod of a spear; and they will be burned with fire, every one of them.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: These are the names of David's men of war: Ishbaal the Hachmonite, chief of the three; his axe was lifted up against eight hundred put to death at one time.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: After him was Eleazar, the son of Dodai the Ahohite, one of the three great fighters, who was with David in Pas-dammim when the Philistines came together there for the fight; and when the men of Israel had gone in flight,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: He was with David and went on fighting the Philistines till his hand became tired and stiff from gripping his sword: and that day the Lord gave a great salvation, and the people came back after him only to take the goods of the Philistines.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: After him was Shammah, the son of Ela the Hararite. And the Philistines came together in Lehi, where there was a bit of land full of seed; and the people went in flight from the Philistines.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: But he kept his place in the middle of the bit of land, and kept back their attack and overcame the Philistines: and the Lord gave a great salvation.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: And three of the thirty went down at the start of the grain-cutting, and they came to David at the strong place of Adullam; and the band of Philistines had taken up their position in the valley of Rephaim.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 14
text: And at that time David had taken cover in the strong place, and an armed force of the Philistines was in Beth-lehem.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: And David, moved by a strong desire, said, If only someone would give me a drink of water from the water-hole of Beth-lehem, by the doorway into the town!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: And the three men, forcing their way through the Philistine army, got water from the water-hole of Beth-lehem, by the doorway into the town, and took it back to David: but he would not take it, but, draining it out, made an offering of it to the Lord.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 17
text: And he said, Far be it from me, O Lord, to do this; how may I take as my drink the life-blood of men who have put their lives in danger? So he would not take it. These things did the three great men of war.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 18
text: And Abishai, the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief of the thirty. He put to death three hundred with his spear, and he got for himself a name among the thirty.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 19
text: Was he not the noblest of the thirty? so he was made their captain: but he was not equal to the first three.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 20
text: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, a fighting man of Kabzeel, had done great acts; he put to death the two sons of Ariel of Moab: he went down into a hole and put a lion to death in time of snow:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 21
text: And he made an attack on an Egyptian, a tall man: and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand; but he went down to him with a stick, and pulling the spear out of the hands of the Egyptian, put him to death with that same spear.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 22
text: These were the acts of Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, who had a great name among the thirty men of war.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 23
text: He was honoured over the rest of the thirty, but he was not equal to the first three. And David put him over the fighting men who kept him safe.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 24
text: Asahel, the brother of Joab, was one of the thirty; and Elhanan, the son of Dodai, of Beth-lehem,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 25
text: Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 26
text: Helez the Paltite, Ira, the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 27
text: Abiezer the Anathothite, Sibbecai the Hushathite,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 28
text: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 29
text: Heldai, the son of Baanah the Netophathite, Ittai, the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 30
text: Benaiah the Pirathonite, Hiddai of the valleys of Gaash,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 31
text: Abiel the Arbathite, Azmaveth of Bahurim,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 32
text: Eliahba the Shaalbonite, Jashen the Gunite,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 33
text: Jonathan, the son of Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam, the son of Sharar the Hararite,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 34
text: Eliphelet, the son of Ahasbai the Maacathite, Eliam, the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 35
text: Hezrai the Carmelite, Paarai the Archite,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 36
text: Igal, the son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani the Gadite,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 37
text: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, who had the care of the arms of Joab, son of Zeruiah,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 38
text: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 23 Verse 39
text: Uriah the Hittite: thirty-seven in number.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: Again the wrath of the Lord was burning against Israel, and moving David against them, he said, Go, take the number of Israel and Judah.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: And the king said to Joab and the captains of the army, who were with him, Go now through all the tribes of Israel, from Dan as far as Beer-sheba, and have all the people numbered, so that I may be certain of the number of the people.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: And Joab said to the king, Whatever the number of the people, may the Lord make it a hundred times as much, and may the eyes of my lord the king see it: but why does my lord the king take pleasure in doing this thing?

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: But the king's order was stronger than Joab and the captains of the army. And Joab and the captains of the army went out from the king, to take the number of the children of Israel.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: And they went over Jordan, and starting from Aroer, from the town which is in the middle of the valley, they went in the direction of the Gadites, and on to Jazer;

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: Then they came to Gilead, and to the land of the Hittites under Hermon; and they came to Dan, and from Dan they came round to Zidon,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: And to the walled town of Tyre, and to all the towns of the Hivites and the Canaanites: and they went out to the South of Judah at Beer-sheba.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: So after going through all the land in every direction, they came to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: And Joab gave the king the number of all the people: there were in Israel eight hundred thousand fighting men able to take up arms; and the men of Judah were five hundred thousand.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: And after the people had been numbered, David's heart was troubled. And David said to the Lord, Great has been my sin in doing this; but now, O Lord, be pleased to take away the sin of your servant, for I have done very foolishly

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: And David got up in the morning; now the word of the Lord had come to the prophet Gad, David's seer, saying,

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: Go and say to David, The Lord says, Three things are offered to you: say which of them you will have, and I will do it to you.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: So Gad came to David, and gave him word of this and said to him, Are there to be three years when there is not enough food in your land? or will you go in flight from your haters for three months, while they go after you? or will you have three days of violent disease in your land? take thought and say what answer I am to give to him who sent me.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: And David said to Gad, This is a hard decision for me to make: let us come into the hands of the Lord, for great are his mercies: let me not come into the hands of men.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: So David made selection of the disease; and the time was the days of the grain-cutting, when the disease came among the people, causing the death of seventy thousand men from Dan as far as Beer-sheba.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: And when the hand of the angel was stretched out in the direction of Jerusalem, for its destruction, the Lord had regret for the evil, and said to the angel who was sending destruction on the people, It is enough; do no more. And the angel of the Lord was by the grain-floor of Araunah the Jebusite.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: And when David saw the angel who was causing the destruction of the people, he said to the Lord, Truly, the sin is mine; I have done wrong: but these are only sheep; what have they done? let your hand be against me and against my family.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: And that day Gad came to David and said to him, Go up, and put up an altar to the Lord on the grain-floor of Araunah the Jebusite.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 19
text: So David went up, as Gad had said and as the Lord had given orders.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 20
text: And Araunah, looking out, saw the king and his servants coming to him: and Araunah went out, and went down on his face to the earth before the king.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 21
text: And Araunah said, Why has my lord the king come to his servant? And David said, To give you a price for your grain-floor, so that I may put up an altar to the Lord, and the disease may be stopped among the people.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 22
text: And Araunah said to David, Let my lord the king take whatever seems right to him, and make an offering of it: see, here are the oxen for the burned offering, and the grain-cleaning instruments and the ox-yokes for wood:

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 23
text: All this does the servant of my lord the king give to the king. And Araunah said, May the Lord your God be pleased with your offering!

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 24
text: And the king said to Araunah, No, but I will give you a price for it; I will not give to the Lord my God burned offerings for which I have given nothing. So David got the grain-floor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.

title: 2 Samuel Chapter 24 Verse 25
text: And there David put up an altar to the Lord, making burned offerings and peace-offerings. So the Lord gave ear to his prayer for the land, and the disease came to an end in Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Now King David was old and far on in years; and though they put covers over him, his body was cold.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: So his servants said to him, Let search be made for a young virgin for my lord the king, to take care of him and be waiting on him; and you may take her in your arms, and so my lord the king will be warm.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: So after searching through all the land of Israel for a fair young girl, they saw Abishag the Shunammite, and took her to the king.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Now she was very beautiful; and she took care of the king, waiting on him at all times; but the king had no connection with her.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: Then Adonijah, the son of Haggith, lifting himself up in pride, said, I will become king; and he made ready his carriages of war and his horsemen, with fifty runners to go before him.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: Now all his life his father had never gone against him or said to him, Why have you done so? and he was a very good-looking man, and younger than Absalom.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And he had talk with Joab, the son of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar the priest; and they were on his side and gave him their support.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: But Zadok the priest, and Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, and Nathan the prophet and Shimei and Rei, and David's men of war did not take the side of Adonijah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: Then Adonijah put to death sheep and oxen and fat beasts by the stone of Zoheleth, by En-rogel; and he sent for all his brothers, the king's sons, and all the men of Judah, the king's servants, to come to him:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: But he did not send for Nathan the prophet and Benaiah and the other men of war and Solomon his brother.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Then Nathan said to Bath-sheba, the mother of Solomon, Has it not come to your ears that Adonijah, the son of Haggith, has made himself king without the knowledge of David our lord?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: So now, let me make a suggestion, so that you may keep your life safe and the life of your son Solomon.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Come now, go to King David and say to him, Did you not, O my lord, take an oath to me, your servant, saying, Truly Solomon your son will be king after me, seated on the seat of my kingdom? why then is Adonijah acting as king?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And while you are still talking there with the king, see, I will come in after you and say that your story is true.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: Then Bath-sheba went into the king's room; now the king was very old, and Abishag the Shunammite was waiting on him.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And Bath-sheba went down on her face on the earth before the king giving him honour. And he said, What is your desire?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And she said to him, My lord, you took an oath by the Lord your God and gave your word to your servant, saying, Truly, Solomon your son will be king after me, seated on the seat of my kingdom.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And now, see, Adonijah has made himself king without my lord's knowledge;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And has put to death oxen and fat beasts and sheep in great numbers, and has sent for all the sons of the king, and Abiathar the priest, and Joab, the captain of the army; but he has not sent for Solomon your servant.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: And now, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are on you, waiting for you to say who is to take the place of my lord the king after him.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: For as things are, it will come about, when my lord the king is sleeping with his fathers, that I and Solomon my son will be made outlaws.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And while she was still talking with the king, Nathan the prophet came in.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: And they said to the king, Here is Nathan the prophet. And when he came in before the king, he went down on his face on the earth.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: And Nathan said, O my lord king, have you said, Adonijah is to be king after me, seated on the seat of my kingdom?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: Because today he has gone down and has put to death oxen and fat beasts and sheep in great numbers, and has sent for all the king's sons to come to him, with the captains of the army and Abiathar the priest; and they are feasting before him and crying, Long life to King Adonijah!

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: But me, your servant, and Zadok the priest, and Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, and your servant Solomon, he has not sent for.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: Has this thing been done by my lord the king, without giving word to your servants who was to be placed on my lord the king's seat after him?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 28
text: Then King David in answer said, Send for Bath-sheba to come to me. And she came in and took her place before the king.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 29
text: And the king took an oath, and said, By the living Lord, who has been my saviour from all my troubles,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 30
text: As I took an oath to you by the Lord, the God of Israel, saying, Certainly Solomon your son will become king after me, seated on my seat in my place; so will I do this day.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 31
text: Then Bath-sheba went down on her face on the earth before the king giving him honour, and said, May my lord King David go on living for ever.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 32
text: And King David said, Send for Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada. And they came before the king.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 33
text: And the king said to them, Take with you the servants of your lord, and put Solomon my son on my beast, yes, mine, and take him down to Gihon;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 34
text: And there let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet put the holy oil on him to make him king over Israel; and sounding the horn say, Long life to King Solomon!

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 35
text: Then come up after him and he will come in and take his place on the seat of my kingdom; for he is to be king in my place, and I have given orders that he is to be ruler over Israel and over Judah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 36
text: And Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, answering the king, said, So be it: and may the Lord, the God of my lord the king, say so.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 37
text: As the Lord has been with my lord the king, even so may he be with Solomon and make the seat of his authority greater than that of my lord King David.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 38
text: So Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, went down and put Solomon on King David's beast and took him to Gihon.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 39
text: And Zadok the priest took the vessel of oil out of the Tent, and put the holy oil on Solomon. And when the horn was sounded, all the people said, Long life to King Solomon!

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 40
text: And all the people came up after him, piping with pipes, and they were glad with great joy, so that the earth was shaking with the sound.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 41
text: And it came to the ears of Adonijah and all the guests who were with him, when their meal was ended. And Joab, hearing the sound of the horn, said, What is the reason of this noise as if the town was worked up?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 42
text: And while the words were on his lips, Jonathan, the son of Abiathar the priest, came; and Adonijah said, Come in; for you are a man of good faith and the news which you have for us will be good.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 43
text: And Jonathan, answering, said to Adonijah, Not so, but our lord King David has made Solomon king:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 44
text: And he sent with him Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and they put him on the king's beast:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 45
text: And Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet put the holy oil on him and made him king in Gihon; and they came back from there with joy, and the town was all worked up. This is the noise which has come to your ears.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 46
text: And now Solomon is seated on the seat of the kingdom.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 47
text: And the king's servants came to our lord King David, blessing him and saying, May God make the name of Solomon better than your name, and the seat of his authority greater than your seat; and the king was bent low in worship on his bed.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 48
text: Then the king said, May the God of Israel be praised, who has given one of my seed to be king in my place this day and has let my eyes see it.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 49
text: And all the guests of Adonijah got up in fear and went away, every man to his place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 50
text: And Adonijah himself was full of fear because of Solomon; and he got up and went to the altar, and put his hands on its horns.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 51
text: And they gave Solomon word of it, saying, See, Adonijah goes in such fear of King Solomon, that he has put his hands on the horns of the altar, saying, Let King Solomon first give me his oath that he will not put his servant to death with the sword.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 52
text: And Solomon said, If he is seen to be a man of good faith, not a hair of him will be touched; but if any wrongdoing is seen in him, he is to be put to death.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 53
text: So King Solomon sent, and they took him down from the altar. And he came and gave honour to King Solomon; and Solomon said to him, Go to your house.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Now the time of David's death came near; and he gave orders to Solomon his son, saying,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: I am going the way of all the earth: so be strong and be a man;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And keep the orders of the Lord your God, walking in his ways, keeping his laws and his orders and his rules and his words, as they are recorded in the law of Moses; so that you may do well in all you do and wherever you go,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: So that the Lord may give effect to what he said of me, If your children give attention to their ways, living uprightly before me with all their heart and their soul, you will never be without a man to be king in Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: Now you have knowledge of what Joab, the son of Zeruiah, did to me, and to the two captains of the army of Israel, Abner, the son of Ner, and Amasa, the son of Jether, whom he put to death, taking payment for the blood of war in time of peace, and making the band of my clothing and the shoes on my feet red with the blood of one put to death without cause.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: So be guided by your wisdom, and let not his white head go down to the underworld in peace.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: But be good to the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be guests at your table; for so they came to me when I went in flight from Absalom your brother.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: Now you have with you Shimei, the son of Gera the Benjamite of Bahurim, who put a bitter curse on me on the day when I went to Mahanaim; but he came down to see me at Jordan, and I gave him my oath by the Lord, saying, I will not put you to death by the sword.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: But do not let him be free from punishment, for you are a wise man; and it will be clear to you what you have to do with him; see that his white head goes down to the underworld in blood.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: Then David went to rest with his fathers, and his body was put into the earth in the town of David.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: David was king over Israel for forty years: for seven years he was king in Hebron and for thirty-three years in Jerusalem.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And Solomon took his place on the seat of David his father, and his kingdom was made safe and strong.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: Then Adonijah, the son of Haggith, came to Bath-sheba, the mother of Solomon. And she said, Come you in peace? And he said, Yes, in peace.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: Then he said, I have something to say to you. And she said, Say on.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And he said, You saw how the kingdom was mine, and all Israel had the idea that I would be their king; but now the kingdom is turned about, and has become my brother's, for it was given to him by the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: Now I have one request to make to you, and do not say, No, to me. And she said to him, Say on.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: Then he said, Will you go to Solomon the king (for he will not say, No, to you) and put before him my request that he will give me Abishag the Shunammite for a wife?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And Bath-sheba said, Good! I will make your request to the king.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: So Bath-sheba went to King Solomon to have talk with him on Adonijah's account. And the king got up to come to her, and went down low to the earth before her; then he took his place on the king's seat and had a seat made ready for the king's mother and she took her place at his right hand.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: Then she said, I have one small request to make to you; do not say, No, to me. And the king said, Say on, my mother, for I will not say, No, to you.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: And she said, Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah your brother for a wife.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 22
