text: Then King Solomon made answer and said to his mother, Why are you requesting me to give Abishag the Shunammite to Adonijah? Take the kingdom for him in addition, for he is my older brother, and Abiathar the priest and Joab, the son of Zeruiah, are on his side.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: Then King Solomon took an oath by the Lord, saying, May God's punishment be on me if Adonijah does not give payment for these words with his life.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: Now by the living Lord, who has given me my place on the seat of David my father, and made me one of a line of kings, as he gave me his word, truly Adonijah will be put to death this day.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: And King Solomon sent Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, and he made an attack on him and put him to death.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: And to Abiathar the priest the king said, Go to Anathoth, to your fields; for death would be your right reward; but I will not put you to death now, because you took up the ark of the Lord God before David my father, and you were with him in all his troubles.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 27
text: So Solomon let Abiathar be priest no longer, so that he might make the word of the Lord come true which he said about the sons of Eli in Shiloh.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 28
text: And news of this came to Joab; for Joab had been one of Adonijah's supporters, though he had not been on Absalom's side. Then Joab went in flight to the Tent of the Lord, and put his hands on the horns of the altar.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 29
text: And they said to King Solomon, Joab has gone in flight to the Tent of the Lord and is by the altar. Then Solomon sent Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, saying, Go, make an attack on him.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 30
text: And Benaiah came to the Tent of the Lord and said to him, The king says, Come out. And he said, No; but let death come to me here. And Benaiah went back to the king and gave him word of the answer which Joab had given.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 31
text: And the king said, Do as he has said and make an attack on him there, and put his body into the earth; so that you may take away from me and from my family the blood of one put to death by Joab without cause.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 32
text: And the Lord will send back his blood on his head, because of the attack he made on two men more upright and better than himself, putting them to the sword without my father's knowledge; even Abner, the son of Ner, captain of the army of Israel, and Amasa, the son of Jether, captain of the army of Judah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 33
text: So their blood will be on the head of Joab, and on the head of his seed for ever; but for David and his seed and his family and the seat of his kingdom, there will be peace for ever from the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 34
text: So Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, went up, and falling on him, put him to death; and his body was put to rest in his house in the waste land.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 35
text: And the king put Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, in his place over the army; and Zadok the priest he put in the place of Abiathar.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 36
text: Then the king sent for Shimei, and said to him, Make a house for yourself in Jerusalem and keep there and go to no other place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 37
text: For be certain that on the day when you go out and go over the stream Kidron, death will overtake you: and your blood will be on your head.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 38
text: And Shimei said to the king, Very well! as my lord the king has said, so will your servant do. And for a long time Shimei went on living in Jerusalem.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 39
text: But after three years, two of the servants of Shimei went in flight to Achish, son of Maacah, king of Gath. And word was given to Shimei that his servants had gone to Gath.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 40
text: Then Shimei got up, and making ready his ass, he went to Gath, to Achish, in search of his servants; and he sent and got them from Gath.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 41
text: And news was given to Solomon that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath and had come back again.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 42
text: Then the king sent for Shimei, and said to him, Did I not make you take an oath by the Lord, protesting to you and saying, Be certain that on the day when you go out from here, wherever you go, death will overtake you? and you said to me, Very well!

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 43
text: Why then have you not kept the oath of the Lord and the order which I gave you?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 44
text: And the king said to Shimei, You have knowledge of all the evil which you did to David my father; and now the Lord has sent back your evil on yourself.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 45
text: But a blessing will be on King Solomon, and the kingdom of David will keep its place before the Lord for ever.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 46
text: So the king gave orders to Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada; and he went out and, falling on him, put him to death. And Solomon's authority over the kingdom was complete.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Solomon became the son-in-law of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and took Pharaoh's daughter as his wife, keeping her in the town of David, till the house he was building for himself, and the house of the Lord and the wall round Jerusalem, were complete.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: But all this time the people were making their offerings in the high places, because no house had been put up to the name of the Lord till those days.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: And Solomon, in his love for the Lord, kept the laws of David his father; but he made offerings and let them go up in smoke on the high places.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And the king went to Gibeon to make an offering there, because that was the chief high place: it was Solomon's way to make a thousand burned offerings on that altar.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: In Gibeon, Solomon had a vision of the Lord in a dream by night; and God said to him, Say what I am to give you.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And Solomon said, Great was your mercy to David my father, as his life before you was true and upright and his heart was true to you; and you have kept for him this greatest mercy, a son to take his place this day.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And now, O Lord my God, you have made your servant king in the place of David my father; and I am only a young boy, with no knowledge of how to go out or come in.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And your servant has round him the people of your selection, a people so great that they may not be numbered, and no account of them may be given.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Give your servant, then, a wise heart for judging your people, able to see what is good and what evil; for who is able to be the judge of this great people?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: Now these words and Solomon's request were pleasing to the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And God said to him, Because your request is for this thing, and not for long life for yourself or for wealth or for the destruction of your haters, but for wisdom to be a judge of causes;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: I have done as you said: I have given you a wise and far-seeing heart, so that there has never been your equal in the past, and never will there be any like you in the future.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And with this I have given you what you made no request for: wealth and honour, so that no king was ever your equal.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And if you go on in my ways, keeping my laws and my orders as your father David did, I will give you a long life.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And Solomon, awakening, saw that it was a dream; then he came to Jerusalem, where he went before the ark of the agreement of the Lord, offering burned offerings and peace-offerings; and he made a feast for all his servants.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Then two loose women of the town came and took their places before the king;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And one of them said, O my lord, I and this woman are living in the same house; and I gave birth to a child by her side in the house.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: And three days after the birth of my child, this woman had a child: we were together, no other-person was with us in the house but we two only.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: In the night, this woman, sleeping on her child, was the cause of its death.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: And she got up in the middle of the night and took my son from my side while your servant was sleeping; and she took it in her arms and put her dead child in my arms.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: And when I got up to give my child the breast, I saw that it was dead; but in the morning, looking at it with care, I saw that it was not my son.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: And the other woman said, No; but the living child is my son and the dead one yours. But the first said, No; the dead child is your son and the living one mine. So they kept on talking before the king.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: Then the king said, One says, The living child is my son, and yours is the dead: and the other says, Not so; but your son is the dead one and mine is the living.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: Then he said, Get me a sword. So they went and put a sword before the king.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: And the king said, Let the living child be cut in two and one half given to one woman and one to the other.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: Then the mother of the living child came forward, for her heart went out to her son, and she said, O my lord, give her the child; do not on any account put it to death. But the other woman said, It will not be mine or yours; let it be cut in two.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 27
text: Then the king made answer and said, Give her the child, and do not put it to death; she is the mother of it.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 28
text: And news of this decision which the king had made went through all Israel; and they had fear of the king, for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him to give decisions.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Now Solomon was king over all Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And these were his chief men: Azariah, the son of Zadok, was the priest;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: Elihoreph and Ahijah, the sons of Shisha, were scribes; Jehoshaphat, the son of Ahilud, was the recorder;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, was head of the army; Zadok and Abiathar were priests;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Azariah, the son of Nathan, was over those in authority in the different divisions of the country; Zabud, the son of Nathan, was priest and the king's friend;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: Ahishar was controller of the king's house; Adoniram, the son of Abda, was overseer of the forced work.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And Solomon put twelve overseers over all Israel, to be responsible for the stores needed for the king and those of his house; every man was responsible for one month in the year.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And these are their names: ... the son of Hur in the hill country of Ephraim;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: ... the son of Deker in Makaz and Shaalbim and Beth-shemesh and Elonbeth-hanan;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: ... the son of Hesed in Arubboth; Socoh and all the land of Hepher were under his control;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: ... the son of Abinadab in all Naphath-dor; his wife was Taphath, the daughter of Solomon.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: Baana, the son of Ahilud, in Taanach and Megiddo, and all Beth-shean which is by the side of Zarethan, under Jezreel, from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah, as far as the far side of Jokmeam;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: ... the son of Geber in Ramoth-gilead; he had the towns of Jair, the son of Manasseh, which are in Gilead, and the country of Argob, which is in Bashan, sixty great towns with walls and locks of brass.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: Ahinadab, the son of Iddo, in Mahanaim;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: Ahimaaz in Naphtali; he took Basemath, the daughter of Solomon, as his wife;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: Baana, the son of Hushai, in Asher and Aloth;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: Jehoshaphat, the son of Paruah, in Issachar;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: Shimei, the son of Ela, in Benjamin;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: Geber, the son of Uri, in the land of Gilead, the country of Sihon, king of the Amorites, and Og, king of Bashan; and one overseer had authority over all the overseers who were in the land.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: Judah and Israel were as great in number as the sand by the seaside, and they took their food and drink with joy in their hearts.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: And Solomon was ruler over all the kingdoms from the River to the land of the Philistines, and as far as the edge of Egypt; men gave him offerings and were his servants all the days of his life.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: And the amount of Solomon's food for one day was thirty measures of crushed grain and sixty measures of meal;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: Ten fat oxen and twenty oxen from the fields, and a hundred sheep, in addition to harts and gazelles and roes and fat fowls.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: For he had authority over all the country on this side of the River, from Tiphsah to Gaza, over all the kings on this side of the River; and he had peace round him on every side.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: So Judah and Israel were living safely, every man under his vine and his fig-tree, from Dan as far as Beer-sheba, all the days of Solomon.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: And Solomon had four thousand boxed-off spaces for horses for his carriages, and twelve thousand horsemen.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 27
text: And those overseers, every man in his month, saw that food was produced for Solomon and all his guests, they took care that nothing was overlooked.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 28
text: And they took grain and dry grass for the horses and the carriage-horses, to the right place, every man as he was ordered.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 29
text: And God gave Solomon a great store of wisdom and good sense, and a mind of wide range, as wide as the sand by the seaside.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 30
text: And Solomon's wisdom was greater than the wisdom of all the people of the East and all the wisdom of Egypt.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 31
text: For he was wiser than all men, even than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman and Calcol and Darda, the sons of Mahol; and he had a great name among all the nations round about.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 32
text: He was the maker of three thousand wise sayings, and of songs to the number of a thousand and five.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 33
text: He made sayings about all plants, from the cedar in Lebanon to the hyssop hanging on the wall; and about all beasts and birds and fishes and the small things of the earth.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 34
text: People came from every nation to give ear to the wisdom of Solomon, from all the kings of the earth who had word of his wisdom.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Now Hiram, king of Tyre, hearing that Solomon had been made king in place of his father, sent his servants to him; for Hiram had ever been a friend to David.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: And Solomon sent back word to Hiram, saying,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: You have knowledge that David my father was not able to make a house for the name of the Lord his God, because of the wars which were round him on every side, till the Lord put all those who were against him under his feet.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: But now the Lord my God has given me rest on every side; no one is making trouble, and no evil is taking place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: And so it is my purpose to make a house for the name of the Lord my God, as he said to David my father, Your son, whom I will make king in your place, will be the builder of a house for my name.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: So now, will you have cedar-trees from Lebanon cut down for me, and my servants will be with your servants; and I will give you payment for your servants at whatever rate you say; for it is common knowledge that we have no such wood-cutters among us as the men of Zidon.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: And these words of Solomon made Hiram glad, and he said, Now may the Lord be praised who has given to David a wise son to be king over this great people.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: Then Hiram sent to Solomon, saying; The words you sent have been given to me: I will do all your desire in the question of cedar-wood and cypress-wood.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: My men will take them down from Lebanon to the sea, where I will have them corded together to go by sea to whatever place you say, and I will have them cut up there so that you may take them away; as for payment, it will be enough if you give me food for my people.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: So Hiram gave Solomon all the cedar-wood and cypress-wood he had need of;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: And Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand measures of grain, as food for his people, and twenty measures of clear oil; this he did every year.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: Now the Lord had given Solomon wisdom, as he had said to him; and there was peace between Hiram and Solomon, and they made an agreement together.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: Then King Solomon got together men for the forced work through all Israel, thirty thousand men in number;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: And sent them to Lebanon in bands of ten thousand every month: for a month they were working in Lebanon and for two months in their country, and Adoniram was in control of them.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: Then he had seventy thousand for the work of transport, and eighty thousand stone-cutters in the mountains;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: In addition to the chiefs of the responsible men put by Solomon to oversee the work, three thousand and three hundred in authority over the workmen.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: By the king's orders great stones, stones of high price, were cut out, so that the base of the house might be made of squared stone.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: Solomon's builders and Hiram's builders did the work of cutting them, and put edges on them, and got the wood and the stone ready for the building of the house.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: In the four hundred and eightieth year after the children of Israel came out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year that Solomon was king of Israel, in the month Ziv, which is the second month, the building of the Lord's house was started.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: The house which Solomon made for the Lord was sixty cubits long, twenty cubits wide and thirty cubits high.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: The covered way before the Temple of the house was twenty cubits long, as wide as the house, and ten cubits wide in front of the house.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: And for the house he made windows, with network across.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And against the walls all round, and against the walls of the Temple and of the inmost room, he put up wings, with side rooms all round:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: The lowest line of them being five cubits wide, the middle six cubits wide and the third seven cubits; for there was a space all round the outside walls of the house so that the boards supporting the rooms did not have to be fixed in the walls of the house.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: (And the stones used in the building of the house were squared at the place where they were cut out; there was no sound of hammer or axe or any iron instrument while they were building the house.)

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: The door to the lowest side rooms was in the right side of the house; and they went up by twisting steps into the middle rooms, and from the middle into the third.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: So he put up the house and made it complete, roofing it with boards of cedar-wood.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And he put up the line of side rooms against the walls of the house, fifteen cubits high, resting against the house on boards of cedar-wood.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: (And the word of the Lord came to Solomon, saying,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: About this house which you are building: if you will keep my laws and give effect to my decisions and be guided by my rules, I will give effect to my word which I gave to David your father.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And I will be ever among the children of Israel, and will not go away from my people.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: So Solomon made the building of the house complete.)

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: The walls of the house were covered inside with cedar-wood boards; from the floor to the roof of the house they were covered inside with wood; and the floor was covered with boards of cypress-wood.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: And at the back of the house a further space of twenty cubits was shut in with boards of cedar-wood, for the inmost room.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: And the house, that is, the Temple, in front of the holy place was forty cubits long.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: (All the inside of the house was cedar-wood, ornamented with designs of buds and flowers; no stonework was to be seen inside.)

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: And he made ready an inmost room in the middle of the house, in which to put the ark of the agreement of the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: And the inmost room was twenty cubits square and twenty cubits high, plated over with clear gold, and he made an altar of cedar-wood, plating it with gold.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: Solomon had all the inside of the house covered with gold, and he put chains of gold across in front of the inmost room, which itself was covered with gold.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: Plates of gold were put all through the house till it was covered completely (and the altar in the inmost room was all covered with gold).

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: In the inmost room he made two winged beings of olive-wood, ten cubits high;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: With outstretched wings five cubits wide; the distance from the edge of one wing to the edge of the other was ten cubits.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: The two winged ones were ten cubits high, of the same size and form.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: The two of them were ten cubits high.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: These were placed inside the inner house, their outstretched wings touching the walls of the house, one touching one wall and one the other, while their other wings were touching in the middle.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 28
text: These winged ones were plated over with gold.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 29
text: And all the walls of the house inside and out were ornamented with forms of winged ones and palm-trees and open flowers.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 30
text: And the floor of the house was covered with gold, inside and out.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 31
text: For the way into the inmost room he made doors of olive-wood, the arch and the door supports forming a five-sided opening.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 32
text: On the olive-wood doors were cut designs of winged ones and palm-trees and open flowers, all of them, with the doors, plated with gold.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 33
text: Then he made pillars of olive-wood for the way into the Temple; the pillars were square:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 34
text: And two folding doors of cypress-wood, with two leaves.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 35
text: These were ornamented with designs of winged ones and palm-trees and open flowers, plated over with gold.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 36
text: And the inner space was walled with three lines of squared stones and a line of cedar-wood boards.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 37
text: In the fourth year the base of the house was put in its place, in the month Ziv.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 38
text: And in the eleventh year, in the month Bul, which is the eighth month, the building of the house was complete in every detail, as it had been designed. So he was seven years building it.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: Solomon was thirteen years building a house for himself till it was complete.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And he made the house of the Woods of Lebanon, which was a hundred cubits long and fifty cubits wide and thirty cubits high, resting on four lines of cedar-wood pillars with cedar-wood supports on the pillars.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: And it was covered with cedar over the forty-five supports which were on the pillars, fifteen in a line.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: There were three lines of window-frames, window facing window in every line.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: And all the doors and windows had square frames, with the windows facing one another in three lines.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: And he made a covered room of pillars, fifty cubits long and thirty cubits wide, and ... with steps before it.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: Then he made a covered room for his high seat when he gave decisions; this was the covered room of judging; it was covered with cedar-wood from floor to roof.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: And the house for his living-place, the other open square in the covered room, was made in the same way. And then he made a house like it for Pharaoh's daughter, whom Solomon had taken as his wife.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: All these buildings were made, inside and out, from base to crowning stone, and outside to the great walled square, of highly priced stone, cut to different sizes with cutting-instruments.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And the base was of great masses of highly priced stone, some ten cubits and some eight cubits square.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: Overhead were highly priced stones cut to measure, and cedar-wood.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: The great outer square all round was walled with three lines of squared stones and a line of cedar-wood boards, round about the open square inside the house of the Lord and the covered room of the king's house.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: Then King Solomon sent and got Hiram from Tyre.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: He was the son of a widow of the tribe of Naphtali, and his father was a man of Tyre, a worker in brass; he was full of wisdom and knowledge and an expert worker in brass. He came to King Solomon and did all his work for him.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: He it was who made the two brass pillars; the first pillar was eighteen cubits high, and a line of twelve cubits went round it; and the second was the same.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: And he made the two crowns to be put on the tops of the pillars, of brass made soft in the fire; the crowns were five cubits high.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: There were nets of open-work for the crowns on the tops of the pillars, a net of open-work for one and a net of open-work for the other.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: And he made ornaments of apples; and two lines of apples all round over the network, covering the crowns of the pillars, the two crowns in the same way.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: The crowns on the tops of the pillars were ornamented with a design of flowers, and were four cubits across.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: And there were crowns on the two pillars near the round part by the network, and there were two hundred apples in lines round every crown.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: He put up the pillars at the doorway of the Temple, naming the one on the right Jachin, and that on the left Boaz.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: The tops of the pillars had a design of flowers; and the work of making the pillars was complete.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: And he made a great metal water-vessel ten cubits across from edge to edge, five cubits high and thirty cubits round.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: And under the edge of it, circling it all round for ten cubits, were two lines of flower buds, made together with it from liquid metal.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: It was supported on twelve oxen, with their back parts turned to the middle of it, three of them facing to the north, three to the west, three to the south, and three to the east; the vessel was resting on top of them.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: It was as thick as a man's open hand, and was curved like the edge of a cup, like the flower of a lily: it would take two thousand baths.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: And he made ten wheeled bases of brass; every one four cubits long, four cubits wide, and three cubits high.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: And the bases were made in this way; their sides were square, fixed in a framework;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: And on the square sides between the frames were lions, oxen, and winged ones; and the same on the frame; and over and under the lions and the oxen and the winged ones were steps.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 30
text: Every base had four wheels of brass, turning on brass rods, and their four angles had angle-plates under them; the angle-plates under the base were of metal, and there were ornaments at the side of every one.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 31
text: The mouth of it inside the angle-plate was one cubit across; it was round like a pillar, a cubit and a half across; it had designs cut on it; the sides were square, not round.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 32
text: The four wheels were under the frames, and the rods on which the wheels were fixed were in the base; the wheels were a cubit and a half high.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 33
text: The wheels were made like carriage-wheels, the rods on which they were fixed, the parts forming their edges, their rods and the middle points of them, were all formed out of liquid metal.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 34
text: And there were four angle-plates at the four angles of every base, forming part of the structure of the base.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 35
text: And at the top of the base there was a round vessel, half a cubit high;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 36
text: In the spaces of the flat sides and on the frames of them, he made designs of winged ones, lions, and palm-trees, with ornamented edges all round.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 37
text: All the ten bases were made in this way, after the same design, of the same size and form.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 38
text: And he made ten brass washing-vessels, everyone taking forty baths, and measuring four cubits; one vessel was placed on every one of the ten bases.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 39
text: And he put the bases by the house, five on the right side and five on the left; and he put the great water-vessel on the right side of the house, to the east, facing south.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 40
text: And Hiram made the pots and spades and the basins. So Hiram came to the end of all the work he did for King Solomon in the house of the Lord:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 41
text: The two pillars and the two cups of the crowns which were on the tops of the two pillars; and the network covering the two cups of the crowns on the tops of the pillars,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 42
text: And the four hundred apples for the network, two lines of apples for every network, covering the two cups of the crowns on the pillars;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 43
text: And the ten bases, with the ten washing-vessels on them;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 44
text: And the great water-vessel, with the twelve oxen under it;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 45
text: And the pots and the spades and the basins; all the vessels which Hiram made for King Solomon, for the house of the Lord, were of polished brass.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 46
text: He made them of liquid metal in the lowland of Jordan, at the way across the river, at Adama, between Succoth and Zarethan.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 47
text: The weight of all these vessels was not measured, because there was such a number of them; it was not possible to get the weight of the brass.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 48
text: And Solomon had all the vessels made for use in the house of the Lord: the altar of gold and the gold table on which the holy bread was placed;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 49
text: And the supports for the lights, five on the right side and five on the left before the inmost room, of clear gold; and the flowers and the lights and all the instruments of gold;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 50
text: And the cups and the scissors and the basins and the spoons and the fire-trays, all of gold; and the pins on which the doors were turned, the doors of the inner house, the most holy place, and the doors of the Temple, all of gold.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 51
text: So all the work King Solomon had done in the house of the Lord was complete. Then Solomon took the holy things which David his father had given, the silver and the gold and all the vessels, and put them in the store-houses of the house of the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: Then Solomon sent for all the responsible men of Israel, and all the chiefs of the tribes, and the heads of families of the children of Israel, to come to him in Jerusalem to take the ark of the Lord's agreement up out of the town of David, which is Zion.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And all the men of Israel came together to King Solomon at the feast, in the month Ethanim, the seventh month.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And all the responsible men of Israel came, and the priests took up the ark.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: They took up the ark of the Lord, and the Tent of meeting, and all the holy vessels which were in the Tent; all these the priests and the Levites took up.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And King Solomon and all the men of Israel who had come together there, were with him before the ark, making offerings of sheep and oxen more than might be numbered.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: And the priests took the ark of the agreement of the Lord and put it in its place in the inner room of the house, in the most holy place, under the wings of the winged ones.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: For their wings were outstretched over the place where the ark was, covering the ark and its rods.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: The rods were so long that their ends were seen from the holy place, in front of the inmost room; but they were not seen from outside: and there they are to this day.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: There was nothing in the ark but the two flat stones which Moses put there at Horeb, where the Lord made an agreement with the children of Israel when they came out of the land of Egypt.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: Now when the priests had come out of the holy place, the house of the Lord was full of the cloud,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: So that the priests were not able to keep their places to do their work because of the cloud, for the house of the Lord was full of the glory of the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: Then Solomon said, O Lord, to the sun you have given the heaven for a living-place, but your living-place was not seen by men;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: So I have made for you a living-place, a house in which you may be for ever present.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: Then, turning his face about, the king gave a blessing to all the men of Israel; and they were all on their feet together.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: And he said, Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, who himself gave his word to David my father, and with his strong hand has made his word come true, saying,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: From the day when I took my people Israel out of Egypt, no town in all the tribes of Israel has been marked out by me for the building of a house for the resting-place of my name; but I made selection of David to be king over my people Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: Now it was in the heart of David my father to put up a house for the name of the Lord, the God of Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: But the Lord said to David my father, You did well to have in your heart the desire to make a house for my name;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: But you yourself will not be the builder of my house; but your son, the offspring of your body, he it is who will put up a house for my name.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: And the Lord has made his word come true; for I have taken my father David's place on the seat of the kingdom of Israel, as the Lord gave his word; and I have made a house for the name of the Lord, the God of Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: In it I have made a place for the ark, in which is the agreement which the Lord made with our fathers, when he took them out of the land of Egypt.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: Then Solomon took his place before the altar of the Lord, all the men of Israel being present, and stretching out his hands to heaven,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: Said, O Lord, the God of Israel, there is no God like you in heaven or on the earth; keeping faith and mercy unchanging for your servants, while they go in your ways with all their hearts.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: And you have kept the word which you gave to your servant David, my father; with your mouth you said it and with your hand you have made it come true this day.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: So now, O Lord, the God of Israel, let your word to your servant David, my father, come true, when you said, You will never be without a man to take his place on the seat of the kingdom of Israel before me, if only your children give attention to their ways, walking before me as you have done.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: So now, O God of Israel, it is my prayer that you will make your word come true which you said to your servant David, my father.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: But is it truly possible that God may be housed on earth? see, heaven and the heaven of heavens are not wide enough to be your resting-place; how much less this house which I have made!

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: Still, let your heart be turned to the prayer of your servant, O Lord God, and to his prayer for grace; give ear to the cry and the prayer which your servant sends up to you this day;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: That your eyes may be open to this house night and day, to this place of which you have said, My name will be there; hearing the prayer which your servant may make, turning to this place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 30
text: Give ear to the prayers of your servant, and the prayers of your people Israel, when they make their prayers, turning to this place; give ear in heaven your living-place, and hearing, have mercy.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 31
text: If a man does wrong to his neighbour, and has to take an oath, and comes before your altar to take his oath in this house:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 32
text: Then let your ear be open in heaven, and be the judge of your servants, giving your decision against the wrongdoer, so that punishment for his sins may come on his head; and, by your decision, keeping from evil him who has done no wrong.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 33
text: When your people Israel are overcome in war, because of their sin against you; if they are turned to you again, honouring your name, making prayers to you and requesting your grace in this house:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 34
text: Then give ear in heaven, and let the sin of your people Israel have forgiveness, and take them back again into the land which you gave to their fathers.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 35
text: When heaven is shut up and there is no rain, because of their sin against you; if they make prayers with their faces turned to this place, honouring your name and turning away from their sin when you send trouble on them:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 36
text: Then give ear in heaven, so that the sin of your servants, and of your people Israel, may have forgiveness, when you make clear to them the good way in which they are to go; and send rain on your land which you have given to your people for their heritage.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 37
text: If there is no food in the land, or if there is disease, or if the fruits of the earth are damaged through heat or water, locust or worm; if their towns are shut in by their attackers; whatever trouble, whatever disease there may be:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 38
text: Whatever prayer or request for your grace is made by any man, or by all your people Israel, whatever his trouble may be, whose hands are stretched out to this house:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 39
text: Give ear in heaven your living-place, acting in mercy; and give to every man whose secret heart is open to you, the reward of all his ways; for you, and you only, have knowledge of the hearts of all the children of men:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 40
text: So that they may give you worship all the days of their life in the land which you gave to our fathers.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 41
text: And as for the man from a strange land, who is not of your people Israel; when he comes from a far country because of the glory of your name:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 42
text: (For they will have news of your great name and your strong hand and your out-stretched arm;) when he comes to make his prayer, turning to this house:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 43
text: Give ear in heaven your living-place, and give him his desire, whatever it may be; so that all the peoples of the earth may have knowledge of your name, worshipping you as do your people Israel, and that they may see that this house which I have put up is truly named by your name.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 44
text: If your people go out to war against their attackers, by whatever way you may send them, if they make their prayer to the Lord, turning their faces to this town of yours and to this house which I have made for your name:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 45
text: Give ear in heaven to their prayer and their cry for grace, and see right done to them.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 46
text: If they do wrong against you, (for no man is without sin,) and you are angry with them and give them up into the power of those who are fighting against them, so that they take them away as prisoners into a strange land, far off or near;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 47
text: And if they take thought, in the land where they are prisoners, and are turned again to you, crying out in prayer to you in that land, and saying, We are sinners, we have done wrong, we have done evil;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 48
text: And with all their heart and soul are turned again to you, in the land of those who took them prisoners, and make their prayer to you, turning their eyes to this land which you gave to their fathers, and to the town which you took for yourself, and the house which I made for your name:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 49
text: Then give ear to their prayer and to their cry in heaven your living-place, and see right done to them;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 50
text: Answering with forgiveness the people who have done wrong against you, and overlooking the evil which they have done against you; let those who made them prisoners be moved with pity for them, and have pity on them;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 51
text: For they are your people and your heritage, which you took out of Egypt, out of the iron fireplace;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 52
text: Let your eyes be open to your servant's prayer for grace and to the prayer of your people Israel, hearing them when their cry comes to you.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 53
text: For you made them separate from all the peoples of the earth, to be your heritage, as you said by Moses your servant, when you took our fathers out of Egypt, O Lord God.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 54
text: Then Solomon, after making all these prayers and requests for grace to the Lord, got up from his knees before the altar of the Lord, where his hands had been stretched out in prayer to heaven;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 55
text: And, getting on his feet, he gave a blessing to all the men of Israel, saying with a loud voice,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 56
text: Praise be to the Lord who has given rest to his people Israel, as he gave them his word to do; every word of all his oath, which he gave by the hand of Moses his servant, has come true.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 57
text: Now may the Lord our God be with us as he was with our fathers; let him never go away from us or give us up;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 58
text: Turning our hearts to himself, guiding us to go in all his ways, to keep his orders and his laws and his decisions, which he gave to our fathers.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 59
text: And may these my words, the words of my prayer to the Lord, be before the Lord our God day and night, so that he may see right done to his servant and to his people Israel, day by day as we have need.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 60
text: So that all the peoples of the earth may see that the Lord is God, and there is no other.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 61
text: Then let your hearts be without sin before the Lord our God, walking in his laws and keeping his orders as at this day.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 62
text: Now the king, and all Israel with him, were making offerings before the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 63
text: And Solomon gave to the Lord for peace-offerings, twenty-two thousand oxen and a hundred and twenty thousand sheep. So the king and all the children of Israel kept the feast of the opening of the Lord's house.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 64
text: The same day the king made holy the middle of the open square in front of the house of the Lord, offering there the burned offering and the meal offering and the fat of the peace-offerings; for there was not room on the brass altar of the Lord for the burned offerings and the meal offerings and the fat of the peace-offerings.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 65
text: So Solomon and all Israel with him, a very great meeting, (for the people had come together from the way into Hamath to the river of Egypt,) kept the feast at that time before the Lord our God, for two weeks, even fourteen days.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 66
text: And on the eighth day he sent the people away, and, blessing the king, they went to their tents full of joy and glad in their hearts, because of all the good which the Lord had done to David his servant and to Israel his people.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: Now when Solomon came to the end of building the house of the Lord and the king's house, and all Solomon's desires, which he had in mind were effected;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: The Lord came to him again in a vision, as he had done at Gibeon;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And the Lord said to him, Your prayers and your requests for grace have come to my ears: I have made holy this house which you have made, and I have put my name there for ever; my eyes and my heart will be there at all times.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: As for you, if you will go on your way before me, as David your father did, uprightly and with a true heart, doing what I have given you orders to do, keeping my laws and my decisions;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: Then I will make the seat of your rule over Israel certain for ever, as I gave my word to David your father, saying, You will never be without a man to be king in Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: But if you are turned from my ways, you or your children, and do not keep my orders and my laws which I have put before you, but go and make yourselves servants to other gods and give them worship:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: Then I will have Israel cut off from the land which I have given them; and this house, which I have made holy for myself, I will put away from before my eyes; and Israel will be a public example, and a word of shame among all peoples.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And this house will become a mass of broken walls, and everyone who goes by will be overcome with wonder at it and make whistling sounds; and they will say, Why has the Lord done so to this land and to this house?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: And their answer will be, Because they were turned away from the Lord their God, who took their fathers out of the land of Egypt; they took for themselves other gods and gave them worship and became their servants: that is why the Lord has sent all this evil on them.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: Now at the end of twenty years, in which time Solomon had put up the two houses, the house of the Lord and the king's house,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: (Hiram, king of Tyre, had given Solomon cedar-trees and cypress-trees and gold, as much as he had need of,) King Solomon gave Hiram twenty towns in the land of Galilee.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: But when Hiram came from Tyre to see the towns which Solomon had given him, he was not pleased with them.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: And he said, What sort of towns are these which you have given me, my brother? So they were named the land of Cabul, to this day.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: And Hiram sent the king a hundred and twenty talents of gold.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: Now, this was the way of Solomon's system of forced work for the building of the Lord's house and of the king's house, and the Millo and the wall of Jerusalem and Megiddo and Gezer. ...

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: Pharaoh, king of Egypt, came and took Gezer, burning it down and putting to death the Canaanites living in the town, and he gave it for a bride-offering to his daughter, Solomon's wife. ...

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: ... and Solomon was the builder of Gezer and Beth-horon the lower,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: And Baalath and Tamar in the waste land, in that land;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: And all the store-towns and the towns which Solomon had for his war-carriages and for his horsemen, and everything which it was his pleasure to put up in Jerusalem and in Lebanon and in all the land under his rule.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: As for the rest of the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, who were not children of Israel;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: Their children who were still in the land, and whom the children of Israel had not been able to put to complete destruction, them did Solomon put to forced work, to this day.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: But Solomon did not put the children of Israel to forced work; they were the men of war, his servants, his captains, and his chiefs, captains of his war-carriages and of his horsemen.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: These were the chiefs of the overseers of Solomon's work, five hundred and fifty, in authority over the people who did the work.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: At that time Solomon made Pharaoh's daughter come up from the town of David to the house which he had made for her: then he made the Millo.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: Three times in the year it was Solomon's way to give burned offerings and peace-offerings on the altar he had made to the Lord, causing his fire-offering to go up on the altar before the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: And King Solomon made a sea-force of ships in Ezion-geber, by Eloth, on the Red Sea, in the land of Edom.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: Hiram sent his servants, who were experienced seamen, in the sea-force with Solomon's men.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: And they came to Ophir, where they got four hundred and twenty talents of gold, and took it back to King Solomon.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Now the queen of Sheba, hearing great things of Solomon, came to put his wisdom to the test with hard questions.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: And she came to Jerusalem with a very great train, with camels weighted down with spices, and stores of gold and jewels: and when she came to Solomon she had talk with him of everything in her mind.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: And Solomon gave her answers to all her questions; there was no secret which the king did not make clear to her.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: And when the queen of Sheba had seen all the wisdom of Solomon, and the house which he had made,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: And the food at his table, and all his servants seated there, and those who were waiting on him in their places, and their robes, and his wine-servants, and the burned offerings which he made in the house of the Lord, there was no more spirit in her.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: And she said to the king, The account which was given to me in my country of your acts and your wisdom was true.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: But I had no faith in what was said about you, till I came and saw for myself; and now I see that it was not half the story; your wisdom and your wealth are much greater than they said.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: Happy are your wives, happy are these your servants whose place is ever before you, hearing your words of wisdom.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: May the Lord your God be praised, whose pleasure it was to put you on the seat of the kingdom of Israel; because the Lord's love for Israel is eternal, he has made you king, to be their judge in righteousness.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And she gave the king a hundred and twenty talents of gold, and a great store of spices and jewels: never again was such a wealth of spices seen as that which the queen of Sheba gave King Solomon.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: And the sea-force of Hiram, in addition to gold from Ophir, came back with much sandal-wood and jewels.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: And from the sandal-wood the king made pillars for the house of the Lord, and for the king's house, and instruments of music for the makers of melody: never has such sandal-wood been seen to this day.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: And King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatever she made request for, in addition to what he gave her freely from the impulse of his heart. So she went back to her country, she and her servants.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: Now the weight of gold which came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and sixty-six talents;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: In addition to what came to him from the business of the traders, and from all the kings of the Arabians, and from the rulers of the country.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: And Solomon made two hundred body-covers of hammered gold, every one having six hundred shekels of gold in it.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: And he made three hundred smaller body-covers of hammered gold, with three pounds of gold in every cover: and the king put them in the house of the Woods of Lebanon.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: Then the king made a great ivory seat, plated with the best gold.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: There were six steps going up to it, and the top of it was round at the back, there were arms on the two sides of the seat, and two lions by the side of the arms;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: And twelve lions were placed on the one side and on the other side on the six steps: there was nothing like it in any kingdom.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: And all King Solomon's drinking-vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the Woods of Lebanon were of the best gold; not one was of silver, for no one gave a thought to silver in the days of King Solomon.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: For the king had Tarshish-ships at sea with the ships of Hiram; once every three years the Tarshish-ships came with gold and silver and ivory and monkeys and peacocks.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: And King Solomon was greater than all the kings of the earth in wealth and in wisdom.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: And from all over the earth they came to see Solomon and to give ear to his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: And everyone took with him an offering, vessels of silver and vessels of gold, and robes, and coats of metal, and spices, and horses, and beasts of transport, regularly year by year.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: And Solomon got together war-carriages and horsemen; he had one thousand, four hundred carriages and twelve thousand horsemen, whom he kept, some in the carriage-towns and some with the king at Jerusalem.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: And the king made silver as common as stones in Jerusalem and cedars like the sycamore-trees of the lowlands in number.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: And Solomon's horses came from Egypt and from Kue; the king's traders got them at a price from Kue.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: A war-carriage might be got from Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for a hundred and fifty; they got them at the same rate for all the kings of the Hittites and the kings of Aram.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Now a number of strange women were loved by Solomon, women of the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Zidonians, and Hittites:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: The nations of which the Lord had said to the children of Israel, You are not to take wives from them and they are not to take wives from you; or they will certainly make you go after their gods: to these Solomon was united in love.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: He had seven hundred wives, daughters of kings, and three hundred other wives; and through his wives his heart was turned away.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: For it came about that when Solomon was old, his heart was turned away to other gods by his wives; and his heart was no longer true to the Lord his God as the heart of his father David had been.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: For Solomon went after Ashtoreth, the goddess of the Zidonians, and Milcom, the disgusting god of the Ammonites.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And Solomon did evil in the eyes of the Lord, not walking in the Lord's ways with all his heart as David his father did.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: Then Solomon put up a high place for Chemosh, the disgusting god of Moab, in the mountain before Jerusalem, and for Molech, the disgusting god worshipped by the children of Ammon.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: And so he did for all his strange wives, who made offerings with burning of perfumes to their gods.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And the Lord was angry with Solomon, because his heart was turned away from the Lord, the God of Israel, who had twice come to him in a vision;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: And had given him orders about this very thing, that he was not to go after other gods; but he did not keep the orders of the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: So the Lord said to Solomon, Because you have done this, and have not kept my agreement and my laws, which I gave you, I will take the kingdom away from you by force and will give it to your servant.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: I will not do it in your life-time, because of your father David, but I will take it from your son.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: Still I will not take all the kingdom from him; but I will give one tribe to your son, because of my servant David, and because of Jerusalem, the town of my selection.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: So the Lord sent Hadad the Edomite to make trouble for Solomon: he was of the king's seed in Edom.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: And when David had sent destruction on Edom, and Joab, the captain of the army, had gone to put the dead into the earth, and had put to death every male in Edom;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: (For Joab and all Israel were there six months till every male in Edom had been cut off;)

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: Hadad, being still a young boy, went in flight to Egypt, with certain Edomites, servants of his father;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: And they went on from Midian and came to Paran; and, taking men from Paran with them, they came to Egypt, to Pharaoh, king of Egypt, who gave him a house and gave orders for his food and gave him land.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: Now Hadad was very pleasing to Pharaoh, so that he gave him the sister of his wife, Tahpenes the queen, for his wife.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: And the sister of Tahpenes had a son by him, Genubath, whom Tahpenes took care of in Pharaoh's house; and Genubath was living in Pharaoh's house among Pharaoh's sons.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: Now when Hadad had news in Egypt that David had been put to rest with his fathers, and that Joab, the captain of the army, was dead, he said to Pharaoh, Send me back to my country.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: But Pharaoh said to him, What have you been short of while you have been with me, that you are desiring to go back to your country? And he said, Nothing; but even so, send me back.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: And God sent another trouble-maker, Rezon, the son of Eliada, who had gone in flight from his lord, Hadadezer, king of Zobah:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: He got some men together and made himself captain of a band of outlaws; and went to Damascus and became king there.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: He was a trouble to Israel all through the days of Solomon. And this is the damage Hadad did: he was cruel to Israel while he was ruler over Edom.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: And there was Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, an Ephraimite from Zeredah, a servant of Solomon, whose mother was Zeruah, a widow; and his hand was lifted up against the king.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: The way in which his hand came to be lifted up against the king was this: Solomon was building the Millo and making good the damaged parts of the town of his father David;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: And Jeroboam was an able and responsible man; and Solomon saw that he was a good worker and made him overseer of all the work given to the sons of Joseph.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: Now at that time, when Jeroboam was going out of Jerusalem, the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite came across him on the road; now Ahijah had put on a new robe; and the two of them were by themselves in the open country.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: And Ahijah took his new robe in his hands, parting it violently into twelve.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: And he said to Jeroboam, Take ten of the parts, for this is what the Lord has said: See, I will take the kingdom away from Solomon by force, and will give ten tribes to you;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: (But one tribe will be his, because of my servant David, and because of Jerusalem, the town which, out of all the tribes of Israel, I have made mine,)

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: Because they are turned away from me to the worship of Ashtoreth, the goddess of the Zidonians, and Chemosh, the god of Moab, and Milcom, the god of the Ammonites; they have not been walking in my ways or doing what is right in my eyes or keeping my laws and my decisions as his father David did.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 34
text: But I will not take the kingdom from him; I will let him be king all the days of his life, because of David my servant, in whom I took delight because he kept my orders and my laws.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 35
text: But I will take the kingdom from his son, and give it to you.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 36
text: And one tribe I will give to his son, so that David my servant may have a light for ever burning before me in Jerusalem, the town which I have made mine to put my name there.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 37
text: And you I will take, and you will be king over Israel, ruling over whatever is the desire of your soul.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 38
text: And if you give attention to the orders I give you, walking in my ways and doing what is right in my eyes and keeping my laws and my orders as David my servant did; then I will be with you, building up for you a safe house, as I did for David, and I will give Israel to you.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 39
text: (So that I may send trouble for this on the seed of David, but not for ever.)

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 40
text: And Solomon was looking for a chance to put Jeroboam to death; but he went in flight to Egypt, to Shishak, king of Egypt, and was in Egypt till the death of Solomon.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 41
text: Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, and all he did, and his wisdom, are they not recorded in the book of the acts of Solomon?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 42
text: And the time Solomon was king in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 43
text: And Solomon went to rest with his fathers, and was put into the earth in the town of David his father: and Solomon went to rest with his fathers and Rehoboam his son became king in his place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: And Rehoboam went to Shechem, where all Israel had come together to make him king,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: And, hearing of it, Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, who was still in Egypt, where he had gone in flight from Solomon, and was living there, came back to his town Zeredah, in the hill-country of Ephraim;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: And all the men of Israel came to Rehoboam and said,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: Your father put a hard yoke on us: if you will make the conditions under which your father kept us down less cruel, and the weight of the yoke he put on us less hard, then we will be your servants.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: And he said to them, Go away for three days and then come back to me again. So the people went away.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: Then King Rehoboam took the opinion of the old men who had been with Solomon his father when he was living, and said, In your opinion, what answer am I to give to this people?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: And they said to him, If you will be a servant to this people today, caring for them and giving them a gentle answer, then they will be your servants for ever.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: But he gave no attention to the opinion of the old men, and went to the young men of his generation who were waiting before him:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: And said to them, What is your opinion? What answer are we to give to this people who have said to me, Make less the weight of the yoke which your father put on us?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: And the young men of his generation said to him, This is the answer to give to the people who came to you saying, Your father put a hard yoke on us; will you make it less? say to them, My little finger is thicker than my father's body;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: If my father put a hard yoke on you, I will make it harder: my father gave you punishment with whips, but I will give you blows with snakes.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: So all the people came to Rehoboam on the third day, as the king had given orders, saying, Come back to me the third day.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: And the king gave them a rough answer, giving no attention to the suggestion of the old men;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: But giving them the answer put forward by the young men, saying, My father made your yoke hard, but I will make it harder; my father gave you punishment with whips, but I will give it with snakes.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: So the king did not give ear to the people; and this came about by the purpose of the Lord, so that what he had said by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam, son of Nebat, might be effected.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: And when all Israel saw that the king would give no attention to them, the people in answer said to the king, What part have we in David? what is our heritage in the son of Jesse? to your tents, O Israel; now see to your people, David. So Israel went away to their tents.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: (But Rehoboam was still king over those of the children of Israel who were living in the towns of Judah.)

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: Then King Rehoboam sent Adoniram, the overseer of the forced work; and he was stoned to death by all Israel. And King Rehoboam went quickly and got into his carriage to go in flight to Jerusalem.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: So Israel was turned away from the family of David to this day.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: Now when all Israel had news that Jeroboam had come back, they sent for him to come before the meeting of the people, and made him king over Israel: not one of them was joined to the family of David but only the tribe of Judah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: When Rehoboam came to Jerusalem, he got together all the men of Judah and the tribe of Benjamin, a hundred and eighty thousand of his best fighting-men, to make war against Israel and get the kingdom back for Rehoboam, the son of Solomon.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: But the word of God came to Shemaiah, the man of God, saying,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: Say to Rehoboam, the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all the men of Judah and Benjamin and the rest of the people:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: The Lord has said, You are not to go to war against your brothers, the children of Israel; go back, every man to his house, because this thing is my purpose. So they gave ear to the word of the Lord, and went back, as the Lord had said.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: Then Jeroboam made the town of Shechem in the hill-country of Ephraim a strong place, and was living there; and from there he went out and did the same to Penuel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 26
text: And Jeroboam said in his heart, Now the kingdom will go back to the family of David:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 27
text: If the people go up to make offerings in the house of the Lord at Jerusalem, their heart will be turned again to their lord, to Rehoboam, king of Judah; and they will put me to death and go back to Rehoboam, king of Judah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 28
text: So after taking thought the king made two oxen of gold; and he said to the people, You have been going up to Jerusalem long enough; see! these are your gods, O Israel, who took you out of the land of Egypt.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 29
text: And he put one in Beth-el and the other in Dan.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 30
text: And this became a sin in Israel; for the people went to give worship to the one at Beth-el, and to the other at Dan.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 31
text: And he made places for worship at the high places, and made priests, who were not Levites, from among all the people.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 32
text: And Jeroboam gave orders for a feast in the eighth month, on the fifteenth day of the month, like the feast which is kept in Judah, and he went up to the altar. And in the same way, in Beth-el, he gave offerings to the oxen which he had made, placing in Beth-el the priests of the high places he had made.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 33
text: He went up to the altar he had made in Beth-el on the fifteenth day of the eighth month, the month fixed by him at his pleasure; and he gave orders for a feast for the people of Israel, and went up to the altar, and there he made the smoke of his offerings go up.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: Then a man of God came from Judah by the order of the Lord to Beth-el, where Jeroboam was by the altar, burning offerings.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: And by the order of the Lord he made an outcry against the altar, saying, O altar, altar, the Lord has said, From the seed of David will come a child, named Josiah, and on you he will put to death the priests of the high places, who are burning offerings on you, and men's bones will be burned on you.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: The same day he gave them a sign, saying, This is the sign which the Lord has given: See, the altar will be broken and the burned waste on it overturned.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: Then the king, hearing the man of God crying out against the altar at Beth-el, put out his hand from the altar, saying, Take him prisoner. And his hand, stretched out against him, became dead, and he had no power of pulling it back.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: And the altar was broken and the burned waste on it overturned; this was the sign which the man of God had given by the word of the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: Then the king made answer and said to the man of God, Make a prayer now for the grace of the Lord your God, and for me, that my hand may be made well. And in answer to the prayer of the man of God, the king's hand was made well again, as it was before.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: And the king said to the man of God, Come with me to my house for food and rest, and I will give you a reward.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: But the man of God said to the king, Even if you gave me half of all you have, I would not go in with you, and I would not take food or a drink of water in this place;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: For so I was ordered by the word of the Lord, who said, You are not to take food or a drink of water, and you are not to go back the way you came.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: So he went another way, and not by the way he came to Beth-el.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: Now there was an old prophet living in Beth-el; and one of his sons came and gave him word of all the man of God had done that day in Beth-el, and they gave their father an account of the words he had said to the king.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: Then their father said to them, Which way did he go? Now his sons had seen which way the man of God who came from Judah had gone.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: So the prophet said to his sons, Make ready an ass for me. So they made an ass ready, and he got on it,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: And went after the man of God, and came up with him while he was seated under an oak-tree. And he said to him, Are you the man of God who came from Judah? And he said, I am.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: Then he said to him, Come back to the house with me and have a meal.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: But he said, I may not go back with you or go into your house; and I will not take food or a drink of water with you in this place;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: For the Lord said to me, You are not to take food or water there, or go back again by the way you came.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: Then he said to him, I am a prophet like you; and an angel said to me by the word of the Lord, Take him back with you and give him food and water. But he said false words to him.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: So he went back with him, and had a meal in his house and a drink of water.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: But while they were seated at the table, the word of the Lord came to the prophet who had taken him back;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: And crying out to the man of God who came from Judah, he said, The Lord says, Because you have gone against the voice of the Lord, and have not done as you were ordered by the Lord,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: But have come back, and have taken food and water in this place where he said you were to take no food or water; your dead body will not be put to rest with your fathers.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: Now after the meal he made ready the ass for him, for the prophet whom he had taken back.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: And he went on his way; but on the road a lion came rushing at him and put him to death; and his dead body was stretched in the road with the ass by its side, and the lion was there by the body.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: And some men, going by, saw the body stretched out in the road with the lion by its side; and they came and gave news of it in the town where the old prophet was living.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 26
text: Then the prophet who had made him come back, hearing it, said, It is the man of God, who went against the word of the Lord; that is why the Lord has given him to the lion to be wounded to death, as the Lord said.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 27
text: And he said to his sons, Make ready the ass for me. And they did so.
