title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 28
text: And he went and saw the dead body stretched out in the road with the ass and the lion by its side: the lion had not taken the body for its food or done any damage to the ass.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 29
text: Then the prophet took up the body of the man of God and put it on the ass and took it back; and he came to the town to put the body to rest with weeping.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 30
text: And he put the body in the resting-place made ready for himself, weeping and sorrowing over it, saying, O my brother!

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 31
text: And when he had put it to rest, he said to his sons, When I am dead, then you are to put my body into the earth with the body of this man of God, and put me by his bones so that my bones may be kept safe with his bones.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 32
text: For the outcry he made by the word of the Lord against the altar in Beth-el and against all the houses of the high places in the towns of Samaria, will certainly come about.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 33
text: After this Jeroboam, not turning back from his evil ways, still made priests for his altars from among all the people; he made a priest of anyone desiring it, so that there might be priests of the high places.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 13 Verse 34
text: And this became a sin in the family of Jeroboam, causing it to be cut off and sent to destruction from the face of the earth.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: At that time Abijah, the son of Jeroboam, became ill.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: And Jeroboam said to his wife, Now come, put on different clothing so that you may not seem to be the wife of Jeroboam, and go to Shiloh; see, Ahijah is there, the prophet who said I would be king over this people.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: And take with you ten cakes of bread and dry cakes and a pot of honey, and go to him: he will give you word of what is to become of the child.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: So Jeroboam's wife did so, and got up and went to Shiloh and came to the house of Ahijah. Now Ahijah was unable to see, because he was very old.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: And the Lord had said to Ahijah, The wife of Jeroboam is coming to get news from you about her son, who is ill; give her such and such an answer; for she will make herself seem to be another woman.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: Then Ahijah, hearing the sound of her footsteps coming in at the door, said, Come in, O wife of Jeroboam; why do you make yourself seem like another? for I am sent to you with bitter news.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: Go, say to Jeroboam, These are the words of the Lord, the God of Israel: Though I took you from among the people, lifting you up to be a ruler over my people Israel,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: And took the kingdom away by force from the seed of David and gave it to you, you have not been like my servant David, who kept my orders, and was true to me with all his heart, doing only what was right in my eyes.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: But you have done evil more than any before you, and have made for yourself other gods, and images of metal, moving me to wrath, and turning your back on me.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: So I will send evil on the line of Jeroboam, cutting off from his family every male child, those who are shut up and those who go free in Israel; the family of Jeroboam will be brushed away like a man brushing away waste till it is all gone.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: Those of the family of Jeroboam who come to death in the town, will become food for the dogs; and those on whom death comes in the open country, will be food for the birds of the air; for the Lord has said it.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: Up, then! go back to your house; and in the hour when your feet go into the town, the death of the child will take place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: And all Israel will put his body to rest, weeping over him, because he only of the family of Jeroboam will be put into his resting-place in the earth; for of all the family of Jeroboam, in him only has the Lord, the God of Israel, seen some good.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: And the Lord will put up a king over Israel who will send destruction on the family of Jeroboam in that day;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: And even now the hand of the Lord has come down on Israel, shaking it like a river-grass in the water; and, uprooting Israel from this good land, which he gave to their fathers, he will send them this way and that on the other side of the River; because they have made for themselves images, moving the Lord to wrath.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: And he will give Israel up because of the sins which Jeroboam has done and made Israel do.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: Then Jeroboam's wife got up and went away and came to Tirzah; and when she came to the doorway of the house, death came to the child.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: And all Israel put his body to rest, weeping over him, as the Lord had said by his servant Ahijah the prophet.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how he made war and how he became king, are recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: And Jeroboam was king for twenty-two years, and was put to rest with his fathers, and Nadab his son became king in his place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: And Rehoboam, the son of Solomon, was king in Judah. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he became king, and he was king for seventeen years in Jerusalem, the town which the Lord had made his out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there; his mother's name was Naamah, an Ammonite woman.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: And Judah did evil in the eyes of the Lord, and made him more angry than their fathers had done by their sins.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: For they made high places and upright stones and wood pillars on every high hill and under every green tree;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: And more than this, there were those in the land who were used for sex purposes in the worship of the gods, doing the same disgusting crimes as the nations which the Lord had sent out before the children of Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: Now in the fifth year of King Rehoboam, Shishak, king of Egypt, came up against Jerusalem;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: And took away all the stored wealth from the house of the Lord, and from the king's house, and all the gold body-covers which Solomon had made.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: So in their place King Rehoboam had other body-covers made of brass, and gave them into the care of the captains of the armed men who were stationed at the door of the king's house.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: And whenever the king went into the house of the Lord, the armed men went with him taking the body-covers, and then took them back to their room.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 29
text: Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam, and all he did, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Judah?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 30
text: And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all their days.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 14 Verse 31
text: And Rehoboam went to rest with his fathers, and was put into the earth with his fathers in the town of David; his mother's name was Naamah, an Ammonite woman. And Abijam his son became king in his place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, Abijam became king over Judah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: For three years he was king in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Maacah, the daughter of Abishalom.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: And he did the same sins which his father had done before him: his heart was not completely true to the Lord his God, like the heart of David his father.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: But because of David, the Lord gave him a light in Jerusalem, making his sons king after him, so that Jerusalem might be safe;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: Because David did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, and never in all his life went against his orders, but only in the question of Uriah the Hittite.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: Now the rest of the acts of Abijam, and all he did, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: Then Abijam went to rest with his fathers, and they put him into the earth in the town of David: and Asa his son became king in his place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: In the twentieth year that Jeroboam was king of Israel, Asa became king over Judah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: And he was king for forty-one years in Jerusalem; his mother's name was Maacah, the daughter of Abishalom.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: Asa did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as David his father did.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: Those used for sex purposes in the worship of the gods he sent out of the country, and he took away all the images which his fathers had made.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: And he would not let Maacah his mother be queen, because she had made a disgusting image for Asherah; and Asa had the image cut down and burned by the stream Kidron.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: The high places, however, were not taken away: but still the heart of Asa was true to the Lord all his life.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: He took into the house of the Lord all the things which his father had made holy, and those which he himself had made holy, silver and gold and vessels.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: Now there was war between Asa and Baasha, king of Israel, all their days.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: And Baasha, king of Israel, went up against Judah, building Ramah, so that no one was able to go out or in to Asa, king of Judah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: Then Asa took all the silver and gold which was still stored in the Lord's house, and in the king's house, and sent them, in the care of his servants, to Ben-hadad, son of Tabrimmon, son of Rezon, king of Aram, at Damascus, saying,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: Let there be an agreement between me and you as there was between my father and your father: see, I have sent you an offering of silver and gold; go and put an end to your agreement with Baasha, king of Israel, so that he may give up attacking me.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: So Ben-hadad did as King Asa said, and sent the captains of his armies against the towns of Israel, attacking Ijon and Dan and Abel-beth-maacah, and all Chinneroth as far as all the land of Naphtali.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: And Baasha, hearing of it, put a stop to the building of Ramah, and was living in Tirzah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: Then King Asa got all Judah together, making every man come; and they took away the stones and the wood with which Baasha was building Ramah, and King Asa made use of them for building Geba in the land of Benjamin, and Mizpah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: Now the rest of the acts of Asa, and his power, and all he did, and the towns of which he was the builder, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Judah? But when he was old he had a disease of the feet.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: So Asa went to rest with his fathers and was put into the earth in the town of David his father: and Jehoshaphat his son became king in his place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: Nadab, the son of Jeroboam, became king over Israel in the second year that Asa was king of Judah; and he was king of Israel for two years.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, copying the evil ways of his father, and the sin which he did and made Israel do.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: And Baasha, the son of Ahijah, of the family of Issachar, made a secret design against him, attacking him at Gibbethon, a town of the Philistines; for Nadab and the armies of Israel were making war on Gibbethon.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: In the third year of the rule of Asa, king of Judah, Baasha put him to death, and became king in his place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: And straight away when he became king, he sent destruction on all the offspring of Jeroboam; there was not one living person of all the family of Jeroboam whom he did not put to death, so the word of the Lord, which he said by his servant Ahijah the Shilonite, came about;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: Because of the sins which Jeroboam did and made Israel do, moving the Lord, the God of Israel, to wrath.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: Now the rest of the acts of Nadab, and all he did, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Israel?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: And there was war between Asa and Baasha, king of Israel, all their days.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 33
text: In the third year of the rule of Asa, king of Judah, Baasha, the son of Ahijah, became king over all Israel in Tirzah, and was king for twenty-four years.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 15 Verse 34
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, copying the evil ways of Jeroboam and the sin which he made Israel do.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to Jehu, son of Hanani, protesting against Baasha and saying,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: Because I took you up out of the dust, and made you ruler over my people Israel; and you have gone in the ways of Jeroboam, and made my people Israel do evil, moving me to wrath by their sins;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: Truly, I will see that Baasha and all his family are completely brushed away; I will make your family like the family of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: Anyone of the family of Baasha who comes to death in the town, will become food for the dogs; and he to whom death comes in the open country, will be food for the birds of the air.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: Now the rest of the acts of Baasha, and what he did, and his power, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Israel?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: And Baasha went to rest with his fathers, and was put into the earth at Tirzah; and Elah his son became king in his place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: And the Lord sent his word against Baasha and his family by the mouth of the prophet Jehu, the son of Hanani, because of all the evil he did in the eyes of the Lord, moving him to wrath by the work of his hands, because he was like the family of Jeroboam, and because he put it to death.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: In the twenty-sixth year that Asa was king of Judah, Elah, the son of Baasha, became king of Israel in Tirzah, and he was king for two years.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: And his servant Zimri, captain of half his war-carriages, made secret designs against him: now he was in Tirzah, drinking hard in the house of Arza, controller of the king's house in Tirzah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: And Zimri went in and made an attack on him and put him to death, in the twenty-seventh year that Asa was king of Judah, and made himself king in his place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: And straight away when he became king and took his place on the seat of the kingdom, he put to death all the family of Baasha: not one male child of his relations or his friends kept his life.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: So Zimri put to death all the family of Baasha, so that the word which the Lord said against him by the mouth of Jehu the prophet came about;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: Because of all the sins of Baasha, and the sins of Elah his son, which they did and made Israel do, moving the Lord, the God of Israel, to wrath by their foolish acts.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: Now the rest of the acts of Elah, and all he did, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Israel?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: In the twenty-seventh year of Asa, king of Judah, Zimri was king for seven days in Tirzah. Now the people were attacking Gibbethon in the land of the Philistines.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: And news came to the people in the tents that Zimri had made a secret design and had put the king to death: so all Israel made Omri, the captain of the army, king that day in the tents.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: Then Omri went up from Gibbethon, with all the army of Israel, and they made an attack on Tirzah, shutting in the town on every side.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: And when Zimri saw that the town was taken, he went into the inner room of the king's house, and burning the house over his head, came to his end,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: Because of his sin in doing evil in the eyes of the Lord, in going in the way of Jeroboam and in his sin which he made Israel do.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: Now the rest of the acts of Zimri, and the secret design he made, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Israel?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: Then there was a division among the people of Israel; half the people were for making Tibni, son of Ginath, king, and half were supporting Omri.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: But the supporters of Omri overcame those who were on the side of Tibni, the son of Ginath; and death came to Tibni and to his brother Joram at that time: and Omri became king in the place of Tibni.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: In the thirty-first year of Asa, king of Judah, Omri became king over Israel, and he was king for twelve years; for six years he was ruling in Tirzah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 24
text: He got the hill Samaria from Shemer for the price of two talents of silver, and he made a town there, building it on the hill and naming it Samaria, after Shemer the owner of the hill.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 25
text: And Omri did evil in the eyes of the Lord, even worse than all those before him,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 26
text: Copying all the evil ways of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, and all the sins he did and made Israel do, moving the Lord, the God of Israel, to wrath by their foolish ways.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 27
text: Now the rest of the acts which Omri did, and his great power, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Israel?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 28
text: So Omri went to rest with his fathers, and was put into the earth in Samaria; and Ahab his son became king in his place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 29
text: In the thirty-eighth year that Asa was king of Judah, Ahab, the son of Omri, became king over Israel; and Ahab was king in Samaria for twenty-two years.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 30
text: And Ahab, the son of Omri, did evil in the eyes of the Lord, even worse than all who went before him.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 31
text: And as if copying the evil ways of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, was a small thing for him, he took as his wife Jezebel, daughter of Ethbaal, king of Zidon, and became a servant and worshipper of Baal.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 32
text: And he put up an altar for Baal in the house of Baal which he had made in Samaria.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 33
text: And Ahab made an image of Asherah and did more than all the kings of Israel before him to make the Lord, the God of Israel, angry.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 34
text: In his days Hiel made Jericho; he put its base in position at the price of Abiram, his oldest son, and he put its doors in place at the price of his youngest son Segub; even as the Lord had said by Joshua, the son of Nun.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: And Elijah the Tishbite, of Tishbe in Gilead, said to Ahab, By the living Lord, the God of Israel, whose servant I am, there will be no dew or rain in these years, but only at my word.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: Then the word of the Lord came to him, saying,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: Go from here in the direction of the east, and keep yourself in a secret place by the stream Cherith, east of Jordan.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: The water of the stream will be your drink, and by my orders the ravens will give you food there.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: So he went and did as the Lord said, living by the stream Cherith, east of Jordan.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: And the ravens took him bread in the morning and meat in the evening; and the water of the stream was his drink.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: Now after a time the stream became dry, because there was no rain in the land.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: Then the word of the Lord came to him, saying,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: Up! go now to Zarephath, in Zidon, and make your living-place there; I have given orders to a widow woman there to see that you have food.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: So he got up and went to Zarephath; and when he came to the door of the town, he saw a widow woman getting sticks together; and crying out to her he said, Will you give me a little water in a vessel for my drink?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: And when she was going to get it, he said to her, And get me with it a small bit of bread.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: Then she said, By the life of the Lord your God, I have nothing but a little meal in my store, and a drop of oil in the bottle; and now I am getting two sticks together so that I may go in and make it ready for me and my son, so that we may have a meal before our death.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: And Elijah said to her, Have no fear; go and do as you have said, but first make me a little cake of it and come and give it to me, and then make something for yourself and your son.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: For this is the word of the Lord, the God of Israel: The store of meal will not come to an end, and the bottle will never be without oil, till the day when the Lord sends rain on the earth.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: So she went and did as Elijah said; and she and he and her family had food for a long time.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: The store of meal did not come to an end, and the bottle was never without oil, as the Lord had said by the mouth of Elijah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: Now after this, the son of the woman of the house became ill, so ill that there was no breath in him.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: And she said to Elijah, What have I to do with you, O man of God? have you come to put God in mind of my sin, and to put my son to death?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 19
text: And he said to her, Give your son to me. And lifting him out of her arms, he took him up to his room and put him down on his bed.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 20
text: And crying to the Lord he said, O Lord my God, have you sent evil even on the widow whose guest I am, by causing her son's death?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 21
text: And stretching herself out on the child three times, he made his prayer to the Lord, saying, O Lord my God, be pleased to let this child's life come back to him again.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 22
text: And the Lord gave ear to the voice of Elijah, and the child's spirit came into him again, and he came back to life.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 23
text: And Elijah took the child down from his room into the house and gave him to his mother and said to her, See, your son is living.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 24
text: Then the woman said to Elijah, Now I am certain that you are a man of God, and that the word of the Lord in your mouth is true.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: Now after a long time, the word of the Lord came to Elijah, in the third year, saying, Go and let Ahab see you, so that I may send rain on the earth.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: So Elijah went to let Ahab see him. Now there was no food to be had in Samaria.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: And Ahab sent for Obadiah, the controller of the king's house. (Now Obadiah had the fear of the Lord before him greatly;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: For when Jezebel was cutting off the prophets of the Lord, Obadiah took a hundred of them, and kept them secretly in a hole in the rock, fifty at a time, and gave them bread and water.)

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: And Ahab said to Obadiah, Come, let us go through all the country, to all the fountains of water and all the rivers, and see if there is any grass to be had for the horses and the transport beasts, so that we may be able to keep some of the beasts from destruction.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: So they went through all the country, covering it between them; Ahab went in one direction by himself, and Obadiah went in another by himself.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: And while Obadiah was on his way, he came face to face with Elijah; and seeing who it was, he went down on his face and said, Is it you, my lord Elijah?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: And Elijah in answer said, It is I; now go and say to your lord, Elijah is here.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: And he said, What sin have I done, that you would give up your servant into the hand of Ahab, and be the cause of my death?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: By the life of the Lord your God, there is not a nation or kingdom where my lord has not sent in search of you; and when they said, He is not here; he made them take an oath that they had not seen you.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: And now you say, Go, say to your lord, Elijah is here.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: And straight away, when I have gone from you, the spirit of the Lord will take you away, I have no idea where, so that when I come and give word to Ahab, and he sees you not, he will put me to death: though I, your servant, have been a worshipper of the Lord from my earliest years.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: Has my lord not had word of what I did when Jezebel was putting the Lord's prophets to death? how I kept a hundred of them in a secret hole in the rock, fifty at a time, and gave them bread and water?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: And now you say, Go and say to your Lord, Elijah is here; and he will put me to death.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: And Elijah said, By the life of the Lord of armies, whose servant I am, I will certainly let him see me today.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: So Obadiah went to Ahab and gave him the news; and Ahab went to see Elijah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: And when he saw Elijah, Ahab said to him, Is it you, you troubler of Israel?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: Then he said in answer, I have not been troubling Israel, but you and your family; because, turning away from the orders of the Lord, you have gone after the Baals.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: Now send, and get Israel together before me at Mount Carmel, with the four hundred and fifty prophets of Baal who get their food at Jezebel's table.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: So Ahab sent for all the children of Israel, and got the prophets together at Mount Carmel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: And Elijah came near to all the people and said, How long will you go on balancing between two opinions? if the Lord is God, then give worship to him; but if Baal, give worship to him. And the people said not a word in answer.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: Then Elijah said to the people, I, even I, am the only living prophet of the Lord; but Baal's prophets are four hundred and fifty men.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: Now, let them give us two oxen; and let them take one for themselves, and have it cut up, and put it on the wood, but put no fire under it; I will get the other ox ready, and put it on the wood, and put no fire under it.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: And do you make prayers to your god, and I will make a prayer to the Lord: and it will be clear that the one who gives an answer by fire is God. And all the people in answer said, It is well said.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: Then Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, Take one ox for yourselves and get it ready first, for there are more of you; and make your prayers to your god, but put no fire under.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: So they took the ox which was given them, and made it ready, crying out to Baal from morning till the middle of the day, and saying, O Baal, give ear to us. But there was no voice and no answer. And they were jumping up and down before the altar they had made.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: And in the middle of the day, Elijah made sport of them, saying, Give louder cries, for he is a god; he may be deep in thought, or he may have gone away for some purpose, or he may be on a journey, or by chance he is sleeping and has to be made awake.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: So they gave loud cries, cutting themselves with knives and swords, as was their way, till the blood came streaming out all over them.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 29
text: And from the middle of the day they went on with their prayers till the time of the offering; but there was no voice, or any answer, or any who gave attention to them.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 30
text: Then Elijah said to all the people, Come near to me; and all the people came near. And he put up again the altar of the Lord which had been broken down.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 31
text: And Elijah took twelve stones, the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, to whom the Lord had said, Israel will be your name:

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 32
text: And with the stones he made an altar to the name of the Lord; and he made a deep drain all round the altar, great enough to take two measures of seed.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 33
text: And he put the wood in order, and, cutting up the ox, put it on the wood. Then he said, Get four vessels full of water and put it on the burned offering and on the wood. And he said, Do it a second time, and they did it a second time;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 34
text: And he said, Do it a third time, and they did it a third time.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 35
text: And the water went all round the altar, till the drain was full.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 36
text: Then at the time of the offering, Elijah the prophet came near and said, O Lord, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, let it be seen this day that you are God in Israel, and that I am your servant, and that I have done all these things by your order.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 37
text: Give me an answer, O Lord, give me an answer, so that this people may see that you are God, and that you have made their hearts come back again.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 38
text: Then the fire of the Lord came down, burning up the offering and the wood and the stones and the dust, and drinking up the water in the drain.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 39
text: And when the people saw it, they all went down on their faces, and said, The Lord, he is God, the Lord, he is God.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 40
text: And Elijah said to them, Take the prophets of Baal, let not one of them get away. So they took them, and Elijah made them go down to the stream Kishon, and put them to death there.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 41
text: Then Elijah said to Ahab, Up! take food and drink, for there is a sound of much rain.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 42
text: So Ahab went up to have food and drink, while Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; and he went down on the earth, putting his face between his knees.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 43
text: And he said to his servant, Go now, and take a look in the direction of the sea. And he went up, and after looking said, There is nothing. And he said, Go again seven times; and he went seven times.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 44
text: And the seventh time he said, I see a cloud coming up out of the sea, as small as a man's hand. Then he said, Go up and say to Ahab, Get your carriage ready and go down or the rain will keep you back.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 45
text: And after a very little time, the heaven became black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. And Ahab went in his carriage to Jezreel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 46
text: And the hand of the Lord was on Elijah; and he made himself strong, and went running before Ahab till they came to Jezreel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: Ahab gave Jezebel news of all Elijah had done, and how he had put all the prophets to death with the sword.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: Then Jezebel sent a servant to Elijah, saying, May the gods' punishment be on me if I do not make your life like the life of one of them by tomorrow about this time.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: And he got up, fearing for his life, and went in flight, and came to Beer-sheba in Judah, parting there from his servant;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: While he himself went a day's journey into the waste land, and took a seat under a broom-plant, desiring for himself only death; for he said, It is enough: now, O Lord, take away my life, for I am no better than my fathers.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: And stretching himself on the earth, he went to sleep under the broom-plant; but an angel, touching him, said to him, Get up and have some food.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: And looking up, he saw by his head a cake cooked on the stones and a bottle of water. So he took food and drink and went to sleep again.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: And the angel of the Lord came again a second time, and touching him said, Get up and have some food, or the journey will be overmuch for your strength.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: So he got up and took food and drink, and in the strength of that food he went on for forty days and nights, to Horeb, the mountain of God.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: And there he went into a hole in the rock for the night; then the word of the Lord came to him, saying, What are you doing here, Elijah?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: And he said, I have been burning for the honour of the Lord, the God of armies; for the children of Israel have not kept your agreement; they have made destruction of your altars, and have put your prophets to death with the sword: till I, even I, am the only one living; and now they are attempting to take away my life.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: Then he said, Go out and take your place on the mountain before the Lord. Then the Lord went by, and mountains were parted by the force of a great wind, and rocks were broken before the Lord; but the Lord was not in the wind. And after the wind there was an earth-shock, but the Lord was not in the earth-shock.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: And after the earth-shock a fire, but the Lord was not in the fire. And after the fire, the sound of a soft breath.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: And Elijah, hearing it, went out, covering his face with his robe, and took his place in the opening of the hole. And there a voice came to him saying, What are you doing here, Elijah?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: And he said, I have been burning for the honour of the Lord, the God of armies; for the children of Israel have not kept your agreement; they have had your altars broken down, and have put your prophets to death with the sword: till I, even I, am the only one living; and now they are attempting to take away my life.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: And the Lord said to him, Go back on your way through the waste land to Damascus; and when you come there, put the holy oil on Hazael to make him king over Aram;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: And on Jehu, son of Nimshi, making him king over Israel; and on Elisha, the son of Shaphat of Abel-meholah, to be prophet in your place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: And it will come about that the man who gets away safe from the sword of Hazael, Jehu will put to death; and whoever gets away safe from the sword of Jehu, Elisha will put to death.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: But I will keep safe seven thousand in Israel, all those whose knees have not been bent to Baal, and whose mouths have given him no kisses.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: So he went away from there and came across Elisha, the son of Shaphat, ploughing with twelve yoke of oxen, he himself walking with the twelfth; and Elijah went up to him and put his robe on him.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: And letting the oxen be where they were, he came running after Elijah, and said, Only let me give a kiss to my father and mother, and then I will come after you. But he said to him, Go back again; for what have I done to you?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: And he went back, and took the oxen and put them to death, and cooking their flesh with the yokes of the oxen, he gave the people a feast. Then he got up and went after Elijah and became his servant.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: Now Ben-hadad, king of Aram, got all his army together, and thirty-two kings with him, and horses and carriages of war; he went up and made war on Samaria, shutting it in.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: And he sent representatives into the town to Ahab, king of Israel;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: And they said to him, Ben-hadad says, Your silver and your gold are mine; and your wives and children are mine.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: And the king of Israel sent him an answer saying, As you say, my lord king, I am yours with all I have.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: Then the representatives came back again, and said, These are the words of Ben-hadad: I sent to you saying, Give up to me your silver and your gold, your wives and your children;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: But I will send my servants to you tomorrow about this time, to make a search through your house and the houses of your people, and everything which is pleasing in your eyes they will take away in their hands.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: Then the king of Israel sent for all the responsible men of the land, and said, Now will you take note and see the evil purpose of this man: he sent for my wives and my children, my silver and my gold, and I did not keep them back.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: And all the responsible men and the people said to him, Do not give attention to him or do what he says.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: So he said to the representatives of Ben-hadad, Say to my lord the king, All the orders you sent the first time I will do; but this thing I may not do. And the representatives went back with this answer.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: Then Ben-hadad sent to him, saying, May the gods' punishment be on me if there is enough of the dust of Samaria for all the people at my feet to take some in their hands.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: And the king of Israel said in answer, Say to him, The time for loud talk is not when a man is putting on his arms, but when he is taking them off.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: Now when this answer was given to Ben-hadad, he was drinking with the kings in the tents, and he said to his men, Take up your positions. So they put themselves in position for attacking the town.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: Then a prophet came up to Ahab, king of Israel, and said, The Lord says, Have you seen all this great army? See, I will give it into your hands today, and you will see that I am the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: And Ahab said, By whom? And he said, The Lord says, By the servants of the chiefs who are over the divisions of the land. Then he said, By whom is the fighting to be started? And he made answer, By you.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: Then he got together the servants of all the chiefs who were over the divisions of the land, two hundred and thirty-two of them; and after them, he got together all the people, all the children of Israel, seven thousand.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: And in the middle of the day they went out. But Ben-hadad was drinking in the tents with the thirty-two kings who were helping him.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: And the servants of the chiefs who were over the divisions of the land went forward first; and when Ben-hadad sent out, they gave him the news, saying, Men have come out from Samaria.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: And he said, If they have come out for peace, take them living, and if they have come out for war, take them living.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: So the servants of the chiefs of the divisions of the land went out of the town, with the army coming after them.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: And every one of them put his man to death, and the Aramaeans went in flight with Israel after them; and Ben-hadad, king of Aram, got away safely on a horse with his horsemen.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: And the king of Israel went out and took the horses and the war-carriages, and made great destruction among the Aramaeans.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: Then the prophet came up to the king of Israel, and said to him, Now make yourself strong, and take care what you do, or a year from now the king of Aram will come up against you again.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: Then the king of Aram's servants said to him, Their god is a god of the hills; that is why they were stronger than we: but if we make an attack on them in the lowlands, we will certainly be stronger than they.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: This is what you have to do: take away the kings from their positions, and put captains in their places;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: And get together another army like the one which came to destruction, horse for horse, and carriage for carriage; and let us make war on them in the lowlands, and certainly we will be stronger than they. And he gave ear to what they said, and did so.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: So, a year later, Ben-hadad got the Aramaeans together and went up to Aphek to make war on Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 27
text: And the children of Israel got themselves together, and food was made ready and they went against them; the tents of the children of Israel were like two little flocks of goats before them, but all the country was full of the Aramaeans.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 28
text: And a man of God came up and said to the king of Israel, The Lord says, Because the Aramaeans have said, The Lord is a god of the hills and not of the valleys; I will give all this great army into your hands, and you will see that I am the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 29
text: Now the two armies kept their positions facing one another for seven days. And on the seventh day the fight was started; and the children of Israel put to the sword a hundred thousand Aramaean footmen in one day.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 30
text: But the rest went in flight to Aphek, into the town, where a wall came down on the twenty-seven thousand who were still living. And Ben-hadad went in flight into the town, into an inner room.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 31
text: Then his servants said to him, It is said that the kings of Israel are full of mercy: let us then put on haircloth, and cords on our heads, and go to the king of Israel; it may be that he will give you your life.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 32
text: So they put on haircloth, and cords on their heads, and came to the king of Israel and said, Your servant Ben-hadad says, Let me now keep my life. And he said, Is he still living? he is my brother.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 33
text: Now the men took it as a sign, and quickly took up his words; and they said, Ben-hadad is your brother. Then he said, Go and get him. So Ben-hadad came out to him and he made him get up into his carriage.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 34
text: And Ben-hadad said to him, The towns my father took from your father I will give back; and you may make streets for yourself in Damascus as my father did in Samaria. And as for me, at the price of this agreement you will let me go. So he made an agreement with him and let him go.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 35
text: And a certain man of the sons of the prophets said to his neighbour by the word of the Lord, Give me a wound. But the man would not.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 36
text: Then he said to him, Because you have not given ear to the voice of the Lord, straight away when you have gone from me a lion will put you to death. And when he had gone, straight away a lion came rushing at him and put him to death.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 37
text: Then he came across another man, and said, Give me a wound. And the man gave him a blow wounding him.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 38
text: So the prophet went away, and pulling his head-band over his eyes to keep his face covered, took his place by the road waiting for the king.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 39
text: And when the king went by, crying out to him he said, Your servant went out into the fight; and a man came out to me with another man and said, Keep this man: if by any chance he gets away, your life will be the price of his life, or you will have to give a talent of silver in payment.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 40
text: But while your servant was turning this way and that, he was gone. Then the king of Israel said to him, You are responsible; you have given the decision against yourself.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 41
text: Then he quickly took the head-band from his eyes; and the king of Israel saw that he was one of the prophets.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 42
text: And he said to him, These are the words of the Lord: Because you have let go from your hands the man whom I had put to the curse, your life will be taken for his life, and your people for his people.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 43
text: Then the king of Israel went back to his house, bitter and angry, and came to Samaria.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: Now Naboth the Jezreelite had a vine-garden in Jezreel, near the house of Ahab, king of Samaria.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: And Ahab said to Naboth, Give me your vine-garden so that I may have it for a garden of sweet plants, for it is near my house; and let me give you a better vine-garden in exchange, or, if it seems good to you, let me give you its value in money.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: But Naboth said to Ahab, By the Lord, far be it from me to give you the heritage of my fathers.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: So Ahab came into his house bitter and angry because Naboth the Jezreelite had said to him, I will not give you the heritage of my fathers. And stretching himself on the bed with his face turned away, he would take no food.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: But Jezebel, his wife, came to him and said, Why is your spirit so bitter that you have no desire for food?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: And he said to her, Because I was talking to Naboth the Jezreelite, and I said to him, Let me have your vine-garden for a price, or, if it is pleasing to you, I will give you another vine-garden for it: and he said, I will not give you my vine-garden.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: Then Jezebel, his wife, said, Are you now the ruler of Israel? Get up, take food, and let your heart be glad; I will give you the vine-garden of Naboth the Jezreelite.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: So she sent a letter in Ahab's name, stamped with his stamp, to the responsible men and the chiefs who were in authority with Naboth.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: And in the letter she said, Let a time of public sorrow be fixed, and put Naboth at the head of the people;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: And get two good-for-nothing persons to come before him and give witness that he has been cursing God and the king. Then take him out and have him stoned to death.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: So the responsible men and the chiefs who were in authority in his town, did as Jezebel had said in the letter she sent them.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: They gave orders for a day of public sorrow, and put Naboth at the head of the people.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: And the two good-for-nothing persons came in and took their seats before him and gave witness against Naboth, in front of the people, saying, Naboth has been cursing God and the king. Then they took him outside the town and had him stoned to death.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: And they sent word to Jezebel, saying, Naboth has been stoned and is dead.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: Then Jezebel, hearing that Naboth had been stoned and was dead, said to Ahab, Get up and take as your heritage the vine-garden of Naboth the Jezreelite, which he would not give you for money, for Naboth is no longer living but is dead.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: So Ahab, hearing that Naboth was dead, went down to the vine-garden of Naboth the Jezreelite to take it as his heritage.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: And the word of the Lord came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: Go down to Ahab, king of Israel, in Samaria; see, he is in the vine-garden of Naboth the Jezreelite, where he has gone to take it as his heritage.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: Say to him, The Lord says, Have you put a man to death and taken his heritage? Then say to him, The Lord says, In the place where dogs have been drinking the blood of Naboth, there will your blood become the drink of dogs.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: And Ahab said to Elijah, Have you come face to face with me, O my hater? And he said, I have come to you because you have given yourself up to do evil in the eyes of the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: See, I will send evil on you and put an end to you completely, cutting off from Ahab every male child, him who is shut up and him who goes free in Israel;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: And I will make your family like the family of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, and like the family of Baasha, the son of Ahijah, because you have made me angry, and have made Israel do evil.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: And of Jezebel the Lord said, Jezebel will become food for dogs in the heritage of Jezreel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: Any man of the family of Ahab who comes to his death in the town will become food for the dogs; and he who comes to his death in the open country will be food for the birds of the air.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: (There was no one like Ahab, who gave himself up to do evil in the eyes of the Lord, moved to it by Jezebel his wife.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 26
text: He did a very disgusting thing in going after false gods, doing all the things the Amorites did, whom the Lord sent out before the children of Israel.)

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 27
text: Hearing these words, Ahab, in great grief, put haircloth on his flesh and went without food, sleeping in haircloth, and going about quietly.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 28
text: Then the word of the Lord came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,

title: 1 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 29
text: Do you see how Ahab has made himself low before me? because he has made himself low before me, I will not send the evil in his life-time, but in his son's time I will send the evil on his family.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: Now for three years there was no war between Aram and Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: And it came about in the third year, that Jehoshaphat, king of Judah, came down to the king of Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: And the king of Israel said to his servants, Do you not see that Ramoth-gilead is ours? and we are doing nothing to get it back from the hands of the king of Aram.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: And he said to Jehoshaphat, Will you go with me to Ramoth-gilead to make war? And Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, I am as you are: my people as your people, my horses as your horses.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: Then Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, Let us now get directions from the Lord.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: So the king of Israel got all the prophets together, about four hundred men, and said to them, Am I to go to Ramoth-gilead to make war or not? And they said, Go up: for the Lord will give it into the hands of the king.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: But Jehoshaphat said, Is there no other prophet of the Lord here from whom we may get directions?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, There is still one man by whom we may get directions from the Lord, Micaiah, son of Imlah; but I have no love for him, for he is a prophet of evil to me and not of good. And Jehoshaphat said, Let not the king say so.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: Then the king of Israel sent for one of his unsexed servants and said, Go quickly and come back with Micaiah, the son of Imlah.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: Now the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, were seated on their seats of authority, dressed in their robes, by the doorway into Samaria; and all the prophets were acting as prophets before them.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: And Zedekiah, the son of Chenaanah, made himself horns of iron and said, The Lord says, Pushing back the Aramaeans with these, you will put an end to them completely.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: And all the prophets said the same thing, saying, Go up to Ramoth-gilead, and it will go well for you, for the Lord will give it into the hands of the king.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: Now the servant who had gone to get Micaiah said to him, See now, all the prophets with one voice are saying good things to the king; so let your words be like theirs and say good things.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: And Micaiah said, By the living Lord, whatever the Lord says to me I will say.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: When he came to the king, the king said to him, Micaiah, are we to go to Ramoth-gilead to make war or not? And in answer he said, Go up, and it will go well for you; and the Lord will give it into the hands of the king.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: Then the king said to him, Have I not, again and again, put you on your oath to say nothing to me but what is true in the name of the Lord?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: Then he said, I saw all Israel wandering on the mountains like sheep without a keeper; and the Lord said, These have no master: let them go back, every man to his house in peace.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, Did I not say that he would not be a prophet of good but of evil?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: And he said, Give ear now to the word of the Lord: I saw the Lord seated on his seat of power, with all the army of heaven in their places round him at his right hand and at his left.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: And the Lord said, How may Ahab be tricked into going up to Ramoth-gilead to his death? And one said one thing and one another.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: Then a spirit came forward and took his place before the Lord and said, I will get him to do it by a trick.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: And the Lord said, How? And he said, I will go out and be a spirit of deceit in the mouth of all his prophets. And he said, Your trick will have its effect on him: go out and do so.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: And now, see, the Lord has put a spirit of deceit in the mouth of all these your prophets; and the Lord has said evil against you.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: Then Zedekiah, the son of Chenaanah, came near and gave Micaiah a blow on the side of the face, saying, Where is the spirit of the Lord whose word is in you?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 25
text: And Micaiah said, Truly, you will see on that day when you go into an inner room to keep yourself safe.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 26
text: And the king of Israel said, Take Micaiah and send him back to Amon, the ruler of the town, and to Joash, the king's son;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 27
text: And say, It is the king's order that this man is to be put in prison and given prison food till I come again in peace.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 28
text: And Micaiah said, If you come back at all in peace, the Lord has not sent his word by me.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 29
text: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, went up to Ramoth-gilead.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 30
text: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, I will make a change in my clothing, so that I do not seem to be the king, and will go into the fight; but do you put on your robes. So the king of Israel made a change in his dress and went into the fight.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 31
text: Now the king of Aram had given orders to the thirty-two captains of his war-carriages, saying, Make no attack on small or great, but only on the king of Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 32
text: So when the captains of the war-carriages saw Jehoshaphat, they said, Truly, this is the king of Israel; and turning against him, they came round him, but Jehoshaphat gave a cry.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 33
text: And when the captains of the war-carriages saw that he was not the king of Israel, they went back from going after him.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 34
text: And a certain man sent an arrow from his bow without thought of its direction, and gave the king of Israel a wound where his breastplate was joined to his clothing; so he said to the driver of his war-carriage, Go to one side and take me away out of the army, for I am badly wounded.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 35
text: But the fight became more violent while the day went on; and the king was supported in his war-carriage facing the Aramaeans, and the floor of the carriage was covered with the blood from his wound, and by evening he was dead.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 36
text: And about sundown a cry went up from all parts of the army, saying, Let every man go back to his town and his country, for the king is dead.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 37
text: And they came to Samaria, and put the king's body to rest in Samaria.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 38
text: And the war-carriage was washed by the pool of Samaria, which was the bathing-place of the loose women, and the dogs were drinking his blood there, as the Lord had said.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 39
text: Now the rest of the acts of Ahab, and all he did, and his ivory house, and all the towns of which he was the builder, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Israel?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 40
text: So Ahab was put to rest with his fathers; and Ahaziah his son became king in his place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 41
text: And Jehoshaphat, the son of Asa, became king over Judah in the fourth year of Ahab's rule over Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 42
text: Jehoshaphat was thirty-five years old when he became king, and he was king for twenty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Azubah, the daughter of Shilhi.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 43
text: He did as Asa his father had done, not turning away from it, but doing what was right in the eyes of the Lord; but the high places were not taken away: the people went on making offerings and burning them in the high places.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 44
text: And Jehoshaphat made peace with the king of Israel.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 45
text: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, and his great power, and how he went to war, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Judah?

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 46
text: He put an end to the rest of those who were used for sex purposes in the worship of the gods, all those who were still in the land in the time of his father Asa.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 47
text: At that time there was no king in Edom;

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 48
text: And the representative of King Jehoshaphat made a Tarshish-ship to go to Ophir for gold, but it did not go, because it was broken at Ezion-geber.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 49
text: Then Ahaziah, the son of Ahab, said to Jehoshaphat, Let my men go with yours in the ships. But Jehoshaphat would not let them.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 50
text: Then Jehoshaphat went to rest with his fathers, and his body was put into the earth in the town of David his father; and Jehoram his son became king in his place.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 51
text: Ahaziah, the son of Ahab, became king over Israel in Samaria in the seventeenth year of the rule of Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, and he was king over Israel for two years.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 52
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, going in the ways of his father and his mother, and in the ways of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, who made Israel do evil.

title: 1 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 53
text: He was a servant and worshipper of Baal, moving the Lord, the God of Israel, to wrath, as his father had done.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: After the death of Ahab, Moab made itself free from the authority of Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Now Ahaziah had a fall from the window of his room in Samaria, and was ill. And he sent men, and said to them, Put a question to Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron, about the outcome of my disease, to see if I will get well or not.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: But the angel of the Lord said to Elijah the Tishbite, Go now, and, meeting the men sent by the king of Samaria, say to them, Is it because there is no God in Israel, that you are going to get directions from Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Give ear then to the words of the Lord: You will never again get down from the bed on to which you have gone up, but death will certainly come to you. Then Elijah went away.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And the men he had sent came back to the king; and he said to them, Why have you come back?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And they said to him, On our way we had a meeting with a man who said, Go back to the king who sent you and say to him, The Lord says, Is it because there is no God in Israel that you send to put a question to Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron? For this reason, you will not come down from the bed on to which you have gone up, but death will certainly come to you.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And he said to them, What sort of a man was it who came and said these words to you?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And they said in answer, He was a man clothed in a coat of hair, with a leather band about his body. Then he said, It is Elijah the Tishbite.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: Then the king sent to him a captain of fifty with his fifty men; and he went up to him where he was seated on the top of a hill, and said to him, O man of God, the king has said, Come down.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And Elijah in answer said to the captain of fifty, If I am a man of God, may fire come down from heaven on you and on your fifty men, and put an end to you. Then fire came down from heaven and put an end to him and his fifty men.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Then the king sent another captain of fifty with his fifty men; and he said to Elijah, O man of God, the king says, Come down quickly.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And Elijah in answer said, If I am a man of God, may fire come down from heaven on you and on your fifty men, and put an end to you. And the fire of God came down from heaven, and put an end to him and his fifty men.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Then he sent a third captain of fifty with his fifty men; and the third captain of fifty went up, and falling on his knees before Elijah, requesting mercy of him, said, O man of God, let my life and the life of these your fifty servants be of value to you.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: For fire came down from heaven and put an end to the first two captains of fifty and their fifties; but now let my life be of value in your eyes.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: Then the angel of the Lord said to Elijah, Go down with him; have no fear of him. So he got up and went down with him to the king.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And he said to him, This is the word of the Lord: Because you sent men to put a question to Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron, for this reason you will never again get down from the bed on to which you have gone up, but death will certainly come to you.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: So death came to him, as the Lord had said by the mouth of Elijah. And Jehoram became king in his place in the second year of the rule of Jehoram, son of Jehoshaphat, king of Judah; because he had no son.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: Now the rest of the acts of Ahaziah, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Israel?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Now when the Lord was about to take Elijah up to heaven in a great wind, Elijah went with Elisha from Gilgal.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And Elijah said to Elisha, Come no farther for the Lord has sent me to Beth-el. But Elisha said, As the Lord is living and as your soul is living, I will not be parted from you. So they went down to Beth-el.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And at Beth-el the sons of the prophets came out to Elisha and said, Has it been made clear to you that the Lord is going to take away your master from over you today? And he said, Yes, I have knowledge of it: say no more.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: Then Elijah said to him, Come no farther, for the Lord has sent me to Jericho. But he said, As the Lord is living and as your soul is living, I will not be parted from you. So they went on to Jericho.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: And at Jericho the sons of the prophets came up to Elisha and said to him, Has it been made clear to you that the Lord is going to take away your master from over you today? And he said in answer, Yes, I have knowledge of it: say no more.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: Then Elijah said to him, Come no farther, for the Lord has sent me to Jordan. But he said, As the Lord is living and as your soul is living, I will not be parted from you. So they went on together.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And fifty men of the sons of the prophets went out and took their places facing them a long way off, while the two of them were by the edge of Jordan.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: Then Elijah took off his robe, and, rolling it up, gave the water a blow with it, and the waters were parted, flowing back this way and that, so that they went over on dry land.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And when they had come to the other side, Elijah said to Elisha, Say what you would have me do for you before I am taken from you. And Elisha said, Be pleased to let a special measure of your spirit be on me.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And he said, You have made a hard request: still, if you see me when I am taken from you, you will get your desire; but if not, it will not be so.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And while they went on their way, going on talking together, suddenly there were carriages and horses of fire separating them from one another and Elijah went up to heaven in a great wind.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And when Elisha saw it he gave a cry, My father, my father, the carriages of Israel and its horsemen! And he saw him no longer; and he was full of grief.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: Then he took up Elijah's robe, which had been dropped from him, and went back till he came to the edge of Jordan.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And he took Elijah's robe, which had been dropped from him, and giving the water a blow with it, said, Where is the Lord, the God of Elijah? and at his blow the waters were parted this way and that; and Elisha went over.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And when the sons of the prophets who were facing him at Jericho saw him, they said, The spirit of Elijah is resting on Elisha. And they came out to him, and went down on the earth before him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And they said, Your servants have with us here fifty strong men; be pleased to let them go in search of Elijah; for it may be that the spirit of the Lord has taken him up and put him down on some mountain or in some valley. But he said, Do not send them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: But when they kept on requesting him, he was shamed and said, Send, then. So they sent fifty men; but after searching for three days, they came back without having seen him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And they came back to him, while he was still at Jericho; and he said to them, Did I not say to you, Go not?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: Now the men of the town said to Elisha, You see that the position of this town is good; but the water is bad, causing the young of the cattle to come to birth dead.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: So he said, Get me a new vessel, and put salt in it; and they took it to him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: Then he went out to the spring from which the water came, and put salt in it, and said, The Lord says, Now I have made this water sweet; no longer will it be death-giving or unfertile.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: And the water was made sweet again to this day, as Elisha said.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: Then from there he went up to Beth-el; and on his way, some little boys came out from the town and made sport of him, crying, Go up, old no-hair! go up, old no-hair!

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: And turning back, he saw them, and put a curse on them in the name of the Lord. And two she-bears came out of the wood and put forty-two of the children to death.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: From there he went to Mount Carmel, and came back from there to Samaria.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: And Jehoram, the son of Ahab, became king over Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of the rule of Jehoshaphat, king of Judah; and he was king for twelve years.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord; but not like his father and his mother, for he put away the stone pillar of Baal which his father had made.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: But still he did the same sins which Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, did and made Israel do; he went on in them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: Now Mesha, king of Moab, was a sheep-farmer; and he gave regularly to the king of Israel the wool from a hundred thousand lambs and a hundred thousand sheep.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: But when Ahab was dead, the king of Moab got free from the authority of the king of Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: At that time, King Jehoram went out from Samaria and got all Israel together in fighting order.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And he sent to Jehoshaphat, king of Judah, saying, The king of Moab has got free from my authority: will you go with me to make war on Moab? And he said, I will go with you: I am as you are, my people as your people, and my horses as your horses.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And he said, Which way are we to go? And he said in answer, By the waste land of Edom.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: So the king of Israel went with the king of Judah and the king of Edom by a roundabout way for seven days: and there was no water for the army or for the beasts they had with them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And the king of Israel said, Here is trouble: for the Lord has got these three kings together to give them into the hands of Moab.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: But Jehoshaphat said, Is there no prophet of the Lord here, through whom we may get directions from the Lord? And one of the king of Israel's men said in answer, Elisha, the son of Shaphat, is here, who was servant to Elijah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: And Jehoshaphat said, The word of the Lord is with him. So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat and the king of Edom went down to him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: But Elisha said to the king of Israel, What have I to do with you? go to the prophets of your father and your mother. And the king of Israel said, No; for the Lord has got these three kings together to give them up into the hands of Moab.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: Then Elisha said, By the life of the Lord of armies whose servant I am, if it was not for the respect I have for Jehoshaphat, king of Judah, I would not give a look at you, or see you.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: But now, get me a player of music, and it will come about that while the man is playing, the hand of the Lord will come on me and I will give you the word of the Lord: and they got a player of music, and while the man was playing, the hand of the Lord was on him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: And he said, The Lord says, I will make this valley full of water-holes.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: For the Lord says, Though you see no wind or rain, the valley will be full of water, and you and your armies and your beasts will have drink.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: And this will be only a small thing to the Lord: in addition he will give the Moabites into your hands.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: And you are to put every walled town to destruction, cutting down every good tree, and stopping up every water-spring, and making all the good land rough with stones.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: Now in the morning, about the time when the offering was made, they saw water flowing from the direction of Edom till the country was full of water.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: Now all Moab, hearing that the kings had come to make war against them, got together all who were able to take up arms and went forward to the edge of the country.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: And early in the morning they got up, when the sun was shining on the water, and they saw the water facing them as red as blood.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: Then they said, This is blood: it is clear that destruction has come on the kings; they have been fighting one another: now come, Moab, let us take their goods.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: But when they came to the tents of Israel, the Israelites came out and made a violent attack on the Moabites, so that they went in flight before them; and they went forward still attacking them;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: Pulling down the towns, covering every good field with stones, stopping up all the water-springs, and cutting down all the good trees; they went on driving Moab before them till only in Kir-hareseth were there any Moabites; and the fighting-men went round the town raining stones on it.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: And when the king of Moab saw that the fight was going against him, he took with him seven hundred men armed with swords, with the idea of forcing a way through to the king of Aram, but they were not able to do so.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 3 Verse 27
text: Then he took his oldest son, who would have been king after him, offering him as a burned offering on the wall. So there was great wrath against Israel; and they went away from him, back to their country.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Now a certain woman, the wife of one of the sons of the prophets, came crying to Elisha and said, Your servant my husband is dead; and to your knowledge he was a worshipper of the Lord; but now, the creditor has come to take my two children as servants in payment of his debt.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: Then Elisha said to her, What am I to do for you? say now, what have you in the house? And she said, Your servant has nothing in the house but a pot of oil.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: Then he said, Go out to all your neighbours and get vessels, a very great number of them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Then go in, and, shutting the door on yourself and your sons, put oil into all these vessels, putting on one side the full ones.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: So she went away, and when the door was shut on her and her sons, they took the vessels to her and she put oil into them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And when all the vessels were full, she said to her son, Get me another vessel. And he said, There are no more. And the flow of oil was stopped.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: So she came to the man of God and gave him word of what she had done. And he said, Go and get money for the oil and make payment of your debt, and let the rest be for the needs of yourself and your sons.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: Now there came a day when Elisha went to Shunem, and there was a woman of high position living there, who made him come in and have a meal with her. And after that, every time he went by, he went into her house for a meal.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And she said to her husband, Now I see that this is a holy man of God, who comes by day after day.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 10
