text: So let us make a little room on the wall; and put a bed there for him, and a table and a seat and a light; so that when he comes to us, he will be able to go in there.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: Now one day, when he had gone there, he went into the little room and took his rest there.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And he said to Gehazi, his servant, Send for this Shunammite. So in answer to his voice she came before him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And he said to him, Now say to her, See, you have taken all this trouble for us; what is to be done for you? will you have any request made for you to the king or the captain of the army? But she said, I am living among my people.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: So he said, What then is to be done for her? And Gehazi made answer, Still there is this, she has no son and her husband is old.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: Then he said, Send for her. And in answer to his voice she took her place at the door.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: And Elisha said, At this time in the coming year you will have a son in your arms. And she said, No, my lord, O man of God, do not say what is false to your servant.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: Then the woman became with child and gave birth to a son at the time named, in the year after, as Elisha had said to her.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: Now one day, when the child was older, he went out to his father to where the grain was being cut.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: And he said to his father, My head, my head! And the father said to a servant, Take him in to his mother.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: And he took him in to his mother, and she took him on her knees and kept him there till the middle of the day, when his life went from him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: Then she went up and put him on the bed of the man of God, shutting the door on him, and went out.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: And she said to her husband, Send me one of the servants and one of the asses so that I may go quickly to the man of God and come back again.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: And he said, Why are you going to him today? it is not a new moon or a Sabbath. But she said, It is well.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: Then she made the ass ready and said to her servant, Keep driving on; do not make a stop without orders from me.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: So she went, and came to Mount Carmel, to the man of God. And when the man of God saw her coming in his direction, he said to Gehazi, his servant, See, there is the Shunammite;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: Go quickly to her, and on meeting her say to her, Are you well? and your husband and the child, are they well? And she said in answer, All is well.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 27
text: And when she came to where the man of God was on the hill, she put her hands round his feet; and Gehazi came near with the purpose of pushing her away; but the man of God said, Let her be, for her soul is bitter in her; and the Lord has kept it secret from me, and has not given me word of it.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 28
text: Then she said, Did I make a request to my lord for a son? did I not say, Do not give me false words?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 29
text: Then he said to Gehazi, Make yourself ready, and take my stick in your hand, and go: if you come across anyone on the way, give him no blessing, and if anyone gives you a blessing, give him no answer. And put my stick on the child's face.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 30
text: But the mother of the child said, As the Lord is living and as your soul is living, I will not go back without you. So he got up and went with her.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 31
text: And Gehazi went on before them and put the stick on the child's face; but there was no voice, and no one gave attention. So he went back, and meeting him gave him the news, saying, The child is not awake.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 32
text: And when Elisha came into the house he saw the child dead, stretched on his bed.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 33
text: So he went in, and shutting the door on the two of them, made prayer to the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 34
text: Then he got up on the bed, stretching himself out on the child, and put his mouth on the child's mouth, his eyes on his eyes and his hands on his hands; and the child's body became warm.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 35
text: Then he came back, and after walking once through the house and back, he went up, stretching himself out on the child seven times; and the child's eyes became open.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 36
text: And he gave orders to Gehazi, and said, Send for the Shunammite. And she came in answer to his voice. And he said, Take up your son.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 37
text: And she came in, and went down on her face to the earth at his feet; then she took her son in her arms and went out.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 38
text: And Elisha went back to Gilgal, now there was very little food in the land; and the sons of the prophets were seated before him. And he said to his servant, Put the great pot on the fire, and make soup for the sons of the prophets.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 39
text: And one went out into the field to get green plants and saw a vine of the field, and pulling off the fruit of it till the fold of his robe was full, he came back and put the fruit, cut up small, into the pot of soup, having no idea what it was.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 40
text: Then they gave the men soup from the pot. And while they were drinking the soup, they gave a cry, and said, O man of God, there is death in the pot; and they were not able to take any more food.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 41
text: But he said, Get some meal. And he put it into the pot, and said, Now give it to the people so that they may have food. And there was nothing bad in the pot.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 42
text: Now a man came from Baal-shalishah with an offering of first-fruits for the man of God, twenty barley cakes and garden fruit in his bag. And he said, Give these to the people for food.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 43
text: But his servant said, How am I to put this before a hundred men? But he said, Give it to the people for food; for the Lord says, There will be food for them and some over.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 4 Verse 44
text: So he put it before them, and they had a meal and there was more than enough, as the Lord had said.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Now Naaman, chief of the army of the king of Aram, was a man of high position with his master, and greatly respected, because by him the Lord had given salvation to Aram; but he was a leper.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: Now the Aramaeans had gone out in bands, and taken prisoner from Israel a little girl, who became servant to Naaman's wife.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: And she said to her master's wife, If only my lord would go to the prophet in Samaria, he would make him well.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: And someone went and said to his lord, This is what the girl from the land of Israel says.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: So the king of Aram said, Go then; and I will send a letter to the king of Israel. And he went, taking with him ten talents of silver and six thousand shekels of gold, and ten changes of clothing.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And he took the letter to the king of Israel, in which the king of Aram had said, See, I have sent my servant Naaman to you to be made well, for he is a leper.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: But the king of Israel, after reading the letter, was greatly troubled and said, Am I God, to give death and life? why does this man send a leper to me to be made well? is it not clear that he is looking for a cause of war?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: Now Elisha, the man of God, hearing that the king of Israel had done this, sent to the king, saying, Why are you troubled? send the man to me, so that he may see that there is a prophet in Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: So Naaman, with all his horses and his carriages, came to the door of Elisha's house.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And Elisha sent a servant to him, saying, Go to Jordan, and after washing seven times in its waters your flesh will be well again and you will be clean.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: But Naaman was angry and went away and said, I had the idea that he would come out to see such an important person as I am, and make prayer to the Lord his God, and with a wave of his hand over the place make the leper well.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: Are not Abana and Pharpar, rivers of Damascus, better than all the waters of Israel? may I not be washed in them and become clean? So turning, he went away in wrath.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: Then his servants came to him and said, If the prophet had given you orders to do some great thing, would you not have done it? how much more then, when he says to you, Be washed and become clean?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: Then he went down seven times into the waters of Jordan, as the man of God had said; and his flesh became like the flesh of a little child again, and he was clean.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: Then he went back to the man of God, with all his train, and, taking his place before him, said, Now I am certain that there is no God in all the earth, but only in Israel: now then, take an offering from me.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: But he said, By the life of the Lord whose servant I am, I will take nothing from you. And he did his best to make him take it but he would not.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: Then Naaman said, If you will not, then let there be given to your servant as much earth as two beasts are able to take on their backs; because from now on, your servant will make no offering or burned offering to other gods, but only to the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: But may your servant have the Lord's forgiveness for this one thing: when my master goes into the house of Rimmon for worship there, supported on my arm, and my head is bent in the house of Rimmon; when his head is bent in the house of Rimmon, may your servant have the Lord's forgiveness for this thing.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: And he said to him, Go in peace. And he went from him some distance.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: But Gehazi, the servant of Elisha, the man of God, said, Now my master has taken nothing from Naaman, this Aramaean, of what he would have given him: by the living Lord, I will go after him and get something from him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: So Gehazi went after Naaman. And when Naaman saw him running after him, he got down from his carriage and went back to him and said, Is all well?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: And he said, All is well: but my master has sent me, saying, Even now, two young men of the sons of the prophets have come to me from the hill-country of Ephraim; will you give me a talent of silver and two changes of clothing for them?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: And Naaman said, Be good enough to take two talents. And forcing him to take them, he put two talents of silver in two bags, with two changes of clothing, and gave them to his two servants to take before him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: When he came to the hill, he took them from their hands, and put them away in the house; and he sent the men away, and they went.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: Then he came in and took his place before his master. And Elisha said to him, Where have you come from, Gehazi? And he said, Your servant went nowhere.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: And he said to him, Did not my heart go with you, when the man got down from his carriage and went back to you? Is this a time for getting money, and clothing, and olive-gardens and vine-gardens, and sheep and oxen, and men-servants and women-servants?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: Because of what you have done, the disease of Naaman the leper will take you in its grip, and your seed after you, for ever. And he went out from before him a leper as white as snow.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Now the sons of the prophets said to Elisha, There is not room enough for us in the place where we are living under your care;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: So let us go to Jordan, and let everyone get to work cutting boards, and we will make a living-place for ourselves there. And he said to them, Go, then.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: And one of them said, Be pleased to go with your servants. And he said, I will go.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: So he went with them. And when they came to Jordan, they got to work cutting down trees.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: But one of them, while cutting a board, let the head of his axe go into the water; and he gave a cry, and said, This is a bad business, my master, for it is another's.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: And the man of God said, Where did it go in? and when he saw the place where it had gone into the water, cutting a stick, he put it into the water, and the iron came up to the top of the water.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: Then he said, Take it up. So he put out his hand and took it.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: At that time the king of Aram was making war against Israel; and he had a meeting with the chiefs of his army and said, I will be waiting in secret in some named place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: And the man of God sent to the king of Israel, saying, Take care to keep away from that place, for the Aramaeans are waiting there in secret.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: So the king of Israel sent to the place where the man of God had said there was danger, and kept clear of it more than once.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And at this, the mind of the king of Aram was greatly troubled, and he sent for his servants and said to them, Will you not make clear to me which of us is helping the king of Israel?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And one of them said, Not one of us, my lord king; but Elisha, the prophet in Israel, gives the king of Israel news of the words you say even in your bedroom.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: Then he said, Go and see where he is, so that I may send and get him. And news came to him that he was in Dothan.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: So he sent there horses and carriages and a great army; and they came by night, circling the town.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: Now the servant of the man of God, having got up early and gone out, saw an army with horses and carriages of war all round the town. And the servant said to him, O my master, what are we to do?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: And he said in answer, Have no fear; those who are with us are more than those who are with them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: Then Elisha made a prayer to the Lord, saying, Lord, let his eyes be open so that he may see. And the Lord made the young man's eyes open; and he saw that all the mountain was full of horses and carriages of fire round Elisha.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: Now when the Aramaeans came down to Elisha, he made a prayer to the Lord saying, Lord, make this people blind. And he made them blind at Elisha's request.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: And Elisha said to them, This is not the way, and this is not the town: come after me so that I may take you to the man you are searching for. And he took them to Samaria.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: And when they had come into Samaria, Elisha said, Lord, let the eyes of these men be open so that they may see. And the Lord made their eyes open, and they saw that they were in the middle of Samaria.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: And the king of Israel, when he saw them, said to Elisha, My father, am I to put them to the sword?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: But he said in answer, You are not to put them to death; have you any right to put to death those whom you have not taken prisoner with your sword and your bow? put bread and water before them, so that they may have food and drink and go to their master.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: So he made ready a great feast for them, and when they had had food and drink, he sent them away and they went back to their master. And no more bands of Aramaeans came into the land of Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: Now after this, Ben-hadad, king of Aram, got together all his army and went up to make an attack on Samaria, shutting the town in on all sides with his forces.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: And they became very short of food in Samaria; for they kept it shut in till the price of an ass's head was eighty shekels of silver, and a small measure of doves' droppings was five shekels of silver.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: And when the king of Israel was going by on the wall, a woman came crying out to him, and said, Help! my lord king.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: And he said, If the Lord does not give you help, where am I to get help for you? from the grain-floor or the grape-crusher?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 28
text: And the king said to her, What is troubling you? And she said in answer, This woman said to me, Give your son to be our food today, and we will have my son tomorrow.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 29
text: So, boiling my son, we had a meal of him; and on the day after I said to her, Now give your son for our food; but she has put her son in a secret place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 30
text: Then the king, hearing what the woman said, took his robes in his hands, violently parting them; and, while he was walking on the wall, the people, looking, saw that under his robe he had haircloth on his flesh.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 31
text: Then he said, May God's punishment come on me if Elisha, the son of Shaphat, keeps his head on his body after this day.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 32
text: But Elisha was in his house, and the responsible men were seated there with him; and before the king got there, Elisha said to those who were with him, Do you see how this cruel and violent man has sent to take away my life?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 6 Verse 33
text: While he was still talking to them, the king came down and said, This evil is from the Lord; why am I to go on waiting any longer for the Lord?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: Then Elisha said, Give ear to the word of the Lord: the Lord says, Tomorrow, about this time, a measure of good meal will be offered for the price of a shekel and two measures of barley for a shekel, in the market-place of Samaria.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: Then the captain whose arm was supporting the king said to the man of God, Even if the Lord made windows in heaven, would such a thing be possible? And he said, Your eyes will see it, but you will not have a taste of the food.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Now there were four lepers seated at the doorway into the town: and they said to one another, Why are we waiting here for death?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: If we say, We will go into the town, there is no food in the town, and we will come to our end there; and if we go on waiting here, death will come to us. Come then, let us give ourselves up to the army of Aram: if they let us go on living, then life will be ours; and if they put us to death, then death will be ours.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: So in the half light they got up to go to the tents of Aram; but when they came to the outer line of tents, there was no one there.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: For the Lord had made the sound of carriages and horses, and the noise of a great army, come to the ears of the Aramaeans, so that they said to one another, Truly, the king of Israel has got the kings of the Hittites and of the Egyptians for a price to make an attack on us.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: So they got up and went in flight, in the half light, without their tents or their horses or their asses or any of their goods; they went in flight, fearing for their lives.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: And when those lepers came to the outer line of tents, they went into one tent, and had food and drink, and took from it silver and gold and clothing, which they put in a secret place; then they came back and went into another tent from which they took more goods, which they put away in a secret place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: Then they said to one another, We are not doing right. Today is a day of good news, and we say nothing: if we go on waiting here till the morning, punishment will come to us. So let us go and give the news to those of the king's house.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: So they came in, and, crying out to the door-keepers of the town, they gave them the news, saying, We came to the tents of the Aramaeans, and there was no one there and no voice of man, only the horses and the asses in their places, and the tents as they were.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: Then the door-keepers, crying out, gave the news to those inside the king's house.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: Then the king got up in the night and said to his servants, This is my idea of what the Aramaeans have done to us. They have knowledge that we are without food; and so they have gone out of their tents, and are waiting secretly in the open country, saying, When they come out of the town, we will take them living and get into the town.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: And one of his servants said in answer, Send men and let them take five of the horses which we still have in the town; if they keep their lives they will be the same as those of Israel who are still living here; if they come to their death they will be the same as all those of Israel who have gone to destruction: let us send and see.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: So they took two horsemen; and the king sent them after the army of the Aramaeans, saying, Go and see.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: And they went after them as far as Jordan; and all the road was covered with clothing and vessels dropped by the Aramaeans in their flight. So those who were sent went back and gave the news to the king.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: Then the people went out and took the goods from the tents of the Aramaeans. So a measure of good meal was to be had for the price of a shekel, and two measures of barley for a shekel, as the Lord had said.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: And the king gave authority to that captain, on whose arm he was supported, to have control over the doorway into the town; but he was crushed to death there under the feet of the people, as the man of God had said when the king went down to him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: So the words of the man of God came true, which he said to the king: Two measures of barley will be offered for the price of a shekel and a measure of good meal for a shekel, tomorrow about this time in the market-place of Samaria.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: And that captain said to the man of God, Even if the Lord made windows in heaven, would such a thing be possible? And he said to him, Your eyes will see it, but you will not have a taste of the food.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: And such was his fate; for he was crushed to death under the feet of the people, in the doorway into the town.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: Now Elisha had said to the woman whose son he had given back to life, Go now, with all the people of your house, and get a living-place for yourselves wherever you are able; for by the word of the Lord, there will be great need of food in the land; and this will go on for seven years.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: So the woman got up and did as the man of God said; and she and the people of her house were living in the land of the Philistines for seven years.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And when the seven years were ended, the woman came back from the land of the Philistines and went to the king with a request for her house and her land.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: Now the king was talking with Gehazi, the servant of the man of God, saying, Now, give me an account of all the great things Elisha has done.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And while he was giving the king the story of how Elisha had given life to the dead, the woman whose son had come back to life came to the king with a request for her house and her land. And Gehazi said, My lord king, this is the woman and this is her son, whose life Elisha gave back to him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: And in answer to the king's questions, the woman gave him all the story. So the king gave orders to one of his unsexed servants, saying, Give her back all her property, and all the produce of her fields from the day when she went away from the land up till now.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And Elisha came to Damascus; and Ben-hadad, king of Aram, was ill; and they said to him, The man of God has come.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: Then the king said to Hazael, Take an offering with you, and go to see the man of God and get directions from the Lord by him, saying, Am I going to get better from my disease?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: So Hazael went to see him, taking with him forty camels with offerings on their backs of every sort of good thing from Damascus; and when he came before him, he said, Your son Ben-hadad, king of Aram, has sent me to you, saying, Will I get better from this disease?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And Elisha said to him, Go, say to him, You will certainly get better; but the Lord has made it clear to me that only death is before him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And he kept his eyes fixed on him till he was shamed, and the man of God was overcome with weeping.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And Hazael said, Why is my lord weeping? Then he said in answer, Because I see the evil which you will do to the children of Israel: burning down their strong towns, putting their young men to death with the sword, smashing their little ones against the stones, and cutting open the women who are with child.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: And Hazael said, How is it possible that your servant, who is only a dog, will do this great thing? And Elisha said, The Lord has made it clear to me that you will be king over Aram.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: Then he went away from Elisha and came in to his master, who said to him, What did Elisha say to you? And his answer was, He said that you would certainly get well.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: Now on the day after, Hazael took the bed-cover, and making it wet with water, put it over Ben-hadad's face, causing his death: and Hazael became king in his place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: In the fifth year of Joram, the son of Ahab, king of Israel, Jehoram, the son of Jehoshaphat, king of Judah, became king.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: He was thirty-two years old when he became king; and he was ruling in Jerusalem for eight years.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: He went in the ways of the kings of Israel, as the family of Ahab did: for the daughter of Ahab was his wife; and he did evil in the eyes of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: But it was not the Lord's purpose to send destruction on Judah, because of David his servant, to whom he had given his word that he would have a light for ever.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: In his time, Edom made themselves free from the rule of Judah, and took a king for themselves.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: Then Joram went over to Zair, with all his war-carriages; ... made an attack by night on the Edomites, whose forces were all round him, ... the captains of the war-carriages; and the people went in flight to their tents.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: So Edom made themselves free from the rule of Judah to this day. And at the same time, Libnah made itself free.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: Now the rest of the acts of Joram, and all he did, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Judah?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: And Joram went to rest with his fathers and was put into the earth with his fathers in the town of David: and Ahaziah his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: In the twelfth year that Joram, the son of Ahab, was king of Israel, Ahaziah, the son of Jehoram, king of Judah, became king;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: Ahaziah was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he was ruling in Jerusalem for one year. His mother's name was Athaliah, the daughter of Omri, king of Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: He went in the ways of the family of Ahab, and did evil in the eyes of the Lord as the family of Ahab did, for he was a son-in-law of the family of Ahab.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: He went with Joram, the son of Ahab, to make war on Hazael, king of Aram, at Ramoth-gilead: and Joram was wounded by the Aramaeans.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: So King Joram went back to Jezreel to get well from the wounds which the bowmen had given him at Ramah, when he was fighting against Hazael, king of Aram. And Ahaziah, the son of Jehoram, king of Judah, went down to see Joram, the son of Ahab, in Jezreel, because he was ill.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: And Elisha the prophet sent for one of the sons of the prophets, and said to him, Make yourself ready for a journey, and take this bottle of oil in your hand, and go to Ramoth-gilead.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: And when you get there, go in search of Jehu, the son of Jehoshaphat, the son of Nimshi; and go in and make him get up from among his brothers, and take him to an inner room.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: Then take the bottle and put the oil on his head, and say, The Lord says, I have put the holy oil on you to make you king over Israel. Then, opening the door, go in flight, without waiting.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: So the young prophet went to Ramoth-gilead.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: And when he came, he saw the captains of the army seated together; and he said, I have something to say to you, O captain. And Jehu said, To which of us? And he said, To you, O captain.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: And he got up and went into the house; then he put the holy oil on his head and said to him, The Lord, the God of Israel, says, I have made you king over the people of the Lord, over Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: You are to see that the family of Ahab your master is cut off, so that I may take from Jezebel payment for the blood of my servants the prophets, and for the blood of all the servants of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: For the family of Ahab will come to an end; every male of Ahab's family will be cut off, he who is shut up and he who goes free in Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: I will make the family of Ahab like that of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, and Baasha, the son of Ahijah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And Jezebel will become food for the dogs in the heritage of Jezreel, and there will be no one to put her body into the earth. Then, opening the door, he went in flight.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: Then Jehu came out again to the servants of his lord, and one said to him, Is all well? why did this man, who is off his head, come to you? And he said to them, You have knowledge of the man and of his talk.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And they said, That is not true; now give us his story. Then he said, This is what he said to me: The Lord says, I have made you king over Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: Then straight away everyone took his robe and put it under him on the top of the steps, and, sounding the horn, they said, Jehu is king.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: So Jehu, the son of Jehoshaphat, the son of Nimshi, made designs against Joram. (Now Joram and all the army of Israel were keeping watch on Ramoth-gilead because of Hazael, king of Aram:

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: But King Joram had gone back to Jezreel to get well from the wounds which the Aramaeans had given him when he was fighting against Hazael, king of Aram.) And Jehu said, If this is your purpose, then let no one get away and go out of the town to give news of it in Jezreel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: So Jehu got into his carriage and went to Jezreel, for Joram was ill in bed there; and Ahaziah, king of Judah, had come down to see Joram.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: And the watchman on the tower in Jezreel saw Jehu and his band coming, and said, I see a band of people. And Joram said, Send out a horseman to them, and let him say, Is it peace?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: So a horseman went out to them and said, The king says, Is it peace? And Jehu said, What have you to do with peace? come after me. And the watchman gave them word, saying, The horseman went up to them, but has not come back.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: Then he sent out a second horseman, who came up to them and said, The king says, Is it peace? And Jehu said in answer, What have you to do with peace? come after me.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: And the watchman gave them word, saying, He went up to them and has not come back again; and the driving is like the driving of Jehu, son of Nimshi, for he is driving violently.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: Then Joram said, Make ready. So they made his carriage ready; and Joram, king of Israel, with Ahaziah, king of Judah, went out in their carriages for the purpose of meeting Jehu; and they came face to face with him at the field of Naboth the Jezreelite.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: Now when Joram saw Jehu he said, Is it peace, Jehu? And he said in answer, What peace is possible while all the land is full of the disgusting sins of your mother Jezebel, and her secret arts?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: Then Joram, turning his horses in flight, said to Ahaziah, Broken faith, O Ahaziah!

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: Then Jehu took his bow in his hand, and with all his strength sent an arrow, wounding Joram between the arms; and the arrow came out at his heart, and he went down on his face in his carriage.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: Then Jehu said to Bidkar, his captain, Take him up, and put him in the field of Naboth the Jezreelite: for is not that day in your memory when you and I together on our horses were going after Ahab, his father, and the Lord put this fate on him, saying:

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: I saw the blood of Naboth and of his sons yesterday; and I will give you full payment in this field, says the Lord? So now, take him and put him in this field, as the Lord said.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: Now when Ahaziah, king of Judah, saw this, he went in flight by the way of the garden house. And Jehu came after him and said, Put him to death in the same way; and they gave him a death-wound in his carriage, on the slope up to Gur, by Ibleam; and he went in flight to Megiddo, where death came to him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: And his servants took him in a carriage to Jerusalem, and put him into the earth with his fathers in the town of David.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 29
text: (In the eleventh year of the rule of Joram, the son of Ahab, Ahaziah became king over Judah.)

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 30
text: And when Jehu came to Jezreel, Jezebel had news of it; and, painting her eyes and dressing her hair with ornaments, she put her head out of the window.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 31
text: And when Jehu was coming into the town, she said, Is all well, O Zimri, taker of your master's life?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 32
text: Then, looking up to the window, he said, Who is on my side, who? and two or three unsexed servants put out their heads.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 33
text: And he said, Take her and put her out of the window. So they sent her down with force, and her blood went in a shower on the wall and on the horses; and she was crushed under their feet.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 34
text: And he came in, and took food and drink; then he said, Now see to this cursed woman, and put her body into the earth, for she is a king's daughter.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 35
text: And they went out to put her body into the earth, but nothing of her was to be seen, only the bones of her head, and her feet, and parts of her hands.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 36
text: So they came back and gave him word of it. And he said, This is what the Lord said by his servant Elijah the Tishbite, saying, In the heritage of Jezreel the flesh of Jezebel will become food for dogs;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 9 Verse 37
text: And the dead body of Jezebel will be like waste dropped on the face of the earth in the heritage of Jezreel; so that they will not be able to say, This is Jezebel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Now there were in Samaria seventy of Ahab's sons. And Jehu sent letters to Samaria, to the rulers of the town, and to the responsible men, and to those who had the care of the sons of Ahab, saying,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: Straight away, when you get this letter, seeing that your master's sons are with you, and that you have carriages and horses and a walled town and arms;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: Take the best and most upright of your master's sons, and make him king in his father's place, and put up a fight for your master's family.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: But they were full of fear, and said, The two kings have gone down before him: how may we keep our place?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: So the controller of the king's house, with the ruler of the town, and the responsible men, and those who had the care of Ahab's sons, sent to Jehu, saying, We are your servants and will do all your orders; we will not make any man king; do whatever seems best to you.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: Then he sent them a second letter, saying, If you are on my side, and if you will do my orders, come to me at Jezreel by this time tomorrow, with the heads of your master's sons. Now the king's seventy sons were with the great men of the town, who had the care of them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And when the letter came to them, they took the king's sons and put them to death, all the seventy, and put their heads in baskets and sent them to him at Jezreel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: And a man came and said to him, They have come with the heads of the king's sons. And he said, Put them down in two masses at the doorway of the town till the morning.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: And in the morning he went out and, stopping, said to all the people there, You are upright men: it is true that I made designs against my master, and put him to death; but who is responsible for the death of all these?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: You may be certain that nothing which the Lord has said about the family of Ahab will be without effect; for the Lord has done what he said by his servant Elijah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: So Jehu put to death all the rest of the seed of Ahab in Jezreel, and all his relations and his near friends and his priests, till there were no more of them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: Then he got up and came to Samaria. And he was at the meeting-place of the keepers of sheep, by the way,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: When he came across the brothers of Ahaziah, king of Judah, and said, Who are you? And they said, We are the brothers of Ahaziah, king of Judah; we are going down to see the children of the king and of the queen.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: And he said, Take them living. So they took them living, and put them to death in the water-hole of Beth-eked; of the forty-two men he put every one to death;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: And when he had gone away from there, he came across Jehonadab, the son of Rechab: and he said good-day to him, and said to him, Is your heart true to mine, as mine is to yours? And Jehonadab in answer said, It is; and Jehu said, If it is, give me your hand. And he gave him his hand, and he made him come up into his carriage.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: And he said, Come with me and see how I am on fire for the Lord's cause. So he made him go with him in his carriage.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: And when he came to Samaria, he put to death all those of Ahab's family who were still in Samaria, till there were no more of them, as the Lord had said to Elijah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: Then Jehu got all the people together and said to them, Ahab was Baal's servant in a small way, but Jehu will be his servant on a great scale.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: Now send for all the prophets of Baal and all his servants and all his priests, to come to me; let no one keep away: for I have a great offering to make to Baal; anyone who is not present, will be put to death. This Jehu did with deceit, his purpose being the destruction of the servants of Baal.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: And Jehu said, Let there be a special holy meeting for the worship of Baal. So a public statement was made.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: And Jehu sent out through all Israel; and all the servants of Baal came, not one kept away. And they came into the house of Baal, so that it was full from end to end.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: And Jehu said to him who kept the robes, Get out robes for all the servants of Baal. So he got out robes for them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: And Jehu, with Jehonadab, the son of Rechab, went into the house of Baal; and he said to the servants of Baal, Make a search with care, to see that no servant of the Lord is with you, but only servants of Baal.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: Then they went in to make offerings and burned offerings. Now Jehu had put eighty men outside, and said to them, If any man whom I give into your hands gets away, the life of him who lets him go will be the price of his life.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: Then when the burned offering was ended, straight away Jehu said to the armed men and the captains, Go in and put them to death; let not one come out. So they put them to the sword; and, pulling the images to the earth, they went into the holy place of the house of Baal.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: And they took out the image of Asherah from the house of Baal, and had it burned.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: The altar of Baal was pulled down and the house of Baal was broken up and made an unclean place, as it is to this day.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: So Jehu put an end to the worship of Baal in Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: But Jehu did not keep himself from all the sins of Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, and the evil he made Israel do; the gold oxen were still in Beth-el and in Dan.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: And the Lord said to Jehu, Because you have done well in doing what is right in my eyes and effecting all my purpose for the family of Ahab, your sons will be kings of Israel to the fourth generation.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: But Jehu did not take care to keep the law of the Lord with all his heart: he did not keep himself from the sin which Jeroboam did and made Israel do.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: In those days the Lord was angry first with Israel; and Hazael made attacks on all the land of Israel,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 33
text: East of Jordan, in all the land of Gilead, the Gadites and the Reubenites and the Manassites, from Aroer by the valley of the Arnon, all Gilead and Bashan.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 34
text: Now the rest of the acts of Jehu, and all he did, and his great power, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Israel?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 35
text: And Jehu went to rest with his fathers, and was put into the earth in Samaria. And Jehoahaz his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Verse 36
text: And the time of Jehu's rule over Israel in Samaria was twenty-eight years.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Now when Athaliah, the mother of Ahaziah, saw that her son was dead, she had all the rest of the seed of the kingdom put to death.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: But Jehosheba, the daughter of King Joram, sister of Ahaziah, secretly took Joash, the son of Ahaziah, with the woman who took care of him, away from among the king's sons who were put to death, and put him in the bedroom; and they kept him safe from Athaliah, so that he was not put to death.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: And for six years she kept him safe in the house of the Lord, while Athaliah was ruling over the land.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: Then in the seventh year, Jehoiada sent for the captains of hundreds of the Carians, and the armed men, and taking them into the house of the Lord, made an agreement with them, and made them take an oath in the house of the Lord, and let them see the king's son.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And he gave them orders, saying, This is what you are to do: the third part of you, who come in on the Sabbath and keep the watch of the king's house,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: And the two divisions of you, who go out on the Sabbath and keep the watch of the house of the Lord,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: Will make a circle round the king, every man being armed; and whoever comes inside your lines is to be put to death; keep with the king, when he goes out and when he comes in.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And the captains of hundreds did as Jehoiada the priest gave them orders; every one took with him his men, those who came in and those who went out on the Sabbath, and they came in to Jehoiada the priest.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: And the priest gave to the captains of hundreds the spears and body-covers which had been King David's, and which were kept in the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: Then the armed men took up their positions, every man with his instruments of war in his hand, from the right side of the house to the left, round about the altar and the house.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: Then he made the king's son come out, and put the crown on him and the arm-bands, and made him king, and put the holy oil on him; and they all, making sounds of joy with their hands, said, Long life to the king.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: Now Athaliah, hearing the noise made by the people, came to the people in the house of the Lord;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And looking, she saw the king in his regular place by the pillar, and the captains and the horns near him; and all the people of the land giving signs of joy and sounding the horns. Then Athaliah, violently parting her robes, gave a cry, saying, Broken faith, broken faith!

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: Then Jehoiada the priest gave orders to those who were placed in authority over the army, saying, Take her outside the lines, and let anyone who goes after her be put to death with the sword, for he said, Let her not be put to death in the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: So they put their hands on her, and she went to the king's house by the doorway of the horses, and there she was put to death.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: And Jehoiada made an agreement between the Lord and the king and the people, that they would be the Lord's people; and in the same way between the king and the people.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: Then all the people of the land went to the house of Baal and had it pulled down: its altars and images were all broken to bits, and Mattan, the priest of Baal, they put to death before the altars. And the priest put overseers over the Lord's house.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: Then he took the captains of hundreds, and the Carians, and the armed men, and all the people of the land; and they came down with the king from the house of the Lord, through the doorway of the armed men, to the king's house. And he took his place on the seat of the kings.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: So all the people of the land were glad, and the town was quiet; and they had put Athaliah to death with the sword at the king's house.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: And Jehoash was seven years old when he became king.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: In the seventh year of Jehu's rule, Jehoash became king; and he was ruling for forty years in Jerusalem; his mother's name was Zibiah of Beer-sheba.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: Jehoash did what was right in the eyes of the Lord all his days, because he was guided by the teaching of Jehoiada the priest.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: But the high places were not taken away; the people went on making offerings and burning them in the high places.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: And Jehoash said to the priests, All the money of the holy things, which comes into the house of the Lord, (the amount fixed for every man's payment,) and all the money given by any man freely from the impulse of his heart,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: Let the priests take, every man from his friends and neighbours, to make good what is damaged in the house, wherever it is to be seen.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: But in the twenty-third year of King Jehoash, the priests had not made good the damaged parts of the house.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: Then King Jehoash sent for Jehoiada the priest, and the other priests, and said to them, Why have you not made good what is damaged in the house? now take no more money from your neighbours, but give it for the building up of the house.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: So the priests made an agreement to take no more money from the people, and not to make good what was damaged in the house.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: But Jehoiada the priest took a chest, and making a hole in the cover of it, put it by the altar, on the right side when one comes into the house of the Lord; and the priests who kept the door put in it regularly all the money which was taken into the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: And when they saw that there was much money in the chest, the king's scribe and the high priest came and put it in bags, noting the amount of all the money there was in the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: And the money which was measured out they gave regularly to those who were responsible for overseeing the work, and these gave it in payment to the woodworkers and the builders who were working on the house of the Lord,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: And to the wall-builders and the stone-cutters, and to get wood and cut stone for building up the broken parts of the house of the Lord, and for everything needed to put the house in good order.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: But the money was not used for making silver cups or scissors or basins or wind-instruments or any vessels of gold or silver for the house of the Lord;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: But it was all given to the workmen who were building up the house.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: And they did not get any statement of accounts from the men to whom the money was given for the workmen, for they made use of it with good faith.

text: And he said, Take the arrows: and he took them. And he said to the king of Israel, Send them down into the earth; and he did so three times and no more.

text: He put to the sword twelve thousand men of Edom in the Valley of Salt, and took Sela in war, naming it Joktheel, as it is to this day.

text: And Jehoash, king of Israel, sent to Amaziah, king of Judah, saying, The thorn-tree in Lebanon sent to the cedar in Lebanon, saying, Give your daughter to my son for a wife: and a beast from the woodland in Lebanon went by, crushing the thorn under his feet.

text: It is true that you have overcome Edom and your heart is uplifted; let that glory be enough for you, and keep in your country; why do you make causes of trouble, putting yourself, and Judah with you, in danger of downfall?

text: But Amaziah gave no attention. So Jehoash, king of Israel, went up, and he and Amaziah, king of Judah, came face to face at Beth-shemesh, which is in Judah.

text: And Jehoash, king of Israel, made Amaziah, king of Judah, the son of Jehoash, son of Ahaziah, prisoner at Beth-shemesh, and came to Jerusalem, and had the wall of Jerusalem pulled down from the doorway of Ephraim to the door in the angle, four hundred cubits.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: In the seventeenth year of Pekah, the son of Remaliah, Ahaz, the son of Jotham, became king of Judah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king; he was ruling for sixteen years in Jerusalem. He did not do what was right in the eyes of the Lord his God, as David his father did.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: But he went in the ways of the kings of Israel, and even made his son go through the fire, copying the disgusting ways of the nations whom the Lord had sent out of the land before the children of Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: And he made offerings, burning them in the high places and on the hills and under every green tree.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: Then Rezin, king of Aram, and Pekah, son of Remaliah, king of Israel, came up to Jerusalem to make war; and they made an attack on Ahaz, shutting him in, but were not able to overcome him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: At that time the king of Edom got Elath back for Edom, and sent the Jews out of Elath; and the Edomites came back to Elath where they are living to this day.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: So Ahaz sent representatives to Tiglath-pileser, king of Assyria, saying, I am your servant and your son; come to my help against the kings of Aram and Israel who have taken up arms against me.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: And Ahaz took the silver and gold which were in the house of the Lord and in the king's store-house, and sent them as an offering to the king of Assyria.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: And the king of Assyria, in answer to his request, went up against Damascus and took it, and took its people away as prisoners to Kir, and put Rezin to death.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: Then King Ahaz went to Damascus for a meeting with Tiglath-pileser, king of Assyria; and there he saw the altar which was at Damascus; and King Ahaz sent to Urijah the priest a copy of the altar, giving the design of it and all the details of its structure.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: And from the copy King Ahaz sent from Damascus, Urijah made an altar and had it ready by the time King Ahaz came back from Damascus.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: And when the king came from Damascus, he saw the altar; and he went up on it and made an offering on it.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: He made his burned offering and his meal offering and his drink offering there, draining out the blood of his peace-offerings on the altar.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: And the brass altar, which was before the Lord, he took from the front of the house, from between his altar and the house of the Lord, and put it on the north side of his altar.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: And King Ahaz gave orders to Urijah the priest, saying, Make the morning burned offering and the evening meal offering and the king's burned offering and meal offering, with the burned offerings of all the people and their meal offerings and drink offerings, on the great altar, and put on it all the blood of the burned offerings and of the beasts which are offered; but the brass altar will be for my use to get directions from the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: So Urijah the priest did everything as the king said

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: And King Ahaz took off the sides of the wheeled bases, and took down the great water-vessel from off the brass oxen which were under it and put it on a floor of stone.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: *** the house of the Lord, because of the king of Assyria.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: Now the rest of the things which Ahaz did, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Judah?

text: And Ahaz went to rest with his fathers, and was put into the earth with his fathers in the town of David; and Hezekiah his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: In the twelfth year of Ahaz, king of Judah, Hoshea, the son of Elah, became king over Israel in Samaria, ruling for nine years.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, though not like the kings of Israel before him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: Against him came up Shalmaneser, king of Assyria, and Hoshea became his servant and sent him offerings.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: But Hoshea's broken faith became clear to the king of Assyria because he had sent representatives to So, king of Egypt, and did not send his offering to the king of Assyria, as he had done year by year: so the king of Assyria had him shut up in prison and put in chains.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: Then the king of Assyria went through all the land and came up to Samaria, shutting it in with his forces for three years.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: In the ninth year of Hoshea, the king of Assyria took Samaria, and took Israel away to Assyria, placing them in Halah and in Habor on the river Gozan, and in the towns of the Medes.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: And the wrath of the Lord came on Israel because they had done evil against the Lord their God, who took them out of the land of Egypt from under the yoke of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and had become worshippers of other gods,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: Living by the rules of the nations whom the Lord had sent out from before the children of Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: And the children of Israel did secretly against the Lord their God things which were not right, building high places for themselves in all their towns, from the tower of the watchmen to the walled town.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: They put up pillars of stone and wood on every high hill and under every green tree:

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: Burning their offerings in all the high places, as those nations did whom the Lord sent away from before them; they did evil things, moving the Lord to wrath;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: And they made themselves servants of disgusting things, though the Lord had said, You are not to do this.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: And he gave witness to Israel and Judah, by every prophet and seer, saying, Come back from your evil ways, and do my orders and keep my rules, and be guided by the law which I gave to your fathers and sent to you by my servants the prophets.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: And they did not give ear, but became stiff-necked, like their fathers who had no faith in the Lord their God.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: And they went against his rules, and the agreement which he made with their fathers, and his laws which he gave them; they gave themselves up to things without sense or value, and became foolish like the nations round them, of whom the Lord had said, Do not as they do.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: And turning their backs on all the orders which the Lord had given them, they made for themselves images of metal, and the image of Asherah, worshipping all the stars of heaven and becoming servants to Baal.
